name: Amazon Armor
notes: It is only dropped during orc raids on [[Carlin Raids#Orc Raid on Femor Hills|Femor Hills]]. It is less rare than the [[Amazon Shield]], but still would take you 5 years on average to loot one if you killed every orc raid occurring. It is therefore extremely valuable. It is part of the [[Amazon Set]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]] with the implementation of raids.

name: Amazon Shield
notes: A rare sight on any world, since it only appears in the seldom [[Carlin Raids#Orc Raid on Femor Hills|orc raid on Femor Hills]]. On average, it is looted once every 10 years per game world if the special raid is killed 100% of the time. It has the same defence and weight as a [[Crown Shield]]. It is part of the [[Amazon Set]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]] with the implementation of raids. The first amazon shield was looted on February 15th, 2005 in [[Tenebra]].

name: Amphora
buyfrom: Ukea, Feizuhl, Nydala, Yoem, Hofech, Edvard, Eddy, Iwar, Peggy, Vera, Janz, Gamon, Ashtamor, Dorbin
notes: It looks the same as an [[Amphora of Grease]] and a [[Funeral Urn]].\nIt can be found at daily spawns in basement of [[Tom]]'s barn in [[Rookgaard]], [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}125.83,125.183,8 here].

name: Amulet of Life
notes: This amulet prevented loss of all items, levels and skills, effectively nullifying the death penalties. It also would break after user's death. All of these amulets were turned into [[Broken Amulet]] in the [[Updates#Update 7.2 (Christmas 2003) December 16, 2003|Update 7.2]]. The closest replacement for this amulet is the updated version of it, the [[Amulet of Loss]].
history:
It was introduced in the [[Update#Update 7.1 .28Christmas 2002.29. December 17.2C 2002|7.1 Update]] in December 2002. It could be purchased from [[Eremo]] for 50,000gp.

== Removal ==
In [[Updates/7.2|December 2003]], this amulet was removed from the game. All Amulets of Life in the game were changed into [[Broken Amulet]]s, which could be sold back to [[Eremo]] for 50,000gp or kept as a collectible.

The main reason why it was removed was because of its potential to propagate power discrepancies without many consequences. For example: A high level [[sorcerer]] could cast [[Ultimate Explosion|ultimate explosion]] multiple times in a crowd and kill many players without many repercussions. For extremely wealthy guilds and players, one strategy would be to cast it repeatedly, die, equip a new amulet and immediately go back at it. This of course, was a costly, but effective strategy. After all, it had the potential to kill hundreds of players a day, potentially giving massive advantages against warring guilds' enemies. Also in the process, leaving causalities on innocent players.

[[CipSoft]] removed the Amulet of Life in about a year after its release. And also introduced the [[Skull System]] as a countermeasure against [[Power Abuser|power abuse]].

''Some'' of the benefits of this amulet are now achieved by wearing an [[Amulet of Loss]] or purchasing at least 5 regular [[blessings]], but there is no way to completely circumvent the death penalties.

name: Amulet of Loss
droppedby: Blightwalker | Gaffir | Mantosaurus | Sulphider | Zorvorax | Zugurosh
notes:
Prevents [[item]] loss caused by [[Death|dying]], but breaks upon dying. Since update 8.41 buying all [[blessings]] gives the same functionality as wearing the Amulet of Loss. However, Amulet of Loss does not protect against [[Blessings#Experience and Skill loss|experience and skill loss]], which full blessings do. If you die in PVP with the [[Twist of Fate]] blessing and wearing an Amulet of Loss, you will only lose Twist of Fate.
It does not work on [[Red Skull]]ed and [[Black Skull]]ed players. In this case it breaks and is not lootable.
[[Premium]] players can sell them to [[Free Account]] players who can not get all five blessings, for a higher price, because only [[Eremo]] sells them. They can be bought and looted on [[Hardcore PvP]] game worlds since [[Updates/8.53|Update 8.53]].
This amulet replaced the [[Amulet of Life]], which would shield both skills and items from loss. It was also possible to obtain in a [[Surprise Bag (Red)|Red Surprise Bag]] during [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]] and [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]] celebrations.

name: Ancient Amulet
droppedby: Ancient Scarab | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Fleshcrawler | Ghazbaran | Memory of a Scarab | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | The Ravager
notes: Only used as decoration. Can be seen in [[Omruc]]s pharaoh room in [[Ankrahmun]].

name: Ancient Rune
notes: Trade this item for a [[Helmet Piece]] (part of [[Helmet of the Ancients]]).
flavortext: This rune vibrates with ancient powers. It seems to be rotting rapidly.

name: Ancient Shield
droppedby: Enslaved Dwarf | Ghost | Lich | Nightmare | Tarnished Spirit
notes: A shield used once in the past by the now undead. It somewhat resembles to the [[Viking Shield]] which can be bought in [[Edron]]. A long time ago this shield was called Kaerell Shield and was given to Kaerell guild on [[Antica]] by the [[Gods]] same as [[Rose Shield]] and [[Mercenary Shield]] was. Kaerell is a word of the Breton language (spoken in Brittany / France), and it means weasel (the animal). It was drawn by the former leader of the Kaerell guild, Mantus.\nCan be obtained by [[Unrusting]] a [[Slightly Rusted Shield]].

name: Ancient Tiara
notes: Can be seen on the second floor of the [[Explorer Society]] in [[Port Hope]]. This item has no armor value as it is only known for being decorative. This item is one of the [[Pharaoh Rares]] and is quite valuable as it is dropped exclusively by [[Vashresamun]] who is infrequently hunted.

buyfrom: Arito;mug, Armenius: 3;mug, Bolfona;mug, Boozer;mug, Clyde;mug, Innkeeper Alphonse;mug,Jimbin;mug, Karl: 20;mug, Maria;mug, Mirabell;mug, Norma: 3;mug, Pugwah: 3;mug, Satsu: 52;cocktailglass, Snake Eye: 5;mug, Swolt;mug, Urkalio;mug

[[Druid]]s, [[Sorcerer]]s and [[Paladin]]s can use blank runes to create spell [[runes]]. Since [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]], it is not necessary to have the blank rune in your hand, you can simply have it in your backpack and then cast the rune spell.
Say ''sell rune'' to NPC [[A Prisoner]] and he will tell you he is willing to buy this item off you for 50,000 gp. He ends up paying you a mere 10 gp once you go through with the trade, though.

name: Blessed Ankh
notes:
[[Decoration]], although you can perform the "use with" action with it.
\nLooks the same as the [[Ankh]].\nObtained in the [[The White Raven Monastery Quest]].
flavortext: You see the engraving of a white raven on its surface.

name: Blessed Shield
history:
* This shield used to be one of the best in [[Tibia]]. 
* It has been gifted a few times by the [[Tibian Gods#Creators|Gods]] to those they deemed worthy.
* This exceptional shield is not normally obtainable in-game; as it is bestowed exclusively as a gift from the [[Gods]]. After years of uncertainty about its existence, the legendary shield resurfaced on [[Antica]].
* The very first Blessed Shield on Antica was a gift from the gods to {{character|Elleshar}} in appreciation for his contribution to game graphics. Elleshar sold the shield to {{character|Muesli}} with the promise of never selling it again, but later broke that promise by auctioning it. Among the bidders were {{character|Yi}}, {{character|Slayn}}, and [[Lightbringer]], who ultimately bought it.
* Initially, the shield had a defense rating of 50, which was reduced to 40 with [[Updates/7.0|Update 7.0]]. 
* Until [[Updates/11.80|Summer Update 2018]], it held the highest defense rating in the game.
* On June 15, 2022, the shield was sold via [[Market]] by Karr Chaos ({{Character|Nathquata}}) to {{Character|Rei de Lutabra}} for 12 billion [[Gold Coin]]s. Rei transferred the shield to [[Lutabra]] the following day.

Hellgate Treasure Room.png|[[Treasure Rooms#Hellgate Treasure Chamber|Hellgate Treasure Chamber]]
Blessed.jpg|A really old pic - {{Character|Lightbringer}} and his shield
</gallery>
flavortext: The shield grants divine protection.

name: Blood
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Blood is normally useless (except for keeping us alive), only has use in some [[quests]]. You can get it by 'using' a liquid [[Container]] on a monster corpse who is not undead or invertebrate. For example, you won't get blood from [[skeleton]]s, but you will get blood from [[hunter]]s or [[bear]]s.\nItem used in [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]], [[The Queen of the Banshees Quest]], [[Blood Brothers Quest]] and [[Unnatural Selection Quest]].

name: Blood Herb
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Often used in [[house]] decoration. It is a rare herb, due to its botanical property. Amongst the witches, it is widely known that a blood herb sucks all the life force from a tree leaving it dead. Putting 10 [[Coconut]]s under a Blood Herb will make a nice decoration background. In earlier times it also used to spawn at the [[Black Knight]] everyday.
\nThis can only be obtained in [[Venore]] swamps through the [[Blood Herb Quest]]. \nCan be handed over to [[Wyda]] during the [[Bored Mini World Change]] for a chance to get a [[Torn Teddy]].
history: This [[Plants and Herbs|herb]] used to look like this until [[Updates/7.6|Christmas Update 2005]]: [[File:Blood Herb (Old).gif]]

name: Blood Orb
notes: You can see it in the [[Ferumbras Citadel]] treasure room, in [[Pythius the Rotten]]'s treasure room or across lava at the [[Green Djinn]] of the [[Serpentine Tower]]. It has the same sprite as a lava bubble in lava. This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

flavortext: The blue crystal is softly humming a ghostly melody. It seems to be rotting rapidly.

name: Blue Robe
droppedby: Banshee | Countess Sorrow | Enlightened of the Cult | Feversleep | Frost Flower Asura | Girtablilu Warrior | Gravelord Oshuran | Hellgorak | Horadron | Lich | Lumbering Carnivor | Midnight Asura | Quara Mantassin | Renegade Quara Mantassin | Spiky Carnivor | Terrorsleep | The Handmaiden | The Moonlight Aster | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Vashresamun | Warlock | Zarabustor
notes:
It's a decent armor for anyone looking to save capacity. It can be used by any vocation but there are usually better armors available.

*[[Paladin]]s can use [[Paladin Armor]].
*[[Druid]]s and [[Sorcerer]]s can use [[Ethno Coat]], [[Spirit Cloak]], [[Focus Cape]].
*[[Knight]]s can use [[Golden Armor]], [[Dragon Scale Mail]], [[Demon Armor]].
It may be a good option for a low-level knight who only blocks more damage in armor upgrades, while the other vocations improve their skills to deal more damage. The extra capacity will allow the knight to carry more potions.

It was very attractive for [[Mage]]s before the [[Updates/8.2|Summer Update 2008]]. Most mages now prefer to use a [[Spirit Cloak]] or [[Focus Cape]] for the extra [[Magic Level]] although [[Spirit Cloak]]s are heavier and have less defense and [[Focus Cape]]s have less defense but is lighter. On the [[Test Server]] ([[Updates/8.2|8.2]]), Blue Robe added an extra [[Magic Level]], however the convenience was removed after the Test Server. Many people believed that these robes increased magic damage by 25%, however this rumor was (and is) false.
Obtainable in the [[Medusa Shield Quest]].
history: Some say this magical robe was found in a Cyclops in 6.4. It just said "Blue Robe" with the attributes of a Cape. Some think it was hackers who put it in. It wasn't until 7.4 that this "Blue Robe" was put in the game as a new item.
flavortext: It is a magic robe.

name: Blue Rose
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Semi rare item.
\nIt can be seen on the table at [[Venore]]'s foodstore.\nIt can be found at daily spawns in [[Fibula Dungeon]], [[Ab'Dendriel]] and on [[Venore]]'s food and flowers shop.

name: Blue Spell Wand
notes: This wand was transformed into the [[Wand of Vortex]] in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]]. This item no longer exists in game.

name: Blue Tapestry
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Velvet, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Tapestries]] for more information about other types and colors of tapestries.

name: Blue Tome
notes:
One of the 5 volumes of [[The Mystic Secrets of Tibia]]. Blue Tomes are obtainable only as a gift from the [[Tibian Gods#Creators|gods]], bought from players on older game worlds or as a reward from contests of [[Supported Tibia Fansites|supported]] and [[Promoted Tibia Fansites|promoted fansites]]. 
Since [[Updates/8.4]] Blue Tome can be looted from [[Ghazbaran]].
Was first looted in [[Danera]] by {{character|Nerd Din}} (01/01/09).
Was also looted in [[Hiberna]] by {{character|Savage Funkstar}}.
history: This item used to be obtainable in two ways. The first way was to pick it up near the current [[Life Ring Quest]], where it spawned once per map reset. The other way to obtain this item was as a reward from the [[Demon Legs Quest]] in the [[Hero Cave]] â€“ this one was also supposed to spawn once per map reset, but on [[Antica]] there was a bug causing the rewards to respawn every day instead. As a result there are far more Blue Tomes on Antica than on any other world.
flavortext: It's a volume of The Mystic Secrets of Tibia.

name: Blueberry
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
They can be picked in the wild on [[Blueberry Bush]]es, before you can pick them you need to "Use" the bush. There should be only 3 berries left to pick. Still, sometimes other players "use" the Blueberry Bush and don't take them with themselves. Thus, there can be up to six blueberries in a bush. One hour is needed since the last player that used the bush for it to grow back the blueberries.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Headache Pill]].\nAfter using [[Blueberry Bush]]es 500 times, you will earn the achievement [[Bluebarian]].

name: Bolt
droppedby: Dwarf Soldier | Elder Forest Fury | Forest Fury | Minotaur Archer | Minotaur Poacher | Vicious Squire
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Galuna, Gnomerrow, Irea, Maun, Mugruu, Perac, Perod, Pompan, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Talphion, Timur, Uzgod, Vincent, Willard, Xed
notes: Bolts are projectiles, fired with any type of [[Two-Handed Distance Weapons|Crossbow]], usually by [[Paladin]]s. Until the [[Updates/8.0|Summer Update 2007]] - which introduced the new spears - they were the most popular ammunition of [[Paladin]]s.
history: Before the [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], [[Paladin]]s were able to create 5 of these using the [[Conjure Bolt]] spell.

name: Bone
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Bonebeast | Brittle Skeleton | Crypt Shambler | Crypt Warrior | Dark Carnisylvan | Demon (Goblin) | Dreadbeast | Dworc Voodoomaster | Feverish Citizen | Frazzlemaw | Goblin | Goblin Assassin | Goblin Leader | Goblin Scavenger | Grand Master Oberon | Guzzlemaw | Hulking Carnisylvan | Jailer | Memory of a Frazzlemaw | Muglex Clan Assassin | Muglex Clan Footman | Muglex Clan Scavenger | Oodok Witchmaster | Pirate Skeleton | Skeleton | Skeleton Elite Warrior | Skeleton Warrior | Tomb Servant | Two-Headed Turtle | Undead Mine Worker | Weakened Frazzlemaw
notes:
Has no practical use.

\nYou need 20 bones in the [[Postman Quest]].

name: Bone Club
droppedby: Bonebeast | Demon (Goblin) | Dreadbeast | Goblin | Goblin Assassin | Goblin Leader | Goblin Scavenger | Muglex Clan Assassin | Muglex Clan Footman | Muglex Clan Scavenger | Munster | Necropharus | Orger | Pirate Skeleton | Salamander Trainer | Troll-Trained Salamander
sellto: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne: 5, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Lee'Delle, Memech, Morpel, Obi, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
notes: Not very useful. Considered a rare to some on [[Rookgaard]]. Part of [[Bone Set]].
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Bone Club changed from [[File:Bone Club (Old).gif]] to [[File:Bone Club.gif]].
flavortext: It apparently originally belonged to some lesser undead.

name: Bone Key
notes:
For a list of bone keys, see [[Keys by Type/Bone Key]].
Looks the same as a [[Goblin Bone Key]] and [[Omrabas' Bone Key]].

name: Bone Shield
droppedby: Bonebeast | Chakoya Toolshaper | Chakoya Tribewarden | Chakoya Windcaller | Crypt Shambler | Dreadbeast | Dworc Fleshhunter | Loricate Orger | Necropharus | Ocyakao | Orger | Ribstride | Tomb Servant
notes: Used to be a rare shield on mainland. Often can be seen lying on the floor in [[Ankrahmun]] [[tomb]]s and [[Mount Sternum]]. It is part of the [[Bone Set]].

name: Bone Sword
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
sellto: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
notes: Part of the [[Bone Set]].

name: Abyss Hammer
droppedby: Alptramun | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Grimeleech | Hand of Cursed Fate | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Lady Tenebris | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Phantasm | Plagueroot | Prince Drazzak | Renegade Quara Predator | The Nightmare Beast | The Percht Queen | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Shatterer
notes: This mysterious hammer is a very rare item since it can only be obtained in places hard to reach, such as some parts of [[The Inquisition Quest]] or deep in the [[Pits of Inferno]].
flavortext: Floating stones form the tip of this strange weapon, held in place by unspeakable magic.

name: Amazon Helmet
notes: A mysterious and rarely seen helmet. For a long time, it was nothing more than a myth. Many Tibians talked about this helmet, but very few knew how to obtain one. It is only dropped during orc raids on [[Carlin Raids#Orc Raid on Femor Hills|Femor Hills]]. It is a part of the [[Amazon Set]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]] with the implementation of raids.

name: Amber Staff
droppedby: Adept of the Cult | Amenef the Burning | Enlightened of the Cult | Eradicator | Fleshcrawler | Grandfather Tridian | Hellhound | Juvenile Bashmu | Outburst | Ragiaz | Rupture | Sulphider | The Count of the Core | World Devourer

name: Antidote Potion
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It has a deposit of '''5 [[Empty Potion Flask (Small)|gp]] '''It cures [[poisoned]] targets. Antidote potions replaced [[Cure Poison Rune]]s in [[Rookgaard]].

name: Ape Fur
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Cursed Ape | Hairman the Huge | Kongra | Merlkin | Sibang
notes:
It can be found in dead apes, but cannot be [[Skinning|skinned]] from their corpse.
100 of them are needed for an addon of [[Oriental Outfits]].
100 of them are needed for an addon of [[Beggar Outfits]].
40 of them are needed for an addon of [[Mage Outfits]] (Female) and [[Summoner Outfits]] (Male). |

name: Arbalest
notes:
It has longer range than [[crossbow]] (1 tile more, 6 sqm). The extra range can be very useful when hunting [[dragon]]s when they flee in low [[HP|hp]], for example.\nValue increased with the Winter update 2007 because of the reduced spear range.
Looks the same as [[The Crossbow of Swordfish]].Obtained through the [[Pits of Inferno Quest]].
flavortext: It is a bit heavy due to the iron mounting, but very precise.

name: Arcane Staff
droppedby: Alptramun | Izcandar the Banished | Lady Tenebris | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Plagueroot | The Nightmare Beast | The Sandking | The Scourge of Oblivion
notes: It looks the same as an [[Arcane Staff (Unknown)]] and [[Racoohan Rat Revealer]].\nObtainable through [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.9|Christmas Update 2006]].
flavortext: It is enchanted with ancient magic that renders a weak staff into a powerful weapon.

name: Assassin Dagger
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Brachiodemon | Draken Elite | Frazzlemaw | Frost Flower Asura | Fury | Furyosa | Guzzlemaw | Katex Blood Tongue | Liodile | Madareth | Mawhawk | Midnight Asura | Ripper Spectre | The Flaming Orchid | The Sandking | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Usurper Archer | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes:
Used to be a very rare item, however after [[Summer Update 2008]] it is much easier to obtain, due to it being a reward from a quest. Great weapon for knights using sword around level 40.
\nObtainable in the [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Assassin Dagger changed from [[File:Assassin Dagger (Old).gif]] to [[File:Assassin Dagger.gif]].

name: Assassin Star
droppedby: Angry Demon | Annihilon | Askarak Demon | Askarak Lord | Behemoth | Betrayed Wraith | Black Vixen | Blightwalker | Bretzecutioner | Dark Torturer | Demon | Demon Outcast | Enfeebled Silencer | Falcon Knight | Falcon Paladin | Flameborn | Frost Flower Asura | Fury | Furyosa | Gaz'haragoth | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Grand Canon Dominus | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Grand Commander Soeren | Hand of Cursed Fate | Hellhound | Hellhunter Inferniarch | Hellspawn | Juggernaut | Kroazur | Latrivan | Mad Mage | Melting Frozen Horror | Midnight Asura | Minotaur Amazon | Morgaroth | Morguthis | Mr. Punish | Orshabaal | Preceptor Lazare | Quara Predator | Raging Mage | Reflection of a Mage | Renegade Quara Constrictor | Renegade Quara Predator | Silencer | Stonecracker | The Blazing Rose | The Diamond Blossom | The Flaming Orchid | The Lily of Night | The Noxious Spawn | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Tyrn | Undead Dragon | Warlock | Werefox | Zarabustor
notes: On average, they break every 3 hits (33% chance to break).
history: * In the early testing, the attack value was 90. This was later changed to 65 as 90 was seen as too powerful.\n* After [[Updates/9.6]], Assassin Stars were used less often mainly due to the large increase of damage given to [[Infernal Bolt]]s.

name: Atlas
notes:
Can be purchased by every member of [[Tibian Explorer Society]] with rank of [[The Explorer Society Quest/Spoiler#Rank of Relic Hunter|Relic Hunter]] or higher. They are commonly used for decorative purposes. People who've completed the Explorer Society Quest can sell them for a higher price to other players.
Looks the same as a [[Book (Atlas)]], a [[Book (CGB)]], and [[Strange Good Night Songs]].\n

Used in part of the [[Meriana Quest]].
flavortext: It is filled with detailed maps of Tibia.

name: Baby Seal Doll
notes:
It animates for a 3 seconds when used. A perfect projection of baby seals. This cute doll is mostly used for decoration.

* Obtained from [[The Ultimate Challenges Quest]] ''(Scrapper level)''.
* You can earn the achievement [[I Need a Hug]] by using a [[Panda Teddy]], a [[Stuffed Dragon]], a Baby Seal Doll and a [[Santa Doll]].

name: Bag (Ahmet)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Bag of Smuggled Goods]], a [[Pirate Bag]] and a [[Suspicious Surprise Bag]].\nUsed in the [[Tibia Tales]] series, the one called [[Steal From Thieves Quest]].
flavortext: It contains Ahmet's stolen property.

name: Bait
notes: Used to catch the [[Sea Serpent]] in [[The Hunt for the Sea Serpent Quest]].

name: Baking Tray
notes: You can find them nearly in every Tibian tavern, also spawns in the Thaian Palace, Edron Palace (Kitchen), South-West [[Nargor]] (Kitchen), [[Fibula]] Flour Mill and [[Thais]] Troll's Cave. Can be used to make [[Cookie]]s. \nNeeded in the [[Blood Brothers Quest]]

name: Baking Tray (Cookie)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Can be used with an oven to get 12 [[Cookie]]s (and an empty, reusable [[Baking Tray]]).
It looks the same as a [[Baking Tray (Garlic)]].
flavortext: There is cookie dough on it.

name: Bale of White Cloth
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Tapestry|White Tapestry]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[What a foolish Quest]].

name: Bale of Yellowed Cloth
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Tapestry|Yellow Tapestry]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[What a foolish Quest]]. |

name: Ball Gown
notes: This item is extremely rare. One was received by {{character|Queen of Light II}} thanks to what is believed to be a major bug report. {{character|Savage Demon}} won this rare item from a competition between [[Tutor]]s. Moreover, there is a ball gown displayed on a desk in the fashion shop of [[Hugo]] in [[Venore]].
history: From the [[Updates/8.7|Winter Update 2010]] onwards, Ball Gowns have been given away as a very rare gift by [[Santa Claus]].

name: Bandana
notes:
For now just a decoration piece because any real purpose remains unknown.
\nIn contrast to general assumptions, it is not part of the [[Pirate Set]], the hat piece of which being not the Bandana but the [[Pirate Hat]].
flavortext: It is quite fashionable as well as useful for anyone spending huge amounts of time in the sun.

name: Bar of Chocolate
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Could be obtained when using a [[Surprise Bag|surprise bag]] that was looted from many monsters during [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]] and [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. A valuable item since it is needed for a quest. It can be obtained as a reward of the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]]. Can also be obtained from [[Surprise Nest]]s.
1 is needed to make a [[Chocolate Cake]] (used in [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]]) and 3 are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Barrel of Beer
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Barrel (Brown)|brown barrel]].

Item temporarily obtained in [[Secret Service Quest]].

|

name: Bat Decoration
notes: It's a [[daily respawn]]. It hangs on the wall of [[Tafariel]]s throneroom in the [[Pits of Inferno]].

name: Bat Wing
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Bat | Bruise Payne | Exotic Bat | Grynch Clan Goblin | Mutated Bat | Vicious Manbat
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a multiple using in various [[quests]]. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
70 of these are needed for male [[Summoner Outfits Quest]].
70 of these are needed for female [[Mage Outfits Quest]].
10 of these are needed for [[Beggar Outfits Quest]].
5 of these are needed in a mission of [[The Ice Islands Quest]].
2 of these are needed in a mission of [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
Used in the [[Witches' Cauldron Quest]].

name: Beach Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Beach Bag
notes:
See [[Bag]] for general information regarding bags.
It looks the same as a [[Christmas Present Bag]].

name: Bear Paw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Don't sell them to [[NPC]]s because their value significantly increases in [[Mainland]] or when selling them to [[Rooker]]s.

50 of these are needed for [[Druid Outfits Quest]].
4 of these are needed in a mission of [[The Ice Islands Quest]].

name: Beastslayer Axe
droppedby: Barbarian Bloodwalker | Choking Fear | Girtablilu Warrior | Glooth Bandit | Hellgorak | Horadron | Retching Horror | Thanatursus
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.5|Summer Update 2005]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/8.0|Summer Update 2007]] when the first creatures to drop it were implemented.

name: Beetroot
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 2 of them are needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]]

name: Behemoth Claw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: \nOne is needed for the [[Assassin Outfits Quest]].

name: Behemoth Trophy
notes: It can be hung on a wall.

name: Belted Cape
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Bog Raider | Crazed Summer Vanguard | Gladiator | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | Weakened Shlorg
notes: A very good armor for low level [[Paladin]]s since it isn't too expensive, has the same armor value as the [[Plate Armor]] and is really light.

name: Berserk Potion
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Alptramun | Annihilon | Bloodback | Boogy | Brain Head | Count Vlarkorth | Darkfang | Drume | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Flameborn | Ghazbaran | Ghulosh | Gorzindel | Goshnar's Cruelty | Goshnar's Greed | Goshnar's Hatred | Goshnar's Malice | Goshnar's Megalomania | Goshnar's Spite | Hellspawn | Hemming | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Lokathmor | Lord Azaram | Madareth | Magma Bubble | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Mazzinor | Megasylvan Yselda | Ogre Savage | Orc Cult Inquisitor | Orc Cult Minion | Orc Cult Priest | Orc Cultist | Orclops Doomhauler | Orclops Ravager | Overcharged Energy Element | Owin (Creature) | Plagueroot | Ratmiral Blackwhiskers | Scarlett Etzel | Shadowpelt | Sir Baeloc | Tentugly's Head | The Abomination | The Brainstealer | The Dread Maiden | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The Fear Feaster | The Nightmare Beast | The Pale Worm | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Time Guardian | The Unwelcome | Timira the Many-Headed | Urmahlullu the Weakened | War Golem | Werebear | Wereboar | Werewolf | Worker Golem | Yakchal | Zushuka | The Monster | Ichgahal
notes:
It increases your [[Melee]] skills (Sword, Axe and Club) by 5 each, and decreases your [[Shielding]] skill by 10 points for 10 minutes. It does not increase your fist skill and it can only be used by [[Knight]]s.
'''Note:''' It will negate any fighting skill boost such as [[Enchant Party]], [[Blood Rage]] or [[Veggie Casserole]]. Be careful - there is a 1-2 second delay for drinking this, therefore you can easily waste a potion instead of using the intended one. It does not matter if you drink 1 or 100 at once; there will be no extra bonuses. Can be obtained in the [[Berserk Potion Quest]], [[The New Frontier Quest]], [[Waterskin of Mead Quest]], and the [[Rise of Devovorga]]. Can also be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s. }}[[Category:Axe Fighting Booster]][[Category:Club Fighting Booster]][[Category:Sword Fighting Booster]]
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases your fighting skill while decreasing your defense.

name: Bill
notes: It looks the same as a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.\nUsed during the [[The Postman Missions Quest]].
flavortext: This is a bill for an expensive magicians hat and several rabbits.

name: Black Bishop Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].

name: Black Castle Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].

name: Black King Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].

name: Black Knight Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].\nNeeded in [[Paradox Tower Quest]].

name: Black Pawn Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].

name: Black Queen Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].

name: Black Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].

name: Blacksteel Sword
notes: This item is a good two-handed sword for low-mid level [[knight]]s who cannot afford or use the slightly better and much heavier [[Giant Sword]]. It is also relatively easy to get.\nReward from the [[The Ultimate Challenges Quest|Arena]], Greenhorn level.
history:
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy Blacksteel Sword}} [[Icy Blacksteel Sword]]
* {{Ilink|Earth Blacksteel Sword}} [[Earth Blacksteel Sword]]
* {{Ilink|Energy Blacksteel Sword}} [[Energy Blacksteel Sword]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery Blacksteel Sword}} [[Fiery Blacksteel Sword]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].
flavortext: This sword is only granted to a greenhorn of the Svargrond arena.

name: Blank Poetry Parchment
notes:
When you use an [[Inkwell]] on it, it changes to a [[Parchment (Poetry)]].
Looks the same as a [[Parchment (Yellow Rewritable)]].\nUsed in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: Use your inkwell on it to try writing a poem.

name: Blessed Sceptre
notes:
This is a good one-handed [[Club Weapon]] for level 75 players. As long as you are also using a [[Shields|shield]], this weapon compares favourably to both [[Justice Seeker]] and [[Royal Axe]] due to its lower weight.
Reward from the [[Barbarian Arena Quest|Barbarian Arena - Warlord Mode]].
flavortext: This sceptre is only granted to a warlord of the Svargrond arena.

name: Blessed Wooden Stake
notes:
Can be used on slain [[Vampires]] in order to get [[Vampire Dust]] and on dead [[Demon]]s to get [[Demon Dust]]. See also [[Obsidian Knife]].

\nObtainable through [[The Blessed Stake Quest]].
\nOne is required for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]] for making [[Sweet Mangonaise Elixir]].
flavortext: Many mighty priests of Tibia have blessed this stake.

name: Bloody Edge
droppedby: Arachir the Ancient One | Betrayed Wraith | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Madareth | Mamma Longlegs | The Old Widow | The Pale Count
notes: It is a rare item used mostly for decoration. It is used less than before since the implementation of the [[Zaoan Sword]], which is easier to get ahold of and has slightly better attributes.

name: Blue Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Blue Bag
notes: See [[Bag]] for general information regarding bags.

name: Blue Christmas Garland
notes: It can also be gotten with [[Santa Claus]] as a [[Christmas]] present.

name: Blue Legs
notes:
They have the same armor as [[Knight Legs]] and [[Crown Legs]], but are considerably lighter. Since the [[Updates/8.4|8.4 Update]], these are a valuable piece of armor for mid-level mages, until they can afford to purchase [[Lightning Legs]], [[Terra Legs]], [[Magma Legs]], or [[Glacier Kilt]]. Most mid-high players use them because of their low weight and high armor.\n
\nObtained in the [[Koshei the Deathless Quest]].

name: Blue Piece of Cloth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blue Djinn | Broken Shaper | Fahim the Wise | Hideous Fungus | Hirintror | Humongous Fungus | Marid | Minotaur Hunter | Minotaur Invader | Terrorsleep | The Pale Count | The Winter Bloom | Undead Jester | Weakened Shlorg | Wiggler | Worm Priestess | Yakchal | Zugurosh | Zushuka
notes:
[[Irmana]] ([[Venore]]) trades a [[Mystic Turban]] for a Blue Piece of Cloth.
100 of these are needed for the [[Oriental Outfits Quest]].
50 of these are needed for the [[Assassin Outfits Quest]].
1 of this is needed for the [[Jester Outfits Quest]].

name: Abacus
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer. Erig owns 2 abaci, with the text: *{{Message|type=look|If you possess this abacus, you are a thief. Please return it to Erig at once!}} *{{Message|type=look|Last Abacus, created in memory of erig.net, supported fansite of Tibia till March 2009.}} This item can no longer be obtained due to the closure of [[Erig.net]] on March 28, 2009. Its replica is the [[Abacus (Replica)]].

Abacuserig21.png|One of the abaci
history: Although this item was implemented with the [[Updates/7.8|Summer Update 2006]], it used to be [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable]] till [[Updates/8.20|Summer Update 2008]] when it became the fansite item of [[Erig.net]].
flavortext: If you use it wisely, you may write yourself into the history books. It was awarded by Erig.

name: Acorn
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
A creature product. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
50 Are needed in [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].

name: Almanac of Magic
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Nature Magic Spellbook]], [[Spellbook]] and [[Spellbook of Dragha]].
Needed in a mission of [[The New Frontier Quest]].
flavortext: Invaluable for all magic research.

name: Amarie's Favourite Book
notes:
Looks the same as [[Red Square Book]]
\nTemporarily obtainable in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].

name: Amazon Disguise Kit
notes:
When used, it temporarily turns you into an [[Amazon]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Birdcage Kit]], a [[Dwarf Disguise Kit]], a [[Globe Kit]], a [[Gnomish Crystal Package]], a [[Mysterious Package (AVIN)]], a [[Mysterious Package (CGB)]], a [[Mysterious Package (TBI)]], a [[Table Lamp Kit]] and a [[Used Globe Kit]].\nItem temporarily obtained in {{Spoiler Section|Secret Service Quest|Mission 6 - The Weakest Spot}}.
flavortext: It contains the clothes of a beautiful amazon.

name: Ancient Stone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Eternal Guardian | Ogre Brute | Stone Devourer | Stone Golem | The Last Lore Keeper | The Source of Corruption
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Angelic Axe
droppedby: Humongous Fungus | Mutated Tiger | Weakened Shlorg | Feroxa
notes: It's a very rare loot from [[Mutated Tiger]].

name: Animal Cure
notes: Looks the same as a vial of [[Slime (Liquid)|Slime]], [[Wonder Glue]], a [[Flask with Beaver Bait]], a [[Flask with Paint]], a [[Flask of Poison]], and a [[Flask of Plant Poison]].\nItem needed for 5th mission of [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].\nCan ONLY be purchased from [[Siflind]] during 5th mission of [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]] and you must have completed mission 4 of [[The Ice Islands Quest]], otherwise she will say that she is out of stock.

name: Animal Fetish
notes: Looks the same as a [[Dirty Fur]].\nPossibly temporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 10.

name: Animate Dead Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
Use it on a [[corpse]] to transform it into a [[skeleton]] to become your minion like a [[Summon|summoned monster]]. It may be convenient for paladins and knights to have such a summon in certain situations: for instance to block monsters that doesn't push other. If in need, you may bring a corpse with yourself. For instance, a [[Dead Snake]] weights 12 oz and is usable for 11 minutes.
There are certain rules governing when the rune may be used: * You must stand next to a corpse (it cannot be in your backpack) and the tile (or an adjacent one) must be free for the summon to spawn. It's possible to summon a skeleton while the character and the corpse are both inside a [[Protection Zone]]. * You cannot use the rune on non-decaying corpses or special corpse-alike objects like the [[Dead Frog (Item)]] dropped by [[Dark Apprentice]]s. However, at the time of writing, [[Lizard Snakecharmer]]s still drop a regular snake corpse. * It cannot be used on a first stage of corpse decay of certain creatures: humans, but they decay quickly. * You cannot use it during the first 10 seconds after killing a monster, as the rune will destroy a corpse like a [[Disintegrate Rune]]. For the spell, see [[Animate Dead]].

name: Antlers
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It's a creature product, but it has a use. You can use a [[Star Herb]] on it to obtain an [[Antler Talisman]]. Don't sell in [[Rookgaard]] or [[Dawnport]], as the price increases in [[Mainland]].

name: Armor Rack Kit
buyfrom: Borkas, Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in an [[house]] to construct an {{Ilink|Armor Rack}} [[Armor Rack]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct an armor rack.

name: Aubergine
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Avalanche Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes: [[File:Freezing Icon.gif]] Shoots an [[Ice]] attack that covers a large circular area centered around the target, this is the [[Druid]]s' equivalent of the [[Great Fireball]].\n\nThe spell to create the rune is called [[Avalanche]].
history: The price was changed from 57 to 64 since [[Summer Update 2024]].

name: Baby Rotworm
notes:
Look the same as a [[Worm]].
Used to bribe [[Humgolf]] in [[The New Frontier Quest]].
flavortext: It looks hungry.

name: Badger Fur
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Bag of Oriental Spices
notes:
The official [[Tibia-Wiki|Tibia-Wiki.net]] item ('''not''' the [[TibiaWiki]] item). It was created by {{character|Diantris}}. 

Its replica is the [[Bag of Oriental Spices (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|According to tibia-wiki.net, jalapeÃ±o peppers are as hot and famous as the place they come from - Ankrahmun.|According to tibia-wiki.net, a bulb of garlic is a great spice AND protection against vampires.|According to tibia-wiki.net, star and sling herbs taste like cinnamon and vanilla.}}
flavortext: Those spices were gathered all around the Tibian world.

name: Bamboo Stick
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Banana Chocolate Shake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: Sweetness.

name: Banana Sash
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Barrel Kit
buyfrom: Borkas, Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Barrel}} [[Barrel]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a barrel.

name: Battle Stone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Ogre Brute | Armadile | Behemoth | Ogre Brute
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Chop]] and [[Powerful Chop]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
flavortext: It seems to be perfect to shape a weapon from it. Someone could definitely be interested in it.

name: Batwing Hat
notes: It increases [[Magic Level]] by 1 when worn. It has the same attributes as [[Hat of the Mad]] but is 1[[oz]] lighter and harder to obtain, which raises its price.

name: Bear Doll
notes: It is a very rare present given by [[Santa Claus]] during [[Christmas]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.5|Summer Update 2005]], it became obtainable with [[Christmas]] 2010.

name: Beautiful Marble Statue
notes:
If you use [[Obsidian Knife]] on a [[Piece of Marble Rock]] you have a chance for it to turn into a Beautiful Marble Statue.

* You can earn the Achievement [[Marblelous]] by making a Beautiful Marble Statue from a [[Piece of Marble Rock]]. * You can earn the Achievement [[Marble Madness]] by making five Beautiful Marble Statues from [[Piece of Marble Rock|Pieces of Marble Rock]].
flavortext: This little figurine of Tibiasula was masterfully sculpted by "player name".

name: Beer Bottle
notes: Looks the same as an [[Empty Beer Bottle]] and a [[Bottle]].<noinclude>Part of [[The Ultimate Booze Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: It is filled with the legendary dwarvish brown ale.

name: Beetle Necklace
droppedby: Lancer Beetle | Orclops Doomhauler | The Blightfather
notes:
It increases your speed by 4 points (2 levels).
\n*For other items that grant speed bonuses, see: [[Speed Set]].

name: Bejeweled Ship's Telescope
notes:
It can be rotated. Considered luxurious decoration.
\nObtainable in the [[Treasure Hunt Quest]].
flavortext: It's the only left-over from a famous pirate treasure.

name: Berserker
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Massacre | Rupture | War Golem
notes: Strong two-handed weapon for mid-[[level]]s. It has the same attack value of [[Magic Sword]] and [[Blade of Corruption]], two level 80+ swords, while being usable by a level 65. It is one of the most powerful two-handed sword that has 3 imbuement slots until level 200, when the [[Slayer of Destruction]] becomes available.

name: Big Table Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem, Yulas
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Big Table}} [[Big Table]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a big table.

name: Birdcage Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Birdcage}} [[Birdcage]] (with a bird inside). It looks the same as a tiny [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a birdcage.

name: Black Candle
notes: It can be found near the [[Corruption Hole]] in central [[Zao]] and in [[Drefia]]. It disappears when burnt out - 30 minutes after you pick it up - and cannot be unlit.

name: Black Hood
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Black Jade Cobra
notes: Provides a small amount of red light.\nObtainable in the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Black Skull (Item)
droppedby: Death Priest Shargon | Flameborn | Hellspawn | Infernalist | Floating Savant
notes: Provides 4 squares of permanent red light. Can be used for decoration or as a light source, if equipped. It is a very rare loot from [[Infernalist]], [[Hellspawn]] and its boss [[Flameborn]].

name: Black Wool
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Blade of Corruption
droppedby: Draken Elite | Paiz the Pauperizer | Essence of Malice
notes: A good, often cheaper alternative to the [[Magic Sword]]. It has the same attack power, but one less shielding bonus.

name: Blank Paper
notes:
Found in [[Magician Quarter]] ([[Yalahar]]). This paper is extremely blank.
Looks the same as a [[Sheet of Tracing Paper (Blank)]].
Used in [[25 Years of Tibia Quest]].
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Blank Paper changed from [[File:Blank Paper (Old).gif]] to [[File:Blank Paper.gif]].
flavortext: It is rewriteable.

name: Blessed Steak
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It will refill your mana completely.

When using a Blessed Steak, [[Green Sparkles Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Sparkles Effect}} will appear on the user who will get the following message: "{{Server Message|Your mana was refilled completely.}}". Note that you can only eat this dish once every 10 minutes. This cooldown is shared with all other [[Jean Pierre]] dishes as well as with all [[Hireling]] dishes, but not with the [[Cupcakes]]. 

To create this dish you must speak with the [[Djinn]] [[Jean Pierre]] in [[Ankrahmun]], near the Marid Fortress, during the Hot Cuisine event.

'''Necessary Ingredients:'''

*1 [[Ham]] [[File:Ham.gif]]
*5 [[Plum]]s [[File:Plum.gif]]
*1 [[Onion]] [[File:Onion.gif]]
*2 [[Beetroot]] [[File:Beetroot.gif]]
*1 [[Pumpkin]] [[File:Pumpkin.gif]]
*2 [[JalapeÃ±o Pepper]]s [[File:JalapeÃ±o Pepper.gif]]

Only obtainable through the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
flavortext: It's nicely decorated with plums and pumpkin.

name: Blood Crystal
notes: Charging it will result in a [[Blood Crystal (Charged)]]. It looks the same as a [[Rough Red Gem]].\nPart of the [[Blood Brothers Quest]].
flavortext: It has the power to store magic energy.

name: Blood Goblet
notes: It is a very rare drop. Used as decoration. \nObtainable in a dead skeleton in [[Vengoth/Castle]] after completing the [[Blood Brothers Quest]]

name: Blood Preservation
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Arachir the Ancient One | Arthei | Boreth | Diblis the Fair | Lersatio | Nightfiend | The Pale Count | Vampire | Vampire Bride | Vampire Viscount | Vicious Manbat
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
flavortext: Someone put a cocktail straw in it.

name: Blood Skull
notes:
It looks like a skull with blood spots on it.

Obtainable on the lower part of [[Vengoth]] after giving 100 [[Vampire Lord Token]]s to [[Storkus]] in the [[Vampire Hunter Quest]]. Additionally, since the patch on March 9th 2010, it is available in Vengoth Castle in a chest that was previously blocked. The purpose of the Blood Skull is not known yet. There are rumours that it is a key of some kind.

name: Bloodkiss Flower
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Looks the same as a [[Royal Blossom|Red Royal Blossom]].\nPossibly temporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 10.

name: Bloody Pincers
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blood Crab | Deepsea Blood Crab | Thanatursus
notes: This item's value is usually higher than the amount NPCs pay for it because it's used for the [[Imbuing|imbuements]]. 15 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Vampirism]] [[Imbuing|imbuement]].

name: Blue Bed Kit
notes: Looks the same as a [[Furniture Package]] and many other [[Furniture]] kits.
history:
It could be used on a bed to change the colors of the covers until [[Updates/12.20.9260|November, 2019]], when beds inside player's houses and guildhalls became movable. It was replaced by the [[Blue Headboard]] and [[Blue Footboard]]. 


Since the item may still be found in game but is no longer obtainable, it's a relatively rare item.
flavortext: Use it on your bed to change the bed to blue.

name: Blue Christmas Bundle
notes:
[[Christmas Bundle]]s come in [[Red Christmas Bundle|Red]], [[Green Christmas Bundle|Green]] or Blue. The [[Christmas Bundle]] can so far only be obtained as a present from [[Santa Claus]] at [[Christmas]] time or bought from [[Furniture Shopkeeper NPCs]].

When used, [[Blue Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Blue Notes Effect}} will appear and the player will find 7 random items of the following selection:
* 15 [[Candy|Candies]]
* 20 [[Cookie]]s
* 10 [[Candy Cane]]s
* 10 [[Orange]]s
* 5 [[Apple]]s
* [[Gingerbreadman]]
* [[Christmas Wreath]]
* [[Christmas Branch]]
* [[Blue Christmas Garland]]
* [[Christmas Card]]
* [[Christmas Present (Blue)]]

And there is a low chance to get [[Christmas Present (Blue)]] as an 8th item, provided it was not part of the 7 items.
flavortext: It contains random christmas decoration.

name: Blue Pillow
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Velvet, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Pillow]] for more information regarding pillows.

name: Boggy Dreads
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Bone Shoulderplate
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Abacus (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of a [[Abacus]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Abyssador's Lash
notes: A creature product which can be given to [[Gnomission]] by saying ''hero''. Once handed in you will no longer need a [[Red Teleport Crystal]] to enter the third warzone, meaning you can hunt there but cannot fight [[Abyssador]] more than once in a 20 hour period.

name: Adventurer's Stone
notes: Teleports you to the [[Adventurer's Guild]] if used in a temple. To get an Adventurer's Stone, go to any [[Priest NPCs|temple NPC]] and say '''hi''', '''adventurer's stone''', '''yes'''. New players can also get this item from a [[chest]] on [[Island of Destiny]] and [[Dawnport]].
flavortext: Use it in a city temple to travel to the Adventurers Guild. A replacement is available at temples.

name: Advertisement Sign
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]]. Can only be used on [[Cracked Stone]]s.

name: Aggressive Fluid
notes:
Looks the same as [[Urine]]. It becomes a [[Reagent Flask]] a few minutes after being created.


Item temporarily obtained in [[War Against The Hive Quest]].
flavortext: It is unstable and will lose its aggressive properties soon.

name: Airtight Cloth
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Orange Tapestry]].
\nObtained in [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.
flavortext: It should be fine for keeping gases inside.

name: Albino Plate
notes: Dropped by the rare boss [[White Pale]], but not very useful. Even though the similar name to [[Molten Plate]], [[Frozen Plate]] and [[Divine Plate]] it has a very different look.

name: Alloy Legs
droppedby: Brachiodemon | Bulltaur Alchemist | Control Tower | Katex Blood Tongue | Metal Gargoyle | Sorcerer's Apparition | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes: A lesser variant of the [[Grasshopper Legs]]. It weighs 13.0 oz more, as well as having one less armor.

name: Ancient Dream
notes: Used and temporarily obtained in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: The dream glows as if alive.

name: Anniversary Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.
history: * One could be obtained by each player by talking to [[Knightmare (NPC)|NPC Knightmare]] and asking him for a ''present'' during the celebration of [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]].
flavortext: It was awarded during the festivities of Tibia's 15th anniversary.

name: Anniversary Cake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It was introduced to celebrate [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using a [[Surprise Bag (Red)]] or using [[Anniversary Remains]] left by [[Chayenne (Creature)|Chayenne]] or [[Count Tofifti (Creature)|Count Tofifti]].
flavortext: It was created by Tibia's finest bakers for the celebration of 15 years of Tibia.

name: Arcane Insignia
notes: It was given to the randomly chosen winners of ten feedback forms (on {{OfficialNewsArchive|2070|May 10, 2012}}, {{OfficialNewsArchive|2129|July 12, 2012}}, {{OfficialNewsArchive|2149|August 16, 2012}}, {{OfficialNewsArchive|2257|December 11, 2012}}, {{OfficialNewsArchive|2691|February 26, 2014}}, {{OfficialNewsArchive|2888|September 4, 2014}}, {{OfficialNewsArchive|3060|January 16, 2015}}, {{OfficialNewsArchive|3502|March 4, 2016}}, {{OfficialNewsArchive|3535|April 4, 2016}}, and {{OfficialNewsArchive|4182|July 14, 2017}}), to the winners of {{OfficialNewsArchive|3096|''Readle's Scavenger Hunt''}} (on {{post|36816126|March 4, 2015}}), {{OfficialNewsArchive|3302|''Behind the Gate of Expertise for Level 999''}} (on {{post|37180742|October 2, 2015}}) and {{OfficialNewsArchive|4030|''How Thais Received its Name'' }}(on {{OfficialNewsArchive|4099|May 19, 2017}}) contests, and to the winners of an eleventh feedback form (who were not chosen randomly, on {{OfficialNewsArchive|3502|March 4, 2016}}).

name: Armageddon Plans
notes: This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Artist's Brush
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using [[Anniversary Remains]] left by [[Penciljack (Creature)|Penciljack]] and [[Lyxoph (Creature)|Lyxoph]].

name: Artist's Brush (with Paint)
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using [[Anniversary Remains]] left by [[Penciljack (Creature)|Penciljack]].
flavortext: Paint is dripping from its tip.

name: Artist's Canvas
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using [[Anniversary Remains]] left by [[Penciljack (Creature)|Penciljack]] and [[Lyxoph (Creature)|Lyxoph]].

name: Artist's Easel
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. An [[Easel Kit]] could be obtained by using [[Anniversary Remains]] left by [[Penciljack (Creature)|Penciljack]] and [[Lyxoph (Creature)|Lyxoph]]. This item must be unpacked. Unlike most other furniture, the easel and all of its paintings can be carried.

name: Artist's Easel (with Canvas)
notes:
Can be obtained by using an {{Ilink|Artist's Canvas}} [[Artist's Canvas]] on an {{Ilink|Artist's Easel}} [[Artist's Easel|Easel]].
You can paint on it by using a {{Ilink|Artist's Brush (with Paint)}} [[Artist's Brush (with Paint)]] on it.
\n\n{{Seealso|Artist's Easel (with Canvas)/Statistics}}
history: * It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]].
flavortext: An empty canvas has been placed on it.

name: Artist's Palette
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using [[Anniversary Remains]] left by [[Penciljack (Creature)|Penciljack]] and [[Lyxoph (Creature)|Lyxoph]]. It looks the same as [[Palette and Brushes]].

name: Babel Swimmer
notes:
This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt can be seen through the [[Market]].

name: Badge of Glory
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.
\nThis item can only be obtained as a [[fansites|Promoted or Supported Fansite]] contest prize.

name: Badger Fur (Decoration)
notes: Itemized form of [[Badger Fur (Object)]]. Note that it has weight and thus can be carried. Data can be found on the [[Market]]. Looks the same as the object counterpart.

name: Badly Made Piece of Cloth
notes:
A badly made piece of cloth can be found in [[Workshop Quarter]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Luminous Piece of Cloth]].
flavortext: It doesn't look as though it could be useful for anything.

name: Bag of Apple Slices
droppedby: Bane Lord | Ekatrix | Witch | Yaga the Crone
notes:
This is the item needed to tame a [[Donkey]] [[image:Donkey.gif]].
It has a chance of breaking when used.

Broke: '''You scattered all of the apple slices without any success.'''
Failed: '''You did not manage to feed the donkey enough apple slices.'''
Failed: '''The donkey transformation suddenly wears off.'''
Succeeded: '''Munching a large pile of apple slices tamed the donkey.'''

To tame a [[Donkey]], go to the [[Incredibly Old Witch]]'s house, [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}125.250,126.95,7,2,1,1 here]. Lure any wild [[creature]] and wait for the Incredibly Old Witch to turn it into a [[Donkey]] and then use the Bag of Apple Slices on the changed creature before it returns to its normal form again. Can be obtained from an [[Unrealized Dream]].
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Bag of Screws
notes: Looks the same as a [[Grey Bag]] and a [[Scum Bag]].\nPart of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 12.

name: Bag with Stolen Gold
droppedby: Elvira Hammerthrust | Jesse the Wicked | Mornenion | Robby the Reckless
notes:
This item expires 24 hours after it is created, i.e. when the robber spawns. For this reason it cannot be traded on the [[Market]]. Turn it in as soon as possible.
It looks the same as a [[Camouflage Bag]].\nItem obtained during the [[Bank Robbery Mini World Change]]. Return it to the corresponding bank to get the [[achievement]] [[Honest Finder]]. Return 5 of them and you'll earn the achievement [[Goldhunter]].
flavortext: It contains so much cash that you wouldn't have any idea how to use it. Return it to a nearby bank.

name: Bamboo Drawer Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Bamboo Drawer}} [[Bamboo Drawer]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a bamboo drawer.

name: Bamboo Leaves
droppedby: Bane Lord | Draken Abomination | Draken Spellweaver
notes:
Used to Tame a {{Ilink|Tamed Panda}} [[Panda]]. There is a risk that the [[Panda]] will eat the leaves when you use them. It has nearly the same chance of breaking as [[Slingshot]].

'''Failed''':
{{Sound|The panda flees.}}
'''Failed''':
{{Sound|The panda refuses to follow any of your orders.}}
'''Broke''':
{{Sound|While you were trying to soothe the panda, it ate all of the remaining bamboo behind your back.}}
'''Succeeded''':
{{Sound|You tamed the panda.}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Bamboo Table Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Bamboo Table}} [[Bamboo Table]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a bamboo table.

name: Bar of Gold
droppedby: Ahau | King Zelos | Megasylvan Yselda | Morshabaal | Thawing Dragon Lord
sellto: Augustin, Chantalle, Jessica, Odemara, Talila, Tesha, Valindara
notes:
Fifty of them can be seen near [[Gnomillion]].\n\nYou may receive one from the chest reachable after using a [[Charged Compass (Violet)]] on the [[Magic Portal]] near [[Andrew Lyze]].
A bar of gold can be obtained from [[Brass-Shod Chest]]s inside [[Iksupan]].
history: This was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] until the [[Updates/11.80|Summer Update 2018]].

name: Basalt Fetish
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Lost Basher | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Lost Thrower
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Basalt Figurine
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Lost Basher | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Lost Thrower
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Basket (Puppies)
notes: Very rare reward of the [[Noodles is Gone Mini World Change]].
flavortext: There are little puppies inside.

name: Bell
notes: Item temporarily obtainable in the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] - [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest/Spoiler#Golem Repair|Golem Repair]] task.

name: Belongings of a Deceased
notes:
Using this bag will give you a chance of getting one of the following items: 
*{{Ilink|Worn Leather Boots}} [[Worn Leather Boots]]
*{{Ilink|Dirty Cape}} [[Dirty Cape]]
*{{Ilink|Broken Piggy Bank}} [[Broken Piggy Bank]]
*{{Ilink|Egg}} [[Egg]]
*{{Ilink|Bat Wing}} [[Bat Wing]]
*{{Ilink|Honeycomb}} [[Honeycomb]]
*{{Ilink|Spider Fangs}} [[Spider Fangs]]
*{{Ilink|Worm}} 4 [[Worm]]s
*{{Ilink|Bunch of Troll Hair}} [[Bunch of Troll Hair]]
*{{Ilink|Gold Coin}} 6 [[Gold Coin]]s
*{{Ilink|Chicken Feather}} [[Chicken Feather]]
*{{Ilink|Turtle Shell}} [[Turtle Shell]]
*{{Ilink|White Mushroom}} [[White Mushroom]]
*{{Ilink|Knife}} [[Knife]]
*{{Ilink|Scarf}} [[Scarf]] 
*{{Ilink|Garlic Necklace}} [[Garlic Necklace]]
*{{Ilink|Spider Silk}} [[Spider Silk]]
*{{Ilink|White Pearl}} [[White Pearl]]
*{{Ilink|Piggy Bank}} [[Piggy Bank]]
*{{Ilink|Doll}} [[Doll]]
*{{Ilink|Book of Prayers}} [[Book of Prayers]]
*{{Ilink|Iron Ore}} [[Iron Ore]]
*{{Ilink|Fish Fin}} [[Fish Fin]] (rare)
*{{Ilink|Plague Bell}} [[Plague Bell]] (rare)
*{{Ilink|Plague Mask}} [[Plague Mask]] (rare)
*{{Ilink|Boots of Haste}} [[Boots of Haste]] (very rare)
*{{Ilink|Flask of Warrior's Sweat}} [[Flask of Warrior's Sweat]] (very rare?)
*{{Ilink|Slug Drug}} [[Slug Drug]] (very rare)
*{{Ilink|Nose Ring}} [[Nose Ring]] (very rare)

{{Seealso|Belongings of a Deceased/Statistics}}

It looks the same as a [[Bag]], [[Belongings of a Deceased (The Ravager)]], [[Belongings of a Deceased (Death Priest Shargon)]] and a [[Loot Bag (Item)]].
One can be obtained from [[Ottokar]] by trading a [[Medicine Pouch]].

name: Black Knight Doll
notes:
The official [[TibiaLatina.wikia.com]] item. Once used, it pulls out the sword and bonelord shield: [[File:Black Knight Doll (Pulling).gif]]. The Black Knight Doll was created by {{Character|Lupus Aurelius}}.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Comandante Jones}} ([[Gladera]])
* {{Character|Cotinha Fullcharlove}} ([[Collabra]])
* {{Character|Tron Blacksoul}} ([[Marbera]])
sounds: {{Sound List|I can hear their whisperings... Revenge!|You shall feel pain and terror, <Player>!|I do not need a sword to slaughter you.|I can speak 469 and more...|My dark magic lies on tibialatina.wikia.com|And black shall be the colour of my revenge...}}
flavortext: Awarded by TibiaLatina.Fandom.com. My sad story is told by few living humans but many dead warriors.

name: Blank Parchment
notes:
It's a rewritable [[Parchment (Yellow)|Yellow Parchment]]. This was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] for many years.
It looks the same as a [[Blank Poetry Parchment]].
{{seealso|Parchment}}
flavortext: It is rewriteable.

name: Blazing Bone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dragonling | Hellhound | Lava Golem | Magma Crawler | Vulcongra | Weeper
notes: 10 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Dragon Hide]] and [[Powerful Dragon Hide]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Intricate Dragon Hide, Powerful Dragon Hide

name: Blob Bomb
notes:
Looks the same as [[Coloured Egg (Red)]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[War Against The Hive Quest]].

name: Blood Tincture in a Vial
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 4 are needed for the [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: Used for writing and spattering unholy items.

name: Blood Vial
notes: Two of them are obtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: Tomruk The Ruddy gave you this vial to collect blood samples.

name: Bloody Dwarven Beard
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Blue Pollen
notes: Can be harvested by using [[Peppermoon Bells]] plants, which grow in abundance north-west of [[Rathleton]], in the [[Oramond Hydra/Bog Raider Cave]]. Needed in part of the [[Oramond_Quest/Spoiler#The_Powder_of_the_Stars|Oramond Quest - The Powder of the Stars]].

name: Blue Powder
notes: It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and unlike other creature products, has a low gold-to-oz ratio.

name: Bolfrim's Golden Bug Trophy
notes: It could be obtained rarely during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]] by using [[Bolfrim (Creature)|Bolfrim's]] [[corpse]]. It looks like a scaled version of [[The Famous Golden Bug]].
flavortext: It was awarded during the festivities of Tibia's 15th anniversary.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Ogre Shaman | Lost Basher | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Ogre Sage | Ogre Shaman
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
flavortext: The strange shape of this key glistens softly in the light.

name: Bone Flute
notes: It looks the same as a [[Flute Made of a Single Bone]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].
flavortext: Crude pictures of animals are carved into it.

name: Adventurer's Map
notes:
Use it to chart locations for the [[Adventurer's Guild]].
Part of [[Cartography 101 Quest]].
flavortext: This map shows various locations of Tibia above and below sea level.

name: Ancient Amulet (Quest)
notes: Some fine artisanship right there.\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes:
This map seems to be quite interesting.
It looks the same as a [[Map (Brown)]],a [[Golem Blueprint]] and a [[Secret Map]].\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].

name: Antler Talisman
flavortext: It is an antler, entwined with star herb.

name: Arena Badge
notes: You could earn these through the [[Monster Arena]] challenges, until the arena was replaced by the [[Tibiadrome]]. They could be exchanged with [[Lorenzo]] for packs of [[potions]]. \n\nThe original Arena Badges are no longer obtainable, but [[Arena Badge Replica]]s can be obtained using [[Tibiadrome|drome points]].

Its replica is the [[Assassin Doll (Replica)]].

name: Axe of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Axe of Carving (Charged)}} [[Axe of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Axe of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Axe of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Axe of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Axe of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Axe of Carving, Axe of Mayhem and Axe of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Axe of Destruction}} [[Axe of Destruction]].

name: Axe of Carving (Charged)
notes: This item is an [[Axe of Carving]] charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which could be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 20% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Axe of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Axe of Carving (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is an [[Axe of Carving]] heavily charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which could be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Axe of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Axe of Carving (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an [[Axe of Carving]] overcharged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which could be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Axe of Carving|uncharged versions]]. [[Ornate Carving Axe]] is a replica of this weapon.
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Axe of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Axe of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Axe of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Axe of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Axe of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Axe of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Axe of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Axe of Carving, Axe of Mayhem and Axe of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Axe of Destruction}} [[Axe of Destruction]].

name: Axe of Mayhem (Charged)
notes:
This item is a charged [[Axe of Mayhem]], it could be charged by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Axe of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Axe of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a heavily charged [[Axe of Mayhem]], it could be charged by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 15% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 25% to 40%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Axe of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Axe of Mayhem (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an overcharged [[Axe of Mayhem]], charged by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s. It was possible to fail overcharging, in this case you would loose your 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 20% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 30% to 60%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Axe of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Axe of Carving, Axe of Mayhem and Axe of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Axe of Destruction}} [[Axe of Destruction]].

notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s with [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of a [[Bag of Oriental Spices]].

name: Black Pit Demon
buyfrom: Agostina;For 3000 [[Drome Points]],Alberto;For 3000 [[Drome Points]],Emilio;For 3000 [[Drome Points]],Fabiana;For 3000 [[Drome Points]],Lorenzo;For 3000 [[Drome Points]]
notes:
It was obtainable by opening a [[Surprise Cube]], although these cubes are frequently preserved since they are no longer acquirable.
{{Seealso|Surprise Cube/Statistics}}
history: Before the [[Monster Arena]] was replaced with the [[Tibiadrome]], there existed an opportunity to receive a [[Surprise Cube]] from [[Lorenzo]] when exchanging [[Arena Badge]]s for potions. The likelihood of obtaining a Surprise Cube increased with the number of badges required for specific potions. These cubes could then be opened for a chance to receive a [[Pit Demon (Item)]].
flavortext: Figurine 4 of 5.

With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 35% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Blade of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Blood Crystal (Charged)
notes: It's a charged [[Blood Crystal]] and will return to its uncharged state after 24 hours. Part of the [[Blood Brothers Quest]].
flavortext: It is charged with magic energy, but that won't last forever.

name: Blood Vial (Necromancer)
notes: \nObtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: The blood in this vial is of a deep ruby red.

name: Blood Vial (Vampire)
notes: \nObtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: The blood in this vial is of a strange, luminous red.

name: Blue Pit Demon
buyfrom: Agostina;For 1500 [[Drome Points]],Alberto;For 1500 [[Drome Points]],Emilio;For 1500 [[Drome Points]],Fabiana;For 1500 [[Drome Points]],Lorenzo;For 1500 [[Drome Points]]
notes:
It was obtainable by opening a [[Surprise Cube]], although these cubes are frequently preserved since they are no longer acquirable.
{{Seealso|Surprise Cube/Statistics}}
history: Before the [[Monster Arena]] was replaced with the [[Tibiadrome]], there existed an opportunity to receive a [[Surprise Cube]] from [[Lorenzo]] when exchanging [[Arena Badge]]s for potions. The likelihood of obtaining a Surprise Cube increased with the number of badges required for specific potions. These cubes could then be opened for a chance to receive a [[Pit Demon (Item)]].
flavortext: Figurine 3 of 5.

name: Blue Sphere
notes: Two of them were distributed during the [[TibiaWiki:Contests/Craft a Fansite Item|Craft a Fansite Item]] event, one for {{Character|Makadamia}} and the other for {{Character|Favarona}}.

name: Bolt (Weak)
droppedby: Dwarf Soldier | Forest Fury | Minotaur Archer | Minotaur Poacher
buyfrom: Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Galuna, Irea, Perac, Perod, Pompan, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Talphion, Timur, Uzgod, Vincent, Willard, Xed
notes: This weaker variant of [[Bolt]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Updates/10.8|Summer Update 2015]] with all [[Weak Ammunition and Runes]], but [[CipSoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Acid Resistant Fishing Rod
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].

name: Active Probing Device
notes: It looks the same as a [[Strange Probing Device (Instable)]] and a [[Strange Probing Device]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Oramond Quest]].
flavortext: This thing looks highly instable, you better find a place to deploy it soon.

name: Adamant Shield
notes:
It's [[TibiaLife]]'s fansite item. When used, its color and light changes from Blue {{Color Box|{{RGB Light Color|23}}}} to Purple {{Color Box|{{RGB Light Color|154}}}} (and vice versa), as shown below, and it stays in the other color. It will also display one of its sounds.

[[File:Adamant Shield 2.gif]]
[[File:Adamant Shield 3.gif]]
[[File:Adamant Shield 4.gif]]

Known receivers of this item: 

*{{character|Makadamia}}, item creator.
*{{character|Carol Witt}}, administrator of [[TibiaLife]].

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to four players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Sir Demoleide}} ([[Solidera]])
* {{Character|Snaidell}} ([[Nefera]])
* {{Character|Luiz Faixas}} ([[Havera]])
* {{Character|Duchess Lara}} ([[Nefera]])
sounds: {{Sound List|These colors will blow your mind!|Everybody knows I've got the magic in me...|Shine bright like a diamond, <player>!|Are you ready to enter a world of magic, <player>?|Hail Tibia Life!}}
flavortext: It was forged with magical diamonds collected during the journey of a true tibian. Awarded by TibiaLife.com.br

name: Alptramun's Toothbrush
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
