droppedby: Morshabaal | Plunder Patriarch | The Abomination | The Dread Maiden | The Fear Feaster | The Pale Worm | The Unwelcome | Murcion | Ichgahal
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan

name: Amulet of Theurgy
notes: Depleted version of the [[Enchanted Theurgic Amulet]]. You can [[Enchanted Theurgic Amulet|recharge]] it at [[Cledwyn]] for 2 [[Silver Token]]s.

name: Anatomy Book
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: It describes the physiology of different humanoid races.

name: Ancient Liche Bone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Count Vlarkorth | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | King Zelos | Lord Azaram | Sir Baeloc
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Angel Figurine
droppedby: Brain Head | The Dread Maiden | The Fear Feaster | The Pale Worm | The Unwelcome
flavortext: It is made of ivory.

name: Apron
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Arcane Staff (Unknown)
notes: It looks the same as an [[Arcane Staff]] and [[Racoohan Rat Revealer]]. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Assassin Doll (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. It looks the same as an [[Assassin Doll]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Axe of Destruction
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history: This weapon was created as the result of the unification of the [[Axe of Carving]], [[Axe of Remedy]] and [[Axe of Mayhem]].\n\nOn [[Updates/12.08.7995|February 5, 2019]], the level requirement for this weapon was raised from 100 to 200.

name: Badbara
notes: In original state she is crying, then when used she will become happy [[File:Badbara 2.gif]] for 1 hour.\nIt is a possible reward of the [[Demon's Lullaby]] event.

name: Baking Tray (Reed)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: You will get this item if you use a [[Lump of Reed Flour Dough]] on an empty [[Baking Tray]]. If you use it on any [[Oven]], you will bake [[Reed Balls]].
flavortext: There is reed flour dough on it.

name: Balloon Cloth
notes: A Balloon Cloth spawns daily on the top of a building at [[Oramond]]'s [[Workshop Quarter]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|131.71|124.235|4|4|1|0.250.25}}. \n\nIt used to be a very rare item since it was only obtainable on the rare full map resets, but it became a daily spawn when CipSoft implemented the daily Map Refreshes on {{OfficialNewsArchive|5200|September 16, 2019}}.
flavortext: Looks as if it exploded.

name: Bard Doll
notes:
It's [[TibiaRia]]'s fansite item. When first used, it will grab a mug of beer and drink it: [[File:Bard Doll (Grabbing Beer).gif]] [[File:Bard Doll (Drinking).gif]]
If used again, it will grab the lute and play it again: [[File:Bard Doll (Grabbing Lute).gif]] [[File:Bard Doll.gif]] This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to four players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were: * {{Character|Sayodin}} ([[Tembra]]) * {{Character|Eldoratrok}} ([[Belobra]]) * {{Character|Aragorn Matador}} ([[Reinobra]]) * {{Character|Sara Sedentaria}} ([[Zenobra]])
sounds: {{Sound List|That Avar Tar stole my sword once, people now call it Excalibug. Can you belive it?!|<Player>! If I could share all the stories I heard in the Tibiaria Tavern! HAHAHA| Who can marry a necromancer? His GHOUL-FRIEND!|... and then I realised it was a hunter and not a PK. HAHAHA|Let me tell you a story from my last adventure. Have a seat and grab your mug of hydromel!}}
flavortext: A mythical bard rumoured to magically appear in Tibian taverns with a lute and a mug to tell amazing and funny stories. Granted by Tibiaria.com.

name: Bark Peeler
notes: Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

name: Bass
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
sellto: --\n| notes =Obtained by using an [[Advanced Fishing Rod]].

name: Bat (Item)
notes: Can be obtained by using a [[Net (Fishing)]] on a [[Bat]]. Note that it may take several attempts to be successful. A successful attempt will show this message {{Sound|You have catched a bat.}} A failed attempt will show this message {{Sound|The bat flutters away easily.}} Item is needed for the [[Sculptor Apprentice]] achievement.

name: Bear Skin
droppedby: Count Vlarkorth | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Lord Azaram | Sir Baeloc

name: Beast's Nightmare-Cushion
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Bed of Nails
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Barkless Devotee | Barkless Fanatic | Ravenous Hunger
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
flavortext: Not for everyone.

name: Beer Tap
notes: This item is needed along with a [[Decorative Blue Sheet|Decorative Blueâ€Žâ€Ž]], [[Decorative Green Sheetâ€Žâ€Ž|Green]] or [[Decorative Red Sheet|Red Sheet]] in order to obtain [[Blue Rolling Barrel|Blue]], [[Green Rolling Barrel|Green]] or [[Red Rolling Barrel]] mount.
flavortext: Can be used to tap a barrel of beer.

name: Belongings of a Deceased (Death Priest Shargon)
notes:
Using this bag will give you a chance of getting one of the following items: 
*{{Ilink|Crystal Coin}} [[Crystal Coin]]
*{{Ilink|Skull Helmet}} [[Skull Helmet]]
*{{Ilink|Skull Staff}} [[Skull Staff]]
*{{Ilink|Black Skull (Item)}} [[Black Skull (Item)|Black Skull]]

It looks the same as a [[Bag]], [[Belongings of a Deceased]], [[Belongings of a Deceased (The Ravager)]] and a [[Loot Bag (Item)]].
Obtained after slaying [[Death Priest Shargon]] in [[Dark Trails Quest]].

name: Belongings of a Deceased (The Ravager)
notes:
Using this bag will give you a chance of getting one of the following items: 
*{{Ilink|Blue Gem}} [[Blue Gem]]
*{{Ilink|Crystal Coin}} [[Crystal Coin]]
*{{Ilink|Gold Ingot}} [[Gold Ingot]]
*{{Ilink|Green Gem}} [[Green Gem]]
*{{Ilink|Ravager's Axe}} [[Ravager's Axe]]

It looks the same as a [[Bag]], [[Belongings of a Deceased]], [[Belongings of a Deceased (Death Priest Shargon)]] and a [[Loot Bag (Item)]].
Obtained after slaying [[The Ravager]] in [[Dark Trails Quest]].

name: Birthday Cake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It was introduced to celebrate [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]]. Rewarded from [[Vigintia]]'s can knockdown minigame, ''silver'' category.
history: It used to be dropped by [[PiÃ±ata Dragon]]s during the [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]], but not anymore during the [[Tibia Anniversary]] event.
flavortext: It was created by Tibia's finest bakers for the celebration of 20 years of Tibia.

name: Black Raven Kit
notes: Use it while standing inside a house to unpack a {{Ilink|Black Raven}} [[Black Raven]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].\nObtainable from the [[Bewitched]] [[World Quests|World Quest]].
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a black raven.

name: Blade of Destruction
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history: This weapon was created as the result of the unification of the [[Blade of Carving]], [[Blade of Remedy]] and [[Blade of Mayhem]].\n\nOn [[Updates/12.08.7995|February 5, 2019]], the level requirement for this weapon was raised from 100 to 200.

name: Blessed Acorn
Blister Ring
notes: You can [[Enchanted Blister Ring|recharge]] it at [[Cledwyn]] for 2 [[Silver Token]]s.
flavortext: This ring is out of magic energy.

name: Blood of the Mountain (Item)
droppedby: Ravenous Hunger | The False God | Essence of Malice | The Source of Corruption
notes:
This item can be used to provide the user the [[blessing]] [[Blood of the Mountain]]. It only works once and then it disappears, the [[Blood Effect]] {{Ilink|Blood Effect}} appears on the user and the following message will appear: {{Server Message|The Blood of the Mountain strenghtens you.}}
If the user already has the blessing, the following message will appear in orange preventing using it: {{Message|type=sound|You already possess this blessing.}}\nYou have the chance of getting this item by using a [[Mystery Box]] which is a reward from [[Cults of Tibia Quest]].
history: This was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] from its implementation till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. It became tradable at the [[Market]] and its light color was changed on {{OfficialNewsArchive|4219|August 1, 2017}} ([[Updates/11.41.5435|11.41]]).
flavortext: The Blood of the Mountain is contained in it.

name: Bloody Tears
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Two can be used during the [[Rotten Blood Quest]].

name: Blossom Bag
notes: The Blossom Bag weighs 8.00 oz, making it just as light as a regular bag, but it has 24 item spaces, just like the [[Backpack of Holding]], [[Pillow Backpack]] and [[Energetic Backpack]]. Compared to those three, it is quite easy to obtain as well. See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.\nIt's a reward from the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Blue and Golden Cordon
notes: Item obtained in {{Spoiler Section|Kilmaresh Quest|Midnight Rituals}}.

name: Blue Crystal (Item)
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: The crystal is full of energy.

name: Blue Ectoplasm
notes: It can be used to travel between the areas of the Haunted House as long as you completed the corresponding missions of the [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: The stuff nightmares are made of - literally.

name: Blue Fireworks Powder
notes: You can fill a [[Fireworks Capsule]] with it to make a Fireworks Rocket.

name: Blue Fireworks Rocket
notes: Using an [[Obsidian Knife]] on a firework allows you to disassemble the [[Fireworks|Blue Fireworks Rockets]] into its respective components: [[Blue Fireworks Powder]] and the [[Fireworks Capsule]]. \n\nYou can create one by using {{Ilink|Blue Fireworks Powder}} [[Blue Fireworks Powder]] on a {{Ilink|Fireworks Capsule}} [[Fireworks Capsule]].
flavortext: It can be disassembled with the right tool.

name: Blue Glass Plate
notes: 50 are needed for [[The Dream Courts Quest]].

name: Blue Goanna Scale
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Blue Memory Shard
notes: Item needed for {{Spoiler Section|Kilmaresh Quest|Fafnar's Wrath}}.

name: Blue Spectacles
notes: Obtained during the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
flavortext: These spectacles have strange blue lenses which appear completely opaque, yet provide perfectly clear vision.

name: Blueberry Cupcake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: One per character can be obtained from [[Brutus The Baker]] if the game world succeeds in [[A Piece of Cake]]. Eating the blueberry cupcake completely fills up your mana. The cooldown period for this item is 10 minutes

name: Blurred Transcript
notes: Looks the same as a [[Scroll (Brown)]] and an [[Old Parchment (Brown)]].\nObtained in the [[First Dragon Quest]].

name: Bone Fiddle
notes: You can play it like a [[Musical Instruments|Musical Instrument]]. Either [[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} or [[White Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|White Notes Effect}} will appear when you play it. It can be very useful when fighting creatures that deal a lot of [[Life Drain]].\nObtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]].

name: Bone Fiddle without Strings
notes: Temporarily obtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]].

name: Bone Meal
notes: It's the result of grinding a [[Skull (Item)]].\nPart of the [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].

name: 25 Years Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.\n\nOne can be obtained by characters who received at least 7,197 [[Theons]] during [[Tibia's 25th Anniversary]] and open their open {{ilink|Big Reward Box}} [[Big Reward Box]].
history: This backpack originally cost 75,000 [[Theons]] but due to a bug with NPC [[Theodora]] CipSoft decided to {{OfficialNewsArchive|6764|reduce its price}} to 7,197 [[Theons]].
flavortext: It could be bought for Theons after the festivities of Tibia's 25th anniversary.

name: 50 Theons
droppedby: Great Timedisplaced Anomaly | Major Timedisplaced Anomaly | Major Timedisplaced Anomaly (Fiehonja) | Minor Timedisplaced Anomaly | Minor Timedisplaced Anomaly (Rookgaard) | Timedisplaced Anomaly | Major Timedisplaced Anomaly (Issavi) | Major Timedisplaced Anomaly (Rascacoon) | Minor Timedisplaced Anomaly (Ankrahmun) | Minor Timedisplaced Anomaly (Greenshore) | Timedisplaced Anomaly (Banuta) | Timedisplaced Anomaly (Chazorai) | Timedisplaced Anomaly (Warzone)
notes: ''Theons'' are a special currency related to [[Tibia's 25th Anniversary]].

name: 200 Theons
notes: ''Theons'' are a special currency related to [[Tibia's 25th Anniversary]].

name: 7197 Theons
notes:
''Theons'' are a special currency related to [[Tibia's 25th Anniversary]]. 

You obtain this once you defeat [[Lord Retro]] ([[Retros Treasure]]) for the first time during the [[Tibia's 25th Anniversary]].

The number resembles "7th January 1997", the date [[Tibia]] was released.

name: Abomination's Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Abomination's Tail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Abomination's Tongue
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Addled Egg
notes: They can be found on the floor around [[The Feeding Grounds]].\n\nThey are required for the ''Do not Feed the Porker'' game of the [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Adventurers' Guild Picture
notes: Obtained by using [[Palette and Brushes]] on a [[Blank Paper]] in [[Adventurer's Guild]] during the [[25 Years of Tibia Quest]] ({{Mapper Coords|125.200|126.38|7|2|text=here}}).\n|marketable=n

name: Afflicted Strider Head
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Afflicted Strider Worms
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: All Knowing Sausages
notes: Using this item will reveal the location of [[The Great Schnitzel]]'s gate during the [[Orcsoberfest]] event.\n\nIt can be bought from [[Xaver]] for 100 Festive Points.
flavortext: The all knowing sausages know probably all mysteries of the world. Too bad they only want to talk about schnitzel.

name: Almost Full Picture Album (Ab'Dendriel)
notes: Part of the [[25 Years of Tibia Quest]].
flavortext: Two pictures are missing. Under the first missing one you read: "house in the southern part of Ab'Dendriel".

name: Almost Full Picture Album (Calcanea)
notes: Part of the [[25 Years of Tibia Quest]].
flavortext: One picture is missing. You read: "Calcanea".

name: Amethyst Necklace
notes: Someone can trade 4,000 trust points for this necklace with [[Tik'hi Tak'he]] in [[Rascacoon]].

name: Another Yellow Present Kit
notes: Using [[Another Yellow Present Kit]] within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]] triggers a transformation, converting the kit into [[Another Yellow Present]]. {{Ilink|Another Yellow Present}}
flavortext: Use it in your house to place another yellow present.

name: Armillary Sphere (TibiaMaps)
notes:
It's [[TibiaMaps]]' fansite item. 

When using this item, a message related to one of the following 6 places will be displayed:
# The alluring position is the {{Mapper Coords|text=small island|127.155|125.138|7|2|1|0.50.5}} in [[Jakundaf Desert]].
# The captivating position is [[Sword of Fury]]'s {{Mapper Coords|text=small island|125.101|125.86|7|2|1|0.50.5}} near [[Rookgaard]].
# The enthralling position is {{Mapper Coords|text=the island|126.62|124.193|7|2|1|0.50.5}} known as [[Isle of Solitude]].
# The fascinating position is {{Mapper Coords|text=the island|125.163|126.47|7|2|1|0.50.5}} located West of the [[Adventurers' Guild]] known as [[Calcanea]].
# The intriguing position is {{Mapper Coords|text=the unreachable ice island|125.248|123.101|7|2|1|0.50.5}} located Northeast of [[Senja]].
# The mysterious position is {{Mapper Coords|text=the small cave|127.128|124.200|15|4|1|0.250.25}} where the NPC [[Basilisk]] is found.

It has also other stages that appear when interacted with:

[[File:Armillary Sphere (TibiaMaps) 2.gif]]
[[File:Armillary Sphere (TibiaMaps) 3.gif]]
[[File:Armillary Sphere (TibiaMaps) 4.gif]]

Known players to have received this item are:

* {{Character|Mathias Bynens}} as a contact person and member of the team.
* {{Character|Robin Kint}} as the winner of the TibiaMaps.io fansite item contest (item creator).
* {{Character|Hunter of Dragoes}}, {{Character|Lee kun}}, {{Character|Sofsterella}}, {{Character|Picture}} and {{Character|Spenceron}} for their contribution to the fansite.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Lomer Zeth}} ([[Menera]])
* {{Character|Kurayami'Dreed}} ([[Havera]])
* {{Character|Tiu Lucca}} ([[Reinobra]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Alluring position detected: 32667,32137,7|Captivating position detected: 32101,32085,7|Enthralling position detected: 32318,31936,7|Fascinating position detected: 32163,32302,7|Intriguing position detected: 32248,31588,7|Mysterious position detected: 32640,31943,15}}
flavortext: It's a sphere with models of the celestial bodies in the sky, used when navigating. TibiaMaps.io have used this sphere on their adventures to explore the Tibian lands.

name: Artefact Box
notes: Obtained during the [[Adventures of Galthen Quest]].
flavortext: The knight Galthen built this box to hold Prime Artefacts.

name: Baby Munster
notes:
Fansite item of [[Rookie.com.pl]].

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Leozera Spit}} ([[Celebra]])
* {{Character|Khronnous}} ([[Astera]])
* {{Character|Zekinoma}} ([[Pacera]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail Rookie.com.pl!|I wanna be a big boss when I grow up!|Meeeeep!|Play with me, <player>!|Stay on Rookgaard, we have cookies!}}
flavortext: Legends say that when he grew up, he accidentally swallowed his favourite toy. Awarded by Rookie.com.pl.

name: Baby Munster (Activated)
notes: Fansite item of [[Rookie.com.pl]].
flavortext: Legends say that when he grew up, he accidentally swallowed his favourite toy. Awarded by Rookie.com.pl.

name: Bag of Smuggled Goods
notes: The item is temporarily obtained and used during [[A_Pirate%27s_Tail_Quest/Spoiler#Sniff|A Pirate's Tail Quest]]. It also looks the same as a [[Bag (Ahmet)]], a [[Pirate Bag]] and a [[Suspicious Surprise Bag]].\n

name: Bag You Desire
droppedby: Brachiodemon | Infernal Demon | Infernal Phantom | Branchy Crawler | Mould Phantom | Rotten Golem | Bony Sea Devil | Capricious Phantom | Hazardous Phantom | Turbulent Elemental | Cloak of Terror | Vibrant Phantom | Courage Leech | Many Faces | Distorted Phantom | Paladin's Apparition | Knight's Apparition | Druid's Apparition | Sorcerer's Apparition | Goshnar's Spite | Goshnar's Cruelty | Goshnar's Hatred | Goshnar's Greed | Goshnar's Malice | Goshnar's Megalomania
notes:
For non-boss creatures, this item is only dropped by players with at least one of the [[Goshnar's Taints]] active. For non-boss creatures and bosses with the exception of [[Goshnar's Megalomania]], the drop chance is higher for players with more taints. The chance of dropping it from Megalomania increases every time you kill it and resets to the initial value whenever a Bag is dropped. 

While you can not equip these bags, they are an exception in the [[Bosstiary]]'s equipment loot bonus, and setting Soul War bosses in your boss slot will increase the chances of dropping it.

The bag quickly transforms into another item once the [[Reward Container]] it's in is opened. It can be transformed into any of the parts of the [[Soul Set]]:

* {{Ilink|Soulbastion}} [[Soulbastion]]
* {{Ilink|Soulbleeder}} [[Soulbleeder]]
* {{Ilink|Soulcrusher}} [[Soulcrusher]]
* {{Ilink|Soulmaimer}} [[Soulmaimer]]
* {{Ilink|Soulcutter}} [[Soulcutter]]
* {{Ilink|Soulshredder}} [[Soulshredder]]
* {{Ilink|Soulbiter}} [[Soulbiter]]
* {{Ilink|Souleater (Axe)}} [[Souleater (Axe)|Souleater]]
* {{Ilink|Soulhexer}} [[Soulhexer]]
* {{Ilink|Soultainter}} [[Soultainter]]
* {{Ilink|Soulpiercer}} [[Soulpiercer]]
* {{Ilink|Soulshanks}} [[Soulshanks]]
* {{Ilink|Soulstrider}} [[Soulstrider]]
* {{Ilink|Soulshroud}} [[Soulshroud]]
* {{Ilink|Soulmantle}} [[Soulmantle]]
* {{Ilink|Soulshell}} [[Soulshell]]
* {{Ilink|Pair of Soulwalkers}} [[Pair of Soulwalkers]]
* {{Ilink|Pair of Soulstalkers}} [[Pair of Soulstalkers]]
flavortext: It contains the most powerful artifacts from the depths of Zarganash's darkest realms.

name: Ballistic Boulder
notes: \nItem temporarily obtained and used during [[A Pirate's Tail Quest]].
history: On the first days of the external test server, this item used to be called ''ammunition''.

name: Balloon Box
notes:
It was able to be obtained by eating at [[The Ambrosia Buffet]] or by trying your luck at the [[Lucky Dragon]].
By opening this box you can get one of the following: * {{Ilink|Blue Balloon}} [[Blue Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Colourful Balloons}} [[Colourful Balloons]] * {{Ilink|Green 25 Years Balloon}} [[Green 25 Years Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Green Balloon}} [[Green Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Orange 25 Years Balloon}} [[Orange 25 Years Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Orange Balloon}} [[Orange Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Pink 25 Years Balloon}} [[Pink 25 Years Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Pink Balloon}} [[Pink Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Purple Balloon}} [[Purple Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Red 25 Years Balloon}} [[Red 25 Years Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Red Balloon}} [[Red Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Teal 25 Years Balloon}} [[Teal 25 Years Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Teal Balloon}} [[Teal Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Yellow 25 Years Balloon}} [[Yellow 25 Years Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Yellow Balloon}} [[Yellow Balloon]] {{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}
history: On May 24th, 2022, the [[Blue 25 Years Balloon]] {{Ilink|Blue 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)}} and the [[Purple 25 Years Balloon]] {{Ilink|Purple 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)}} were introduced into the game. Further details can be found in the {{OfficialNewsArchive|6749|Official News Post}}.\n\nCipsoft has confirmed that these two balloons '''cannot''' be obtained through a [[Balloon Box]]. They stated, "that would be unfair to players who already opened their boxes."

name: Banor Doll

It's [[TibiArt]]'s fansite item. When used, it transitions to a golden version without the helmet and its light changes from green to yellow.

[[File:Banor Doll (Activated).gif]]
[[File:Banor Doll (Transition 2).gif]]

It was created by {{Character|Titan of Tsunami}}

* {{Character|Everchosen}} ([[Damora]])
* {{Character|Lord Cerberus}} ([[Serdebra]])
sounds: {{Sound List|I was the first human, I am the pinnacle of creation.|I wield the power of my creators, I see their spark in you.|The gods made it my mission to save this world.|The might of the gods lies with TibiArt.net!|We are to triumph over the forces of evil, the gods will do so.}}
flavortext: Imbued with the undying soul of the first human, it bestows the might of the gods to its owner. Awarded by TibiArt.net

name: Bestiary Betterment
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will make kills count twice for the [[Bestiary]] for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily makes kills count twice for the Bestiary.

name: Abridged Promotion Scroll
notes: Using this [[Promotion Scroll]] produces the server message "{{Server Message|You have successfully used the item and received bonus promotion points.}}" and grants the character 3 promotion points to spend in the [[Wheel of Destiny]]. Each character can only use it once. Can only be dropped from [[Bakragore]] when fighting it under the influence of its [[Bakragore's Taints|final taint]].
flavortext: Only a hero of level 51 or above can decipher this scroll to gain 3 promotion points for the Wheel of Destiny.

name: Advanced Promotion Scroll
notes: Using this [[Promotion Scroll]] will grant the character 20 promotion points to spend in the [[Wheel of Destiny]]. Each character can only use it once. Can only be dropped from [[Bakragore]] when fighting it under the influence of its [[Bakragore's Taints|final taint]] and at least [[Bakragore's Burden|four burdens]].
flavortext: Only a hero of level 51 or above can decipher this scroll to gain 20 promotion points for the Wheel of Destiny.

name: Aurora's Collection
sounds: {{Sound List|Hi! I'm Aurora, like borealis... mystical and mysterious!|These are my favorites. Show me yours!|In this amazing backpack I carry so many things, so many memories...|Is not about what items you have Player it's about what they mean to you! |Do you have any nuts? I need to eat something before going on another rare hunt. |Hail TibiaCollection.com}}
flavortext: Equipped with a magical backpack that never runs out of space, Aurora carries her endless collection on every adventure, eager to show it to everyone along the way. Awarded by TibiaCollection.com

name: Aylie
notes:
This item is the fansite item associated with [[TibiaTales|TibiaTales.com]] and was designed by ''{{Character|Amy Meow}}''.

* Using Aylie once will transform her from her ''Elementalist'' form [[File:Aylie.gif|Aylie]] into a ''Fairy'' as depicted here. [[File:Aylie_1.gif|Aylie]]
* If used while in her ''Elementalist'' form, she will display a conversion animation, as shown here.
[[File:Aylie_2.gif]]
* When utilized while in her ''Fairy'' form, she will showcase a conversion animation, depicted here.
[[File:Aylie_3.gif]]
Aylie will remain in the chosen form until she is transformed again.
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail TibiaTales.com!|The first time I called myself Elementalist was the most magical moment of my life.|I had a dream where I had wings, it was like a FairyTale...|Magic, kindness, charm and sweetness are within me.|Feyrist? I know that place very well...|Feel my brightness and magic ''Player''!}}
flavortext: She fights injustice with kindness in any kingdom, glowing with her light and knowledge throughout all of Tibia. Awarded by TibiaTales.com

name: Bag with Naga Eggs
notes: Temporarily obtained during the [[Within the Tides Quest]].

name: Bag You Covet
notes:
This item is only dropped by bosses in the [[Rotten Blood Quest]], but can also be obtained via [[Crimson Offering]]s. Having more [[Bakragore's Taints]] active will increase the chance of looting one from a boss. 

A "first-kill chance" exists for this item while fighting [[Bakragore]], which means that when players defeat this boss for the first time, and for as long as they do not drop it, players will have a considerably higher chance to drop it. The chance of dropping it from Bakragore increases every time you kill it and resets to the initial low value whenever it is dropped.

While you can not equip these bags, they are an exception in the [[Bosstiary]]'s equipment loot bonus, and setting Rotten Blood bosses in the boss slot will increase the chances of looting it.

The bag quickly transforms into another item once the [[Reward Container]] it's in is opened. It can be transformed into any of the parts of the [[Sanguine Set]], but can only transform into a Grand version when fighting Bakragore under the influence of [[Bakragore's Burden]]:

name: Biscuit Barrier
notes:
While equipped, it speeds up your [[Regeneration]] indefinitely. 

The Biscuit Barrier restores 16 [[Mana]] every 6 seconds. Players who spend time within [[Resting Area]]s can make use of it for [[Magic Level]] training purposes.

This regeneration is also doubled if the appropriate [[Daily Reward System]] streak is maintained, stacking with [[Soft Boots]], [[Life Ring]], and [[Ring of Healing]].
history: * As announced on {{OfficialNewsArchive|7983|July 23, 2024}}, the cost of purchasing this item from [[Coco]] was reduced by half, from 16,000 [[Dark Chocolate Coin]]s to 8,000 [[Dark Chocolate Coin]]s.\n}}\n<noinclude>[[Category:Regenerative Items]]</noinclu
flavortext: This tasty-looking shield protects from damage and boosts your regeneration.

name: Battle Tactics
notes:
Using it reduces the damage of [[Raubritters]] on the [[Isle of Ada]] by 10% for a duration of 4 hours. The timer counts down even if the player is offline.\n
When used, the following message appears: {{Server Message|You can clearly decipher various planned troop movements and tactical positions of the enemy. You should have an easier time with enemies in the bastion for the next four hours.}}\n
When it expires, the following message appears: {{Server Message|The enemy has adapted and changed its tactics once again.}}
flavortext: This plans show various tactical formations, troop locations and supply depots around the isle of Ada.

name: Boots of Waterwalking
notes:
It looks the same as [[Soft Boots]]. Its data can be seen on the [[Market]].
According to [https://www.tibia.com/gameguides/?subtopic=manual§ion=world#exploring Tibian manual], you can't walk on water fields. This suggests these boots are not meant to be obtained.
\nThey can be seen beneath the [[Serpentine Tower]] in [[Ankrahmun]] below the room with a [[Fire Elemental]], a [[Vampire]] and a [[Behemoth]]. Be careful as the [[Fire Elemental]] below ground floor or the [[Green Djinn]] on the bottom floor can be let out. See a screenshot [[Treasure Rooms#Serpentine Tower Treasure Room|here]].
\nThey can also be seen under a fence in [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis Room]].
flavortext: (This item has 5 charges left).

name: Bread
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dark Monk | Dharalion | Elf Arcanist | Elf Overseer | Fernfang | Memory of an Elf | Monk (Creature) | Monk of the Order | Warlock
buyfrom: Arito: 8, Armenius: 4, Billy: 3, Bolfona: 4, Boozer: 4, Christine: 4, Clyde: 4, Dankwart: 4, Frodo: 4, Gnomejam: 4, James: 3, Jehan the Baker: 10, Lyonel: 4, Maria: 4, Maryza: 4, Mirabell: 4, Miraia: 4, Norma: 3, Pugwah: 4, Richard: 3, Scott: 4, Swolt: 4, Tanaro, Tokel: 3, Urkalio: 4, Willie: 3
sellto: Billy: 1, Jehan the Baker: 1, Sherry McRonald, Willie: 1
notes:
Bread can be made from [[Lump of Dough|dough]] (oddly, a loaf of bread weighs 5 oz., but a lump of dough only weighs 1 oz.) Also, if you're a [[Druid]], you can make bread by casting the spell [[exevo pan]].
Looks the same as [[Garlic Bread]] and the [[Stale Bread of Ancientness]].
'''How to make bread'''
To make ''bread'', you need...
*[[Flour]] (can be gotten by harvesting [[wheat]] and then using it in a [[millstone]]) *[[Water (Liquid)|Water]] *[[Oven]] #Get water into a [[trough]] or [[bucket]]. Water can be extracted from an above ground [[Shallow Water]] (eg. the sea), a [[Draw Well]] or a [[Fountain]]. [[Bucket]]s and [[trough]]s are quite common around draw wells, but [[trough]]s cannot be carried. [[Bottle]]s that can be bought in shops are lighter than buckets and can also be used as intermediary containers to carry water. #Use flour with water. You will get a [[Lump of Dough]]. #Use the lump of dough with an [[oven]]. You will get your ''Bread''.

name: Bright Sword
notes: Can be obtained by completing the [[Bright Sword Quest]].
history:
* Bright Sword used to be one of the rarest items in the game. 
* The item's sprite was introduced in [[Updates/5.1|Update 5.1]], but it only became obtainable in [[Updates/6.4|Update 6.4]] when the quest was introduced.
* When CipSoft changed the [[quest]] system in the [[Updates/7.2|Christmas Update 2003]], it became a regular item since it was obtainable at level 45 through the [[The Outlaw Camp Quest]].
* Until the [[Summer Update 2007]], the bright sword was one of the best swords available on most worlds.
* With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Bright Sword changed from [[File:Bright Sword (Old).gif]] to [[File:Bright Sword.gif]].
flavortext: The blade shimmers in light blue.

name: Broadsword
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Dragon | Grand Mother Foulscale | Orc Leader | Renegade Orc
notes: Reward in the [[Alawar's Vault Quest]].

name: Broken Amulet
notes: This was the old [[Amulet of Life]] before the [[Updates/7.2|Update 7.2]]. It has no practical purpose and can be sold back to [[Eremo]]. But it is advised '''to not do this!''' Since it is a [[rares|discontinued item]] and extremely valuable when sold to other players. Alternatively, due to its rarity it is an impressive item to own. Therefore, great for collectors.

name: Bronze Amulet
droppedby: Dworc Venomsniper | Memory of a Vampire | Minotaur | Minotaur Cult Follower | Vampire
notes: Reduces [[Mana Drain|mana drain]] by up to 20%. It has 200 [[charges]]. Considered rare and valuable in [[Rookgaard]]. Very useful when fighting monsters that drain mana, as it is almost surely to make up for its cost. Some monsters that can deal a lot of mana drain damage are: all kinds of [[Bonelord]]s, [[Demon]]s, [[Dwarf Geomancer]]s, [[Hand of Cursed Fate|Hands of Cursed Fate]], [[Spectre]]s, [[Dipthrah]], [[Priestess]]es, [[Warlock]]s.\n\nOne can be obtained in the [[Power Ring Quest]].

name: Bronze Necklace
notes: In former times it was a one time spawn at the [[Venore]] swamp.
history:
* A bronze necklace was given as a gift from [[CipSoft]] as 2nd place award for the Tibia Ball League in 2003 on [[Antica]].
* Another was rewarded to {{character|Mystic Videl}} for winning the [[Tibiopedia]] "Tibian Traveler" contest on August 31st, 2009.
* Another was rewarded to {{character|Sahsy}} for winning the [[Tibiafriends]] "My Tibia Story" Competition on May 15th, 2010.
* Another one was rewarded to {{character|Whinorn Lube}} for winning the New Years Lottery sponsored by [[TibiaTR]] and [[TibiaLottery]] on January 2nd, 2011.
* Another was rewarded to {{character|Almighty Slash}} for 2nd place in [[Tibia Collection]] "Fansite Item Contest" Competition on Aug 1th, 2023.

name: Brown Mushroom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Askarak Demon | Askarak Lord | Askarak Prince | Broken Shaper | Chasm Spawn | Crypt Warrior | Enslaved Dwarf | Grandfather Tridian | Hemming | Honour Guard | Jailer | Lost Basher | Lost Berserker | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Lost Thrower | Memory of a Shaper | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Leader | Owin (Creature) | Renegade Orc | Retching Horror | Rotspit | Shaburak Demon | Shaburak Lord | Shaburak Prince | Shadow Pupil | Sharpclaw | Skeleton Elite Warrior | Skeleton Warrior | Spitter | The Hungerer | Thornback Tortoise | Twisted Shaper | Undead Mine Worker | Ushuriel | Werebadger | Wereboar | Werewolf | Yielothax
notes:
Brown Mushrooms are one of the best foods for long trips. They provide one of the highest regeneration seconds per [[ounce]] eaten, making them very useful to mages in [[Hunting Places|hunting places]] without food. These are not only lighter than white mushrooms, but heal more per gp spent buying them, so it's not only more efficient, but more cost effective to spend the same gp on these as you would on [[white mushrooms]]. Also, it's the best food obtainable in a shop. 100 brown mushrooms weigh 20 oz. and will last you 7 h 20 m. Because of its low weight, they are useful for training.

Can be found at daily spawns in a [[Rotworm]] cave in [[PoH]], [[Dusalk's Troll Clan Cave]] east of [[Dwarven Bridge]], [[Wyrm]] mountain in [[Liberty Bay]] and in [[Hyacinth]]'s tower and the War Wolf Den on [[Rookgaard]]. 100 of them can be obtained through the [[Steal From Thieves Quest]] and 10 can be obtained as an optional reward in [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]]. 10 of these are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Cut wheat using a [[scythe]] and then use it with a [[millstone]] to make [[flour]], then use the [[flour]] with a bucket or trough of water to make [[dough]], then use the [[dough]] with an oven to make [[bread]]. Replacing the water with [[milk]], you get a [[cake]]. To make [[Sugar Oat]] {{Ilink|Sugar Oat}}, you need: * [[Sickle]] * [[Scythe]] * [[Bunch of Sugar Cane]] * [[Wheat]] * [[Fire Bug]] # Travel to [[Liberty bay]] and buy [[Fire Bug]]s from Evan {{Mapper Coords|126.3|128.113|7|3|text=here}}. # Go to the [[Sugar Cane]]s {{Mapper Coords|125.227|128.29|7|2|text=here}} and use the [[Fire Bug]]s to burn the [[Sugar Cane]]s down. # Pick up the Bunch of Sugar Canes and travel to [[Thais]] wheat field {{Mapper Coords|126.181|125.246|7|4|text=here}}. # Cut down the wheat with the [[Scythe]]. # Use the Bunch of Wheat on the [[Bunch of Sugar Cane]]. Note: You can use the [[Sugar Oat]]s on [[Wild Horse]] to get the [[War Horse]] mount. A lot of bunches of wheat can be found at daily spawns in one of the buildings in [[Rookgaard]], [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}125.83,125.185,7 here].
Cut 200 of these to obtain the [[Happy Farmer]] [[achievement]].

name: Burning Heart
notes: Trade this item for a [[Helmet Ornament]] (part of [[Helmet of the Ancients]]).
flavortext: The burning heart is still beating with unholy life. It seems to be rotting rapidly.

name: Burst Arrow
droppedby: Arthom the Hunter | Destroyer | Dragon | Grand Mother Foulscale | Hunter | Omruc | Wyrm
notes: You can never miss your target with burst arrows, even with a distance skill of 10, since the explosion effect will always take place regardless of damage output or accuracy %. Burst arrows damage a 9 square area centered on the targeted monster or, in case of a miss, wherever it lands. They use your [[Distance]] skill to cause [[Physical]] damage. Their damage output is about the same as that of a [[bolt]]. [[Paladin]]s can create 8 of them with the [[Conjure Explosive Arrow]] [[spell]]. A player with a [[Black Skull]] cannot use Burst Arrows. May be useful for paladins who fight creatures which come in packs, as it has a 100% hit rate to a direct target, and may still deal damage to nearby foes. This has its consequences, too, as in PvP worlds the burst arrow will hit players even if the paladin doesn't mean to.\n\nDuring big team hunts in Hardcore PvP worlds, Paladins can attack their tank to do 9 square meters of damage to all surrounding monsters in case they are unable to use [[Diamond Arrow]]s or they simply don't have enough of them.
history: Before [[Updates/Update 8.0|Tibia version 8.0]], the damage caused by Burst Arrows was based upon your level and magic level, so they were used primarily by [[Druid]]s and [[Sorcerer]]s. They were also frequently used in the [[Annihilator Quest]]. Burst Arrow damage is now based upon your [[Distance]] skill, so these days they are used almost exclusively by [[Paladin]]s.

name: Butterfly Conservation Kit (Empty)
buyfrom: Angus;By saying "preparation kit"., Mortimer;By saying "preparation kit".
notes:
It is used to conserve [[butterflies]] in.
It looks the same as a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Blue)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Purple)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Red)]] and a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Yellow)]].\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It is empty.

name: Candelabrum
buyfrom: Ahmet, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nezil, Nienna, Perod, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zora
notes:
It can be found all over [[Tibia]], in places such as castles, stores and [[house]]s.
{{seealso|Lit Candelabrum|Used Candelabrum}}

name: Candlestick
droppedby: Banshee | Dharalion | Elf Arcanist | Memory of a Banshee | Warlock | Memory of an Elf
buyfrom: Ahmet, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nezil, Nienna, Perod, Pompan, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zora
notes: Rarely used, provides light for a short period of [[time]]. Mainly, for those purposes, [[player]]s use a [[torch]]. A Candlestick is also used to light a [[pumpkin]] once carved. It can also be combined with a skull to make a [[Skull Candle]]. Can be put in cakes, putting it on top of the cake on a surface and then the Candlestick on top, to create a [[Party Cake]].\n\nWhen it's used-up, a candlestick weighs 2.50 oz.

name: Candy Cane
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: During the [[Christmas]] event, you can get 10 candy canes as part of common presents from [[Santa Claus]], and you can also drop up to 3 candy canes from [[Grynch Clan Goblin]]s (rare loot). Additionally, between the [[Server Save]]s of October 31 and November 3 ([[Halloween]]), you can get 50 Candy Canes by skinning the corpse of [[The Mutated Pumpkin]] with an [[Obsidian Knife]].\n3 of them are needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Cape
droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Bellicose Orger | Ekatrix | Enraged Soul | Ghost | Lizard Snakecharmer | Quara Mantassin | Tarnished Spirit | Two-Headed Turtle | Witch | Yaga the Crone
notes: This cape is used as an armor, looks the same as [[The Rain Coat]].

name: Carlin Sword
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard

notes: If you have one of these in [[Rookgaard]] and already reached level 8 you may want to keep it, if you are going to [[Carlin]]. A common strategy in [[Rookgaard]] was to buy as many carlin swords as the Rookgaardian can carry and sell all their [[equipment]] to other Rookgaardians and make a hefty profit on the carlin swords in [[Mainland]], although this may not be recommendable now that one goes to the [[Island of Destiny]] at [[level]] 8 ([[Raffael]] doesn't buy Carlin Swords).\nObtainable in [[Rookgaard]] through the [[Minotaur Hell Quest]].

name: Clerical Mace
droppedby: Adept of the Cult | Braindeath | Dwarf Geomancer | Gozzler | Ice Witch | Necromancer | Necropharus | Priestess | Shadow Pupil | Swan Maiden
notes: Used to be quite popular with lower leveled players, now it is outclassed by other club weapons, such as [[Spiky Club]] and [[Furry Club]]. Nevertheless, players on a very tight budget should consider using them, specially for their [[Defense Modifier]], at the offset of higher weight and lower attack.
history:
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy Clerical Mace}} [[Icy Clerical Mace]]
* {{Ilink|Earth Clerical Mace}} [[Earth Clerical Mace]]
* {{Ilink|Energy Clerical Mace}} [[Energy Clerical Mace]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery Clerical Mace}} [[Fiery Clerical Mace]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].

name: Club
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard

notes: The starting weapon for those with no-vocation. Should be replaced as soon as possible. Good for [[Training]], just slightly worse than the [[Crowbar]]. If one intends to use this as a main weapon, those in [[Rookgaard]] or [[Dawnport]] are advised to look for better alternatives, such as [[Mace]] or [[Bone Club]]. While those in [[Mainland]], intending to use [[Club Weapons]], should seek a [[Morning Star]] or [[Battle Hammer]].\n\nObtained in [[The Beginning Quest]] and the [[Flash Client Tutorial]].

droppedby: Cursed Ape | Custodian | Cyclops | Cyclops Drone | Cyclops Smith | Depowered Minotaur | Frost Giant | Frost Giantess | Gang Member | Gargoyle | Gorger Inferniarch | Hairman the Huge | Insectoid Scout | Kongra | Madareth | Memory of an Ogre | Ogre Brute | Plaguesmith | War Golem

name: Coconut
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Before the summer [[update]] 2005, coconuts were very rare as they were only dropped by [[Demon]]s. Since they are now dropped by [[Sibang]]s instead, they have drastically dropped in value. Putting a [[Blood Herb]] over 10 Coconuts will make a very nice decoration background.

You can make [[Coconut Milk]] from them by using a [[Juice Squeezer]] on it.

Needed in [[The Paradox Tower Quest]].
7 vials of [[Coconut Milk]] are needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
history: This item was once only lootable from [[Demons]]. Therefore, they used to have a price range of 2,000 - 8,000 [[gp]] each. After [[Sibang]]s were introduced they became much easier to obtain, and go for a price of anywhere from nothing at all to 3 [[gp]] each.

name: Bonelord Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Bonelord | Elder Bonelord | Braindeath | The Evil Eye
notes: \n* 30 of these are needed for [[Assassin Outfits Quest]].\n* 3 of these are needed in a mission of [[The Ice Islands Quest]].
history: This item used to be an ingredient for the [[Bewitched]] event up until it was removed from the list in 2019.
flavortext: You could swear it just winked at you.

name: Book (Atlas)
notes:
Can be found in [[Demona]] and [[Nargor]].
\nIt looks the same as an [[Atlas]], a [[Book (CGB)]], and [[Strange Good Night Songs]].

It looks the same as a [[Monk's Diary]], a [[Theatre Script]], a [[Botany Almanach]], and a [[Yalahari Folio]].

notes: Found in chief huntsman's, [[Robin]]'s hut in [[Thais]].

name: Book (Brown Thin)

It can be found in places like the bank in [[Thais]].
\nIt looks the same as [[File AH-X17L89]].

buyfrom: Bertha, Gorn, Perod, Shiantis, The Librarian: 20, Thomas, Zora

Before [[Update#Update 7.9 December 12.2C 2006|Christmas Update 2006]] this book was called T-Book and it looked like this: [[File:T-Book.gif]]


For a while they were also dropped by [[Wyvern]]s. They were later replaced by [[Wyvern Talisman]]s.

sellto: Bertha: 15, Gorn: 15, Perod: 15, Shiantis: 15, The Librarian, Thomas: 15
notes: Found in Djinn Tower Library's. You can find also one by [[Lily]] in [[Rookgaard]] with some [[blueberries]] on it.

name: Book (Grey)

buyfrom: Bertha, Gorn, Perod, Shiantis, The Librarian: 20, Thomas, Zora
notes:
Once it has been written in, this book cannot be edited. One can buy these books from any general equipment supplier in Tibia, such as [[Gorn]].
It looks the same as a [[Book with Old Legends]] and a [[Book with Old Legends (Doctored)]].

name: Book (Red)
notes: It can be found in [[Nargor]] Library, [[Meriana]] and other daily respawn locations.

name: Bottle of Whisper Beer
notes: A special beer that is only sold in Carlin, and can only be purchased by those who are sent to buy it. Is sold by the NPC [[Karl]].\nNeeds to be bought and delivered in a mission of the [[Meriana Quest]].

name: Bowl (Silver)
notes: It can be found on [[Nargor]], inside [[Rottin Wood]]'s house, in [[Doubleday]]'s house in [[Rathleton]], and in the [[Souleater Mountains]] buildings. Other variations of bowls include: [[Bowl]], [[Bowl (Green)]], [[Bowl (Gold)]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.8|Summer Update 2006]].

name: Box (Brown)
notes:
It is mainly used to trap [[monsters]] or climb hills on [[Rookgaard]], where [[parcel]]s do not exist. It can be seen and obtained on several [[Boat]]s.
It looks the same as a [[Storage Box]].

name: Broken Bottle
notes: It has no practical use.

name: Broken Brown Glass
notes: It has no practical use.

name: Broken Flask
notes: It doesn't have any practical use. It can be found in various places throughout [[Tibia]] at daily spawns.

name: Broken Green Glass
notes: It has no practical use.

name: Broken Piggy Bank
notes: It has no practical use. This is what happens when you shake a {{Ilink|Piggy Bank}} [[Piggy Bank]] too much.
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.8|Summer Update 2006]] when [[Piggy Bank]] was added to creatures loot.

name: Broken Pottery
notes: It is rubbish and can be found almost anywhere. It has no practical use and is worth nothing. Historically it was dropped by [[Juggernaut]]s and this was a fact [[scam]]mers used to sell it for high prices.

name: Broken Sword
notes: It has no practical use.

It can be either used as a decoration or to award a winner of a player held contest.

There are three kind of Goblets, bronze, [[Silver Goblet|silver]] and [[Golden Goblet|golden]]. You will also get this item from winning the first level (Greenhorn) of the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]] by killing the 10 [[Greenhorn Bosses]].

This is one of the most commonly found and used colour of cloth.

50 of these needed for the [[Assassin Outfits Quest]]
20 of these needed for the [[Beggar Outfits Quest]]

|

name: Brutetamer's Staff
notes: A good, if not uncommon [[club]] weapon for lower [[level]]s. Oddly enough this weapon can look like its laying on the ground or standing up on its own when viewed from different angles.
flavortext: Barbarian women are said to use it for conjuring beasts.

name: Brutus Bloodbeard's Hat
notes:
Looks same as a [[Pirate Hat]], except it is a little darker. Note this item can '''NOT''' be worn.

\nUsed as part of the [[Pirate Outfits Quest]].

name: Bullseye Potion
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Alptramun | Brain Head | Count Vlarkorth | Crazed Summer Vanguard | Drume | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Elder Forest Fury | Ghulosh | Gorzindel | Goshnar's Cruelty | Goshnar's Greed | Goshnar's Hatred | Goshnar's Malice | Goshnar's Megalomania | Goshnar's Spite | Haunted Treeling | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Lokathmor | Lord Azaram | Mad Mage | Madareth | Magma Bubble | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Mazzinor | Megasylvan Yselda | Minotaur Amazon | Naga Archer | Plagueroot | Raging Mage | Ratmiral Blackwhiskers | Razzagorn | Reflection of a Mage | Scarlett Etzel | Shaburak Demon | Shaburak Lord | Shaburak Prince | Sir Baeloc | Tentugly's Head | The Abomination | The Brainstealer | The Dread Maiden | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The Fear Feaster | The Monster | The Nightmare Beast | The Pale Worm | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Unwelcome | Timira the Many-Headed | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Usurper Commander | Yakchal | Zushuka | Vemiath
notes:
Drinking this potion increases distance skill by 5 points while decreasing shielding by 10 points for 10 minutes. You can only have one distance boosting skill active at a time, i.e. you cannot use this and [[Sharpshooter]], [[Carrot Cake]], or [[Lemon Cupcake]] at the same time.

Obtainable in the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]], [[Formorgar Mine Quest]], [[Frost Dragon Quest]], [[The New Frontier Quest]], and the [[Rise of Devovorga]]. Can also be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.

Drinking 100 of these grants the [[Sharpshooter (Achievement)|Sharpshooter]] achievement.
}}<noinclude>[[Category:Distance Fighting Booster]]</noinclu
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases your distance skill while decreasing your defense.

name: Bunch of Sugar Cane
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: ==How to make Rum== To make ''[[Rum]]'' [[File:Rum.gif]], you need... *[[Fire Bug]]; *[[Sickle]] (or equivalent); *[[Distilling Machine]]; *Any fluid container like [[Vial]]s or [[Mug]]s. # Use the fire bug on [[Sugar Cane]] to turn it into [[Burning Sugar Cane]] that will become [[Sugar Cane (Burnt)]] after the fire dies. # Use the sickle to cut it and leave [[Sugar Cane (Harvested)]] with a Bunch of Sugar Cane on top. # Pick up this bunch and use it on a [[Distilling Machine]]. # Use the fluid container on the distilling machine to get the rum. Note: Each bunch of sugar cane provides 10 seconds of rum production. ==How to make Sugar Oat== To make ''[[Sugar Oat]]'' [[File:Sugar Oat.gif]], you need... *[[Sickle]] *[[Scythe]] *Bunch of Sugar Cane *[[Wheat]] *[[Fire Bug]] # Repeat the above process but instead of using your Bunch of Sugar Cane on a [[Distilling Machine]] use it on a [[Bunch of Wheat]]. Note: You can use the [[Sugar Oat]]s on [[Wild Horse]] to get the [[War Horse]] mount. Use 50 of these on [[Distilling Machine]]s to obtain the [[Homebrewed]] [[achievement]].

name: Bunnyslippers
notes: It's a very rare drop from a very rare creature. They are extremely rare [[boots]] that have only been confirmed to exist on a few [[Worlds|game worlds]]. Since [[Updates/8.7|Winter Update 2010]], Bunnyslippers also are a rare gift from [[Santa Claus]], thus reducing their rarity and value a bit.
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]] with the implementation of raids.

name: Burnt Scroll
notes: It has no practical use.

name: Butcher's Axe
droppedby: Bibby Bloodbath | Brachiodemon | Courage Leech | Dark Torturer | Execowtioner | Ghulosh | Glooth Brigand | Hellgorak | Horadron | Ogre Brute | Retching Horror | Shaburak Prince | Warlord Ruzad
notes: They have become more common after [[Updates/8.4|Christmas Update 2008]], because [[CipSoft GmbH|CipSoft]] made bigger looting chance on bosses like [[Hellgorak]], since then many axes of this kind exist on many worlds. Many collectors are after this item, usually for house decoration.

name: Cake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Made with oven and [[Lump of Cake Dough]]. Can be decorated in order to become a [[Cake (Decorated)|Decorated Cake]], and once decorated, you can place a candlestick onto it to make [[Party Cake]].
'''How to make a Cake''' To make a ''Cake'', you need... [[Flour]] (can be gotten by harvesting [[wheat]] in a [[millstone]])
[[Milk]]
[[Oven]]
1. Get the milk into a [[trough]] or [[bucket]].
2. Use flour with milk. You will get [[Lump of Cake Dough|cake dough]].
3. Use the cake dough with an oven. You will get your ''Cake''.

Notes: You can make it become a [[Decorated Cake]] by decorating it with fruits.
You can make the [[Decorated Cake]] become a [[Party Cake]] by placing a [[Candlestick]] onto it.
{{Clear}} Bake 30 of these to obtain the [[The Cake's the Truth]] [[achievement]].

name: Cake (Decorated)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Made with oven and [[Lump of Cake Dough]]. It can be decorated using any sort of fruit, and once placed a candlestick onto it, it becomes a [[Party Cake]].
'''How to make a Decorated Cake''' To make a ''Decorated Cake'', you need... [[Flour]] (can be gotten by harvesting [[wheat]] in a [[millstone]])
[[Milk]]
[[Oven]]
A [[Fruit]] (check table of fruits you may use [[Cooking#Fruits for Decorated Cake and Fruit Juice|here]])
[[Kitchen Knife]]
1. Get the milk into a [[trough]] or [[bucket]].
2. Use flour with milk. You will get [[Lump of Cake Dough|cake dough]].
3. Use the cake dough with an oven. You will get a [[cake]].
4. Use the knife on a [[fruit]] (check table of fruits you may use [[Cooking#Fruits for Decorated Cake and Fruit Juice|here]]) while having the cake in your [[backpack]]. If you've done this correctly, there will now be red decorations on your cake, forming your ''Decorated Cake''.

Note: You can make it become a [[Party Cake]] by placing a [[Candlestick]] onto it.

{{Clear}} One of these is needed during the [[Krailos Quest]].
Create 20 of these to obtain the [[With a Cherry on Top]] [[achievement]] and half of the [[Piece of Cake]] achievement.
flavortext: It is nicely decorated with fruits and icing.

name: Candy
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Could be obtained from a [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|Blue Surprise Bag]] during [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]] (January 2007).You can get 10 candies in each level of the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]].
Can be obtained from [[Surprise Nest]]s.
Chance to obtain it when skinning the [[Slain Mutated Pumpkin]] within his portal.
3 of them are needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Cat's Paw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dark Torturer | Hemming | Mr. Punish | The Scourge of Oblivion
notes: A Cat's Paw is a whip-like instrument of torture used to inflict pain on its victim (see also the Wikipedia article [[Wikipedia:Spanish Tickler|Cat's Paw]]).

name: Ceiron's Waterskin
notes:
It looks the same as [[Ceiron's Waterskin (Filled)]], [[Nilsor's Waterskin]] and [[Nilsor's Waterskin (Filled)]].\nNeeded for [[Druid Outfits Quest]].
\nIf you lose your waterskin during the mission, you can buy another from [[Ceiron]] by asking for "Ceiron's Waterskin" and paying a fee of 1,000 [[gp]].
flavortext: It is empty.

name: Ceremonial Ankh
notes:
Shows which [[blessing]]s you have received.
\nLooks the same as the [[Ornamented Ankh]].

\nThis item can be obtained in [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]]

name: Ceremonial Mask
notes:
You can see it in treasure room in [[Ferumbras]] Tower and its data can be found on the [[Market]]. Bears a striking resemblance to the [[Full Helmet of the Ancients]]. The mask can show your blessings, just like [[Ceremonial Ankh]].
<gallery position="center" style="text-align:center" captionalign="center" mode="nolines">
Ceremonial mask in treasure in ferumbras tower.jpg
| 1 = Ferumbras Tower's Treasure Room
</gallery>
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it began to irradiate light only after [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]].

name: Certificate
notes: You can hang this on a wall.\nCan be gotten through the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]].
flavortext: You have mastered the Dream Challenge and may apply for joining the order of the Nightmare Knights.

name: Chain Bolter
notes: Has a range of 3 square tiles around the user. Despite its name, it has not been proven that it shoots faster than any other crossbow weapon.

name: Chaos Mace
droppedby: Alptramun | Anomaly | Bretzecutioner | Destroyer | Duke Krule | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Gorzindel | Infernal Phantom | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | Juvenile Bashmu | Lost Basher | Lost Berserker | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Moohtant | Nightstalker | Outburst | Plagueroot | Rupture | Sir Valorcrest | Tarbaz | The Nightmare Beast | The Pale Count | The Scourge of Oblivion | Utua Stone Sting | Weakened Shlorg
notes: Used to be rare, but later became more common and cheaper to buy with the introduction of [[Nightstalker]]s and [[Rashid]].
flavortext: Only those who have descended to the deepest depths may wield this hammer without it cursing them.

name: Chicken Feather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Agrestic Chicken | Chicken | Grynch Clan Goblin
notes:
Since the [[Christmas Update 2008]], the price has increased due to many chickens being removed from [[Rookgaard]].


\n\n* 100 of these are needed for an addon of [[Citizen Outfits]].
history: This item used to be an ingredient for the [[Bewitched]] event up until it was removed from the list in 2019.
flavortext: Some thousands of these would probably make an extremely comfortable pillow.

name: Chocolate Cake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Since the [[Christmas Update 2008]], it is valued because it is needed for a [[quest]]. You can't put a candle on it.

'''How to make a Chocolate Cake''' To make a ''Cake'', you need... [[Flour]] (can be gotten by harvesting [[wheat]] in a [[millstone]])
[[Milk]]
[[Bar of Chocolate]]
[[Oven]]
1. Get the milk into a [[trough]] or [[bucket]].
2. Use flour with milk. You will get [[Lump of Cake Dough|cake dough]].
3. Use the [[Lump of Cake Dough]] on the [[Bar of Chocolate]]. You will get a [[Lump of Chocolate Dough]]. '''NB: Be careful NOT to try to use the [[Bar of Chocolate]] first, or you will eat it!'''
4. Use the chocolate dough with an oven. You will get your ''Cake''.

One is needed for [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
Baking 10 of these will reward you with the [[Sweet Tooth]] [[achievement]] and half of the [[Piece of Cake]] achievement.

name: Christmas Branch
notes: It is a decorative tree branch with a candle on it. Provides 3 squares of red light.

name: Christmas Card
notes: A nice card to send to your friends on [[Christmas]]. When you use it, [[Yellow Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Yellow Notes Effect}} and the following orange text message will appear: {{Message|type=sound|Merry Christmas, ''Player''!}}

name: Christmas Present Bag
notes:
The [[Grynch Clan Goblin]]s appear during the [[Santa Event]]. Trade it for a [[Christmas Token]] at the NPC [[Ruprecht]] on [[Vega]].
Looks the same as a [[Beach Bag]].
flavortext: It contains presents which were stolen from Santa. Bring them back to Ruprecht on Vega.

name: Christmas Token
notes:
You can get this item from the NPC [[Ruprecht]] on [[Vega]] by giving him a [[Present Bag]].
The Christmas Token was the first item in-game to weigh less than 0.10 [[oz]].
50 are obtainable by lighting at least 1 basin on the [[Lightbearer]] event.
You can also trade the tokens with [[Ruprecht]] for the following items:
{{Selling|Ruprecht}}
flavortext: Collect enough of these to trade them for valuable prizes.

Better do it right in front of the frog, else a dragon may spot you.|You look like a beautiful princess... at least for a short time. Hurry up and kiss the frog!}}

notes: One of these is required to obtain the [[Toothfairy Assistant]] achievement during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Carrot Cake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It will boost your [[Distance Fighting]] skill by 10 for one hour. If a [[Bullseye Potion]] is used after you eat the cake, the skills from the cake are lost and you will only have the +5 skills from the Bullseye Potion, or if you die during the hour that you have the +10, the boost gets lost.

When using a Carrot Cake, [[Green Sparkles Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Sparkles Effect}} will appear on the user who will get the following message: "{{Server Message|Your distance skill is improved for the next hour.}}"

To create this dish, you must speak with the [[Djinn]] [[Jean Pierre]] in [[Ankrahmun]], near the Marid Fortress, during the Hot Cuisine event.

'''Necessary Ingredients:'''

*5 [[Carrot]]s [[File:Carrot.gif]]
*1 [[Vial]] of [[Milk]] [[File:Milk.gif]]
*1 [[Lemon]] [[File:Lemon.gif]]
*10 ounces of [[Flour]] [[File:Flour.gif]]
*2 [[Egg]]s [[File:Egg.gif]]
*10 [[Cookie]]s [[File:Cookie.gif]]
*2 [[Peanut]]s [[File:Peanut.gif]]

Only obtainable through the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
}}
[[Category:Distance Fighting Booste
flavortext: This spicy-sweet cake will probably put you into a sugar rush.

name: Carrying Device
notes: \n\nUsed in [[Sea of Light Quest]].
flavortext: The astronomer Spectulus gave you this device to safely transport the mirror crystal.

name: Case of Rust Bugs
notes:
It looks exactly like a [[Jewel Case]] and it contains rust bugs.
Temporarily obtained in the [[Secret Service Quest]] (Carlin).

name: Cask of Brown Ale (Item)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Beer Cask]], a [[Lemonade Cask]], a [[Cask of Brown Ale|Cask of Brown Ale (Object)]], a [[Rum Cask]], a [[Small Cask]], a [[Water Cask]] and a [[Wine Cask]].\nThis item is needed for a mission of [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
flavortext: It contains dwarven brown ale brewed by a human.

name: Centipede Leg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Champion's Cup
