You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.
\nThe first champion's cup was given to [[TibiaMx]]'s soccer team at the first [[Fansites Soccer Cup]].
\n{{character|Sahsy}} was the first single player to receive this item by winning the [[Tibia Cubix]] "Cheering for the win" contest.

name: Charged Ghost Charm
notes: Looks the same as [[The Orb of Nature]] and an [[Inactive Teleporter]].\nPart of the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Christmas Garland
notes: It can be obtained from [[Blue Christmas Bundle]]s and [[Green Christmas Bundle]]s. It can be lit: [[File:Christmas Garland (Lit).gif]]

name: Christmas Present (Blue)
notes: It's a nice box to put items inside as a gift to someone. It comes in three colors: [[Christmas Present (Red)|red]], [[Christmas Present (Green)|green]] and blue.

name: Christmas Present (Green)
notes: It's a nice box to put items inside as a gift to someone. It comes in three colors: [[Christmas Present (Red)|red]], green and [[Christmas Present (Blue)|blue]].

name: Christmas Present (Red)
notes: It's a nice box to put items inside as a gift to someone. It comes in three colors: red, [[Christmas Present (Green)|green]] and [[Christmas Present (Blue)|blue]].

name: Christmas Tree Package
notes: This item is only available during [[Christmas]] season. Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Christmas Tree}} [[Christmas Tree]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
flavortext: Use it in your house to reveal a christmas tree.

name: Claw of 'The Noxious Spawn'
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It cures your [[Poisoned]] state when you click on it while wearing it, you can use it once every 10~ seconds. When you move it to your ring slot, you will receive 200 damage (will be less if wearing equipment), but if you do it while standing in a protection zone you won't take any damage, once you've put it on you don't have to take it off for it to recharge. When it depletes for one day, you might get [[Poisoned]] or [[Cursed]]. When you get cursed, you'll get the following message: {{Server Message|You are cursed by The Noxious Spawn!}}. If it happens you receive around 15 turns of damage, increasing from 1 until the last damage of 662+ (remove the curse eating a [[Hydra Tongue Salad]] or asking for healing in a temple). When it happens, the message about the claw being usable only for levels 100+ disappears and the claw can't be put in ring slot (becomes a decoration object). It recharges in about 24 hours. Note that the 24 hour recovery time counts down only when the item is "active" i.e. it will not count down in your depot unless you stand on the depot tile, nor will it recover in your inventory if you are offline; keeping it in a house is the better option as it will take the least amount of time. You could also carry 2 or more claws and switch when one depletes.
\nWhen you wear it, it will say "{{Server Message|It tightens around your wrist as you take it on.}}" and also "{{Server Message|Ouch! The serpent claw stabbed you.}}"\nAfter getting cursed by a Claw of 'The Noxious Spawn' you will receive the [[achievement]] [[Cursed!]].
flavortext: It's like a glove and you can't wear a ring on it. You are not sure if you should really put it on.

name: Clay Lump
droppedby: Clay Guardian | Drillworm | Earth Elemental | Eternal Guardian | Ink Blob | Jagged Earth Elemental | Lost Berserker | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Massive Earth Elemental | Muddy Earth Elemental | Two-Headed Turtle
notes:
If you use it, you will either break it ("{{Sound|Aw man. That did not work out too well.}}") or shape it into one of the following: *{{Ilink|Rough Clay Statue}} [[Rough Clay Statue]] *{{Ilink|Clay Statue}} [[Clay Statue]] *{{Ilink|Pretty Clay Statue}} [[Pretty Clay Statue]] See a research article by [[Tibia-Stats]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20210509005650/http://www.tibia-stats.com/index.php?akcja=6003&research=sculpting here] to discover what the chances for getting each form of the clay statues are.
{{Seealso|Clay Lump/Sculpting Statistics}} You can earn the [[achievement]] [[Clay Fighter]] by sculpting a [[Pretty Clay Statue]] and the achievement [[Clay to Fame]] by sculpting five [[Pretty Clay Statue]]s.
flavortext: You could use it and try to form a statue out of it.

name: Clay Statue
notes: When you "use" a [[Clay Lump]] you have a chance for it to turn into a little figurine. Sometimes it will be complete, sometimes it will not be. Unlike an ice cube, you cannot use it several times and it will not "break" it will just remain incomplete if you fail.[[File:Clay_Statue_(Making).gif]]
flavortext: It was made by "player name" and is clearly a little figurine of.. hm, one does not recognise that yet.

name: Closed Trap
droppedby: Falcon Knight | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Juggernaut | Poacher
buyfrom: Ahmet, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zora
sellto: Ahmet, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zora
notes: Traps can be set to injure [[creatures]] up to 29 damage, but they do not stop the creatures from moving. You can find this item around dwarven camp in Tiquanda jungle. Put it on the ground and use it to open a '''Closed Trap'''. If you move an [[Trap|open trap]] it will close again. Note that usage of a trap to damage a creature will yield less [[experience]], and completely killing a creature using traps will not yield experience, [[Dust]], [[Weapon Proficiency]] and bestiary or bosstiary progress.\n\nPart of the [[Grimvale Quest]].

name: Club of the Fury
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Boogey]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. It's the lightest [[Club Weapon]] in the game together with the [[Stale Bread of Ancientness]].
\nLooks the same as a [[Rolling Pin]] and a [[Rolling Pin (Rookgaard)]]. It is likely a reference to the so-called "Mace of Fury" that is being sold by [[Bozo]]. This in itself is a reference to the legendary [[Sword of Fury]].
\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: It's ready to unleash a fury's wrath on its enemies.

name: CM Token
notes:
It can be hung on a wall. This item is handed out by [[Community Manager]]s on special occasions.
It looks the same as a [[CM Token (15th Anniversary)]].
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.
The winners of CM Tokens can be viewed [[CM Token/Owners|here]]. CM Token Kyle.png|CM Token given to {{character|Kyle the Third}} for guessing the date of Summer Update 2011. Cm_tokens.jpg|CM Tokens on Lord Vladir's residence.
flavortext: It was a gift from a community manager.

name: Cobra Tongue
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Due to the recent use that was implemented, it is no longer recommended to sell this item to an NPC. One is sacrificed to gain entry to the second floor of [[Lion's Rock]], required for the [[Lion's Rock Quest]]. With the introduction of [[Updates/10.7]] the price of cobra tongues rose absurdly. It's recommended to loot one yourself instead of buying it.

name: Cocktail Glass
buyfrom: Satsu;beer, Satsu;fruitjuice, Satsu;lemonade, Satsu;mead, Satsu;milk, Satsu;rum, Satsu;tea, Satsu;water, Satsu;wine
notes: It can hold liquid.

name: Bonecarving Knife
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Lost Basher | Lost Exile | Lost Husher
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
flavortext: The blade of this knife already assumes the colour of the carved bones.

name: Bonfire Amulet
notes: This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
flavortext: It engulfs you in flames - fire against fire.

name: Bongo Drum
notes: This item used to be [[Unobtainable Items|unobtainable]]. That changed with the [[Winter Update 2023]] when the item was made available in the [[Bulltaur Lair]].

name: Book (Draconia)
notes: Only known to exist in the form of a written book: ''[[Key to Magic (Book)|Key to Magic]]''.
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.9|Christmas Update 2006]], it became obtainable only after January 2012 on [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]].

name: Book of Orc Language
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].</noinclude>

name: Bookcase Kit
buyfrom: Borkas, Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Bookcase}} [[Bookcase]]. It looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a bookcase.

name: Bookworm Doll
notes:
The fansite item of the former supported fansite [[TibiaLibrary]]. It was created by {{character|Jaegaren}}.

Its replica is the [[Bookworm Doll (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail Tibia Library!|Shhhhhh, please be quiet!|Books are great!! Aren't they?}}
flavortext: It does not wish to be disturbed. Awarded by TibiaLibrary.org.

name: Botany Almanach
notes: Looks the same as a [[Black Book]], a [[Monk's Diary]], a [[Theatre Script]], and a [[Yalahari Folio]].\nObtained in the [[An Interest In Botany Quest]].
flavortext: The title of this heavy book reads: 'Rabaz' Unabridged Almanach Of Botany'.

name: Bottle with Rat Urine
notes: It can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.31|126.92|10|4|text=here}}.\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].

name: Bowl (Gold)
notes: It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]. Other variations of bowls include: [[Bowl]], [[Bowl (Green)]], [[Bowl (Silver)]].

name: Bowl (Green)
notes: It can be found in the [[Doubleday]]'s house in [[Rathleton]], and in [[Northern Zao]] buildings. Other variations of bowls include: [[Bowl]], [[Bowl (Silver)]], [[Bowl (Gold)]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]].

name: Bowl of Terror Sweat
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Its only purpose is to be sold to NPCs. It has a high gold-to-oz ratio.

name: Brimstone Fangs
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 10 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Snake Skin]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Brimstone Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Blockade]] and [[Powerful Blockade]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Broccoli
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Broken Draken Mail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Broken Helmet
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Orc Warlord | Orc Warrior
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Broken Key Ring
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Adept of the Cult | Enlightened of the Cult | Melting Frozen Horror | Ravenous Hunger | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
history: Broken Key Rings and [[Jewelled Backpack]]s were used to replace [[Key Ring]]s when [[CipSoft]] decided to remove the Key Rings due to them being used as a replacement for the heavy [[Backpack]]s. These and the Key Rings' contents then came inside of Jewelled Backpacks when the Key Ring was changed into this non-container item.

name: Broken Ring of Ending
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Can be transformed into a [[Shimmer Wand]] by using a [[Shimmer Swimmer]] on it. You can also use a [[String of Mending]] on it to create a [[Ring of Ending]].
flavortext: It seems all its former magical power has left this broken carcass of a ring.

name: Broken Shamanic Staff
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Ogre Shaman | Ogre Sage | Ogre Shaman | Orc Cult Priest | Orc Shaman
notes:
It looks the same as [[Hopgoblin's Broken Staff]].
15 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Epiphany]] and [[Powerful Epiphany]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Broken Slicer
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Broken Throwing Axe
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Broken Visor
notes: It is one of the few creature items that is wearable, even when stacked. The arm value stays at 1 no matter how many visors you stack.

name: Bronze Medal
notes:
Probably a future [[Contest Prizes|contest prize]].
\nYou can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer.

name: Brown Crystal Splinter
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Brinebrute Inferniarch | Choking Fear | Crystalcrusher | Drillworm | Enslaved Dwarf | Feroxa | Feroxa (Gloom Wolf) | Frazzlemaw | Gaz'haragoth | Gazer Spectre | Guzzlemaw | Iks Aucar | Iks Churrascan | Ironblight | Lost Berserker | Magma Crawler | Mawhawk | Memory of a Frazzlemaw | Omnivora | Orc Cultist | Orclops Doomhauler | Orclops Ravager | Reflection of Mawhawk | Rhindeer | Sight of Surrender | Spiky Carnivor | Varnished Diremaw | Vulcongra | Weeper | Werehyaena Shaman | Zamulosh
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan

name: Bucket of Bog Water
notes: You fill the magical bog water into the prepared bucket. The bucket seems to hold the water but for how long?\nUse a [[Prepared Bucket]] on [[Bog Water]] from the [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}129.101,125.147,7,8,1,1 bog god's temple]. This is used to put out fires in Shadowthorn in the [[Thornfire]] World Change. This item will last for one hour before turning back into a [[Prepared Bucket]].
flavortext: It seems the water wants to go back to the bog it came from. Soon it will all be trickled away.

name: Buckle
droppedby: Lost Basher | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Lost Thrower | Spiky Carnivor
notes: It has the same armor as [[Knight Armor]] but weighs much less, and may be a nice substitute for a knight or paladin who cannot yet afford a [[Crown Armor]] or [[Paladin Armor]].

name: Buggy Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Bunch of Winterberries
droppedby: Azure Frog | Badger | Bat | Bonelord | Crystal Spider | Deepling Guard | Deepling Scout | Deepling Spellsinger | Deepling Worker | Dragon Lord | Dragon | Dragon Hatchling | Elder Bonelord | Frost Dragon Hatchling | Frost Dragon | Frost Troll | Frost Giant | Frost Giantess | Ice Witch | Island Troll | Killer Caiman | Lancer Beetle | Lizard Chosen | Lizard High Guard | Lizard Legionnaire | Mutated Bat | Blue Djinn | Orchid Frog | Penguin | Dire Penguin | Polar Bear | Quara Constrictor | Renegade Quara Constrictor | Quara Mantassin | Renegade Quara Mantassin | Quara Mantassin Scout | Sandcrawler | Squirrel | Terror Bird | Thornback Tortoise | Tortoise | Winter Wolf | Yeti
notes: They provide a medium amount of blue light.\nPart of the [[Annual Autumn Vintage]] world quest.
flavortext: This berry is not edible in its raw form. Maybe Emilie of the Winterberry Society in Thais can help.

name: Cake Cabinet Kit
notes: Use it while standing inside a house to unpack a {{Ilink|Cake Cabinet}} [[Cake Cabinet]].\nReceived from [[Brutus The Baker]] during the [[A Piece of Cake]] [[world quest]].
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a cake cabinet.

name: Calopteryx Cape
droppedby: Hive Overseer | Kollos | Spidris | Spidris Elite | Spitter | The Baron from Below | The Hungerer | The Sandking

name: Can of Oil
notes:
If you lost this item you can ask [[Norman The Foreman]] for another.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Can of Grease]] and a [[Wheel Oil]].\nUsed in a mission of the [[Venore Daily Tasks Quest]].
flavortext: Makes your tools go swimmingly.

name: Candle Made of Human Tallow
notes:
Gives off a very faint green light, but cannot be equipped in your belt slot.
\n3 of them are obtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: It burns with a reeking, pale green flame.

name: Canopy Bed Kit
notes: Looks the same as a [[Furniture Package]] and many other [[Furniture]] kits.
history: It could be used on a bed to change the colors of the covers until [[Updates/12.20.9260|November, 2019]], when beds inside player's houses and guildhalls became movable. It was replaced by the [[Canopy Headboard]] and [[Canopy Footboard]]. \n\nSince the item may still be found in game but is no longer obtainable, it's a relatively rare item.
flavortext: Use it on your bed to change the bed to a canopy bed.

name: Captured Wolf
notes:
[[Benevola]] wants to keep the nature balanced so if you find a [[Starving Wolf]], capture it and deliver it to her. You may have to give [[Benevola]] more than 20 wolfs to complete the task.
\n'''WARNING:''' People may use this item to [[scam]] and tell you it is needed to obtain the [[Crystal Wolf (Mount)]], which is not true.
flavortext: The trap has imobilized and shrunken the wolf.

name: Carapace Shield
droppedby: Hive Overseer | Kollos | Mindmasher | Spidris | Spidris Elite | Waspoid
notes: Since it has only one defense point more, but is more expensive and a lot heavier than the [[Demon Shield]] most [[Knight]]s and [[Paladin]]s opt to save up until they have enough money to buy a [[Mastermind Shield]] instead of using the Carapace Shield. Mages will simply stick to [[Demon Shield]]. It is most often only used as decoration.

name: Carrot on a Stick
droppedby: Carniphila | Dryad | Flameborn | Omnivora | Pooka | Tiquandas Revenge | Twisted Pooka
notes:
This is the item needed to tame a [[Terror Bird]] [[image:Racing_Bird.gif]].
This item has a chance to break.

Failed: '''The bird ran away.'''
Failed: '''The terror bird is pecking you.'''
Broke: '''Oh no, the bird ate the carrot.'''
Succeeded: '''You tamed the bird.'''
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Cauliflower
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Cavebear Skull
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Chameleon Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
Turns you into an item. The effect lasts for 200 seconds (3 minutes, 20 seconds).
Using this rune on an item will turn you into it.
\nOften used for fun. But on PvP worlds this can be used to hide from [[Player Killer|PK]]s, just turn yourself into a useless item and go upstairs to cover your name. You '''cannot''' use it on a [[creature]], an [[NPC]], another [[player]] or [[Objects|immovable objects]].
\nFor the spell, see [[Chameleon]].

name: Chaos Matter
notes: Looks the same as [[Demonic Essence]].\n\nPart of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 12.

name: Chayenne's Magical Key
notes: Was a very rare loot from [[Chayenne (Creature)|Chayenne's]] [[Anniversary Remains]] during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. In August 2012, CipSoft also held the {{OfficialNewsArchive|2151|Chayenne's Farewell Contest}} in which had this item as a reward to {{OfficialNewsArchive|2177|three winners}}. It's a valuable item because of its exclusiveness and because a quest requires it. As a consequence of its rarity, the quest's exclusive reward is also very valuable.\n\n* Required to be within the players inventory to enter the [[Realm of Dreams]] during the [[Realm of Dreams Quest]].
flavortext: No one really knows where it leads to, but the dragon graveyard might reveal the secret - or not.

name: Cheese Cookie
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]. It can be seen on the [[Market]].
<gallery mode="nolines">
New items summerupdate2010.jpg|A stack of cheese cookies can be seen on the second teaser for the [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]].
</gallery>

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

droppedby: Cobra Scout | Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.\nOne of these is needed during [[Grave Danger Quest]].

name: Chimney Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Chimney}} [[Chimney]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.

name: Cliff Strider Claw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Coal
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Armadile | Blazing Fire Elemental | Blistering Fire Elemental | Carrion Worm | Drillworm | Dwarf Guard | Earth Elemental | Earth Overlord | Enslaved Dwarf | Eternal Guardian | Fire Overlord | Firestarter | Guardian of Tales | Hellfire Fighter | Infected Weeper | Jagged Earth Elemental | Lost Basher | Lost Berserker | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Lost Thrower | Magma Crawler | Massive Earth Elemental | Muddy Earth Elemental | Rotworm Queen | Stone Devourer | Stone Golem | Stonerefiner | Vulcongra | Weeper
notes: Required for the [[Awash|Awash World Change]] and the [[Steamship World Change]].

name: Coal Basin Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Coal Basin}} [[Coal Basin]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a coal basin.

name: Cobra Crown
droppedby: Draken Elite | Hatebreeder | King Zelos | Ravenous Hunger | The Sandking
history: * This expensive helmet was initially only dropped by [[Draken Elite]], but since 2012 also by the [[Ghastly Dragon]] boss [[Hatebreeder]].

name: Boots of Homecoming
notes:
When used inside of a [[Protection Zone|protection zone]], they will teleport you in front of the [[Ferumbras Citadel]] found {{Mapper Coords|125.121|127.196|7|4|text=here}} and the text will appear:
{{Sound|Magical sparks whirl around the boots and suddenly you are somewhere else.}}
If you do not meet the criteria to be able to [[Teleport|teleport]] using these boots, the message below will appear, accompanied by two graphical effects: red sparkles overlaid with an explosion effect, both displayed ontop your character.
{{Server Message|Some magical sparks blaze up and die out immediately. There is an energy barrier somewhere that you cannot pass yet.}}
[[File:Explosion Effect.gif]] [[File:Red Sparkles Effect.gif]] These boots have a 24-hour [[Boots of Homecoming (Used)|cooldown]] period and lack a visible indication of their charge status. The easiest method to confirm their readiness for teleportation (when not on cooldown) is to maintain them in a 'charged' state on your [[Action Bars|action bar]]. Alternatively, if not pre-set on an action bar, you can ascertain their charge by placing them in your depot and checking [[The Market (Object)|The Market]], as only boots that are charged can be sold on the market.
flavortext: They are made of dark red buckskin and the golden clasps look like the letter F.

name: Boots of Homecoming (Used)
notes: Used [[Boots of Homecoming]]. You will have to wait 24(?) hours to use them again.
flavortext: They are made of dark red buckskin and the golden clasps look like the letter F.

name: Boots of Renewal
notes: They were seen on the test server for [[Updates/10.94|Summer Update 2016]], but never got implemented ingame. They looked like a [[Pair of Soft Boots]].

name: Botanist's Container (Bells)
notes:
There is a sample of the [[Jungle Bells Plant]] in it.
Looks the same as a [[Botanist's Container (Empty)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Cauldron)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Rose)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Orchid)]], a [[Griffinclaw Container]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Red)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Blue)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Yellow)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Green)]], and a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Complete)]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It holds a sample of the jungle bells plant.

name: Botanist's Container (Cauldron)
notes:
There is a sample of the [[Witches' Cauldron Plant]] in it.
Looks the same as a [[Botanist's Container (Empty)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Bells)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Rose)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Orchid)]], a [[Griffinclaw Container]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Red)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Blue)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Yellow)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Green)]], and a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Complete)]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It holds a sample of the witches cauldron plant.

name: Botanist's Container (Orchid)
notes:
It contains a [[Skull Orchid]].
Looks the same as a [[Botanist's Container (Empty)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Bells)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Cauldron)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Rose)]], a [[Griffinclaw Container]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Red)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Blue)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Yellow)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Green)]], and a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Complete)]].Temporarily obtained during the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It holds a sample of the rare skull orchid.

name: Botanist's Container (Rose)
notes:
There is a sample of the [[Giant Jungle Rose]] in it.
Looks the same as a [[Botanist's Container (Empty)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Bells)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Cauldron)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Orchid)]], a [[Griffinclaw Container]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Red)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Blue)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Yellow)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Green)]], and a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Complete)]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It holds a sample of the giant jungle rose.

name: Bottle of Airtight Gloo
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Flask with Magical Oil]], a [[Flask with Oil and Blood]], and vials of [[Beer]], [[Mead]], [[Mud]], [[Oil]], [[Rum]] and [[Tea]].
\nTemporarily obtained in [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.
flavortext: This gloo should make anything absolutely airtight.

name: Bottle of Gloo
notes:
Looks the same as [[Vial]] of slime.
\nTemporarily obtained in [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.
flavortext: It smells a bit like rotten fish.

name: Bottle of Glooth Wine
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Bow of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Bow of Carving (Charged)}} [[Bow of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Bow of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Bow of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Bow of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Bow of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and hit modifier values were adjusted to the to values of its overcharged version.


With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Bow of Carving, Bow of Mayhem and Bow of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Bow of Destruction}} [[Bow of Destruction]].

name: Bow of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Bow of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Bow of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Bow of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Bow of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Bow of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Bow of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and hit modifier values were adjusted to the to values of its overcharged version.


With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Bow of Carving, Bow of Mayhem and Bow of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Bow of Destruction}} [[Bow of Destruction]].

name: Bow of Mayhem (Charged)
notes: This item is a charged [[Bow of Mayhem]], it can be charged by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 15% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 20% to 30%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Bow of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Bow of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)
notes: This is a heavily charged [[Bow of Mayhem]], which was charged by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 20% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 25% to 50%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Bow of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Bow of Mayhem (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an overcharged [[Bow of Mayhem]], charged by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s. It is possible to fail overcharging, in this case you will lose your 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 25% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 30% to 75%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Bow of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Bow of Remedy
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Bow of Remedy (Charged)}} [[Bow of Remedy (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Bow of Remedy (Heavily Charged)}} [[Bow of Remedy (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Bow of Remedy (Overcharged)}} [[Bow of Remedy (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and hit modifier values were adjusted to the to values of its overcharged version.


With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Bow of Carving, Bow of Mayhem and Bow of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Bow of Destruction}} [[Bow of Destruction]].

name: Bowl of Glooth Soup
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 10 of these can be gotten out of a [[Glooth Bag]].

name: Bowl of Tea Leaves
notes: Used and temporarily obtained in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: It contains some strange tea leaves.

name: Bowl with Sacred Water
notes: Part of the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].
flavortext: The water in this bowl has been purified.

name: Brandon's Wedding Ring
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Might Ring]].
\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]].
flavortext: It is worn and scratched, with a faint engraving 'To Roswitha, Forever'.

name: Broken Dream
notes: Used and temporarily obtained in the [[Roshamuul Quest]]. Can be obtained by using the sparkling [[Objects (Broken Dream)|objects]] within Roshamuul, it can also give you a piece of rubish or fail, by saying that nothing happens.
flavortext: The fragment of a dream. Strange pictures seem to flit through the shards.

name: Broken Opticording Sphere
notes: Use it on an [[Opticording Sphere]] in order to get a [[Complete Opticording Sphere]]. It disappears after 1 minute.\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
flavortext: This strange box holds a dark sphere. It is broken and crumbles into dust any second now - but the vital key mechanism seems to be in a pristine condition.

name: Broken Wooden Shield
notes: This item is unobtainable. It was introduced in {{Update|10.55}} with [[Dawnport]], suggesting that it was intended to be given to aspiring [[Knight]]s instead of the superior [[Wooden Shield]] they currently receive. The details of this item can be seen via the [[The Market (Object)|Market]].

name: Bronze Gear Wheel
droppedby: Glooth Golem | Memory of a Golem | Metal Gargoyle | Rustheap Golem
notes: It's one of only few items that weigh less than 0.10 oz.\nObtained and used in the {{Spoiler Section|Glooth Factory Quest|Mutated Glooth Plague}}.

name: Bronze Prison Key
notes: Low chance to obtain it from an [[Unrealized Dream]]. Allows access to [[Zavarash]]'s chamber for 1 person. Use it at the [[Roshamuul Prison]] when standing on the respective tile to be teleported to him.
flavortext: You dreamt that this key unlocks the prison of a powerful horror that you had to face on your own.

name: Brown Pit Demon
buyfrom: Agostina;For 400 [[Drome Points]],Alberto;For 400 [[Drome Points]],Emilio;For 400 [[Drome Points]],Fabiana;For 400 [[Drome Points]],Lorenzo;For 400 [[Drome Points]]
notes:
It was obtainable by opening a [[Surprise Cube]], although these cubes are frequently preserved since they are no longer acquirable.
{{Seealso|Surprise Cube/Statistics}}
history: Before the [[Monster Arena]] was replaced with the [[Tibiadrome]], there existed an opportunity to receive a [[Surprise Cube]] from [[Lorenzo]] when exchanging [[Arena Badge]]s for potions. The likelihood of obtaining a Surprise Cube increased with the number of badges required for specific potions. These cubes could then be opened for a chance to receive a [[Pit Demon (Item)]].
flavortext: Figurine 1 of 5.

name: Bucket Filled with Chalk
notes:
[[Chalk]] gathered in a [[Bucket]]. It's not really worth anything because it's so easy to obtain. On the [[Test Server]], this item initially had no weight. It seems it was fixed before the release of the update.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bucket Filled with Chalk (Fine)]].\nUsed in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: By adding it to gravel, this chalk could be used as a binder of some sort to create mortar.

name: Bucket Filled with Gravel
notes: \nUsed in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: This gravel is quite finely granulated, combining it with chalk could be a base for mortar.

name: Bucket Full of Mortar
notes: Used in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: This mortar seems to be perfect for construction or repair works.

name: Burnt Out Devourer Core
notes: After using a [[Devourer Core]], it will become a Burnt Out Devourer Core.

name: Burst Arrow (Weak)
droppedby: Destroyer | Dragon | Grand Mother Foulscale | Hunter | Omruc | Wyrm
notes: This weaker variant of [[Burst Arrow]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Updates/10.8|Summer Update 2015]] with all [[Weak Ammunition and Runes]], but [[CipSoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Butterfly Conservation Kit (Blue)
notes:
The corpse of a [[Butterfly (Blue)|blue butterfly]] is in here.
It looks the same as a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Empty)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Purple)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Red)]] and a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Yellow)]].\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It contains a blue butterfly.

name: Butterfly Conservation Kit (Purple)
notes:
The corpse of a [[Butterfly (Purple)|purple butterfly]] is in here.
It looks the same as a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Blue)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Empty)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Red)]] and a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Yellow)]].\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It contains a purple butterfly.

name: Butterfly Conservation Kit (Red)
notes:
The corpse of a [[Butterfly (Red)|red butterfly]] is in here.
It looks the same as a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Blue)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Empty)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Purple)]] and a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Yellow)]].\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It contains a red butterfly.

name: Cake Backpack
notes: Obtainable as a reward from the [[A Piece of Cake]] event (introduced in [[Updates/10.35|February, 2014]]).\n\nSee [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Cake Tapestry
notes: Reward from [[A Piece of Cake]] event.

name: Calibrated Indicator Gauge
notes: Temporarily obtained in the {{Spoiler Section|Glooth Factory Quest|Mutated Glooth Plague}}.

name: Carafe of Water Binding
notes:
It can be used to capture the soul of water spirits.
It looks the same as a [[Delicate Vase]].\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It possesses the power to take in the essence of a water elemental.

name: Cateroide's Doll
notes:
Fansite item of [[Cateroide]]. Created by {{Character|Gordo Warlike}}. If you ''use'' it, it will turn into [[Cateroide's Doll (Activated)]] and look like that: [[File:Cateroide's Doll (Activated).gif]]. 

Its replica is the [[Crimson Doll (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail Tibians, you have the right to remain silent!|I am Cateroide and I always have BOH!|HAIL CATEROIDE!|Oops, have BOH!}}
flavortext: A rare doll that only worthy warriors can touch! Awarded by Cateroide.com.br.

name: Cateroide's Doll (Activated)
notes: Activated [[Cateroide's Doll]]. It will turn back into previous state after a short moment.
flavortext: A rare doll that only worthy warriors can touch! Awarded by Cateroide.com.br.

name: Chopper of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Carving (Charged)}} [[Chopper of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Chopper of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Chopper of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Chopper of Carving, Chopper of Mayhem and Chopper of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Chopper of Destruction}} [[Chopper of Destruction]].

name: Chopper of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Chopper of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Chopper of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Chopper of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Chopper of Carving, Chopper of Mayhem and Chopper of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Chopper of Destruction}} [[Chopper of Destruction]].

name: Chopper of Mayhem (Charged)
notes:
This item is a charged [[Chopper of Mayhem]], it can be charged by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Chopper of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Chopper of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a heavily charged [[Chopper of Mayhem]], which can be charged by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 15% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 25% to 40%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Chopper of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Chopper of Mayhem (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an overcharged [[Chopper of Mayhem]], charged by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s. It is possible to fail overcharging, in this case you will lose your 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 20% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 30% to 60%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Chopper of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Chopper of Remedy
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Remedy (Charged)}} [[Chopper of Remedy (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Remedy (Heavily Charged)}} [[Chopper of Remedy (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Chopper of Remedy (Overcharged)}} [[Chopper of Remedy (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Chopper of Carving, Chopper of Mayhem and Chopper of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Chopper of Destruction}} [[Chopper of Destruction]].

name: Christmas Cookie Tray
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Closed Silvered Trap
notes: Use it during the fight with [[Feroxa]] when she's immune to regular attacks or spells. Simply put it on the floor, [[Silvered Trap|open]] and wait for [[Feroxa]] to step on it. It will deal 1000 damage.\n\nObtained during the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|Obtaining the Liquid Silver Trap}}.
flavortext: It looks like a common leghold trap, but the jags are coated in silver. The trap is closed and safe.

name: Cluster of Solace
droppedby: Choking Fear | Demon Outcast | Feversleep | Frazzlemaw | Gaz'haragoth | Guzzlemaw | Horadron | Kroazur | Lady Tenebris | Mawhawk | Memory of a Frazzlemaw | Omrafir | Prince Drazzak | Reflection of Mawhawk | Retching Horror | Shiversleep | Sight of Surrender | Silencer | Terofar | Terrorsleep | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Sandking | The Time Guardian | Weakened Frazzlemaw | Zavarash
notes:
Required for [[Umbral Creation]] - to create and refine [[Umbral Weapons]].

When combined with [[Dream Matter]], it can create very strong materials.
* 1x [[Dream Matter]] + 20x Cluster of Solace → attempt at creating a '''crude umbral''' item.
* 75x Cluster of Solace → attempt at improving a '''crude umbral''' item into an '''umbral''' item.
* 150x Cluster of Solace → attempt at transforming an '''umbral''' item into a '''master umbral''' item.
In average, 2100 Clusters of Solace are spent on creating an umbral master item, according to [[Umbral Creation/Statistics]]. For more information about the process of creating, improving and transforming umbral weaponry, see [[Umbral Creation]].

In [[Lower Roshamuul|Lower]] and [[Upper Roshamuul]] you can complete tasks for Inquisition gold, 100 of which can be exchanged for a Cluster of Solace at [[Sandomo]] in the Lower Roshamuul Inquisition base.

In [[Upper Roshamuul]] you can complete the tasks there for [[Essence of Wishful Thinking]] and [[Essence of Dread|Dread]]. [[Morax]] (in his dream realm) will exchange these items for Clusters of Solace, 1 Cluster for 3x [[Essence of Dread]] and 1 Cluster for 2x [[Essence of Wishful Thinking]].

You can also obtain them from [[Unrealized Dream]] very rarely.

Obtained in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
history: It used to have a [[World Transfer]] restriction of 100 (1 stack) between updates {{Update|10.38}} and {{Update|10.90}}.

name: Bone Toothpick
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Orclops Doomhauler | Orclops Ravager | Skeleton Elite Warrior

name: Bones (Item)
notes: There are 2 items with this name.\nPart of the [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].

name: Bones of Zorvorax
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: They used to be [[Zorvorax]]'s.Obtained and used during the [[First Dragon Quest]].

name: Bony Rod
notes: One can be obtained at [[The Extension Site]] as part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: There is an empty bracket on its top.

name: Bony Rod (Ruby)
notes: It's a [[Bony Rod]] charged with a [[Ruby Fire Stone]]. It transforms back into a regular [[Bony Rod]] 14 seconds after being created unless you recharge it on a special [[Coal Basin]].\n\nPart of [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: It has a glowing fire stone on its top.

notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.
history: * Even though this item was implemented with the [[Summer Update 2018]], it was not obtainable in game until the [[Winter Update 2018]] was released.

name: Book with Old Legends
notes:
It contains rural folklore.
It looks the same as a [[Book (Grey)]] and a [[Book with Old Legends (Doctored)]].Temporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
flavortext: It contains many stories and myths about the woods and the forest animals. But you don't find any story about a white deer.

name: Book with Old Legends (Doctored)
notes:
It contains rural folklore.
It looks the same as a [[Book (Grey)]] and a [[Book with Old Legends]].Temporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
flavortext: It contains many stories and myths about the Tibian woods and the forest animals - recently also a story about how it brings ill luck to kill a white deer.

name: Bookworm Doll (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. It looks the same as a [[Bookworm Doll]].

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It was introduced to celebrate [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]].
history: It used to be dropped by [[PiÃ±ata Dragon]]s during the [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]], but not anymore during the [[Tibia Anniversary]] event.
flavortext: It was created by Tibia's finest vintagers for the celebration of 20 years of Tibia.

name: Broken Compass
notes:
It can be found in a chest behind a [[Door (Sealed)|Sealed Door]] in [[The Extension Site]], [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}130.62-125.120-10-8-1-1 here]. To open this door, you must use a [[Sample of Monster Blood]] on the center Skull just east of the door.
Item used in {{Spoiler Section|The Dream Courts Quest|Unsafe Release}}.
history: Even though this item was implemented with the [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it was unobtainable until the [[Updates/11.80|Summer Update 2018]], but remained a mere decoration item until [[Updates/12.00|Winter Update 2018]].

flavortext: Dr Merlay's scrawl is barely legible, but the sigil on those letters looks nice.

name: Butterfly Conservation Kit (Yellow)
notes:
The item description implies this conservation kit has a [[Butterfly (Yellow)|Yellow Butterfly]] inside it. Since there are no reachable yellow butterflies, this is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
It looks the same as a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Blue)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Empty)]], a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Purple)]], and a [[Butterfly Conservation Kit (Red)]].
flavortext: It contains a rare yellow butterfly.

name: Butterfly Ring
droppedby: Dark Carnisylvan | Lavaworm | Mercurial Menace | Nymph | Pixie | Swan Maiden | Undertaker
notes: Very easily obtained ring with permanent 2 armor and 3% death protection.\nObtained in the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
history: At the beginning of the test server to the [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it had 10% death protection, and was meant to have 15 charges which would be drained when taking death damage only. These charges were however not visible in the description, which led to quite a bit of confusion as well as the reduction down to 3% death protection. In the end, the decision was made for the ring to be permanent with the weaker attributes.

It's [[TibiaTV]]'s fansite item. If you ''use'' it, it will look like this for 3 seconds: [[File:Citizen Doll (Animated).gif]]. This item was designed by {{character|Twin Zare}}.

* {{Character|Val Relux}} ([[Talera]])
* {{Character|Kaichi Kidd}} ([[Menera]])
* {{Character|Camarluk}} ([[Thyria]])

Take a look at TibiaTV.com.br!|Have you heard about the Sword of Fury in Rookgaard? It's been a long time since I have seen it...|Hey <character name>! Be careful not to rip my outfit!}}

name: Branch (Quest)
notes: Many of them are required during the [[Winterlight Solstice|fight]] against [[The Percht Queen]].

name: Bright Bell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Broken Bell
notes: This item can only be obtained during [[Winterlight Solstice]] and will vanish at the end of it.\nPart of the [[Winterlight Solstice]] event.

name: Broken Longbow
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: \n20 of these are needed for [[The Order of the Lion Quest]].

name: Brooch of Embracement
flavortext: The oval gem looks like a huge onyx.

name: Bucket Full of Ectoplasm
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: This bucket is filled to the brim with ectoplasm. It is very leaky.

name: Bucket with Ectoplasm
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: This bucket contains a lot of ectoplasm. It is very leaky.

name: Bucket with Some Ectoplasm
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: This bucket contains some samples of ectoplasm. It is very leaky.

name: Bunch of Reed
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: In order to get a bunch of reed, you need to cut [[Reed (Object)|Reed]] with a [[Scythe]], a [[Machete]], a [[Heavy Machete]] or a [[Secret Agent Tools|Secret Agent Tool]]. Use it with a [[Millstone]] to make [[Ground Reed]]. If you use ground reed with a [[Bucket]] or [[Trough]] of [[Water]], you will make a [[Lump of Reed Flour Dough]]. Then use the dough on a baking tray get a [[Baking Tray (Reed)]]. Finally, use this tray on an [[Oven]] to make [[Reed Balls]].

name: Burial Shroud
notes: Part of the [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].
flavortext: It is made of faintly glowing yarn.

name: Calamary (Item)
notes: Can be obtained by using a [[Net (Fishing)]] on the water as you would do so for fishing. Note that it may take several attempts to be successful. A successful attempt will be shown with this message {{Server Message|You catch a calamary.}} You may also catch a [[Small Tortoise]] which will result in this message {{Server Message|You catch an almost drowned tortoise.}} Lastly a failed attempt will show this message {{Server Message|You catch nothing.}} This item is needed for the [[Sculptor Apprentice]] achievement.

name: Capricious Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Capricious Robe
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Carrion Casserole
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It restores 30% of the character's maximum [[Health]] when used. After consuming one, a character has to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish.\n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold.
flavortext: This traditional casserole made of leftovers is beefy and actually smells quite good.

name: Carrot Pie
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It grants +7 [[Distance]] skill for one hour when eaten. After consuming one, you have to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish. \n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold. \n}}\n[[Category:Distance Fighting Booste
flavortext: This pie is fruity and spicy at the same time, which makes it absolutely delicious. Try to control yourself.

name: Cask (Four Salted Rats)
notes: Temporarily obtained in the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|An Ancient Feud}}.

{{Ilink|Cask (Takable, Active)}}\n\nReward of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|An Ancient Feud}}.
flavortext: A goblin zombie is stuffed into it.

name: Chilli Con Carniphila
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It grants +80 [[Speed]] boost for one hour. Buff can be removed at any point by haste spells and paralyse. After consuming one, you have to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish. \n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold. \n}}<noinclude>[[Category:Speed Booster]]</noinclude>
flavortext: Spicy chilli combined with delicious minced carniphila meat, salad is already included.

name: Cobra Wand
history: * On {{OfficialNewsArchive|8436|July 21, 2025}}, the [[Summer Update 2025]] nerfed some of its attributes with the introduction of [[Weapon Proficiency]].

name: Bonelord Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Bonelord Balloon (Inflated)|Bonelord Balloon]] {{Ilink|Bonelord Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Special Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Special Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Special Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Bonelord Tome
notes:
It's [[TibiaSecrets]]' fansite item. Its sounds, sprite, name and weight are all allusions to [[469]] and [[Bonelords]]. 

It has also another stage that appears when interacted with:

[[File:Bonelord Tome 2.gif]]

Known players to have received this item are:

* {{Character|Lupus Aurelius}} for designing the item.
* {{Character|Bosst}} as a contact person and member of the team.
* {{Character|Mogh}} as a member of the team.
* {{Character|Haishen}} as a member of the team.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Forever Fire}} ([[Seanera]])
* {{Character|Fala Yuno Cosera}} ([[Marbera]])
* {{Character|Perthro}} ([[Premia]])
sounds: {{Sound List|3478 67 90871 97664 3466 0 345!|486486 holds the answers to some of your questions. But what have you done to justify the attention of our ancient race?|Hail TibiaSecrets.com! They are very close to the truth...|Oculi plus vident, quam oculus.|Oh...It is you again, <Player>. Get out of my sight, two-eyed creature.|The price for that knowledge is your mind, body and soul. Still want to proceed?}}
flavortext: Eons of wisdom are looking upon thee. Granted by TibiaSecrets.com.

name: Book with Transcripts
notes: Temporarily obtained during [[The Cradle of Monsters Quest]].

name: Bottle of Champagne
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Memory of a Banshee | Memory of a Book | Memory of a Carnisylvan | Memory of a Faun | Memory of a Frazzlemaw | Memory of a Hero | Memory of a Hydra | Memory of a Mammoth | Memory of a Manticore | Memory of a Pirate | Memory of a Scarab | Memory of a Vampire | Memory of a Werelion | Memory of a Yalahari | Memory of an Insectoid | Memory of an Ogre
flavortext: It was created by Tibia's finest vintagers for the celebration of 25 years of Tibia.

Buying this box is cheaper than buying all balloons individually, since each one costs 250 Theons. By opening it you'll get the following items:

* {{Ilink|Balloon No.0}} [[Balloon No.0]]
* {{Ilink|Balloon No.1}} [[Balloon No.1]]
* {{Ilink|Balloon No.2}} [[Balloon No.2]]

* {{Ilink|Balloon No.8}} [[Balloon No.8]]
* {{Ilink|Balloon No.9}} [[Balloon No.9]]
flavortext: Use this to get the balloons no.0 to no.9.

name: Box Full of Decoration
notes:
It can be obtained by trying your luck at the [[Lucky Dragon]].
By opening this box you can get one of the following: * {{Ilink|Box Full of Presents}} [[Box Full of Presents]] * {{Ilink|Dragon Pinata Kit}} [[Dragon Pinata Kit]] * {{Ilink|Embroidered Box}} [[Embroidered Box]] * {{Ilink|Luminous Box}} [[Luminous Box]] {{Seealso|Box Full of Decoration/Statistics}}

name: Box Full of Presents
notes:
It was obtainable by eating at [[The Ambrosia Buffet]] and by opening a [[Box Full of Decoration]].
By opening this box you will get '''one''' of the following 10 options: * {{Ilink|Another Yellow Present Kit}} [[Another Yellow Present Kit]] * {{Ilink|Blue Present Kit}} [[Blue Present Kit]] * {{Ilink|Blue and Red Presents Kit}} [[Blue and Red Presents Kit]] * {{Ilink|Green and Blue Presents Kit}} [[Green and Blue Presents Kit]] * {{Ilink|Green and Red Presents Kit}} [[Green and Red Presents Kit]] * {{Ilink|Pile of Presents Kit}} [[Pile of Presents Kit]] * {{Ilink|Pile of Three Presents Kit}} [[Pile of Three Presents Kit]] * {{Ilink|Red Present Kit}} [[Red Present Kit]] * {{Ilink|Small Blue Present Kit}} [[Small Blue Present Kit]] * {{Ilink|Yellow Present Kit}} [[Yellow Present Kit]] {{Seealso|Box Full of Presents/Statistics}}

name: Chaos Critical Dice
notes:
[[Critical Hit Effect]] {{Ilink|Critical Hit Effect}} will appear when this item is used.
Upon using this item, it will change for this temporary state for about 5 seconds: [[File:Chaos Critical Dice (Rolling).gif]]
This is [[ManjaTibia]]'s fansite item. This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were: * {{Character|Almom}} ([[Lutabra]]) * {{Character|Mogh}} ([[Bona]]) * {{Character|Ares Coldhands}} ([[Inabra]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail ManjaTibia!|In Honor of Tibiasula!|Roll the dice and challenge the God's equilibrium, if you dare to pay the price.|When touching Tibiasula's heart, the power of the dagger was broken. A fraction was absorbed by this object.|Would you sacrifice your soul for a critical hit?|Wow! You got a critical...}}
flavortext: The one prepared to handle this mortal instrument has the power to alter the equilibrium established by the Gods. Choose a target and roll the dice. Awarded by ManjaTibia.com.br.

attrib: distance fighting +3, magic level +1, holy magic level +1
notes: Part of the [[Alicorn Set]]. It will [[Alicorn Ring|discharge]] after wearing it for 3 hours. You can recharge it at [[Cledwyn]] for 5 [[Silver Token]]s.
resist: fire +4%, earth +4%, energy +4%, ice +4%, holy +4%, death +4%

name: Charged Arboreal Ring

name: Charm Upgrade
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase offensive [[Charms|Charm]] trigger chances by 5% (except [[Cripple]]) for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases offensive charm trigger chances except Cripple.

name: Book of Wisdom

flavortext: It is full of jokes about dragons, wyrms and wyverns.

name: Book with an Hourglass
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: It is entitled "The Meaning of Life". All pages are blank.

name: Boots of Enlightenment
notes: Obtained by [[Monk]]s when using the Shrine of Guidance in [[Thais Peninsula]] during [[The Way of the Monk Quest]].
flavortext: Traditional boots worn by pilgrims of the Three-Fold Path. Its design features elements of the natural appearance of moths.

name: Bottle of Enhanced Raubritter Lager
notes:
Obtained by using a [[Meal From the Beak of a Night Harpy]] on a [[Bottle of Raubritter Lager]]. Using it gives some positive affect against [[Night Harpy|Night Harpies]] on the [[Isle of Ada]]. The timer counts down even if the player is offline.\n
When used, the following message appears: {{Server Message|A delightful brew, extra spicy and with an invigorating aftertaste! The night harpies should have a harder time with you for the next four hours.}}\n
When it expires, the following message appears: {{Server Message|The effects of the Night Harpy Lager fade.}}
flavortext: A bottle of "Raubritter Lager", refined with the meal of grinded night harpy beaks. Additionally, it comes without any of the side effects from a regular lager. For better or worse.

name: Bottle of Raubritter Lager
notes: Can be turned into [[Bottle of Enhanced Raubritter Lager]]. Can also be obtained from [[Brass-Shod Chest]]s on the [[Isle of Ada]].
flavortext: A sealed bottle of "Raubritter Lager". Bottled by brewmaster Bhaan of the Order of the Stag on the Isle of Ada.

buyfrom: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan, Giri, Kiru
notes: Can be upgraded through, and used with, the [[Task_Board#Bounty Tasks|Bounty Tasks]].

name: Cookie
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Ogre Brute | Arctic Faun | Cave Rat | Ekatrix | Faun | Grynch Clan Goblin | Mad Scientist | Memory of an Ogre | Munster | Ogre Brute | Ogre Savage | PiÃ±ata Dragon | Pooka | Twisted Pooka | Witch | Yaga the Crone
buyfrom: Bonifacius, Boozer: 5, Christine, Clyde, Imalas, Jehan the Baker, Larek: 7, Maria: 5, Maryza, Relaxed Bartender, Tanaro, Urkalio: 5
notes:
Looks the same as an [[Exploding Cookie]].

How to Bake Cookies

Requirements: * [[Flour]] * [[Milk]] * [[Baking Tray]] * [[Oven]] Method: # Get the milk into a [[trough]] or [[bucket]]. # Use flour with milk. You will get [[Lump of Cake Dough]]. # Use the [[Lump of Cake Dough]] on the [[Baking Tray]]. You will get a [[Baking Tray (With Dough)|Baking Tray with cookie dough]] on it. # Use the baking tray with an oven. You will get 12 ''Cookies''. 4 can be found at a [[daily spawn]] in [[Wyda]]'s house and 27 are obtained in the [[Emperors Cookies Quest]].
20 of these are needed during the [[Krailos Quest]], 10 of them are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]], and 2 are needed in the [[Treasure Hunt Quest]].
Bake 20 trays of cookies (240 cookies in total) in order to gain the [[Cookie Monster]] [[achievement]].

name: Crocodile Boots
notes: '''Crocodile Boots''' are identical to [[Leather Boots]] in both armor rating and weight, but have been traded at seemingly ridiculous prices due to their rarity and the fact that free accounts are unable to loot them for themselves. Their graphic is a recolored version of the old sprite of Leather Boots.

name: Crowbar
droppedby: Behemoth | Destroyer | Faceless Bane | Girtablilu Warrior | Loricate Orger | Orger | Pirat Cutthroat | Stonecracker
buyfrom: Ahmet, Baltim, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Habdel, Halif, Hardek, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Memech, Morpel, Nelliem, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Red Lilly, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Sarina, Shanar, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard, Zora
sellto: Ahmet, Baltim, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, H.L.: 1, Habdel, Halif, Hardek, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Memech, Morpel, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Red Lilly, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Sarina, Shanar, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard, Zora
notes:
Crowbars can be used to fix or destroy certain objects. Also it is the lowest attack [[Club Weapons|club]] and is good for [[Training]].
Needed in one of [[The Postman Missions]], in the [[The Ape City Quest]], and for the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]]. Unlocks a door in the [[Desert Dungeon]]. 

You can use the [[Whacking Driller of Fate]] as a substitution for this tool.
flavortext: It may come in handy sometime.

name: Crown
notes:
A very rare item. There is only one documented crown obtained in Tibia, in [[Lutabra]]. 

It first appeared when [[Knightmare]] (after broadcasting the giveaway) threw this item and a [[Crystal Wand]] as special rewards into the [[Thais]] temple in Antica in 2000. It was owned by a famous rare collector, [[Lightbringer]], and later sold to an unknown player. It can be seen in the treasure rooms in [[Kazordoon]], [[Maze of Lost Souls]], [[Hellgate]], [[Omruc]]'s pharaoh room in [[Ankrahmun]], in a tomb in the [[Isle of the Kings]], in the room just south of [[Bunny Bonecrusher]], [[Pits of Inferno]] reward room, and inside [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis' Treasure Room]].

history: * In November 28, 2019, {{Character|Rei de Lutabra}} bought it for around {{ilink|Tibia Coin}} 168,000 [[Tibia Coin|TCs]].

name: Crown Armor
droppedby: Ashmunrah | Cliff Strider | Demon Outcast | Execowtioner | Gorzindel | Hand of Cursed Fate | Hellgorak | Hero | Horadron | King Zelos | Orewalker | Phantasm | Prince Drazzak | Quara Pincher | Renegade Knight | Renegade Quara Pincher | Serpent Spawn | The Noxious Spawn | Thul | Vile Grandmaster
notes:
Part of the [[Crown Set]].
After the Update 8.4, the Crown Armor became for knights and paladins only. This can also be gotten by using a [[Flask of Rust Remover]] on [[Rusted Armor]] or [[Slightly Rusted Armor]].
Good armor for mid level [[Knights]], some will prefer to use the [[Knight Armor]], which has 1 arm less and is cheap, [[Paladins]] should prefer to use a [[Paladin Armor]]. The next upgrade should be a [[Golden Armor]].
It can be traded for a [[Piece of Royal Steel]] with [[A Sweaty Cyclops]]. It can be obtained through the [[Black Knight Quest]].

name: Crown Helmet
droppedby: Hero | Nightmare Scion | Orewalker | Renegade Knight | Roaring Lion | Ushuriel | Vile Grandmaster | Werelioness | Zanakeph
notes: This is a good and fairly strong helmet used by most players and is part of the [[Crown Set]]. It's also pretty light, making it a decent helmet for any medium level [[Paladin]], [[Mages]] would probably prefer a [[Hat of the Mad]] or an elemental [[Helmet]] such as a [[Terra Hood]].\nObtainable from the [[Noble Armor Quest]].

name: Crown Legs
droppedby: Captain Jones | Hellgorak | Hero | Horadron | Renegade Knight | Sight of Surrender | The Imperor | Vile Grandmaster
notes:
Part of the strong and expensive [[Crown Set]]. Similar to [[Knight Legs]] in armor, but significantly more expensive because of the rarity of Crown Legs and because they are 5.00 oz lighter. Since the 8.1 Update the [[Blue Legs]] have seemed to replace the Crown Legs thus making the Crown Legs harder to sell and drop in value. These can be gotten by [[Rust Remover|unrusting]] [[Rusted Legs]] and [[Slightly Rusted Legs]].
Needed for an addon of [[Wizard Outfits]].

name: Crown Shield
droppedby: Annihilon | Demon Outcast | Flameborn | Hero | Knight's Apparition | Lava Golem | Renegade Knight | Retching Horror | Soul-Broken Harbinger | Sulphider | Terofar | Varnished Diremaw | Vile Grandmaster | Zavarash
notes: Better than [[Tower Shield]] because it weighs less. It is also part of the [[Crown Set]].\nReward from the [[Black Knight Quest]]. Can be obtained by [[Unrusting]] a [[Slightly Rusted Shield]].

name: Crusader Helmet
droppedby: Bibby Bloodbath | Cliff Strider | Demon Outcast | Duke Krule | Lavaworm | Melting Frozen Horror | Orc Warlord | Rotspit | Sight of Surrender | Spitter | The Hungerer | Thul | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator
notes: Most players prefer to use this over a [[Warrior Helmet]], which has the same defence but is a bit heavier (by 16 [[oz]]) than Crusader Helmet, although it is more expensive.\nObtainable from the [[Crusader Helmet Quest]].
history: The sprite of this helmet was changed during [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]]. Before that, it used to look like this: [[File:Old-crusaderhelmet.gif|Old sprite]]

name: Crystal Arrow
notes: Trade this item for a [[Helmet Adornement]] (part of the [[Helmet of the Ancients]]) for the [[Helmet of the Ancients Quest]]
flavortext: This arrow seems not suitable for the use with ordinary bows. It seems to be rotting rapidly.

name: Crystal Ball
droppedby: Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Latrivan | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Priestess | Zugurosh

Can be seen in the Halls of Sorcery in [[Kazordoon]]. There is no use for it except for decoration. Looks the same as a [[Crystal Ball (Object)]], a [[Scrying Ball]], and a [[Mago Mechanic Core]]. 5 crystal balls spawn in the room of [[Rahemos]].
Obtained from the [[Time Ring Quest]].

name: Crystal Coin
droppedby: Alptramun | Amenef the Burning | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Bony Sea Devil | Brachiodemon | Brain Head | Branchy Crawler | Capricious Phantom | Cloak of Terror | Count Vlarkorth | Courage Leech | Distorted Phantom | Druid's Apparition | Drume | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Emerald Tortoise | Enusat the Onyx Wing | Gaz'haragoth | Ghazbaran | Ghulosh | Gore Horn | Gorerilla | Gorzindel | Goshnar's Cruelty | Goshnar's Greed | Goshnar's Hatred | Goshnar's Malice | Goshnar's Megalomania | Goshnar's Spite | Hazardous Phantom | Headpecker | Hulking Prehemoth | Infernal Demon | Infernal Phantom | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Knight's Apparition | Lokathmor | Lord Azaram | Magma Bubble | Malofur Mangrinder | Mantosaurus | Many Faces | Maxxenius | Mazzinor | Megasylvan Yselda | Mercurial Menace | Morshabaal | Mould Phantom | Neferi the Spy | Nighthunter | Noxious Ripptor | Paladin's Apparition | Plagueroot | Plunder Patriarch | Ratmiral Blackwhiskers | Rotten Golem | Scarlett Etzel | Shrieking Cry-Stal | Sir Baeloc | Sister Hetai | Sorcerer's Apparition | Stalking Stalk | Sulphider | Sulphur Spouter | Tentugly's Head | The Abomination | The Baron from Below | The Brainstealer | The Count of the Core | The Dread Maiden | The Duke of the Depths | The Fear Feaster | The Nightmare Beast | The Pale Worm | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Unwelcome | Timira the Many-Headed | True Dawnfire Asura | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Turbulent Elemental | Undertaker | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Vibrant Phantom | Sabretooth (Creature) | Murcion | Vemiath | Chagorz | Ichgahal
notes:
A crystal coin is equal to 100 [[platinum coin]]s, or 10,000 [[gold coin]]s. Although you cannot directly buy this item, it is possible to exchange money with [[Banker NPCs]]. For more information, read the [[Currency]] page. Also called "CC".\n10 of them can be obtained from the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]]. It can also be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s and [[Shiny Stone]]s.
{{Seealso|Gnomish Supply Package/Statistics|Shiny Stone/Refining Statistics}}

name: Crystal Key
notes: There are a total of two type of crystal keys in game, [[Key 3700|3700]] having been added during the Christmas 2006 update.\n\nFor a list of crystal keys, see [[Keys by Type/Crystal Key]].

name: Crystal Mace
droppedby: Animated Feather | Boar Man | Brachiodemon | Eradicator | Eyeless Devourer | Icecold Book | Infernal Phantom | Ironblight | Juvenile Bashmu | Knight's Apparition | Lavafungus | Melting Frozen Horror | Realityquake | Sight of Surrender | Squid Warden | Stone Devourer | Streaked Devourer | The Baron from Below | Tunnel Tyrant | Utua Stone Sting | Vashresamun | Walker | Yakchal | Zushuka
notes: Due to its stats and rarity compared to other weapons, this beautiful mace is used mainly as a valuable decoration, since it is a rare [[loot]] from only a few hard [[creatures]].\nIt can be obtained from [[Mucus Plug]]s.
history:
Interesting to note that it was dropped by a lot of [[Ice]]-themed creatures during the Test Server for the [[Updates/8.0|Summer Update 2007]], but it was removed before the update. However, value of this weapon decreased greatly after the [[Updates/9.6|Summer Update 2012]], and later, when [[Sight of Surrender|Sights of Surrender]] were introduced ([[Updates/10.3|Winter Update 2013]]). It is one of the few [[Pharaoh Rares]] that have lost their rarity status.
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]: * {{Ilink|Icy Crystal Mace}} [[Icy Crystal Mace]] * {{Ilink|Earth Crystal Mace}} [[Earth Crystal Mace]] * {{Ilink|Energy Crystal Mace}} [[Energy Crystal Mace]] * {{Ilink|Fiery Crystal Mace}} [[Fiery Crystal Mace]] These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].

droppedby: Amazon | Behemoth | Bretzecutioner | Crystal Spider | Destroyer | Hellgorak | Lucifuga Aranea | Orshabaal | Priestess
notes:
Only used as a decoration amulet, often neglected by most players until [[Rashid]] started buying them after [[Updates/8.4|Winter Update 2008]] and its loot value increased dramatically.
Can be obtained in the [[Skull of Ratha Quest]].

name: Crystal Ring
droppedby: Animated Mummy | Banshee | Boar Man | Crystal Spider | Elder Mummy | Energy Elemental | Ferumbras | Frost Flower Asura | Fury | Furyosa | Ghazbaran | Grorlam | High Voltage Elemental | Knowledge Elemental | Kusuma | Mahatheb | Mantosaurus | Memory of a Banshee | Midnight Asura | Morgaroth | Mummy | Naga Archer | Nightstalker | Orshabaal | Raging Mage | Stone Golem | The Blazing Rose | The Diamond Blossom | The Flaming Orchid | The Winter Bloom | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Vashresamun | Warlock | Iks Chuka
notes:
The Crystal Ring is mostly used for [[decoration]] purposes only.
It looks the same as [[Crystal Ring (Eleonore)|Eleonore's Crystal Ring]] and [[House Silversun's Signet Ring]].\nItem obtained in [[Behemoth Quest]].

name: Crystal Wand
notes: It is one of the only remaining [[Old Wands|Older Wands]].\nObtainable from the [[Crystal Wand Quest]].
history:
Back in 2000, after [[Updates/6.0|Update 6.0]], former GM [[Knightmare]] broadcasted that he was going to gamble some items in Thais temple. He left both a [[Crown]] and a Crystal Wand in different spots of the temple so players could get them quickly.
Warax bought it but he was deleted later, and so was the Crystal Wand.

Despite being an incredible rare item back in the days, Crystal Wand is no longer a rare item since it is dropped by [[Rahemos]], giving it the status of a [[Pharaoh Rares|Pharaoh Rare]].

history: It became sellable after [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]], with the introduction of the [[NPC]], [[Rashid]]. Another change was made during February 2013, when the name changed from Daramanian Mace to Daramian Mace with a patch.

droppedby: Ancient Scarab | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Grave Guard | Memory of a Scarab | The Ravager

However, they only appear during a not often occurring [[World Change]].\n* In February 2013, the name changed from ''Daramanian Waraxe'' to ''Daramian Waraxe'' with the [[Updates/9.82|patch 9.82]].

droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Arthom the Hunter | Behemoth | Bellicose Orger | Bibby Bloodbath | Black Knight | Bretzecutioner | Destroyer | Dracola | Gargoyle | Ghastly Dragon | Pirate Corsair | Spiky Carnivor | Stonecracker | Werelion

A common helmet, many low level players use it. Had its graphics changed during 7.8 update to match the new [[Dark Armor]] graphic that was introduced during 7.6 update. It is the same in armor and weight as a [[Steel Helmet]] and a [[Strange Helmet]]. Part of the [[Dark Set]].\n
\nReward in the [[Alawar's Vault Quest]].

name: Dark Mushroom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
