notes:
Can be seen in Mushroomfarms Brewery in [[Kazordoon]]. They are somewhat valuable since no [[NPC]] sells them and they are required for a [[The Shattered Isles Quest|quest]], if you loot them you're advised not to eat them.
[[File:Dark_Mushroom_Spawn.jpg|400px]] Can be found at a [[daily spawn]] in [[Dusalk's Troll Clan Cave]] east of the [[Dwarven Bridge]].
Used for the [[The Shattered Isles Quest]]

name: Dark Shield
droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Bellicose Orger | Bretzecutioner | Grim Reaper | Pirate Corsair | Silencer | Thanatursus | The Handmaiden | Werelion
notes:
Used by most people when they come from [[Rookgaard]] because it's so easy to get. Used to be rare, until a quest to get it was implemented. Part of the [[Dark Set]].
\nLooks the same as [[The Shield Nevermourn]].\nReward from the [[Lighthouse Quest]].

name: Demon Armor
notes: Since the Update 8.4 this is the strongest armor without level restrictions for mages as they can no longer use [[Magic Plate Armor]]. Part of the [[Demon Set]].\nObtainable in the [[Annihilator Quest]].

name: Demon Helmet
notes:
It has been superseded by the [[Zaoan Helmet]]. The Demon Helmet is also a very good helmet for Mages who want to prioritize defense.
\nObtainable in the [[Demon Helmet Quest]].
history: Demon Helmet used to be very rare before the [[Demon Legs]] quest was changed into todays Demon Helmet quest, it's a bit unclear how it was obtained before this but most likely one time spawn's of it or as a gift from Gods.
flavortext: You hear an evil whispering from inside.

name: Demon Legs
notes: Obtainable in [[The Demon Oak Quest]].
history:
* They used to be obtainable around the area of the [[Demon Helmet Quest]], when the quest system consisted of a chest with various items that could only be obtained once. They were meant to spawn after a full [[Floor Reset|map reset]] (happens when an [[Update]] sends players to temple) but [[Knightmare]] forgot to set this and it was abused. Many players completed the quest and got the reward, making the Demon Legs not as rare as they were intended to be. The old Demon Legs quest was replaced by the current [[Demon Helmet Quest]] many years ago.
* Before [[Updates/8.2|Update 8.2]] these were unobtainable and, therefore, an extremely exclusive item. 
** After the update they became a reward for [[The Demon Oak Quest]], making the value and rarity decrease. 
** This quest sparked a lot of controversy, because many felt that making the Demon Legs a quest reward would destroy a piece of Tibia history. 
** The legs were extremely rare and very few people had ever obtained them. Older worlds, such as [[Antica]], [[Amera]], [[Calmera]], [[Danubia]], [[Eternia]], [[Isara]], [[Libera]], [[Lunara]], [[Rubera]], [[Secura]], [[Nova]] and [[Trimera]] had a pair of demon legs before the update.
* With [[Updates/8.5]] CipSoft released a new quest ([[Killing in the Name of... Quest]]), which allowed players access to the Demon Oak area as a reward, once again allowing players the chance of gaining these legs.

Demon Legs Quest.jpg|Old Demon Legs Quest

history:
Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.5|Summer Update 2005]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/8.4|Winter Update 2008]] when it was added to [[Madareth]]'s loot.
Before the [[Updates/8.54|Christmas Update 2009]], this item was very rare and expensive, usually owned by collectors. But after this update, it became available to buy from [[Cael]], lowering the price considerably.

notes: It has no practical use. It can be found in some junk piles throughout [[Tibia]].\nYou can get it from [[Bunny Bonecrusher]] in Mission 6: The Unhappy Frog of [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].

\nLooks the same as an [[Animal Fetish]].\nNeeded in the [[Postman Quest]] and in the [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].

The Dragon Lance's sprite was changed in the [[Updates/8.0|2007 Summer Update]] to: [[File:Dragon Lance (old).gif]].

name: Composite Hornbow
droppedby: Black Vixen | Cave Chimera | Elder Wyrm | Gorerilla | Hellhunter Inferniarch | Ironblight | Outburst | Paladin's Apparition | World Devourer | Wyrm
notes: This [[bow]] is almost the same as the [[arbalest]], but it has 1 more attack. Combined with [[Onyx Arrow]]s it has 1 less attack than the [[arbalest]] with [[power bolt]]s. Contrary to popular belief, a Composite Hornbow combined with onyx arrows actually hits higher on average than an Arbalest with power bolts. The average damage inflicted by a level 100 paladin with 100 distance using a Composite Hornbow and onyx arrows is 193, whereas the average damage inflicted by the same paladin using an Arbalest and power bolts is 192. This is due to the higher hit percentage of the Hornbow(they both have 2% hit, only difference is +1 atk on Hornbow, need an updated source on this).

name: Cranial Basher
notes: A good one handed club weapon for players of level 60. However, lootable clubs such as the [[Metal Bat]] and the exceptional [[Deepling Squelcher]] present better options, with the later having only a level 48 requirement. Better to use it in as a second weapon with an [[Imbuing|elemental imbuement]] to kill physical resistant/immune creatures (such as [[Ghost]]s).\nIt can be obtained through [[The Ultimate Challenges Quest]], Scrapper Level.
history:
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy Cranial Basher}} [[Icy Cranial Basher]]
* {{Ilink|Earth Cranial Basher}} [[Earth Cranial Basher]]
* {{Ilink|Energy Cranial Basher}} [[Energy Cranial Basher]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery Cranial Basher}} [[Fiery Cranial Basher]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].

flavortext: The words 'Ramsay the Reckless' are engraved inside. It appears to be cracked and broken.

name: Dark Lord's Cape
notes: Since this [[Armor]] drops from [[Morgaroth]], it is not an item commonly seen or used by players.
flavortext: There is a dark aura surrounding it.

name: Dark Trinity Mace
notes:
The name of the item is an allusion to the Church of Zathroth. The Dark Trinity (Archpriest and two Tribunes) is its highest commission. Therefore, you might expect this weapon to appear as loot from further powerful demon bosses yet to appear in game.
\nIt can currently be seen in [[Pythius The Rotten]]'s treasure room; however, the mace is being covered by a [[Green Gem]].
\nBefore [[Gamemaster]]s were dismissed, [[CipSoft]] gave them a list of items to choose as a token of their appreciation and this is one of the items that were on this list.

name: Deadeye Devious' Eye Patch
notes:
It is an item dropped by a boss during a raid on Liberty Bay.

\nNeeded for an addon of [[Pirate Outfits]].

name: Death Ring
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Betrayed Wraith | Blightwalker | Bretzecutioner | Burning Book | Dark Torturer | Dawnfire Asura | Defiler | Destroyer | Diabolic Imp | Dracola | Fleshslicer | Fury | Furyosa | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Grave Guard | Gravedigger | Grim Reaper | Hand of Cursed Fate | Haunted Dragon | Latrivan | Loricate Orger | Lost Soul | Madareth | Morgaroth | Nightmare | Nightmare Scion | Omnivora | Orshabaal | Phantasm | Ragiaz | Shulgrax | Souleater | Spectre | Spidris | Spidris Elite | The Abomination | The Flaming Orchid | The Handmaiden | Tormentor | True Dawnfire Asura | Undead Dragon | Ushuriel | Xogixath | Zanakeph | Zorvorax
notes:
Death rings were once one of the oldest items in [[Tibia]]. It was replaced in an [[update]] by [[Stealth Ring]]s at the same time the other magical [[ring]]s were introduced. It reduces your [[shielding]] by 10 points and has energy for 7 minutes 30 seconds. Quite valued on the market nowadays since they can be used as quest items and useful in wars because of its death protection. Using a death ring when your shield skill is originally 10, it is reduced down to 0. It's also worth mentioning that even though shield is reduced by 10 levels, '''your shielding skill won't go up faster'''. The value of the ring decreased after [[Updates/8.10|Christmas Update 2007]] because since then it is obtainable from quests. The attributes are only shown when worn.\nTwo of them are needed for the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]].
One can be obtained in the [[Into the Bone Pit Quest]].
Another can be obtained every year at [[Lightbearer]] event.
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|171|December 2002}}, there was an item called the "Death Ring." After December 2002, all death rings were turned into the current [[Stealth Ring]]s.\n\nIn the [[Updates/Update 7.9|7.9 Update]], the current incarnation of the "Death Ring" was added to the game with the [[Pits of Inferno]] and many strong creatures.
flavortext: Wearing it makes you feel a little weaker than usual.

name: Deed of Ownership
notes:
Look same as the [[Spy Report]].
Temporarily obtained in [[The Thieves Guild Quest]]
flavortext: It declares the ownership of the dwarf bridge, but is obviously a fake.

name: Deer Trophy
notes:
It can be hung on a wall. It is not dropped by [[Deer]] as you might think. Valuable because it is needed for an important quest.
Needed for [[The Traveling Trader Quest]].

name: Demon Dust
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Demon Outcast | The Source of Corruption
notes:
Can be obtained if you use a [[Blessed Wooden Stake]] on a slain [[Demon]].
{{seealso|Demon Dust/Dusting}} 100 of them are needed for an addon of [[Druid Outfits]].
10 of them are needed to acquire [[Assassin Outfits]].
flavortext: It reeks of hatred and malice.

name: Demon Horn
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Angry Demon | Annihilon | Demon | Gaz'haragoth | Ghazbaran | Ghulosh | Gorzindel | Hellgorak | Horadron | Lokathmor | Madareth | Mazzinor | Morgaroth | Omrafir | Orshabaal | Prince Drazzak | Terofar | Ushuriel | Zavarash | Zugurosh
notes: 5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Scorch]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Demon Trophy
notes: It can be hung on a wall.

name: Demonbone
notes: Good one-handed club weapon. It was first looted on [[Candia (Game World)|Candia]] by {{Character|Darkseph}}. It is the heaviest weapon in the game, together with the [[Giant Sword]] and [[Twiceslicer]]. Mainly used as a deco due to it's value. Nowadays, on many [[Optional PvP]] worlds the price dropped drastically, due to the fact that [[Annihilon]] is hunted frequently there. It is still a very rare and valuable item on most servers due to [[Annihilon]] being hard to hunt on [[Open PvP]] and [[Hardcore PvP]] servers.

name: Demonbone Amulet
droppedby: Falcon Knight | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Hellfire Fighter | Hellflayer | Hellgorak | Juggernaut | Mazzinor | Morguthis | Preceptor Lazare | Prince Drazzak | Spectre | The Imperor
notes:
Just for [[decoration]], no actual use yet. Part of the [[Bone Set]].
\nIt looks the same as the [[V-Belt]].

name: Demonic Essence
droppedby: Angry Demon | Betrayed Wraith | Blightwalker | Bretzecutioner | Burning Book | Countess Sorrow | Dark Torturer | Dawnfire Asura | Defiler | Demon | Destroyer | Diabolic Imp | Dracola | Ethershreck | Flameborn | Floating Savant | Frost Flower Asura | Fury | Furyosa | Gaz'haragoth | Ghastly Dragon | Ghazbaran | Ghulosh | Golgordan | Grim Reaper | Grimeleech | Hand of Cursed Fate | Hatebreeder | Haunted Dragon | Hellfire Fighter | Hellflayer | Hellgorak | Hellhound | Hellspawn | Horadron | Juggernaut | Kerberos | Kusuma | Latrivan | Lost Soul | Madareth | Massacre | Mazoran | Mazzinor | Midnight Asura | Morgaroth | Mr. Punish | Nightmare | Omrafir | Orshabaal | Phantasm | Plagirath | Plaguesmith | Preceptor Lazare | Prince Drazzak | Rage Squid | Ragiaz | Razzagorn | Shulgrax | Spectre | Tarbaz | Terofar | The Abomination | The Blazing Rose | The Diamond Blossom | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The Flaming Orchid | The Handmaiden | The Imperor | The Lily of Night | The Moonlight Aster | The Plasmother | The Winter Bloom | Tormentor | True Dawnfire Asura | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Undead Dragon | Ushuriel | Vexclaw | Zamulosh | Zanakeph | Zavarash | Zorvorax | Zugurosh | Lokathmor
sellto: Augustin;bob-rank4, The Bone Master;bob-rank4, The Dream Master;nk-rank4
notes:
Since [[Updates/8.4|Update 8.4]] they're easier to obtain, so the quests that require them have become easier. However, more players are interested in completing the quest because of their availability, and both the demand for essences and their price have risen as a result. As a result of [[Updates/10.37|Update 10.37]], [[Demon]]s finally started dropping them themselves as well.
\nIt looks the same as [[Chaos Matter]].\nYou need 3000 of these to complete [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]].
You need 30 of these in the [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].
You need 20 of these in [[The Inquisition Quest]].
3 of these can be obtained in [[Berserk Potion Quest]].
50 of these can be obtained during the [[Lightbearer Event]] if you have lit all ten basins.
flavortext: Someone might be interested in trading this.

name: Demonrage Sword
droppedby: Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Angry Demon | Ayana the Crimson Curse | Courage Leech | Demon | Demon Outcast | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Katex Blood Tongue | Mazoran | Rage Squid | Srezz Yellow Eyes | Vexclaw | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes: It is a little bit more powerful and lighter than the popular two-handed [[Giant Sword]]. It's rather difficult to obtain as it is very rarely looted from [[Demon]]s.

name: Diamond
droppedby: Ahau | Brain Head | Cursed Prospector | Irgix the Flimsy | The Dread Maiden | The Fear Feaster | The Pale Worm | The Unwelcome | Unaz the Mean
sellto: Augustin, Chantalle, Jessica, Odemara, Tesha, Talila, Valindara

name: Diamond Sceptre
droppedby: Animated Feather | Annihilon | Blemished Spawn | Cursed Book | Enfeebled Silencer | Girtablilu Warrior | Gore Horn | Hulking Carnisylvan | Ice Witch | Icecold Book | Juvenile Bashmu | Massive Earth Elemental | Nightmare Scion | Ogre Ruffian | Poisonous Carnisylvan | Silencer | Squid Warden | Swan Maiden | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Time Guardian | Varnished Diremaw | Zavarash
notes: Best one handed club weapon for [[level]] 25.
flavortext: The beautiful jewel on the top of this sceptre is sharp enough to cut through glass.

name: Die
droppedby: Arctic Faun | Dark Faun | Faun | Grynch Clan Goblin | Memory of a Faun | Memory of a Pirate | Munster | Pirate Buccaneer | Pirate Cutthroat | Pirate Marauder
notes:
The die rolls when used, producing a text that announces who rolled the die and what the result is. There is not known to be any pattern to what outcome the die may bring, although this is often believed by gamblers. Players within two squares of the die can see this orange text. When placed on an open area, the die has a rolling animation. Often used by scammers and die fanatics when they offer an item and let people pay an amount of [[gp]] for a roll. '''Important:''' The die won't roll if you are standing on a [[Glowing Switch|depot tile]], you need to step aside in order to use the dice. Can be obtained by gambling with [[Zebron]] in [[Venore]] or with [[Klaus]] in [[Nargor]].
The [[Number of the Beast]] [[achievement]] is obtainable by rolling a 6 three times in a row with a die.
history: In October 2013 the name of this item changed from '''Dice''' to '''Die'''. The reason Cipsoft gave for this name change was that 'dice' is plural and 'die' is singular (even though 'dice' is a perfectly fine singular as well, see [http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/dice this wiktionary] quote: ''Dice is used for both the singular and the plural'').

name: Djinn's Lamp
notes:
They can be seen in the [[Treasure Rooms#Serpentine Tower Treasure Room|Serpentine Tower Treasure Room]] and [[Treasure Rooms#Ankrahmun's Pharaoh Treasure Room|Ankrahmun's Pharaoh Treasure Room]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Small Oil Lamp]].
flavortext: (This item has 2 charges left).

name: Document (Certificate)
notes:
[[Fishing Master Certificate (Book)|One copy]] of this item is a document that spawns daily is [[Santiago]]'s cellar on [[Rookgaard]], [[Deed of Ownership (Book)|another]] is a deed awarded to lightbearers who show great effort.
It looks the same as a [[Contract]], a [[Signed Contract]], a [[Tactical Map]], and a [[Faded Last Will]].

name: Document of the Follower
notes:
Upon completion of mission 4 in the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]] and talking to their faction leader (the [[Brotherhood of Bones]] or the [[Nightmare Knights]]), a player can "use" this document to instantly obtain the [[Brotherhood of Bones Outfits]] or [[Nightmare Knights Outfits]], depending on which faction the player chose. For the price of 1 [[Small Diamond]] Lord Protectors and Dread Lords can [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest/Spoiler#Creating Documents|create this document]] in the officers quarters inside the [[Dream Realm]].
It looks the same as [[Building Plans for a Ship]], a [[Document of the Leader]], a [[Document of the Officer]], an [[Old Parchment (Omrabas)]], a [[Parchment (White)]] and [[Parchment of Dark Knowledge]].\nUsed in the [[Brotherhood Outfits Quest]] and the [[Nightmare Outfits Quest]].

name: Document of the Leader
notes:
Upon completion of mission 6 in the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]] this document can be "used" to obtain the second addon of the [[Brotherhood of Bones Outfits]] or the [[Nightmare Knights Outfits]], depending on which faction the player chose. For the price of 1 [[Small Diamond]] Lord Protectors and Dread Lords can [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest/Spoiler#Creating Documents|create this document]] in the officers quarters inside the [[Dream Realm]].
It looks the same as [[Building Plans for a Ship]], a [[Document of the Follower]], a [[Document of the Officer]], an [[Old Parchment (Omrabas)]], a [[Parchment (White)]] and [[Parchment of Dark Knowledge]].\nUsed in the [[Brotherhood Outfits Quest]] and the [[Nightmare Outfits Quest]].

name: Document of the Officer
notes:
Upon completion of mission 5 in the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]] this document can be "used" to obtain the first addon of the [[Brotherhood of Bones Outfits]] or the [[Nightmare Knights Outfits]], depending on which faction the player chose. For the price of 1 [[Small Diamond]] Lord Protectors and Dread Lords can [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest/Spoiler#Creating Documents|create this document]] in the officers quarters inside the [[Dream Realm]].
It looks the same as [[Building Plans for a Ship]], a [[Document of the Follower]], a [[Document of the Leader]], an [[Old Parchment (Omrabas)]], a [[Parchment (White)]] and [[Parchment of Dark Knowledge]].\nUsed in the [[Brotherhood Outfits Quest]] and the [[Nightmare Outfits Quest]].

name: Dracola's Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Used for decoration purposes only, it is quite rare as it is only dropped by the [[Undead Dragon]] boss, [[Dracola]].

name: Dragha's Spellbook
notes:
Looks the same as an [[Almanac of Magic]], [[Nature Magic Spellbook]] and [[Spellbook]].
\nObtainable in a dead human on [[Goroma]]. Can be given to [[Chondur]] to gain access to deeper [[Goroma]].
flavortext: It apparently belonged to someone called Dragha, the apprentice of a voodoomaster.

name: Dragon Claw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Only lootable from [[Demodras]]. It can be obtained as a present from [[Santa Claus]]. \nNeeded for an addon of [[Warrior Outfits]].
\nYou will have a chance to kill [[Demodras]] if you are a Trophy Hunter of [[Paw and Fur Society]].
history: Before the [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]], this item's sprite looked like this: [[File:Dragon Claw (Green).gif]]. With the same update, an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] using the old sprite was implemented, the [[Dragon Claw (Green)]].
flavortext: It is the claw of Demodras.

name: Dragon Lord Trophy
notes: It can be hung on a wall.

name: Coconut Shoes
notes: Elegant shoes made of coconut, they are reasonably rare and a fine decoration. For many people these shoes are valuable. It was first seen on June 1, 2009. {{seealso|Dryad Set}}

name: Coconut Shrimp Bake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
history: The dish is one of the four winning recipes of the {{OfficialNewsArchive|1335|Gourmet Competition}} held by [[CipSoft]] in May 2010. The creator of this recipe is {{character|Natalya Rimsky}}.\n\nIt is much less useful than it initially was because underwater walking speed was increased with the [[Updates/9.8|Winter Update 2012]] which also decreased the relative character speed (for characters higher than level 175).
flavortext: It looks as if it was sealed with milky goodness.

name: Colourful Feather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Comb
notes: Spawns in [[Eclesius]] house on the table of the laboratory where also a broom spawns. Some people may use them as decoration.
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.8|Summer Update 2006]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]]. It used to look like a [[Coral Comb]] until [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]].

name: Compass
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Pirate Buccaneer | Pirate Corsair | Pirate Cutthroat | Pirate Marauder
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Swiftness]] and [[Powerful Swiftness]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Contract
notes: Looks the same as a [[Document (Certificate)]], a [[Signed Contract]], a [[Tactical Map]], and a [[Faded Last Will]].Part of the [[What a Foolish Quest]].
flavortext: It is not signed yet.

name: Convince Creature Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[Convince]]s a creatures to help you.
[[Convince Creature]] and [[Paralyze]] are the only [[runes]] that need mana to be used.
The mana required to use this rune varies depending upon the creature that you want to convince.
There are some creatures that cannot be [[convince]]d and some creatures that can only be [[convince]]d (cannot be [[summon]]ed). You also cannot convince monster summoned by someone else.
\nFor the spell, see [[Convince Creature]].

name: Corned Fish
notes: Obtained and used temporarily during [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: This fish has been salted and already prepared as provision for soldiers.

name: Corrupted Flag
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Lizard Chosen | The Voice of Ruin
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Crab Pincers
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 5 of these are needed during the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

name: Crate (Swapped)
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Crate]], a [[Crate (Usable)]], an [[Old Crate]], a [[Crate (Wine)]], a [[Crate (Jimmy)]], a [[Crate Full of Coral]], a [[Machine Crate]] and a [[Weapons Crate]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[What a foolish Quest]].
flavortext: You swapped it with Bozo's crate of wine flasks.

name: Crate (Wine)
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Crate]], a [[Crate (Usable)]], an [[Old Crate]], a [[Crate (Swapped)]], a [[Crate (Jimmy)]], a [[Crate Full of Coral]], a [[Machine Crate]] and a [[Weapons Crate]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[What a foolish Quest]].
flavortext: It contains a lot of wine flasks.

name: Crocodile Steak
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Can be obtained using an [[Obsidian Knife]] on a dead [[Killer Caiman]] (but only during a [[An Uneasy Alliance Quest/Spoiler#Task 2 - To feed a beast|certain task]]).
Required for [[An Uneasy Alliance Quest/Spoiler#Task 2 - To feed a beast|An Uneasy Alliance Quest]].

name: Crown Backpack
notes: Obtainable after completing [[The Explorer Society Quest]], after which they can be purchased from [[Angus]] or [[Mortimer]]. They are also a reward from the [[The Lightbearer|Lightbearer Event]] for players who light all the basins. \n\nSee [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Crystal Boots
notes: It's a very rare item.
history: The first pair of Crystal Boots were supposedly looted by the guild '''Hades''' on [[Secura]].

name: Crystal of Balance
flavortext: It is said to make you calmer and less afflicted by anger and anxiety.

name: Crystal of Focus
droppedby: Mad Mage | Nightmare Scion | Twisted Pooka
notes: Used as a [[Decorations|decoration]].\n\nObtainable in [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
flavortext: It is said to increase your ability to concentrate and take the right decisions.

name: Crystal of Power
droppedby: Boogy | Cliff Strider | Infernalist | Ironblight | Raging Mage | Reflection of a Mage | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | War Golem
flavortext: It is said to make you more resistant to weaknesses and to supply you with energy.

name: Cultish Mask
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Demon Presence]] and [[Powerful Demon Presence]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Intricate Demon Presence, Powerful Demon Presence

name: Cultish Robe
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Adept of the Cult | Cult Believer | Cult Enforcer | Cult Scholar | Minotaur Cult Follower | Minotaur Cult Prophet | Minotaur Cult Zealot | Novice of the Cult | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Cult Inquisitor | Orc Cult Minion | Orc Cult Priest | Orc Cultist | Priestess
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Demon Presence]], [[Intricate Demon Presence]] and [[Powerful Demon Presence]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Demon Presence, Intricate Demon Presence, Powerful Demon Presence

name: Cultish Symbol
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Adept of the Cult | Enlightened of the Cult | Tzumrah the Dazzler
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}\n\nBecause of the similar appearance to [[Vampire Lord Token]], it has been used to scam people.

name: Cup (Dwarven)
notes: It can be found in [[Farmine]], at the [[Swolt|tavern]].

name: Cup of Molten Gold
notes:
It will last for 10 hours after creation. You can receive one from [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] in exchange for a [[Gold Ingot]]. To turn it into a [[Golden Fir Cone]], use it on a [[Fir Tree]] or on a [[Fir Cone]]. There is a high chance that the '''Cup of Molten Gold''' will disappear when you use it on a either of those, and if it does one of the following messages will appear.
When using it on a [[Fir Tree]]:
{{Sound|Drizzling all over a fir cone you picked from the tree, the molten gold only covers about half of it - not enough.}} When using it on a [[Fir Cone]]:
{{Sound|Drizzling all over the fir cone, the molten gold only covers about half of it - not enough.}} {{Infobox Transcript| ''Player'': '''hi'''
A Sweaty Cyclops: Hum Humm! Welcume here lil' ''player''.
''Player'': '''melt'''
A Sweaty Cyclops: Can melt gold ingot for lil' one. You want?
''Player'': '''yes'''
A Sweaty Cyclops: Ah, lil'one brought gold ingot to melt. You give?
''Player'': '''yes'''
A Sweaty Cyclops: *whoooosh* There! }}
flavortext: Be careful, this vessel can hold the molten gold only for a short time.

name: Cursed Shoulder Spikes
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Lizard Chosen | The Voice of Ruin
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Cyclops Toe
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Cyclops | Cyclops Drone | Cyclops Smith | The Old Whopper
notes: 20 of them are needed for the [[Basic Bash]], [[Intricate Bash]] and [[Powerful Bash]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Bash, Intricate Bash, Powerful Bash

name: Daramian Axe
notes: It seems to be the standard version of the [[Daramian Waraxe]]. This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Dark Essence
notes: Looks the same as a [[Glob of Tar]] and a [[Glob of Grease]].\nPossibly temporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 10.

name: Dark Rosary
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Deep Crystal
notes: It looks the same as a [[Gnomish Resonance Crystal]], a [[Life Crystal]], a [[Purified Soul]], a [[Resonance Crystal]], a [[Resonance Crystal (Recorded)]] and a [[Spectral Stone]].\nPossibly temporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 10.
flavortext: It is pulsating with spectral energy.

name: Deepling Axe
notes: A strong [[Axe Weapons|axe weapon]], recommended for level 80s until they can use [[Stonecutter Axe]] or [[Hellforged Axe]]. Part of the [[Deepling Set]].

name: Delicate Vase
notes:
Can be found [[Daily Respawns|daily]] at the [[Ribstride]] boss room and in the [[Drefia]] main dungeon, on the way to the [[Vampire Crypts]]. It can also be found in the [[Asura Palace]] and [[Lion's Rock]].
Looks the same as a [[Carafe of Water Binding]].

name: Demon Backpack
notes:
Commonly traded to free account players or those who havenâ€™t completed enough missions to purchase it from NPCs. 
Up to three of these backpacks can also be obtained during the [[Rise of Devovorga]] event.

See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Demon Infant
notes:
Depends on mood it has different description.
With tears: {{Message|type=look|The little demon is awake.}} [[File:Demon Infant (Tears).gif]]
With smile and closed eyes: {{Message|type=look|The little demon is sleeping.}} [[File:Demon Infant (Smile).gif]]
With big smile and opened eyes: {{Message|type=look|The little demon looks greedy.}} [[File:Demon Infant (Euphoric).gif]]
With hearts near face: {{Message|type=look|The little demon wants to kiss.}} [[File:Demon Infant (Kiss).gif]]
With smile and opened eyes: {{Message|type=look|The little demon is pleased.}} [[File:Demon Infant (Happy).gif]]

'''WARNING:''' If you activate it after the event ends, the little demon '''will disappear''': {{Sound|The baby returned to its mother.}} It's part of [[Demon's Lullaby]] [[World Quest]]. During this time you have to make it happy. To get one, you may talk to [[Demon Mother]].

Iz much better now!|The baby seems pleased. Return it to it's mother.}}

name: Demonic Candy Ball
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
This food has six random common effects, each with the same chance of happening:
* Increases {{Icon|Axe}}{{Icon|Club}}{{Icon|Sword}} [[melee]] skills (except for [[Fist Fighting]]) by 3 for an hour.
* Increases {{Icon|Distance}} [[distance]] skills by 3 for an hour.
* Increases {{Icon|Shielding}} [[shielding]] skills by 6 for an hour.
* Increases your {{Icon|Magic Level}} [[magic level]] by 3 for an hour.
* Increases your {{Icon|Speed}} [[speed]] by 50 levels for an hour.
* Makes you {{Icon|Invisible}} [[invisible]] for 10 minutes.
There's one possible negative effect which happens about 1% of the times you eat it:
* Makes you {{Icon|Poisoned}} [[Poisoned]], {{Icon|Cursed}} [[Cursed]], {{Icon|Dazzled}} [[Dazzled]], {{Icon|Burning}} [[Burning]], {{Icon|Freezing}} [[Freezing]] and {{Icon|Drowning}} [[Drowning]]. This effect makes you lose a total of 364 [[Hit Point]]s if you wear no equipment that modifies these damage types.
Additionally, there is an even rarer effect:
* Turns your outfit into {{Icon|Shapeshifting}} [[The Mutated Pumpkin]] and makes you irradiate {{Color Box|{{RGB Light Color|198}}}} light for a radius of 6 map fields.

Note that it is possible to stack different effects as you can eat one of this every 10 minutes.

When using a Demonic Candy Ball, [[Green Sparkles Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Sparkles Effect}} will appear on the user who will get one of the following messages: "{{Server Message|You're not exactly sure what it did, but you feel different. Tasted great though!}}" (for the common effects) or "{{Server Message|OUCH! That had somewhat undesired effects. Tasted great though!}}" (for the negative effect).

'''Necessary Ingredients:'''

* 3 [[Candy|Candies]] {{Ilink|Candy}}
* 3 [[Candy Cane]]s {{Ilink|Candy Cane}}
* 2 [[Bar of Chocolate|Bars of Chocolate]] {{Ilink|Bar of Chocolate}}
* 15 [[Gingerbreadman|Gingerbreadmen]] {{Ilink|Gingerbreadman}}
* 1 [[Flask of Demonic Blood]] {{Ilink|Flask of Demonic Blood}}

Obtainable through the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
history: This dish is one of the four winning recipes of the {{OfficialNewsArchive|1335|Gourmet Competition}} held by [[CipSoft]] in May 2010. The creator of this recipe is {{character|Hitogedgy}}.\n}}<noinclude>[[Category:Axe Fighting Booster]][[Category:Club Fighting Booster]][[Category:Distance Fighting Booster]][[Category:Magic Booster]][[Category:Shielding Booster]][[Category:Speed Booster]][[Category:Sword Fighting Booster]]</noinclu
flavortext: You're never sure what demonic candy balls will do, but they sure taste sweet and exciting.

name: Demonic Finger
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Can be used in the [[Doomforge]].

name: Demonic Skeletal Hand
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
2 are needed for the [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
20 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Reap]] and [[Powerful Reap]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
200 x need for the [[Doomforge]].

name: Demonwing Axe
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Hellgorak | Horadron | Prince Drazzak | The Source of Corruption
notes:
The 3rd strongest [[Axe Weapon|axe]] in-game after [[Umbral Master Chopper]] and [[Umbral Master Axe]] . It is still considerably rare, in spite of being dropped by [[Hellgorak]]. This axe was first looted on [[Menera]] by {{Character|Gwircel}}.\n

[[File:Demonwing.png|200px|A demonwing axe on Calmera]]

name: Depth Scutum
notes: The only shield that increases your magic level that has better defense than spellbooks. On the other hand, it does not list your available spells. Part of the [[Depth Set]].

name: Destroy Field Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
Destroys [[Fire Field|fire]], [[Poison Field|poison]] and [[Energy Field|energy]] fields, from any distance as long there's nothing blocking the path.
This rune is useful to escape from [[PK]] traps in [[PvP]] worlds and is needed in a couple of quests. Previously it could be used to loot monsters that may be under the fields layed by other monsters until the introduction of the [[Quick Looting]] mechanic, rendering this rune's usage still possible but obsolete.
\nFor the spell, see [[Destroy Field]].

name: Diapason
notes:
A [[Diapason]] can be used to tame a [[Crystal Wolf]]. Note: It has a chance of breaking when used.
If you're successful, you'll see the message: {{Sound|The smooth sound of the diapason tamed the crystal wolf.}}
[[Edala]] will give this item to [[Character]]s who plays a [[Lyre]] near her 7 times, each time being at least 24 hours (real life time) apart. Someone can only receive one Diapason per character. {{=}}{{=}}{{=}} Transcripts {{=}}{{=}}{{=}} {{Infobox Transcript|1st day:
{{Sound|}}
''Player'': hi
Edala: Ashari, ''Player''. How... nice to see a human taking interest in a beautiful art such as music.

2nd day:
{{Sound|}}
''Player'': hi
Edala: Ashari, ''Player''... that sound was.. interesting.

3rd day:
{{Sound|}}
''Player'': hi
Edala: Ashari, ''Player''. You've made some... progress playing the lyre, haven't you..? I want to believe you have.

4th day:
{{Sound|}}
''Player'': hi
Edala: ''Player''. My regular visitor. I certainly... appreciate your efforts to entertain me, but let me assure you, I'm quite comfortable up here by myself. Alone. In silence.

5th day:
{{Sound|}}
''Player'': hi
Edala: Ashari, ''Player''. I'm starting to feel a little sorry... for your lyre. Being forced to produce such noise must be a tragic fate.

6th day:
{{Sound|}}
''Player'': hi
Edala: ''Player''! You're driving me insane! I beg you, take your lyre away from this sacred and peaceful place.

7th day:
{{Sound|}}
''Player'': hi
Edala: AAAARGH! ''Player''! My ears! I'd prefer listening to drunken dwarves rambling all day to the sound of your lyre! Please, at least get it tuned. Here, you can have this elvish '''diapason'''.}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Dirty Turban
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blue Djinn | Crypt Defiler | Grave Robber | Green Djinn | Nomad (Basic) | Nomad (Blue) | Nomad (Female)
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Disgusting Trophy
notes: A rare find but appreciated by collectors.\n[[File:Show.jpg|thumb|250px|Disgusting Trophy Looted by Pestilent Duck at Candia]]

name: Disintegrate Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
Destroys movable objects.
Very useful, try to have some in your [[backpack]] if you are in a [[PvP]] world because it may help save you from a [[Player Killer|PK]] trap. You need to stand next to the item(s) you want to disintegrate. It will disintegrate up to 500 movable items (it will not disintegrate any dead human body, but it will disintegrate monster bodies). It does not count as an aggressive action, and therefore works in [[Protection Zone]]s and does not prevent the player from entering them.

name: Divine Plate
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Undead Dragon | Zanakeph
notes: Only obtainable since [[Updates/8.4|Christmas Update 2008]]. It gives 10% death protection, but increases damage taken from holy by 10%. It is only available for [[Paladins]].
history:
First implemented on the [[Updates/8.2|Summer Update 2008]], but it was impossible to get. Since [[Updates/8.4|Christmas Update 2008]] it is dropped by [[Ferumbras]] and [[Undead Dragon]]s, first to be discovered of {{character|Matte cohan}} on [[Thoria]].

<gallery mode="nolines">
File:jeje.jpg|{{character|Matte cohan}} and his Divine Plate.
File:User Kruchyy Divine Plate.jpg|{{character|Kruchyy}} and his loot from Undead Dragon.
</gallery>

name: Doll (Dread)
notes:
It was the official [[FunTibia]] item. {{character|Romano The Knight}} received this item as [[FunTibia]]'s head administrator, and {{character|Geeviz}} as its creator.
{{character|Andarist}} won the doll in Masters of Fun contest, his joke was selected by users as the best one. It can be seen in [[Market Street 1]] on [[Furora]].
\n\nThis item was originally titled [[Dread Doll]] until it was the subject of a map bug in which it spawned in the [[Rain Castle|Thaian Castle]]. Because of this and its intended rarity, CipSoft changed the doll's name and description, and they were later transformed into [[Fan Doll of Queen Eloise|Fan Dolls of Queen Eloise]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Mhausheausheu! What a FAIL! Mwahaha!|Hail <character name>! You are wearing old socks!|You are so unpopular even your own shadow refuses to follow you.|Have fun with FunTibia.com!}}
flavortext: This is a magical doll that will change its shape sometime soon.

name: Downy Feather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items. It is considered quite a rare drop from Flamingos.

name: Drachaku
history: * It only became obtainable since the [[2016 Winter Update]].\n* This weapon was previously a [[Club Weapons|club]] used only by [[Knight]]s. After the release of the [[Monk Vocation Update]] it was changed into a [[Fist Fighting Weapons|fist fighting weapon]] for [[Monk]]s.\n* On [[Updates/15.12.c7d92c|October 21, 2025]] the attack value was reduced from 41 to 39.

name: Dracoyle Statue
notes: You can use a [[Small Enchanted Emerald]] on it in order to [[Dracoyle Statue (Enchanted)|enchant it]].\n\nYou will receive the achievement [[I Like it Fancy]] after enchanting a Dracoyle Statue for the first time.
flavortext: This rare treasure can be charged with an enchanted emerald.

name: Dragon Backpack
notes: It has the same weight as [[Crown Backpack]] but cheaper. See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.\nObtainable in the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Dragon Goblet
sounds: {{Sound List|I WILL PROTECT YOUR KNOWLEDGEZZZ.|FCHHH - FEEEEED ME AT TIBIAVENEZUELA.COM|I SENSE WISDOM...HUMILITY...AND...PERSEVERANCE-!!!|MAY MY ETERNAL FLAME BE YOUR SHIELD AND PATH OF SUCCESS, <player>!}}
flavortext: A goblet forged by the dragon Khax that represents all the knowledge and wisdom of TibiaVenezuela.

name: Compound Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Chopper | Crawler | Fleshslicer | Hive Overseer | Insectoid Worker | Kollos | Maw | Mindmasher | Rotspit | Shadowstalker | Spidris | Spidris Elite | Spitter | Swarmer | The Hungerer | The Mean Masher | Waspoid
sellto: Malunga, Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir

name: Compromising Letter
notes: Looks the same as a [[Stamped Letter]], an [[Envelope from the Wizards]], a [[Letter to Chantalle]], a [[Letter to Eremo]], a [[Letter to Markwin]] and a [[Secret Letter]].Temporarily obtained in [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].
flavortext: The letter from Carlin proves that Arnold is a born Bonecrusher.

name: Copper Prison Key
notes: Low chance to obtain it from an [[Unrealized Dream]]. Allows access to [[Horadron]] for 1 player. To use it, go to [[Roshamuul Prison]] and use it while standing on the respective platform.
flavortext: You dreamt that this key unlocks the prison of a powerful horror that you had to face on your own.

name: Council Certificate
Crate Full of Coral
notes: After about 24 hours it turns into a regular [[Crate]]. it looks the same as a [[Crate]], a [[Crate (Usable)]], an [[Old Crate]], a [[Crate (Wine)]], a [[Crate (Swapped)]], a [[Crate (Jimmy)]], a [[Machine Crate]] and a [[Weapons Crate]].\nMultiple are temporarily obtained during the [[Liquid Black Quest]].
flavortext: This crate is full of fossilised coral. It needs to be obstructed in time or it will corrode.

name: Crawler Head Plating
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
sellto: Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir
notes: 15 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Cloud Fabric]] and [[Powerful Cloud Fabric]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Intricate Cloud Fabric, Powerful Cloud Fabric

name: Crimson Sword (Uzgod)
notes: Part of [[The Travelling Trader Quest]].
flavortext: Its blade is very notchy.

notes: See also [[Umbral Creation]].

notes: One of the [[Umbral Items]]. See also [[Umbral Creation]].

notes:
It spawns in [[Drefia]]'s [[Vampire Crypts]].
It looks the same as a [[Formula for a Memory Potion]].

name: Crystal Backpack
Crystal Crossbow
droppedby: Abyssador | Branchy Crawler | Cave Chimera | Cliff Strider | Crazed Summer Rearguard | Deathstrike | Deep Terror | Freakish Lost Soul | Gnomevil | Gorerilla | Guard Captain Quaid | Mould Phantom | Naga Archer | Orewalker | Sulphur Spouter | Vok the Freakish

name: Crystal Lamp
notes: When turned on it becomes a [[Lit Crystal Lamp]].

name: Crystal Rubbish
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Frazzlemaw | Guzzlemaw | Memory of a Frazzlemaw
notes: It is obtained by breaking a [[Crystal Table]], as loot or found around Tibia.

name: Crystalline Arrow
droppedby: Cave Devourer | Crystalcrusher | Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Enraged Crystal Golem | Magma Crawler | Melting Frozen Horror | Stone Devourer | Wiggler
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes:
They are a good replacement for [[Assassin Stars]], since they cost 20 gp per shot, compared to 33 gp for [[Assassin Stars]] on average. You will also miss less often, and you'll have the extra attack value and extended range of your bow. The only drawback being that you cannot use a [[Shields|shield]].
It looks the same as a [[Crystalline Arrow Earth]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Energy]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Fire]] and a [[Crystalline Arrow Ice]].\n15 of them can be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.

name: Crystalline Axe
notes: It is a cheap [[Zero-Attack Weapon]] for characters up to level 70.
flavortext: Even in the light of day, the stars seem to reflect in each facet of this crystalline axe.

name: Crystalline Spikes
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Armadile | Crystalcrusher | Enraged Crystal Golem | Ironblight | Stone Devourer
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Crystalline Sword
droppedby: Abyssador | Anomaly | Brachiodemon | Branchy Crawler | Cliff Strider | Deathstrike | Gnomevil | Harpy | Melting Frozen Horror | Outburst | The Last Lore Keeper
notes: Rarely obtained from [[Mucus Plug]]s.

name: Cure Poison Rune (Item)
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
Cures the target from [[Poisoned|Poison]].
This rune is not used much after level 10 as any vocation can use the [[Cure Poison]] spell instead.
This could be useful to have one to heal you when you get poisoned and you don't have [[Mana]] for the [[Cure Poison]] spell.
Once were able to buy this rune in [[Rookgaard]] from [[Lily]]. But since the update they have removed the item instead a player can buy an [[Antidote Potion]] from her.
Some characters still have the rune in [[Rookgaard]] making it a collectors item.
For the spell, see [[Cure Poison Rune]].

name: Cyan Crystal Fragment
droppedby: Blemished Spawn | Brain Squid | Breach Brood | Burster | Cave Devourer | Cliff Strider | Cobra Vizier | Crazed Winter Rearguard | Crypt Warden | Dread Intruder | Enraged Crystal Golem | Faceless Bane | Feral Sphinx | Feversleep | Girtablilu Warrior | Hellhunter Inferniarch | Infernal Demon | Instable Breach Brood | Instable Sparkion | Jungle Moa | Juvenile Bashmu | Lavafungus | Lucifuga Aranea | Makara | Mantosaurus | Mazoran | Nighthunter | Ogre Ruffian | Omrafir | Orewalker | Pirat Mate | Plagirath | Prince Drazzak | Ragiaz | Sparkion | Stabilizing Dread Intruder | Stone Devourer | Terrorsleep | Tremor Worm | Varnished Diremaw | Venerable Girtablilu | White Lion

name: Damselfly Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Damselfly Wing
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 15 of them are needed for the [[Basic Swiftness]], [[Intricate Swiftness]] and [[Powerful Swiftness]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Swiftness, Intricate Swiftness, Powerful Swiftness

name: Dead Weight
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Its only purpose is to be sold to NPCs. It has a high gold-to-oz ratio.

name: Deathstrike's Snippet
notes: A creature product which can be given to [[Gnomission]] by saying ''hero''. Once handed in you will no longer need a [[Red Teleport Crystal]] to enter the [[Warzone 1|first warzone]], meaning you can hunt there but cannot fight [[Deathstrike]] more than once in a 20 hour period.

name: Decorative Ribbon
notes:
This is the item needed to [[Dragonling (Mount)|tame]] a {{Ilink|Dragonling (Mount)}} [[Dragonling]]. It has a chance of breaking. '''Failed''':
{{Sound|The dragonling fled.}}
'''Failed''':
{{Sound|The dragonling doesn't seem too impressed with your ribbon.}}
'''Broke''':
''Missing message'' '''Succeeded''':
{{Sound|The wild dragonling has accepted you as its master.}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Deepling Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Deepling Breaktime Snack
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
sellto: Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
sellto: Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Elite | Deepling Master Librarian | Deepling Spellsinger | Deepling Warrior | Neutral Deepling Warrior
notes: One Deepling filet will regenerate you for 180 seconds.

name: Deepling Guard Belt Buckle
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
sellto: Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir, Irmana
flavortext: A belt buckle snatched from a deepling guard.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Elite | Deepling Warrior | Neutral Deepling Warrior
sellto: Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir, Malunga

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes: None.

name: Deepling Squelcher
notes: The stats for this weapon are hugely disproportionate considering its requirements. It is the strongest weapon available for players with level 48 or above, even superior (or equal) to two-handed weapons of its level across all melee weapon types.\n\nPart of the [[Deepling Set]].

name: Deepling Staff
notes: Very little is currently known about this [[Weapon]]. Part of the [[Deepling Set]].

name: Deepling Warts
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Elite | Deepling Warrior | Neutral Deepling Warrior
sellto: Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir

name: Deeptags
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Elite | Deepling Warrior | Neutral Deepling Warrior
sellto: Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir
flavortext: The identity of some deepling is written there.

name: Delany's Golden Bug Trophy
notes: Could be obtained rarely during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]] by using [[Delany (Creature)|Delany's]] [[corpse]]. Looks like a scaled version of [[The Famous Golden Bug]].
flavortext: It was awarded during the festivities of Tibia's 15th anniversary.

name: Depth Calcei
notes: Part of the [[Depth Set]].
history: These shoes are no longer able to be imbued with the "Swiftness" imbuement as of {{OfficialNewsArchive|4974|March 12, 2019}}. Prior to that date this imbuement was possible.

name: Depth Galea
notes:
The Depth Galea is used to dive [[underwater]]. Wearing it is required to be able to go underwater, but once there the helmet can be removed. However, without it players will take 5 times 20 [[Drowning]] damage kicking in after four seconds of standing still. It is useful out of the depths, too: some monsters, like [[Water Elemental]]s, use drowning damage attacks.
Part of the [[Depth Set]]. Functions as a lightweight, higher armored [[Helmet of the Deep]].
flavortext: Enables underwater exploration.

name: Depth Lorica
notes: Part of the [[Depth Set]].

name: Depth Ocrea
notes: Part of the [[Depth Set]]. These are, together with [[Porcelain Mask]], [[Witch Hat]] and [[Starlight Vial]], one of the equipment with permanent protection against [[Mana Drain]].

name: Dog Collar
notes: You can get this item from [[King Tibianus]] during the [[Noodles is Gone Mini World Change]].
flavortext: It belongs to Noodles, the King's dog.

name: Doll of Durin The Almighty
notes:
It's the official [[TibiaBariloche]] item. This item was created by {{character|Geeviz}}.
When you use a doll of Durin the Almighty, it may say one of the sounds above and starts to move like this: [[File:Durin the Almighty Doll (Animated).gif|Animated doll of Durin the Almighty]] Its replica is the [[Doll of Durin The Almighty (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|My powers are limitless!|Hail Tibia Bariloche!}}
flavortext: The mightiest. The only. God of all dwarfs. Awarded by Tibia Bariloche.

name: Dowser
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dazed Leaf Golem | Leaf Golem | Wilting Leaf Golem
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Dragon Eye
notes:
This is [[Tibia-Market]]'s official item. Since [[Tibia-Market]] ceased to be a supported fansite, this item is now unobtainable. It was created by {{Character|Mondlanze}}.

Its replica is the [[Dragon Eye (Replica)]].
flavortext: It belonged to the first dragon to roam the world and was adorned with Tibia-Market's purest gold.

name: Collar of Blue Plasma
droppedby: Ahau | Alptramun | Anomaly | Bashmu | Brain Squid | Breach Brood | Burster | Capricious Phantom | Count Vlarkorth | Crazed Summer Rearguard | Dread Intruder | Dreadful Disruptor | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Eradicator | Hazardous Phantom | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Lloyd | Lord Azaram | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Mould Phantom | Outburst | Paladin's Apparition | Plagueroot | Poisonous Carnisylvan | Reality Reaver | Realityquake | Rupture | Sir Baeloc | Sparkion | The Nightmare Beast | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Unarmored Voidborn | World Devourer
notes: Similar to rings, and different from most amulets, this collar can be equipped/unequipped in smart mode using an action button of the action bars. It can be sold for the full price to the NPC even if used, as long as it does not disappear when used completely.
notes2: Can also look like: [[File:Collar of Blue Plasma (Activated).gif]]

name: Collar of Green Plasma
droppedby: Ahau | Alptramun | Anomaly | Arachnophobica | Brain Squid | Breach Brood | Burster | Count Vlarkorth | Dread Intruder | Dreadful Disruptor | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Eradicator | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Lord Azaram | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Outburst | Plagueroot | Reality Reaver | Realityquake | Rupture | Sir Baeloc | Soul-Broken Harbinger | Sparkion | The Nightmare Beast | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Unarmored Voidborn | World Devourer | Rhindeer
notes: Increases your [[Mana]] and [[Hitpoints]] [[Regeneration]] for 30 minutes by the rate of 2 [[HP]] and 8 [[Mana|MP]] per 6 seconds, which means it recover 2400 [[Mana|MP]] and 600 [[HP]] in total. Similar to rings, and different from most amulets, this collar can be equipped/unequipped in smart mode using an action button of the action bars. It can be sold for the full price to the NPC even if used, as long as it does not disappear when used completely.
notes2:
Can also look like:
[[File:Collar of Green Plasma (Activated).gif]]\n}}\n[[Category:Regenerative Items]]

name: Collar of Red Plasma
attrib: sword fighting +4, club fighting +4, axe fighting +4

notes: Similar to rings, and different from most amulets, this collar can be equipped/unequipped in smart mode using an action button of the action bars. It can be sold for the full price to the NPC even if used, as long as it does not disappear when used completely.
notes2:
Can also look like:
[[File:Collar of Red Plasma (Activated).gif]]

name: Complete Opticording Sphere
