It can be obtained by using a [[Broken Opticording Sphere]] in an [[Opticording Sphere]].
It looks the same as an [[Opticording Sphere]].\nObtained in the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
flavortext: This strange box holds a dark sphere. The sphere has been adjusted and its key mechanism aligned and is complete.

name: Condensed Energy
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Control Unit
notes:
The [[Control Unit]] can be used to tame a [[Walker]]. Note: It has a chance of breaking when used.
It can be obtained from opening a [[Glooth Bag]].
{{Seealso|Glooth Bag/Statistics}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Copper Token
notes: It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Cowbell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Minotaur Amazon | Minotaur Cult Follower | Minotaur Cult Prophet
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Crackling Egg
notes: Use this item to receive the [[Neon Sparkid]] mount. {{Ilink|Neon Sparkid}}\n\n{{Sound|You receive the permission to ride the neon sparkid.}}
flavortext: It is of unnerving, greenish colour and pulses steadily. It seems that something is moving inside.

name: Crest of the Deep Seas
notes: Despite the name's connection to the sea, it does '''not''' act as a diving helmet. On the [[Test Server]] of 10.7 it was proposed by several testers that this helmet allow diving underwater, since its name implies a connection to the sea and the stats were very poor at the time. Instead, CipSoft added [[Ice Resistant|Ice Resistance]] and a [[Speed]] boost to it. Can be used as part of the [[Speed Set]].

name: Crimson Crest Mushroom
notes: Used in the [[Oramond_Quest/Spoiler#The_Mutated_Glooth_Plague|Oramond Quest - Mutated Glooth Plague]].

name: Crimson Rose
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It's an item to celebrate [[Valentine's Day]].

name: Crossbow of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Carving (Charged)}} [[Crossbow of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Crossbow of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Crossbow of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and hit modifier values were adjusted to the to values of its overcharged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Crossbow of Carving, Crossbow of Mayhem and Crossbow of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Crossbow of Destruction}} [[Crossbow of Destruction]].

name: Crossbow of Carving (Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Crossbow of Carving]] charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 20% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Crossbow of Carving (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Crossbow of Carving]] heavily charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Crossbow of Carving (Overcharged)
notes: This item is a [[Crossbow of Carving]] overcharged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Crossbow of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Crossbow of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Crossbow of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Crossbow of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and hit modifier values were adjusted to the to values of its overcharged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Crossbow of Carving, Crossbow of Mayhem and Crossbow of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Crossbow of Destruction}} [[Crossbow of Destruction]].

name: Crossbow of Mayhem (Charged)
notes: This item is a charged [[Crossbow of Mayhem]], it can be charged by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 15% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 20% to 30%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Crossbow of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a heavily charged [[Crossbow of Mayhem]], charged by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 20% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 25% to 50%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Crossbow of Mayhem (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an overcharged [[Crossbow of Mayhem]], charged by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s. It is possible to fail overcharging, in this case you will loose your 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 25% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 30% to 75%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Crossbow of Remedy
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Remedy (Charged)}} [[Crossbow of Remedy (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Remedy (Heavily Charged)}} [[Crossbow of Remedy (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Crossbow of Remedy (Overcharged)}} [[Crossbow of Remedy (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and hit modifier values were adjusted to the to values of its overcharged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Crossbow of Carving, Crossbow of Mayhem and Crossbow of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Crossbow of Destruction}} [[Crossbow of Destruction]].

name: Crossbow of Remedy (Charged)
notes: This item is a charged [[Crossbow of Remedy]], charged by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Crossbow of Remedy (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a heavily charged [[Crossbow of Remedy]], charged by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Crude Horn of Bone
notes: It can be obtained from a [[Large Pile of Various Bones]] and will expire after 24 hours.\n\nCan be used with a [[Mouthpiece for a Horn]] to create a [[Crude Horn with Mouthpiece]] in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
history: They did not expire prior to the [[2016 Winter Update]]. On [[Updates/12.51.10215|September, 2020]], they started to expire even if they were inside the depot and the owner away from it or offline.
flavortext: This horn makes a strange noise when blowing it.

name: Crude Horn with Mouthpiece
notes:
These will expire after 24 hours.
Made by combing a [[Mouthpiece for a Horn]] with a [[Crude Horn of Bone]]. It is used in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
history: They did not expire prior to the [[2016 Winter Update]]. On [[Updates/12.51.10215|September, 2020]], they started to expire even if they were inside the depot and the owner away from it or offline.
flavortext: This horn actually sounds like a horn when blowing it - a very loud and distorted horn.

name: Crude Umbral Chopper
notes: See also [[Umbral Creation]].

name: Crude Umbral Slayer
notes: See also [[Umbral Creation]].

name: Crumpled Paper
notes: It looks the same as an [[Incantation Fragment]] and a [[Torn Incantation Fragment]].\nObtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext:
A crumpled notice showing a recipe.
Recipe for .. ck.. soup
br... (herbs)
celery
...
chick... (dead)
Use one knife pinch of...
Stir....
Boil for... minutes, then
Add... for ... taste
.

name: Crystal Bone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Crystal Table Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Crystal Table}} [[Crystal Table]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a crystal table.

name: Crystallized Anger
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Breach Brood | Burster | Lokathmor | Realityquake | The Source of Corruption | World Devourer
notes: 15 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Vibrancy]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Cup of Cowcoa
notes: It will corrode in '''3 minutes''', upon which you will receive the message: {{Sound|The acrid cowcoa has actually corroded its way out of the vessel.}}
flavortext: This substance is extremely acrid, that vessel won't hold it for long.
notes2: Temporarily obtained and used in the [[Oramond_Quest/Spoiler#Sabotage|Oramond Quest - Sabotage]]. Obtain it by using the [[Nozzle for Cowcoa]].

name: Curious Matter
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Anomaly | Breach Brood | Burster | Gorzindel | The Sinister Hermit (Blue) | The Souldespoiler

name: Cursed Gold
notes:
Looks a bit like a [[Christmas Token]].
\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]].
flavortext: A heavy coin of ancient gold, tarnished and with an ominous feel to it.

name: Dangerous Proto Matter
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Dark Wizard's Crown
notes:
It's [[TibiaMisterios]]' fansite item. If you ''use'' it, it will turn into a [[Dark Wizard's Crown (Activated)]] and look like this: {{Ilink|Dark Wizard's Crown (Activated)}}. The creator of the Dark Wizard's Crown is {{Character|Lupus Aurelius}}.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Thomax}} ([[Havera]])
* {{Character|Mage Korz}} ([[Dibra]])
* {{Character|Zarty Stark}} ([[Thyria]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Getshhh ... I can tell you all the secrets. Maybe ...|You should take a quick look over your shoulder now and then ... Getshhh ... just in case ...|Getshhh ...|Be careful ''Player'', the bearer of this crown will be cursed by the spirits of darkness! Getshhh ...|The truth? Getshhh ... Often the truth is hidden in the lies! You're dumb.}}
flavortext: It grants infinite power and knowledge to the one who wears it. Awarded by TibiaMisterios.com.br.

name: Dark Wizard's Crown (Activated)
notes: This is an activated [[Dark Wizard's Crown]]. It will turn back into its regular state after a short moment.
flavortext: It grants infinite power and knowledge to the one who wears it. Awarded by TibiaMisterios.com.br.

name: Dead Holy Bog Frog
notes: It looks the same as a [[Dead Frog]] and a [[Dead Frog (Item)]].\n\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: To the goblins, it's a delicacy and a holy meal that gives supergoblin strength.

name: Dead Rat (Oramond)
notes: Looks like the first stage of a [[Dead Rat]]. Temporarily obtained and used in the [[Glooth Factory Quest#Glooth Bandits|Glooth Factory Quest - Glooth Bandits]].

name: Decoration Kit
notes: They are similar to [[Furniture Kit]]s, but they have the limitations of items bought from the [[Store]] (i.e. they cannot be traded or given to other players). As of {{OfficialNewsArchive|7481|August 8th, 2023}} decoration kits now appear as the item in which it represents.
flavortext: You bought this item in the Store or gained it as a daily reward. This item cannot be traded.

name: Delicate Pan
notes: Given to you by the [[Dream Butterfly]].\nUsed and temporarily obtained in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: Thin and translucent, this pan is of an unearthly beauty, slowly melting.

name: Demonic Tapestry
notes: It's a very rare [[Tapestries|tapestry]], only dropped by some [[Roshamuul Prison]] bosses. It's one of the few tapestries that are animated. The [[Psychedelic Tapestry]] is its counterpart.

name: Devourer Core
notes: Upon using this item, your cooldown for entering [[World Devourer]] chamber will be reset allowing you to face the boss one more time without having to wait any longer. Additionally, it will become a [[Burnt Out Devourer Core]]. It's a rare loot from [[World Devourer]].
flavortext: The core of the devourer has the power to provide you with a powerful charge that allows you to challenge him again immediately

name: Dinky Moss Floret
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
[[Use]] a [[Dinky Moss Floret (Object)]] to obtain it. Use one of these on another to create [[Interwoven Moss Florets]].
Its sprite seems to be a superposition of an [[Orange Star]] and [[Moon Flowers]]. Part of the [[Glooth Factory Quest]].

name: Dinky Moss Floret Garland
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Created by using a [[Dinky Moss Floret]] on [[Interwoven Moss Florets]]. Part of the [[Glooth Factory Quest]].

name: Doll of Durin The Almighty (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s with [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of a [[Doll of Durin The Almighty]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Dragon Egg Shells
notes:
Parts of broken [[Dragon]] eggs.Part of the [[Krailos Quest]]. Can be obtained by using:
[[File:Obtaining Dragon Egg Shells.gif]]
flavortext: They are light grey with small blue spots.

name: Dragon Eye (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of a [[Dragon Eye]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Colourful Feathers
notes: It is related to an outfit quest introduced to celebrate [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]].\n\nYou can obtain 3 every day when the [[First Dragon Quest]] is active. 50 are needed for the [[Festive Outfits Quest]].

name: Colourful Fireworks Rocket
notes: Using an [[Obsidian Knife]] on a firework allows you to disassemble the [[Fireworks|Colourful Fireworks Rockets]] into its respective components: [[Versicolour Fireworks Powder]] and the [[Fireworks Capsule]]. \n\nYou can create one by using {{Ilink|Versicolour Fireworks Powder}} [[Versicolour Fireworks Powder]] on a {{Ilink|Fireworks Capsule}} [[Fireworks Capsule]].
flavortext: It can be disassembled with the right tool.

name: Colourful Mushroom
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: It smells of liquorice, raspberries, pepper and fish.

name: Colourful Snail Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Consecrated Beef
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It restores 30% of the character's maximum [[Mana]] when used. After consuming one, you have to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish. \n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold.
flavortext: Tasty beef with an aromatic sauce and parsley potatoes.

name: Cool Gloothy Mixture
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[Oramond_Quest#Dr._Merlay's_Misery|Oramond Quest - Dr. Merlay's Misery]] by using the [[Glooth Potion]] on the [[Soothe Bloom]].
flavortext: It feels cool and oily.

name: Coral Brooch
droppedby: Adult Goanna | Broken Shaper | Goshnar's Cruelty | Goshnar's Hatred | Mantosaurus | Memory of a Werelion | Mercurial Menace | Ripper Spectre | Swan Maiden | Two-Headed Turtle | Usurper Archer | Utua Stone Sting | Werelion
sellto: Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes:
You can get a coral brooch from the [[Seashell (Large)]] located at the Single Crab's Island which you can reach by shipwrecking with captain [[Charles]].
\nYou can dig coral brooches at [[Vigintia#Treasure Hunting|Vigintia's Treasure Hunting Zone]].

name: Costume Bag (Retro)
flavortext: It looks rather old.

name: Cow Bell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Cracked Alabaster Vase
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Broken Shaper | Shaper Matriarch | Twisted Shaper

name: Crimson Doll (Replica)
notes: This item is a replica of [[Cateroide's Doll]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Crimson Nightshade Blossoms
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.

name: Crossbow of Destruction
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history: This weapon was created as the result of the unification of the [[Crossbow of Carving]], [[Crossbow of Remedy]] and [[Crossbow of Mayhem]].\n\nOn [[Updates/12.08.7995|February 5, 2019]], the level requirement for this weapon was raised from 100 to 200.

name: Crossbow of Remedy (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an overcharged [[Crossbow of Remedy]], charged by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s. It is possible to fail overcharging, in this case you will loose your 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 35% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Crossbow of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Crude Primitive Printout
notes:
It looks the same as [[Narsai's List]], [[Rita's Letter]], a [[Ransom Note]], a [[Sheet of Paper]], a [[Sheet of Tracing Paper (Full)]], [[Shimun's List]], [[Tefrit's List]], a [[Torn Out Page]] and [[Yonan's List]].
\n\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Oramond_Quest/Spoiler#Probing|Oramond Quest - Probing]] task.
flavortext: This printout is nearly unreadable. One column of numbers on it is followed by the word: Doubleday.

name: Crude Wood Planks
droppedby: The Duke of the Depths | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla
notes: Item needed to get addon 1 of [[Makeshift Warrior Outfits]].
flavortext: They look like you could use them to enhance some kind of makeshift armour.

name: Crunor Idol
sellto: Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes: It can be obtained from the Green Charge chest next to [[Andrew Lyze]].

name: Crunor's Heart
notes:
It's the official [[TibiaBosses]] item. The idea came from {{Character|Licad}} and was later on created in a cooperation of {{Character|Makadamia}} and {{Character|Lupus Aurelius}}.
When you use Crunor's heart, it looks like this for a few seconds: [[File:Crunor's Heart 2.gif]] This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were: * {{Character|Shi En}} ([[Gentebra]]) * {{Character|King Dominius}} ([[Lutabra]]) * {{Character|True Bloody Archero}} ([[Mykera]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Your pure heart pleases me.|Hail TibiaBosses!|Strive to purity!|*thump, thump*}}
flavortext: It was frozen deep in the caverns of Folda. A certain warmth and pulse emit from inside. Awarded by TibiaBosses.com.

name: Cryana
notes: In its original state, it is crying. After being used, it turns into a happy look [[File:Cryana 2.gif]] for 1 hour.\nIt is a possible reward of the [[Demon's Lullaby]] event.

name: Crystalline Arrow Earth
notes:
This item was never obtainable.
\nIt looked the same as a [[Crystalline Arrow]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Energy]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Fire]] and a [[Crystalline Arrow Ice]].
history: This item was removed from the game with [[Updates/11.00#11.81.7107|Update 11.81]].

name: Crystalline Arrow Energy
notes:
This item was never obtainable.
\nIt looked the same as a [[Crystalline Arrow]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Earth]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Fire]] and a [[Crystalline Arrow Ice]].
history: This item was removed from the game with [[Updates/11.00#11.81.7107|Update 11.81]].

name: Crystalline Arrow Fire
notes:
This item was never obtainable.
\nIt looked the same as a [[Crystalline Arrow]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Earth]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Energy]] and a [[Crystalline Arrow Ice]].
history: This item was removed from the game with [[Updates/11.00#11.81.7107|Update 11.81]].

name: Crystalline Arrow Ice
notes:
This item was never obtainable.
\nIt looked the same as a [[Crystalline Arrow]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Earth]], a [[Crystalline Arrow Energy]] and a [[Crystalline Arrow Fire]].
history: This item was removed from the game with [[Updates/11.00#11.81.7107|Update 11.81]].

name: Damaged Armor Plates
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Falcon Knight | Falcon Paladin | Grand Canon Dominus | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Grand Commander Soeren

name: Damaged Worm Head
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: One of the heads of the Duke of the Depths.

name: Dandelion Seeds
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Dark Bell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Dark Moon Mirror
notes: There is also a [[Lit Moon Mirror|lit version]] of this item: {{Ilink|Lit Moon Mirror}}.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Dark Sun Catcher
notes: There is also a [[Shining Sun Catcher|shining version]] of this item: {{Ilink|Shining Sun Catcher}}.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Dark Whispers
notes: This helmet can be imbued with [[Basic Epiphany]] ([[Magic Level]] bonus), but not with [[Intricate Epiphany|Intricate]] or [[Powerful Epiphany]].

name: Decorative Blue Sheet
notes: It exists in [[Decorative Red Sheet|red]] and [[Decorative Green Sheet|green]] form as well. It is one of the needed items to obtain the [[Blue Rolling Barrel]] mount.
flavortext: A traditional Orcsoberfest sheet to decorate large beer barrels during the traditional tapping ceremony.

name: Decorative Green Sheet
notes: It exists in [[Decorative Red Sheet|red]] and [[Decorative Blue Sheet|blue]] form as well. It is one of the needed items to obtain the [[Green Rolling Barrel]] mount.
flavortext: A traditional Orcsoberfest sheet to decorate large beer barrels during the traditional tapping ceremony.

name: Decorative Red Sheet
notes: It exists in [[Decorative Green Sheet|green]] and [[Decorative Blue Sheet|blue]] form as well. It is one of the needed items to obtain the [[Red Rolling Barrel]] mount.
flavortext: A traditional Orcsoberfest sheet to decorate large beer barrels during the traditional tapping ceremony.

name: Deepling Ceremonial Dagger
notes: Among the most powerful weapons available for a sub-200 mage, comparable to the [[Energized Limb]] (which does higher damage but has shorter range). Both [[Druid]]s and [[sorcerer]]s can use this weapon and (alongside it's upgrade, the [[Deepling Fork]]).\n\nIt is impossible to imbue this item with critical hit imbuements.

name: Deepling Fork
notes: An upgrade of sorts from the [[Deepling Ceremonial Dagger]]. It's one of the few weapons that come with a Critical hit chance out of the box (It's also impossible to imbue it with additional critical hit chance).
history: * On {{OfficialNewsArchive|8436|July 21, 2025}}, the [[Summer Update 2025]] nerfed some of its attributes with the introduction of [[Weapon Proficiency]].

name: Deepworm Jaws
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Deepworm Spike Roots
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Deepworm Spikes
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Delicatessen Salad
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It grants +3 on all [[Melee]] skills for one hour when eaten. After consuming one, you have to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish. \n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold. \n}}<noinclude>[[Category:Axe Fighting Booster]][[Category:Club Fighting Booster]][[Category:Sword Fighting Booster]]</noinclu
flavortext: A true gourmet salad with some very tasty but also not very healthy ingredients.

name: Diamond Arrow
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes: Diamond arrows damage an area of 21 fields centred on the target (2 fields of radius), just like old [[Fireball Rune]] (before update in 2007). Since target will always be within the damage area, you will hit it even when you miss it. [[Blue Electricity Effect]]s {{Ilink|Blue Electricity Effect}} appears on the damage area.\n\nDiamond Arrows are not affected by Bows [[Imbuing|imbued]] with Elemental Damage such as [[Powerful Frost]]. The damage they deal is always [[Physical Damage]].
history: Before [[Updates/12.55|Vocation Adjustments Update]], [[Paladins|Royal Paladins]] could make 100 of them by casting the [[Conjure Diamond Arrow]] [[spell]]. Diamond Arrows used to expire 60 minutes after they were made.\nThe price was changed from 100 to 130 since [[Summer Update 2024]].
notes2: {{Scene|spell=2sqmballtarget|effect=Blue Electricity Effect|effect_on_target=Blue Electricity Effect|missile=Diamond Arrow Missile|missile_direction=south-east|missile_distance=2/2}}

name: Diremaw Brainpan
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Diremaw Legs
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Document (Rewriteable)
notes:
This is the rewriteable version of [[Document]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.
flavortext: It is rewriteable.

name: Doll (Blond)
notes: This item was implemented with [[Updates/7.92|Update 7.92]], suggesting that it was related to [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]]. However, nobody got it from [[Surprise Bag]]s nor from the special [[Thais Raids#Historic: Primitive raid|Primitive]] and [[Darashia Raids#Demonic Creatures on Darashia (Deprecated)|Demonic Raids]]. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Dracoyle Statue (Enchanted)
notes: You must use a [[Small Enchanted Emerald]] on an inactive [[Dracoyle Statue]] in order to enchant it. The enchantment will last for 8 days. After that you will have to recharge the statue once again to get it glowing.\n\nYou will receive the achievement [[I Like it Fancy]] after enchanting a [[Dracoyle Statue]] for the first time.
flavortext: This rare treasure is said to protect its owner from misery and curses.

name: Daedal Chisel
notes:
Can be used to break urns during the [[Ahau]] boss fight to make the fight easier.
\nPart of the [[Adventures of Galthen Quest]].
flavortext: A richly ornamented chisel with crude but complex symbols and signs. The intense workmanship this ancient tool underwent made it brittle and fragile. Used in an Iks ritual to destroy urns.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Dark Obsidian Splinter
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Darklight Construct | Darklight Source | Darklight Striker

name: Dark Oracle
notes:
It's [[TibiaVIP]]' fansite item. It was created by {{Character|Lupus Aurelius}}.

It has also other stages that appear when interacted with:

[[File:Dark Oracle 2.gif]]

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Shinigami Reis}} ([[Reinobra]])
* {{Character|Kbralz}} ([[Descubra]])
* {{Character|Gilega}} ([[Gentebra]])
sounds: {{Sound List|<Player>, you have to... DIE!|<Player>, you have to... KILL!|<Player>, you have to... LIVE!|<Player>, you have to... LOSE!|<Player>, you have to... WIN!}}
flavortext: Rumours say that someone took the skull of Goshnar from his grave to create this scary magical device. Awarded by TibiaVip.app.

name: Darklight Basalt Chunk
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Darklight Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It is one of the materials required to perform a [[Crimson Offering]] and craft items of the [[Sanguine Set]].\n\nCan be dropped by anyone contributing to the kill of the monsters in the [[Rotten Blood Quest]] areas, but only if they have at least one [[Bakragore's Taint]]. It will be dropped through the [[Reward Container]] system.

name: Darklight Obsidian Axe
notes: This item can be used on stone pillars to speed up access to [[Chagorz]] in [[Gloom Pillars]] by 3 charges (60 seconds) during the [[Rotten Blood Quest]]. It disappears after a few minutes if not used.
flavortext: A rare variant of obsidian that originates from highly compressed darklight matter.

name: Dawnfire Pantaloons
notes: It's part of the [[Naga Set]].

name: Dawnfire Sherwani
notes: It's part of the [[Naga Set]].

name: Dazzling Fireworks Rocket
notes:
When using this item, [[Fireworks Effect (Star)]] {{Ilink|Fireworks Effect (Star)}} will appear over a large radius.
It can be obtained by using [[Special Fx Box]].\n\n{{Seealso|Special Fx Box/Statistics}}

name: Dead Frog (Item)
notes: Looks like the first stage of a [[Dead Frog]].\n\nThis item was implemented to replace the regular [[Dead Frog]] corpse in [[Dark Apprentice]]s loot and allow it to be treated as other items by features such as the [[Quick Looting]].

name: Dead Minotaur (Item)
notes: Looks the same as a recently slain [[minotaur]], but it does not disappear, making it a fine decoration for [[Halloween]]. You cannot equip this item on your backpack slot.

name: Dead Snake (Item)
notes: Looks like the first stage of a [[Dead Snake]].

name: Death Amplification
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your targets sensitivity to your [[Death Damage]] attacks by 8% for one hour. It only affects attacks against monsters.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily amplifies death damage against monsters.

name: Death Knell
notes: Part of the [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].
flavortext: It is made of silver and engraved with a skull.

name: Death Resilience
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your [[Death Damage]] protection by 8% for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases death protection.

It is a more limited and simpler tool to destroy gems compared to an {{ilink|Amber Crusher}} [[Amber Crusher]].

name: Crypt Spine
flavortext: Used by silent assassins of bygone aeons, once known as Deathwhisper, this bow carries the last sighs of those who fell to its arrows. One of the creations of a mysterious soul-smith.

name: Crypt Splitter

name: Crypt Strike

<noinclude><gallery hideaddbutton="true" position="center" style="text-align:center" captionalign="center" mode="nolines">
Amazon Camp Treasure Room.gif
| 1 = Dragon Scale Helmet
</gallery></noinclude>
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/11.02|Winter Update 2016]] when the boss monster that drops it was implemented.

name: Dragon Scale Legs
notes: They were the legs with the highest defense rating in [[Tibia]] until the introduction of the [[Falcon Greaves]]. These are unobtainable and thus very rare. It is shown at Tibian Exhibitions. They can also be seen in the [[Kazordoon Treasure Room]] and the [[Beregar Treasure Room]]. Part of the [[Dragon Set]].
history:
Dragon Scale Legs are one of the Tibian items that cannot be looted from a creature or obtained in a quest. They are given as a present by the [[Tibian Gods|Gods]]Â to certain players who are believed to deserve them. There are three known pairs of Dragon Scale Legs in-game.

== First Pair ==
Back in the day, before the present [[House|house system]], a player named Lostboy used to control the apartment system in the city of [[Thais]], by owning the keys that allowed to open and close the houses doors. His implication with the game was so high that [[Cipsoft]] decided to thank him by giving him a pair of Dragon Scale Legs, which was shown during the item exhibition held by Alliance of Free Tibians 2004.

== Second Pair ==
A second pair of Dragon Scale Legs were given to {{character|Pskonejott}} after helping the Tibia community in different ways, such as reporting several bugs.

== Third Pair ==
On July 26th, 2007, a character named {{character|Abertt}} from the world [[Titania]] was given a pair of these majestic legs for becoming the 100,000th [[Premium Account]] buyer on [[Tibia]], as well as a [[Golden Figurine]] with a special inscription. Their last owners assure that these pair are the only ones that ever existed, since they were never shown by any player before they were given to {{character|Abertt}}, and they have never been seeing in multiple game worlds at the same time.

== Other possible pairs ==
*Some people say that a pair is also on [[Antica]]. '''Sir Dan''' once owned a pair of these in Antica, but was killed on the second floor of the Thais Paladin guild. This was when if you died in game you dropped all you had equipped, instead of letting his assailants get the legs, he threw them in the trash.
*They could be seen in '''Imperador Rush''''s house on Shanera. The amount of gold he offered for it was so high that the trade couldn't be concluded by the normal "trade with" system, due to the limitation in the number of items that can be traded (200 slots full of crystal coins weren't enough). So both parties settled on a price in US Dollars and they concluded the deal.

<gallery>
DSL.png
Dragon Scale Legs final.png
Dsl.jpg
Lord Warez Rares2.png|One pair of Dragon Scale Legs was transferred to Optional PvP and could be see on [[Pacera]].
</gallery>

These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].

\n'''Note:''' You need to use it to be able to get a new one, which means if you lose it you won't get another one.

[[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]]. Daily spawn at various places; like watch tower before [[Orc Fortress]] or several places in caves of Edron Orcs, also in [[Chondur]]'s hut on [[Meriana]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Swarmer Drum]] and a [[Swarmer Drum (Vibrating)]].

name: Dwarven Armor
notes: It's a very rare armor because the item required to obtain the armor can only be looted in a specific place. This armor can block the same physical damage as [[Magic Plate Armor]] but only if you get physical hits of 119 or more, so you will have to fight stronger monsters to make this armor block as good as Magic Plate Armor. Part of the [[Dwarven Set]].\nObtainable through [[Sam's Old Backpack Quest]].

name: Dwarven Axe
notes: Part of the [[Dwarven Set]]. Obtainable through the [[Dwarf Hell Quest]] and [[Griffin Shield Quest]].

name: Dwarven Beard
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
The beard of a [[Dwarf]]. This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Fake Dwarven Beard]] and [[The Dwarven Emperor's Beard]].
flavortext: It was once worn proudly by a dwarfish warrior - or maiden.

name: Dwarven Helmet
notes: This helmet is a very rare loot from the [[Minotaurs|Minotaur]] boss [[The Horned Fox]]. Dwarven Helmet's price skyrocketed after the implementation of [[Imbuing]] with the [[Updates/11.02|Winter Update 2016]]. This helmet itself has +2% physical resistance and additional 2 imbuing slots, additionally, it has no level and vocation requirements, making it a very interesting option mostly for mages becouse of extra resistance, but remember Dwarven Helmet CANNOT be imbued with extra Magic Level like all other non mage-exclusive helmets. If you are a knight or a paladin and you don't care about imbuements, [[Zaoan Helmet]] is a better option because it gives you a higher physical protection, its only downside is that it has 1 less imbuing slot.\n\nIts rivals, [[Demon Helmet]] and [[Visage of the End Days]], will only be better options if you want 2 imbuing slots or you are not taking more than 200 physical damage per hit. However, the [[Enchanted Werewolf Helmet]]s would always protect more than a dwarven helmet, but they have level requirement (100) and no imbuing slots.

name: Dwarven Pickaxe
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Thawing Ice Pick]] and an [[Ice Pick]]. There are various spawns, for example, {{Mapper Coords|126.251|124.221|12|4|text=here}}, {{Mapper Coords|126.233|124.185|10|2|text=here}}, {{Mapper Coords|127.33|124.240|11|2|text=here}}, {{Mapper Coords|126.166|124.156|11|4|text=here}}, {{Mapper Coords|127.150|124.204|10|4|text=here}}, {{Mapper Coords|text=here|126.191|124.228|11|8|1|0.1250.125}}, {{Mapper Coords|text=here|126.171|124.205|12|4|1|0.250.25}} or {{Mapper Coords|126.223|124.253|10|4|text=here}}.
\nNote that Dwarven Pickaxes cannot be used to open [[List of Pickable Holes|Pickable Holes]].\nItem temporarily obtained in the [[Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It is a masterpiece of dwarvish smithery and made of especially hard steel.

name: Dwarven Ring
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Crazed Beggar | Crazed Dwarf | Drillworm | Dwarf | Dwarf Geomancer | Dwarf Miner | Gore Horn | Gozzler | Haunted Treeling | Lavafungus | Lost Basher | Lost Berserker | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Madareth | Massive Earth Elemental | Mindmasher | Novice of the Cult | Orewalker | Sister Hetai | Stone Devourer | War Golem
notes:
The Dwarven Ring prevents [[drunkenness]] and has energy for 60 minutes. It is helpful in slaying monsters that make you drunk, such as [[Assassin]]s, [[Cyclops Smith]]s, [[Cult]]s, [[Djinn]]s, [[Dworc Voodoomaster]]s and [[Wyvern]]s.

Note that the character does not become sober, but the effects of drunkenness are inactive while the ring is worn: your character remains drunk. Thus, taking the ring off after you have killed all drunkenness-causing creatures will still render your character incapacitated.

In addition to the loot from various creatures, they can also be found inside [[Crate (Usable)|Usable crate]]s that are around [[Thais]], [[Yalahar]] and [[Edron]].

Can be acquired by completing the [[Geomancer Quest]], [[Waterfall Quest]], [[Skull of Ratha Quest]] and [[Triangle Tower Quest]].

name: Dwarven Shield

5 of them are needed for [[Hunter Outfits Quest]]

flavortext: It is said to make your feet fly.

name: Enchanted Spear
notes:
[[Paladin]]s can turn one ordinary [[Spear]] into an enchanted spear with the [[Enchant Spear]] spell, which uses 3 [[Soul Point|soul points]]. Comparatively speaking, these spears are a bit better than [[Royal Spears]], with 3 more attack and one more square meter of distance, which makes them better suited for hunting creatures that run from their targets.

\n\nOne test at training dummies with these spears has shown that they have a significant lower breakage than both [[Spear]] (2.5%) as well as [[Royal Spears]] (2.75%). The breakage rate for Enchanted Spears has shown to be 1.1%. This means you can hunt more than twice as long, compared to other kinds of spears.

name: Enchanted Staff
notes: Buy the [[Enchant Staff|Enchant Staff Spell]] from [[Eremo]] and cast it on a [[Staff]]. Not very useful, as it only lasts for 60 seconds. However, it can be used as an enchanted shield since its defense is the highest of all [[Item#Weapons|weapons]]. It's the best weapon of those without a level requirement. A knight at level 8 with skill 107 can kill other player at level 8 with one hit (185 PVP damage).
flavortext: Temporal magic powers enchant this staff.

name: Energy Ring
droppedby: Animated Feather | Arachnophobica | Askarak Demon | Askarak Lord | Bellicose Orger | Bruise Payne | Choking Fear | Demodras | Dipthrah | Dragon Lord | Energy Elemental | Enlightened of the Cult | Ferumbras | Frost Dragon | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Hand of Cursed Fate | High Voltage Elemental | Infernalist | Knowledge Elemental | Latrivan | Magma Crawler | Mamma Longlegs | Massive Water Elemental | Mazoran | Metal Gargoyle | Morgaroth | Mutated Bat | Orshabaal | Renegade Quara Mantassin | Serpent Spawn | Shaburak Demon | Shaburak Lord | Tarbaz | The Handmaiden | The Old Widow | Twisted Shaper | Tzumrah the Dazzler | Ushuriel | Vexclaw | Warlock | Water Elemental
notes:
The Energy Ring provides a [[Magic Shield]] for 10 minutes. This is also useful for [[knight]]s, giving them an extra layer of [[defense]].
'''Note:''' This [[ring]] uses your own [[mana]] and you do not gain [[magic level]] for mana lost this way.\nObtainable through the [[Draconia Quest]] and the [[Demona Ring Quest]].
history: Since the [[Updates/12.55|Vocation Adjustments Update]], only knights and paladins could wear this ring, but since the introduction of the Monk vocation in April 2025, they can also use it.

name: Energy Wall Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[File:Electrified Icon.gif]] Creates a 1x7 [[Energy Field]]s Area if shot straight from the body. If shot on an angle, a total of 13 energy field squares will be made spanning 7 sqm vertical and 7 sqm horizontal.
Similar to [[Poison Wall Rune]] and [[Fire Wall Rune]] but is wider and deals [[Energy]] damage. On the other hand, it lasts shorter than other wall runes. The energy fields will last for 1 min. 38 sec.
For the spell, see [[Energy Wall]].
{{Scene|spell=energy_wall_north_diag_area|effect=Energy Field (Field)|edge_size=0}}
{{Scene|spell=energy_wall_south_diag_area|effect=Energy Field (Field)|edge_size=0}}
{{Scene|spell=energy_wall_north_south_area|effect=Energy Field (Field)|edge_size=0}}

name: Envenom Rune
notes:
[[File:Poisoned Icon.gif]] This rune poisoned a Target with a 70+/-20 damage but the damage was slow and could be healed with [[Antidote]] or an [[Antidote Rune]].
It was replaced by the [[Stalagmite Rune]] in the [[8.1 Update]].

name: Epee
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Brachiodemon | Esmeralda | Feroxa | Girtablilu Warrior | Hulking Carnisylvan | Insectoid Worker | Ironblight | Knight's Apparition | Memory of an Insectoid | Mindmasher | Swarmer | Tarbaz | The Lord of the Lice | The Pale Count | War Golem | Werewolf | Yielothax
notes: This weapon can be seen in the pirate "armory" on [[Nargor]]. The Epee is a good choice of weapon for mid [[level]] [[Paladin]]s wishing to carry a backup weapon, as it is both light and has respectable damage.
history:
After the [[Updates/7.8|Summer Update 2006]], this weapon can be seen in the Pirate Armory in [[Nargor]]. At that time it was called ''Foil'' and it had lower stats (Atk: 9, Def: 11). Nobody got the Foil.
\nWith the [[Updates/8.0|Summer Update 2007]] the name was changed to ''Epee'' and the stats were upgraded (Atk: 37, Def: 23). Since the [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]], this weapon is now a drop from creatures.

name: Exotic Flowers
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Can be seen in [[Port Hope]] in the [[Tibian Explorer Society]] and the house of [[Rosemarie]] (southwest of Port Hope). There are two Exotic Flowers which are a [[daily respawn]] on [[Kazzan]]'s Castle ([[Darashia]]). They also spawn in the resting room of the [[Rookgaard Academy]], but these cannot be taken.\nAnother one is in the Falcon Bastion and seems to be quest-related.\n

name: Exploding Cookie
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Cookie]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[What a foolish Quest]].

name: Explorer Brooch
notes:
Looks the same as the [[Elven Brooch]].
\nIn the [[Santa Event]], it was also dropped by [[Grynch Clan Goblin]]s.

\nItem obtained in the [[Explorer Brooch Quest]].
flavortext: It is the official badge of the explorer society.

name: Eye Patch
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Pirate Buccaneer | Pirate Corsair | Pirate Cutthroat | Pirate Marauder
notes: \n100 Of these are needed for the first addon of [[Pirate Outfits]].
flavortext: It belonged once to a pirate.

name: Fake Dwarven Beard
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Dwarven Beard]] and [[The Dwarven Emperor's Beard]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].

name: Family Brooch
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Family Brooch (Dwarven)]] and a [[Silver Brooch]].\nYou have to do the [[Family Brooch Quest]] to get this item.
\nGive this item to [[Dalbrect]] to get his permission to travel for the [[Isle of the Kings]].
flavortext: You see the familyname Windtrouser engraved on this brooch.

name: Family Brooch (Dwarven)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Family Brooch]] and a [[Silver Brooch]].\nItem temporarily obtained in the [[Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: The emblem of a dwarven family is engraved on it.

name: Fanfare
notes: [[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]].\nCan be obtained doing the [[Fanfare Quest]].

name: Feather Headdress
notes:
This item can only be obtained by killing [[Terror Bird]]s which spawn in [[Tiquanda]], [[Zao]] and the [[Arena and Zoo Quarter]] in [[Yalahar]].
Can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.

name: Fern
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It looks the same as [[Trousers of the Ancients]].\nDaily spawns in [[Fibula]] and [[Meriana]]'s bar.
\n1 of these is needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Ferumbras' Hat
notes:
One of the most expensive items that is still obtainable. 

Needed for an addon of the male [[Mage Outfits]] and female [[Summoner Outfits]].
<gallery mode="nolines">
Ferumbras' Hats in Halls of Ascension.png|An unreachable room with several Ferumbras' Hats in the [[Halls of Ascension]].
</gallery>
flavortext: It is the proof that Ferumbras has fallen. For now. The Edron Academy should be interested in this.

name: File AH-X17L89
notes: Looks the same as a [[Brown Thin Book]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[Secret Service Quest]].

name: Dragon Robe
notes: It gives 12% fire protection, but increases damage taken from ice by 12%.\nObtainable in the [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].
flavortext: It is covered with runic symbols.

name: Dwarf Disguise Kit
notes:
When used, it turns you into a [[Dwarf Geomancer]] for 5 minutes.
\nIt looks the same as an [[Amazon Disguise Kit]], a [[Birdcage Kit]], a [[Globe Kit]], a [[Gnomish Crystal Package]], a [[Mysterious Package (AVIN)]], a [[Mysterious Package (CGB)]], a [[Mysterious Package (TBI)]], a [[Table Lamp Kit]] and a [[Used Globe Kit]].\nTemporarily obtained in {{Spoiler Section|The Thieves Guild Quest|Mission 4: Bridge Robbery}}.
flavortext: It contains the clothes of a dwarf.

history: Earth War Hammers could be made by [[enchanting]] [[War Hammer]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Emerald]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Earth War Hammer Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Earthborn Titan Armor
droppedby: Lord of the Elements | Terofar | Zulazza the Corruptor | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla
notes:
It gives 5% earth protection, but increases damage taken from fire by 5%. Extremely rare armor, can only be seen in a few worlds. This armor is so valuable because of the axe fighting bonus.
\n[[Image:Earthborn Candia.png|thumb|An Earthborn Titan Armor on Candia]]

name: Elethriel's Elemental Bow
notes: This bow has a range of 4 square tiles around the user, Atk +7. It is hidden below a treasure chest inside [[Treasure Rooms#Beregar Treasure Room|Pythius the Rotten's treasure room]].

name: Elven Vase
notes:
Exposed in Explorer Society Hall ([[Svargrond]]).
\nLooks the same as a [[Fine Vase]], [[Fine Vase (Unknown)]] and a [[Valuable Vase]].
flavortext: It is made of very fine glass and covered with decorations.

name: Elvish Bow
droppedby: Cave Chimera | Elder Forest Fury | Elf Scout | Firestarter | Forest Fury | Naga Archer | Usurper Archer
notes: Obtainable since [[Updates/8.20|Update 8.20]]. An excellent bow favored by any player wishing to use [[Bow Ammunition|Arrows]]. It is superior to a regular [[Bow]] and is useful until a player advances far enough to wield a [[Composite Hornbow]]. Before [[Updates/10.55|Update 10.55]], players who chose to become a [[Paladin]] could see an Elvish bow in the associated cellar of the [[Island of Destiny]].
flavortext: This beautifully ornamented bow was made by a skilled elvish bowmaker.

name: Emerald Sword
notes: Obtainable in the [[The Inquisition Quest]].

name: Energy Blacksteel Sword
history: Energy Blacksteel Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Blacksteel Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges.

name: Energy Bomb Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes: [[File:Electrified Icon.gif]] Creates a 3x3 area of [[Energy Field]]s. The energy fields will last for 1:38.
history: * There are some old energy bombs in [[Antica]] with a larger area and 15 charges.

history: Energy Cranial Bashers could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Cranial Basher]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges.

flavortext: This club is only granted to a greenhorn of the Svargrond arena.

name: Energy Soil
droppedby: Charged Energy Elemental | Overcharged Energy Element
notes:
Obtainable during [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].
Can be used to pass the energy wall or fire wall in the Magician's Quarter [[Magician Quarter/Residential Area|Residential Area]] to access the [[Warlock]] and [[Infernalist]] spawns. It can also be used to enter the blue flame and access the [[Demon]]s spawn under the Magician Quarter's [[Magician Quarter/Restricted Area|Restricted Area]].

name: Energy Spike Sword
notes: This is the only enchanted weapon that has no elemental attack. Its attack was supposed to be 20 physical + 4 energy.
history:
Energy Spike Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Spike Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges.
\n[[High Voltage Elemental]], [[Instable Sparkion]], [[Massive Energy Elemental]] and [[Sparkion]] don't drop this item anymore since {{OfficialNewsArchive|4219|August 1, 2017}} ([[Updates/11.41.5435|Update 11.41]]).

name: Energy War Axe
history: Energy War Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[War Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges.

name: Energy War Hammer
history: Energy War Hammers could be made by [[enchanting]] [[War Hammer]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges.

name: Eternal Flames
notes:
A nice item to use as house decoration during Halloween or in general.\n

\nItem obtained in [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].

name: Ethno Coat
notes: This is one of three [[Mage]]'s armors that increases [[Magic Level]] by 1, yet carries no minimum [[Level]] requirements. Compared to either a [[Focus Cape]] or a [[Spirit Cloak]], this is the worst of the three as it provides the lowest protection. Only [[Sorcerer]]s and [[Druid]]s may use them.

name: Explosion Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[File:Physical Damage Icon.gif]] If you want to maximize your damage, you have to aim well with this [[Rune]] due to its small area of effect.

Explosion is the only [[Rune]] which inflicts [[Physical Damage]].

<noinclude>Area of effect (the centre is the square which is targeted):

[[File:Explosion animation.gif]]
</noinclude>

name: Fiery Blacksteel Sword
history: Fiery Blacksteel Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Blacksteel Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Fire Blacksteel Replica]] is a replica of this item.

flavortext: This club is only granted to a greenhorn of the Svargrond arena.

name: Fiery Rainbow Shield
notes: To get this shield you need to use a [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] on a [[Rainbow Shield]], enchanting it with '''fire'''. It increases your shielding skill by 3 for 15 minutes.
flavortext: It has been temporarily imbued with fire magic and boosts your shielding skill.

name: Fiery Spike Sword
history: Fiery Spike Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Spike Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Fiery Spike Sword Replica]] is a replica of this item.
