history: Fiery War Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[War Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Fiery War Axe Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Fiery War Hammer
notes: It looks the same as a [[Heated Worm Punisher]].
history: Fiery War Hammers could be made by [[enchanting]] [[War Hammer]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Fiery War Hammer Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Dragon Priest's Wandtip
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Dragon Scale Boots
notes:
It's a very rare item. Part of the [[Dragon Set]].
<gallery>
DSB.jpg
</gallery>

name: Dragon Tapestry
notes: See also other [[Tapestries]].

name: Dragon's Tail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Dragonfruit
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: As this fruit is only obtainable from two particular [[NPC]]s residing in a rarely visited place, you won't see these around often.

name: Draken Chestplate
notes:
This item was found in the [[Test Server]] for the [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]], but was not implemented in game. Instead it was replaced by [[Elite Draken Helmet]].
<gallery mode="nolines">
New items summerupdate2010.jpg|A draken chestplate can be seen on the second teaser for the [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]].
</gallery>

name: Draken Sulphur
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Draken Elite | Draken Spellweaver | Paiz the Pauperizer
notes: 5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Dragon Hide]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Draken Trophy
notes: You can't hang it on the wall.

name: Draken Wristbands
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Drakinata
droppedby: Draken Warmaster | Ethershreck | Ghastly Dragon | Hatebreeder | Lizard Legionnaire | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch
notes: This weapon was added with the [[Updates/8.54|Christmas Update 2009]]. The name is a word twist of a similar weapon, the [[Naginata]].

name: Dwarven Legs
notes: They have the same armor as [[Plate Legs]] but are 1 oz lighter and also improves physical resistance whilst worn. This legs can block the same physical damage as [[Golden Legs]] but only if you gets physical hits of 67 or more, so you will have to fight stronger monsters to make this legs block as good as Golden Legs. Part of the [[Dwarven Set]].\nObtainable through {{Spoiler Section|The Hidden City of Beregar Quest|The Royal Rescue}}.
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]].

name: Eagle Shield
notes: You can see it in [[Treasure Rooms|Morguthis Treasure Room]]. Its data can be found on the [[Market]].

name: Earth Barbarian Axe
history:
Earth Barbarian Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Barbarian Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Emerald]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Earth Barbaric Axe Replica]] is a replica of this item.
\nThe sprite of Earth Barbarian Axe changed from http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/tibia/en/images/archive/e/e5/20120415010548!Earth_Barbarian_Axe.gif to http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/tibia/en/images/e/e5/Earth_Barbarian_Axe.gif with the [[Updates/9.52|9.52 patch]].

name: Earth Relic Sword
history: Earth Relic Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Relic Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Emerald]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Earth Relic Sword Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Eclesius' Sandals
notes:
Looks the same as normal [[Sandals]].
\nTemporarily obtained in the [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Eclesius' Sandals changed from [[File:Eclesius' Sandals (Old).gif]] to [[File:Eclesius' Sandals.gif]].
flavortext: There is a tag on them which says 'Do not wear! Those are mine!' As if you had wanted to wear them.

name: Egg of The Many
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Can be used on a LIZARD head DIRECTLY EAST the teleport in deeper [[Banuta]] to unlock a secret tunnel from [[Tiquanda]] ([http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}128.85-127.157-7-2-1-1 here]). You can use this tunnel to get to deeper [[Banuta]] faster from then on. In order to reach the floor where the snakehead is located you need to destroy the Amphoras on the floor above and completed [[The Ape City Quest]] mission 8.

name: Elder Bonelord Tentacle
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Elemental Crystal
notes:
Looks the same as an [[Icicle (Item)|icicle]], but it does not melt. It also makes somehow good decoration item.
10 of these are needed to do [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]]. They can be obtained by [[pick]]ing a slain [[earth elemental]] during the 3rd mission. After giving crystals to [[Telas]] it is no longer possible to gather them.
Buying them directly from Black Bert is somehow useless as crystals are relatively easy to get, much easier than leather with [[obsidian knife]].

name: Elite Draken Mail
notes: This armor gives purple [[light]] and gives +10 [[Speed]]. It has the same speed boost as [[Zaoan Armor]], but the same armor as [[Dragon Scale Mail]]. However useful this armor may seem, most high level [[Paladin]]s will generally wear [[Master Archer's Armor]] because of its skill boost and most high level [[Knight]]s will wear whatever armor gives them a boost towards their weapon, or their shielding. (I.e. [[Windborn Colossus Armor]], and [[Fireborn Giant Armor]] for weapons, or [[Ornate Chestplate]] for shielding.)

name: Elven Astral Observer
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crazed Summer Vanguard | Crazed Winter Rearguard | Dharalion | Elf Arcanist
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Elven Legs
notes: It look the same as [[Ranger Legs]].
history: It was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] from [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], when the boss monster that drops it was implemented.

name: Elven Mail
notes: This is currently the only armor in the game with three [[Imbuing]] slots. This makes it highly sought-after, especially by high-level players who need two elemental protection imbues on places such as the [[Soul War Quest]] areas.
history: It was found during a test server in [[Rookgaard]] on May 16, 2006. A long time ago and for a short period of time this was the sprite of the [[Dragon Scale Mail]]. It was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] for many years. Since [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it is dropped by [[Ravenous Hunger]].

name: Elven Scouting Glass
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Precision]], [[Intricate Precision]] and [[Powerful Precision]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Precision, Intricate Precision, Powerful Precision

name: Elvish Talisman
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crazed Summer Rearguard | Dharalion | Elf | Elf Arcanist | Elf Overseer | Elf Scout | Firestarter | Soul-Broken Harbinger
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Epiphany]], [[Intricate Epiphany]] and [[Powerful Epiphany]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Epiphany, Intricate Epiphany, Powerful Epiphany

name: Empty Beer Bottle
notes: It looks the same as a [[Beer Bottle]] and a [[Bottle]].<noinclude>Part of [[The Ultimate Booze Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: It is the bottle Boozer gave you for the brown ale.

name: Empty Flower Pot
notes:
An empty [[Flower Pot]]. You will end up with one of these if you did not take proper care of the [[Flower Pot|flower]] that used to be in there.
\nUse [[Ice Flower Seeds]] with the empty pot to create frozen flowers.
flavortext: Nothing is planted in there.

name: Empty Jug
notes: It looks the same as a [[Jug]] and a [[Jug (Ants)]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Ice Islands Quest]], it is used to collect ants. After using it on an [[Ant-Hill]], it will become a [[Jug (Ants)]].
flavortext: It seems to be perfect for collecting ants.

name: Empty Potion Flask (Large)
sellto: Alaistar, Asnarus, Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Digger, Faloriel, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Maun, Mehkesh, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Sandra, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Tarun, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes: Some NPCs sell them filled as [[Great Mana Potion]]s, [[Great Spirit Potion]]s, [[Great Health Potion]]s, [[Ultimate Mana Potion]]s, [[Ultimate Spirit Potion]]s, [[Ultimate Health Potion]]s and [[Supreme Health Potion]]s. You can trade 100 empty potion flasks to [[Sandra]] in [[Edron]] for a [[Lottery Ticket]]. Usually, you can find different types of empty potion flasks scattered in many hunting places, including backpacks of them.\nThey are needed for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]].
history: * On [[Updates/15.12.c7d92c|October 21, 2025]] the weight was changed from 1.80 oz to 1.35 oz.
flavortext: Return it to a potion store for your deposit or refill it with a potion keg or cask.

name: Empty Potion Flask (Medium)
sellto: Alaistar, Asnarus, Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Digger, Faloriel, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Maun, Mehkesh, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Sandra, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Tarun, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes: Some NPCs sell them filled as [[Strong Mana Potion|strong mana potions]] and [[Strong Health Potion|strong health potions]]. You can trade 100 empty potion flasks to [[Sandra]] in [[Edron]] for a [[Lottery Ticket]].\nThey are needed for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]].
history: * On [[Updates/15.12.c7d92c|October 21, 2025]] the weight was changed from 1.60 oz to 1.00 oz.
flavortext: Return it to a potion store for your deposit or refill it with a potion keg or cask.

name: Energy Barbarian Axe
history:
Energy Barbarian Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Barbarian Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges.
\nThe sprite of Energy Barbarian Axe changed from http://images2.wikia.nocookie.net/tibia/en/images/archive/1/15/20120415010549!Energy_Barbarian_Axe.gif to [[File:Energy Barbarian Axe.gif]] with the {{Update|9.52}} patch.

name: Energy Clerical Mace
history: Energy Clerical Maces could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Clerical Mace]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges.

name: Energy Relic Sword
history: Energy Relic Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Relic Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges.

name: Engraved Wedding Ring
notes: An engraved [[Wedding Ring]]. These are obtained by marrying someone, replacing the [[Wedding Ring]] after the ceremony. Each of the newly weds will get a ring, and the only distinguishing feature between them is that the partner's name is always written first in the description of the ring; the player's is written second.
flavortext: Player2 & Player1 forever - married on Date.

name: Enigmatic Voodoo Skull
notes: A used [[Mysterious Voodoo Skull]]. It will activate again after being 20 hours in a house or on an online character.
flavortext: It is not time yet.

name: Epaminondas Doll
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail <character name>! Hail Portal Tibia!|Hauopa!|WHERE IS MY HYDROMEL?!|Yala Boom}}
flavortext: He talks, moves and sings just like a real person. It is awarded only by PortalTibia.com.br.

name: Essence of a Bad Dream
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Nightmare | Nightmare Scion | Thanatursus | Tormentor
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Executioner
droppedby: Hellgorak | Horadron | Kerberos | Prince Drazzak | The Enraged Thorn Knight
history: * It used to be a very rare item since it was originally only dropped by [[Hellgorak]]. \n* The first executioner was seen on [[Refugia]].\n* As announced on {{OfficialNewsArchive|8483|August 12, 2025}}, the [[Updates/15.11.d69b04|patch]] changed the [[perk]]s of this weapon that added 50% additional [[Critical Hit]] chance on auto-attacks to extra critical damage on auto-attacks instead.

name: Expedition Backpack
buyfrom: Pompan;After finishing Mission 6 - Days Of Doom of [[The New Frontier Quest]].
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Expedition Bag
notes: See [[Bag]] for general information regarding bags.

name: Eye of Corruption
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Fan Club Membership Card
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Evil Mastermind]] to get it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: This king Tibianus fan club premium membership card is issued to 'The Evil Mastermind'.

name: Fan Doll of King Tibianus
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Voodoo Doll (King)]].
This item can be obtained by the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: The small label reads: For my greatest admirer.

name: Farmer's Avenger
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Monstor]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nLooks the same as a [[Pitchfork]].
\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: A weapon forged to fight oppression of the poor underdogs.

name: Ferumbras Doll
notes:
The official [[Tibiopedia]] item. 

Knwon receivers of this item:
* {{Character|Oxyven}} for designing the item. 
* It was awarded in the "Tibiopedia Movie Awards" contest to {{character|Nayumi}}, {{character|Pilux}}, {{character|Demi Azikaim}}.
* One was also given to {{character|Van Lyves}} for winning [[Tibiopedia]]' RPG Event 2010.
* Another one was given to {{character|Goodwine}} for being chosen as best submission in [[Tibia ML]] programming contest by [[Tibiopedia]].
* {{character|Fenris Greyback}} received one for being Thais' Best Royal Painter.
* {{character|Sahphira}} was awarded with this doll in Funtibia.com's Layout Contest.
* {{character|Kat Woman}} received this doll as a reward for winning the "Celebrating birthday contest" in december 2012 sponsored by [[Tibiopedia]].
* {{character|Makadamia}} got it as a reward for winning the "Tibian Chef's Kitchen" contest organized by [[Tibiopedia]].
* {{character|Northern Moon}} received it as a gift for his contribution to Boosted Creatures calendar on [[Tibiopedia]].

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to four players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Leidy Shay}} ([[Astera]])
* {{Character|Ostatni Astrofizyk}} ([[Vunira]])
* {{Character|Nuubzin}} ([[Dibra]])
* {{Character|Fanjita}} ([[Celesta]])
sounds: {{Sound List|NO ONE WILL STOP ME THIS TIME!|THE POWER IS MINE!|THE POWER IS IN TIBIOPEDIA!|Mwahaha!}}
flavortext: It was awarded by Tibiopedia.pl.

name: Fiery Barbarian Axe
history:
Fiery Barbarian Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Barbarian Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Fiery Barbarian Axe Replica]] is a replica of this item.
\nThe sprite of Fiery Barbarian Axe changed from http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/tibia/en/images/archive/7/76/20120415010549!Fiery_Barbarian_Axe.gif to [[File:Fiery Barbarian Axe.gif]] with the {{Update|9.52}} patch.

name: Fiery Clerical Mace
history: Fiery Clerical Maces could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Clerical Mace]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Fiery Clerical Mace Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Fiery Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blazing Fire Elemental | Blistering Fire Elemental | Fire Overlord | Hellfire Fighter | Hellhound | Lava Golem | Magma Crawler | Thornfire Wolf | Vulcongra | Weeper
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Scorch]], [[Intricate Scorch]] and [[Powerful Scorch]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Scorch, Intricate Scorch, Powerful Scorch

name: Fiery Relic Sword
history: Fiery Relic Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Relic Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Fiery Relic Sword Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Filled Carrying Device
notes:
It's a [[Carrying Device]] with a mirror crystal inside.

Used in [[Sea of Light Quest]].
flavortext: The special carrying device Spectulus gave you now contains a mirror crystal.

name: Filled Jalapeno Peppers
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
history: This item used to be named "''filled jalapeÃ±o peppers''" until [[Updates/11.47.5602|Update 11.47]].\n}}<noinclude>\n[[Category:Speed Booste
flavortext: The creamy cheese makes a great combination with the spicy peppers.

name: Dragon Statue Kit
buyfrom: Cael;For 1 [[Red Lantern]] (after bringing 11 [[Tome of Knowledge|tomes]] in [[Tomes of Knowledge Quest]])
notes: Use it to construct a {{Ilink|Dragon Statue (Item)}} [[Dragon Statue (Item)|Dragon Statue]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a dragon statue.

name: Dragon Throne Kit
buyfrom: Cael;for 1 [[Red Piece of Cloth]] (after handing in 12 [[Tome of Knowledge|Tomes of Knowledge]])
notes:
Use it in a house to unpack a {{Ilink|Dragon Throne}} [[Dragon Throne]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
This item can only be obtained once every 5 weeks (35 days), and only by a character who has handed in 12 [[Tome of Knowledge|Tomes of Knowledge]] to [[Cael]]. {{Infobox Transcript| ''Player'': hi
Cael: Greetings, ''Player''! You must have come around quite a bit. I'm always interested in learning new things about Zao.
''Player'': red piece of cloth
Cael: Have you brought me a piece of red cloth? I can make a throne for you if you want. But remember, I won't do that all the time - so try and don't destroy it, okay?
''Player'': yes
Cael: Let's put this cloth over the seat.. there you go. I wrap it up for you, just unwrap it in your house again!
''Player'': bye
Cael: Farewell, ''Player''! Come back with new stories! }}
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a dragon throne.

name: Draken Boots
droppedby: Draken Abomination | Draken Elite | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch
notes: An excellent choice for people searching for a balance between armor and speed.
history: Due to {{OfficialNewsArchive|1390|a bug}}, these boots could be bought from NPC [[Esrik]] for 40,000 [[gp]]. On the 1st of July, 2010 CipSoft changed all existent draken boots into [[Trashed Draken Boots]].

name: Draken Doll
notes:
The official [[TibiaJourney]] item. This item could be obtained only by winning a contest held or sponsored by [[TibiaJourney]]. {{Character|Meliodas Sin}}(formely named Demolition Loover) has been rewarded with first one as a creator of this doll and winner of fansite item contest of [[TibiaJourney]]. {{Character|Mellie Minx}} has been rewarded the second winner of the doll of the Royal Painting Contest of January 2011 of [[TibiaJourney]]. {{Character|Shawtay}} has also been rewarded the Draken Doll from TibiaJourney's lottery. 

Its replica is the [[Draken Doll (Replica)]].

<noinclude><gallery mode="nolines"> 
File:Demo's_House_and_D_Doll.png|Meliodas Sin (formely named Demolition Loover) showing the Draken Doll in her house.
</gallery></noinclude>
flavortext: This doll seems to be the favourite doll of the emperor. It was awarded by TibiaJourney.com.

name: Draptor Scales
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. This item is considered rare, since [[Draptor]]s is a semi rare spawn.

name: Drawer Kit
buyfrom: Borkas, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct {{Ilink|Drawers}} [[Drawers]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a drawer.

name: Dread Doll
notes:
It's the official FunTibia item. 

Known players to have received this item are:
* {{Character|Romano The Knight}}, for being FunTibia's head administrator.
* {{Character|Geeviz}} for creating the item.
* {{Character|Andarist}}, for winning with the best joke of the [http://funtibia.com/forum/viewthread.php?thread_id=112 Masters of Fun contest].
* {{Character|Dark Elemental}}, for winning the Best Comedy category in the [https://tibiopedia.pl/forum/t/5638,TMA-results Tibia Movie Awards 2011]. 
* {{Character|Star Nami}}, for winning the [http://funtibia.com/news.php?readmore=57 Fantasy Contest 2012].
* {{Character|Meerkat The Legend}}, for winning the [http://funtibia.com/forum/viewthread.php?thread_id=9282 Make Our Party] contest in 2014.
* {{Character|Tirano Flamem}}, for winning the [http://funtibia.com/forum/viewthread.php?thread_id=11587 Holyday Comic 2021] contest.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Wrathson}} ([[Thyria]])
* {{Character|Ufthak}} ([[Gladera]])
* {{Character|Skorponok The Knight}} ([[Kalibra]])
history: Item was originally added in [[Updates/8.72|Update 8.72]].\n\nDue to a map bug with [[Updates/9.1|Update 9.1]] that took place in Thais Castle throne room, it spawned during 2 days after server save, which led to some players from all game worlds briefly obtaining this fansite item. With that mistake reported, CipSoft later turned it into a [[Doll (Dread)]] - as can be read on {{OfficialNewsArchive|1769|this news article}} and {{post|30636528|this Auditorium post}} - for some months, and then was changed into a [[Fan Doll of Queen Eloise]]. The original Dread Doll was reintroduced and given back to the original fansite contest winners in [[Updates/9.2|Update 9.2]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Mhausheausheu! What a FAIL! Mwahaha!|Hail <character name>! You are wearing old socks!|You are so unpopular even your own shadow refuses to follow you.|Have fun with FunTibia.com!}}
flavortext: It is shining with positive energy and was awarded by FunTibia.com.

name: Dream Matter
droppedby: Gaz'haragoth | Horadron | Omrafir | Prince Drazzak | Terofar
notes: A very rare item only obtained from [[Roshamuul Prison]] bosses, especially [[Gaz'haragoth]]. This item is required for [[Umbral Creation]] in the first step - creating crude [[Umbral Items]]. To improve the crude umbral item, you do not need more dream matter, although your weapon can break, requiring more dream matter to recreate it. In average, 12.7 Dream Matter are spent on creating an umbral master item, according to [[Umbral Creation/Statistics]].

name: Dream Nebuliser
notes: Used and temporarily obtained in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: Used to spray fine dream sand on things.

name: Dream Sand
notes: Used and temporarily obtained in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: A fine glowing powder and crystalline nuggets.

name: Dream Warden Claw
sellto:
-- | notes =You can obtain this item by opening a [[Unrealized Dream]] besides [[Eruaran]] ({{Mapper Coords|131.91|126.113|5|8|text=here}}).
{{Seealso|Unrealized Dream/Statistics}} It is used to obtain Addon 2 for the [[Dream Warden Outfits]].

name: Dream Warden Mask
droppedby: Gaz'haragoth | Horadron | Omrafir | Prince Drazzak | Terofar | Zavarash
notes: Used for the [[Dream Warden Outfits]].

name: Dresser Kit
buyfrom: Borkas, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Dresser}} [[Dresser]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a dresser.

name: Drill Bolt
droppedby: Armadile | Broodrider Inferniarch | Drillworm | Enslaved Dwarf | Humongous Fungus | Lost Berserker | Wiggler
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard

name: Dry Piece of Wood
notes:
Used in the world quest [[Bewitched]].
If you use 1 of these, you will receive the [[achievement]] [[Fire Lighter]].
If you use 100 of these, you will receive the achievement [[Fire Devil]].
If you use 500 of these, you will receive the achievement [[Pyromaniac]].
flavortext: Use it on the cauldron slide to keep the fire burning.

name: Dubious Piece of Cloth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can reach higher prices in [[Optional PvP]] worlds given the fact of the rarity of the [[Feverish Citizen]] raids based on the non-stop medicine pouch delivery. Nevertheless they are a little bit more common since the last update in almost all the optional pvp servers.
Can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.30|126.91|10|8|text=here}}.
Looks the same as a [[Soft Piece of Cloth]].\nNeeded for [[Afflicted Outfits Quest]].
flavortext: It seems to be a part of an outfit. Find all six parts to complete the outfit.

name: Dung Ball
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
sellto: Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir, Luna

name: Dung Ball (Quest)
droppedby: Chopper | Fleshslicer | Maw | Mindmasher | Rotspit | Shadowstalker
notes: This item grants the user 10 War Exp in [[War Against The Hive Quest]] when you use it ({{Server Message|You have gained some valuable experience in the war against the hive}}). Note that it does not grant 10 favour, which is required to access the inner [[Hive]].

name: Earflap
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products.

name: Ectoplasmic Sushi
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Provides 1 square of blue light.

name: Eerie Song Book
notes: It looks the same as [[The Witches' Grimoire]] and an [[Unholy Book]].\nObtained during {{Spoiler Section|Roshamuul Quest|Soothing Bad Dreams}}.
flavortext: The songs in it are... special. Very special. Not for weak stomachs.

name: Elemental Spikes
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 1 of these is needed for the [[Elementalist Outfits Quest]].

name: Elite Draken Helmet
notes: One of the rewards in the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Elven Hoof
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 20 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Precision]] and [[Powerful Precision]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Elven Trophy
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.
\nThis item can only be obtained as a [[fansites|Promoted or Supported Fansite]] contest prize.

name: Elven Vial
notes: \nObtained and used during [[The Repenters Quest]].
flavortext: This vial is currently empty, there are no traces of any liquid.

name: Emergency Kit
notes:
It contains some vital tools for any handyman.
Looks the same as a [[Bricklayers' Kit]].Used during the [[World Task]] [[A Pirate's Death to Me]] to fix the ship floor. Found at the northeast corner of the lower deck with a [[Ghost Duster]].

name: Empty Receptacle
notes: \nObtained and used during [[The Repenters Quest]].

name: Empty Storage Flask
notes:
Looks like a [[Berserk Potion]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]]. After using with a [[Snake]] which is alive, it will turn into a [[Full Storage Flask]].
flavortext: Omrabas gave you this flask to stuff intestines in.

name: Energy Field Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes: [[File:Electrified Icon.gif]] Creates an [[Energy Field (Field)|energy field]], initial damage of 30 and followed by 25 additional damage once the field is left. The energy field will last for 1 minute 38 seconds.

name: Energy Net
notes:
Looks the same as an [[Energy Field (Field)|Energy Field]].
Part of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 12.

name: Envelope from the Wizards
droppedby: Azure Frog | Badger | Bat | Blue Djinn | Bonelord | Crystal Spider | Dawn Bat | Deepling Guard | Deepling Scout | Deepling Spellsinger | Deepling Worker | Dragon | Dragon Hatchling | Dragon Lord | Dragon Lord Hatchling | Elder Bonelord | Frost Dragon | Frost Dragon Hatchling | Frost Giant | Frost Giantess | Frost Troll | Ice Witch | Island Troll | Killer Caiman | Lancer Beetle | Lizard Chosen | Lizard High Guard | Lizard Legionnaire | Mutated Bat | Orchid Frog | Penguin | Polar Bear | Quara Constrictor | Quara Mantassin | Quara Mantassin Scout | Sandcrawler | Squirrel | Terror Bird | The Bloodweb | Tortoise | Winter Wolf | Yeti
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Stamped Letter]], a [[Compromising Letter]], a [[Letter to Chantalle]], a [[Letter to Eremo]], a [[Letter to Markwin]] and a [[Secret Letter]].

Contains a [[Letter from the Wizards|letter]], and either a [[Strange Yellow Powder|yellow]], [[Strange Red Powder|red]], or [[Strange Blue Powder|blue powder]] needed for the world event [[The Colours of Magic]]. The envelopes will become unusable when a wizard is chosen, and will finally disappear a week after the event. The following creatures are known to drop it, but only while the event is active:
flavortext: The sender on this letter reads: "The Three Wizards, Skyward Lane 33 in 82335 Cloudstream".

name: Envenomed Arrow
droppedby: Adult Goanna | Armadile | Earworm | Hideous Fungus | Ink Blob | Sun-Marked Goanna | Young Goanna
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes:
This arrow has a combined attack of 54 (half earth, half physical). It will output acceptable damage and on earth-neutral or weak monsters will be more efficient than [[Prismatic Bolt]]s (3.3 atk/gp vs. 4.5 atk/gp). However, many high-end creatures are immune or strong to [[Earth Damage]]. 

The main use of these arrows for Paladins upon reaching Level 70 is to complete the Quara Scout task of the [[Killing in the Name of... Quest]] until Level 79 and then the Underwater Quara task after reaching Level 80. This could be dangerous without a shield and Level 70-100 Paladins should be extremely careful not to get swarmed because Quaras hit very hard with melee. Alternatively, they can be used to hunt [[Shaburak Demon]]s. 

Other than those two uses, they can also be used effectively against the much weaker [[Barbarians]] (but not Ice Witches), [[Orcs]] and [[Cyclopes]]. [[Undead Gladiator]]s, however, which are weak to Envenomed Arrows, should only be hunted in Yalahar because the [[Krailos Ruins]] contain creatures which are immune to Earth Damage. Overall, most Paladins upon reaching Level 70 elect to instead use the crossbow ammunition counterpart, the [[Drill Bolt]], which deals entirely physical damage.

Paladins can explore the [[Earth Damage/Weak]] page and sort the list by experience to find creatures in their difficulty range for which these arrows would be effective to use.

15 of them can be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.

name: Essence of Dread
notes: You can trade 3 Essences of Dread for 1 [[Cluster of Solace]], at [[Morax]] in his dream. See also [[Essence of Wishful Thinking]], a similar item.\n\nObtained from the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: You don't like holding it. Really don't. As if something bad was just waiting to happen.

name: Essence of Wishful Thinking
notes: You can trade 2 Essences of Wishful Thinking for 1 [[Cluster of Solace]], at [[Morax]] in his dream. See also [[Essence of Dread]], a similar item.
flavortext: Just looking at it makes you feel better. What could possibly go wrong.

name: Evilina
notes: Normal state is having the greedy look, when used she fall asleep [[File:Demon Infant (Smile).gif]] for 10 minutes.\nIt is obtained through the [[Demon's Lullaby]] event.

name: Exquisite Silk
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[A Father's Burden Quest]].

name: Exquisite Wood
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[A Father's Burden Quest]].

name: Eye of a Deepling
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Brawler | Deepling Elite | Deepling Guard | Deepling Master Librarian | Deepling Scout | Deepling Spellsinger | Deepling Tyrant | Deepling Warrior | Deepling Worker | Reflection of Obujos | Shark
sellto: Malunga, Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir
notes: Can be used to create a [[Shimmer Glower]] by using with a [[Shimmer Swimmer]].
flavortext: Did it just twitch...? No, must have been an optical illusion.

name: Eye of a Weeper
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Eye of the Storm
notes:
Can be equipped in the belt slot as a light source.\n
\n[[File:Eye of the Storm light.png]]

name: Faded Last Will
notes: It looks the same as a [[Document (Certificate)]], a [[Contract]], a [[Signed Contract]], and a [[Tactical Map]].\nPart of [[The Spirit Will Get You Quest]].
flavortext: Supposedly the last will of someone. Whatever may have been written on it is long vanished.

name: Fake Rabbit's Foot
notes: Quest item temporarily obtained in the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]]. Obtained by using a [[Spoon with a Ribbon]] on [[Wool]].
flavortext: The wool that was stuffed under the ribbon makes the spoon look and feel like a real rabbit's foot.

name: Faked Label
notes:
This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Label]].

name: Family Signet Ring
notes: It can be worn as a normal ring.\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Secret Service Quest]]: AVIN branch. For the TBI equivalent, see [[Suspicious Signet Ring]].

name: Fan Doll of Queen Eloise
notes: Due to a map bug, the old [[Doll (Dread)]] was changed into this item. The [[Dread Doll]] was then reintroduced on the [[Updates/9.2|9.2 update]].\nVery rare reward of the [[Noodles is Gone Mini World Change]].

name: Filled Cup
notes: Used and temporarily obtained in the [[Roshamuul Quest]]. Obtained by using [[Bowl of Tea Leaves]] on [[Tea Cup]].
flavortext: The blend inside smells as if a dead green fairy had been dropped in it.

name: Filled Elven Vial
notes:
None.
\nObtained and used during [[The Repenters Quest]].
flavortext: The water in this vial is sacred to some. It will not stay in this vessel forever, however.

name: Filled Receptacle
notes: Obtained and used during [[The Repenters Quest]].

name: Dragon Tongue
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Ice Dragon | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Kalyassa | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | Tazhadur

name: Draken Doll (Replica)
notes: This item is a replica of [[Draken Doll]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Dream Blossom Staff
droppedby: Faceless Bane | Mercurial Menace | Nymph | Pixie | Pooka | Sugar Mommy
notes: It is notable for being one of the few magical weapons usable by both [[sorcerer]]s and [[druid]]s. For a [[sorcerer]], it is an straight downgrade from [[Wand of Defiance]], compared to which it deals less damage per shot but has otherwise identical stats (save for the two imbuement slots). For a [[druid]], it is a rather valuable weapon though, as it deals [[Energy Damage|energy damage]] which they otherwise have a very limited access to. It has two imbuement slots, but it cannot be imbued with [[Critical Hit]], only [[Mana Leech]], [[Hit Points Leech]] and [[Magic Level]]. Provides 4 sqm of blue light.
flavortext: It's a gnarly branch with a gleaming blue blossom.

name: Drowned Seaman's Skull
notes: It looks the same as [[Omrabas' Talking Skull]], a [[Skull (Item)]], a [[Skull of Ratha]] and [[Some Mortal Essence]].\n5 of these are temporarily obtained in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]].

name: Earthheart Cuirass
notes: Can be bought from [[Cledwyn]] for 100 [[Silver Token]]s.

name: Earthheart Hauberk
notes: Can be bought from [[Cledwyn]] for 100 [[Silver Token]]s.

name: Earthheart Platemail
notes: Can be bought from [[Cledwyn]] for 100 [[Silver Token]]s.

notes: Can be bought from [[Cledwyn]] for 100 [[Silver Token]]s.

name: Earthsoul Tabard
notes: Can be bought from [[Cledwyn]] for 100 [[Silver Token]]s.

name: Easel Kit
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using [[Anniversary Remains]] left by [[Penciljack (Creature)|Penciljack]] and [[Lyxoph (Creature)|Lyxoph]]. Becomes an [[Artist's Easel]] when unpacked.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct an easel.

name: Ectoplasm Container (Bone)
notes:
It contains a desecrated bone.
It looks the same as a [[Spirit Container]] and an [[Ectoplasm Container (Ectoplasm)]].\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Into the Bone Pit Quest]].
flavortext: It is filled with a desecrated bone.

name: Ectoplasm Container (Ectoplasm)
notes:
It contains the ectoplasm of a dead [[Ghost]].
It looks the same as a [[Spirit Container]] and an [[Ectoplasm Container (Bone)]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It is filled with ectoplasm.

name: Eggs of a Sacred Snake
notes: Found and used during the [[Dawnport Legion Helmet Quest]]. Looks the same as [[Insectoid Egg]]s.
flavortext: Through the brown glistening shell you see movement.

name: Emblem (Replica)
notes: This item is a replica of [[TibiaHispano Emblem]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Empty Birdcage
notes: Part of the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: This birdcage is empty. It seems uniquely prepared to host a specific species of birds.

name: Empty Starlight Vial
notes: There is also a [[Gleaming Starlight Vial|gleaming version]] of this item: {{Ilink|Gleaming Starlight Vial}}.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Enchanted Werewolf Amulet
notes: This is a [[Werewolf Amulet]] which is enchanted with [[Moonlight Crystals]]. Timer will only run while this item is equipped.\nIt lasts 60 minutes.
history: Prior to the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], enchanted werewolf amulets had +3 of physical protection and an armor value of 2.

name: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet (Axe)
notes: To create an [[Enchanted Werewolf Helmet]] you have to talk to NPC [[Maeryn]] (''hi'' â†’ ''werewolf helmet'' â†’ ''yes'' â†’ then choose vocation and weapon type). From now on, every time you use [[Moonlight Crystals]] on ANY [[Werewolf Helmet]], it will be enchanted with new attributes depending on vocation and weapon type you have chosen. To create different enchantments return to NPC [[Maeryn]] and repeat the process.\n\n{{seealso|Enchanted Werewolf Helmet}}

name: Ewer (Blue)
notes: Can be found in [[Marapur]] ({{Mapper Coords|131.213|128.10|5|4|text=here}}). There are also [[Ewer (Golden)|golden]], [[Ewer (Green)|green]] and [[Ewer (Silver)|silver]] versions.

name: Ewer (Golden)
notes:
There are two known spawns: {{Mapper Coords|129.34|121.123|7|8|text=here}} in the [[Razachai|Razachai Keep]], and in {{Mapper Coords|text=here|130.115|127.140|5|8|1|0.1250.125}} in the [[Cobra Bastion]].
\nThere are also [[Ewer (Blue)|blue]], [[Ewer (Green)|green]] and [[Ewer (Silver)|silver]] versions.
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]].

name: Ewer (Green)
notes: It is currently unknown how to obtain one. There are also [[Ewer (Blue)|blue]], [[Ewer (Golden)|golden]] and [[Ewer (Silver)|silver]] versions.

name: Ewer (Silver)
notes: There are three known spawns: one in the tower east of the [[Northern Zao Plantations]] ({{Mapper Coords|130.39|121.109|5|4|text=here}}), and two in [[Razachai|Razachai Keep]] ({{Mapper Coords|129.67|121.135|5|8|text=here}} and {{Mapper Coords|129.42|121.130|6|8|text=here}}).\n\nThere are also [[Ewer (Blue)|blue]], [[Ewer (Golden)|golden]] and [[Ewer (Green)|green]] versions.
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]].

name: Ewer with Holy Water
notes:
It looks like a blue [[Ewer]].
\nUse the [[Well With a Lion-like Face]] to obtain it. Needed for the [[Lion's Rock Quest]].
flavortext: The water in the ewer shimmers faintly. In the desert's heat it will evaporate soon, however.

buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Nelly, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes: 20 of them are needed for the [[Basic Featherweight]], [[Intricate Featherweight]] and [[Powerful Featherweight]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Featherweight, Intricate Featherweight, Powerful Featherweight

name: Feedbag
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Ferumbras' Amulet
notes: Using this amulet can give you 1000 [[Hit Points]] or 1000 [[Mana Points]] (by random chance). It has a 1 hour cooldown. This means the Ferumbras' Amulet used can not be used by another player for an hour, and you can not use a different Ferumbras' Amulet for an hour. \nNote: for the amulet to recharge you have to be online and have the amulet either equipped or in your backpack, you can also leave it at a [[House]]
flavortext: The rare jewel is made of sapphire and ruby and has a golden F-pendant.

name: Ferumbras' Candy Hat
notes:
It was introduced to celebrate [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]].
Despite what its name might suggest, this item is not edible.
flavortext: It is a sweet candy replica of the famous Ferumbras' hat.

name: Ferumbras' Mana Keg
notes:
Once used, it will produce 10 [[Great Mana Potion]]s and the text will appear:
\n{{Sound|Magical sparks whirl around the keg as you open the spigot and you fill ten empty vials with mana fluid.}}
\nBoth the item and the character have a [[Ferumbras' Mana Keg (Used)|24-hour cooldown]].
flavortext: It is made of dark oak and crested with a large golden F.

name: Ferumbras' Mana Keg (Used)
notes: An used [[Ferumbras' Mana Keg]]. You will have to wait 24 hours in order to use it again.
flavortext: It is made of dark oak and crested with a large golden F.

name: Ferumbras' Staff (Blunt)
notes: When using this item, it turns temporarily into a [[Ferumbras' Staff (Enchanted)]] or a [[Ferumbras' Staff (Failed)]], and the [[Red Sparkles Effect]] {{Ilink|Red Sparkles Effect}} and the following message appear: {{Server Message|Magical sparks whirl around the staff and suddenly it changes its appearance.}}\n\n{{Seealso|Ferumbras' Staff (Blunt)/Statistics}}
flavortext: It is made of platinum and emeralds and topped by a large F made of gold.

name: Ferumbras' Staff (Enchanted)
notes: It is an enchanted [[Ferumbras' Staff (Blunt)]]. It will become a [[Ferumbras' Staff (Blunt)]] again after 12 hours.
flavortext: It is made of platinum and emeralds and topped by a large F made of gold.

name: Ferumbras' Staff (Failed)
notes:
It is obtained after a failed attempt to enchant [[Ferumbras' Staff (Blunt)]]. It will become a [[Ferumbras' Staff (Blunt)]] again after 12 hours.
\nIt is slightly worse than a [[Wand of Defiance]].
flavortext: It is made of platinum and emeralds and topped by a large F made of gold.

name: Ferumbras' Teddy
notes: Reward of the [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].

name: Fig Leaf
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Barkless Devotee | Barkless Fanatic | Ravenous Hunger
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
history: During the first days of test server, 5 Fig Leaves were required for [[Powerful Featherweight]]. It was later changed to 5 [[Goosebump Leather]]. However, [http://forum.test.tibia.com/forum/?action=thread&postid=16449#post16449 this change made during test server] didn't make it to the real servers. This was corrected on {{OfficialNewsArchive|4430|December 17, 2017}} ([[Updates/11.00|Update 11.52]]).
flavortext: For vital parts.

name: Filled Glooth Converter
notes:
It's a [[Glooth Converter]] filled with [[Vial of Mushroom Distillate|Mushroom Distillate]]. This can be used to cleanse [[Tainted Glooth Capsule]]s. You may also use this to cleanse mutated pools of glooth, but your glooth converter will break after 8 uses.
Obtained and used in the [[Oramond_Quest/Spoiler#The_Mutated_Glooth_Plague|Oramond Quest - Mutated Glooth Plague]].

name: Exercise Axe

An Exercise Rod can be purchased in game for gold or it can also be bought at the [[Store]] for 25 {{TC}} [[Tibia Coins]]. Those which are bought from the Store cannot be traded. 

This Item is used in conjunction with an [[Exercise Dummy]].
If you own a house you can also use either a [[Demon Exercise Dummy]], [[Ferumbras Exercise Dummy]] or a [[Monk Exercise Dummy]].

According to a Tibia Forum response from [[Burchan]], both the Exercise Rod and [[Exercise Wand]] are equivalent to using 600 [[Ultimate Mana Potion]]s or approximately 300,000 [[Mana]] points.
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its NPC price was 210,000 gold and its Store price was 20 Tibia Coins.\nThe price was changed from 262500 to 347222 since [[Summer Update 2024]].

name: Empty Ritual Flask
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It can be found inside the [[Cobra Bastion]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|130.115|127.154|5|4|1|0.250.25}}. It spawns multiple times per day when the room "resets". Using it on a dead [[Cobra]] will result in a [[Flask with Snake Poison]].
flavortext: This small ritual flask is used to gather potent snake poison.

name: Falcon Escutcheon
notes:
It was once a [[Falcon Shield]].
<noinclude>
In order to create this item, you'll need the following items:

* One {{Ilink|Falcon Shield}} [[Falcon Shield]], dropped by [[Grand Master Oberon]].
* One {{Ilink|Grant of Arms}} [[Grant of Arms]], dropped by [[Grand Master Oberon]].
* One {{Ilink|Patch of Fine Cloth}} [[Patch of Fine Cloth]], dropped by Falcon minibosses and obtainable from the [[Brass-Shod Chest]]s in the [[Falcon Bastion]].

Take the items to the forge inside the [[Falcon Bastion]], [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}130.83-122.111-7-4-1-1 here] (you need to have advanced in {{Spoiler Section|The Secret Library Quest|The Order of the Falcon}} to enter this room), and then use the Falcon Shield on the [[Anvil]]{{Ilink|Anvil}}. The Shield will be upgraded into the Escutcheon, the [[Patch of Fine Cloth]] will be consumed but you will keep the [[Grant of Arms]].
</noinclude>

name: Dwarf Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Dwarf Balloon (Inflated)|Dwarf Balloon]] {{Ilink|Dwarf Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Special Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Special Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Special Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Earth Amplification
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your targets sensitivity to your [[Earth Damage]] attacks by 8% for one hour. It only affects attacks against monsters.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily amplifies earth damage against monsters.

name: Earth Resilience
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your [[Earth Damage]] protection by 8% for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases earth protection.

notes: Part of the [[25 Years of Tibia Quest]].

name: Evora
notes:
It's [[TibiaHome]]'s fansite item. it was created by [https://www.instagram.com/p/CRUS8dopcmA danielsake]. It has several stages that occur when interacted with: [[File:Evora 2.gif]] [[File:Evora 3.gif]] [[File:Evora 4.gif]] The [[Death Effect]] {{Ilink|Death Effect}} appears atop the user when this item is used and displays the following text: * {{Sound|I am this place's protector!}}. The [[Plant Effect]] {{Ilink|Plant Effect}} appears atop the user when this item is used and displays the following text: * {{Sound|LEAVE OR I WILL CURSE YOU!!!}}.
Known players to have received this item are: * {{Character|Suzy Kill Decor}} as a contact person and member of the team. This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to four players on [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were: * {{Character|Adziowiec}} ([[Harmonia]]) * {{Character|Loki The Druiidek}} ([[Nefera]]) * {{Character|Baczula}} ([[Gladera]]) * {{Character|Sara Sedentaria}} ([[Zenobra]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Home, Sweet home...|I am this place's protector!|LEAVE OR I WILL CURSE YOU!!!|Please park all brooms at the door.|Welcome Home ''Player''!}}
flavortext:
Omnipotent energies inhabit this place. It is my mission to protect our home.
Awarded by TibiaHome.com.

name: Exaltation Chest
notes: One is obtained containing the resulting item(s) when using the [[Exaltation Forge]] to fuse items or transfer tiers.

name: Exalted Core
notes: One exalted core is needed in order to [[Equipment Upgrade#Transferring|transfer]] tiers to a 0-tier item. It can also be used to rise the success rate as well as to reduce the tier reduction chances during [[Equipment Upgrade#Fusing|Fusion]].\n\nAdditionally, an exalted core can be used on a creature [[Soul Core]] to transform the latter into one of a lower [[Bestiary]] difficulty, with any creature class and occurence being possible.
flavortext: Use this item to enhance your chances at the exaltation forge.

name: Extended Promotion Scroll
notes: Using this [[Promotion Scroll]] will grant the character 13 promotion points to spend in the [[Wheel of Destiny]]. Each character can only use it once. Can only be dropped from [[Bakragore]] when fighting it under the influence of its [[Bakragore's Taints|final taint]] and at least [[Bakragore's Burden|three burdens]].
flavortext: Only a hero of level 51 or above can decipher this scroll to gain 13 promotion points for the Wheel of Destiny.

flavortext: It has been extracted from an inactive lava hole.

name: Fire Axe
droppedby: Angry Demon | Brachiodemon | Custodian | Demon | Essence of Malice | Feral Sphinx | Ferumbras | Golgordan | Guardian of Tales | Hellfire Fighter | Infernal Phantom | Insane Siren | Latrivan | Lava Golem | Lost Basher | Lost Berserker | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Mahrdis | Mazoran | Mean Lost Soul | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Rage Squid | Sulphider | The Duke of the Depths | The Imperor | Unaz the Mean | Vexclaw | Weeper | Xogixath
notes:
It emits a very small amount of light (makes your screen a little bit brighter). It is enchanted with eternal fire, so it does also fire damage beside the normal damage. The [[Summer Update 2008]] changed the attack description to: 27 physical + 11 fire.
Can be obtained through the [[Fire Axe Quest]].
flavortext: The blade is a magic flame.

name: Fire Bug
notes:
This tool is used for burning [[Sugar Cane]] fields before harvesting them to make [[Rum]]. It will sometimes explode upon use, causing 5 damage to the user and being destroyed in the process. Also provides 3 squares of permanent yellow light and can light up [[Empty Coal Basin]]s. Also, when you use it successfully, it won't necessarily disappear. So it's possible to use the same fire bug multiple times. Moreover, it doesn't seem to be able to explode during quests (like [[Machinery of War Quest]]).

\nEach fire bug can burn around 20 fields of sugar cane based on a test done by a player in which he bought 100 bugs and managed to burn 2011 fields.\nThis item is also used in the [[Meriana Quest]], [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]], [[Treasure Hunt Quest]], [[Machinery of War Quest]], [[Tower Defence Quest]], [[Secret Service Quest]] (For TBI), [[Blood Brothers Quest]], and [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: This strange creature has the tendency to set certain things on fire.

name: Fire Mushroom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Angry Demon | Demon | Demon Outcast | Grimeleech | Memory of a Carnisylvan | Poisonous Carnisylvan | Rage Squid | Spellreaper Inferniarch | Ungreez | Vexclaw
notes: Can be seen in [[Kazordoon]]. It is the best [[food]] available in the game considering recovering time/weight. It's one of the best foods for long trips since they are light and provide a good regeneration rate. 100 fire mushrooms weighs 10 oz. and will last you for 12 hours.
