flavortext: The blade is a magic flame.

name: Fireworks Rocket
notes:
When using this item, either [[Blue Confetti Effect]] {{Ilink|Blue Confetti Effect}} or [[Red Confetti Effect]] {{Ilink|Red Confetti Effect}} or [[Yellow Confetti Effect]] {{Ilink|Yellow Confetti Effect}} will appear.
It can be obtained by using [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|Blue Surprise Bags]] and [[Surprise Bag (Red)|Red Surprise Bags]]. You can receive 2 [[achievement]]s from using this item. *[[Fireworks in the Sky]] is gained by using 250 fireworks rockets on the ground. *[[Rocket in Pocket]] is gained by using 3 fireworks rockets while they are in your inventory (e.g backpack).
history: Before [[Updates/8.7|Winter Update 2010]], you would lose 10 [[hp]] if you would use it while it was in a [[Containers|container]] of your inventory, except if you were in a [[Protection Zone]] or had less than 10 hp.
flavortext: Do not use in your backpack or while asleep. Keep away from animals or children.

name: Fish
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Abyssal Calamary | Animated Guzzlemaw | Bibby Bloodbath | Blood Crab | Chakoya Toolshaper | Chakoya Tribewarden | Chakoya Windcaller | Crab | Deepling Brawler | Deepling Master Librarian | Deepling Spellsinger | Deepling Worker | Deepsea Blood Crab | Demon (Goblin) | Dire Penguin | Filth Toad | Frazzlemaw | Frost Troll | Goblin | Goblin Assassin | Goblin Leader | Goblin Scavenger | Guzzlemaw | Marsh Stalker | Massive Water Elemental | Meadow Strider | Memory of a Frazzlemaw | Muglex Clan Assassin | Muglex Clan Footman | Muglex Clan Scavenger | Ocyakao | Omnivora | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Leader | Orc Warlord | Penguin | Quara Hydromancer Scout | Renegade Orc | Shark | Swamp Troll | Thornback Tortoise | Toad | Tortoise | Undead Jester | Warlord Ruzad | Water Elemental | Weakened Frazzlemaw
buyfrom: Arito: 6, Bruno, Christine, Innkeeper Alphonse:6, Jezzara:6, Pemaret, Raffael: 3, Ramina: 10, Snake Eye, Tanaro
notes:
[[Fish (Creature)]] turns into an edible Fish when killed.
To fish, use a [[Fishing Rod]] (you also need [[Worm]]s with you, to use as bait). You can also put the Fishing Rod on a [[Hotkeys|Hotkey]]. Only shallow water contains fish. Each water square has one fish which needs to respawn after it is caught, which takes approximately 30 minutes. See [[Fishing]] for more information. Obtainable in [[The Beginning Quest]].
It can be found at [[Daily Respawns]] in the fishing hut near [[Thais]], in [[Nargor]] kitchen, [[Edron Orc Cave]], in a house in [[Sabrehaven]] and many more places in Tibia.
5 of them are needed for [[The Hunt for the Sea Serpent Quest]].
50 Are needed in the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
The secret [[Achievements|achievement]] "Here, Fishy Fishy!" is obtainable by fishing 1000 fishes.

name: Fish Fin
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Brawler | Deepling Elite | Deepling Master Librarian | Deepling Scout | Deepling Spellsinger | Deepling Warrior | Deepling Worker | Frazzlemaw | Groam | Guzzlemaw | Mawhawk | Quara Constrictor | Quara Constrictor Scout | Quara Hydromancer | Quara Hydromancer Scout | Quara Mantassin | Quara Mantassin Scout | Quara Pincher | Quara Pincher Scout | Quara Predator | Quara Predator Scout | Renegade Quara Constrictor | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Renegade Quara Mantassin | Renegade Quara Pincher | Renegade Quara Predator | Shark | Terrorsleep | Thul | Weakened Frazzlemaw
notes:
It's very similar to the [[Quara Predator]]'s fin, if it faces to the west.

100 of these are needed in [[Oriental Outfits Quest]].
20 of these are needed in [[Assassin Outfits Quest]].
2 of these are needed in a mission of [[The Ice Islands Quest]].
flavortext: It once belonged to a mighty creature of the deep.

name: Fish Tail
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Frazzlemaw | Guzzlemaw | Memory of a Frazzlemaw
notes:
Has no practical use.
\nCan be found on the floor in [[Santiago]]'s cellar in the tutorial area of [[Rookgaard]], the [[Tiquanda Tarantula Caves]], close to [[Plains of Havoc]] [[Cyclops]] encampment, the [[Demon Skeleton]] spawn in the [[Pits of Inferno]], [[Ragnir]] and most likely other [[Barbarian Settlements]].
\nWas considered to be a rare item for a long time, until it became an official spawn in [[PoH]] and in [[PoI]].

name: Fishbone
droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Animated Guzzlemaw | Frazzlemaw | Guzzlemaw | Memory of a Book | Mutated Human | Sharptooth | Memory of a Frazzlemaw
notes: It has no practical use.

name: Fishing Rod
droppedby: General Murius | Minotaur Guard | Swamp Troll | The Horned Fox
buyfrom: Ahmet, Al Dee: 150, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Iriana, John: 300, Lee'Delle: 140, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nelliem, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Raffael, Rafzan, Richard, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zethra, Zora
sellto: Ahmet, Al Dee: 30, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Maro, Maun, Lee'Delle: 30, Lubo, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Rafzan: 30, Red Lilly, Richard: 30, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zethra: 30, Zora
notes:
Fishing rods are used to fish. The more you use a rod, the higher your [[fishing]] skill becomes. Only some squares of water contains fish at any given time, and once a [[fish]] is caught from a square, it will take around 30 minutes for it to [[respawn]]. Fishing is the only skill that is not related to [[combat]].
As of the [[Updates/7.5|Summer Update 2005]], you will also need [[worms]] in order to catch fish. It is also a quite good [[lootbag]] item.
One fishing rod can be seen in [[Al's Shop]] in [[Rookgaard]]. Needed for the [[Demon's Lullaby]] [[World Quest]].

name: Flaming Arrow
droppedby: Annihilon | Blazing Fire Elemental | Bragrumol | Firestarter | Manticore | Memory of a Manticore | Ogre Rowdy | Thornfire Wolf
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes: Causes half '''physical damage''' and half '''fire damage'''.\n50 of them can be obtained through the [[Tower Defence Quest]].

name: Flash Arrow
droppedby: Charged Energy Elemental | Cursed Prospector | Energuardian of Tales | Energy Elemental | Faceless Bane | Ghazbaran | High Voltage Elemental | Knowledge Elemental | Massive Energy Elemental | Urmahlullu the Weakened
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes:
It causes half [[Physical Damage|physical]] and half [[Energy Damage|energy damage]]. The damage reduction from each creature's armor value produces variation in the damages so it's not likely that the energy damage component will equal the physical damage component.

Using elemental arrows is situational. An obvious use case is against creatures that are [[Physical Damage/Immune|immune to physical damage]]. However, higher level paladins are likely to avoid these creatures because their primary damage output is still physical. Low level paladins may consider elemental arrows because they offer more damage than the other store-bought arrows. The [[Arrow]] offers 25 attack while the elemental arrows offer 28 (14 + 14). In addition, half of the damage will be in another element which may improve the damage.

Another option is to use [[Burst Arrow]]s, which offer 27 attack and have no level requirement. [[Burst Arrow]]s cannot miss their target and they may also hit a nearby creature. As a downside, [[Burst Arrow]]s cannot be bought in stores and must be bought from players or obtained from e.g. [[Dragon]]s.
:{{Seealso|Flaming Arrow|Earth Arrow|Shiver Arrow}}
50 of them can be obtained through the [[Tower Defence Quest]].

name: Flask of Cough Syrup
notes:
Looks just like a [[Brown Flask]] and [[Warrior's Sweat]].

\nThis item is needed for a mission of the [[The Ape City Quest]].
flavortext: It smells like herbs.

name: Flask of Demonic Blood
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Betrayed Wraith | Burning Book | Dark Torturer | Dawnfire Asura | Diabolic Imp | Falcon Knight | Floating Savant | Frost Flower Asura | Fury | Furyosa | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Grim Reaper | Grimeleech | Hand of Cursed Fate | Hellflayer | Hellhound | Juggernaut | Kerberos | Kusuma | Mazoran | Midnight Asura | Nightmare | Plagirath | Preceptor Lazare | Ragiaz | Razzagorn | Shulgrax | Tarbaz | The Blazing Rose | The Diamond Blossom | The Flaming Orchid | The Lily of Night | Tormentor | True Dawnfire Asura | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Zamulosh | The Moonlight Aster | The Winter Bloom
notes:
It turns into a [[Strong Mana Potion]] or [[Strong Health Potion]] and the [[Blood Effect]] {{Ilink|Blood Effect}} appears when you ''shake it'' by [[Use|using]] it.
It looks the same as a [[Strong Health Potion]].
{{Seealso|Concentrated Demonic Blood/Statistics}}250 are needed for the [[achievement]] [[Demonic Barkeeper]] and 1 is needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
history: It used to be called ''Concentrated Demonic Blood'' until it was renamed to ''Flask of Demonic Blood'' in [[Updates/12.62.10592|February 09, 2021]], for unknown reasons.\n\nOn [[Updates/12.72.11389|November 09, 2021]] the flask weight has changed from 2.00 oz to 2.90 oz.
flavortext: Shake it to create a potion.

name: Flask of Warrior's Sweat
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Duke Krule | King Zelos | The Enraged Thorn Knight | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | Ushuriel
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Brown Flask]] or a [[Cough Syrup]] flask. Although it's a liquid, it cannot be drank or spilled on the ground.
4 [[Warrior Helmet]]s can be exchanged for this item with [[Haroun]] ([[Blue Djinn Fortress]]) or [[Yaman]] ([[Green Djinn Fortress]]).
Needed for [[Assassin Outfits Quest]], [[Barbarian Outfits Quest]] and [[Knight Outfits Quest]].
flavortext: It contains the sweat spilled in many battles and is said to be used for certain perfumes too.

name: Flask with Paint
notes: It looks the same as a vial of [[Slime (Liquid)|Slime]], an [[Animal Cure]], a [[Flask with Beaver Bait]], [[Wonder Glue]], a [[Flask of Poison]], and a [[Flask of Plant Poison]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Ice Islands Quest]].

name: Flour
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Use a [[scythe]] {{Ilink|Scythe}} to cut [[wheat]] to get [[Bunch of Wheat|bunches of wheat]] {{Ilink|Bunch of Wheat}} from a [[Wheat Field|wheat field]], grind it to flour {{Ilink|Flour}} in a [[millstone]].
Also used in the process of making [[bread]] and [[cake]]s, use it with water from a [[trough]] or [[bucket]] to turn it into a [[Lump of Dough]] and mix with [[milk]] to make a [[Lump of Cake Dough]]. For those with no skill at farming a trip to the pirate kitchen in the upper reaches of [[Nargor]] will yield both flour and lumps of dough. You can also find more than 594 flour in the [[Dream Realm]], {{Mapper Coords|128.77|125.235|14|2|text=here}} close to [[The Dream Master]].
It looks the same as [[Fungus Powder]] and [[Sugar]]. 1 of these is needed in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
24 of these are needed in the [[What a foolish Quest]].
15 are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
2 are needed in the [[Blood Brothers Quest]].
history:
The weight was changed from 5.00 oz to 1.00 oz on the [[Updates/8.5|Update 8.5]].
It happened basically to avoid confusion with how many units of flour are needed in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]] and because flour is actually really light and shouldn't weigh as much as a [[fish]].{{character|Chayenne}}, ''Known and fixed Content Bugs'' thread of ''Private - Test Board'', June 29th, 2009.

name: Flower Bowl
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
buyfrom: Azalea, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Florentine, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nienna, Nydala, Peggy, Rose, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes:
Some [[creatures]] and players using autowalk will not walk over a Flower Bowl, making it a good item to have with you on hunts (if you want to block the way), since it is lighter than a [[Parcel]]. It can be found in many different places throughout [[Tibia]].
\nLooks the same as the [[Helmet of Nature]].

name: Fork
notes:
Can be found in most cities, particularly in castles or taverns.
Looks the same as a [[Milking Fork]].

name: Frost Charm
notes:
This is one of the magical items that the shamans from [[Nibelor]] has found out to mark certain places to concentrate a spiritual gate and unleash their frost magic. There seems to be a certain place in [[Hrodmir]] where you can mark a certain kind of spot...
Obtained and used in [[The Ice Islands Quest]].

name: Frostbite Herb
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It is a rare herb that can be cut from a [[Frostbite Herb (Object)|Frostbite Herb]].\n
\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Ice Islands Quest]].
flavortext: It has been cut from a plant which grows only in very cold regions.

name: Frozen Starlight
notes: Provides 6 squares of permanent blue light with the same range as the [[Utevo Lux]] spell. Can be used for decoration or as a light source, if equipped.\nObtained through the [[Pits of Inferno Quest]]. Can be used to wake [[Yakchal]]. There is a small chance that the Frozen Starlight will break when you try to wake up [[Yakchal]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.9|Christmas Update 2006]]. It didn't irradiate light before [[Updates/7.6|Christmas Update 2005]].

name: Fruit Juice
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Use a [[Juice Squeezer]] on a [[Fruit]] while carrying an empty [[vial]] to make juice from your favourite fruit. Check table of fruits you may use [[Cooking#Fruits for Decorated Cake and Fruit Juice|here]]. It doesn't matter which fruit you use to make the juice, it will always be yellow.\nOne vial of this liquid is needed during [[The Isle of Evil Quest]], and another five are needed during the [[Krailos Quest]].

name: Funeral Urn
notes: Looks the same as an [[Amphora]] and an [[Amphora of Grease]].\nItem temporarily obtained in the [[Explorer Society Quest]]. This item can be found in [[Chor]]
flavortext: It contains the ashes of a lizard high priest.

name: Fur Boots
droppedby: Barbarian Bloodwalker | Barbarian Brutetamer | Barbarian Headsplitter | Barbarian Skullhunter | Bloodback
notes:
In [[Updates/8.2|Summer Update 2008]] these boots received a [[speed]] penalty of -6. There was an unknown decrease in speed before the update, see Discussion for more details.
\nThey are a good replacement for [[Leather Boots]], because they have a higher armor value and are only 3 oz. heavier, but it will make you walk slightly slower.
flavortext: These boots keep your toes warm even in the iciest regions, but they feel kind of heavy.

name: Fur Cap
notes: Most often used as decoration. Value may be high since it is only lootable from a rare-spawning boss creature.
flavortext: It feels nice and warm on your ears.

name: Furry Club
droppedby: Bloodback | Clomp | Headpecker | Mammoth | Memory of a Mammoth | Owin (Creature) | Shadowpelt | The Bloodtusk | Werebear | Wereboar | Hulking Prehemoth
notes: Can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.
history: * Before [[Updates/8.2|Summer Update 2008]], [[Rashid]] used to buy this item for 500 [[gp]].

name: Garlic Necklace
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Blightwalker | Burster Spectre | Ekatrix | Exotic Bat | Novice of the Cult | Witch | Yaga the Crone
notes:
Reduces [[Life Drain]] by 20%. A useful item to significantly reduce life drain attacks such as the [[Frost Dragon]]s smoke wave and [[Demon]]s life drain beam, among others. Especially useful while hunting [[Voodoo Cultists|cults]], since most of the damage you take comes from Life Drain. Item obtained in [[Ghoul Room Quest]], [[Ornamented Shield Quest]], [[Triangle Tower Quest]], [[Troll Cave Quest]], and [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].
Three of these are needed to weaken [[The Count]], and one is needed in [[Blood Brothers Quest]].

name: Gem Holder
notes: This [[item]] is gotten in [[Helmet of the Ancients Quest]], by having [[Cobrafang Dagger]] in inventory, and going through [[teleport]] in [[Stone Tomb|Thalas' Tomb]].
flavortext: This item seems to be a single part of a bigger object.

name: Gemmed Lamp
notes: It looks the same as [[Gemmed Lamp (Fa'hradin's)|Fa'hradin's Gemmed Lamp]].\nObtained in the [[The Djinn War - Marid Faction|Blue Djinn Quest]] or in the [[The Djinn War - Efreet Faction|Green Djinn Quest]].
flavortext: It is the djinn leader's sleeping lamp.

name: Giant Ape's Hair
notes: \nItem temporarily obtained in the [[Banuta Quest]].

name: Giant Shimmering Pearl
droppedby: Alptramun | Amenef the Burning | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Annihilon | Anomaly | Bretzecutioner | Drume | Eradicator | Essence of Malice | Ethershreck | Faceless Bane | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Fleshslicer | Gaz'haragoth | Goshnar's Greed | Goshnar's Hatred | Goshnar's Malice | Goshnar's Megalomania | Goshnar's Spite | Grand Canon Dominus | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Grand Commander Soeren | Guard Captain Quaid | Hazardous Phantom | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | Katex Blood Tongue | Kusuma | Lady Tenebris | Lloyd | Lokathmor | Lucifuga Aranea | Malofur Mangrinder | Maw | Maxxenius | Mazoran | Mazzinor | Melting Frozen Horror | Memory of a Carnisylvan | Mindmasher | Omrafir | Outburst | Plagirath | Plagueroot | Preceptor Lazare | Prince Drazzak | Ragiaz | Ravenous Hunger | Realityquake | Reflection of Obujos | Roaring Water Elemental | Rotspit | Rupture | Scarlett Etzel | Shulgrax | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | Terofar | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Count of the Core | The Duke of the Depths | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The False God | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Last Lore Keeper | The Nightmare Beast | The Sandking | The Souldespoiler | The Source of Corruption | The Time Guardian | The Unarmored Voidborn | The Welter | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Usurper Commander | Venerable Foam Stalker | World Devourer | Zamulosh | Zavarash | Zulazza the Corruptor | Ghulosh
sellto: Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara

name: Giant Smithhammer
notes: It looks the same as a [[Battle Hammer]], a [[Hammer of Mighty Cheating]] and a [[Trunkhammer]].\nFound in the [[Giant Smithhammer Quest]]. Also needed to complete [[The Explorer Society Quest|Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: This cyclopean hammer seems to be an awesome smithing tool.

name: Giant Sword
droppedby: Angry Demon | Askarak Prince | Behemoth | Bibby Bloodbath | Bretzecutioner | Brinebrute Inferniarch | Cliff Strider | Demon | Demon Outcast | Destroyer | Eyeless Devourer | Gaz'haragoth | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Hellhound | Infernal Demon | Katex Blood Tongue | Knight's Apparition | Latrivan | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Rage Squid | Rotten Golem | Srezz Yellow Eyes | Stone Devourer | Stonecracker | Streaked Devourer | Terrorsleep | The Count of the Core | The False God | Ushuriel | Vexclaw | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes:
Two-handed weapon and the heaviest weapon in the game, along with the [[Demonbone]] and [[Twiceslicer]]. It is a popular item, many medium [[level]] knights have one. It was more valuable before the mass introduction of new weapons in the [[Updates/8.0|Update 8.0]]. At the time, the next (and only) regular upgrade a sword-user could expect to attain was the rare [[Sword of Valor]].\nCan be traded for a [[Huge Chunk of Crude Iron]] with [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] ( ''Uth'Prta'' ).
\nCan be obtained through the [[Banshee Quest]].
history:
Before the [[Updates/8.0|Summer Update 2007]], Giant Swords used to look like this: [[File:Giant_Sword_(Old).gif]]
It was easy to [[scam]] people in those days by offering a [[Two Handed Sword]] instead of a Giant Sword.

Its attack and defense values were changed from 50 and 20 to 46 and 22, respectively, with [[Updates/7.0|Update 7.0]].
flavortext: This sword has been forged by ancient giants.

name: Gingerbread Recipe
notes:
You can make [[gingerbreadman|gingerbreadmen]] after you "use" this recipe, it will then disappear (only 1 can be used per character). [[Gingerbreadman|Gingerbreadmen]] can be made using a [[scythe]] to cut [[wheat]] from a [[wheat field]], grind it to [[flour]] in a mill, add [[milk]] with a [[trough]] or [[bucket]] to make [[Lump of Cake Dough]] and bake on an oven at the [[Christmas Bakery]] located in [[Vega]] under Santa's house.
\nLooks the same as [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], a [[Yellow Parchment]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].
sounds: {{Sound List|You can now make gingerbread from normal cake dough in Santa's bakery.}}
flavortext: Use it to learn how to make gingerbread in the christmas bakery.

name: Gingerbreadman
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Can be gotten by [[Santa Claus]] at Christmas Time, Trading 10 [[Christmas Token]]s for the [[Gingerbread Recipe]] or by trading 1 [[Christmas Token]] to [[Ruprecht]] near Santa's house on [[Vega]].
\nIt could also be obtained from [[Grynch Clan Goblin]]s on the [[Santa Event]]\n15 of them are needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Glacier Kilt
droppedby: Bony Sea Devil | Cave Chimera | Crape Man | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Ghazbaran | Grim Reaper | Icecold Book | Sea Serpent | Seacrest Serpent | Soul-Broken Harbinger | Squid Warden | Srezz Yellow Eyes | Tarbaz | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Bloodweb | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Time Guardian | The Winter Bloom | Utua Stone Sting | Varnished Diremaw | Yakchal | Zushuka
notes: It gives 6% protection from [[Ice Damage]], but increases damage taken from [[Energy Damage|Energy]] by 6%. It's part of the [[Glacier Set]].

name: Glacier Mask
droppedby: Animated Feather | Crazed Winter Rearguard | Crystal Spider | Earl Osam | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Hirintror | Ice Dragon | Ice Golem | Icecold Book | Memory of a Dwarf | Neferi the Spy | Paladin's Apparition | Seacrest Serpent | Shardhead | Squid Warden | The Bloodweb | Zushuka
notes: It gives 4% protection from [[Ice Damage]], but increases damage taken from [[Energy Damage|Energy]] by 5%. It's a part of the [[Glacier Set]].

name: Glacier Shoes
droppedby: Foam Stalker | Hirintror | Ice Witch | Icecold Book | Many Faces | Neferi the Spy | Seacrest Serpent | Soul-Broken Harbinger | Usurper Archer | Varnished Diremaw | Zushuka | Two-Headed Turtle | Venerable Foam Stalker
notes: They give 5% protection from [[Ice Damage]], but increase damage taken from [[Energy Damage|Energy]] by 5%. They are part of the [[Glacier Set]].

name: Goat Grass
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Arctic Faun | Dark Faun | Faun | Memory of a Faun | Priestess | Raxias
notes:
It spawns daily in certain places around [[Tibia]]. Like for example [[Eremo's Island]] and the [[Zao Steppe]]. See also [[Daily Respawns]].
\nGoat Grass is an item required by [[Lazaran]] to fulfill a task after you have completed the [[Unnatural Selection Quest]].

name: God Flowers
buyfrom: Azalea, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Florentine, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nienna, Nydala, Peggy, Rose, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Some monsters and players using autowalk will not walk over the God Flower, making it a good item to have with you on hunts, since it is lighter than a [[parcel]]. It can be found in many different places throughout [[Tibia]].

name: Gold Coin
notes:
The most abundant item in Tibia as hundreds of thousands of these are looted every day. For more information, read [[Currency]] and [[List of Creatures That Drop Gold Coins]]. Often abbreviated to "GP" when talking in game, such as "100 gp." For larger amounts it is often seen as 1k for 1,000 gold coins or 1kk for 1,000,000 gold coins. 1,000,000 gold pieces can also be written as 1M (one million, but not commonly used).350 of them can be obtained from the [[Dawnport Quest]] and [[The Rookie Guard Quest]], 250 from [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]], 201 from the [[Mastermind Potion Quest]], 175 from the [[Berserker Treasure Quest]], 103 from the [[Steel Helmet Quest]], 100 from the [[Elvenbane Quest]], the [[Formorgar Mine Quest]], the [[Giant Smithhammer Quest]], the [[Skull of Ratha Quest]], and the [[Steal From Thieves Quest]], 89 from the [[Skeleton Decoration Quest]], 82 from the [[Waterskin of Mead Quest]], 76 from the [[Longsword Quest]], 50 from the [[Goblin Temple Quest]], [[The Explorer Society Quest]], and the [[Uneasy Alliance Quest]], 40 from the [[Bear Room Quest]], 33 from the [[Alawar's Vault Quest]], 5 from the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]], and 3 from the [[Flash Client Tutorial]]. 6 of them can be obtained from [[Belongings of a Deceased]], and 1 can be obtained from breaking a [[Piggy Bank]] and from [[Shiny Stone]]s.
{{Seealso|Shiny Stone/Refining Statistics}}
history: On [[Updates/15.12.c7d92c|October 21, 2025]] the weight was changed from 0.10 oz to 0.01 oz.

name: Gold Nugget
droppedby: Goldhanded Cultist | Goldhanded Cultist Bride | Gorger Inferniarch | Memory of a Yalahari | Srezz Yellow Eyes | Two-Headed Turtle
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes:
You can dig gold nuggets at [[Vigintia#Treasure Hunting|Vigintia's Treasure Hunting Zone]].
You can see some golden nuggets in a locked room under [[Venore]] [[Bank]], also in [[Omruc]]'s pharaoh room below [[Ankrahmun]], and locked in chambers in the [[Circle Room Quest]]. Probably also a few other places around Tibia.\n2 Gold Nuggets can be obtained through the [[First Dragon Quest]] during January.
3 Gold Nuggets can be obtained from [[Brass-Shod Chest]]s inside [[Iksupan]].
history: These existed in-game long before they were made obtainable during [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]]. Rumour has it that someone with [[Key 0000]] in his possession managed to steal them from the room in [[Venore]] back in the day, but that CipSoft knew about this and deactivated the key after taking the nuggets back.

name: Gold Ring
droppedby: Angry Demon | Blightwalker | Cave Chimera | Courage Leech | Dark Carnisylvan | Demon | Ferumbras | Ghazbaran | Golden Servant | Golden Servant Replica | Golgordan | Harpy | Katex Blood Tongue | Latrivan | Misguided Thief | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Ushuriel | Yirkas Blue Scales | Mantosaurus
notes: The Gold Ring is used mostly for decoration. It is often considered a status symbol due to its difficulty to obtain, similar to the [[Ring of the Sky]].

name: Golden Amulet
buyfrom: Augustin, Briasol, Carina, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes: Only used as decoration. Can be seen in [[Omruc]]s pharaoh room in [[Ankrahmun]] and upstairs in the Venore Bank.
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Golden Amulet changed from [[File:Golden Amulet (Old).gif]] to [[File:Golden Amulet.gif]].
flavortext: Many gems glitter on the amulet.

name: Golden Armor
droppedby: Falcon Knight | Falcon Paladin | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Ghazbaran | Golden Servant | Golden Servant Replica | Grand Canon Dominus | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Grand Commander Soeren | Hellflayer | Hellgorak | Horadron | Horestis | Juggernaut | Katex Blood Tongue | Kerberos | Massacre | Preceptor Lazare | The Last Lore Keeper | Undead Dragon | Warlock | Zanakeph | Zarabustor
notes: Part of the [[Golden Set]]. Obtainable through the [[Behemoth Quest]]. Can also be obtained via [[Rust Remover|unrusting]] a [[Slightly Rusted Armor]].
history: * After the [[Updates/8.4]], the Golden Armor became restricted to [[knight]]s and [[paladin]]s.
flavortext: It's an enchanted armor.

name: Golden Boots
notes: They are a part of the [[Golden Set]]. A pair of these can be seen at Darashia's [[Deeper Catacombs|Catacombs]], near [[Koshei the Deathless]]'s room, as well as in the [[Venore Amazon Camp]] treasure room.\n\nThe sprite of the Golden Boots was changed in the Winter Update of 2008. In addition to the change of the sprite, they were also re-introduced into the game. Nowadays they can be seen on various worlds.
history: The boots were given to the character {{character|Erana}} on [[Nova]] for discovering a serious bug that allowed players to get a premium account for free. Erana was asked to write a list of things she would like to get as a thanks and [[CipSoft]] would pick the prize they thought was reasonable. They decided that the boots were the perfect gift. These were, for a very long time, the one and only existing Golden Boots in Tibia.\n\nOn October the 9th, 2004, Golden Boots could be seen in an exhibition on [[The Tibianic]] in [[Antica]].

name: Golden Figurine
sellto: Augustin, Chantalle, Jessica, Odemara, Talila, Tesha, Valindara
notes: You can only read the text if you stand 2 fields from it or closer.
history: On July 26, 2007, a golden figurine bearing the inscription "{{Message|type=look|Honorary Award to Welcome the 100.000th Premium Account. Presented to: ''Player''}}" was given to a lucky player from [[Titania]], as an award for becoming the 100,000th [[Premium Account]] buyer on Tibia. Some of them were given to the members of [[TibiaMx]] soccer team for winning the first [[Fansite Soccer Cup]]. The first one looted in whole tibia was in [[Celesta]] by Ne'roox.

name: Golden Goblet
buyfrom: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes:
It can be either used as a decoration or to award a winner of a player held contest.
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer. Text cannot be edited once saved.
There are three kind of Goblets, [[Bronze Goblet|bronze]], [[Silver Goblet|silver]] and golden. You will also get this item from winning the third and last level (Warlord) of the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]] by killing the 10 [[Warlord Bosses]].

name: Fine Vase
notes: It will [[Broken Pottery|break]] if you move it ({{Sound|Oh no! Your broken the vase!}}, [[Trembling Effect]] is displayed). It looks the same as an [[Elven Vase]], [[Fine Vase (Unknown)]] and a [[Valuable Vase]].\nTemporarly obtained in [[The Traveling Trader Quest]].
flavortext: This vase looks incredibly fragile. Better make sure it won't move one bit

name: Fire Field Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes: [[File:Burned Icon.gif]] Creates a [[Fire]] Field. Every time you step on a fire field you will receive 20 [[Fire Damage]] and receive the [[burning]] [[special condition]], which will cause 10 fire damage over 7 turns, every 9 seconds, for a total of 90 health lost in 1 minute.\n\nThe first stage of the fire field lasts 3:20; the second stage lasts for 2:28; the last stage lasts 1:38. Total time that a fire field will cause damage or block path is 5:48.

name: Fire Wall Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[File:Burned Icon.gif]] Creates a 1x5 [[Fire Field]]s area if shot straight from the body. If shot on an angle, a total of 9 fire field squares will be made spanning 5 sqm vertical and 5 sqm horizontal.
The first stage of the fire field lasts 3:20; the second stage lasts for 2:28; the last stage (that does not block a monster) lasts 1:38. Total time that a fire field will block a monster is 5:48.
\nFor the spell, see [[Fire Wall]].

name: Fireborn Giant Armor
notes: It gives 5% protection against [[Fire Damage|fire]], but also increases damage taken from [[Ice Damage|ice]] attacks by 5%. This armor also raises your [[Sword Fighting]] skill by 2.\n\nObtainable in the [[The Inquisition Quest]].

name: Firewalker Boots
notes: These boots reduce the direct damage from walking on [[Fire|Fire Field]]s by 90% and they also reduce the number of times you burn afterwards (2 instead of 7). They have energy for 60 minutes and can be recharged with an [[Enchanted Small Ruby|enchanted ruby]].\n\nObtained in a mission of [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
flavortext: Wearing these boots reduces the damage gotten from fiery ground.

name: Firlefanz
notes:
Used as a decoration for houses. It can be hung on walls or can be left lying on the floor. Firlefanz is the german word for "nonsense, not usable".
Obtained through the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].

name: Fish Flakes
notes:
These can only be made by blending together special ingredients. It disappears once used.
\nIt looks the same as [[Purple Powder]] and [[Sorrow]].\nMade by [[Magical Blending Device|blending]] a [[Flour]], a [[Worm]], a [[White Mushroom]], an [[Egg]] and a [[Sling Herb]]. Used in the [[Assistant of Eclesius Quest]].
flavortext: Not simple fish flakes, but magical fish flakes supporting linguistic development.

name: Flask of Crown Polisher
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Water (Liquid)|Vial of Water]] and [[Special Flask (Holy Water)|Special Flask containing Holy Water]] or the [[Special Flask (Fools Guild)|Ink of a Quara]].
Needed in a mission of [[The New Frontier Quest]].
flavortext: Ideal to polish crowns.

name: Flask of Rust Remover
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Control Tower | Deepling Scout | Glooth Battery | Rustheap Golem
buyfrom: Harog;After completing {{Spoiler Section|The Hidden City of Beregar Quest|Justice for All}}.
notes:
Can be used to remove the rust from [[Rusty Armor]]s, [[Rusty Helmet]]s, [[Rusty Legs]], and [[Rusty Shield]]s. You have a chance of getting nothing when the following message will appear: {{Sound|The armor was already damaged so badly that it broke when you tried to clean it.}}\n\nCompleting the {{Spoiler Section|The Hidden City of Beregar Quest|Justice for All}} allows you to purchase this item.
Successfully polishing 1000 items with this item grants you the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
Getting a [[Golden Armor]] by successfully polishing a [[Slightly Rusted Armor]] is one of the two requirements to get the [[Lucky Devil]] achievement.
history: In a small patch, its weight was {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|changed}} from 2.50 oz to 0.90 oz on November 10, 2009.
flavortext: It can be used to clean and polish old and rusty armors.

name: Flask with Beaver Bait
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Looks the same as a vial of [[Slime (Liquid)|Slime]], an [[Animal Cure]], [[Wonder Glue]], a [[Flask with Paint]], a [[Flask of Poison]], and a [[Flask of Plant Poison]].\nTemporarily obtained in [[The New Frontier Quest]].
flavortext: It smells like a mixture of wood and fish. Phew.

name: Flask with Magical Oil
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
[[Eclesius]] will make this if you give him the right ingredients. It disappears once used.
Looks the same as a [[Flask with Oil and Blood]] and vials of [[Beer]], [[Mead]], [[Mud]], [[Oil]], [[Rum]] and [[Tea]]. Used in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]]. You need Vial of [[Oil]], a [[Skull (Item)|Skull]], a [[Red Apple]] and a [[Wolf Paw]] to make it.
flavortext: Eclesius made it for you to oil the door of the demon cage.

name: Flawless Ice Crystal
notes: Item obtained in [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].

name: Flower Bouquet
notes: A bouquet of flowers, perfect for [[Valentine's Day]].

name: Flower Dress
notes: Elegant dress made of flowers, they are reasonably rare and a fine decoration. For many people these dresses are valuable. It was first seen on June 1, 2009. {{seealso|Dryad Set}}

name: Flower Wreath
notes: Elegant wreath made of flowers, they are reasonably rare and a fine decoration. For many people these wreaths are valuable. It was first seen on June 1, 2009. Part of the [[Dryad Set]].

name: Focus Cape
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Amenef the Burning | Captain Jones | Dawnfire Asura | Draken Spellweaver | Girtablilu Warrior | Harpy | Hellgorak | Lavafungus | Lizard Dragon Priest | Lumbering Carnivor | Nightmare Scion | Pirat Cutthroat | Raging Mage | Reality Reaver | Sea Serpent | Sister Hetai | Stabilizing Reality Reaver | Tremendous Tyrant | True Dawnfire Asura | Wyrm

name: Food Crate
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Crate]], a [[Crate (Usable)]], an [[Old Crate]], a [[Crate (Wine)]], a [[Crate (Swapped)]], a [[Crate Full of Coral]], a [[Machine Crate]] and a [[Weapons Crate]].
\nItem temporarily obtained in [[Top of the City Quest]].

name: Formula for a Memory Potion
notes: It looks the same as a [[Crumpled Piece of Paper]].\nObtained in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
flavortext: Eclesius invented it.

name: Friendship Amulet
notes:
This item can only be obtained by buying from players as [[TibiaFriends]] has closed. If you use this item you can hear sounds.

Its replica is the [[Friendship Amulet (Replica)]].

It was created by {{character|Sir Ruffuzz}}, who received the first Friendship Amulet. This item was first awarded in a {{Thread|2794941|Halloween Party}} on [[Luminera]] by {{character|Nefen Strongmage Luminera}}.

{{character|Pilux}}, {{character|Annya Anger}}, {{character|Jawor Paank}}, {{character|Anara Shadowdark}} and {{character|Redax}} all won a Friendship Amulet in the contest "Pimp your profile" hosted by [[TibiaFriends]] in 2009.

Other receivers of this item include:
* {{character|Beyolina}} won a Friendship Amulet for her contribution to the Truth Odyssey Art Competition hosted by TibiaFriends in 2010.
* Players placed 3rd in the "My Tibia Story" [http://web.archive.org/web/20100528130521/http://tibiafriends.com/pg/news/Kiwi_Chris/read/46241/my-tibia-story-competition contest], in May, 2010:
** {{character|Natakat}}
** {{character|Geek Luveh}}
* {{character|Karlkoninan}} won a Friendship Amulet for winning TibiaFriends' contest "Best Decorated House in Tibia".
* {{character|Bigx}} was awarded with this amulet for winning second place in lottery of TibiaFriends.
* {{character|Paula Ines}} recieved one in 2010 for winning 1st place in the Christmas Card Competition.
* {{character|Loth Jose}} recieved one in 2010 for winning 2nd Place in the Christmas Card Competition.
* "Royal Painting Contest", hosted by Tibia.com and supported by TibiaFriends:
** {{character|Shallie}} received one for Carlin;
** {{character|Pshyco Druid}} received one for Thais.
* {{character|Ardilla Selassie}} won a Friendship Amulet each for the {{Thread|3383235|Pick the CM's Statement Contest}} hosted by [[TibiaFriends]].
* {{character|Voyant}} won a Friendship Amulet for participating in programming contest hosted by [[TibiaFriends]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail <player>, my friend!|Friends forever!|Look, how our friendship shines!|Hail Tibiafriends!}}
flavortext: It shines as beautifully as a good friendship. This amulet was rewarded by Tibiafriends.

name: Frost Giant Pelt
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Frosty Ear of a Troll
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Frosty Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Frost Dragon Hatchling | Hirintror | Ice Golem | Icecold Book | Melting Frozen Horror | Shardhead | Squid Warden
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Frost]], [[Intricate Frost]] and [[Powerful Frost]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Frost, Intricate Frost, Powerful Frost

name: Frozen Plate
droppedby: Renegade Quara Predator | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Ghazbaran | Leviathan | Melting Frozen Horror
notes: It gives 7% of ice protection, but increases damage taken from energy by 7%. It is only available for [[Paladins]].\nIt was a very rare loot from [[Sea Serpent]]s, but it got removed in a later patch. There were plenty of them around, but in some game worlds this item became very rare. After it could only be looted by [[Ghazbaran]] and [[Leviathan]], it became a valuable item.
history: This item was implemented in game as loot of a [[Sea Serpent]], though this is not the case anymore, making this item much more rare.

name: Fur Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Fur Bag
notes: See [[Bag]] for general information regarding bags.

name: Garlic Bread
notes:
You can't eat this bread. When you try to eat/use this bread, a message appears in the ''Sounds'' area of the game window. You can only bake this bread during a [[Blood Brothers Quest|quest]]. To bake it, use [[Flour]] on [[Special Flask (Holy Water)|Holy Water]], the resulting dough on a [[Bulb of Garlic]], and then the Garlic Dough on an [[Oven]].
Looks the same as [[Bread]] and the [[Stale Bread of Ancientness]].
Item needed in the [[Blood Brothers Quest]].
sounds: {{Sound List|After taking a small bite you decide that you don't want to eat that.}}
flavortext: It is made of holy water and smells lightly of garlic. Sounds better than it actually tastes.

name: Gauze Bandage
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Mummy | Elder Mummy | Mahatheb | Mummy
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Gear Crystal
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Damaged Worker Golem | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Worker Golem
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Gear Wheel
droppedby: Control Tower | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Glooth Battery | Glooth Fairy | Glooth Golem | Golden Servant | Golden Servant Replica | Iron Servant | Iron Servant Replica | Worker Golem
notes:
One of few items weighing less than 0.10 oz. Its value rose considerably in the [[Updates/9.86|9.86 update]] as they are required for entry to the new [[War Golem]] spawn.
Looks the same as a [[Yalahari Gear Wheel]].\nObtained from [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] by trading an [[Iron Ore]] after you start the [[Going Down]] mission in [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]], but you will only be able to trade 3 Iron Ores.

name: Ghastly Dragon Head
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Ghost Charm
notes:
Item temporarily obtained in the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]], in 6th mission.
You can not charge ghost charms once mission 6 of In service of yalahar quest is completed.

name: Ghost Residue
notes: It looks the same as [[Remains of a Ghost]]. This item can be obtained by using a slain [[Tormented Ghost]].\nItem used in the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]], in the 6th mission.

name: Ghost's Tear
notes: Looked the same as [[Countess Sorrow's Frozen Tear]] until update 9.6.\n\nCan be obtained from [[NPC]] [[A Fading Memory]] in [[Blood Brothers Quest]]. Required to fight [[Arthei]].

name: Ghostly Tissue
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
history: * This item was planned to be used for [[Basic Punch]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]] with the release of the [[Monk Vocation Update]], but it was replaced with [[Tarantula Egg]].

name: Giant Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Girl's Dress
notes: Not suitable for males to use.

name: Glacier Amulet
droppedby: Animated Feather | Bashmu | Burster Spectre | Cave Chimera | Crazed Winter Rearguard | Crazed Winter Vanguard | Druid's Apparition | Eyeless Devourer | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Knight's Apparition | Paladin's Apparition | Sea Serpent | Seacrest Serpent | Sorcerer's Apparition | Spiky Carnivor | Tarbaz | Turbulent Elemental | Zushuka
notes:
It gives 20% [[Ice Damage|Ice]] Protection, but increases damage taken from [[Energy Damage|Energy]] by 10%.
Part of the [[Glacier Set]].

name: Glacier Robe
droppedby: Crazed Winter Rearguard | Crazed Winter Vanguard | Druid's Apparition | Girtablilu Warrior | Hazardous Phantom | Icecold Book | King Zelos | Many Faces | Quara Pincher | Quara Predator | Renegade Quara Pincher | Renegade Quara Predator | Squid Warden | Srezz Yellow Eyes | Tarbaz | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Time Guardian | Tremendous Tyrant | Turbulent Elemental | Utua Stone Sting | Yakchal | Zushuka | The Winter Bloom
notes: It gives 8% protection from [[Ice Damage]], but increases damage taken from [[Energy Damage|Energy]] by 8%.\nIt's useful to wear when hunting monsters that use [[ice]] attacks. It is part of the [[Glacier Set]].

name: Gland
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Very few players on Tibia have encountered a [[Rotworm Queen]]. This makes the pheromone gland a very rare find. It's a creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
flavortext: It is the pheromone gland of a rotworm queen.

name: Glimmering Soil
droppedby: Blazing Fire Elemental | Blistering Fire Elemental
notes:
Obtainable during [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].
Can be used to pass the energy wall or fire wall in the Magician's Quarter [[Magician Quarter/Residential Area|Residential Area]] to access the [[Warlock]] and [[Infernalist]] spawns. It can also be used to enter the blue flame and access the [[Demon]]s spawn under the Magician Quarter's [[Magician Quarter/Restricted Area|Restricted Area]].

name: Glob of Acid Slime
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Glob of Mercury
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Glob of Tar
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}\n\nLooks the same as a [[Dark Essence]] and a [[Glob of Grease]].

name: Glorious Axe
droppedby: Bashmu | Bellicose Orger | Enfeebled Silencer | Enraged Crystal Golem | Enslaved Dwarf | Feroxa | Ghazbaran | Infernal Phantom | Lumbering Carnivor | Mutated Tiger | Orewalker | Silencer | Stone Devourer | Weakened Shlorg | Werelion
notes: Not used by many players as a weapon. Usually found in low prices at the [[market]].

name: Glutton's Mace
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Doctor Perhaps]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
Looks the same as [[Meat]]. Beware of [[scam]]s!
There is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: It would be an awesome weapon if the handle weren't that greasy.

name: Gold Ingot
droppedby: Alptramun | Annihilon | Blightwalker | Bony Sea Devil | Branchy Crawler | Brokul | Capricious Phantom | Cave Chimera | Chizzoron the Distorter | Cloak of Terror | Cobra Assassin | Cobra sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes: When in stacks of five or more, the graphic has sparkles over them. [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] can melt your ingot, turning it into a [[Cup of Molten Gold]].\nOne can be obtained through the [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]], 2 from [[The New Frontier Quest]], 3 from the [[Treasure Hunt Quest]], 5 from the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]], 2 if your world succeeds in the [[Lightbearer|Lightbearer Event]] (you must have have helped with it, otherwise you wonÂ´t be able to go to the reward room) and if you lit all 10 basins you will get another 4 and 5 from the [[Rise of Devovorga]]. Can also be obtained from [[Gooey Mass]]es. One can be obtained from the daily task in [[Lion's Rock]] if the player has access to the inner sanctuary and sacrifice a small ruby, a small sapphire, a small emerald and a small topaz in the right order

name: Golden Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Golden Bag
notes: See [[Bag]] for general information regarding bags.

name: Golden Fafnar Trophy
notes: This trophy can be equipped as a light source.\nYou can get it by [[use|using]] the [[Statue of Fafnar (Lightbearer)]] in the reward room of the [[The Lightbearer]] event after you've lit all ten basins during the event.
flavortext: You read: ''Player'' kept all ten fire basins burning and is one of the true lightbearers of this world.

name: Golden Falcon
notes:
This item could only be obtained by winning a contest of [[TibiaBR]]. It was created by {{character|Drigos}} during the [[Item Design Contest]].

Its replica is the [[Golden Falcon (Replica)]].

Current owners of this item are:
* {{character|Antrolla}} on [[Pacera]].
* {{character|Squall Arcalarya}} on [[Julera]].
* {{character|Wiser}} on [[Magera]].
* {{character|Arechion}} on [[Guardia]].
* {{character|Black Swan}} on [[Guardia]].
* {{character|Maria Tereza}} on [[Calmera]].
* {{character|Charmosinha'Pernelope}} on [[Fidera]].
* {{character|Edu The Dark Apokalipse}} on [[Honera]].
* {{character|Railago Titus}} and {{character|Assamita Salubri}} both won a falcon on [[Luminera]] due to a convention in Brazil.
* {{character|Thomas af Hufvudstaden}} on [[Antica]].
* {{character|Mouton Lenoir}} on [[Belobra]].

It looks the same as a [[Golden Falcon (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail TibiaBR.com! Flap! Flap!|Let's hunt, <player>!|Oh, when I get my claws on you...}}
flavortext: It is a token of honour granted only by TibiaBR.

name: Fire Bomb Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes: [[File:Burned Icon.gif]] Creates a 3x3 square of [[Fire Field]]s. The first stage of the fire field lasts 3:20; the second stage lasts for 2:28; the last stage lasts 1:38. Total time that a fire field will block path or cause damage is 5:48.\n\nOn Open PvP worlds, this rune is useful for trapping players during battle, though it allows for low-level characters to suicide and give unjustified kills to unsuspecting combatants.

name: Fireball Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes: [[File:Burned Icon.gif]] Shoots a [[Fire]] Attack, this is the [[Sorcerer]]s' equivalent of the [[Icicle (Rune)|Icicle]].\nFor the spell, see [[Fireball]].
history:
This rune wasn't used much because it inflicted low damage, but after theÂ [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]]Â it became premium and the level requirement changed from 17 to 27, it became more useful against monsters vulnerable toÂ [[Fire Damage]]Â likeÂ [[Ancient Scarab]]s, and creatures that keep distance beyond the reach of the [[Flame Strike]]. It also does not inflict damage on multiple squares anymore.\n\nThe graphics of this rune's effect were changed in the [[Updates/8.1|2007 winter update]]. It used to look like this:
[[File:{{LC:Fireball1.gif}}]]

name: Fishnapped Goldfish
notes: Looks the same as a [[Goldfish Bowl]] and a [[Goldfish Bowl (Object)]].\nTemporarily obtained in [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].
flavortext: It belongs to Theodore Loveless.

name: Fist on a Stick
droppedby: Utua Stone Sting | Sandstone Scorpion | Tomb Servant
notes:
Used to tame a {{Ilink|Dromedary (Mount)}} [[Dromedary]]. It can break while you're trying to tame a dromedary. '''Failed''':
{{Sound|The dromedary flees.}}
'''Failed''':
{{Sound|The dromedary remains stubborn.}}
'''Broke''':
{{Sound|Swinging the fist on a stick with full force, you break the stick.}}
'''Succeeded''':
{{Sound|You tamed the dromedary.*blaaammm*}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Flask of Chitin Dissolver
notes:
Looks the same as [[Water (Liquid)|Vial of Water]] and [[Flask of Crown Polisher]].
This item is given by [[Orockle]] during the "Dissolve Chitin" mission in the [[War Against The Hive Quest]]. It must be used on a dead [[Crawler]] to then get a [[Flask of Dissolved Chitin]].

name: Flask of Dissolved Chitin
notes:
Looks the same as [[Slime (Liquid)|Vial of Slime]] and many other green liquids.
This item can be obtained by using a [[Flask of Chitin Dissolver]] on a dead [[Crawler]] during the "Dissolve Chitin" mission in the [[War Against The Hive Quest]].

name: Flask of Embalming Fluid
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Mummy | Elder Mummy | Mahatheb | Mummy
notes:
One of these is needed for [[The Cursed Crystal Quest]].
One is required for making a [[Prepared Bucket]], which are needed for the [[Thornfire World Change]].
25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Lich Shroud]], [[Intricate Lich Shroud]] and [[Powerful Lich Shroud]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].\n
imbuements: Basic Lich Shroud, Intricate Lich Shroud, Powerful Lich Shroud

name: Flask of Extra Greasy Oil
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: Extra greasy oil from Zalamon's storage.

name: Flask of Plant Poison
notes: Looks the same as a vial of [[Slime (Liquid)|Slime]], an [[Animal Cure]], a [[Flask with Beaver Bait]], a [[Flask with Paint]], a [[Flask of Poison]], and [[Wonder Glue]].Temporarily obtained in [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]]. If lost, you can get a new one from Zalamon at least one hour after receiving the first.
flavortext: This plant poison is meant to destroy the growths near the Keeper's lair deep beneath the gardens.

name: Flask of Poison
notes: Looks the same as a vial of [[Slime (Liquid)|Slime]], an [[Animal Cure]], a [[Flask with Beaver Bait]], a [[Flask with Paint]], [[Wonder Glue]], and a [[Flask of Plant Poison]].Needed for [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: This poison is meant to weaken the enemy and should be used on the rice fields near Chaochai.

name: Flask of Wasp Poison
notes: \nItem temporarily obtained in the [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].
flavortext: It's very toxic. Do not ever drink green liquids.

name: Fleshy Bone
notes: It can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.32|126.92|10|4|text=here}}.\nItem temporarily obtained in the [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].
flavortext: Dogs would probably find this treat really yummy.

name: Flexible Dragon Scale
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[A Father's Burden Quest]].

name: Flintstone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Can be transformed into [[Shimmer Sword]] by using with a [[Shimmer Swimmer]].

name: Four-Leaf Clover
notes:
Item used to tame a [[Ladybug]]. Can only be obtained by using [[Gooey Mass]], found inside of the [[Hive]] by using [[Insectoid Cell]]s. It probably has chance to break when used like all taming items. Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The lady bug is trying to nibble you.}}
Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The bug got scared and ran away.}}
Succeeded: {{Message|type=sound|You tamed the lady bug.}}
[[File:Biedrona2.png|thumb|The [[Ladybug (Mount)|ladybug]] is tamed using the four-leaf clover.]]
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Foxtail
droppedby: Deepling Guard | Black Vixen | Deepling Tyrant
notes: Item used to tame a [[Manta Ray]]. There is a chance that the Manta Ray will eat the Foxtail when you use it on them.
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Fresh Mushroom Beer
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Fresh Mushroom Beer turns into [[Stale Mushroom Beer]] 20 seconds after buying it from NPC.\nNeeded in [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] if you fail the recruitment test.

name: Frozen Heart
notes:
Since [[TibiaTr]] left the fansite programme, this item cannot be obtained any more.
Its replica is the [[Frozen Heart (Replica)]]. It was rewarded to {{character|Kyward}} for creating it. In total there 9 Frozen Hearts were given in game, 6 of them are on [[Optional PvP]] servers and 3 originally on [[PvP]] servers. It shows TR on the heart when it is on the last phase of melting, TR stands for [[TibiaTr]]. When using a frozen heart, it starts to melt and looks like this for around 15 seconds: [[File:Frozen Heart (Melting).gif]]
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail TibiaTr.net!|The world was born from Tibiasula's love.|Look after TibiaTR's frozen heart. I've left it with you.|Could a dead, frozen heart beat again? It felt like mine was about to.}}
flavortext: The eternal love is awarded by TibiaTR.net.

name: Gamemaster Doll
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand 2 square meters from it or closer.
\nAll [[Gamemaster]]s received this doll on August 24, 2010 along with one other item of choice: [[Dark Trinity Mace]], [[Solar Axe]], [[The Epiphany]], [[Great Shield]], [[Ferumbras' Hat]], [[Rainbow Shield]], [[Snake God's Wristguard]] or [[Royal Crossbow]]. A few ex-Gamemasters that were still active at the time also received the doll.
\nAs this doll is very rare and not obtainable anymore, it's highly desired by collectors. The value of this doll varies between [[Open PvP]] and [[Optional PvP]] worlds, on March 19, 2022 one was sold on Optional PvP world [[Secura]] for the sum of 2,010,000,000 [[gp]].
flavortext: It was awarded in memory of the dedicated service of Tibia's gamemaster team.

name: Gemmed Lamp (Fa'hradin's)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Gemmed Lamp]].Temporarily obtained in the [[The Djinn War - Marid Faction|Blue Djinn Quest]] or in the [[The Djinn War - Efreet Faction|Green Djinn Quest]]. It can be bought from [[Black Bert]], but only if you have the quest for The Djinn War and can buy from Black Bert. You need to complete [[The Thieves Guild Quest]] before you can trade with him.
flavortext: It is Fa'hradin's enchanted lamp.

name: Geomancer's Robe
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
flavortext: It's too tiny to be worn by humans.

name: Geomancer's Staff
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Ghost Duster
notes: Looks the same as a [[Broom]] and a [[Witchesbroom]].Used during the [[World Task]] [[A Pirate's Death to Me]] to kill [[Ghost Rat]]s. Found at the northeast corner of the lower deck with an [[Emergency Kit]].

name: Ghoul Snack
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
This arm is from a human body. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

\n2 are needed for the [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].

name: Giant Crab Pincer
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Mostly used for decoration. It is highly recommended to not sell this item to NPC.

name: Giant Shrimp
droppedby: Quara Pincher | Quara Predator | Renegade Quara Pincher | Renegade Quara Predator
notes:
This is the item needed to tame a [[Crustacea Gigantica]] [[image:Titanica.gif]]. It has a chance of breaking when used.
Failed: '''The gigantic creature is trying to pinch you.'''
Failed: '''The gigantic creature ran away.'''
Succeeded: '''You tamed the gigantic creature.'''
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Gill Coat
notes: Part of the [[Gill Set]]

name: Gill Gugel
notes: Part of the [[Gill Set]]

name: Gill Legs
notes: Part of the [[Gill Set]].

name: Gill Necklace
notes:
The resistances and charges on this item make it very attractive, but one major drawback is the prevalence of poisoning monsters - poison damage will be blocked, wasting charges. The other necklace, [[Prismatic Necklace]], has physical/energy resistance instead and may be an alternative purely for the physical resistance. Still, it is a useful necklace and quite affordable with the popularity of [[warzones]] (mostly on optional PvP servers).
Can be obtained as reward of the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] in [[Warzone 1]].

name: Girlish Hair Decoration
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Glacial Rod
droppedby: Animated Feather | Bony Sea Devil | Burster Spectre | Capricious Phantom | Cliff Strider | Distorted Phantom | Flimsy Lost Soul | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Hazardous Phantom | Icecold Book | Ironblight | Many Faces | Schiach | Squid Warden | Irgix the Flimsy
flavortext: Hurls the icy essence of the Svargrond glaciers.

name: Globe Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Globe}} [[Globe]]. It looks the same as a tiny [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a globe.

name: Glow Wine
notes:
This is the item needed to [[Magma Crawler (Mount)|tame]] a [[Magma Crawler]]. {{Ilink|Magma Crawler (Mount)}} It has a chance of breaking.
Failed: {{Sound|The magma crawler is smelling the glow wine suspiciously.}}
Failed: {{Sound|The magma crawler refused to drink the wine and vanishes into thin air.}}
Broken: {{Sound|Argh! The magma crawler pushed you and you spilled the glow wine!}}
Succeeded: {{Sound|You tamed the magma crawler.}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Glowing Mushroom
Gnomevil's Hat
notes: A creature product which can be given to [[Gnomission]] by saying ''hero''. Once handed in you will no longer need a [[Red Teleport Crystal]] to enter the second warzone, meaning you can hunt there but cannot fight [[Gnomevil]] more than once in a 20 hour period.

name: Gnomish Extraction Crystal
notes: Use this on a fresh [[Crystalcrusher]] corpse. Item temporarily obtainable in the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] - [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest/Spoiler#Raiders of the Lost Spark|Spark Hunting]] task.

name: Gnomish Repair Crystal
notes: Item temporarily obtainable in the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] - [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest/Spoiler#Crystal Keeper|Crystal Keeper]] task.

name: Gnomish Supply Package
notes:
Open it to get one of the following items:
* {{Ilink|White Mushroom}} 20 [[White Mushroom]]s * {{Ilink|Mushroom Pie}} 1 [[Mushroom Pie]] * {{Ilink|Envenomed Arrow}} 15 [[Envenomed Arrow]]s * {{Ilink|Crystalline Arrow}} 15 [[Crystalline Arrow]]s * {{Ilink|Teleport Crystal}} 1 [[Teleport Crystal]] * {{Ilink|Strong Health Potion}} 2 [[Strong Health Potion]]s * {{Ilink|Strong Mana Potion}} 2 [[Strong Mana Potion]]s * {{Ilink|Health Potion}} 4 [[Health Potion]]s * {{Ilink|Mana Potion}} 4 [[Mana Potion]]s * {{Ilink|Great Mana Potion}} 1 [[Great Mana Potion]] * {{Ilink|Great Health Potion}} 1 [[Great Health Potion]] * {{Ilink|Bullseye Potion}} 1 [[Bullseye Potion]] * {{Ilink|Berserk Potion}} 1 [[Berserk Potion]] * {{Ilink|Mastermind Potion}} 1 [[Mastermind Potion]] * {{Ilink|Transcendence Potion}} 1 [[Transcendence Potion]] * {{Ilink|Red Piece of Cloth}} 1 [[Red Piece of Cloth]] * {{Ilink|Platinum Coin}} 5 [[Platinum Coins]]s * {{Ilink|Pet Pig}} 1 [[Pet Pig]] * {{Ilink|Gnomish Voucher Type CA2}} 1 [[Gnomish Voucher Type CA2]] * {{Ilink|Gnomish Voucher Type MA2}} 1 [[Gnomish Voucher Type MA2]] * {{Ilink|Crystal Coin}} 1 [[Crystal Coin]] * {{Ilink|Red Gem}} 3 [[Red Gem]]s * {{Ilink|Yellow Gem}} 1 [[Yellow Gem]] * {{Ilink|Red Teleport Crystal}} 1 [[Red Teleport Crystal]] * {{Ilink|Blue Gem}} 1 [[Blue Gem]] * {{Ilink|Green Gem}} 1 [[Green Gem]] {{Seealso|Gnomish Supply Package/Statistics}} Obtained by doing [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] tasks.

name: Gnomish Voucher Type CA1
notes:
Use it to obtain the first addon of the [[Crystal Warlord Outfits]]. The [[Ice Crystal Effect]] {{Ilink|Ice Crystal Effect}} will appear on you. You cannot use it if you already possess this addon or you do not currently have [[Premium Time]] running.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all other [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.
flavortext: It is a voucher for the first addon of the crystal warlord outfit.

name: Gnomish Voucher Type CA2
notes: Use it to obtain the second addon of the [[Crystal Warlord Outfits]]. The [[Ice Crystal Effect]] {{Ilink|Ice Crystal Effect}} will appear on you. You cannot use it if you do not currently have [[Premium Time]] running, lack the base outfit or already possess this addon.\nIt looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all other [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.\nObtained very rarely from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.
flavortext: It is a voucher for the second addon of the crystal warlord outfit.

name: Gnomish Voucher Type CB
notes:
Use it to obtain the basic [[Crystal Warlord Outfits|Crystal Warlord Outfit]]. The [[Ice Crystal Effect]] {{Ilink|Ice Crystal Effect}} will appear on you. You cannot use it if you already possess this addon or if you do not currently have [[Premium Time]] running.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all other [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.
flavortext: It is a voucher for a basic crystal warlord outfit.

name: Gnomish Voucher Type MA1
notes:
Use it to obtain the first addon of the [[Soil Guardian Outfits]]. [[Poison Effect 3]] {{Ilink|Poison Effect 3}} will appear on you. You cannot use it if you already possess this addon or if you do not currently have [[Premium Time]] running.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all other [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.
flavortext: It is a voucher for the first addon of the soil guardian outfit.

name: Gnomish Voucher Type MA2
notes:
Use it to obtain the second addon of the [[Soil Guardian Outfits]]. [[Poison Effect 3]] {{Ilink|Poison Effect 3}} will appear on you. You cannot use it if you do not currently have [[Premium Time]] running, lack the base outfit or already possess this addon.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all other [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.\nObtained very rarely from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.
flavortext: It is a voucher for the second addon of the soil guardian outfit.

name: Gnomish Voucher Type MB
notes:
Use it to obtain the basic [[Soil Guardian Outfits]]. [[Poison Effect 3]] {{Ilink|Poison Effect 3}} will appear on you. You cannot use it if you already possess this addon or if you do not currently have [[Premium Time]] running.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]], a [[Soul Contract]] and all other [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.
flavortext: It is a voucher for a basic soil guardian outfit.

name: Goblin Ear
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\nUsed in the [[Witches' Cauldron Quest]].

name: Goblin Statue Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Goblin Statue}} [[Goblin Statue]]. It looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a goblin statue.

name: Gold Medal
notes:
It can be seen on [[Treasure Rooms#Adventurer's Guild Treasure Room|Adventurer's Guild Treasure Room]] under a [[Jewel Case]]. Probably a future [[Contest Prizes|contest prize]]. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nYou can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer.

name: Golden Can of Oil
droppedby: Ethershreck | Golden Servant | Golden Servant Replica
notes:
Used to tame [[Uniwheel (Mount)]]. [[image:Uniwheel_(Mount).gif]]
Succeeded: '''Vroooomratatatatatatat.'''
'''The strange wheel seems to vibrate and slowly starts turning continuously.'''
Failed: '''Splosh!'''
'''It looks like most of the special oil this can was holding was spilt without any effect.'''
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Golden Fir Cone
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Fir Cone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dazed Leaf Golem | Leaf Golem | Wilting Leaf Golem
notes: This item can be used in place of a [[Fir Tree]] in the process of making a [[Golden Fir Cone]].

name: Firecatcher Urn
notes: Obtained and used during [[The Repenters Quest]].
flavortext: This special urn seems to hum slightly.

name: Fireproof Horn
droppedby: Chakoya Toolshaper | Chakoya Tribewarden | Chakoya Windcaller
notes: Use this item with a [[Tinder Box]] to make a [[Melting Horn]].
flavortext: It's very sturdy and could even be considered fireproof.

name: Flask with Oil and Blood
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It looks the same as a [[Flask with Magical Oil]] and vials of [[Beer]], [[Mead]], [[Mud]], [[Oil]], [[Rum]] and [[Tea]].\nObtained and used in [[The Cursed Crystal Quest]].
flavortext: It contains a strange mixture of embalming fluid and medusa blood.

name: Flute Made of a Single Bone
actualname: flute made of a single bone
notes: It looks the same as a [[Bone Flute]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: It is polished smooth and gleams ghastly.

name: Food Matrix Crystal
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Memory Crystal]].
{{seealso|Weapon Matrix Crystal}}\nTemporarily obtained in the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]], mission 8. Can be found in a quest box, [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}128.101-122.33-10-2-1-1 here].
history: Before [[Updates/9.6|Summer Update 2012]], its name was '''Matrix Crystal''' and it looked the same as a [[Life Crystal]].
flavortext: It contains patterns to create food.

name: Frazzle Skin
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Frazzlemaw | Guzzlemaw | Weakened Frazzlemaw
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Blockade]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Frazzle Tongue
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Frazzlemaw | Guzzlemaw | Mawhawk | Reflection of Mawhawk | Weakened Frazzlemaw
notes: Its only purpose is to be sold to NPCs. It has a high gold-to-oz ratio.

name: Friendship Amulet (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This item is a replica of [[Friendship Amulet]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Frozen Heart (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This item is a replica of [[Frozen Heart]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Full Storage Flask
notes: Looks like a [[Berserk Potion]] with something in it.\nTemporarily obtained and used in the [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: You hear an angry, hissing noise from it.

name: Fungus Powder
notes: It looks the same as [[Strange Powder]] and [[Sugar]].\nTemporarily obtained and used in the [[Oramond_Quest/Spoiler#Tending_Gloothworms|Oramond Quest - Tending Gloothworms]].
flavortext: Gloothworms love it.

name: Furious Frock
notes: It has the same attributes as [[Royal Scale Robe]], except that the furious frock weighs less.

name: Furniture Kit
notes:
[[Furniture]] come wrapped in this package when bought. It can be unwrapped and re-wrapped while inside a house.
\nIt looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Before [[Updates/10.92|april 2016]], furniture bought from NPCs came in a usable [[Furniture Package|furniture kit]] that couldn't be repackaged.

name: Gas Bag
notes:
When it is full it is called a [[Full Gas Bag]].
It looks the same as a [[Waterskin]] and a [[Full Gas Bag]].\nTemporarily obtained in [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.

name: Gearwheel Chain
droppedby: Control Tower | Glooth Battery | Glooth Bomb | Glooth Golem | Rustheap Golem | Walker
notes: Supersedes the [[Platinum Amulet]] for players who meet the level requirement. An [[Enchanted Werewolf Amulet]] has no level requirement and provides more physical protection where [[Moonlight Crystals]] are available. Higher level players can also consider a [[Foxtail Amulet]].

name: Ghost Detector
notes: Part of the [[Spike Tasks Quest]].

name: Giant Pacifier
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Moohtant | Bullwark | Moohtant | Moohtant Wallbreaker

name: Giant Screwdriver
notes: Looks the same as a [[Spear]] and a [[Mean Paladin Spear]].\nPart of the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 12.

name: Giant Shimmering Pearl (Brown)
droppedby: Bony Sea Devil | Cobra Vizier | Deepworm | Hive Overseer | Ink Blob | Kollos | Lumbering Carnivor | Ogre Rowdy | Prince Drazzak | Renegade Quara Pincher | Shadowpelt | Shark | Sorcerer's Apparition | Srezz Yellow Eyes | The Percht Queen | The Scourge of Oblivion | Usurper Commander | Vibrant Phantom
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes: There are also [[Giant Shimmering Pearl (Green)|green Giant Shimmering Pearls]]. You cannot stack two different-coloured pearls. It has no known use, but it can be used for decoration. You can attempt obtaining one from a [[Sea Shell]] every 20 hours.

name: Giant Shimmering Pearl (Green)
droppedby: Blemished Spawn | Blightwalker | Bony Sea Devil | Bragrumol | Cave Chimera | Crape Man | Diremaw | Falcon Knight | Falcon Paladin | Foam Stalker | Glooth Brigand | Hellflayer | Juggernaut | Killer Caiman | Poisonous Carnisylvan | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Rotten Golem | Seacrest Serpent | Spidris | Spidris Elite | The Percht Queen | Two-Headed Turtle | Usurper Archer | Usurper Warlock | Iks Ahpututu | Iks Pututu | Sulphur Spouter
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes:
There are also [[Giant Shimmering Pearl (Brown)|brown Giant Shimmering Pearls]]. You cannot stack two different-coloured pearls. It has no known use, but it can be used for decoration. You can attempt obtaining one from a [[Sea Shell]] every 20 hours.\n3 can be obtained through the [[Rise of Devovorga]].
1 can be obtained through [[The Lightbearer]].

name: Glass of Goo
notes:
Can be equipped in the belt slot as a light source.\n
\n[[File:Glass of Goo light.png]]

name: Glass Tube
notes: Not really worth anything, as you can obtain another at any time by asking NPC [[Elbert]] for a "glass tube". Make sure you don't already have one in your backpack, or he'll refuse to give you one. Obtained and used in the {{Spoiler Section|Glooth Factory Quest|Mutated Glooth Plague}}.

name: Glob of Glooth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Glob of Grease
notes: Looks the same as a [[Glob of Tar]] and a [[Dark Essence]].\nPart of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 12.

name: Glooth Amulet
droppedby: Blood Beast | Devourer | Glooth Anemone | Glooth Bandit | Glooth Blob | Glooth Brigand | Glooth Fairy | Glooth Golem | Rot Elemental
notes: Similar to an [[Elven Amulet]] or a [[Might Ring]]. Can be obtained by using a [[Glooth Bag]].
resist: physical +10%, fire +10%, earth +10%, energy +10%, ice +10%, holy +10%, death +10%

name: Glooth Axe
droppedby: Blood Beast | Devourer | Glooth Anemone | Glooth Bandit | Glooth Blob | Glooth Brigand | Glooth Fairy | Glooth Golem | Lisa | Rot Elemental
notes: Breaks after 2 hits (this includes physical [[spells]]).Can be obtained by using a [[Glooth Bag]].

name: Glooth Backpack
notes:
It can be obtained by ''opening'' a [[Glooth Bag]].
{{Seealso|Glooth Bag/Statistics}}\n\nSee [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Glooth Bag
droppedby: Deep Terror | Empowered Glooth Horror | Glooth Bandit | Glooth Brigand | Professor Maxxen | Tremor Worm
notes:
Use it to get one of the following:
*[[File:Glooth Spear.gif]] 2 [[Glooth Spear]]s
*[[File:Glooth Club.gif]] [[Glooth Club]]
*[[File:Glooth Amulet.gif]] [[Glooth Amulet]]
*[[File:Glooth Blade.gif]] [[Glooth Blade]]
*[[File:Glooth Sandwich.gif]] 10 [[Glooth Sandwich]]es
*[[File:Glooth Axe.gif]] [[Glooth Axe]]
*[[File:Bowl of Glooth Soup.gif]] 10 [[Bowl of Glooth Soup|Bowls of Glooth Soup]]
*[[File:Glooth Steak.gif]] 10 [[Glooth Steak]]s
*[[File:Glooth Backpack.gif]] [[Glooth Backpack]]

Considering the prices of the 4 items that can be sold to [[Flint]] and the opening statistics, each Glooth Bag is worth approximately 970 [[gp]].

name: Glooth Spear
droppedby: Blood Beast | Devourer | Glooth Anemone | Glooth Bandit | Glooth Brigand | Glooth Fairy | Glooth Golem | Rot Elemental
notes: Lasts about 2 to 8 hits (break rate somewhere in range 18-36% [95% [[Wikipedia:Confidence interval|CI]]]). This weapon is not very useful due to its high breakage-to-weight ratio in comparison to [[Assassin Star]]s. It may be employed, for instance, by level 60-80 [[Paladin|paladins]] to solo boss creatures in tight spaces, since it is the weapon dealing the most damage for this level range (''effective'' attack value including 75% hit rate is '''41.25''').\nTwo of these can be obtained by using a [[Glooth Bag]].
