name: Glowing Rubbish Amulet
notes:
This is the charged version of a [[Rubbish Amulet]].
\nIt will expire 5 minutes after being looted.\nIt's necessary during the {{Spoiler Section|Cults of Tibia Quest|Misguided}}
flavortext: To some it is rubbish, others see it as the most magnificent necklace in the world. This one glows violently.

name: Goblin Bone Key
notes: It looks the same as a [[Bone Key]] and [[Omrabas' Bone Key]].

name: Gold Converter
notes: A Gold Converter comes in handy when you need capacity and your bags are packed with gold. "Use" the Gold Converter to change either a stack of 100 gold pieces into 1 [[Platinum Coin|platinum coin]], or a stack of 100 [[Platinum Coin|platinum coins]] into 1 [[Crystal Coin|crystal coin]]. Once you have used the Gold Converter for the 500th time, it will break and vanish into thin air.\n\nGold Converters can only be stored in the [[depot]] or the [[Store Inbox|Store inbox]]. Also, it is not possible to give them to other characters. It's the "manual" version of the [[Magic Gold Converter]] which does the conversion automatically but cost 3 times more.
flavortext: You bought this item in the Store or gained it as a daily reward.\nThis item cannot be traded.

name: Gold Pouch
notes: The Gold Pouch is a special container that you can have in [[Your Store Inbox]]. It can only hold [[Gold Coin|Gold]], [[Platinum Coin|Platinum]] and [[Crystal Coin|Crystal]] coins, but it has infinite slots. It can be useful for players that struggle with having to carry a lot of empty containers to acommodate the coins picked up from loot, but because of its high cost it can take a long time to pay itself when compared to not picking up the money, specially gold. \n\nIt's important to note that the coins in the Gold Pouch are still counted in the character's capacity, so in that regard it only helps that you save the additional weight of other containers.
flavortext: This item cannot be traded.

name: Gold Token
droppedby: Alptramun | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Anomaly | Eradicator | Essence of Malice | Ghulosh | Gorzindel | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Kroazur | Lady Tenebris | Lloyd | Lokathmor | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Mazzinor | Melting Frozen Horror | Outburst | Plagueroot | Ravenous Hunger | Realityquake | Rupture | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | The Baron from Below | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Count of the Core | The Duke of the Depths | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The False God | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Last Lore Keeper | The Nightmare Beast | The Sandking | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Souldespoiler | The Source of Corruption | The Time Guardian | The Unarmored Voidborn | World Devourer
notes:
It can be exchanged with [[Yana]] for various [[Weapons of Destruction|weapons]] and for [[Creature Products]] that can be used to [[Imbuing|imbue]] them.

25000 are needed for the [[Royal Costume Outfits Quest]].
You have a chance of finding one when opening a [[Surprise Jar]].
history:
This item was implemented in the [[Updates/10.90|Winter Update 2015]], but only gained a use with the [[Updates/10.94|Summer Update 2016]].
\nIts weight was changed from 0.20 to 0.01 oz with the [[Updates/12.80.11430|Winter Update 2021]].

name: Fire Blacksteel Replica
notes: This item is a replica of a [[Fiery Blacksteel Sword]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.\n\nThis is the only fire-enchanted replica weapon that was named '''Fire''' instead of '''Fiery''', which may have been a bug that was never fixed even though it was reported multiple times.

name: Fireworks Capsule
notes: You can fill them with different colors of Fireworks Powder to create Fireworks Rockets.

name: Fireworks in Shape of '0'

flavortext: It can be disassembled with the right tool.

name: Final Judgement

notes: Item needed to get addon 1 of [[Hand of the Inquisition Outfits Quest|Hand of the Inquisition Outfits]].

name: Fire Amplification
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your targets sensitivity to your [[Fire Damage]] attacks by 8% for one hour. It only affects attacks against monsters.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily amplifies fire damage against monsters.

name: Fire Resilience
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your [[Fire Damage]] protection by 8% for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases fire protection.

name: Firewood
notes: Temporarily obtained during the [[Too Hot to Handle Quest]].\n

name: Fitzwilliam's Special Reserve
notes: Part of the [[Malefitz]] achievement.
flavortext: A fine but practically ancient wine. It's absolutely not advised to actually drink it.

name: Flaccid Salad
notes: They can be found on the floor around [[The Feeding Grounds]].\n\nThey are required for the ''Do not Feed the Porker'' game of the [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Flask with Lamp Oil
notes: It disappears 10 minutes after being obtained. \n\nYou can pick one from the chest in the [[Cobra Bastion]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|130.113|127.158|7|8|1|0.1250.125}} and use it on the [[Tendril Wall]] {{Mapper Coords|text=here|130.116|127.126|3|8|1|0.1250.125}} to light it on fire and open the passage.
flavortext: This lamp oil is highly flammable and evaporates quickly.

name: Flask with Snake Poison
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It's an [[Empty Ritual Flask]] that was filled with [[Cobra]] poison. It disappears some time after being filled.\n\nIf you use it on the Large Cauldron inside the [[Cobra Bastion]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|130.119|127.151|5|4|1|0.250.25}}, all the Cobras will start spawning with 75% of their total hitpoints. The effect lasts for 30 minutes.
flavortext: The cobra poison in this flask is very potent. Even inhaling it would be dangerous. It leaks a bit and will evaporate shortly.

name: Galthen's Satchel
notes:
Cannot be equipped in the backpack slot.\nObtained during the [[Adventures of Galthen Quest]].
\nOn {{post|39221314|August 16, 2021}} Rejana confirmed with a forum post that it is possible to get the item multiple times and that it's an intended behaviour. The time gap between each time you get a new satchel is 30 days.
flavortext: The original satchel in which Galthen once carried all his personal notes and research.

When you do so, the following message will appear: "{{Server Message|As you start polishing the lantern it begins to glow in an otherworldly light.}}"\nCan be obtained by using a [[Spider Web]] {{Mapper Coords|text=here|128.56|123.176|9|4|1|0.250.25}}. Part of the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: It is made of filigree silver braces and delicate indigo glass. But it is dark at the moment.

Unlike the other [[Flower Pot]]s plants and flowers, the Winterblossom grows from [[Ice Flower Seeds]] and not from common [[Seeds]].

See [[Flower Pot]] for details on how to plant and grow different types of plants.

notes: A Dryad's Heart flower has been planted here. If it's not watered enough, it will start to become [[Flower Pot (Dryad's Heart, Grown Dry)|dry]]. It can be transformed into a [[Flower Pot (Dryad's Heart, Permanent)|permanent]] plant that does not need watering by using [[Ice Flower Seeds]] on it.\n\nSee [[Flower Pot]] for details on how to plant and grow different types of plants.

name: Gingerbread Key
Gingerbread Key (Moon Melon and Raspberry)
notes: This [[Gingerbread Key]] has had the first and second glaze applied after using a [[Flask with Moon Melon Sirup]] and a [[Flask with Raspberry Sirup]] on it. This is one of three stages the key will go through during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest#Sweet Dreams|Sweet Dreams Quest]].\n\nTo make this key, you must combine [[Sugar (Quest)|Sugar]] {{Ilink|Sugar (Quest)}} with a [[Moon Melon]] {{Ilink|Moon Melon}}, as well as [[Sugar (Quest)|Sugar]] {{Ilink|Sugar (Quest)}} with a [[Raspberry]] {{Ilink|Raspberry}}. This creates a [[Flask with Moon Melon Sirup]] {{Ilink|Flask with Moon Melon Sirup}} and a [[Flask with Raspberry Sirup]] {{Ilink|Flask with Raspberry Sirup}}, which you will then use on a [[Gingerbread Key]] {{Ilink|Gingerbread Key}} in that order.
flavortext: It is glazed with moon melon and raspberry icing.

name: Gingerbread Key (Moon Melon)
notes: This [[Gingerbread Key]] has had the first glaze applied after using a [[Flask with Moon Melon Sirup]] on it. This is one of three stages the key will go through during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest#Sweet Dreams|Sweet Dreams Quest]].\n\nTo make this key, you must combine [[Sugar (Quest)|Sugar]] {{Ilink|Sugar (Quest)}} with a [[Moon Melon]] {{Ilink|Moon Melon}}. This creates a [[Flask with Moon Melon Sirup]] {{Ilink|Flask with Moon Melon Sirup}}, which you will then use on a [[Gingerbread Key]] {{Ilink|Gingerbread Key}}.
flavortext: It is glazed with moon melon icing.

name: Gingerbread Key (Moon Melon, Raspberry and Lemon)
notes: This [[Gingerbread Key]] has had the first, second, and third glaze applied after using a [[Flask with Moon Melon Sirup]], a [[Flask with Raspberry Sirup]], and a [[Flask with Lemon Sirup]] on it. This is the final stage the key will go through during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest#Sweet Dreams|Sweet Dreams Quest]].\n\nTo make this key, you must combine [[Sugar (Quest)|Sugar]] {{Ilink|Sugar (Quest)}} with a [[Moon Melon]] {{Ilink|Moon Melon}}, as well as [[Sugar (Quest)|Sugar]] {{Ilink|Sugar (Quest)}} with a [[Raspberry]] {{Ilink|Raspberry}}, and lastly [[Sugar (Quest)|Sugar]] {{Ilink|Sugar (Quest)}} with a [[Lemon]] {{Ilink|Lemon}}. This creates a [[Flask with Moon Melon Sirup]] {{Ilink|Flask with Moon Melon Sirup}}, a [[Flask with Raspberry Sirup]] {{Ilink|Flask with Raspberry Sirup}}, and a [[Flask with Lemon Sirup]] {{Ilink|Flask with Lemon Sirup}}, which you will then use on a [[Gingerbread Key]] {{Ilink|Gingerbread Key}} in that order.
flavortext: It is glazed with moon melon, raspberry and lemon icing.

name: Gingerbread Key Recipe
notes: Obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
flavortext: Make a soft chocolate dough and shape it into a key. (note: Only the oven in Feyrist has suitable baking tins for this.) Then glaze the key with moon melon, raspberry and lemon icing.

name: Golden Helmet
notes: Part of the [[Golden Set]]. It can be seen in [[Treasure Rooms#Hellgate Treasure Chamber|Hellgate Treasure Chamber]], [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis Room]] and [[Treasure Rooms#Beregar Treasure Room|Pythius The Rotten's Treasure Room]].
history:
* This rare item was obtainable a long time ago from the [[Daemon]] until a later update. After the introduction of [[Character World Transfer]]s, more servers got access to this legendary helmet. * Its armor value was changed from 13 to 12 with [[Updates/7.0|Update 7.0]]. * [[CM]] [[Skerio]] wrote on {{Post|39252841|November 21, 2021}}: ''"(...) items which cannot be gained in the game any longer and have to be acquired from other players, e.g. golden helmet (...)"'', which means that, as of that date, Golden Helmet was not lootable from bosses or quests. ==== Story from Karl ==== An old story from Karl, former "Wizard" (that's what [[Gamemaster]]s were called a long time ago):
Before I begin, I have to point out that it was not really the first HOTS that was gotten by a player, but the first that still exists today. There was an update (in 1997 with client 2.0 ) where all now rare items were deleted and the whole setting of the item system was reformed. It was necessary, because it was very easy before to get those items (dragons dropped them all) and every level 5 player already had a full set of the (back then) best items in the game: HOTS, E-plate and a firesword. So to make Tibia more interesting, all these items where replaced by a steel helmet, a regular plate armor (or was it a chain armor?) and a regular sword. From that update onwards, the rare items were hard to come by. Maybe it was not as hard as it is today, but still a lot harder then before.

So when the server came online with the new update, Thais was swarming with people filling the temple right away and giving good old Quentin a shock by the sudden appearance of so many players logging in at his residence. Some were upset by the now lame equipment they were wearing, some were rushing into the depot to check what happened in there. One player run ahead of all others to be the first at the demon to see what treasures he would hide. This was [[Galadriiell]], the probably mightiest sorcerer back then. She wouldnâ€™t have had to hurry that much, because there was no one else that was so eager to see the big red one, but still she did. There was only one place in Tibia back then where you could encounter a demon, and that was deep below Thais, south of Mintwallin. It was not longer then 10-15 minutes after the server came online that I got a message from [[Galadriiell]]: she had defeated the demons and found as a treasure the famous Helmet of the Stars and an enchanted plate armor. She was a bit upset, because she thought it was still to easy to get the nice stuff. What we didnâ€™t know then was that this mighty treasure only spawned once, so it was Galadriiell who was the first and only player that had these nice items for some time.
==== Gallery ==== File:Daemon loot.jpg|Daemon Slayed in Mintwallin File:Hots0.gif File:Hots1.png
flavortext: It's the famous Helmet of the Stars.

buyfrom: Alissa, Bonifacius, Brasith, Imalas, Jezzara:8, Livielle, Omur: 5, Rodney, Serafin
notes: Just good to eat.\nCan be found at [[Daily Respawns]] in [[Isle of the Kings]] and some other places. Also needed for the [[The Postman Missions Quest|Postman]] and [[The Paradox Tower Quest]]s.

name: Grave Flower
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Elf Arcanist | Fernfang | Grave Guard | Green Djinn | Memory of a Vampire | Necropharus | Spit Nettle | Vampire | Memory of an Elf
notes:
Can usually be found in [[graveyards]] and crypts. Some are in more obscure places, but usually near or on a coffin. This flower can be carried, but does not block monsters like [[Parcel]]s. Since [[Updates/10.90|Update 10.90]] it became usable, but its use is unknown.
\nUsed in the {{Spoiler Section|The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest|Polish}}. Combining [[Molten Wax]] with a Grave Flower you get [[Special Polish]] and whith that you polish Eclesius' crystal ball.
\n
It is also needed for [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].

name: Great Axe
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Hellgorak | Horadron
history:
* Great Axes were the weapons of the dwarven kings. They were impossible to wield by any normal [[Dwarf]].
* For a very long time, this was considered the best and strongest [[Axe Weapons|axe]] in Tibia.
* There were only a few Great Axes in [[Tibia]]:
** One was given to {{character|Taghor}} as a reward from CipSoft for hosting the 2002 convention in Vienna, he gave it as a christmas gift to his friend {{character|Pytru}} but Pytru sold it to an unknown buyer in 2005.
** {{character|Mulf}}, {{character|Proxy}} and apparently {{character|Zamp}} had one Great Axe each, but they have been deleted.
** {{character|Yvonne}} won a Great Axe in the first tibian lottery ever.
* After [[Updates/8.4|Update 8.4]], [[Hellgorak]] was introduced and the Great Axe became easy to loot from him. After a patch, it was made rarer to loot. Nevertheless, the item became common to see in any world.
* The original image for this axe [[File:Great Axe (original).gif]] was replaced in the [[Updates/Update 8.0|Summer 2007 update]].
flavortext: A masterpiece of a dwarven smith.

name: Great Shield
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Massacre | Morgaroth | Razzagorn | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch
notes:
It may be seen on [[Emperor Kruzak]]'s [[Treasure Room]], in [[Kazordoon]], and also in the Maze of Lost Soul's treasure. It's part of the [[Full Set]].
<gallery hideaddbutton="true" position="center" style="text-align:center" captionalign="center" mode="nolines">
mols_treasures.jpg|Maze of Lost Souls Treasure Room
</gallery>
history:
The Great Shield has existed since nearly the beginning of Tibia when the only server was called Tibia, which is now present day [[Antica]]. It's known that the first Great Shield was owned by {{character|Cressir}} on [[Antica]]. [[Dragon Lord]]s for a short time dropped Great Shields. Looting this was harder than looting a [[Dragon Scale Mail]]. Back in that times there was only three [[Dragon Lord]] spawns, the one in the [[Plains of Havoc]], the one in [[Thais]], and the one in Deeper [[Fibula]]. Also Dragon Lords were the hardest monster back then, and the highest levels were around 50. The value and high defense of the shield was deemed too much, even as a rare loot, so it was soon removed from Dragon Lords.

There are still many rumours concerning the origin of the Great Shield. The fact is that many were on Antica and a few others are scattered about other servers. Now it can be found in more worlds, since it is dropped by some bosses around Tibia. 

Its defense value was changed from 42 to 38 with [[Updates/7.0|Update 7.0]].

The sprite of this shield was changed during [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]]. Before that, it used to look like this: [[File:Great Shield (old).gif|Old Sprite]]
flavortext: The shield is made of dragon scales.

name: Green Dragon Leather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Can also be obtained by [[Skinning]] a [[Dragon]] and looks slightly darker than [[Lizard Leather]].
{{seealso|Green Dragon Leather/Skinning}}'
20 of them are needed for the [[Basic Dragon Hide]], [[Intricate Dragon Hide]] and [[Powerful Dragon Hide]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Green Key
notes: There are no Current known green keys. In the past most wooden keys used to be Green keys, such as the Fibula dungeon door key.

name: Green Mushroom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Bonebeast | Deepworm | Demodras | Dragon Lord | Dragon Lord Hatchling | Dreadbeast | Exotic Bat | Frost Dragon | Glooth Anemone | Golden Servant | Golden Servant Replica | Grimeleech | Ice Witch | Mutated Rat | Necromancer | Necropharus | Pixie | Ribstride | Serpent Spawn | Swan Maiden | The Noxious Spawn | Wailing Widow | Yakchal
notes:
Green mushrooms have decent regeneration per ounce (600s/oz), but they are far inferior to store-bought [[Brown Mushroom]]s. For the amount green mushrooms sell, you could buy 2640 seconds of regeneration from brown mushrooms (vs. 60 from green mushrooms). In addition to the cost inefficiency, their regeneration per oz is lower than half of brown mushrooms': 600s/oz vs. 1320s/oz. In this way, one could think of green mushrooms to be compared to creature products: they weigh next to nothing, sell high, and are stackable. It is not recommended to use these as a source of food unless it is the only food available.
Can be found at daily spawns around [[Green Claw Swamp]]. There's one [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}127.242,125.16,7,3,1,1 here] and there's also one right next to the tree which you open to get the [[Blood Herb]]. One green mushroom is required during a mission for [[The Shattered Isles Quest]] to gain access to [[Talahu]].

Today, this item is obtainable only as a reward from contests on [[Supported Tibia Fansites|fansites]].

name: Griffin Shield
notes: It's kind of rare since it's not dropped by monsters. Looks good to decorate houses with.\nObtainable through the [[Griffin Shield Quest]].

This shield was introduced to the game in an unknown update. At this time, all "Mercenary Shields" were changed into Griffin Shields. Here is the original information about the Mercenary Shields before they were changed: [[File:Mercenary Shield.gif]] Mercenary Shield
'''Attributes:'''Def: 24
'''Weight:'''52.00 [[oz]]
In the past an exceptionally rare item, was given to the Mercenarys Guild on [[Antica]] (thereof goes the name - ''Mercenary Shield'') by the [[Gods]]. Changed to Griffin Shield after some recent update.

name: Heaven Blossom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crazed Summer Rearguard | Elf | Elf Scout | Firestarter
notes:
30 of these are needed for the [[Beggar Outfits Quest]].
10 of these are your reward in the [[Top of the City Quest]].
1 of these can be obtained in the [[Heaven Blossom Quest]].

name: Heavy Machete
droppedby: Cobra Assassin | Cyclops Smith | Efreet | Fahim the Wise | Marid | Menacing Carnivor | Merikh the Slaughterer
notes:
Like a [[Machete]], but like the name says, heavier (and stronger). Can be used to cut down [[Wild Growth]]s, [[Jungle Grass]], and [[Venorean Spice]]. This item can be used to cut 100 [[Jungle Grass]] in order to gain [[Achievements#Nothing Can Stop Me|Nothing Can Stop Me]] achievement.
[[Secret Agent Tools]] can be used as a heavy machete.

name: Helmet of the Ancients
notes:
[[Pharaohs]] guard the pieces of the [[helmet]]. When you use it on a [[Small Ruby]], it will be enchanted and turn into a [[Helmet of the Ancients (Enchanted)]], which has an additional 3 armor. This effect will only last for 30 minutes. According to [[Morgathla Reveals the Secrets of the Mask (Book)|this book]], using a [[Soul Ruby]] will permanently increase this value.

\nObtained through [[The Ancient Tombs Quest]].

\nEnchanting this helmet with a [[Small Ruby]] will grant you the [[achievement]] [[Hidden Powers]].
flavortext: The gem of the helmet is burned out and should be replaced.

name: Helmet of the Ancients (Enchanted)
notes: This is a [[Helmet of the Ancients]] enchanted with a [[Small Ruby]]. The effect of the enchantment will only last for 30 minutes. According to [[Morgathla Reveals the Secrets of the Mask (Book)|this book]], using a [[Soul Ruby]] will have a permanent effect.\nCreating this [[helmet]] will grant you the [[achievement]] [[Hidden Powers]].
flavortext: The gem is glowing with power.

name: Helmet of the Deep
notes:
The Helmet of the Deep is used to dive [[underwater]]. Wearing it is required to be able to go underwater, but once there the helmet can be removed. However, without it players will take 5 times 20 [[Drowning]] damage kicking in after four seconds of standing still. It is useful out of the depths, too: some monsters, like [[Water Elemental]]s, use drowning damage attacks. There is a 5,000 [[gp]] deposit for the helmet. You must be a member of the [[Explorer Society]] (beginning of the {{Spoiler Section|Explorer Society Quest|The Undersea Kingdom}}) and have at least the Rank of a Relic Hunter/Huntress to rent one. Renting one is not bound to any liabilities and you may return the helmet by saying 'return' to [[Captain Max]].
Players above level 150 may opt to use the [[Depth Galea]] instead, which has 6 more armor points and weighs 164 oz less.
flavortext: Enables underwater exploration.

name: Helmet Ornament
notes: This [[item]] is gotten in [[Helmet of the Ancients Quest]], by having [[Burning Heart]] in your inventory, and going through a [[teleport]]er in [[Shadow Tomb|Mahrdis' Tomb]].
flavortext: This item seems to be a single part of a bigger object.

name: Helmet Piece
notes: This [[item]] is gotten in [[Helmet of the Ancients Quest]], by having [[Ancient Rune]] in inventory, and going through [[teleport]] in [[Oasis Tomb|Rahemos's Tomb]].
flavortext: This item seems to be a single part of a bigger object.

name: Hoe
notes: Can be found in the homes or fields of most farmers.\nUsed during the [[Krailos Quest]].

name: Holy Falcon
notes: Very rare and nice decoration. One of the fabled [[Pharaoh Rares]].

name: Honey Flower
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
buyfrom: Azalea, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Florentine, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nienna, Nydala, Peggy, Rose, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes:
Can be found in various places around [[Tibia]] but is rather rare on [[Rookgaard]]. Weaker monsters do not walk over it, so therefore it can be used to block or trap them.
\nLooks the same as a [[Honeyflower Patch]].\nCan be traded with [[Lee'Delle]] (in the premium part of [[Rookgaard]]) for [[Studded Legs]]. See [[Studded Legs Quest]].

name: Honeycomb
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Bear | Grynch Clan Goblin | Shadowpelt | Wasp | Werebear | Willi Wasp
notes:
50 of them are needed for an addon of the [[Citizen Outfits]].
50 of them are needed to be able to trade [[Spider Silk]]s for [[Spider Silk Yarn]]s with [[Marina]].
10 of them are needed during the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]] for making [[Sweet Mangonaise Elixir]].
At least 1 is needed for the [[Barbarian Test Quest]].
1 of them is needed for [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
1 of them is needed for [[The Cursed Crystal Quest]]. 1 of them is needed for [[Within the Tides Quest]].
flavortext: Some people swear it makes an excellent glue.

name: Horned Helmet
notes:
This helmet is owned by a few players on multiple servers ever since world transfers have been implemented. The helmet was a spawn that appeared at a map reset in the now [[Bright Sword Quest]] underneath the [[Outlaw Camp]], in the old days. Map resets happened once every 4-6 months back then. The Horned Helmet to this day is a priceless item for collectors. Several others were obtained on other old servers, such as [[Antica]], [[Premia]], [[Secura]], [[Isara]], [[Lunara]], and [[Amera]].

name: Horseman Helmet
notes: A Helmet not commonly used by low level players.

name: Hunting Spear
droppedby: Barbaria | Barbarian Brutetamer | Deepling Scout | Dworc Fleshhunter | Elder Forest Fury | Groam | Guard Captain Quaid | Lizard Sentinel | Minotaur Hunter | Naga Archer | Orc Berserker | Orc Warlord | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | Valkyrie | Warlord Ruzad

history:
* The [[Updates/Update 8.0|Summer Update 2007]] made many changes to this item:
** It used to be an [[Axe Weapons|Axe Weapon]], it is now a [[Distance Weapons|Distance Weapon]]. 
** Its weight was changed from 80.00 oz to 22.00 oz, and it became stackable
** [[NPC]] [[Brengus]] stopped buying them for 250 [[gp]] each, and now only pays 25 [[gp]]. 
** The sprite was changed from leaning to left to leaning right.

name: Hydra Egg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
One can be obtained in [[Hydra Egg Quest]]. Beware of the single [[hydra]] located in the quest room.
It can also be obtained from [[Surprise Nest]]s.
It look the same as a [[Hard-Boiled Hydra Egg]]. One is needed in both [[The Ape City Quest]] and [[Grimvale Quest]].

notes: This pick doesn't open [[List of Pickeable Holes|pick holes]]. It looks the same as a [[Dwarven Pickaxe]] and a [[Thawing Ice Pick]].\nItem obtained in and used for certain missions of the [[Explorer Society Quest]].

name: Ice Rapier
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Angry Demon | Blemished Spawn | Broken Shaper | Crazed Winter Rearguard | Crazed Winter Vanguard | Demon | Demon Outcast | Faceless Bane | Frost Dragon | Girtablilu Warrior | Golgordan | Hirintror | Ice Golem | Icecold Book | Latrivan | Lumbering Carnivor | Madareth | Melting Frozen Horror | Memory of a Vampire | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Pirat Cutthroat | Pirat Mate | Renegade Quara Mantassin | Soul-Broken Harbinger | Squid Warden | The Welter | Tremendous Tyrant | Vampire | Vampire Viscount | Vexclaw | Zushuka
notes: Once it used to be the strongest sword weapon in the game (Atk:100), but also very fragile. It will break with the first hit (even when used while casting spells such as [[Exori]] or Whirlwind throw. It is usually being used as decoration rather than in actual fights. The attack value now consists of 42 physical and 18 ice damage.
history: Before the [[Updates/Update 8.0|8.0 Update]], this sword weapon had an attack of 100 (Atk: 100). During this update, it was downgraded to Atk: 60.\n\nBefore the current quest system was implemented, this sword spawned daily on the casket where the current [[Noble Armor Quest]] is.
flavortext: A deadly but fragile weapon.

name: Icicle (Item)
notes: This item melts in 10 minutes. Looks the same as an [[Elemental Crystal]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Explorer Society Quest]]. Gathered under [[Folda]] by using the [[Ice Pick]].
flavortext: It is melting rapidly.

name: Golden Newspaper
notes:
This item could only be obtained by winning a contest of [[TibiaNews]]. If you use this item you will hear some news about [[Tibia]].
The item was designed by {{character|Lord Mijeman}} for the [[Item Design Contest]], held by CipSoft in May of 2008. It was awarded to Lord Mijeman, along with a [[Grey Tome]], as his choice of an additional item. Its replica is the [[Golden Newspaper (Replica)]]. Current owners: * {{character|Cantinelle}}, former contact person for [[TibiaNews]]. The second and third place contestants of the same contest, Pingly and Titadmarde, respectively, were each awarded the newspaper. * {{character|Al-Abdal}} won the Golden Newspaper in TibiaNews' Nursery Rhyme Contest on June 2009, along with a [[Golden Goblet]]. * In December 2010, {{character|Lanzador de Flechas}} won the Golden Newspaper in TibiaNews Twitter Contest. He still owns his paper. * In April 2011, {{character|Zelectron}} won the Golden Newspaper as well. * {{character|Rico Pasa}} is the current owner of it. * {{character|Pshyco druid}} won the Golden Newspaper in "Pick Our Slogan Contest!" * {{character|Mage Rani}} won one. * {{character|Argo Enya}} won one in the 2013 Christmas giveaway competition. * {{character|Xellos Matellium}} owns one on Astera. * {{character|Gryphis}} owns one on Antica. * {{character|Annar Elindor}} owns one on Secura. * {{character|Thomas af Hufvudstaden}} owns one on Antica. * {{character|Gorak}} owns one on Refugia. * {{character|Tzuyu}} owns one on Amera. * {{character|Redgoblin}} (former Tibianews editor) owns one on Secura.
sounds: {{Sound List|It's news to me.|News, updated as infrequently as possible!|Extra! Extra! Read all about it!|Fresh off the press!}}
flavortext: Tibia's most amazing news can be read in it. It was awarded for winning a TibiaNews contest.

name: Goldfish Bowl
notes:
To catch a [[Small Fish]], you need to go to an [[underwater]] area, such as [[Calassa]], or the [[Sunken Quarter]] in [[Yalahar]]. You need to use the [[Empty Goldfish Bowl]] on a patch of [[Coral]] or [[Kelp]] which has a [[Small Fish|fish]] swimming around it. Only rarely will you see a fish occupying a square all by itself, but these can be caught too. After you used the empty bowl on the fish, you will have a goldfish inside the bowl.
Looks the same as a [[Goldfish Bowl (Object)]] and a [[Fishnapped Goldfish]].\n[[File:Calassa fish.jpg]]\nNeeded for [[The Travelling Trader Quest]]. Can be obtained from an [[Unrealized Dream]].

Item temporarily obtained in [[The Demon Oak Quest]].

notes:
A good weapon until you can afford a [[Crystalline Axe]] or [[Umbral Items|better]]. Using the crystalline axe, the difference in damage is a mere +5 points because of the +1 [[Axe Fighting]], however your spells will hit harder too.
\nObtainable in the [[The Inquisition Quest]].

50 are needed for [[Wizard Outfits Quest]].

notes: Can be seen in various [[Treasure Rooms]]. Very few of them exist on various game worlds. Most valuable out of all [[Pharaoh Rares]], because [[Ashmunrah]] is hardest [[Pharaoh]] to kill.

name: Hook
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Pirate Buccaneer | Pirate Corsair | Pirate Cutthroat | Pirate Marauder
notes: \n100 Of these are needed for the first addon of [[Pirate Outfits]].
flavortext: It belonged once to a pirate.

name: Huge Chunk of Crude Iron
droppedby: Alptramun | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Lord Azaram | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Melting Frozen Horror | Plagueroot | The Baron from Below | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Count of the Core | The Duke of the Depths | The False God | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Nightmare Beast | The Sandking | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Time Guardian | Ushuriel
notes: Obtained in [[The Sweaty Cyclops Quest]] by trading in a [[Giant Sword]].\nUsed in the [[Knight Outfits Quest]] and [[Barbarian Outfits Quest]].

name: Hydra Tongue
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Actually it is a [[Plants and Herbs|Plant]]. To buy hydra tongue you must to say '''hydra tongue''' to [[Rose]], you can't buy it via the trade window. {{seealso|Rose/Transcripts}}
1 is needed in the [[Ice Islands Quest]] and 2 are required for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
flavortext: It is a common pest plant in warmer regions.

name: Ice Cream Cone (Blue-Barian)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: You can get one from a [[Suspicious Surprise Bag]]. See also other [[Ice Cream Cone]]s.\n\nObtainable in the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]], Greenhorn mode.
flavortext: It's the famous "blue-barian" flavour.

name: Ice Cream Cone (Chilly Cherry)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: See also other [[Ice Cream Cone]]s.\n\nObtained in [[The Ultimate Challenges Quest]], Scrapper Mode.
flavortext: It's the famous "chilly cherry" flavour.

name: Ice Cream Cone (Crispy Chocolate Chips)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Looks the same as an [[Ice Cream Cone (Venorean Dream)]]. It's mostly used as decoration due to the extreme difficulty in obtaining it. See also other [[Ice Cream Cone]]s.\n\nObtained in [[The Ultimate Challenges Quest]], Warlord Mode.
flavortext: It's the famous "crispy chocolate chips" flavour.

name: Ice Cream Cone (Venorean Dream)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It melts in 2 minutes, see also other [[Ice Cream Cone]]s.
\nLooks the same as an [[Ice Cream Cone (Crispy Chocolate Chips)]].Part of the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: It's the famous Venorean Dream flavour, but the ice cream is melting rapidly.

name: Ice Cube
droppedby: Animated Feather | Chakoya Toolshaper | Crystal Spider | Frost Dragon | Frost Giant | Frost Giantess | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Hirintror | Ice Golem | Ice Witch | Icecold Book | Lucifuga Aranea | Melting Frozen Horror | Naga Archer | Naga Warrior | Ocyakao | Shardhead | Squid Warden | Thawing Dragon Lord | The Bloodweb
notes:
Like [[Parcel]]s, they can be used to go up/down mountains, ''unlike'' parcels however, they will not block [[creatures]] from passing and it is possible to push players on top of them. You can also autowalk over them. Mostly used for [[decoration]] purposes. Use an [[Obsidian Knife]] on it in order to carve the [[Ice Cube (Head)|next stage]] of an Ice Cube. See more information on this topic inside of the research article by [[Tibia-Stats]], [https://web.archive.org/web/20210128140920/http://www.tibia-stats.com/index.php?akcja=6003&research=icecube here].
{{Seealso|Ice Cube/Sculpting Statistics|Ice Cube (Head)|Ice Cube (Tusks)|Ice Cube (Mammoth)|Ice Mammoth}} * Carving an [[Ice Mammoth]] out of one of these will earn you the [[achievement]] [[Ice Sculptor]]. * Carving ten [[Ice Mammoth]]s will earn you the [[achievement]] [[Cold as Ice]].

name: Ice Mammoth
notes:
This statue can only be created by using an [[Obsidian Knife]] four times in a row on an [[Ice Cube]] [[File:Ice Mammoth (Making).gif]] ({{Sound|You shaped a perfect little mammoth from the ice cube.}}). The ice cube has a very high of chance to break during the sculpting attempt ({{Sound|The attempt at sculpting failed miserably.}}).

Research shows that the ice cube has a 30% success rate on the first attempt, a 20% success rate on the second attempt, and a 10% success rate on the third attempt. The success rate on the final attempt is yet to be determined, but it is assumed to be approximately 5%. According to this research, there is roughly a 0.04% chance (1 out of 2500) of carving an ice mammoth from any given ice cube, but 9 time out of 10 you will need anywhere from 1600 to 5500 ice cubes. 
{{seealso|Ice Cube/Sculpting Statistics}}

* Carving one of these will earn you the [[achievement]] [[Ice Sculptor]].
* Carving ten of these will earn you the [[achievement]] [[Cold as Ice]].
flavortext: This small statue has been carefully shaped from an ice cube.

name: Iced Soil
droppedby: Roaring Water Elemental | Slick Water Elemental
notes:
Can often be seen as decoration.
Obtainable during [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].
Can be used to pass the energy wall or fire wall in the Magician's Quarter [[Magician Quarter/Residential Area|Residential Area]] to access the [[Warlock]] and [[Infernalist]] spawns. It can also be used to enter the blue flame and access the [[Demon]]s spawn under the Magician Quarter's [[Magician Quarter/Restricted Area|Restricted Area]].

name: Icy Blacksteel Sword
history: Icy Blacksteel Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Blacksteel Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Blacksteel Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Icy Dragon Slayer
history: Icy Dragon Slayers could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Dragon Slayer]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Dragon Slayer Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Icy Headchopper
history: Icy Headchoppers could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Headchopper]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Headchopper Replica]] is a replica of this item.
flavortext: This axe is only granted to a greenhorn of the Svargrond arena.

name: Icy Heroic Axe
history: Icy Heroic Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Heroic Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Heroic Axe Replica]] is a replica of this item.
flavortext: This axe is only granted to a scrapper of the Svargrond arena.

name: Icy Knight Axe
history: Icy Knight Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Knight Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Knight Axe Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Icy Mystic Blade
history: Icy Mystic Blades could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Mystic Blade]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Mystic Blade Replica]] is a replica of this item.
flavortext: This sword is only granted to a scrapper of the Svargrond arena.

name: Icy Orcish Maul
history: Icy Orcish Mauls could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Orcish Maul]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Orcish Maul Replica]] is a replica of this item.
flavortext: This club is only granted to a greenhorn of the Svargrond arena.

name: Icy Rainbow Shield
notes: To get this shield you need to use a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] on a [[Rainbow Shield]], enchanting it with '''ice'''. The enchantment lasts 15 minutes.
flavortext: It has been temporarily imbued with ice magic and has a greatly increased shielding value.

name: Icy Spike Sword
history: Icy Spike Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Spike Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Spike Sword Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Icy War Axe
history: Icy War Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[War Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy War Axe Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Icy War Hammer
history: Icy War Hammers could be made by [[enchanting]] [[War Hammer]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy War Hammer Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Golden Rune Emblem (Avalanche)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events. Overcharged Avalanche runes were a reward from [[the Lightbearer]] event in 2009.
flavortext: It's an adorned avalanche rune.

name: Golden Rune Emblem (Explosion)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events. Overcharged Explosion runes were a reward from [[the Lightbearer]] event in 2009.
flavortext: It's an adorned explosion rune.

name: Golden Rune Emblem (Magic Wall)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events. Overcharged Magic Wall runes were a reward from [[the Lightbearer]] event in 2009.
flavortext: It's an adorned magic wall rune.

name: Golden Rune Emblem (Sudden Death)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events. Overcharged Sudden Death runes were a reward from [[the Lightbearer]] event in 2009.

name: Golden Rune Emblem (Ultimate Healing)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events. {{character|Mirkaan}} won one in a [[Tibia RP]] quiz contest and {{character|Snacka}} in royal painting contest at [[TibiaSpace]].
flavortext: It's an adorned ultimate healing rune.

notes:
You can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer.

{{character|Mystic Videl}} for winning the [[Tibiopedia]] "Tibian Traveler" contest on 31st August 2009. She also won a [[Bronze Necklace]].
{{character|Gwendydd}} for winning the [[Tibiopedia]] "Writing Contest" on 22nd October 2009.

{{character|Dimonik}} for winning [[TibiaCubix]]'s " Picture of the week".
{{character|Sahsy}} for winning [[Tibiafriends]]' "My Tibia Story" competition on the 15th May 2010 and another for winning [[TibiaSpy]]'s "Mission: Codename XYZ" contest.
{{character|Van Lyves}} for winning [[Tibiopedia]]' RPG Event 2010.
{{character|Karlkoninan}} was awarded with this trophy for winning [[Tibiafriends]]' "The Best Decorated House" competition on 6th July 2010.

{{character|Zeph Fighter}} for winning [[TibiaML]]' Theme Competition 2010.
{{character|Kyward}} for winning [[TibiaTR]]' Item Contest 2010.
{{character|Mage Mago Mal}} for winning [[TibiaSpace]]' Halloween Contest 2010.
{{character|Epicnez}} for winning [[Tibiafans]]' Halloween Contest 2010.
{{character|Relsiegpk}} for winning [[TibiaML]]' Talent Hunt 2010.
{{character|Dark Azo}} for winning [[Portal Tibia]]' Fakes Contest.
{{character|Hunter of Dragoes}} received this trophy as award of the ''"NPC Secreto"'' (Secret NPC) contest of [[Portal Tibia]] on 7th December 2010.
{{character|Kong}} for winning [[TibiaWiki]]'s Creature Contest 2010.
{{character|Capitan Caribe}} for winning Old picture tibia [[TibiaBariloche]]'s Item Contest 2011.
{{character|Shallie}} for winning [[Tibiafriends]]' Royal Painting Contest.
{{character|Malldor}} for winning [[TibiaLottery]]'s Royal Painting Contest.
{{character|Ramy on Secura}} for being the most dangerous in [[TibiaLottery]]'s "Kill somebody or die trying" Contest.
{{character|Honourable Knight of Honera}} for winning first place in [[TibiaWiki.com.br]]'s "Help the Easter Bunny" Contest.

name: Golden Warrior Trophy
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer.
{{character|Rawman}} received this item for winning first place in the [[TibiaMx]] Wrestling Contest.
{{character|Nine Yoshimine}} from Nerana won one at [[Portal Tibia]] contest.
{{character|Beautiful Rebel}} won this trophy from a contest at [[TibiaFans.se]].
{{character|Dark Elemental}} won this trophy for winning in the "best rl photo" category of the photo contest of [[TibiaTR]].
{{character|Ardilla Selassie}} received this item for winning the Halloween contest of TibiaSpace.com
\n{{character|Beartin}} was awarded with this trophy for winning 1st place in the Riddle contest of [[Tibia-Stats]].
{{character|Rhep}} received one after winning the anniversary contest of [[TibiaJourney]].

name: Golem Blueprint
notes: It looks the same as an [[Ancient Map]], a [[Map (Brown)]] and a [[Secret Map]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Golem Disassembler
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Crowbar]].
Obtained during [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]].
flavortext: It looks suspiciously similar to a crowbar.

name: Golem Head
notes:
None.
Temporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Golem Part
notes:
If you use a [[Golem Disassembler]] on:
a dead [[Damaged Worker Golem]] there is a low probability of 15%,
a dead [[Worker Golem]] there is an average probability of 20%,
a [[War Golem]] there is a high probability of 33% to get a golem part.

6 of these are needed to do [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Green Christmas Bundle
notes:
[[Christmas Bundle]]s come in [[Red Christmas Bundle|Red]], Green or [[Blue Christmas Bundle|Blue]]. The [[Christmas Bundle]] can so far only be obtained as a present from [[Santa Claus]] at [[Christmas]] time or bought from [[Furniture Shopkeeper NPCs]].

When used, [[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear and the player will find 7 random items of the following selection:
* 15 [[Candy|Candies]]
* 20 [[Cookie]]s
* 10 [[Candy Cane]]s
* 10 [[Orange]]s
* 5 [[Apple]]s
* [[Gingerbreadman]]
* [[Christmas Wreath]]
* [[Christmas Branch]]
* [[Christmas Garland]]
* [[Christmas Card]]
* [[Christmas Present (Green)]]

And there is a low chance to get [[Christmas Present (Green)]] as an 8th item, provided it was not part of the 7 items.
flavortext: It contains random christmas decoration.

name: Greeting Card
buyfrom: Bertha, Gorn, Perod, Shiantis, The Librarian: 40, Thomas
notes: It is writable, however it is not rewritable.

name: Grodrik's Favourite Axe
notes:
Looks the same as [[Double Axe]]
\nTemporarily obtainable in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest/Spoiler#Mission 3: Love.27s a Wicked Game|The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].

name: Guardian Boots
droppedby: Ethershreck | Ghastly Dragon | Hatebreeder | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Time Guardian

name: Hair of a Banshee
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Half-Digested Piece of Meat
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Half-Eaten Brain
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

\n2 are needed for the [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].

name: Hammer of Prophecy
notes: It can be seen under a [[Flash Arrow]] in [[Treasure Rooms#Beregar Treasure Room|Pythius the Rotten's treasure room]].
history: * Was first looted by players in [[Guardia]].

name: Hand Puppets
notes:
The official [[Tibia RP]] item. Several Hand Puppets exist on numerous Tibian worlds. They have not only been given out by TibiaRP competitions but also in many in-game events - between the two (on-site competitions and in-game events) a pair of Hand Puppets was available every month or two which allowed many Tibians to have a chance at owning this item but still keeping the item quite rare. [[Tibia RP]] closed during February 2013, it is expected Hand Puppets will get more valuable from that point on.

[[File:Hand Puppets Screenshot.png|thumb]]

Its replica is the [[Hand Puppets (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Why so serious?|These are not the puppets you are looking for...|May the roleplay be with you.|An age of roleplay, and all will know, that three hundred puppets gave their last breath to defend it!|They stoles it! Sneaky little puppetses!|There was a dream that was roleplay. You could only whisper it. Anything more than a whisper and it would vanish.}}

name: Hat for Eclesius (Dark)
notes: [[Irmana]] can create this hat for you from one piece of [[Minotaur Leather]] and two [[Bat Wing]]s if you are on the required mission.Temporarily obtained during [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
history: It looked the same as a [[Batwing Hat]] up until the [[Updates/8.54|2009 Christmas Update]].

name: Hat for Eclesius (Pink)
notes: [[Irmana]] can create this hat for you from one piece of [[Minotaur Leather]] and one [[Heaven Blossom]] if you are on the required mission.Obtainable during [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
history: It looked the same as the [[Hat of the Mad]] up until the [[Updates/8.54|2009 Christmas Update]].

name: Hat for Eclesius (Wooden)
notes: [[Irmana]] can create this hat for you from one piece of [[Wood]] and one piece of [[Iron Ore]] if you are on the required mission.Obtainable during [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
history: It looked the same as a [[Bucket]] up until the [[Updates/8.54|2009 Christmas Update]].

name: Haunted Piece of Wood
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
history: This item was added with a small content patch on December 16, 2009, just after the [[Updates/8.54|Christmas Update 2009]].

name: Havoc Blade
notes:
Was first looted in Lucera by {{Character|Ticones}}, on New Year's Eve. Havoc Blade has gained much more in popularity after imbuement slots were implemented. Because of its three imbuement slots it is a viable option for anyone using a two-handed sword.
<gallery mode="nolines">
Havoc Blade Lucera.jpg
| 1 = First Havoc Blade looted on Lucera
</gallery>

name: Headache Pill
notes: Looks the same as a [[Blueberry]]. Headache pills work good againts headaches, especially when reading dull books. \n\nPart of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 09.
sounds: {{Sound List|Your head begins to feel better}}

name: Heart Backpack
notes:
You have to say ''{{KW|Heart Backpack}}'' in order to buy it from [[Valentina]]. She ''only has one left'' and as such any one character can only buy one from her every year. People can sell these backpacks for a lot of money, because you can only buy one per character each year.
\nSee [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.
history: Although item was implemented in {{Update|8.54}}, it has only been obtainable from February 16, 2010. It was intended to be available on Valentine's Day, but the implementation failed and, being a weekend, CipSoft were not around to manually implement it. It first became available on the 16th of February.

name: Heated Worm Punisher
notes:
This item is a [[Worm Punisher]], used with a [[Crucible]] and lasts for 10 seconds. It can be used to hit [[Wormhole (Rotworm)|Rotworm]]s and [[Wormhole (Carrion Worm)|Carrion Worm]]s on their head when they pop out of their tunnels.
Looks the same as a [[Fiery War Hammer]].
Temporarily obtained in [[The Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: This hammer is a worm's worst nightmare.

name: Heavily Rusted Armor
droppedby: Crazed Beggar | Damaged Worker Golem | Earth Elemental | Iron Servant | Iron Servant Replica | Mutated Bat | Mutated Human | Young Sea Serpent | Zombie
notes:
Using a [[Rust Remover|rust remover]] on it will either '''break''' the armor or yield one of the following: * {{Ilink|Chain Armor}} [[Chain Armor]] * {{Ilink|Scale Armor}} [[Scale Armor]] * {{Ilink|Brass Armor}} [[Brass Armor]] (semi-rare) * {{Ilink|Plate Armor}} [[Plate Armor]] (rare) (See [[Heavily Rusted Armor/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]]). Use a [[rust remover]] to un-rust the armor. This armor can also be obtained by using one of the [[Crate (Usable)|quest crates]].
Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
history:
In a small patch the weight was {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|changed}} from 100.00 oz to 120.00 oz on November 10, 2009.
\nOn {{OfficialNewsArchive|5087|June 12, 2019}}, its name was changed from ''Rusty Armor'' to the current one, and the sprite was also updated.
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the armor you will be able to see what it is.
notes2: '''Note:''' Rusted armors can be found in two additional variations, [[Rusted Armor]] and [[Slightly Rusted Armor]].

name: Heavily Rusted Legs
notes:
Able to turn into: *[[Studded Legs]] *[[Chain Legs]] *[[Brass Legs]] *[[Plate Legs]] (rare) [[Heavily Rusted Legs/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]] This item can be found in [[Crate (Usable)]]. Like the [[Rusty Armor]] it has a chance of breaking. You can un-rust these using a [[Rust Remover|rust remover]].
Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
history: In a small patch the weight was {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|changed}} from 35.00 oz to 70.00 oz on November 10, 2009.
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the legs you will be able to see what it is.

name: Heavy Metal T-Shirt
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Boogey]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. Before introduction of the [[Swan Feather Cloak]], it used to be the lightest [[Armor]] in the game. It remains as the lightest armor which can be [[Imbuing|imbued]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Pirate Tapestry]].\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: Oddly enough it is not made of metal at all, but years without washing grant it added protection.

name: Hellhound Slobber
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Hellspawn Tail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 20 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Demon Presence]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Helmet of Nature
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Dirtbeard]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Flower Bowl]].\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: One can only hope nobody will ever insist on wearing that.

name: Helmet of Ultimate Terror
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Monstor]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Pumpkinhead (Lit)]].\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: There is evil inside.

name: High Guard Flag
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: High Guard Shoulderplates
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Holy Icon
notes: Looks like a [[Ceremonial Ankh]] and an [[Ornamented Ankh]] with sparks. This item is given by [[Grizzly Adams]] after killing 6666 [[Demon]]s during the [[Killing in the Name of... Quest]]. It allows you to enter the [[Demon Oak]] area and it disappears after that.
flavortext: It is said that you can break a mighty evil spell with it.

name: Holy Soil
notes: It is not known how to obtain this item yet.

name: Hunter's Quiver
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Hydra Head
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Hydra Meat
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item was meant to be implemented with the [[Summer Update 2010]], however this item's sprite wasn't ready in time for the update.

name: Hydra Tongue Salad
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: Though the hydra tongue is commonly considered a pest plant it tastes surprisingly aromatic.

name: Ice Cream Cone (Mellow Melon)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
In the past, some tutors were awarded this item by [[CipSoft]]. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
  • {{character|Parodox}} was the first person to be awarded this item, he told that he obtained it as a gift from the head tutor at the time for helping CipSoft ({{post|30868469|see this post}}).
  • {{character|Lord Mijeman}} was awarded this item for winning a tutor competition during Christmas 2008.
  • {{character|Arcnagett}} was awarded this item for winning a tutor competition during Christmas 2008.
  • {{character|Zinina}} was awarded this item for winning a tutor competition during Christmas 2008.
  • {{character|Karlkoninan}} was awarded this item for winning a tutor competition during Easter 2009.
See also other [[Ice Cream Cone]]s.
flavortext: It's the famous "mellow melon" flavour.

name: Icy Barbarian Axe
history:
Icy Barbarian Axes could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Barbarian Axe]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Barbarian Axe Replica]] is a replica of this item.
\nThe sprite of Icy Barbarian Axe changed from http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/tibia/en/images/archive/9/9c/20120415010549!Icy_Barbarian_Axe.gif to [[File:Icy Barbarian Axe.gif]] with the {{OfficialNewsArchive|2044|9.52 patch}}.

name: Icy Clerical Mace
history: Icy Clerical Maces could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Clerical Mace]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Clerical Mace Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Icy Cranial Basher
history: Icy Cranial Bashers could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Cranial Basher]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Cranial Basher Replica]] is a replica of this item.
flavortext: This club is only granted to a scrapper of the Svargrond arena.

name: Icy Crystal Mace
history: Icy Crystal Maces could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Crystal Mace]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Crystal Mace Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Icy Relic Sword
history: Icy Relic Swords could be made by [[enchanting]] [[Relic Sword]]s with a [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. When first enchanted it had 1000 charges. The [[Icy Relic Sword Replica]] is a replica of this item.

name: Impaler
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Mr. Punish | The Souldespoiler
notes: First obtained in [[Furora]].\n<gallery mode="nolines">Impaler.jpg</gallery>

name: Golden Hyaena Pendant
notes:
<gallery captionalign="center" widths="300" heights="300" mode="nolines">
September 2017 FA.jpg
| 1 = A golden hyena pendant on a table is depicted in an artwork for {{OfficialNewsArchive|4250|September 2017's Featured Article}}.</gallery>
{{seealso|Golden Scorpion Pendant}}
history:
Despite being implemented in [[Updates/9.1|version 9.1]], it only became obtainable after the [[Updates/12.20|Summer Update 2019]], as a boss loot. Before that, it was considered an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\n\nFor many years, this item was wrongfully named ''Golden Hyena Pendant''. The typo was only fixed after it became obtainable.

name: Golden Rune Emblem (Animate Dead)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events. {{character|Shallie}} received one after winning a contest and so did {{character|Exhidi}}.
flavortext: It's an adorned animate dead rune.

name: Golden Rune Emblem (Chameleon)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
history:
* One copy was awarded to {{Character|Jehanne}} for winning the 3rd place price in a contest by [[TibiaRP]].
* Another one was awarded to {{Character|Paula Ines}} for an honorable mention in a contest by [[TibiaRP]]. 

These [[Rune Emblems]] could also be obtained from [[Denson Larika (Creature)|Denson Larika]] raids in celebration of [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]] as well.
flavortext: It's an adorned chameleon rune.
