name: Golden Rune Emblem (Wild Growth)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
flavortext: It's an adorned wild growth rune.

name: Golden Scorpion Pendant
notes:
It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\n{{seealso|Golden Hyena Pendant}}

name: Gooey Mass
droppedby: Hive Overseer | Maw | The Mean Masher
notes:
Found in the [[Hive]] behind the green walls by using [[Insectoid Cell]]s once per week.

Can be used and turned into a random item:
* {{Ilink|Black Pearl}} 2x [[Black Pearl]]
* {{Ilink|Larvae}} 10x [[Larvae]]
* {{Ilink|Platinum Coin}} 2x [[Platinum Coin]]
* {{Ilink|Great Mana Potion}} 2x [[Great Mana Potion]]
* {{Ilink|Great Health Potion}} 2x [[Great Health Potion]]
* {{Ilink|Gold Ingot}} [[Gold Ingot]]
* {{Ilink|Hive Scythe}} [[Hive Scythe]]
* {{Ilink|Four-Leaf Clover}} [[Four-Leaf Clover]]
{{Seealso|Gooey Mass/Statistics}}
flavortext: Perhaps it contains something useful.

name: Gooey Substance
notes:
Looks the same as [[Poisonous Slime]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[War Against The Hive Quest]].
flavortext: The substance will dissolve after a while.

name: Grasshopper Legs
droppedby: Crawler | Spitter | The Hungerer | The Sandking | Waspoid
notes:
Very sought after by sorcerers and druids, so they will sell for much higher than the NPC price. A lesser variant would be the [[Alloy Legs]], designed for a lower level audience.
{{Seealso|Speed Set}}

name: Great Fireball Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[File:Burned Icon.gif]] Shoots a large circular flame attack based on the center of the selected area, this is the [[Sorcerer]]s' equivalent of the [[Avalanche]].
This rune is really useful to get rid of big groups of monsters when the character gets surrounded or when you need to clear a room. It once was available to make at level 23, however this was changed in an update.
\nFor the spell, see [[Great Fireball]].
history:
The sprite produced by a [[Great Fireball Rune]] changed in the [[Updates/8.1|2007 Winter Update]]. It used to look like this:
\n[[File:Great fireball1.gif]]\nThe price was changed from 57 to 64 since [[Summer Update 2024]].

name: Green Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Green Balloon (Inflated)|Green Balloon]] {{Ilink|Green Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Green Bed Kit
notes: Looks the same as a [[Furniture Package]] and many other [[Furniture]] kits.
history: It could be used on a bed to change the colors of the covers until [[Updates/12.20.9260|November, 2019]], when beds inside player's houses and guildhalls became movable. It was replaced by the [[Green Headboard]] and [[Green Footboard]]. \n\nSince the item may still be found in game but is no longer obtainable, it's a relatively rare item.
flavortext: Use it on your bed to change the bed to green.

name: Green Crystal Shard
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Anomaly | Bashmu | Breach Brood | Brinebrute Inferniarch | Burster | Cave Devourer | Chasm Spawn | Choking Fear | Cobra Assassin | Cobra Scout | Deepworm | Diremaw | Emerald Tortoise | Enslaved Dwarf | Eradicator | Eyeless Devourer | Faceless Bane | Feral Sphinx | Feroxa | Feroxa (Gloom Wolf) | Gaz'haragoth | Girtablilu Warrior | Guard Captain Quaid | Instable Breach Brood | Ironblight | Juvenile Bashmu | Lady Tenebris | Lamassu | Liodile | Lloyd | Lumbering Carnivor | Makara | Mawhawk | Melting Frozen Horror | Memory of a Book | Nighthunter | Omrafir | Orewalker | Outburst | Pirat Mate | Prince Drazzak | Realityquake | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Rogue Naga | Rupture | Sight of Surrender | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | Tarbaz | Terofar | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Count of the Core | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Last Lore Keeper | The Sandking | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Time Guardian | Tremendous Tyrant | Tremor Worm | Varnished Diremaw | Venerable Girtablilu | White Lion | World Devourer | Xogixath | Young Goanna | Zavarash | Mantosaurus
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan

name: Green Cushioned Chair Kit
buyfrom: Allen, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Green Cushioned Chair}} [[Green Cushioned Chair]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a green cushioned chair.

name: Guardian Axe
droppedby: Deepling Guard | Deepling Tyrant | Earl Osam | The Count of the Core | Utua Stone Sting
notes:
Part of the [[Guardian Set]].
\nAvailable in reward chests after defeating [[Jaul]], [[Obujos]] and/or [[Tanjis]].
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Guardian Axe changed from [[File:Guardian Axe (Old).gif]] to [[File:Guardian Axe.gif]].

name: Handcrafted Ribbon
notes: Quest item temporarily obtained in the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]].
flavortext: This ribbon was handcrafted by Rottin Wood and the Married Men of the forest.

name: Harness
notes:
This is the item needed to tame a [[Draptor]]. It has a chance of breaking when used. This item used to be extremly rare and was only dropped by [[Draken Spellweaver]]. Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The wild draptor is struggling.}}
Succeeded: {{Message|type=sound|You tamed the wild draptor.}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Harp Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Julian, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Harp}} [[Harp]]. Looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs, however, the Harp Kit can still be bought in [[Rathleton]], likely due to an oversight by CipSoft. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a harp.

name: Haunch of Boar
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 1 is needed for the [[Grimvale Quest]].}}

name: Heavy Magic Missile Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[File:Electrified Icon.gif]] Shoots an attack that inflicts [[Energy Damage]].
This rune is mostly used by [[Paladin]]s and [[Mage]]s.\n\nFor the spell, see [[Heavy Magic Missile]].
history: Before [[Updates/8.1|Update 8.1]]Â it had less charges (only 5) but also took less [[mana]] to make (just 280). It required [[magic level]] 4 to use, rather than the current 3.Â This update disallowedÂ [[paladin]]sÂ to make this rune.

name: Heavy Medal
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.
\nThis item can only be obtained as a [[fansites|Promoted or Supported Fansite]] contest prize.

name: Heavy Stone
notes:
You must wait 1 minute in order to get another one.
\nTemporarily obtained in [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].
flavortext: It can be used to arm catapults.

name: Heavy Trident
droppedby: Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Brawler | Deepling Elite | Deepling Guard | Deepling Scout | Deepling Tyrant | Deepling Warrior | Deepling Worker
notes: Item introduced in the [[Updates/9.1|Summer update 2011]].

name: Hero's Medal
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.
\nThis item can only be obtained as a [[fansites|Promoted or Supported Fansite]] contest prize.

name: Hieroglyph Banner
notes: {{Seealso|Hieroglyph Banner (Object)}}

name: Hive Bow
notes: Despite requiring a higher level than [[Warsinger Bow]], its stats are actually worse. It is arguably only useful as decoration.

name: Hive Scythe
droppedby: Hive Overseer | Kollos | Spidris | Spidris Elite | The Mean Masher | Waspoid
notes: It has one less attack point than a [[Royal Axe]], but is a fair bit cheaper.\nCan be obtained from [[Gooey Mass]]es.

name: Hollow Stampor Hoof
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: '''30''' of these are needed for the [[Stampor (Mount)|Stampor Mount]]

name: Holy Missile Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
[[File:Dazzled Icon.gif]] Shoots an attack that inflicts [[Holy Damage]].
This rune can only be '''created and used''' by [[paladin]]s.
It deals a little bit more damage than [[Divine Missile]] and has more range.
Due to the very low cost merchants sell them at, it would be better for paladins to buy them instead of creating them.
\nThis rune was added to the game in the [[Updates/8.4|Christmas Update 2008]].
\nFor the spell, see [[Holy Missile]].

name: Hunting Horn
notes:
This is the item used to tame a [[Boar]]. It has a chance of breaking when used. Due to its rarity, this item has become a highly desired decorative piece in prestigious guilds.
When you use it, you may get the following messages: * {{Sound|The boar is refusing to obey the hunting horn.}} â€” Nothing happens and you may try again * {{Sound|The boar ran away.}} â€” The boar disappears and you will have to find another one * {{Sound|Oh no! The hunting horn broke.}} â€” Hunting horn disappears * {{Sound|You tamed the wild boar.}} â€” You tamed the boar Very rare reward of the "Lucky Loop" task of the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]]. Some people do the task for months (with more than one character) until they get this item.
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Ice Cream Cone (Sweet Strawberry)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nSee also other [[Ice Cream Cone]]s.
flavortext: It's the famous "sweet strawberry" flavour.

name: Ice Cream Cone (Velvet Vanilla)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nSee also other [[Ice Cream Cone]]s.
flavortext: It's the famous "velvet vanilla" flavour.

name: Ice Flower Seeds
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Obtained by using [[Ice Flower]]s during the [[Thawing Mini World Change]]. It can be planted in an [[Empty Flower Pot]] which will grow into a [[Flower Pot|Winterblossom Flower]].\n{{Seealso|Ice Flower/Harvesting Statistics}}When you use the ice flower seeds on any fully grown plant it will never need to be watered again. Also the first time you combine the ice seeds with a fully grown plant you will earn the Achievement [[Preservationist]].
flavortext: They seem to have strange effects on other plants and can also be grown into an own plant.

name: Icicle Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
[[File:Freezing Icon.gif]] Shoots an [[Ice]] attack, this is the [[Druid]]s' equivalent of the [[Fireball]].
Very useful for [[mage]]s to hunt creatures that are [[Ice Damage/Weak|weak against ice damage]], such as [[Dragon]]s, [[Dragon Lord]]s and [[Demon]]s, since it has a longer range than [[Ice Strike]] and does about 33% more damage.
\nFor the spell, see [[Icicle]].

name: Imortus
notes:
The official [[Exhiti]] item.
{{character|Honourable Knight of Honera}} chose this as his reward for winning first place in the [[TibiaML]] "Comic Competition 2012". Its replica is the [[Imortus (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Now you will see, <player>!|Numbers for Exhiti...|More eyes for many numbers!|469!? So easy...}}
flavortext: It knows all secrets of all numbers. It was awarded by the Exhiti.com.

name: Golden Lotus Brooch
droppedby: Dawnfire Asura | Frost Flower Asura | Kusuma | Midnight Asura | The Blazing Rose | The Diamond Blossom | The Flaming Orchid | The Lily of Night | True Dawnfire Asura | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | The Moonlight Aster | The Winter Bloom
notes: None.

name: Golden Prison Key
notes: Chance to obtain it when using an [[Unrealized Dream]]. Allows access to [[Prince Drazzak]]'s chamber for you and 4 team members; to use it, go to the [[Roshamuul Prison]].
flavortext: You dreamt that this key unlocks the prison of a powerful horror that you had to face on your own.

name: Golden Quartz Powder
notes:
This powder comes from [[Golden Quartzes]] and is said to have detoxifying powers.
It looks the same as [[Magic Sulphur]], [[Easily Inflammable Sulphur]], [[Fine Sulphur]], [[Yellow Powder]], and the remains of a [[Wisp]].\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It glitters brightly in the sunlight.

name: Golden Raid Token
notes: It will probably be obtained and used in a similar way to its [[Silver Raid Token|silver version]], however, it is currently believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Golem Wrench
notes:
Use this item on a [[Modified Gnarlhound]] to tame it. You can find Modified Gnarlhounds in [[Telas]]' laboratory in [[Edron]].
\nReward from [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]].
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Goo Shell
notes: It's a rare [[Armors|armor]] because it's only dropped by the rare boss [[Weakened Shlorg]].

name: Goosebump Leather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Featherweight]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Gourd
notes: It looks the same as a [[Rattling Gourd]].\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It is attached to a short stick.

name: Gravel and Chalk in a Bucket
actualname: gravel and chalk in a bucket
notes: Used in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: This contains a mixture of gravel and chalk.

name: Great Fireball Rune (Weak)
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Nelly, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: This weaker variant of [[Great Fireball Rune]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Summer Update 2015]], but [[Cipsoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Green Crystal Fragment
droppedby: Armadile | Bony Sea Devil | Cobra Assassin | Cobra Vizier | Crypt Warden | Emerald Tortoise | Girtablilu Warrior | Infernal Demon | Lamassu | Lavafungus | Lost Berserker | Magma Crawler | Manticore | Mazoran | Memory of a Book | Memory of a Manticore | Menacing Carnivor | Ogre Sage | Omrafir | Plagirath | Prince Drazzak | Ragiaz | Tremor Worm | Venerable Girtablilu | Werehyaena | White Lion | Wiggler | Xogixath | Makara | Shrieking Cry-Stal | Stalking Stalk
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan

name: Green Crystal Splinter
droppedby: Adult Goanna | Armadile | Brinebrute Inferniarch | Crystalcrusher | Drillworm | Enslaved Dwarf | Feroxa | Feroxa (Gloom Wolf) | Gaz'haragoth | Iks Aucar | Iks Chuka | Iks Churrascan | Lamassu | Lava Golem | Mawhawk | Ogre Ruffian | Omnivora | Reflection of Mawhawk | Sight of Surrender | Stone Devourer | Varnished Diremaw | Werehyaena Shaman | Wiggler | Zamulosh
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes: One of these is needed for [[The Cursed Crystal Quest]].

name: Green Light
notes: Provides permanent green light with the same range as the [[Light]] spell. Can be used for decoration or as a light source, if equipped.\n\nIt was obtainable from NPC [[Gaberiel]] for about 2 weeks since May 31st 2014 as a token of appreciation, once Tibia was {{OfficialNewsArchive|2773|greenlit}} on Steam.

name: Green Powder
notes: It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Green Power Core
notes: Looks the same as a [[Coloured Egg (Green)|Green Coloured Egg]].\n\nPart of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 12.

name: Grey-Blue Powder
notes: One common ingredient for shamanic paste.<noinclude>Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: It is made of voodoo lily pollen and dragon egg shells.

name: Griffinclaw Container
notes:
This is a [[Botanist's Container]] with a sample of the rare [[Blooming Griffinclaw|griffinclaw flower]] inside.
Looks the same as a [[Botanist's Container (Empty)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Bells)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Cauldron)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Rose)]], a [[Botanist's Container (Orchid)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Red)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Blue)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Yellow)]], a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Green)]], and a [[Gnomish Spore Gatherer (Complete)]].Temporarily obtained during the [[Druid Outfits Quest]].
flavortext: It holds a sample of the rare griffinclaw flower.

name: Grind Stone
notes: If you lost this item you can ask [[Norman The Foreman]] for another.\nUsed in a mission of the [[Venore Daily Tasks Quest]].
flavortext: Resupply the pathfinder crew with tools and new moral.

name: Guardcatcher
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].

name: Hallowed Bone
notes: Once it was a [[Yellowed Bone]].\nObtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: A human bone glowing in a dark light. It tingles unpleasantly when you touch it.

name: Hammer of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Carving (Charged)}} [[Hammer of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Hammer of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Hammer of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Hammer of Carving, Hammer of Mayhem and Hammer of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Hammer of Destruction}} [[Hammer of Destruction]].

name: Hammer of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Hammer of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Hammer of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Hammer of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Hammer of Carving, Hammer of Mayhem and Hammer of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Hammer of Destruction}} [[Hammer of Destruction]].

name: Hatched Rorc Egg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Haunted Mirror Piece
notes: A very rare item indeed.[[File:Haunted_mirror_piece.jpg|thumb|Haunted Mirror Piece on Inferna]]

name: Head of Abyssador
notes: Bring all pieces of the set to [[Gnomally]] to have the [[Statue of Abyssador]] reconstructed.\n\nRarely obtained by opening [[Abyssador]]'s treasure chest.

name: Head of Deathstrike
notes: Bring all pieces of the set to [[Gnomally]] to have the [[Statue of Deathstrike]] reconstructed.\n\nRarely obtained by opening [[Deathstrike]]'s treasure chest.

name: Head of Gnomevil
notes: Bring all pieces of the set to [[Gnomally]] to have the [[Statue of Gnomevil]] reconstructed.\n\nRarely obtained by opening [[Gnomevil]]'s treasure chest.

name: Heat Core
droppedby: Control Tower | Glooth Brigand | Glooth Fairy | Glooth Golem | Memory of a Golem

name: Heavily Rusted Helmet
notes:
Information about this item can be found in [[Market]] and [[Cyclopedia]]. However, it hasn't been obtained in-game yet, therefore this is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]. Using a [[Flask of Rust Remover]] on it will probably remove the rust and uncover a helmet. There might be a chance the helmet will fall apart upon trying to do so.
\nSuccessfully polishing this item will probably count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the helmet you will be able to see what it is.

name: Heavily Rusted Shield
notes: Information about this item can be found in [[Market]]. However, it hasn't been obtained in-game yet, therefore this is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the shield you will be able to see what it is.

name: Heavy Magic Missile Rune (Weak)
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Nelly, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: This weaker variant of [[Heavy Magic Missile Rune]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Summer Update 2015]], but [[Cipsoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Heavy Stone Hammer
notes: A make-shift hammer that feels rather heavy. Can occasionally be found by [[use|using]] a [[Dead Goblin (Fresh Quest)]] or [[Dead Goblin (Decaying Quest)]]. Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It's a wonder a goblin might ever be able to lift this massive thing.

name: Hemp Rope
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Its only purpose is to be sold to NPCs. It has a high gold-to-oz ratio.

name: Hideous Chunk
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Holy Ash
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Holy Missile Rune (Weak)
buyfrom: Alexander, Rock In A Hard Place
notes: This weaker variant of [[Holy Missile Rune]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Summer Update 2015]], but [[Cipsoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Hopgoblin's Broken Staff
notes:
It once belonged to the great goblin Hopgoblin.
It looks the same as a [[Broken Shamanic Staff]].\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It's neatly broken into several pieces, all of them carefully wrapped into a soft leather hide.

name: Horn (Ring)
notes: Like [[Death Ring]], has an Arm of 1. Unlike Death Ring, however, this ring does not wear out.
history: It used to be the only permanent ring providing [[armor]] until the implementation of the [[Butterfly Ring]]. This made its value, which used to be high because of its rarity, drop significantly.

name: Horoscope
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blood Hand | Blood Priest | Shadow Pupil
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
flavortext: A personal horoscope, inscribed with comments and formulas.

name: Hot Firecatcher Urn
notes: Obtained and used during [[The Repenters Quest]].
flavortext: This special urn is brimming with harmless flames gathered from the ashes of fire elementals.

name: House Silversun's Signet Ring
notes: It looks the same as a [[Crystal Ring]] and [[Crystal Ring (Eleonore)|Eleonore's Crystal Ring]].\nItem temporarily obtained during [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].
flavortext: It depicts a small silver sun with many rays of light.

name: Humongous Chunk
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Hyaena Trap
notes:
It is perfect to catch a [[Hyaena]] with.
It looks the same as a [[Tarantula Trap]] and [[Net (Fishing)]].\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It is a roughly woven net made of cactus tree fibres.

name: Ice Cube (Head)
flavortext: There is a rough shape of a head.

name: Ice Cube (Mammoth)
flavortext: There is a rough shape of a mammoth.

name: Ice Cube (Tusks)
flavortext: There is a rough shape of a head with tusks.

name: Icicle Bow
notes:
Used to be a very rare item as it was only dropped by the boss [[Hirintror]]. As of the 20th anniversary of Tibia, it is also dropped by [[Gelidrazah the Frozen]], dramaticly decreasing the price.
<gallery mode="nolines">
Icicle bow.jpg
</gallery>

name: Icicle Rune (Weak)
buyfrom: Alexander, Rock In A Hard Place
notes: This weaker variant of [[Icicle Rune]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Summer Update 2015]], but [[Cipsoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Icy Culottes
notes: Much better than a [[Glacier Kilt]], which has a level restriction (40+), 2% less ice protection and -6% energy protection. The rarity and the stats makes it a very valuable item.
history: It was renamed from "Icy Culotte" to "Icy Culottes" in [[Updates/10.55|Update 10.55]].

name: Golden Newspaper (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s with [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of a [[Golden Newspaper]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Golden Symbol of Suon
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.
flavortext: The aureola represents Suon the Benevolent Sun, one of the Tibian sun gods.

name: Golden Talon
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Goromaphone
notes:
This is [[RadioGoroma]]'s fansite item. If you ''use'' it, it will turn into a [[Goromaphone (Activated)]] [[File:Goromaphone (Activated).gif]] for a few seconds.

Its replica is the [[Goromaphone (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|It's the Eye of the Panther!|You are now listening to 66.6 RadioGoroma FM! Your Tibian Radio!|~ And Iiiiii-eeee-iii Will always Heal youuuuuu-hooooo! ~|~ I Love Loot 'N Gold! Put a Crystal Coin in my Backpack, Baby! ~|~ I'm Hungry Like the Warwolf ~|~ Keep spending most of our lives, Living in E.K's paradise ~}}
flavortext: There's a small record that seemingly has an endless aura of sweet tunes playing through its crude speaker, however, something about it seems off. It's the official audio device of RadioGoroma.com.br.

name: Great Health Keg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is available in the [[Store]] only. It fills up to 500 [[Great Health Potion]]s. All potions created this way as well as the keg itself will be kept in [[Your Store Inbox]]. A keg is not only useful for providing potions in a hunting ground, it also saves you some capacity as its constant weight equals the net weight of 250 potions. The keg can only be used by the character who purchased it in the Store. For this reason, the potions filled using the keg need to fit the character's vocation and level. Once the keg is empty it will vanish into thin air.\n\n{{Seealso|Cask & Keg Value Effectiveness}}
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its Store price was 87 [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This keg can be used to refill great health potions.

name: Great Mana Keg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is available in the [[Store]] only. It fills up to 500 [[Great Mana Potion]]s. All potions created this way as well as the keg itself will be kept in [[Your Store Inbox]]. A keg is not only useful for providing potions in a hunting ground, it also saves you some capacity as its constant weight equals the net weight of 250 potions. The keg can only be used by the character who purchased it in the Store. For this reason, the potions filled using the keg need to fit the character's vocation and level. Once the keg is empty it will vanish into thin air.\n\n{{Seealso|Cask & Keg Value Effectiveness}}
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its Store price was 55 [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This keg can be used to refill great mana potions.

name: Great Spirit Keg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is available in the [[Store]] only. It fills up to 500 [[Great Spirit Potion]]s. All potions created this way as well as the keg itself will be kept in [[Your Store Inbox]]. A keg is not only useful for providing potions in a hunting ground, it also saves you some capacity as its constant weight equals the net weight of 250 potions. The keg can only be used by the character who purchased it in the Store. For this reason, the potions filled using the keg need to fit the character's vocation and level. Once the keg is empty it will vanish into thin air.\n\n{{Seealso|Cask & Keg Value Effectiveness}}
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its Store price was 87 [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This keg can be used to refill great spririt potions.

name: Green Bandage
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Green Pit Demon
buyfrom: Agostina;For 750 [[Drome Points]],Alberto;For 750 [[Drome Points]],Emilio;For 750 [[Drome Points]],Fabiana;For 750 [[Drome Points]],Lorenzo;For 750 [[Drome Points]]
notes:
It was obtainable by opening a [[Surprise Cube]], although these cubes are frequently preserved since they are no longer acquirable.
{{Seealso|Surprise Cube/Statistics}}
history: Before the [[Monster Arena]] was replaced with the [[Tibiadrome]], there existed an opportunity to receive a [[Surprise Cube]] from [[Lorenzo]] when exchanging [[Arena Badge]]s for potions. The likelihood of obtaining a Surprise Cube increased with the number of badges required for specific potions. These cubes could then be opened for a chance to receive a [[Pit Demon (Item)]].
flavortext: Figurine 2 of 5.

name: Guidebook
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item's name and category ([[Creature Products|Creature Product]]) suggest it was meant to be dropped by [[Misguided Bully]] and [[Misguided Thief]] which drop no creature product and were implemented on the same update as guidebook. This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
flavortext: Someone's guidebook. It looks rather used and seems to have been read many times.

name: Guilt (Item)
notes: A [[Dark Soul]] will leave behind its '''guilt''' after dying. It looks the same as [[Lost Time (Item)]].\nPart of the [[Cults of Tibia Quest]].

name: Half-Digested Stones
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Hammer of Carving (Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Hammer of Carving]] charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 20% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Hammer of Carving (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Hammer of Carving]] heavily charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Hammer of Carving (Overcharged)
notes: This item is a [[Hammer of Carving]] overcharged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Hammer of Destruction
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history: This weapon was created as the result of the unification of the [[Hammer of Carving]], [[Hammer of Remedy]] and [[Hammer of Mayhem]].\n\nOn [[Updates/12.08.7995|February 5, 2019]], the level requirement for this weapon was raised from 100 to 200.

name: Hammer of Mayhem (Charged)
notes:
This item is a [[Hammer of Mayhem]] charged with [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Hammer of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Hammer of Mayhem]] heavily charged with [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 15% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 25% to 40%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Hammer of Mayhem (Overcharged)
notes: This item is a [[Hammer of Mayhem]] overcharged with [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 20% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 30% to 60%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Hammer of Mighty Cheating
notes:
This item was implemented in the [[Updates/9.1|Summer Update 2011]] with the first batch of [[World Changes]], including [[The Mummy's Curse World Change|The Mummy's Curse]]. Its name suggests it was used for some kind of cheating, possibly used during internal tests to break [[Ornate Canopic Jar]]s in a single try. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Battle Hammer]], a [[Giant Smithhammer]] and a [[Trunkhammer]].
flavortext: This hammer is a lesser version of the fabled Ban-Hammer.

name: Hammer of Remedy
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Remedy (Charged)}} [[Hammer of Remedy (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Remedy (Heavily Charged)}} [[Hammer of Remedy (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Hammer of Remedy (Overcharged)}} [[Hammer of Remedy (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Hammer of Carving, Hammer of Mayhem and Hammer of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Hammer of Destruction}} [[Hammer of Destruction]].

name: Hammer of Remedy (Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Hammer of Remedy]] charged with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Hammer of Remedy (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Hammer of Remedy]] heavily charged with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Hammer of Remedy (Overcharged)
notes: This item is a [[Hammer of Remedy]] overcharged with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 35% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Hammer of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Hand Puppets (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s with [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of [[Hand Puppets]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Harpoon of a Giant Snail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: The harpoon of the Count of the Core is hollow and contains lethal poison.

name: Hastily Scribbled Note
notes:
Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.\n
See text on [[How to Increase the Potency of Herbal Substances (Book)]].

name: Healing Rune for Druids
notes: This rune was implemented in the [[Updates/9.8|Winter Update 2012]] when [[Isle of Destiny]] was revamped, suggesting that it was intended to be given during the [[Festival of Initiates]]. Although the item name implies this rune can only be used by druids, there is no actual vocation requirement to use it. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Health Keg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is available in the [[Store]] only. It fills up to 500 [[Health Potion]]s. All potions created this way as well as the keg itself will be kept in [[Your Store Inbox]]. A keg is not only useful for providing potions in a hunting ground, it also saves you some capacity as its constant weight equals the net weight of 250 potions. The keg can only be used by the character who purchased it in the Store. For this reason, the potions filled using the keg need to fit the character's vocation and level. Once the keg is empty it will vanish into thin air.\n\n{{Seealso|Cask & Keg Value Effectiveness}}
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its Store price was 23 [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This keg can be used to refill health potions.

name: Heart of the Mountain (Item)
droppedby: The Sandking | The Souldespoiler | The Unarmored Voidborn | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | The Source of Corruption
notes:
This item can be used to provide the user the [[blessing]] [[Heart of the Mountain]]. It only works once and then it disappears, the [[Stone Shower Single Field Effect]] [[File:Stone Shower Single Field Effect.gif|32px|link=Stone Shower Effect]] appears on the user and the following message will appear: {{Server Message|The Heart of the Mountain encourages you.}}
If the user already has the blessing, the following message will appear in orange preventing using it: {{Message|type=sound|You already possess this blessing.}}\nYou have the chance of getting this item by using a [[Mystery Box]] which is a reward from [[Cults of Tibia Quest]].
history: This was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] from its implementation till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. It became tradable at the [[Market]] and its light color was changed on {{OfficialNewsArchive|4219|August 1, 2017}} ([[Updates/11.41.5435|11.41]]).
flavortext: The Heart of the Mountain is contained in it.

name: Heavy Crystal Fragment
droppedby: The Baron from Below | The Count of the Core | The Duke of the Depths
notes: It expires in one day.\nPart of the [[Dangerous Depths Quest]].
flavortext: A heavy fragment harvested from a large tree of crystals. It's fragile but should last about a day.

name: Heavy Old Tome
droppedby: Animated Cyclops | Cyclops | Ghoul | Grand Master Oberon | Orc | Orc Cult Priest | Orc Shaman | Orc Spearman | Orc Warrior | Skeleton | Troll
notes: Besides being dropped by monsters, it can also be obtained from each [[Brass-Shod Chest]] once per [[character]].\nPart of the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].

name: Highly Charged Lodestone
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Spike Tasks Quest|Geomantic Charges}}.

name: Horn of Kalyassa
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It used to be [[Kalyassa]]'s. Obtained and used during the [[First Dragon Quest]].

name: Huge Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: The shell of the Baron from Below.

name: Huge Spiky Snail Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: The spikey shell of the Count of the Core.

name: Icy Barbarian Axe Replica
notes: This item is a replica of an [[Icy Barbarian Axe]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.

name: Icy Blacksteel Replica
notes: This item is a replica of an [[Icy Blacksteel Sword]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.

notes: This item is a replica of an [[Icy Crystal Mace]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.

name: Icy Heroic Axe Replica
notes: This item is a replica of an [[Icy Heroic Axe]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.

name: Icy Knight Axe Replica
notes: This item is a replica of an [[Icy Knight Axe]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.

name: Imbuing Crystal
notes: Obtained in the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: This is a Shaper crystal used by their ancient imbuing shrines. It has been separated from its shrine. Without a crystal, it cannot focus any energy.

name: Imortus (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s with [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of [[Imortus]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Golden Idol of Tukh
notes: It will become [[Red Ectoplasmic Residue]] when it expires.\n\nPart of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].

name: Golden Magic Longsword
notes: This item was awarded for the winners of the [[Tournament Valour]]. The [[Gilded Magic Longsword]] looks the same and can be bought in the [[Store]], which also means it cannot be traded with other players. \n\nDespite being a one-handed weapon, it has no attack nor defense, meaning it's only useful for decoration purposes.
flavortext: This is a golden replica of the famous magic longsword.

name: Golden Marble
notes: It's part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
flavortext: A golden marble. An engraving reads: VII.

name: Golden Mask
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Bragrumol | Burning Gladiator | Mozradek | Neferi the Spy | Priestess of the Wild Sun | Sister Hetai | Xogixath

name: Golden Sea Horse Figurine
notes: Item obtained in {{Spoiler Section|Kilmaresh Quest|A Shark in Need}}.
flavortext: It is a mark of distinction, awarded by the priesthood of Bastesh to those who help sea creatures in need.

name: Good Remains of a Druid
notes: These are the remains of a [[Dark Druid]]. \nPart of the [[Grave Danger Quest]].

name: Good Remains of a Knight
notes: These are the remains of a [[Dark Knight]]. \nPart of the [[Grave Danger Quest]].

name: Good Remains of a Paladin
notes: These are the remains of a [[Dark Paladin]]. \nPart of the [[Grave Danger Quest]].

name: Good Remains of a Sorcerer
notes: These are the remains of a [[Dark Sorcerer]]. \nPart of the [[Grave Danger Quest]].

name: Goromaphone (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. It looks the same as a [[Goromaphone]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Grainy Fireworks Powder
notes:
You can fill a [[Fireworks Capsule]] with it to make a numbered Fireworks Rocket:

* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '0'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '0']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '1'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '1']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '2'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '2']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '3'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '3']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '4'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '4']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '5'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '5']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '6'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '6']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '7'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '7']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '8'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '8']]
* {{Ilink|Fireworks in Shape of '9'}} [[Fireworks in Shape of '9']]

name: Grant of Arms
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is required to upgrade a [[Falcon Shield]] into a [[Falcon Escutcheon]].
flavortext: Letter from the Order of the Falcon conferring on a person and his or her descendants to bear the Falcon coat of arms.

name: Grave Flower Extract
notes: Obtained by distilling a [[Grave Flower]]. \nPart of the [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].

name: Greasy Wool

name: Greed's Arm

name: Green Crystal

flavortext: The crystal is full of energy.

name: Green Ectoplasm
notes: It can be used to travel between the areas of the Haunted House as long as you completed the corresponding missions of the [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: The stuff nightmares are made of - literally.

name: Green Energy Ball
notes: Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].

name: Green Fireworks Powder
notes: You can fill a [[Fireworks Capsule]] with it to make a Fireworks Rocket.

name: Green Fireworks Rocket
notes: Using an [[Obsidian Knife]] on a firework allows you to disassemble the [[Fireworks|Green Fireworks Rockets]] into its respective components: [[Green Fireworks Powder]] and the [[Fireworks Capsule]].\n\nYou can create one by using {{Ilink|Green Fireworks Powder}} [[Green Fireworks Powder]] on a {{Ilink|Fireworks Capsule}} [[Fireworks Capsule]].
flavortext: It can be disassembled with the right tool.

name: Green Gingerbread Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Green Glass Plate
notes: 15 are needed for [[The Dream Courts Quest]].

name: Green Marble
notes: \nIt's part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
history: Prior to [[Updates/12.62.10592|February 09, 2021]], this object name used to be ''blue marble''.
flavortext: A bright green marble. An engraving reads: II.

name: Green Memory Shard
notes: Item needed for {{Spoiler Section|Kilmaresh Quest|Fafnar's Wrath}}.

name: Greenish Flintstone
notes: \nItem temporarily obtained and used during [[A Pirate's Tail Quest]].

name: Grey Raven Kit
notes: Use it while standing inside a house to unpack a {{Ilink|Grey Raven}} [[Grey Raven]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].\nObtainable from the [[Bewitched]] [[World Quests|World Quest]].
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a grey raven.

name: Grimace
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Ground Reed
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: In order to get ground reed, you need to use a [[Bunch of Reed]] with a [[Millstone]]. If you use ground reed with a [[Bucket]] or [[Trough]] of [[Water]], you will make a [[Lump of Reed Flour Dough]]. If you use it on a [[Baking Tray]], you will get a [[Baking Tray (Reed)]]. If you use it on any [[Oven]], you will bake [[Reed Balls]].

name: Gruesome Fan

name: Gryphon Mask

It's a deflated [[Green 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)|Green 25 Years Balloon]] {{Ilink|Green 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Green and Blue Presents Kit
notes: Using a [[Green and Blue Presents Kit]] within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]] triggers a transformation, converting the kit into a [[Green and a Blue Present]]. {{Ilink|Green and a Blue Present}}
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a green and a blue present.

name: Green and Red Presents Kit
notes: Using a [[Green and Red Presents Kit]] within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]] triggers a transformation, converting the kit into a [[Green and a Red Present]]. {{Ilink|Green and a Red Present}}

name: Hireling Lamp
notes: This lamp contains a [[Hireling]] that can be placed inside a [[House]] or [[Guildhall]] owned by the character. You can't open the lamp in another character's house, even if it's a character from the same account. \n\n{{Seealso|Hireling}}
flavortext: This mysterious lamp summons your very own personal hireling.

name: Hireling Name Change Scroll
Hireling Sex Change Rune
Holy Amplification
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your targets sensitivity to your [[Holy Damage]] attacks by 8% for one hour. It only affects attacks against monsters.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily amplifies holy damage against monsters.

name: Holy Resilience
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your [[Holy Damage]] protection by 8% for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases holy protection.

name: Human Teeth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dark Carnisylvan | Hulking Carnisylvan | Poisonous Carnisylvan
notes: 2 of these is needed during [[Adventures of Galthen Quest]].
flavortext: Human teeth from a dead carnisylvan.

notes:
It's a deflated [[Hydra Balloon (Inflated)|Hydra Balloon]] {{Ilink|Hydra Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Special Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Special Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Special Balloon Box/Statistics}}

history: * First dropped in [[Gentebra]] by {{Character|Galll}} on July 15, 2025.<ref>[https://www.twitch.tv/galll_tv/clip/AmazingMoralYamSwiftRage-zl1wpbTL1FA6QIBi Twitch Clip]</ref>\n* On {{OfficialNewsArchive|8436|July 21, 2025}}, the [[Summer Update 2025]] nerfed some of its attributes with the introduction of [[Weapon Proficiency]].\n* On [[Updates/15.12.c7d92c|October 21, 2025]] the attack value was reduced from 47 to 45.

flavortext: Mending the fragments of the guardian statue's crystal, a potent energy emits from its core. Letting it shine in a bright and mystic light.

name: Ice-Covered Certificate of Ancestry
notes: Obtained in [[The Order of the Stag Quest]].
flavortext: This certificate affirms the birth of Eldoran, son of Cadwgan Etzel. By decree it has to be returned to the Bounacean court within a month, due time.

name: Icy Crypt Rune
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: On November 18, 2025, in a post on the [[Test Server]] forums for the [[Winter Update 2025]], [[Ilyndor]] stated that these runes are affected by [[Cyclopedia#Boss_Points|boss slot bonus]].
flavortext: This rune pulses with corrupt magic bound into bone. Only by offering a complete set to the guardian spirit may its blight be undone.

notes: You can get Ink by using an empty liquid container on a dead [[Biting Book]]. \nFive vials of ink are required during the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

name: Inkwell
droppedby: Elf Arcanist | Memory of an Elf | Warlock
buyfrom: Bertha, Fyodor, Gorn, Perod, Shiantis, The Librarian: 20, Thomas
sellto: Beatrice:8, Bertha:8, Fyodor:8, Gorn:8, Perod:8, Pompan:8, Shiantis:8, The Librarian, Thomas:8
notes:
This can be found in most [[Hometown|cities]] of [[Tibia]].
\nIt looks the same as the [[Poet's Fencing Quill]].\nOne can be found in the [[Minotaur Hell Quest]] on [[Rookgaard]] together with 5 [[Scroll]]s inside a [[Chest]]. Used in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].

name: Iron Hammer
notes:
Looks the same as the [[Snake Destroyer]].
\n
\nObtainable in the [[Iron Hammer Quest]].

name: Iron Helmet
droppedby: Bandit | Crypt Defiler | Crypt Shambler | Demon Skeleton | Gladiator | Grave Robber | Menacing Carnivor | Nomad (Basic) | Nomad (Blue) | Nomad (Female) | Wild Warrior
sellto: Azil, Brengus, Cornelia, Flint, H.L.:30, Hardek, Kroox, Memech, Morpel, Sam, Shanar, Willard, Yanni
notes: Not used much as a [[Helmet]] as most people prefer the [[Soldier Helmet]] because it is cheaper, easier to get, and is only 2 oz heavier. A good item for lootbags when sold to an [[NPC]] who buys them. There are rumors saying that there's a [[quest]] to obtain one in [[Rookgaard]].

name: Iron Ore
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Cliff Strider | Control Tower | Damaged Worker Golem | Drillworm | Dwarf | Dwarf Geomancer | Dwarf Guard | Dwarf Miner | Dwarf Soldier | Enslaved Dwarf | Eternal Guardian | Foreman Kneebiter | Frazzlemaw | Glooth Battery | Glooth Fairy | Glooth Golem | Grorlam | Guzzlemaw | Jagged Earth Elemental | Lava Golem | Lost Basher | Lost Berserker | Lost Thrower | Mad Technomancer | Magma Crawler | Mawhawk | Metal Gargoyle | Museum Stone Golem | Orewalker | Rustheap Golem | Stone Golem | The False God | The Last Lore Keeper | Ushuriel | War Golem | Weakened Frazzlemaw | Worker Golem
notes:
Generally, many players are interested in buying this item. As a result of so many more monsters dropping the ore, its price has decreased.
100 are needed for [[Knight Outfits Quest]].
100 are needed for [[Warrior Outfits Quest]].
100 are needed for [[Barbarian Outfits Quest]].
3 are needed for [[The Traveling Trader Quest]].
1 can be obtained from the [[Iron Ore Quest]].

name: Jacket
buyfrom: Azil, Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Cornelia, Coltrayne: 10, Dixi: 10, Esrik, Flint, Hardek, Kroox, Lee'Delle: 9, Memech, Morpel, Norbert, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Rudolph, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Willard, Yanni

notes: None.\nCan be obtained by skipping [[The Beginning Quest]].

name: Jug
buyfrom: Bertha, Chephan, Gorn, Maro, Perod, Zora
notes:
You can find them nearly in every Tibian [[tavern]].
\nIt looks the same as an [[Empty Jug]] and a [[Jug (Ants)]].

name: Juice Squeezer
notes: This tool is used to make [[Fruit Juice]] from any kind of fruit. It can also make [[Coconut Milk]] from [[Coconut]]s.The Juice Squeezer has to be in a container to make Fruit Juice and a [[Vial]] should be in the same container. You can then transfer the juice from the vial to another container since it appears impossible to do it automatically e.g. To put juice in a [[Pot]] you need to pass it from juice in a [[Vial]] to juice in a [[Pot]].\n\nYou can use the [[Squeezing Gear of Girlpower]] as a substitution for this tool.

name: Katana
droppedby: Memory of a Vampire | Naga Warrior | Rottie the Rotworm | Stalker | Vampire
sellto: Baltim, Brengus, Coltrayne: 35, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, H.L.: 8, Habdel, Hardek, Lee'Delle: 35, Memech, Morpel, Obi: 35, Raffael: 35, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
notes:
Katana is the strongest obtainable sword in [[Rookgaard]].
It is part of the [[Rook Set]].
It can be found as a daily spawn in [[Dusalk's Troll Clan Cave]]. On [[Rookgaard]] you can obtain one through the [[Katana Quest]].

name: Key Ring
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Adept of the Cult | Dark Torturer | Enlightened of the Cult | Lost Soul | Mr. Punish
notes: They were removed with the [[Updates/8.6|Summer Update 2010]]. It worked similar to an ordinary [[Backpack]], but could not be equipped in the backpack slot. It was the lightest container. Players who owned one were compensated with a [[Broken Key Ring]] inside a [[Jewelled Backpack]].

name: Kitchen Knife
notes:
Can be found in most cities, or in certain areas where [[creatures]] live such as the [[Troll]] cave east of [[Thais]] and the [[Swamp Troll]] cave south of [[Venore]]. It can be used for cutting [[pumpkin]]s, as well as decorating [[Cake]]s.\nTwo of these are needed in missions of [[What a foolish Quest]].
Needed in a mission of [[The Ice Islands Quest]].
Needed in the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]]. Or instead you can use an [[Obsidian Knife]].
Can be used to cut fruit for [[Decorated Cake]]s in order to gain the [[Piece of Cake]] and [[With a Cherry on Top]] [[achievements]].

name: Knife
droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Apprentice Sheng | Assassin | Barbarian Headsplitter | Barbarian Skullhunter | Cobra Assassin | Crazed Summer Vanguard | Faceless Bane | Headpecker | Smuggler | Undead Prospector | Usurper Archer | Werehyaena
notes: The weakest [[sword]] in the game and is primarily used for [[training]], either with another player or by slowly killing weak [[creatures]] with it. It's among the lightest [[melee]] weapons, making it valuable for destroying obstacles when trapped. It's considered very rare on [[Rookgaard]], as it is only dropped by [[Apprentice Sheng]].\nCan be found as a [[daily spawn]] in a [[chest]] in [[Dusalk's Troll Clan Cave]].

name: Knight Armor
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Amenef the Burning | Black Knight | Brutus Bloodbeard | Crystal Spider | Deadeye Devious | Enusat the Onyx Wing | Esmeralda | Falcon Knight | Fleshcrawler | Giant Spider | Giant Spider (Nostalgia) | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Hand of Cursed Fate | Hydra | Juggernaut | Lethal Lissy | Lord Azaram | Mamma Longlegs | Medusa | Mooh'Tah Warrior | Naga Warrior | Neferi the Spy | Pirat Cutthroat | Preceptor Lazare | Quara Hydromancer | Quara Hydromancer Scout | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Rhindeer | Ron the Ripper | Sister Hetai | Stampor | Terrorsleep | The Bloodweb | The Many | The Old Widow | The Snapper | The Welter | Tromphonyte | Undead Dragon | Usurper Archer | Zanakeph
notes:
Part of the [[Knight Set]].
After the [[Updates/8.4|Update 8.4]], the Knight Armor became for [[knight]]s and [[paladin]]s only.

Paladins are recommended to wear [[Paladin Armor]] instead as they save 55 oz of capacity and gain +2 [[Distance Fighting]], but as this is more expensive some choose to use the Knight Armor until they can afford it later.

Knight Armors can also be obtained by using a [[Rust Remover]] on a [[Rusted Armor]] or on a [[Slightly Rusted Armor]].
Obtainable in the [[Orc Fortress Quest]].

name: Knight Axe
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Amenef the Burning | Black Knight | Blemished Spawn | Execowtioner | Girtablilu Warrior | Hellhound | Hulking Carnisylvan | Kerberos | Lost Basher | Lost Berserker | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Minotaur Invader | Morguthis | Neferi the Spy | Pirat Cutthroat | Poisonous Carnisylvan | Skeleton Elite Warrior | Thanatursus | The Enraged Thorn Knight | Tremendous Tyrant | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator
notes: Can be obtained through the [[Orc Fortress Quest]] and [[Deeper Fibula Quest]].
history:
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy Knight Axe}} [[Icy Knight Axe]]
* {{Ilink|Earth Knight Axe}} [[Earth Knight Axe]]
* {{Ilink|Energy Knight Axe}} [[Energy Knight Axe]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery Knight Axe}} [[Fiery Knight Axe]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].

name: Knight Legs
droppedby: Black Knight | Cliff Strider | Count Vlarkorth | Crystal Spider | Cult Enforcer | Flameborn | Foam Stalker | Giant Spider | Giant Spider (Nostalgia) | Hellgorak | Hellspawn | Hide | Horadron | Lost Basher | Mamma Longlegs | Menacing Carnivor | Mooh'Tah Warrior | Nightmare | Orewalker | Plaguesmith | Sir Baeloc | Soul-Broken Harbinger | The Bloodweb | The Old Widow | Tormentor | Usurper Knight | Usurper Warlock | Vicious Squire | Gore Horn | Sulphur Spouter | Two-Headed Turtle
notes: Fourth strongest [[legs]] of [[Tibia]], commonly used by [[Knight]]s of level 30+. They can also be attained by removing rust from [[Rusted Legs]] and [[Slightly Rusted Legs]].
history: Its armor value was changed from 9 to 8 with [[Updates/7.0|Update 7.0]].

name: Label
buyfrom: Auron, Benjamin, Chemar, Chrystal, Dove, Fyodor, Gnomailion, Herbert, Jakahr, Kaya, Liane, Lokur, Murim, Nelly, Ninos, Olrik, Ray, Redward, Robson, Wally
notes: Labels must have a name in the first line, to be then placed inside a [[Parcel]]. After [[Updates/8.2|Summer Update 8.2]] it can be bought for 1 [[gp]] from [[Postman NPCs]]. Labels can be reused and often litter [[Depot]]s, or are in [[Stamped Parcel]]s that litter [[Depot]]s. Looks the same as a [[Faked Label]].

name: Lamp
droppedby: Barbarian Bloodwalker | Dark Monk | Fernfang | Monk (Creature) | Monk of the Order | Orc Berserker
notes: Provides light for 33 minutes. Same amount of light as [[Utevo Lux]]. Unlit it looks the same as an [[Old Power Core]].\nCan be refilled with a [[Vial of Oil]].\n'''Important Note:''' you must use the lamp on the vial in order to refill it. If you use the vial on the lamp you lose the oil and the lamp is '''not''' refilled. It is not known why it does not refill the other way around.

name: Leather Armor
droppedby: Demon (Goblin) | Dworc Fleshhunter | Dworc Venomsniper | Dworc Voodoomaster | Goblin | Goblin Assassin | Goblin Leader | Goblin Scavenger | Mountain Troll | Muglex Clan Assassin | Muglex Clan Footman | Muglex Clan Scavenger | Oodok Witchmaster

notes: Good for early levels on [[Rookgaard]]. Part of the [[Leather Set]].

droppedby: Big Boss Trolliver | Dwarf Guard | Elf | Island Troll | Swamp Troll | Troll | Troll Champion | Troll Marauder | White Lion | Witch | Young Troll
buyfrom: Aldo:10, Azil:10, Baltim:10, Brengus:10, Cedrik:10, Cornelia:10, Esrik:10, Flint:10, Hardek:10, Kroox:10, Memech:10, Morpel:10, Raffael:10, Robert:10, Rock In A Hard Place:10, Rudolph, Sam:10, Shanar:10, Turvy:10, Willard:10, Yanni:10

droppedby: Apprentice Sheng | Bellicose Orger | Demon (Goblin) | Goblin | Goblin Assassin | Goblin Leader | Goblin Scavenger | Island Troll | Minotaur Mage | Minotaur Occultist | Muglex Clan Assassin | Muglex Clan Footman | Muglex Clan Scavenger | Poacher | Smuggler | Troll | Werelioness | Young Troll
buyfrom: Aldo, Azil, Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne: 12, Cornelia, Dixi, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Hardek, Kroox, Lee'Delle:11, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Willard, Yanni

notes: It's probably the first helmet someone finds or purchases. It is part of the [[Leather Set]].

name: Leather Legs
droppedby: Apprentice Sheng | Arthom the Hunter | Bandit | Bellicose Orger | Crazed Dwarf | Dwarf | Dwarf Miner | Gang Member | Minotaur Mage | Minotaur Occultist | Poacher | Smuggler | Usurper Knight
buyfrom: Aldo, Azil, Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne: 10, Cornelia, Dixi, Esrik, Flint, Hardek, Kroox, Lee'Delle:9, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rudolph, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Willard, Yanni
sellto: Aldo, Azil, Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Cornelia, Dixi:2, Esrik, Flint, Hardek, Kroox, Lee'Delle:2, Memech, Morpel, Raffael, Robert, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Willard, Yanni
notes:
One of the first items you'll own.
Looks the same as [[Smelly Leather Legs]].

name: Left Horn
notes: This [[item]] is gotten in [[Helmet of the Ancients Quest]], by having [[Blue Note]] in inventory, and going through [[teleport]] in [[Ancient Ruins Tomb|Vashresamun's Tomb]].
flavortext: This item seems to be a single part of a bigger object.

name: Legion Helmet
sellto: Dixi: 22, Flint, H.L.:8, Lee'Delle: 22, Raffael: 22, Willard
notes: This is the best helmet in [[Rookgaard]]. One is required for an addon of the [[Citizen Outfits Quest]], both the mainland and [[Citizen Outfits Quest on Rook|Rookgaard]] quests. If you want to make the addon, it is recommended to get this helmet while still in Rookgaard. This item can be obtained in the [[Dragon Corpse Quest]], or the [[Present Box Quest]] in Rookgaard. It can also be obtained in [[Dawnport]] through the [[Dawnport Legion Helmet Quest]].
history: * Legion Helmets were removed from [[Rotworm]] loot in [[Christmas Update 2009]], raising their value considerably.\n* After [[Christmas Update 2009]] the value of Legion Helmet rose steeply because they are not dropped by Rotworms anymore but still needed for an outfit quest.

name: Lemonade
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This can be received for free out of [[Lemonade Cask]]s found in various locations around Tibia.

name: Leopard Armor
notes: This armor is a rare drop from [[Assassin]]s. It's pretty similar to a [[Scale Armor]], but is 10 [[ounces]] lighter; which raises its price.

name: Letter
buyfrom: Auron, Benjamin, Chemar, Chrystal, Dove, Fyodor, Gnomailion, Herbert, Jakahr, Kaya, Liane, Lokur, Murim, Nelly, Ninos, Olrik, Ray, Redward, Rock In A Hard Place, Wally
notes:
Price is 5 [[gp]] if you have completed the [[Postman Quest]], 8 gp otherwise.\nLooks the same as an [[Invitation]].
They are used to send letters to other players via the [[Mailbox]]es spread throughout the map. Once sent, they arrive as a [[Stamped Letter]] to the recipient and cannot be rewritten or reused.
\n''See also [[Mailbox]] and [[Sending Letters]].''

name: Letterbag
notes: Item temporarily obtained on the [[The Postman Missions Quest]].
flavortext: This bag is nearly bursting from all the letters inside.

name: Lich Staff
notes: You can see it in treasure room in [[Ferumbras]] Tower. [[Lich]]es carry this staff but they do not drop these. This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
flavortext: A scent of death and decay sticks to this weapon.

name: Life Crystal
droppedby: Animated Feather | Banshee | Burster Spectre | Crazed Winter Rearguard | Dark Monk | Demodras | Dharalion | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Dracola | Dragon | Dragon Lord | Elf Arcanist | Faceless Bane | Fernfang | Frost Dragon | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Ghazbaran | Hydra | Lizard Snakecharmer | Mad Scientist | Memory of an Elf | Monk (Creature) | Monk of the Order | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Quara Pincher Scout | Serpent Spawn | Undead Dragon | Ushuriel | War Golem | Worker Golem | Young Sea Serpent
notes: It looks the same as a [[Deep Crystal]], a [[Gnomish Resonance Crystal]], a [[Purified Soul]], a [[Resonance Crystal]], a [[Resonance Crystal (Recorded)]] and a [[Spectral Stone]]. It glows weakly in the dark.\nIt can be traded for a [[Life Ring]] by speaking with [[Chester Kahs]].

name: Life Ring
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Arachnophobica | Barbarian Headsplitter | Barbarian Skullhunter | Choking Fear | Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Elite | Deepling Master Librarian | Deepling Scout | Deepling Spellsinger | Deepling Warrior | Deepworm | Flamecaller Zazrak | Gaz'haragoth | Ghost of a Planegazer | Ghoul | Groam | Lizard Dragon Priest | Lizard Snakecharmer | Madareth | Mahrdis | Massive Water Elemental | Metal Gargoyle | Midnight Panther | Mutated Tiger | Neutral Deepling Warrior | Omnivora | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Rot Elemental | Serpent Spawn | The Lord of the Lice | The Noxious Spawn | The Snapper | Undead Prospector | Water Elemental | White Pale | Yakchal | Zomba | Zombie | Zushuka
notes:
The [[ring]] gives 8 [[manapoint]]s and 2 [[hitpoint]]s every 6 seconds on top of your normal [[regeneration]] rate for the 20 minutes that it lasts, which results in additional 1600 [[manapoint]]s and 400 [[hitpoint]]s in total; 3200 [[manapoint]]s and 800 [[hitpoint]]s if the player is inside a [[Resting Area]] and double regeneration is unlocked.

See the [[Money Spent per Mana Point|GP/MP]], [[Money Spent per Hit Point|GP/HP]], [[Capacity Taken per Mana Point|Cap/MP]] and [[Capacity Taken per Hit Point|Cap/HP]] efficiency tables for comparisons of the different items that regenerates your mana and hit points.

You can get [[Life Crystal]]s exchanged for Life Rings by speaking to [[Chester Kahs]]. You can also obtain 1 of these [[ring]]s from the [[Life Ring Quest]], [[Darashia Dragon Quest]] and [[Behemoth Quest]]. A life ring is used in the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]].

name: Magic Longsword
value: Negotiable<!-- for unique or extremely rare, unobtainable items, we should NOT list a price. -->
notes:
Its inestimable value comes from its rarity and history. Also known as the ''Cyclopmania Sword'', ''Cyc Sword'' and ''Godslayer''. This sword is not available from any monster or quest in the game.

The in game legend says that, many years ago, the evil god [[Brog]] enslaved [[Cyclopes]] to smith weapons for his perilous armies. In secrecy, the smiths created this powerful weapon in order to commit mutiny against their captor. They failed at the task of slaying Brog, however he was heavily wounded. Filled with unspeakable rage he cast the sword down into the lands of Tibia to be lost forever. While buried in Brog's flesh, it became covered with his horrible blood, which hardened the blade and enchanted the ''Godslayer'' with unmatched power. However, a dark curse has been cast upon the blade causing its owner to become stricken with awesome madness and horrible luck. It is said nothing good can come to he who possesses the mystical blade. 

<noinclude><gallery mode="nolines">
File:godslayer.jpg
| 1 = With {{character|Alex}}
File:Mls_cele.png
| 2 = {{character|Honken}}'s house
File:Moises the Dark MLS.png
| 3 = on {{character|Moises the Dark}}'s house along with other rares
File:Magic longsword.png
</gallery></noinclude>
history:
The Magic Longsword first entered Tibia when Arieswar, Taghor and another very powerful person at that time were exploring the [[Plains of Havoc]] in search of a way to enter [[Knightwatch Tower]], with the knowledge that [[pick]]s would now open new holes. This was discovered by Taghor when, after an update, he went running around the areas surrounding [[Carlin]] and found a hole. He went down the hole and found [[Guido]] down there, who told him to go away. Taghor decided to return later only to find the hole no longer existed. Taghor began doing everything to the spot where the hole had been and eventually tried the pick.

After discovering the room currently known for containing the [[Ornamented Shield Quest]], they noticed a body under a [[fire field]]. Inside this body was a key to the Knightwatch Tower, a book, some assorted junk, and an item with a plain [[sword]] graphic. Upon further inspection of this sword, one-handed with attack 80 and defense 60, they soon realized just what they had stumbled upon. Taghor received a [[Magic Sword]] as compensation and attempts were made to keep this discovery quiet. Less than a week went by before Guido, furious that a map editor had hidden this weapon for himself, angrily demanded the weapon.

=== Second Discovery ===
The Magic Longsword was once again discovered, this time [[Arieswar]] found it in a killed [[Cyclops]]. Once again, this sword was also destroyed by [[CipSoft]] along with possibly other priceless items contained in Arieswar's depot.

=== Tibia Convention Award ===
The Magic Longsword finally resurfaced (with reduced stats of Atk: 55, Def: 40) and was awarded to {{character|Hagbard}} at the [[Tibia Convention 2001]] in Germany.

=== Auctions, sales, and robbery ===
* Hagbard decided to sell the sword, so he held an auction, which was won by {{character|Alex}} with a bid of 5.5 million gp.
* The sword was purchased for 5.5kk by Siobkerry, of Hokuten. 
* Siobkerry wanted to sell the sword for 7kk to Recca, but there was a problem. Tibia's first official war was going on, and it was {{Guild|Hokuten}}, vs. {{Guild|Satori}}, which was Recca's guild. Seeing as [[Safe Trade]] could not handle the amount of items necessary for this trade, it was decided that the only way the sword could be traded safely between these two enemies was for a middle man to do the trading. They called upon a renowned trader, Alex. Alex was only a lvl 20 druid, but he had been trading for so many years (before safe trade) that he was considered very trustable. There was one fatal flaw to Recca's plan, which was the key to Alex's plan... Alex was (secretly) also Strenni, a well known sorcerer who was a member of Hokuten. The trade went forward, with Siobkerry and Alex robbing all of the money from Recca, their enemy. The items could all be seen in the [[Dark Mansion]] for some time, as Hokuten was the original owner of it. This whole story has been since added to a book that can be found on the [[Isle of the Kings]] on books [[Legendary Curses VII.I (Book)]] and [[Legendary Curses VII.II (Book)]]
* It eventually belonged to {{Character|Moises the Dark}}, in [[Antica]].
* It got bought by {{Character|Rei de Lutabra}} around December, 2019, and was brought to [[Lutabra]].

=== Balancing ===
It was for a very long time the strongest non-throwable weapon in Tibia, besides the [[Ice Rapier]] which had 100 attack but would break in one hit. Later the Ice Rapier was changed to 60 attack, which was still stronger than the the Magic Longsword. Over the years, however, stronger weapons with additional attributes such as skill boosts and elemental damage were implemented, topping off the Magic Longsword.
flavortext: It's the magic Cyclopmania Sword.

name: Manafluid
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Manafluid is a fluid just like [[blood]] and [[Water (Liquid)|water]]. It restores between 50 and 150 [[mana]]. Until {{Update|8.10|the introduction of potions}}, the manafluid was the only item to regenerate mana instantly. 

These days you can obtain it from different places as [[Daily Respawns]]:

* [[Potion Stand]]s in [[Yalahar]] [[Magician Quarter]] (only when there's a full [[Floor Reset]], which is rare)
* In multiple places around [[Glooth Factory]], e.g. {{Mapper Coords|131.98|125.36|11|2|text=here}}. (Probably only after a full Floor Reset as well)
* [[Time Travel Dungeon]] ({{Mapper Coords|130.184|121.28|10|4|text=here}})
* Near [[Marapur]]'s [[Training School]], {{Mapper Coords|132.3|127.237|5|4|text=here}}

You can move it into another [[Containers#Fluid Containers|fluid containers]]. It looks the same as [[Wine]].

<gallery>
Potion Stand of Manafluid.png|Manafluid spawns in a [[Potion Stand]] in the [[Magician Quarter]].
Potion Stand of Manafluid2.png|Manafluid in a [[Potion Stand]] in the [[Time Travel Dungeon]].

history:
With update {{Update|8.10}} the following changes occurred:
* [[Potions]] are introduced. Manafluid becomes obsolete.
* [[Magic Shopkeeper NPCs]] no longer sell vials of Manafluid. They used to for 55gp each.
* Note that they are still obtainable from daily respawns.

They used to spawn in a tavern at [[Nargor]]. This was removed in an unknown update.

name: Infernal Bolt
notes:
Infernal Bolts have the 2nd highest attack of all ammunition available for [[Distance_Weapons#Crossbows/|crossbows]] in the game (only beaten by [[Spectral Bolt]]s).
These bolts are not available from NPC stores, thus their price depends on the game world economy. The easiest way to get them is by asking an experienced blacksmith to craft 3 bolts from a single [[Soul Orb]]. Historically, these bolts were seldom used due to sparsity of the material. Nowadays, on older servers there is an abundance of soul orbs coming from places like [[Roshamuul Prison]] being a popular hunting destination among higher-level characters. If obtained in large quantities at NPC buyback price of 25 gp, an infernal bolt effectively costs as low as 8.5 gp each. Such a price tag places them cheaper than weaker [[Prismatic Bolt|Prismatic]] and [[Drill Bolt]]s, thus making them a very affordable ammunition in terms of cost per damage, beating [[Crystalline Arrow]]s by a factor of ~2.5. You can '''exchange''' [[Soul Orb]]s for Infernal Bolts through the [[The Sweaty Cyclops Quest/Spoiler#Ability to deal with A Sweaty Cyclops|The Sweaty Cyclops Quest]]. Each orb turns into 3 infernal bolts.
You can '''obtain''' 100 Infernal Bolts in [[The Ultimate Challenges Quest]] Warlord Level.
history: In the [[Updates/9.60|Summer Update 2012]], the attack and level requirement were changed from 42 to 72 and level 70 to 110.
