notes:
You cannot read what is written in it.
\nLooks the same as a [[Stamped Letter]], a [[Compromising Letter]], an [[Envelope from the Wizards]], a [[Letter to Chantalle]], a [[Letter to Markwin]] and a [[Secret Letter]].Item temporarily obtained in [[Meriana Quest]].

name: Letter to Markwin
notes:
You cannot read what is written on it.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Stamped Letter]], a [[Compromising Letter]], an [[Envelope from the Wizards]], a [[Letter to Eremo]], a [[Letter to Chantalle]] and a [[Secret Letter]].Item temporarily obtained in [[The Postman Missions Quest]].

name: Leviathan's Amulet
droppedby: Animated Feather | Icecold Book | Leviathan | Liodile | Sea Serpent | Squid Warden
notes: Can be obtained by [[fishing]] in a fresh corpse of a [[Water Elemental]] or a [[Massive Water Elemental]].{{Seealso|Water Elemental/Fishing Statistics|Massive Water Elemental/Fishing Statistics}}
flavortext: It holds the last breath of Leviathan.

name: Lightning Boots
droppedby: Burning Gladiator | Cursed Prospector | Elder Wyrm | Energetic Book | Gravelord Oshuran | Juvenile Bashmu | Lich | Mazzinor | Mercurial Menace | Omrafir | Pirat Bombardier | Prince Drazzak | War Golem
notes: They give 5% protection from [[Energy Damage]], but increase damage taken from [[Earth Damage|Earth]] by 5%. They are part of the [[Lightning Set]].

name: Lightning Headband
droppedby: Anomaly | Brain Squid | Burning Gladiator | Cloak of Terror | Courage Leech | Energetic Book | Enusat the Onyx Wing | Evil Prospector | Giant Spider | High Voltage Elemental | Hulking Carnisylvan | Lord Azaram | Neferi the Spy | Outburst | Reality Reaver | Realityquake | Rupture | Sister Hetai | Sphinx | Stabilizing Reality Reaver | Two-Headed Turtle | Tyrn | Usurper Warlock | Werelioness | World Devourer
notes: It gives 4% protection from [[Energy Damage]], but increases damage taken from [[Earth Damage|Earth]] by 5%. It's part of the [[Lightning Set]].

name: Lightning Legs
droppedby: Anomaly | Black Knight | Breach Brood | Burning Gladiator | Burster | Courage Leech | Crape Man | Cursed Prospector | Elder Wyrm | Energetic Book | Energuardian of Tales | Essence of Malice | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | High Voltage Elemental | Horadron | Juvenile Bashmu | Lloyd | Massive Energy Elemental | Neferi the Spy | Outburst | Ravenous Hunger | Rupture | Sister Hetai | Tremendous Tyrant | Tyrn | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Utua Stone Sting | Yielothax | Zarabustor
notes: They used to be dropped by [[Warlock]], but nowadays it is very hard to loot these legs. They give 6% protection from [[Energy Damage]], but increase damage taken from [[Earth Damage|Earth]] by 6%. They are part of the [[Lightning Set]].

name: Lightning Pendant
droppedby: Brain Squid | Burning Gladiator | Courage Leech | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Elder Wyrm | Energetic Book | Energuardian of Tales | Evil Prospector | Faceless Bane | High Voltage Elemental | Juvenile Bashmu | Knowledge Elemental | Massive Energy Elemental | Shulgrax | Sister Hetai | Sphinx | Spiky Carnivor | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Wyrm | Yielothax
notes: Part of the [[Lightning set]]. You can use them if looted while hunting wyrms until they have few charges because even then you can still sell them to [[Rashid]]. You have to be careful because earth damage also drains charges of it, so if you are poisoned you can run out of charges very fast.

name: Lightning Robe
droppedby: Anomaly | Cursed Prospector | Elder Wyrm | High Voltage Elemental | King Zelos | Mad Mage | Mazzinor | Omrafir | Outburst | Prince Drazzak | Realityquake | Tyrn | Warlock | Zarabustor
notes: It gives 8% protection from [[Energy Damage]], but increases damage taken from [[Earth Damage|Earth]] by 8%. Even though it has the same [[armor]] and only weighs 0.5[[oz]] more than [[Blue Robe]] it's extremely hard to sell since it has a [[level]] 50 requirement; this, plus being "easy" to loot compared to other elemental equipment, makes it cheap. It's part of the [[Lightning Set]].

name: Lock Pick
notes: Opens [[Sturdy Chest]]s.\nUsed in [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].

name: Lottery Ticket
notes:
When returning 100 [[vial]]s you can choose to obtain a lottery ticket instead of money. If the ticket is a [[Winning Lottery Ticket|winning]] one it can be exchanged at the [[Edron]] fluid shop for vial belt addon. Looks the same as a [[Poem Scroll]] and a [[Scroll (TBI)]]. If you draw a blank, the ticket will disappear.

[[File:Winning Lottery Ticket.gif|left|Winning Lottery Ticket]] 
The [[Winning Lottery Ticket|winning ticket]] is like a flashing parchment. This was implemented to prevent players from scamming others on [[Safe Trade]].


Once you have opened 500 blank Lottery Tickets you will receive the [[Jinx]] achievement.

{{Seealso|Lottery Ticket/Statistics}}
flavortext: It has not been used yet.

name: Love Potion
notes: Temporarily obtainable in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest/Spoiler#Mission 3: Love.27s a Wicked Game|The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
flavortext: You better be careful with this or you might get unwanted results.

name: Lump of Cake Dough
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
If you mix a [[bucket]] or [[trough]] of [[milk]] with [[flour]] you will get a Lump of cake dough. If you use it on an oven you will receive [[cake]]. If you use it on any oven at the [[Christmas Bakery]] (and if you know the [[Gingerbread Recipe]]) you can bake a [[Gingerbreadman]] instead. If you use it on a [[Baking Tray]] you will get a [[Baking Tray (Cookie)]] use any oven to get 12 [[Cookies]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Lump of Reed Flour Dough]].
history: In a {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|small patch}} on 10 November 2009 its weight was changed from 5.00 [[oz]] to 1.00 oz.

name: Lump of Chocolate Dough
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Combine {{Ilink|Flour}} [[Flour]], {{Ilink|Milk}} [[Milk]], and a {{Ilink|Bar of Chocolate}} [[Bar of Chocolate]] to make a [[Lump of Chocolate Dough]]. \n\nUsed to make [[Chocolate Cake]]s, aswell as [[Gingerbread Key]]s which are made during the [[Threatened_Dreams_Quest/Spoiler#Sweet_Dreams|Sweet Dreams]] quest to access [[Candia]].
history: In aÂ {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|small patch}}Â on 10 November 2009 its weight was changed from 5.00Â [[oz]]Â to 1.00 oz.

name: Lunar Staff
notes: Its value can raise because of its rarity.

name: Machine Crate
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Crate]], a [[Crate (Usable)]], an [[Old Crate]], a [[Crate (Wine)]], a [[Crate (Swapped)]], a [[Crate (Jimmy)]], a [[Crate Full of Coral]] and a [[Weapons Crate]].
\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: It contains a mysterious machine.

name: Mage Hat
notes: It is part of the set given to new [[Sorcerer]]s and [[Druid]]s in the [[Island of Destiny]] and in [[Dawnport]]. Used by a lot of mages under level 200 because it is the only mage-exclusive helmet with 2 imbuing slots under said level, which means it can be imbued with [[Powerful Epiphany]] (all mage helmets with native Magic level give up to +2), while the second slot can be used for [[Powerful Void]].

name: Magical Cage Key
notes:
Even though the interaction with the barrel you get it from suggests otherwise, every player with access to [[Eclesius]]' cellar can get this [[key]] daily.
Found in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].
flavortext: It fits into the lock of the demon cage in Eclesius' cellar.

name: Magical Torch
notes: [[Lucius]] can give you one during [[The Lightbearer]]. It will vanish at the end of November. Cannot be seen in the [[Market]].
history:
Was first seen in the 2 [[Test Server]]s preceding the first [[Lightbearer]] Event (the test servers of [[Updates/8.50|Summer Update 2009]] and [[Updates/8.53|Autumn Patch 2009]]).

==== Speed and shielding ====
On the test server of the Summer Update 2009, this item had a speed bonus of 50 and a defense value of 38. This was reduced (during that test server) to a speed bonus of 25 and a def of 25 because many testers agreed it could be abused. A defense value of 38 would mean a [[Shields|shield]] as strong as a [[Great Shield]] (dropped by Massacre, Morgaroth, Ferumbras and Ghazbaran) for free!
flavortext: Light all important locations given to you by Lucius before one of the basins stops burning.

name: Magical Watch
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Watch]], a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch]], a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch (Broken)]], and a [[Stabilizer]].
\nItem temporarily obtained in [[What a foolish Quest]].

name: Magician's Robe
notes: It is given to [[Sorcerers]] and [[Druids]] in the [[Island of Destiny]] and in [[Dawnport]].
flavortext: This robe feels soft and light as a feather.

name: Magma Amulet
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Bashmu | Bibby Bloodbath | Burning Gladiator | Crazed Summer Vanguard | Druid's Apparition | Feral Sphinx | Hellhound | Infernal Demon | Insane Siren | Kerberos | Lava Golem | Lavafungus | Magma Crawler | Massive Fire Elemental | Mazoran | Scarlett Etzel | Sphinx | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Vulcongra

notes: They give 6% protection from [[Fire Damage]], but increase damage taken from [[Ice Damage|Ice]] by 6%. They are part of the [[Magma Set]].

name: Magma Monocle
droppedby: Burning Book | Diabolic Imp | Efreet | Essence of Malice | Fahim the Wise | Feral Sphinx | Guard Captain Quaid | Hellhound | Insane Siren | Manticore | Marid | Merikh the Slaughterer | Scarlett Etzel | Sir Baeloc | Sphinx | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Usurper Warlock
notes: It gives 4% protection from [[Fire Damage]], but increases damage taken from [[Ice Damage|Ice]] by 5% (was 4% before [[Updates/8.2|Update 8.2]]). It is part of the [[Magma Set]]. Its value has decreased a lot, just like other elemental helmets, because it has become very common.

name: Mago Mechanic Core
notes: Looks the same as a [[Crystal Ball]], a [[Crystal Ball (Object)]], and a [[Scrying Ball]].Temporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Mammoth Fur Cape
droppedby: Barbaria | Barbarian Brutetamer | Man in the Cave | Ravenous Hunger | The Bloodtusk
notes: The [[Mage]]'s alternative to [[Plate Armor]]. However, Mages should not use this armor as for around same price, a player can get the [[Focus Cape]] which is 1 arm less, 1 oz but also +1 [[Magic Level]]. A low level [[Knight]] may use this armor to save on capacity, but should consider the [[Blue Robe]]; for about 4,000 [[gp]] more, players receive an extra 1 armor for only 2 ozs heavier.
flavortext: It is imbued with protective magic.

name: Mammoth Fur Shorts
notes: They are very light, but there is no real reason to wear them since they have no armor; collectors or people using this item for decoration may buy them.
flavortext: They offer little protection but will at least provide some comfort and warmth.

name: Mammoth Whopper
droppedby: Chakoya Toolshaper | Chakoya Tribewarden | Crypt Warrior | Mammoth | Memory of a Mammoth | Ocyakao | Skeleton Elite Warrior
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Mammoth Whopper changed from [[File:Mammoth Whopper (Old).gif]] to [[File:Mammoth Whopper.gif]].
flavortext: Made from a mammoth's legbones, it is one of the favoured weapons among barbarians.

name: Mana Potion
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Armadile | Barbaria | Barbarian Brutetamer | Bibby Bloodbath | Blue Djinn | Bonelord | Dark Apprentice | Dark Magician | Dark Monk | Dawnfly | Death Priest | Demon Skeleton | Dragon Lord Hatchling | Elf Overseer | Emerald Damselfly | Energy Elemental | Frost Giantess | Golden Servant | Golden Servant Replica | Grave Guard | Green Djinn | Hideous Fungus | High Voltage Elemental | Humongous Fungus | Knowledge Elemental | Lava Golem | Lizard Snakecharmer | Mad Scientist | Merlkin | Minotaur Mage | Minotaur Occultist | Oodok Witchmaster | Orewalker | Priestess | Stone Devourer | Wailing Widow | Werebadger | Werefox | Zombie
buyfrom: Alaistar, Asima, Asnarus, Chartan, Chuckles, Digger, Faloriel, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Hamish, Maun, Mehkesh, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Raffael, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Sandra, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Tarun, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet

It has a deposit of '''5 [[Empty Potion Flask (Small)|gp]]''' and restores between '''75''' and '''125 [[Mana]] Points''', around '''100''' on average.

name: Impward
notes: In normal state it is sleeping, after being used turns alternately into greedy [[File:Demon Infant (Euphoric).gif]] and pleased [[File:Demon Infant (Happy).gif]] look for 1 minute.\nIt is obtained through the [[Demon's Lullaby]] event.

name: Incredible Mumpiz Slayer
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Monstor]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nIt looks like a [[Longsword]] with blue sparkles on it.
\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: This magnificent weapon was forged to slay arch mumpiz demons with a single blow.

name: Indoor Plant Kit
buyfrom: Azalea, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Florentine, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nydala, Peggy, Rose, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct an {{Ilink|Indoor Plant}} [[Indoor Plant]]. Looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs, however, the Indoor Plant Kit can still be bought in [[Rathleton]], likely due to an oversight by CipSoft. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to reveal an indoor plant.

name: Intelligence Reports
notes: It looks the same as a [[Lottery Ticket (Blank)]], a [[Nomad Parchment]], an [[Old Parchment]], a [[Parchment]] and [[The Peacock Ballad]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Secret Service Quest]] ([[TBI]]).

name: Interdimensional Potion
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Received and used during the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest/Spoiler#Mission 09: The Sleeping Dragon|Wrath of the Emperor Quest, Mission 09]].
flavortext: This potion will help you enter the dreams of any lifeform.

name: Iron Loadstone
notes:
This is the item needed to [[Ironblight (Mount)|tame]] an [[Ironblight]]. {{Ilink|Ironblight (Mount)}} It has a chance of breaking.
Failed: {{Sound|The ironblight managed to run away.}}
Failed: {{Sound|The ironblight fights the magnetic field.}}
Broken: {{Sound|}}
Succeeded: {{Sound|You tamed the ironblight.}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Jade Hat
droppedby: Battlemaster Zunzu | Ethershreck | Ghastly Dragon | Hatebreeder | Ironblight | Ravenous Hunger | Zanakeph
notes: Has 1 arm more than a [[Hat of the Mad]] but is also 2 oz heavier.

name: Jaul's Pearl
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: \nWhen you kill [[Jaul]] during the 3rd Stage of the [[Liquid Black Quest]], the permission to open his chest will be granted to you. There's a chance to get this item from it.
flavortext: The identity of some deepling is written there.

name: Jean Pierre's Cookbook I
notes:
It contains [[Famous Recipes by MaÃ®tre Jean Pierre I (Book)]].
{{Seealso|Jean Pierre's Cookbook II}}Obtained through the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
flavortext: It was given to you by the djinn maÃ®tre and contains the collection of recipes you cooked.

name: Jean Pierre's Cookbook II
notes:
It contains [[Famous Recipes by MaÃ®tre Jean Pierre II (Book)]].
{{Seealso|Jean Pierre's Cookbook I}}Obtained through the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
flavortext: It was given to you by the djinn maÃ®tre and contains new recipes you cooked.

name: Jewelled Backpack
droppedby: Crystal Spider | Dark Torturer | Enlightened of the Cult | Mr. Punish | The Bloodweb
notes: Obtainable in the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].\n\nSee [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.
history: * This item replaced all [[Key Ring]]s. If you were using a [[Key Ring]] before the update, all the items inside it were transferred to the Jewelled Backpack and your [[Key Ring]] transformed into a [[Broken Key Ring]].

name: Jewelled Belt
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Efreet | Fahim the Wise | Marid | Merikh the Slaughterer
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Key to the Drowned Library
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
sellto: Fiona, Rock In A Hard Place, Yasir
flavortext: The strange shape of this key glistens softly in the light.

name: Knight Statue Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Knight Statue}} [[Knight Statue]]. It looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Large Amphora Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Large Amphora}} [[Large Amphora]]. It looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a large amphora.

name: Larvae
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Can be obtained by using a [[Gooey Mass]].

name: Laurel Wreath
notes:
You can only read the text when standing two squares away or closer. The '''Laurel Wreath''' was awarded to [[tutor]]s on two occasions as a token of appreciation for their dedicated contributions.

* Three wreaths were later presented by [[Karvar]] to {{Character|Lee kun}}, {{Character|Parodox}}, and {{Character|Gogue da Terra de Magogue}} on January 19, 2013.
* Three wreaths were presented by [[Grimrath]] to {{Character|Abiston}}, {{Character|Mirkaan}}, and {{Character|Zinina}} on December 23, 2011.

name: Leather Whip
droppedby: The Freezing Time Guardian | The Time Guardian | Vampire Bride
notes:
This is the item needed to tame a {{Ilink|Midnight Panther (Mount)}} [[Midnight Panther]]. It has a chance of breaking when used.
Failed: {{Sound|The midnight panther is growling at you.}}
Failed: {{Sound|The midnight panther ran away.}}
Succeeded: {{Sound|You tamed the wild panther.}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Legionnaire Flags
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Legs of Deathstrike
notes: Bring all pieces of the set to [[Gnomally]] to have the [[Statue of Deathstrike]] reconstructed.\nRarely obtained by opening [[Deathstrike]]'s treasure chest.

name: Letter from the Wizards
notes: It looks like a [[Greeting Card]]. When you use it, instructions about [[The Colours of Magic]] world event will appear in the [[Server Log]].\nNeeded for the world event [[The Colours of Magic]].
flavortext: A letter from the Three Wizards.

name: Lettuce
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item was meant to be implemented with the [[Summer Update 2010]], however this item's sprite wasn't ready in time for the update.

name: Light Mace
notes: Apparently unobtainable. It was previously known as the Golden Mace.
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|Spring Patch 2012]] the sprite of Light Mace changed from [[File:Light Mace (Old).gif]] to [[File:Light Mace.gif]].

name: Light Magic Missile Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[File:Electrified Icon.gif]] Shoots a weak attack that causes [[Energy]] Damage.
The weakest attack spell. It does about half of the damage of a [[Heavy Magic Missile]] shot. It is not useful for hunting, but useful to finish monsters with low [[HP]] when you don't want to waste a [[Heavy Magic Missile]].
For the spell, see [[Light Magic Missile]].
Looks the same as a [[Lightest Magic Missile Rune]]. [[File:Lmm screen shot.png|thumb|234px|Shot of Lmm on a Monk]]

name: Lion's Mane
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Lion | Noble Lion | Roaring Lion | Werelion | Werelioness | White Lion | Zomba
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Slash]], [[Intricate Slash]] and [[Powerful Slash]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Slash, Intricate Slash, Powerful Slash

name: Lit Glowing Mushroom
Little Pig
notes:
Disappears after one hour.
Looks the same as a [[Pet Pig]].\nItem temporarily obtainable in the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] - Mushroom Digging task.
flavortext: The little pig needs to be returned to its keeper within an hour.

name: Lizard Essence
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Lizard Trophy
notes: An extremely rare drop from [[Lizard Legionnaire]]s.

name: Locker Kit
buyfrom: Borkas, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Locker}} [[Locker]]. It looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a locker.

name: Lonely Crystal
notes: Available from [[Gnomish Crystal Package]].\n\nItem temporarily obtainable in the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] - [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest/Spoiler#Matchmaker|Matchmaker]] task.

name: Lucky Clover Amulet
notes:
This item was originally created by {{character|Charlie Root}} and can only be obtained by winning a contest sponsored by or a contest made by the supported fansite [[TibiaLottery]]. Its replica is the [[Lucky Clover Amulet (Replica)]]. This item can be seen on Secura in the house of {{character|Delixu}}, who received it as a gift from {{character|Shane who likes Cake}}, the administrator and creator of [[Tibia Lottery]]. A copy of this item was given away in a 2010 competition, this was won by on the world of Eternia. This amulet is now on olympa and the owner is {{character|Zerainbow}} its the same amulet that was won on Eternia. It was won by {{Character|Celaya}} during the [[TibiaLottery]]'s "Kill Somebody or Die Trying, 2nd Edition" competition. {{character|Muhamed Marley}} won this item in Tibia Movie Awards 2010.
. {{Character|Nyste}} also won this item through a lottery organised by Tibia Lottery in 2010, and the amulet can be seen in his house on the world of Refugia. {{character|Freedom Angel}} also won it in "Kill Somebody or Die Trying" competition. But He sold it for 4.000.000 gold to {{character|Fusawashii}} {{character|Lokirj}} (TibiaBR Administrator) has this amulet. It is unknown how he got it. {{character|Sir Panax}} & {{character|Lady Panaxx}} has one also. {{character|Honken}} also has one. He bought it from {{character|Zerainbow}}. You can see it in his house, in Olympa. {{character|Shallie}} got one as present from her cousin {{character|Malldor}}, who won 1st place on "Royal Painting Contest". {{character|Lundy}} won as an extra reward in the Tibia-Stats Riddle Contest Lottery for taking 42th place in it. {{character|Quickske}} and {{character|Decadrio Hawke}} won the amulet in a Christmas Lottery from TibiaLottery. They sold it for 25.000.000 gold.
flavortext: It is rumoured to bring you good luck! Luck sponsored by TibiaLottery.

name: Ludicrous Piece of Cloth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes: A Mage's Cap is needed for the [[Elementalist Outfits Quest]].

name: Magic Crystal
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[A Father's Burden Quest]].
flavortext: It is able to store memories and thoughts.

name: Magic Wall Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
[[File:Magic Wall (Object).gif]] Creates a magic wall which lasts for 16 to 24 seconds and blocks one square meter. The wall will block all types of ammunition, spells and runes thrown or cast by both players and creatures. 

Used heavily in [[PvP]] to trap enemies as well as to prevent projectiles from being fired at a given character. On [[Optional PvP]] worlds, it's used to block the attack from creatures but also to prevent them from walking over a certain tile and thus creating barricades or safe passages through them, since on these worlds they can be destroyed by walking over them. 

For the spell, see [[Magic Wall]].
history:
In a [[Updates/7.5|previous update]] they were reduced from 4 charges to 3.

With the [[Updates/10.00|Update 10.00]] the duration of the Magic Wall was changed from fixed 20 seconds to a random duration ''to make it more difficult to create "permanent" blockades''.<ref>{{Post|35059085|Post on official forum by a [[Community Manager]].}}</ref> On [[Optional PvP]] Worlds, since the [[Updates/10.01|10.01 Update]], they get destroyed if a player walks over them.

<references />

name: Magical Measurement Device
notes: If you lose it you can have another one made by [[Spectulus]] and you'll have to wait for a certain amount of time. Used in a task given by Spectulus in Edron Acadamy, after you have completed [[Sea of Light Quest|Sea of Light]]. Spectulus can be found on the top floor of the center tower of Academy.
flavortext: The spirit meter consists of a large handle combined with a green crystal full of magical markings.

name: Magma Clump
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Lava Golem | Magma Crawler | Vulcongra | Weeper | Walking Pillar
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Majestic Shield
notes:
It's the official [[GuildStats]] item. There are only 8 of them in whole Tibia. It's possible to hang it on a wall.

Known receivers of this item are:
* {{character|Sir Dzidek}}, for being the founder of [[GuildStats]].
* {{character|Stroshy}}, for designing the item. 
* Guild {{guild|Furious Boys}} from [[Pythera]]. They won it on the first GuildStats contest.
* {{character|Titi Iris}} from Nova. She won it on the second GuildStats contest.
* {{character|Cauli}} from Celesta. He obtained it as the first person in the activity system on Guildstats.
* {{character|Darusio}} from Celesta. He obtained it as the second person in the activity system on Guildstats.
* {{character|Ice Crambler }} from Candia. He obtained it as gift for his long term help on Guildstats.
* {{character|Akro Alith}} from Olympa. He obtained it as the third person in the activity system on Guildstats.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Osmano}} ([[Lobera]])
* {{Character|Sakeron Archer}} ([[Batabra]])
* {{Character|Zulnan}} ([[Lutabra]])
flavortext: This wonderful shield was designed for GuildStats.eu, to honour all guilds in Tibia.

notes:
2 Major Crystalline Token are given as a reward every time one completes the [[First Warzone]], [[Second Warzone]], or [[Third Warzone]]. These can be traded for outfit items, equipment and some other items with [[Gnomally]].

notes: Obtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Considering their small size, salamander larvae are expected to eclode from these small eggs.
notes2:
There are larger ones, large enough for non-larval juvenile insects to hatch: [[File:Object ID 13299.gif]]
These are not edible, however.

name: Intense Healing Rune (Item Weak)
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Nelly, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: This weaker variant of [[Intense Healing Rune]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Summer Update 2015]], but [[Cipsoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Intense Healing Rune (Item)
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
Heals target better than [[Light Healing]].
This rune is not commonly used. This rune should not be used often, if at all, by knights due to their low magic level affecting the potency of the rune and the higher healing potential of the [[Health Potion]]. However, this rune is useful to use on [[summon]]ed or [[Convince Creature|convinced creatures]], due to its ease of creation and higher healing potency of the vocations that summon or convince. It costs 4000 Soul Points per Backpack.
\nFor the spell, see [[Intense Healing Rune]].
history: In the [[Updates/8.7|Winter Update 2010]], the color of this rune was changed from gray to white to avoid abuse scenarios.

name: Interwoven Moss Florets
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Created by using one [[Dinky Moss Floret]] on another. [[Use]] another [[Dinky Moss Floret]] on this item to create a [[Dinky Moss Floret Garland]].
Its sprite seems to be a superposition of a [[Star Herb]] and a [[Sling Herb]]. Part of the [[Glooth Factory Quest]].

name: Iriana's Chest
notes: Looks the same as a [[Chest]], a [[Chest (Quest)]], a [[Storage Chest]], and a [[Sturdy Chest]].Temporarily obtained in the [[Top of the City Quest]].

name: Ivory Chair Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct an {{Ilink|Ivory Chair}} [[Ivory Chair]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct an ivory chair.

name: Jade Amulet
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer.
It's [[TibiaHof]] fansite item. Its replica is the [[Jade Amulet (Replica)]].
history: With update {{Update|10.34}} the following things changed:\n* It now weighs 4.00 oz. Previously it had no weight.\n* It is now equippable in the neck slot. Previously could not be equipped.
flavortext: Golden lines are embedded in the amulet and show mysterious symbols. It was awarded by TibiaHoF.

notes: Can be harvested by using a [[Juicy Root]], which grow in abundance in the [[Oramond Marshes]], [[Oramond Minotaur Camp]], and the [[Oramond/Western Plains]]. These are temporarily obtained in the [[Oramond_Quest/Spoiler#To_Take_Roots|Oramond Quest - To Take Roots]].

name: Key of Numerous Locks (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This item is a replica of [[Key of Numerous Locks]].
flavortext: Unlocks greatness in everyone. Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Lancet
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

flavortext: A razorsharp tool, commonly used by necromancers to dissect things.

notes: It can be found scattered in various places in [[Drefia]].This can be used in place of a [[Yellowed Bone]] during the [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: A large human bone yellow with age and shimmering as if polished clean.

name: Leather Harness
droppedby: Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard
notes: New item implemented in the [[Winter Update 2012]].

name: Leech
notes:
Use it on a [[Water Buffalo]] to tame it. When you use it, you may get the following messages: * ''The water buffalo ignores you.'' â€” nothing has happened and you may try again * ''The water buffalo flees.'' â€” the buffalo disappeared and you will have to find another one * ''The leech slipped through your fingers and is now following the call of nature.'' â€” the leech disappeared * ''The leech appeased the water buffalo and your taming was successful.'' â€” you tamed the buffalo
It can be obtained through [[Swamp (Diggable)|swamp digging]]. Players also reported to have obtained the Leech by doing the new daily tasks. It may be a possible reward of the [[Venore Daily Tasks Quest]] or the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Legs of Gnomevil
notes: Bring all pieces of the set to [[Gnomally]] to have the [[Statue of Gnomevil]] reconstructed.\n\nRarely obtained by opening [[Gnomevil]]'s treasure chest.

droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard | Werehyaena
notes: New item implemented in the [[Winter Update 2012]]. It looks like a shovel used to dig and bury.

notes: [[File:Poisoned Icon.gif]] Shoots an earth attack that covers a small circular area around the target. The character using this rune is never affected by it. This is the only [[Area Runes|area attack rune]] available in [[Dawnport]].

name: Lightest Magic Missile Rune
notes:
[[File:Electrified Icon.gif]] Shoots a weak attack that causes [[Energy]] Damage, weaker than the [[Light Magic Missile Rune]], causing ~5 damage. You can make 10 of these runes with the [[Practise Magic Missile]] spell. You can get 10 of these runes from [[Salbra]] during the [[Festival of Initiates]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Light Magic Missile Rune]].

name: Lion's Mane Flower
notes: Temporarily obtained and used in the [[Lion's Rock Quest]].
flavortext: It is an orange-red flower with fringed petals. But in the desert's heat it will wither soon.

name: Lit Candelabrum
notes: Provides 6 squares of yellow light. It's not commonly used, due to its weight. Can be found all over [[Tibia]], in places such as castles, stores and [[house]]s. {{seealso|Candelabrum|Used Candelabrum}}

name: Magical Key
notes: There is only one magical key known, it's the [[Master Key]]. This key is used to open every Tibian door. Magical key has only been seen on Test Server making it an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]. It is priceless at the hands of a collector. For a list of magical keys, see [[Keys by Type/Magical Key]].

Inert Astral Shaper Rune
notes: It is an inert version of the [[Astral Shaper Rune]]. It turns back into an Astral Shaper Rune after 20 hours, but only online time counts, so the fastest way to do it is to place it in a house.

Iron Token
notes: It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Journal Shield
notes:
It's the official [[BomDiaTibia]]'s fansite item.

The following players have been awarded with a Journal Shield: 
* {{Character|Didi Hadid}} received one for [https://www.bomdiatibia.com/forum/concursos/concourso-fansite-item/ designing the item] in 2017. 
* {{Character|Licad}} received one for getting first place in their ''[https://www.bomdiatibia.com/forum/concursos/concurso-journal-shield-na-vida-real/ Journal Shield na vida real]'' contest in 2017.
In December 2018, BomDiaTibia held its "Best of the Year" contest. The following players were awarded a Journal Shield after popular vote:
* {{Character|Ferumbrinha Retro}} for being the "Best Youtuber".
* {{Character|Rubini}} for being the "Best Streamer".
* {{Character|Carl Kepler}} for being the administrator of the "Best Fansite" ([[TibiaWiki.com.br]]).
* {{Character|Lee kun}} for being the "Notable Player".
* {{Character|Maxigashi}} for being the "Best International Youtuber".

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to four players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Fryns Winchester}} ([[Antica]])
* {{Character|Lord Soyinho}} ([[Batabra]])
* {{Character|Vinicius shocks}} ([[Pacera]])
* {{Character|Sara Sedentaria}} ([[Zenobra]])
history: It is an equippable shield since [[Updates/11.49.5813|Update 11.49]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Can I tell you some gossip, <character name>?|Hail BomDiaTibia.com!|Read these ancient news to get protected, <character name>.|Well, I have one very old report for you. Old but gold!}}
flavortext: Tibia's very first headline is written on it. Awarded by BomDiaTibia.com.

name: Key to Knowledge
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
This is one of the two items required for the [[Forbidden Knowledge]] achievement.
If you have already eaten a {{Ilink|Forbidden Fruit}} [[Forbidden Fruit]], then upon using the {{Ilink|Key to Knowledge}} [[Key to Knowledge]] on the {{Ilink|Forbidden Tome}} [[Forbidden Tome]], both of which will be consumed, you will receive the following message along with the [[Forbidden Knowledge]] achievement: {{Message|type=server|You gained a tremendous amount of knowledge.}}

name: Large Hallowed Bone
notes: Once it was a [[Large Yellowed Bone]].\nObtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: A big human bone glowing in a dark light. It tingles unpleasantly when you touch it.

name: Large Pliers
notes: Quite a versatile tool. Can occasionally be found by [[use|using]] a [[Dead Goblin (Fresh Quest)]] or [[Dead Goblin (Decaying Quest)]].<noinclude> Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: A crude tool, but still useful for fixing broken screws, wheels and more.

name: Large Used Amphora Kit
notes: Furniture kit for a used [[Large Amphora]]. It looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].\nNeeded in a mission of [[Jack to the Future Quest]].
flavortext: Use it in Jack's house to place a large amphora.

name: Leaf Crown
Leaf Star
droppedby: Arctic Faun | Boogy | Crazed Summer Rearguard | Dark Faun | Faun | Kusuma | Pixie | Raxias | Young Goanna
notes: They break about 41.52% of the time (based on 100 stars).

name: Lemon Cupcake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: One per character can be obtained from [[Brutus The Baker]] if the game world succeeds in [[A Piece of Cake]]. Eating the lemon cupcake will increase your distance fighting skill by +10 for one hour.\n}}<noinclude>[[Category:Distance Fighting Booster]]</noinclu

name: Library Ticket
flavortext: The initials are beautifully decorated and it is sealed with red wax.

notes:
This is now an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Rapier]].

name: Lit Lightsphere
notes: There is also an [[Lightsphere|unlit version]] of this lightsphere: {{Ilink|Lightsphere}}.\nObtainable through the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
flavortext: It floats quietly, yet emits a dim light. You can hear something rattling inside but there seems to be no way to open it.

notes:
It looks the same as a [[Moon Mirror]].
\nThere is also an [[Dark Moon Mirror|unlit version]] of this item: {{Ilink|Dark Moon Mirror}}.\nObtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Lit Rift Lamp
notes: It's a lit [[Rift Lamp]].

name: Little Bowl of Myrrh

name: Loot Bag (Item)
notes:
This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Bag]], [[Belongings of a Deceased]], [[Belongings of a Deceased (The Ravager)]] and [[Belongings of a Deceased (Death Priest Shargon)]].

name: Loremaster Doll
notes:
This is [[TibiaTome]]'s fansite item. This item could be obtained only by winning a contest held or sponsored by [[TibiaTome]]. If you ''use'' it, it will either hold a blue flame or turn the book's pages for a few seconds.

Its replica is the [[Loremaster Doll (Replica)]].
flavortext: This doll possesses an infinite knowledge within. It was rewarded by TibiaTome.com.

name: Lost Time (Item)
notes:
[[Lost Time]] will become this item after dying. It disappears when used on a [[Time Waster]] or after 1 minute.
It looks the same as [[Guilt (Item)]].\nPart of the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].

name: Lottery Ticket (Blank)
notes:
It looks the same as [[Intelligence Reports]], a [[Nomad Parchment]], an [[Old Parchment]], a [[Parchment]] and [[The Peacock Ballad]].
\nThis is considered an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
history: You would get this blank lottery ticket if you were unlucky while using a [[Lottery Ticket]] until [[Updates/8.7|Winter Update 2010]]. After this update, all blank lottery tickets decayed into nothing.<noinclude><ref>{{post|29093272|Mirade's post on '''News: Major Game Update 8.7''' thread}}</ref>\n<references /></noinclude>
flavortext: Unfortunately it seems that you drew a blank.

name: Mace of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Mace of Carving (Charged)}} [[Mace of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Mace of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Mace of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Mace of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Mace of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Mace of Carving, Mace of Mayhem and Mace of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Mace of Destruction}} [[Mace of Destruction]].

name: Mace of Carving (Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Mace of Carving]] charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 20% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Mace of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Mace of Carving (Heavily Charged)

history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Mace of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

history:

flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Mace of Destruction
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history: This weapon was created as the result of the unification of the [[Mace of Carving]], [[Mace of Remedy]] and [[Mace of Mayhem]].\n\nOn [[Updates/12.08.7995|February 5, 2019]], the level requirement for this weapon was raised from 100 to 200.

name: Mace of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Mace of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Mace of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Mace of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Mace of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Mace of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Mace of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Mace of Carving, Mace of Mayhem and Mace of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Mace of Destruction}} [[Mace of Destruction]].

history:

With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Mace of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].

name: Magic Gold Converter
notes: Similar to a [[Gold Converter]], this item can be used to convert stacks of 100 [[Gold Coin]]s to 1 [[Platinum Coin]] and 100 [[Platinum Coin]] to 1 [[Crystal Coin]]. The main difference is that it does this automatically (as opposed to having to manualy use the Converter on the stacks) when a new stack is formed in your inventory, as long as it's turned on: [[File:Magic Gold Converter (Activated).gif]] (when active it's description changes to : {{Message|type=look|It is actually in the active state}}).\n\nEven though this item seems like a time saving helper to make some extra money, in most cases it is more rewarding to sell the {{TC}} [[Tibia Coins]] on the [[The Market]]. Converting 500 stacks of [[Gold Coin]] will get you 50k. Generally, [[Gold Converter]]s and specially Magic Gold Converters are only worth their price during the first few weeks of new [[Game Worlds]] when Tibia Coins are very cheap.
flavortext: It is actually in the inactive state.\nThis item cannot be traded.

name: Mana Keg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is available in the [[Store]] only. It fills up to 500 [[Mana Potion]]s. All potions created this way as well as the keg itself will be kept in [[Your Store Inbox]]. A keg is not only useful for providing potions in a hunting ground, it also saves you some capacity as its constant weight equals the net weight of 250 potions. The keg can only be used by the character who purchased it in the Store. For this reason, the potions filled using the keg need to fit the character's vocation and level. Once the keg is empty it will vanish into thin air.\n\n{{Seealso|Cask & Keg Value Effectiveness}}
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its Store price was 23 [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This keg can be used to refill mana potions.

[[Hearts Effect]] {{Ilink|Hearts Effect}} appear when this item is used.

sounds: {{Sound List|All you need is a small drop and the heart of your chosen one will belong to you.|Feel the power of love!|fizz|Hail CasalTibiano.com.br!|Pollen from a jungle rose, mermaid scales, lots of sugar, magic and love - oh, and three petals of a bloodkiss flower! Perfect!|Use responsibly!}}

name: Kooldown-Aid
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will reset all active spell cooldowns.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily resets cooldowns for all spells.

name: Lasting Exercise Axe
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
notes:
A Lasting Exercise Axe can also be bought at the [[Store]] for 720 {{TC}} [[Tibia Coins]]. Those which are bought from the Store cannot be traded.

It takes 8 hours to consume all its charges.

This Item is used in conjunction with an [[Exercise Dummy]]. If you own a house you can also use either a [[Demon Exercise Dummy]], [[Ferumbras Exercise Dummy]] or a [[Monk Exercise Dummy]], which offer an additional 10% increase in training gains.

name: Lit Torch (Sparkling)
notes: Item obtained and used in {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|An Ancient Feud}}.
flavortext: It sparkles slightly.

name: Little Adventurer Doll (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. It looks the same as a [[Little Adventurer Doll]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Lovely Fireworks Rocket
Lucky Clover Amulet (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. It looks the same as a [[Lucky Clover Amulet]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Lucky Dragon Kit
notes: Only characters who obtained more than 57,197 [[Theons]] during [[Tibia's 25th Anniversary]] are/were able to buy this item. In total, 194 characters obtained the necessary points and were or are able to get a Lucky Dragon Kit. Some characters can buy more than one, and because of that the maximum amount of Lucky Dragons that can exist in Tibia is 327 as long as new methods of obtaining them are not added to the game. \n\nUnwrap it to get a [[Lucky Dragon (Object)|Lucky Dragon]]. [[File:Lucky Dragon (Object).gif]]
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a lucky dragon.

name: Luminous Box
notes:
It was able to be obtained by eating at [[The Ambrosia Buffet]] or by opening a [[Box Full of Decorationâ€Ž]].
By opening this box you can get one of the following: * {{Ilink|String of Fairy Lights (RYG)}} [[String of Fairy Lights (RYG)]] * {{Ilink|String of Fairy Lights (BRG)}} [[String of Fairy Lights (BRG)]] * {{Ilink|String of Fairy Lights (BGY)}} [[String of Fairy Lights (BGY)]] {{Seealso|Luminous Box/Statistics}}

name: Luna (TibiaGoals)
notes:
It's [[TibiaGoals]]' fansite item.

It has also other stages that appear when interacted with:

[[File:Luna (TibiaGoals) 2.gif]]
[[File:Luna (TibiaGoals) 3.gif]]
[[File:Luna (TibiaGoals) 4.gif]]

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Neurotiko rrhgyev}} ([[Antica]])
* {{Character|Thurianx}} ([[Seanera]])
* {{Character|Cotu Wpisac}} ([[Secura]])
sounds: {{Sound List|A horse with a shiny horn doesn't make a unicorn!|Oh my! Is this <Player>?! I've read about you on TibiaGoals.com!|I had a dream I was a queen! I woke up... still a QUEEN!|So divine!|There will never be another one after you, <Player>!|They say the sky is the limit but there are my hoofprints on the moon!}}
flavortext:
Gently shrouded in clouds, her dreams are about to come true. As she awakens something magical is about to happen.
Granted by TibiaGoals.com.

name: Magic Hat
notes:
It's [[VivaTibia]]'s fansite item.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Gran Poderoso}} ([[Libertabra]])
* {{Character|Brabus Ltda}} ([[Reinobra]])
* {{Character|Mind Abraham}} ([[Honbra]])
sounds: {{Sound List|BOOM!|Confetti attack!|Let's get this party started!|Let me guess your vocation, ''Player''...|The night is still young, ''Player''!|Viva Tibia!}}
flavortext: This hat represents the spirit of magic and fun. Awarded by VivaTibia.com

name: Magic Shield Potion
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: When drunk, this potion will activate [[Magic Shield (Condition)|Magic Shield]] for 3 minutes and all damage taken will reduce your [[Mana Point|Mana]] instead of your [[Hit Point]]s.
flavortext: This potion can only be consumed by druids and sorcerers of level 14 or higher.

name: Lasting Exercise Shield
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
notes:
A Lasting Exercise Shield can also be bought at the [[Store]] for 720 {{TC}} [[Tibia Coins]]. Those which are bought from the Store cannot be traded.

It takes 8 hours to consume all its charges. 

This Item is used in conjunction with an [[Exercise Dummy]]. If you own a house you can also use either a [[Demon Exercise Dummy]], [[Ferumbras Exercise Dummy]] or a [[Monk Exercise Dummy]], which offer an additional 10% increase in training gains.
history: \nThe price was changed from 7560000 to 10000000 since [[Summer Update 2024]].

name: Lit Torch
notes: As the torch is used, the light gets weaker and the torch shorter. This first stage lasts for 10 minutes, after which it becomes a [[Lit Torch (Medium)]].\n\nIt was once a useful [[item]]. People always carried one of these in their belt to save [[mana]] in hunts from casting light [[Instant Spells|spells]]. However, since the ambient light feature was implemented, torches were left behind, and nowadays they are almost completely useless.
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Torch changed from [[File:Torch (Old).gif]] to [[File:Torch.gif]].

name: Lit Torch (Medium)
notes: This is a [[Lit Torch]] that has been used for more than 10 minutes. This stage lasts for 5 minutes, after which it becomes a [[Lit Torch (Small)]].

name: Lit Torch (Small)
notes: This was a [[Lit Torch (Medium)]] that has been used for more than 5 minutes. This stage also lasts for 5 minutes, after which it becomes a [[Burnt Down Torch]] and can no longer be lit.

droppedby: Alptramun | Amenef the Burning | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Annihilon | Askarak Demon | Askarak Lord | Askarak Prince | Brain Head | Control Tower | Count Vlarkorth | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Drume | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Ghulosh | Glooth Battery | Gorzindel | Goshnar's Cruelty | Goshnar's Greed | Goshnar's Hatred | Goshnar's Malice | Goshnar's Megalomania | Goshnar's Spite | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | Katex Blood Tongue | King Zelos | Lady Tenebris | Latrivan | Lloyd | Lokathmor | Lord Azaram | Mad Scientist | Madareth | Magma Bubble | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Mazzinor | Megasylvan Yselda | Oodok Witchmaster | Plagueroot | Ratmiral Blackwhiskers | Scarlett Etzel | Sir Baeloc | Spitter | Srezz Yellow Eyes | Tentugly's Head | The Abomination | The Baron from Below | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Brainstealer | The Count of the Core | The Dread Maiden | The Duke of the Depths | The Fear Feaster | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Hungerer | The Monster | The Nightmare Beast | The Pale Worm | The Sandking | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Time Guardian | The Unwelcome | Timira the Many-Headed | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Utua Stone Sting | Yakchal | Yielothax | Yirkas Blue Scales | Zulazza the Corruptor | Zushuka | Murcion | Chagorz
notes:
* Increases your [[Magic Level]] by 3 magic levels for 10 minutes.
* Drinking 100 [[Mastermind Potion]]s will earn you the achievement [[Mastermind]].

This potion does not stack with [[Enchant Party]]. Only one of these effects can be active at a time. Casting [[Enchant Party]] will override Mastermind Potion's effect and vice-versa. It does not reduce your defence, shielding etc like some people thought.
Obtainable in the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]], [[Mastermind Potion Quest]], [[The New Frontier Quest]], and the [[Rise of Devovorga]]. Can also be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.
}}<noinclude>[[Category:Magic Booster]]</noinclu
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases your magic skill.

name: Mastermind Shield
droppedby: Angry Demon | Annihilon | Brachiodemon | Demon | Falcon Knight | Falcon Paladin | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Grand Canon Dominus | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Grand Commander Soeren | Hellflayer | Juggernaut | Latrivan | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Preceptor Lazare | Rhindeer | Terofar | Vexclaw | Zavarash | Zulazza the Corruptor
notes: Part of the [[Rare Set]]. It is quoted in [[Legendary Curses IX.I (Book)]] and [[Legendary Curses IX.II (Book)]].
history: * Its defense value was changed from 40 to 37 with [[Updates/7.0|Update 7.0]].
flavortext: It's an enchanted shield.

name: Mead
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
When you drink mead, you become temporarily drunk and not able to move correctly. It's a common drink on cold areas.
Looks the same as a [[Flask with Magical Oil]], a [[Flask with Oil and Blood]], and vials of [[Beer]], [[Mud]], [[Oil]], [[Rum]] and [[Tea]].\n1 [[vial]] of Mead is needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Mead Horn
notes:
This is the hollow horn of some creature, and is used to hold [[Mead]], probably that's why the horn got this name.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Mead Horn (Empty)]].\nObtained and used in the [[Barbarian Test Quest]].
flavortext: It is filled to the rim.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes:
Very common and easy food to get.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Glutton's Mace]].\n1 piece of meat is needed for the [[Ice Islands Quest]] and 2 pieces of meat are required for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Medal of Honour
notes:
It can be seen in the [[Treasure Rooms#Amazon Camp Treasure Room|Amazon Camp Treasure Room]].
This item can only be gotten by winning a contest of a [[Supported Tibia Fansites|supported]] or [[Promoted Tibia Fansites|promoted fansite]], or by doing something extraordinary to Tibia community.
You can only read the text if you stand 2 fields from it or closer.
\nA partial list of owners of these medals and the inscriptions on them can be viewed [[Medal of Honour/Owners|here]].

name: Medusa Shield
droppedby: Gorgo | Hydra | Medusa | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The Many | The Noxious Spawn | The Souldespoiler | The Welter
notes: A good shield for players level 30-50. A lot of people use a [[Crown Shield]] however, with the next step being a [[Vampire Shield]] or [[Demon Shield]], because they're much lighter and not much more expensive.\nObtained in [[Medusa Shield Quest]]. Also needed for an addon of [[Wizard Outfits]].

name: Melon
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dharalion | Elf Arcanist | Memory of an Elf | Sibang
buyfrom: Alissa, Ariella: 10, Bonifacius, Brasith, Imalas, Jezzara:13, Livielle: 10, Omur: 10, Ramina: 14, Serafin: 10, Sherry McRonald
notes:
Just good to eat.
Can be found at daily spawns in a house south of [[Thais]] [[trolls]], in a crate in this cave and in [[Greenshore]]. Needed in the [[Paradox Tower Quest]].

name: Memory Stone
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Mind Stone]] and a [[Shadow Orb]].
Item temporarily obtained in the [[Explorer Society Quest]]. Quet NPCs will reject any memory stone if the player hasn't obtained it themselves once before.

name: Might Ring
droppedby: Angry Demon | Ashmunrah | Brain Squid | Cult Believer | Cult Enforcer | Cult Scholar | Demon | Demon Outcast | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Energetic Book | Energuardian of Tales | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Hero | Knowledge Elemental | Latrivan | Memory of a Hero | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Rage Squid | Roaring Lion | Sight of Surrender | Ushuriel | Vexclaw | Vicious Squire | Worker Golem | Yielothax | Zarabustor
notes: The damage reduction is 20%, rounded '''up''' to the nearest whole number.\n\nYou can obtain one through the [[Ornamented Shield Quest]] or as a reward from the [[Lightbearer]] event when 10 basins are lit.
history: * Before the [[Winter Update 2007|2007 Winter Update]], it only provided 25% protection against fire, poison, energy, and physical damage.\n* The price was changed from 5,000 to 25,000 with the [[Summer Update 2024|2024 Summer Update]].
resist: physical +20%, fire +20%, earth +20%, energy +20%, ice +20%, holy +20%, death +20%

name: Milk
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
buyfrom: Brasith: 15;bottle, Dane: 4;bottle, Larek: 50;vial, Livielle: 15;bottle, Miraia: 5;mug, Norma: 2;mug, Satsu: 52;cocktailglass
notes:
Needed to make a [[Lump of Cake Dough]] which is used to bake [[cake]].
Milk is the source of the [[Minotaurs]]' power.\nCan be found at [[daily spawns]] in [[Mintwallin]], [[Fibula Dungeon]]. Can also be acquired through the [[Goblin Temple Quest]]. 3 vials of milk are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Mind Stone
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Burster Spectre | Demon Skeleton | Destroyer | Dipthrah | Ferumbras | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Hand of Cursed Fate | Latrivan | Lich | Mad Mage | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Raging Mage | Reflection of a Mage | Renegade Quara Constrictor | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Renegade Quara Mantassin | Renegade Quara Pincher | Renegade Quara Predator | Ushuriel | Warlock
notes:
Mostly used for [[decoration]].
Looks the same as the [[Memory Stone]] and a [[Shadow Orb]]. Needed in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]]. |

name: Minotaur Leather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Moohtant | Apprentice Sheng | Bullwark | Depowered Minotaur | Execowtioner | General Murius | Minotaur | Minotaur Amazon | Minotaur Archer | Minotaur Cult Follower | Minotaur Cult Prophet | Minotaur Cult Zealot | Minotaur Guard | Minotaur Hunter | Minotaur Invader | Minotaur Mage | Mooh'Tah Warrior | Moohtant | The Horned Fox | Worm Priestess
notes:
Can also be obtained by [[Skinning]] a [[Minotaurs|minotaur]] using an [[Obsidian Knife]]. Can be sold for a high price in [[Rookgaard]]. This is one of the easiest creature products to obtain, due to the abundance of minotaurs in tibia. {{seealso|Minotaur Leather/Skinning}}

1 of these can be obtained from the [[Minotaur Leather Quest]].
100 of these are needed for [[Citizen Outfits Quest]].
100 of these are needed for [[Citizen Outfits Quest on Rook]].
50 of these are needed for [[Beggar Outfits Quest]].
5 of these are needed for the [[Unnatural Selection Quest]].
4 of these are needed for [[Jester Outfits Quest]].
1 of this is needed for [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]]

name: Minotaur Trophy
droppedby: Depowered Minotaur | Execowtioner | General Murius | Minotaur Amazon | Minotaur Cult Follower | Minotaur Cult Prophet | Minotaur Cult Zealot | Minotaur Guard | Minotaur Hunter | Minotaur Invader | Mooh'Tah Warrior | Moohtant | Worm Priestess
notes: It can be hung on a wall.

name: Mirror
notes:
Has no known purpose, except to admire your own beauty.

\nObtained in the [[Longsword Quest]].\nObtained in the [[To Blind the Enemy Quest]]

name: Model Ship
notes: It can be seen in the castle in [[Darashia]] and in [[Venore]]'s shipyard.\nObtainable through [[Meriana Quest]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/6.6|Update 6.6]], it became obtainable after more than 4 years later when [[Updates/7.8|Summer Update 2006]] was launched.

name: Moon Flower
notes: Can be found on the ground all over Tibia. It's a single version of [[Moon Flowers]].

name: Moonlight Rod
droppedby: Black Vixen | Crazed Winter Rearguard | Faceless Bane | Feroxa | Feroxa (Gloom Wolf) | Golgordan | Latrivan | Minotaur Cult Prophet | Morgaroth | Necropharus | The Blazing Rose | The Flaming Orchid | The Lily of Night | The Moonlight Aster | Ushuriel | Vampire Bride | Werefox | The Diamond Blossom
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: An upgrade from the [[Snakebite Rod]] and the second weakest rod available on the mainland. It is the [[druid]]'s equivalent of the [[sorcerer]]'s [[Wand of Dragonbreath]]. Moonlight Rods replaced {{Ilink|Conjurer Wand}} [[Conjurer Wand]]s in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]]. They used to deal [[Energy Damage|energy damage]], but the magic reform in the [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]] changed their type of damage dealt to [[Ice Damage|ice]].\nNeeded for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] (male) and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]] (female).
flavortext: Icecold rays of moonlight shimmer on its tip.

name: Morning Star
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Bonelord | Enraged Soul | Gargoyle | Ghost | Gozzler | Hellspawn | Lizard Templar | Menacing Carnivor | Plaguesmith | Tarnished Spirit | The Evil Eye | War Golem | Young Sea Serpent
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
sellto: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, H.L.: 50, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard

name: Mouldy Cheese
droppedby: Demon (Goblin) | Goblin | Goblin Assassin | Goblin Leader | Goblin Scavenger | Muglex Clan Assassin | Muglex Clan Footman | Muglex Clan Scavenger | Mutated Rat | Plaguesmith | Swamp Troll
notes: Can be found as [[Daily Respawns|daily respawns]] in many places, including [[Venore Corym Cave|Venore]] and [[Port Hope Corym Cave|Port Hope Corym caves]], at [[Gray Beach]] and [[Wyda]]'s house in the [[Green Claw Swamp]].\n\nYou need a mouldy cheese in the [[Postman Quest]], a task of the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]] and may need in [[Demon's Lullaby]].
history: After [[Updates/9.8]] this item is dropped by [[Swamp Troll]]s and respawns in a lot more places in the Venore marshes, than it used to do. The reason for this is to make this item more easily available since it is needed in a task of the new [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].

name: Mr. Punish's Handcuffs
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Mud
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Can be obtained by "using" a [[Liquid Container]] on a pool of mud - usually in caves.
Looks the same as a [[Flask with Magical Oil]], a [[Flask with Oil and Blood]], and vials of [[Mead]], [[Beer]], [[Oil]], [[Rum]] and [[Tea]].

name: Mug
buyfrom: Arito;water, Arito: 2;beer, Arito: 2;lemonade, Arito: 3;wine, Armenius: 10;rum, Armenius: 3;beer, Armenius: 4;wine, Bertha: 4, Bolfona: 2;beer, Boozer;water, Boozer: 2;beer, Boozer: 2;lemonade, Boozer: 3;wine, Chephan: 4, Clyde;water, Clyde: 2;beer, Clyde: 2;lemonade, Clyde: 3;wine, Gorn: 4, Innkeeper Alphonse, Innkeeper Alphonse: 2, Innkeeper Alphonse: 3, Jimbin;water, Jimbin: 2;beer, Karl: 20;beer, Maria;water, Maria: 2;lemonade, Maria: 3;wine, Maria: 4;beer, Maro, Mirabell;water, Mirabell: 2;beer, Mirabell: 2;lemonade, Mirabell: 3;wine, Miraia: 2;water, Miraia: 3;lemonade, Miraia: 5;milk, Norma: 2;lemonade, Norma: 2;milk, Norma: 3;beer, Norma: 3;wine, Perod: 4, Pugwah;water, Pugwah: 2;lemonade, Pugwah: 3;beer, Pugwah: 4;wine, Snake Eye: 5;beer, Snake Eye: 6;wine, Zora: 4, Swolt;water, Swolt: 2;beer
notes: You can also buy a mug of [[Beer]], [[Wine]], [[Mead]], [[Lemonade]] or [[Water (Liquid)|Water]], drink the fluid and you'll have a simple mug.

name: Mysterious Fetish
droppedby: Animated Ogre Savage | Dawnfire Asura | Demon Skeleton | Ogre Savage | Orc Cult Priest | Orclops Doomhauler | Orclops Ravager | True Dawnfire Asura
notes: This could be obtained in the past from [[An Old Dragonlord]] on [[Draconia]] island past [[Hellgate|The Hellgate]]. It was meant to be sacrificed in the [[dragon]] room below Draconia to [[teleport]] back to [[Ab'Dendriel]]. Now this function has been replaced by the [[Dragonfetish]] and its purposes are merely decorative.

name: Mysterious Voodoo Skull
droppedby: Enlightened of the Cult | Gravedigger | Hand of Cursed Fate | Nightmare | Tormentor | Ushuriel | Vampire Bride
notes:
Changes into an [[Enigmatic Voodoo Skull]] for 20 hours after being used.
\nThis skull can be used once each day, and gives you one out of 9 possible fortunes. The "{{sound|Never say 'oops'. Always say 'ah, interesting!'}}" fortune is rarer than the others, it has a chance of around 0.2% of appearing. Several of these are popular phrases [[Allusions|borrowed from elsewhere]], such as the dragon line, which spoofs [[wikipedia:J. R. R. Tolkien|Tolkien's]] ''"Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger."''\nYou will receive the [[achievement]] [[Superstitious]] upon having used Mysterious Voodoo Skulls 100 times (the message "It is not time yet." doesn't count).
It can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.
history: With update {{Update|9.83|Update 9.83}}, the time you must wait for [[Enigmatic Voodoo Skull]]s to change back was reduced from 24 hours to 20 hours.
sounds: {{Sound List|It's not winning that matters, but winning in style.|Today's your lucky day. Probably.|Do not meddle in the affairs of dragons, for you are crunchy and taste good with ketchup.|That is one stupid question.|You'll need more rum for that.|Do or do not. There is no try.|You should do something you always wanted to.|If you walk under a ladder and it falls down on you it probably means bad luck.|Never say 'oops'. Always say 'ah, interesting!'}}

name: Mystic Blade
notes: Commonly used [[One-Handed]] sword weapon. Probably a replacement for [[Giant Sword]] because it is one-handed, and only 2 [[Attack]] lower. It is the strongest sword that can be enchanted. This sword can be gotten in a quest, although it is in a [[Premium]] account area so the value is quite high.\nReward from the [[Barbarian Arena Quest|Barbarian Arena - Scrapper Mode]].
history:
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy Mystic Blade}} [[Icy Mystic Blade]]
* {{Ilink|Earth Mystic Blade}} [[Earth Mystic Blade]]
* {{Ilink|Energy Mystic Blade}} [[Energy Mystic Blade]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery Mystic Blade}} [[Fiery Mystic Blade]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].
flavortext: This sword is only granted to a scrapper of the Svargrond arena.

name: Mystic Turban
droppedby: Blood Hand | Blood Priest | Blue Djinn | Dawnfire Asura | Efreet | Fahim the Wise | Green Djinn | Ice Witch | Marid | Merikh the Slaughterer | Necromancer | Necropharus | Shadow Pupil | True Dawnfire Asura | Zushuka
notes: It can be traded to NPC [[Irmana]] for a [[Blue Piece of Cloth]].
flavortext: Something is strange about this turban.

name: Naginata
notes: Can be obtained through the [[Naginata Quest]].
history: * After [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]], it became slightly more valuable due to being sellable to [[Rashid]]. \n* With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]], the sprite of Naginata changed from [[File:Naginata (Old).gif]] to [[File:Naginata.gif]].

name: Necromancer Shield
notes: It is a rare item considering how difficult it is to obtain it. It provides a permanent green light when equipped. Since it has the same defense value as the [[Mastermind Shield]], it is more often used for decoration.\nObtainable in the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]] after you give 1500 [[Demonic Essence]]s (Brotherhood of Bones side).
flavortext: It is enchanted with unholy, necromantic powers.

name: Nightmare Shield
notes: This shield was crafted by the mastery of the [[Nightmare Knights]] order. It is a rare item considering how difficult it is to obtain it. Provides a permanent red light if equipped. Since it has same defense value as the [[Mastermind Shield]], it is more often used for decoration.\nObtainable in the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]] after you give 1500 [[Demonic Essence]]s (Nightmare Knights side).
flavortext: It was crafted by the ancient order of the nightmare knights.

name: Noble Armor
notes: The next step up from a [[Plate Armor]], commonly used a short time before getting [[Knight Armor]] or [[Crown Armor]].\nObtained from the [[Noble Armor Quest]].
history: This armor was once known as the "Rose Armor" many years ago on [[Antica]] (Tibia). It was one gift from [[Gods#Creators|Gods]] to the original members of {{Guild|Red+Rose|the Guild of the Red Rose}}, one of the first [[guild]]s in Tibia. The other gift was the [[Rose Shield]]. Before [[Updates/8.4|Update 8.4]], Noble ArmorsÂ looked like this: [[File:Noble Armor(old).gif]]

name: Northern Pike
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Chakoya Toolshaper | Chakoya Tribewarden | Chakoya Windcaller | Ocyakao | Slippery Northern Pike
notes:
It can be obtained via [[Ice Fishing]] or sometimes when killing a [[Slippery Northern Pike]].
\n5 are needed for [[The Hunt for the Sea Serpent Quest]], and 1 is needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
history: This was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] from [[Updates/7.2|Update 7.2]] until [[Updates/8.0|Update 8.0]]. It was previously referred as "Big Fish" by the players and it was thought to be fishable at some special spot or at a specific fishing skill.

name: Nose Ring
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
The nose ring is a semi-valuable item only dropped by [[The Horned Fox]]. Since it became obtainable through a quest, the value of this item decreased rapidly.
This item is obtained on the [[Killing in the Name of... Quest]].
This item can be obtained from [[Belongings of a Deceased]].
Needed for [[Assassin Outfits Quest]].
flavortext: It was the favourite trinket of the famous Horned Fox.

name: Obsidian Knife
notes:
An Obsidian Knife is mainly used for getting different types of leather from the dead bodies of certain [[Skinning|creatures]], such as [[Minotaurs]], [[Dragon]]s, [[Dragon Lord]]s, [[Lizards]], [[Bonebeast]]s, [[Behemoth]]s and some [[bosses]].
Using an [[Obsidian Knife]] you can :
* [[Skinning|Skin]] several [[Skinning|creatures]] (See also [[Blessed Wooden Stake]]).
* Carve [[Ice Mammoth|Ice Sculptures]] from an [[Ice cube]].
* Carve [[Raw Watermelon Tourmaline]]. 
* Disassemble [[Fireworks|Fireworks Rockets]] to their respective components.
Item obtained in the [[Obsidian Knife Quest]].
flavortext: Sharp and light, this is a useful tool for tanners, doctors and assassins.

name: Obsidian Lance
droppedby: Energy Elemental | High Voltage Elemental | Killer Caiman | Knowledge Elemental | Lizard Sentinel | Lucifuga Aranea | Mutated Bat | Orc Marauder | Orc Rider | Quara Hydromancer Scout | Rorc | Stalker | Thanatursus
notes: It looks the same as [[Sugatrap's Obsidian Lance]]. Obtainable through [[Griffin Shield Quest]]. This lance is one of the items needed to do the [[Obsidian Knife Quest]].

name: Oil
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Used to refill [[lamp]]s (only works if the oil is in a [[vial]]).
Looks the same as a [[Flask with Magical Oil]], a [[Flask with Oil and Blood]], and vials of [[Mead]], [[Mud]], [[Beer]], [[Rum]] and [[Tea]].

name: Old and Used Backpack
notes:
Functions as a regular [[backpack]] and is required for the [[Sam's Old Backpack Quest]].
It can be looted from a rare [[Orc]] that spawns in the north-eastern area of the [[Orc Fortress]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|128.212|123.252|7|4|1|0.250.25}}. See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.
flavortext: A label on the backpack reads: Property of Sam, Thais.

name: Old Parchment
notes: It looks the same as [[Intelligence Reports]], a [[Lottery Ticket (Blank)]], a [[Nomad Parchment]], a [[Parchment]] and [[The Peacock Ballad]].\nItem temporarily obtained in the [[Banuta Quest]]. It can be found in the [[Lizards|lizard]] settlement of [[Chor]].
flavortext: It is covered with foreign symbols.

name: Old Twig
notes: It has no practical use, its a common item can be found in many places around tibia. Scammers have used the fact that [[Massacre]] drops it as an indication of its value, but it is common trash found in many places.

name: Onyx Arrow
droppedby: Demodras | Falcon Knight | Falcon Paladin | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Grand Canon Dominus | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Grand Commander Soeren | Hellhunter Inferniarch | Juggernaut | Kalyassa | Latrivan | Omruc | Orshabaal | Plaguesmith | Preceptor Lazare | Ushuriel | Zugurosh
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes: An article from Tibianews, published on October 21, 2007, suggested that the attack rate of Onyx Arrow is 38. Previously it has been believed to be 35.\n200 of these can be obtained during the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]] by clearing both the Greenhorn Arena and the Scrapper Arena.

name: Orange
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

history:
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy Orcish Maul}} [[Icy Orcish Maul]]
* {{Ilink|Earth Orcish Maul}} [[Earth Orcish Maul]]
* {{Ilink|Energy Orcish Maul}} [[Energy Orcish Maul]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery Orcish Maul}} [[Fiery Orcish Maul]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].
