name: Marlin
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
A rare fish, most people keep them instead of eating it. Island Trolls can be seen carrying this fish, however, they rarely drop them.
You can trade this for a [[Marlin Trophy]] with [[Pemaret]] on [[Cormaya]] boat.
flavortext: This rare fish is almost too precious to simply be eaten. Maybe you can find a collector.

name: Marlin Trophy
notes: You can obtain this by trading a [[Marlin]] with [[Pemaret]] on [[Cormaya]] boat. {{seealso|Pemaret/Transcripts}}

name: Master Archer's Armor
notes: Obtainable in [[The Inquisition Quest]].

name: Meat Shield
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Doctor Perhaps]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nLooks the same as [[Ham]]. Beware of [[scam]]s!\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: A sturdy shield made of old meat.

name: Mechanical Fish
notes:
You need a [[Mechanical Fishing Rod]] and [[nail]]s to get a Mechanical Fish.
Obtained in [[The Isle of Evil Quest]].

name: Mechanical Fishing Rod
notes: You need this fishing rod and [[Nail]]s to catch [[Mechanical Fish]].\nObtained and used in The [[Isle of Evil Quest]].

name: Memory Crystal
notes: It looks the same as a [[Food Matrix Crystal]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Ice Islands Quest]].
history: After player suggestion on the test server forum, this item became buyable from [[Black Bert]] for 500 [[gp]], during a round of content fixes on {{OfficialNewsArchive|2271|Dec 20 2012}}. So if you loose this item now during the quest it is involved in, you can simply buy a new one from [[Black Bert]].\n\nBefore [[Updates/9.6|Summer Update 2012]], it looked the same as a [[Life Crystal]].
flavortext: It is able to store memories and thoughts.

name: Mercenary Sword
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Amenef the Burning | Betrayed Wraith | Bruise Payne | Eyeless Devourer | Foam Stalker | Ghulosh | Glooth Brigand | Infernal Demon | Madareth | Man in the Cave | Mean Lost Soul | Mutated Bat | Retching Horror | Rotten Golem | Serpent Spawn | Streaked Devourer | The Noxious Spawn | Unaz the Mean | Utua Stone Sting | Venerable Foam Stalker
notes: It used to be a very rare drop from [[Man in the Cave]] and [[Serpent Spawn]]. It's more common now.

name: Message in a Bottle
notes: Exposed in the room of [[Raymond Striker]]'s house in [[Sabrehaven]] ([[Meriana]]). It looks similar to the bottles you can find floating around [[Message in a Bottle (Immobile)|Roshamuul]] and [[Message in a Bottle (Falcon)|Gray Island]].

name: Metal Fitting
buyfrom: Harog;After getting the [[Tunnelling Guide (Book)|Tunnelling Guide]] on {{Spoiler Section|The Hidden City of Beregar Quest|The Royal Rescue}}.
notes:
Sometimes used as a floor decoration in [[House]]s.
\nNeeded in {{Spoiler Section|The Hidden City of Beregar Quest|The Royal Rescue}}.

name: Midnight Shard
droppedby: Acolyte of Darkness | Bane of Light | Bride of Night | Doomsday Cultist | Duskbringer | Eclipse Knight | Herald of Gloom | Midnight Spawn | Midnight Warrior | Nightslayer | Shadow Hound | Weak Spawn of Despair
notes:
It can be obtained throughout and as reward of [[The Lightbearer]] event.

Can be traded for [[experience]] points with [[Lucius]] during and after succeeding in [[The Lightbearer]] event. A [[Game World]] that has failed the event can not exchange them. 

For each Midnight Shard, characters can gain <math>300 \cdot L</math> experience; L being the character's level. Note that the formula is not <math>\sum_{i=1}^{N} 300L_i</math> (for N shards), so if a character levels up by using one shard, they will gain 300 more experience per shard for the next level. Thus, it is slightly better to trade them incrementally than all at once. Check the [[Midnight Shard/Table|table]] for better results. 

A character can trade up to 80 shards for experience per year. However, an arbitrary amount of shards can be traded for gold.
history:
==== 2009 ====
Previously, the shards gave <math>30 \cdot L</math> experience and was also lootable from monsters on the good side of the [[Temple of Light]] if the event ends in success. The adjustment came as a result of the raising of the shards' rarity.

==== 2011 ====
During 2011, some players could trade up to 80 shards. Players who had not talked to Lucius yet after the {{OfficialNewsArchive|1892|November 12 patch}} could have their shard trade count reset after their next conversation with Lucius. For example, if one took 80 shards with them to Lucius, asked to trade all for experience, 40 would be traded; ending the conversation with 'bye' and repeating the process with the 40 remaining shards would allow the final 40 to be traded for experience. This was not a bug - it is the compensation for a bug in which some players could not trade 40 shards.

==== 2024 ====
{{OfficialNewsArchive|7987|The August 6 2024 patch}} increased the number of tradable shards from 40 to 80 and removed the level cap (of 200) for redeeming midnight shards.
flavortext: Lucius might be interested in those shards.

name: Mighty Helm of Green Sparks
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Doctor Perhaps]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
Looks similar to a [[Steel Helmet]], but with green sparks.
There is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: This helmet spawns green stars. Awesome.

name: Mining Helmet
notes:
Dwarfs could use this while mining. Provides 4 squares of permanent yellow light, a bit weaker than a [[Torch]].
It looks the same as [[Mining Helmet (Budrik)|Budrik's Mining Helmet]].
A reward from the [[Tibia Tales Quest]] ([[To Outfox a Fox Quest]]).
flavortext: This is your personal mining helmet.

name: Mining Helmet (Budrik)
notes: This helmet belongs to [[Budrik]] and it cannot be equipped.\nItem temporarily received in the [[Tibia Tales Quest]] ([[To Outfox a Fox Quest]]).
flavortext: This is Budrik's old mining helmet.

name: Modified Crossbow
notes:
Has a range of 5 square tiles around the user and a hit% of +1.
\nObtainable in the [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].

name: Molten Plate
notes: It gives 7% [[fire]] protection, but increases damage taken from [[ice]] by 7%. It is only available for [[Paladins]]. First looted in [[Azura]] (05/02/2009) by the guild {{Guild|Wanted}}. It's a very rare item, but exists on several worlds.\n[[Image:Molten_plate.jpg|thumb]]

name: Molten Wax
notes:
This can be used to make [[A Special Polish]].
Looks the same as a [[Glob of Acid Slime]]. Made by melting a [[Honeycomb]] on [[Eclesius]]'s [[Oven]].
Used in the [[Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]] and in [[The Cursed Crystal Quest]].

name: Moon Backpack
notes:
Functions like a regular [[Backpack]] but emits a weak blue light in a 3-square radius, visible only with low ambient light settings. Its value varies greatly between [[Game Worlds]]. Since the [[Updates/9.4|Christmas Update 2010]], it has also become a rare gift from [[Santa Claus]]. 
Additionally, it can be obtained as a reward from the [[The Lightbearer|Lightbearer Event]] for players who light all the basins.

See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Morgaroth's Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Perhaps to be used for an addon. Main use is as a rare decoration.

name: Morik's Helmet
notes: Needed for 5th mission in [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].
flavortext: It belonged to a famous gladiator.

name: Mother Soil
notes: \nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].

name: Mushroom Spores
notes:
Lightest item in Tibia.
\nLooks the same as [[Pinch of Crystal Dust]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Ice Islands Quest]].

name: Mythril Axe
notes:

name: Nail

It is possible to get one nail from slain [[Worker Golem|worker]] or [[War Golem|war]] golem by using a [[Golem Disassembler]] on its remains during 4th mission of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]].

notes:
It can be seen in the [[Pythius The Rotten]]'s treasure room. Its data can be found in the [[Market]].

name: Natural Soil
droppedby: Jagged Earth Elemental | Muddy Earth Elemental
notes:
Obtainable during [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].
Can be used to pass the energy wall or fire wall in the Magician's Quarter [[Magician Quarter/Residential Area|Residential Area]] to access the [[Warlock]] and [[Infernalist]] spawns. It can also be used to enter the blue flame and access the [[Demon]]s spawn under the Magician Quarter's [[Magician Quarter/Restricted Area|Restricted Area]].

\nNeeded for a mission of the [[Secret Service Quest|Carlin Secret Service Quest]]. If you lose it, [[Emma]] can give you the permission to obtain a new one.
flavortext: It contains the arcane secrets of nature magic.

name: Nautical Map
notes: Looks the same as [[Julius' Map]], a [[Map (Colour)]], a [[Map to the Unknown]], [[The Lower Right Part of a Map]], [[The Lower Left Part of a Map]], [[The Top Right Part of a Map]], [[The Top Left Part of a Map]].Temporarily obtained in [[Isle of Evil Quest]].

droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Blood Hand | Blood Priest | Brachiodemon | Crape Man | Essence of Malice | Eyeless Devourer | Fury | Furyosa | Hellgorak | Horadron | Necromancer | Omrafir | Prince Drazzak | Serpent Spawn | Streaked Devourer | The Noxious Spawn | Utua Stone Sting | Werelion

notes: An excellent choice for low levels, as its defense is the same as [[Bonelord Shield]], but is significantly lighter. It's part of the [[Barbarian Set]].\nCan be obtained by [[Unrusting]] a [[Slightly Rusted Shield]].

name: Norseman Doll
notes:
Since [[TibiaNordic]] left the fansite programme, this item cannot be obtained anymore.

Its replica is the [[Norseman Doll (Replica)]].

flavortext: It is given to the winners of TibiaNordic competitions.

name: Northern Fishburger
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It will boost your [[fishing]] skill by 50 for one hour.
To create this dish, you must speak with the [[Djinn]] [[Jean Pierre]] in [[Ankrahmun]], near the Marid Fortress, during the Hot Cuisine event. When using a Northern Fishburger, [[Green Sparkles Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Sparkles Effect}} will appear on the user who will get the following message: "{{Server Message|You suddenly feel like the best fisherman in the whole world.}}" '''Necessary Ingredients:''' *1 [[Northern Pike]] [[File:Northern Pike.gif]] *1 [[Rainbow Trout]] [[File:Rainbow Trout.gif]] *1 [[Green Perch]] [[File:Green Perch.gif]] *5 [[Shrimp]]s [[File:Shrimp.gif]] *2 [[Roll]]s [[File:Roll.gif]] *1 [[Fern]] [[File:Fern.gif]] Only obtainable through the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
flavortext: It's only suited for those who like maritime food.

name: Northwind Rod
droppedby: Blemished Spawn | Bony Sea Devil | Crazed Winter Rearguard | Crazed Winter Vanguard | Frost Flower Asura | Hazardous Phantom | Many Faces | Quara Predator Scout | Renegade Quara Constrictor | Roaring Water Elemental | Sea Serpent | The Winter Bloom | True Frost Flower Asura | Turbulent Elemental | Venerable Girtablilu

It's the lowest level rod which can be imbued (critical imbuement not possible)

Are you interested?}}

Looks similar to a [[Crate]] although it is sealed with red tape.

name: Masterpiece of a Gozzler
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using an [[Artist's Brush]] on an [[Artist's Easel]].

name: Masterpiece of a Muse
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using an [[Artist's Brush]] on a [[Artist's Easel]].
flavortext: It was painted in the style of Penciljack.

name: Mathmaster Shield
notes:
It's the official [[TibiaStat]] item. It was created by {{character|Lupus Aurelius}}.
Its replica is the [[Mathmaster Shield (Replica)]]. When you use a mathmaster shield, it starts to shine and looks like this: [[File:Mathmaster Shield (Shining).gif|Shining Mathmaster Shield]] Mathmaster Shield.png | 1 = Mathmaster Shield
flavortext: This is an emblem of wisdom. It was awarded by TibiaStat.com.

name: Maxilla
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Maxilla Maximus
droppedby: Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Lich | Ribstride | Zanakeph | Zorvorax
notes:
This is the item needed to tame an [[Undead Cavebear]] [[File:Undead_Cavebear_(Mount).gif]]. It has a chance of breaking when used. It was a myth that [[Undead Gladiator]]s dropped it since the name had analogy with the creature because of the roman name and the roman gladiators. Failed: '''The undead cavebear is growling at you.'''
Failed: '''The undead cavebear ran away.'''
Succeeded: '''You tamed the undead cavebear.'''
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Meandi
notes: Normal state is having the greedy look, when used he wants to kiss [[File:Demon Infant (Kiss).gif]] for 10 seconds.\nIt is obtained through the [[Demon's Lullaby]] event.

name: Meaty Vortex
notes: \n\nItem temporarily obtained in [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: This fruit was gathered from a Carnivortex.

name: Medicine Pouch
notes:
It's easy to obtain this item as loot from [[Swamp Troll]], but most higher level players buy Medicine Pouch because only lower level creatures drop them.
This medicine can be used to cure swamp fever - a plague connected with humidity and starvation. Help [[Ottokar]] prevent the plague by delivering them to him.
Can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.32|126.91|10|4|text=here}}.\nYou can give this item to NPC [[Ottokar]] at anytime to get a [[Belongings of a Deceased]] or you can wait until the [[Swamp Fever]] World Change has started. If you give 100 pouches to NPC [[Ottokar]] you'll receive the [[achievement]] "[[Doctor! Doctor!]]"

name: Medusa Skull
notes:
It can only be gotten by winning a contest held by [[TibiaPic]]. The creator of this item is {{character|Don Maximus Meridius}} from Unitera.
Its replica is the [[Medusa Skull (Replica)]]. This item was introduced on the [[Updates/9.5|Spring Patch 2012]]. Medusa Skull creator.png|House of Don Maximus Meridius
sounds: {{Sound List|I will petrify thisss moment! Sstonesss are forever!!!|Where isss my body?!? I'll kill you!!!|Hail mighty <Player>! Hail TibiaPic!}}
flavortext: Her hair's snakes are still alive. Awarded only on TibiaPic.com.

name: Miniature House

name: Minotaur Horn
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Apprentice Sheng | Depowered Minotaur | Execowtioner | General Murius | Minotaur | Minotaur Amazon | Minotaur Archer | Minotaur Cult Follower | Minotaur Cult Prophet | Minotaur Cult Zealot | Minotaur Guard | Minotaur Hunter | Minotaur Invader | Minotaur Mage | Mooh'Tah Warrior | The Horned Fox | Worm Priestess
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\nUsed in the [[Witches' Cauldron Quest]].

name: Minotaur Statue Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Minotaur Statue}} [[Minotaur Statue]]. It looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a minotaur statue.

name: Miraculum
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crazed Winter Vanguard | Insane Siren | Stalker
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}\n\nIt's animation includes a completely empty frame, which makes it useful to make screenshots with no character in the middle if used with a [[Chameleon Rune]].

name: Muck Remover
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It can be used on a [[Mucus Plug]] to remove the mucus and reveal its contents. \nYou can get the [[achievement]] [[Goo Goo Dancer]] by using 100 Muck Removers on [[Mucus Plug]]s.
flavortext: The gnomish slime remover works wonders on mucky objects.

name: Mummy Disguise
notes:
It turns you into a [[Mummy]] for 10 seconds. It looks like a dead [[Mummy]].
Item temporarily obtained in Mission 11 of [[What a foolish Quest]].

name: Mushroom Backpack
droppedby: Diremaw | Hideous Fungus | Humongous Fungus | Chasm Spawn
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Music Box (TibiaSpace)
notes:
It was the [[TibiaSpace]] fansite item and could only be gotten by winning a contest held or sponsored by [[TibiaSpace]]. It was created by {{Character|Frozen Crowley}}.

Its replica is the [[Music Box (Replica)]].
flavortext: The song inside is made of love. It was rewarded by TibiaSpace.com.

name: Musician's Bow
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Boogey]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nLooks the same as a [[Lyre]].
\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: If you could only figure out how you are supposed to fire more arrows at once.

name: Mutated Bat Ear
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Mutated Flesh
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Mutated Rat Tail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Mystic Root
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[A Father's Burden Quest]].

name: Mystical Hourglass
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Grim Reaper | The Last Lore Keeper
notes: 5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Lich Shroud]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Necklace of the Deep
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Deathling Scout | Deathling Spellsinger | Deepling Master Librarian | Deepling Spellsinger | Flimsy Lost Soul | Irgix the Flimsy
notes: Consider using this item in any situation when you can not avoid strong beams dealing [[Life Drain]] damage, like during [[The Annihilator Quest]] or if being trapped by [[Frazzlemaw]]s and [[Guzzlemaw]]s.

name: Necromantic Robe
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
flavortext: A dark curse prevents you from wearing it.

name: Net
notes:
It is used as a [[Trap]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]].

name: Nettle Blossom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Nettle Spit
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
flavortext: Yuck. This might only be interesting to botanists.

name: Nightmare Doll
notes:
It's a doll wearing [[Demon Set]].
This item was originally created by {{character|Li Dao}} for [[Tibia Friends]]' item competition. It did not win the competition (it came on second place) but the content team liked it and added it to the game.
This item can only be obtained as a gift from CipSoft or on a Promoted or Supported Fansite contest.
A nighmare doll was awarded to each promoted and supported fansite contact person in December 2009.
Current owners of This item are: * {{character|Flain}} from [[Hydera]] * {{character|Evicor Thunderbolt}} won this doll as the award of the audience in [[Tibiopedia]] movie awards. * {{character|Karlkoninan}} was awarded with this doll for winning 2nd place in [[Tibia-Stats]] unique fansite item competition on 20th May 2010. * {{character|Loth Jose}} was awarded with this doll for winning 1st place of the [[TibiaHispano]] convention on 11th August 2010. * {{character|Mounthrize}} received this doll for winning 2nd place in "A day in the life of a role player" contest of [[TibiaRP]]. * {{character|Hunter of Dragoes}} received this doll as award of the ''"NPC Secreto"'' (Secret NPC) contest of [[Portal Tibia]] on 7th December 2010. * {{character|Kong}} was awarded with this doll for winning 1st place of TibiaWiki's Create a Creature contest. * {{character|Beartin}} was awarded with this doll for winning 1st place in the Riddle contest of [[Tibia-Stats]], although the current owner is {{character|Andarist}}. * {{character|Ponisz}} was awarded with another doll for last place of lottery in the same contest of [[Tibia-Stats]]. * {{character|Elais}} was awarded with this doll for second place in the "Funny answers" contest conducted by [[FunTibia]] on 24th November 2011. * {{character|Titi Iris}} received this doll for winning 1st place in "Tibian battle" contest of [[TibiaSpace]] on 3rd June 2013. * {{character|Jamaican Shinigami}} was awarded with this doll for winning 3rd place in the fansite item contest of [[TibiaEvents]] on 6th August 2013. * {{character|Yklans vi Riserfaith}} received this doll for winningÂ 1stÂ placeÂ of the "Humble Tavern" (Secret NPC) contest of Portal Tibia on 27th November 2014. * {{character|Xaarcus}} was awarded with this doll for winning 2nd place in the fansite item contest of [[TibiaMisterios]] on 14th April 2015. * {{character|Kiittie}} received Nightmare Doll for wining 1st place of lottery [[TibiaRoyal]] Anniversary - Our world is doomed! on 10th March 2016. * {{character|Makedonecot}} * {{character|Derigard}} on Belobra * {{Character|Cotini}} was awarded with this doll for winning 2nd place in "Mission 1" in the Birthday contest of [[PortalTibia]] on 9th December 2019.

name: Noble Turban
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Efreet | Fahim the Wise | Marid | Merikh the Slaughterer
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Northern Star
notes: This was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] for several years until January 7, 2017, when players were able to do the [[First Dragon Quest]] as part of [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]] celebrations and loot it from a related creature.

name: Notes and Coordinates
notes: It looks the same as a [[Piece of Paper (Blank)]] and a [[Very Old Piece of Paper]].\nItem obtained in [[Liquid Black Quest]].
flavortext: These scribblings are almost unreadable.

name: Obujos' Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: \nWhen you kill [[Obujos]] during the 3rd Stage of the [[Liquid Black Quest]], the permission to open his chest will be granted to you. There's a chance to get this item from it.
flavortext: The identity of some deepling is written there.

name: Obvious Piece of Cloth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can reach higher prices in [[Optional PvP]] worlds given the fact of the rarity of the [[Feverish Citizen]] raids based on the non-stop medicine pouch delivery. Nevertheless they are a little bit more common since the last update in almost all the optional pvp servers.
\nNeeded for [[Afflicted Outfits Quest]].
flavortext: It seems to be a part of an outfit. Find all six parts to complete the outfit.

name: Oil Lamp
notes:
It can be found at [[Asura Palace]].
It looks similar to a [[Small Oil Lamp]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/10.8|Summer Update 2015]] with the introduction of the [[Asura Palace]].

name: Old Cape
notes: \nReward of [[A Father's Burden Quest]]. This item may be given to the [[Cranky Lizard Crone]] in exchange for the first addon of the [[Wayfarer Outfits]].
flavortext: This old cape might be worth more than what it looks like.

name: Old Encrypted Text
notes:
Obtained by using a [[Fire Bug]] on a [[Very Old Piece of Paper]].
It looks the same as a [[Note from the Thieves Guild]], an [[Old Piece of Paper]], an [[Old Pirate Poem]], a [[Parchment of Interest]], a [[Piece of Paper]], a [[Piece of Paper (Object)]], [[Suspicious Documents]], [[The Alchemists' Formulas]] and a [[Translation Scroll]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[Treasure Hunt Quest]].
flavortext: Maybe a sorcerer can help you with the decryption.

name: Old Iron
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[A Father's Burden Quest]].

name: Old Radio
notes:
The official [[RadioTibia]] item. It could only be gotten by winning a contest held by [[RadioTibia]].
\nThe creator of this item is {{character|Mounthrize}} from [[Zanera]].
\nIt looks the same as an [[Old Radio (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Hello bffff... <player>.|Hail bffff... RadioTibia!|Now Tibia bffff... has sound.}}
flavortext: Granted by RadioTibia.com.br to hear the sounds of Tibia.

name: Ominous Piece of Cloth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can reach higher prices in [[Optional PvP]] worlds given the fact of the rarity of the [[Feverish Citizen]] raids based on the non-stop medicine pouch delivery. Nevertheless they are a little bit more common since the last update in almost all the optional pvp servers.
\nNeeded for [[Afflicted Outfits Quest]].
flavortext: It seems to be a part of an outfit. Find all six parts to complete the outfit.

name: Orc Leather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Cublarc the Plunderer | Kraknaknork | Orc | Orc Berserker | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Cult Inquisitor | Orc Cult Priest | Orc Leader | Orc Marauder | Orc Rider | Orc Shaman | Orc Spearman | Orc Warlord | Orc Warrior | Renegade Orc | Warlord Ruzad
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Orc Tooth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Cublarc the Plunderer | Orc | Orc Berserker | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Cult Inquisitor | Orc Cult Priest | Orc Leader | Orc Marauder | Orc Rider | Orc Shaman | Orc Spearman | Orc Warlord | Orc Warrior | Renegade Orc
notes:
5 of them are needed for the [[Unnatural Selection Quest]].
You need 1 of these to obtain [[Toothfairy Assistant]] achievement in [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
20 of them are needed for the [[Basic Chop]], [[Intricate Chop]] and [[Powerful Chop]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Chop, Intricate Chop, Powerful Chop

name: Orc's Jaw Shredder
flavortext: There is no better way to get rid of top secret data. Awarded by TibiaSpy.com.

name: Orcish Gear
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
flavortext: The strong smell of orcish sweat sticks to it.

name: Marsh Stalker Beak
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\nUsed in the [[Witches' Cauldron Quest]].

name: Marsh Stalker Feather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\n50 are needed in the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].

name: Mean Knight Sword
notes: It looks like a [[Wooden Sword]]. You will receive this item from NPC [[Neill]] on the [[Festival of Initiates]].

name: Mean Paladin Spear
notes: You will get three at a time from the box near [[Shanoya]] during the [[Festival of Initiates]]. It looks the same as a [[Spear]] and a [[Giant Screwdriver]]. You can collect 3 every 60 seconds from the [[Box]].

name: Melting Horn
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Memory Box
notes: Fansite item of [[TibiaEvents]]. It is an antique camera. If you ''use'' it, it will turn into [[Memory Box (Activated)]] and look like that: [[File:Memory Box (Activated).gif]].
history:
Originally created by {{Character|Honourable Knight of Honera}}., it is the official fansite item for tibiaevents.com. This item was implemented on September 18th, 2013.

This is what the memory box looked like before it was further improved by its creator: 
[[File:Memorybox3.png|left]]

[[File:Memory_Box2.gif|left]]

As of the Winter update December 10th, 2014 the sprite of the Memory box was updated 
(''Improved graphics/details, and a smoother animation for the flash release to match newer sprites'') upon request by Honourable. Many other fansite items (and replicas) were updated with new animations as well on the very same update.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to four players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Captain Gus}} ([[Calmera]])
* {{Character|Veckina}} ([[Menera]])
* {{Character|Pariah la venganza}} ([[Luminera]])
* {{Character|Lord Akris}} ([[Gladera]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Say 'Rat Cheese!'|Hold still... got it!|I got the perfect shot!|Uploading to TibiaEvents... processing...|Look at this one! Wasn't this your first battle with a dragon?|This picture reminds me of the latest event.}}
flavortext: It is said to freeze time itself to capture your fondest memories. Awarded by TibiaEvents.com.

name: Metal Bat
droppedby: Brachiodemon | Control Tower | Eyeless Devourer | Metal Gargoyle | Rustheap Golem | The Unarmored Voidborn

name: Metal Jaw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Metal Spats
droppedby: Bellicose Orger | Control Tower | Glooth Battery | Gore Horn | Lavafungus | Metal Gargoyle | Ogre Ruffian | Sabretooth (Creature) | Sister Hetai | Walker

name: Metal Toe
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Mino Shield
droppedby: Minotaur Amazon | Minotaur Cult Follower | Minotaur Hunter | Thanatursus | The False God | Usurper Archer
notes: Particularly useful to lower level [[knight]]s as it offers the same defense as a [[Dragon Shield]] for just 5 oz. more. Therefore, the price of this shield largely depends on the value of Dragon Shields on your server.

notes:
Given by [[Commander Stone]] and [[Gnomeral]] as a reward for completing tasks from the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]].

They can be traded for reputation points (5 points per token), outfit items, equipment and some other items with [[Gnomally]]:

name: Monk's Diary
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Black Book]], a [[Theatre Script]], a [[Botany Almanach]], and a [[Yalahari Folio]].
It contains [[They Are Coming (Book)]].\nTemporarily obtained in [[The White Raven Monastery Quest]].

name: Mooh'tah Plate
droppedby: Bullwark | Depowered Minotaur | Minotaur Hunter | Minotaur Invader | Mooh'Tah Warrior
notes: A good armor for low level Knights and Paladins.

name: Mooh'tah Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
This item's value is usually higher than the amount NPCs pay for it because it's used for the [[Imbuing|Imbuements]].
25 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Slash]] and [[Powerful Slash]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Moohtant Horn
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Bullwark | Glooth Bomb | Moohtant | Moohtant Wallbreaker
notes: 20 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Chop]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Mouthpiece for a Horn
notes: You can obtain one from a [[Box]] every 24 hours in the base camp of [[Lower Roshamuul]], near [[Gederas]]. This item's value is tied with the value of [[Cluster of Solace|Clusters of Solace]]. The mouthpiece's description is misleading, as it does not deteriorate in any way over time. Despite being a popularly traded item, you cannot sell this on the [[Market]], so players must advertise buying or selling mouthpieces and perform the trade in person.Can be used with a [[Crude Horn of Bone]] to create a [[Crude Horn with Mouthpiece]] in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
history: These used to be obtainable every 30 minutes before the [[2016 Winter Update]]. Some players created many characters to open the crate every 30+ minutes because they are usually sold for high amounts for the low effort required to obtain them. This worked because you did not need to be online for the 30 minutes to obtain another mouthpiece.
flavortext: This mouthpiece can be used with a musical horn. It won't stay pristine very long in the open air.

name: Muck Rod
droppedby: Gorzindel | Hideous Fungus | Humongous Fungus | Kusuma | Noxious Ripptor | Plagirath | Ravenous Hunger | Stalking Stalk | The Duke of the Depths | Mazzinor
flavortext: A true staff of old, spitting slimy orbs.

name: Mucus Plug
notes:
Use [[Muck Remover]] on it to reveal its contents. The remover will be consumed in the process. You can get the following items out of it: [[File:Crystal Backpack.gif]] [[Crystal Backpack]]
[[File:Blue Gem.gif]] [[Blue Gem]]
[[File:Glowing Mushroom.gif]] [[Glowing Mushroom]]
[[File:Violet Crystal Shard.gif]] 5 [[Violet Crystal Shard]]s
[[File:Blue Crystal Splinter.gif]] 10 [[Blue Crystal Splinter]]s
[[File:Blue Crystal Shard.gif]] 10 [[Blue Crystal Shard]]s
[[File:Crystal Mace.gif]] [[Crystal Mace]]
[[File:Crystalline Armor.gif]] [[Crystalline Armor]]
[[File:Crystalline Sword.gif]] [[Crystalline Sword]]
{{Seealso|Mucus Plug/Statistics}} You have a chance of getting it from a reward chest after completing any [[Warzone]]. You can get the [[achievement]] [[Goo Goo Dancer]] by using 100 [[Muck Remover]]s on Mucus Plugs.
flavortext: Perhaps it contains something useful.

name: Mushroom Pie
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Hideous Fungus | Humongous Fungus | Memory of a Carnisylvan | Poisonous Carnisylvan | Memory of a Fungus
notes:
Can be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.
1 of these are needed for the [[The Cradle of Monsters Quest]].

name: Music Box
notes: * It is a reward of the [[Realm of Dreams Quest]].\n* It can be used to tame a few creatures with a 100% success rate, including: [[Dragonling]], [[Draptor]], [[Enraged White Deer]], [[Ironblight]], [[Magma Crawler]], [[Midnight Panther]], [[Wailing Widow]], [[Wild Horse]], [[Panda]].\n* [[NPC]] [[Lothar]] responds to {{KW|music box}}: {{NPC Quote|NPC=Lothar|msg=Where did you get that? What a rare treat. This must have been crafted by someone who truly loves both music and animals. I can't tell you anything else about it.}}
flavortext: It may have some charming effects when played to certain creatures, but disappears in the process.

name: Music Sheet (First Verse)
droppedby: Grandfather Tridian | Novice of the Cult
notes:
This item is the first verse, but there are four verses to a cult hymn, each on different music sheets. They are dropped by different members of the [[Cult]]. See [[Music Sheet]] for an overview.
Be careful! If you "use" the music sheet it will disappear and you will see a message in red: {{Message|type=sound|You have learned the first part of a hymn.}} If you already know that verse, you can not use it again, when attempting to do so a message will appear {{Message|type=sound|You already know the first verse of the hymn.}}
It looks the same as a [[Music Sheet (Second Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Third Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Fourth Verse)]], an [[Old Letter]] and [[The Rite of Eternal Night]]. You must learn all the verses of the hymn to gain access to the deeper parts of the [[Cult Cave|cultists cave]] on [[Vandura]] (beyond the piano). By learning all the parts of the hymn, you will earn the achievement [[Chorister]].
flavortext: It contains the first verse of a hymn.

name: Music Sheet (Fourth Verse)
droppedby: Enlightened of the Cult | Grandfather Tridian
notes:
This item is the fourth verse, but there are four verses to a cult hymn, each on different music sheets. They are dropped by different members of the [[Cult]]. See [[Music Sheet]] for an overview.
Be careful! If you "use" the music sheet it will disappear and you will see a message in red: {{Message|type=sound|You have learned the fourth part of a hymn.}} If you already know that verse, you cannot use it again, as when attempting to do so this message will appear {{Message|type=sound|You already know the fourth verse of the hymn.}}
It looks the same as a [[Music Sheet (First Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Second Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Third Verse)]], an [[Old Letter]] and [[The Rite of Eternal Night]]. You must learn all the verses of the hymn to gain access to the deeper parts of the [[Cult Cave|cultists cave]] on [[Vandura]] (beyond the piano). By learning all the parts of the hymn, you will earn the achievement [[Chorister]].
flavortext: It contains the fourth and last verse of a hymn.

name: Music Sheet (Second Verse)
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Grandfather Tridian
notes:
This item is the second verse, but there are four verses to a cult hymn, each on different music sheets. They are dropped by different members of the [[Cult]]. See [[Music Sheet]] for an overview.
Be careful! If you "use" the music sheet it will disappear and you will see a message in red: {{Message|type=sound|You have learned the second part of a hymn.}} If you already know that verse, you can not use it again, when attempting to do so a message will appear {{Message|type=sound|You already know the second verse of the hymn.}}
It looks the same as a [[Music Sheet (First Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Third Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Fourth Verse)]], an [[Old Letter]] and [[The Rite of Eternal Night]]. You must learn all the verses of the hymn to gain access to the deeper parts of the [[Cult Cave|cultists cave]] on [[Vandura]] (beyond the piano). By learning all the parts of the hymn, you will earn the achievement [[Chorister]].
flavortext: It contains the second verse of a hymn.

name: Music Sheet (Third Verse)
droppedby: Adept of the Cult | Grandfather Tridian
notes:
This item is the third verse, but there are four verses to a cult hymn, each on different music sheets. They are dropped by different members of the [[Cult]]. See [[Music Sheet]] for an overview.
Be careful! If you "use" the music sheet it will disappear and you will see a message in red: {{Message|type=sound|You have learned the third part of a hymn.}} If you already know that verse, you can not use it again, when attempting to do so a message will appear {{Message|type=sound|You already know the third verse of the hymn.}}
It looks the same as a [[Music Sheet (First Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Second Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Fourth Verse)]], an [[Old Letter]] and [[The Rite of Eternal Night]]. You must learn all the verses of the hymn to gain access to the deeper parts of the [[Cult Cave|cultists cave]] on [[Vandura]] (beyond the piano). By learning all the parts of the hymn, you will earn the achievement [[Chorister]].
flavortext: It contains the third verse of a hymn.

name: Mycological Bow
droppedby: Abyssador | Deathstrike | Gnomevil | Hideous Fungus | Humongous Fungus | Diremaw
notes: Calculations show that this bow has a greater average damage than [[Warsinger Bow]] and is easier to obtain.

name: Nail Case
notes:
It can be used to tame a [[Gravedigger]]. It can't break when used, but the Gravedigger may flee. See [[Hellgrip]] for more information. '''Important: only characters who have completed the quest can use this item.'''
A reward of [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Necromantic Rust
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Nightmare Beacon
notes: It can be lit/unlit and hung on walls.

name: Nightmare Hook
notes: A decoration item. Can be hung on walls.

name: Nightmare Horn
notes: It can be used to tame a [[Shock Head (Mount)]]. It has a very low chance to break.
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Noble Sword
notes:
The official [[Rookie.pl]] fansite item. This item can only be gotten by winning a contest of [[Rookie.pl]]. It was created by {{character|Lupus Aurelius}}. If you ''use'' it, it will turn into [[Noble Sword (Activated)]] and look like that: [[File:Noble Sword (Activated).gif]].

Its replica is the [[Noble Sword (Replica)]].
flavortext: This sword was forged with the enthusiasm and dreams of the Rookgaardians. Awarded by Rookie.pl.

name: Norseman Doll (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This item is a replica of [[Norseman Doll]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Obsidian Zaoan Bishop
notes: Part of the [[Zaoan Chess Set]].\nObtainable through [[The Colours of Magic]] [[world quest]].
flavortext: A Zaoan Chess figure made of obsidian. It depicts the bishop.

name: Obsidian Zaoan King
notes: Part of the [[Zaoan Chess Set]].\nObtainable through [[The Colours of Magic]] [[world quest]].
flavortext: A Zaoan Chess figure made of obsidian. It depicts the king.

name: Obsidian Zaoan Knight
notes: Part of the [[Zaoan Chess Set]].\nObtainable through [[The Colours of Magic]] [[world quest]].
flavortext: A Zaoan Chess figure made of obsidian. It depicts the knight.

name: Obsidian Zaoan Pawn
notes: Part of the [[Zaoan Chess Set]].\nObtainable through [[The Colours of Magic]] [[world quest]].
flavortext: A Zaoan Chess figure made of obsidian. It depicts the pawn.

name: Obsidian Zaoan Queen
notes: Part of the [[Zaoan Chess Set]].\nObtainable through [[The Colours of Magic]] [[world quest]].
flavortext: A Zaoan Chess figure made of obsidian. It depicts the queen.

name: Obsidian Zaoan Rook
notes: Part of the [[Zaoan Chess Set]].\nObtainable through [[The Colours of Magic]] [[world quest]].
flavortext: A Zaoan Chess figure made of obsidian. It depicts the rook.

name: Old Parchment (Omrabas)
notes: It looks the same as [[Building Plans for a Ship]], a [[Document of the Follower]], a [[Document of the Leader]], a [[Document of the Officer]], a [[Parchment (White)]] and [[Parchment of Dark Knowledge]].\nObtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: This parchment is greasy from candle wax. It classifies candles by light, weight, smell, and danger.

name: Omrabas' Bone Key
notes: Looks the same as a [[Bone Key]] and a [[Goblin Bone Key]].<noinclude>Obtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: It is delicately carved out of the bone of some animal and bears strange inscriptions.

name: Omrabas' Copper Key
notes: Looks the same as a [[Copper Key]].<noinclude>Obtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: A very ornate key, made of solid copper.

name: Omrabas' Heart
notes: Obtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: It is still alive and throbs in a steady rhythm.

name: Omrabas' Talking Skull
notes: It looks the same as a [[Drowned Seaman's Skull]], a [[Skull (Item)]], a [[Skull of Ratha]] and [[Some Mortal Essence]].\nObtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: Omrabas The Black's soul lives inside this skull.

name: Opticording Sphere
notes:
This item can be easily obtained (even by a level 8). Be aware of scammers trying to sell it for a high price!
When you use it, you get the following message: ''"Nothing happens except... no, absolutely nothing is happening at all."''
It looks the same as a [[Complete Opticording Sphere]].\nObtained in the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]]. Can be found in a crate after going down [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}127.170-123.116-7-2-1-1 this hole] in [[Ab'Dendriel]]. To open a passage you have to light both wall torches. The Opticording Sphere is in a crate at the southwest corner of the room.\n|marketable=n
flavortext: This strange box holds a dark sphere. There is some kind of button at one side and a lens up front.

name: Orc's Jaw Shredder (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This item is a replica of [[Orc's Jaw Shredder]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Medusa Skull (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s with [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of a [[Medusa Skull]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Memory Box (Activated)
notes: It will turn back into [[Memory Box]] after a short moment.
sounds: {{Sound List|Say "Rat CHeese!"|Hold still...got it!|I got the perfect shot!|Uploading to TibiaEvents.... processing...|Look at this one! Wasn't this your first battle with a dragon?|This picture reminds me of the latest event}}
flavortext: It is said to freeze time itself to capture your fondest memories. Awarded by TibiaEvents.com.

name: Menacing Egg
notes: Use this item to receive the [[Vortexion]] mount. {{Ilink|Vortexion}}\n\n{{Sound|You receive the permission to ride the dreaded Vortexion.}}
flavortext: It is of foreboding, reddish colour and pulses steadily. You have the feeling that something dangerous is moving inside.

name: Midnight Panther Doll
notes:
Current owners of this item:

One was awarded in the "TibiaMagazine.com.ve Fansite Item Contest" to {{character|Makadamia}} who is the item creator.

Two belong to the TibiaMagazine.com.ve admins {{character|Liony}} and {{character|Kikix}}.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Hydranoid}} ([[Menera]])
* {{Character|Ehbi}} ([[Calmera]])
* {{Character|Drunk Suspect}} ([[Celesta]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Hail TibiaMagazine.com.ve!|Don't be afraid of the darkness!|Feel lucky, <player's name>!|Purrrrrrr!}}
flavortext: It is said to be a symbol of perseverance and luck. Awarded by TibiaMagazine.com.ve.

name: Milking Fork
notes: Looks the same as a [[Fork]].\nObtained in [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.
flavortext: Used to harvest the steel spider silk.

name: Monkey Statue 'Hear' Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Monkey Statue (No Hearing)}} [[Monkey Statue (No Hearing)]]. You can buy it from [[Hairycles]] after finishing [[The Ape City Quest]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a monkey statue.

name: Monkey Statue 'See' Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Monkey Statue (No Seeing)}} [[Monkey Statue (No Seeing)]]. You can buy it from [[Hairycles]] after finishing [[The Ape City Quest]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a monkey statue.

name: Monkey Statue 'Speak' Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Monkey Statue (No Speaking)}} [[Monkey Statue (No Speaking)]]. You can buy it from [[Hairycles]] after finishing [[The Ape City Quest]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a monkey statue.

name: Mono Detector
notes: If you lose yours, [[Doubleday]] can give you another one after waiting some time. Temporarily obtained in the [[Oramond Quest]].

name: Moon Mirror
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Lit Moon Mirror]].
\nThere is also an [[Dark Moon Mirror|unlit version]] of this item: {{Ilink|Dark Moon Mirror}}.\nReward from the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Moonlight Crystals
droppedby: Black Vixen | Bloodback | Darkfang | Feroxa | Feroxa (Gloom Wolf) | Katex Blood Tongue | Owin (Creature) | Shadowpelt | Sharpclaw | Werebadger | Werebear | Wereboar | Werefox | Werehyaena | Werehyaena Shaman | Werelion | Werelioness | Werewolf
notes: Can be used on a [[Werewolf Amulet]] to create an [[Enchanted Werewolf Amulet]] or on a [[Werewolf Helmet]] to create an [[Enchanted Werewolf Helmet]]. Can be obtained during the [[Grimvale Mini World Change]].

name: Music Box (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s with [[Jorge]]. This is a replica of a [[Music Box (TibiaSpace)]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Mysterious Metal Egg
notes: [[Use]] it to [[Open Metal Egg|open]] it and receive an [[Opticompass Sphere]] and a [[Rolled-up Parchment]]. This only became possible from [[Tibia]]'s 19th anniversary (7 January 2016) on. Part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].

name: Mysterious Remains
droppedby: Alptramun | Anomaly | Eradicator | Essence of Malice | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Outburst | Plagueroot | Ravenous Hunger | Realityquake | Rupture | The False God | The Nightmare Beast | The Percht Queen | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Sinister Hermit (Blue) | The Souldespoiler | The Unarmored Voidborn | World Devourer
notes:
Use it to get one of the following:
*{{Ilink|Bag of Apple Slices}} [[Bag of Apple Slices]]
*{{Ilink|Surprise Bag (Blue)}} [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|Blue Surprise Bag]]
*{{Ilink|Folded Rift Carpet}} [[Folded Rift Carpet]]
*{{Ilink|Folded Void Carpet}} [[Folded Void Carpet]]
*{{Ilink|Garlic Necklace}} [[Garlic Necklace]]
*{{Ilink|Gnomish Supply Package}} [[Gnomish Supply Package]]
*{{Ilink|Gold Ingot}} [[Gold Ingot]]
*{{Ilink|Huge Chunk of Crude Iron}} [[Huge Chunk of Crude Iron]]
*{{Ilink|Iron Ore}} [[Iron Ore]]
*{{Ilink|Magic Light Wand}} [[Magic Light Wand]]
*{{Ilink|Piggy Bank}} [[Piggy Bank]]
*{{Ilink|Red Dragon Scale}} [[Red Dragon Scale]]
*{{Ilink|Rift Tapestry}} [[Rift Tapestry]]
*{{Ilink|Scarf}} [[Scarf]]
*{{Ilink|Shaggy Ogre Bag}} [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]
*{{Ilink|Slightly Rusted Legs}} [[Slightly Rusted Legs]]
*{{Ilink|Spider Silk}} [[Spider Silk]]
*{{Ilink|Stealth Ring}} [[Stealth Ring]]
*{{Ilink|Tusk}} [[Tusk]]
*{{Ilink|Violet Gem}} [[Violet Gem]]
*{{Ilink|War Horn}} [[War Horn]]
*{{Ilink|Yellow Gem}} [[Yellow Gem]]
{{Seealso|Mysterious Remains/Statistics}}

name: Mysterious Scroll
notes: This item is needed to obtain the [[Rift Runner]] mount. Only those who have finished the [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]] can use it. Characters who have not finished the quest will fail to use it, with the message {{Sound|The ascension of great evil must be stopped before the secret of this scroll may be revealed.}}\n\nIt has the same sprite as [[Note from the Thieves Guild]], [[Old Encrypted Text]], [[Old Piece of Paper]], [[Old Pirate Poem]], [[Parchment of Interest]], [[Piece of Paper]], [[Suspicious Documents]], [[The Alchemists' Formulas]], [[Translation Scroll]], and possibly other items â€” so beware of scams!
history: * The Mysterious Scroll was only added to the [[The Market (Object)|Market]] after {{OfficialNewsArchive|7969|July 9th, 2024}}.
flavortext: Strange symbols hard to decrypt. You wonder if one of the symbols looks like a foreign and mysterious creature.

name: Nacre Slab (Blue)
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]].

name: Nacre Slab (Red)
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]].

name: Nacre Slab (Yellow)
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]].

name: Necrometer
notes: Looks the same as a [[Thermometer]].\nPart of the [[Dark Trails Quest]].

name: Nightmare Teddy
notes: Obtained from the [[Nightmare Teddy Quest]].

name: Noble Sword (Activated)
notes: Has a slighly different light than its orginal form. It will turn back into [[Noble Sword]] after short moment.
flavortext: This sword was forged with the enthusiasm and dreams of the Rookgaardians. Awarded by Rookie.pl.

name: Noble Sword (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This item is a replica of [[Noble Sword]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Notes of a Poacher
notes:
A poacher relates [[Stolen Whelps (Book)|one of his experiences]].
It looks the same as an [[Old Note]] and [[Scribbled Notes]].\nObtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
flavortext: Hints to other wolf whelps.

name: Occupied Birdcage
notes: Part of the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: This birdcage is currently the home of a confused parrot.

name: Odd Organ
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Brain Squid | Dread Intruder | Essence of Malice | Rupture | The Sinister Hermit (Blue) | The Souldespoiler

name: Ogre Beer
notes: It contains beer brewed by [[Ogres]]. It can be picked up inside a [[Barrel]] in the [[Krailos Steppe]] daily.
flavortext: The keg is painted with weird runes.
notes2: Required in the [[Krailos Quest]].

name: Ogre Choppa
notes: It can be sold to NPC [[Mugruu]] after finishing [[Vuzrog]]'s questline. <noinclude>Can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.</noinclude>

name: Ogre Ear Stud
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Ogre Brute | Animated Ogre Savage | Animated Ogre Shaman | Ogre Brute | Ogre Rowdy | Ogre Ruffian | Ogre Sage | Ogre Savage | Ogre Shaman

name: Ogre Klubba
notes: It can be sold to NPC [[Mugruu]] after finishing [[Vuzrog]]'s questline.<noinclude>Can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.</noinclude>

name: Ogre Nose Ring
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Ogre Brute | Animated Ogre Savage | Animated Ogre Shaman | Ogre Brute | Ogre Rowdy | Ogre Ruffian | Ogre Sage | Ogre Savage | Ogre Shaman
notes:
It can be sold to NPC [[Mugruu]] afert finishing [[Vuzrog]]'s questline.
Can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.
15 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Bash]] and [[Powerful Bash]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Ogre Rune Stone
notes: Used to build protection runes with.<noinclude>Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: It is engraved with weird signs.

name: Ogre Rune Stones (Corner)
notes: Used to build protection runes with. These are six [[Ogre Rune Stone]]s forming a corner.<noinclude>Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: They are engraved with weird signs.

name: Ogre Rune Stones (Right)
notes: Used to build protection runes with. These are five [[Ogre Rune Stone]]s forming a semi-circle.<noinclude>Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: They are engraved with weird signs.

name: Ogre Rune Stones (Two)
notes: Used to build protection runes with. It is a pair of [[Ogre Rune Stone]]s.<noinclude>Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: They are engraved with weird signs.

name: Ogre Rune Stones (Up)
notes: Used to build protection runes with. These are five [[Ogre Rune Stone]]s forming a semi-circle.<noinclude>Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: They are engraved with weird signs.

name: Ogre Scepta
notes: It can be sold to NPC [[Mugruu]] after finishing [[Vuzrog]]'s questline. Its price tends to be low by It is identical in properties to a [[Springsprout Rod]], but with the exception that it weighs 2 oz more.\nCan be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.

name: Old Nasty
notes:
While in the water Old Nasty lives in a small subterranean pond in [[Dawnport]].
It looks the same as a [[Fish]].\nOld Nasty can be caught by fishing in the [[Dawnport Quest]].\n|marketable=n
flavortext: A nasty, slippery fish that glares at you out of red eyes.

name: Old Note
notes: It looks the same as [[Notes of a Poacher]] and [[Scribbled Notes]].\nObtained through the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: "They'll come and kill us all. I have to protect the key to the secret door at all costs. If I just could find my only daughter's portrait ... I lost it somewhere down here. I won't leave without it".

name: Old Parchment (Brown)
notes: Looks the same as a [[Scroll (Brown)]] and a [[Blurred Transcript]].\n

name: Old Pirate Poem
notes:
There is only one known text written on an old pirate poem, you can read it [[Old Pirate Poem (Book)|here]].
It looks the same as a [[Note from the Thieves Guild]], an [[Old Encrypted Text]], an [[Old Piece of Paper]], a [[Parchment of Interest]], a [[Piece of Paper]], a [[Piece of Paper (Object)]], [[Suspicious Documents]] and [[The Alchemists' Formulas]].\nPart of [[Treasure Hunt Quest]].

name: Old Rag
notes: It looks the same as a [[Green Piece of Cloth]]. During the annual [[Tibia Anniversary]] [[event]], Thirty of them need to be used on a [[Sewing Table]] in order to trigger ''party time'' :\nduring which [[PiÃ±ata Dragon]]s spawn around [[Thais]] and a world wide experience bonus of 15% lasting one hour is activated.
history: During [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]] starting January 5, 2017, They were dropped by [[Cyclops|Cyclopes]], [[Wolf|Wolves]], [[Troll]]s and [[Bear]]s. Mistakenly, old rags started being dropped by these creatures again exactly one year later, on January 5, 2018. This was fixed on January 9 with [[Updates/11.53|Update 11.53]].

name: Old Silver Key
notes: Part of the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: It is beautifully ornate but heavily tarnished.

name: Old Tome
notes: A tome from another era found in [[Isle of the Kings Library]] and [[Issavi Libraries|Issavi Library]].

name: Onyx Chip
droppedby: Adult Goanna | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Animated Ogre Brute | Animated Ogre Savage | Bony Sea Devil | Broken Shaper | Broodrider Inferniarch | Cobra Vizier | Darkfang | Diremaw | Enusat the Onyx Wing | Gazer Spectre | Ghulosh | Gorzindel | Iks Aucar | Iks Churrascan | Infernal Demon | Lamassu | Lavafungus | Lokathmor | Mazzinor | Memory of a Shaper | Memory of a Werelion | Memory of an Ogre | Menacing Carnivor | Misguided Shadow | Ogre Brute | Ogre Rowdy | Ogre Ruffian | Ogre Savage | Ogre Shaman | Pirat Mate | Razzagorn | Sharpclaw | Shulgrax | Sister Hetai | The Last Lore Keeper | The Source of Corruption | Twisted Shaper | Werelion | Young Goanna
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Larek, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes:
3 of these can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.
\n5 of these are needed in the [[Krailos Quest]].

name: Onyx Pendant
notes: Reward from the [[Krailos Quest]].

name: Opal
droppedby: Adult Goanna | Black Sphinx Acolyte | Cobra Assassin | Cobra Scout | Goldhanded Cultist | Goldhanded Cultist Bride | Iks Ahpututu | Iks Aucar | Iks Churrascan | Iks Pututu | Lamassu | Memory of an Ogre | Menacing Carnivor | Ogre Brute | Ogre Rowdy | Ogre Savage | Ogre Shaman | Pooka | Razzagorn | Shadowpelt | Shulgrax | Stalking Stalk | Swan Maiden | The Last Lore Keeper | The Source of Corruption
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Larek, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes: 2 of these can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s. Also a reward in the [[Krailos Quest]].

name: Open Metal Egg
notes: It is an opened [[Mysterious Metal Egg]].Part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].

name: Opticompass Sphere
notes: Obtain it by opening a [[Mysterious Metal Egg]]. Part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
flavortext: This strange box holds a dark sphere with a small needle in it. It spins sometimes.

name: Mathmaster Shield (Replica)
notes: This item is a replica of [[Mathmaster Shield]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Maxxenius Head
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Mead Horn (Empty)
notes:
This is the hollow horn of some creature, and is used to hold [[Mead]], probably that's why the horn got this name. You can only fill it with mead from the bucket near [[Sven]].
It looks the same as a [[Mead Horn]]. Obtained and used in the [[Barbarian Test Quest]]. |marketable=ye
flavortext: It is empty.

name: Meat Hammer
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Medal of Valiance
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Megalomania's Essence
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Megalomania's Skull
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Meringue Cake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Metal File
notes: A highly useful tool.Part of the [[Hidden Threats Quest]].
flavortext: This file is useful for treating metals.

name: Milk Churn
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: When used on a [[Cow]], you will obtain a [[Filled Milk Churn]], [[Hearts Effect]] {{Ilink|Hearts Effect}} will appear and the following server message will be shown: {{Server Message|*splash*}}

name: Milk Tooth
notes: A tooth that has fulfilled its function and is now obsolete.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Mini NabBot
notes:
It's [[NabBot]]'s fansite item.
If you ''use'' it, it will turn into a [[Mini NabBot (Activated)]] and play a sound: [[File:Mini NabBot (Activating).gif]] [[File:Mini NabBot (Activated).gif]]
If used again, it will deactivate again: [[File:Mini NabBot (Deactivating).gif]] [[File:Mini NabBot.gif]] The following players have '''received''' the item: For designing the item: * {{Character|Juh Mong}}, creator of the item, winner of the fansite's item contest. For contributing to the fansite: * {{Character|Galarzaa Fidera}}, fansite administrator and developer. * {{Character|Nezune}}, co-creator. * {{Character|Tschas}}, development contributor. * {{Character|Sayuri Nowan}}, fansite helper. * {{Character|Callie Aena}}, graphic designer. * {{Character|Trollefar}}, Administrator of [[TibiaData]], which provided services to [[NabBot]]. * {{Character|Dev Zimm}}, collaboration with the fansite. * {{Character|Toehider}}, collaboration with the fansite. For winning fansite contests: * {{Character|Hojkk}} - winner of the Draw NabBot Contest. * {{Character|Fire Draggon}} - winner of the Tibia Movie Awards 2020, Vocation Guide category. * {{Character|Griggi}} - winner of the Craft NabBot Contest. This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were: * {{Character|Pappa Fox}} ([[Kalibra]]) * {{Character|Benja Tankowiek}} ([[Solidera]]) * {{Character|Eat My Arrow}} ([[Marbera]])
sounds: {{Sound List|I am the first mini NabBot prototype, at least the first one that works properly.|Too many questions, too many answers.|Congrats ''Player'' on getting that level! Maybe you can solo rats now?|That's what you get ''Player'', for messing with that monster!|''Player'' got a level? Here, have a cookie!}}
flavortext: It is the first NabBot prototype of service. Awarded by NabBot.xyz.

name: Mini NabBot (Activated)
notes:
It is an activated [[Mini NabBot]].
It will remain in this form until used again: [[File:Mini NabBot (Deactivating).gif]] [[File:Mini NabBot.gif]]
\nIf used again, it will activate again: [[File:Mini NabBot (Activating).gif]] [[File:Mini NabBot (Activated).gif]]
flavortext: It is the first NabBot prototype of service. Awarded by NabBot.xyz.

name: Minotaur Skull
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].

name: Mirror Mask
notes: Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].
flavortext: It is composed of many small shards.

name: Monolith of the Planes Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Monolith of the Planes}} [[Monolith of the Planes]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a monolith of the planes... hopefully you know what you are doing.

droppedby: Brain Head | The Brainstealer | The Dread Maiden | The Fear Feaster | The Pale Worm | The Unwelcome | Unaz the Mean | Vok the Freakish

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

flavortext: It bears the seal of the AVIN.

name: Mysterious Package (CGB)
flavortext: It bears the seal of the CGB.

name: Mysterious Package (TBI)
flavortext: It bears the seal of the TBI.

name: Mysterious Thing
notes:
This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Voodoo Doll]], a [[Voodoo Doll (2543)]], a [[Voodoo Doll (3613)]], a [[Voodoo Doll (5261)]] and a [[Test Voodoo Doll]].

name: Mystery Box
notes:
Using a mystery box will give you a chance of getting one of the following items: 
*{{Ilink|Blood of the Mountain (Item)}} [[Blood of the Mountain (Item)|Blood of the Mountain]]
*{{Ilink|Heart of the Mountain (Item)}} [[Heart of the Mountain (Item)|Heart of the Mountain]]

Obtained in [[Cults of Tibia Quest]].
flavortext: There is something inside this box. A light scent of magic envelops it.

name: Narsai's List
notes: It looks the same as a [[Crude Primitive Printout]], [[Rita's Letter]], a [[Ransom Note]], a [[Sheet of Paper]], a [[Sheet of Tracing Paper (Full)]], [[Shimun's List]], [[Tefrit's List]], a [[Torn Out Page]] and [[Yonan's List]].\nPart of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].
flavortext: needed ingredients: ten bottles of cactus milk, two pieces of crocodile leather and five jars of palm honey.

name: Net (Fishing)
buyfrom: Ahmet, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Maro, Maun, Lubo, Nezil, Perod, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zora
notes:
Looks the same as [[Tarantula Trap]] and [[Hyaena Trap]].
\nPart of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]] and the [[Grimvale Quest|Grimvale Quest - An Ancient Feud]].
Can be used to fish for [[Calamary (Item)]] and at times you can also catch a [[Small Tortoise]].
Can be used on a [[Cave Rat]] to get a [[Cave Rat (Item)]].
flavortext: It is roughly woven.

name: Nightshade Distillate
notes: Part of the [[Grimvale Quest]].

name: Nilsor's Waterskin (Filled)
notes:

name: Noble Cape

name: Note About Two Souls
notes:
This item can be obtained by using [[The Cobra Amulet]] on an [[Intricate Cobra Shrine]] located inside a hidden crypt north of [[Ankrahmun]]. The crypt can be accessed by using a [[Shovel]] {{Mapper Coords|text=here|129.77|127.119|7|4|1|0.250.25}}. When this item was released, its creator [[Lionet]] {{post|38769695|explained}} what's behind its story:

:''I really appreciate the interest of the Tibia Community in our lore and stories! Here are some additional notes on my story of Scarlett and Galthen:''

:''The Cobra amulet is an extremely powerful artifact with an unknown origin as of now. Its traits are concentrated on a single individual but the curse will affect all things directly connected to the amulet and its wearer. When the amulet is returned to its eternal resting place, everything the taker, thus owner, of the amulet has experienced from that point in time onward will be undone. All of this, as already mentioned, will only affect events in direct relation to the bearer of the amulet and the bearer him- or herself.''

:''In the case of Scarlett and Galthen, Scarlett was blinded towards Galthen while in turn a successful search for Scarlett was impeded by the amulet. Returning it to its resting place will alter the timeline for Scarlett (and also Galthen who is directly connected to the Scarlett, the amulet and ultimately the curse). So in their world, the events after the crypt never took place. Everything before that will still have happened. However, without the power of the Cobra, Scarlett will not continue the assassin path much further and she, as well as Galthen, will have the possibility to find each other. Both their searches would eventually be successful as they belong together.''

:''By chosing to return the amulet, players are effectively building a somewhat happy ending for the two but will lose the amulet. That is why the note says: "You are truly selfless".''
history: This item could not be equipped as an amulet until [[Updates/12.20.9066|November 19, 2019]], when it was changed.
flavortext: Returning the amulet of the Cobra to its resting place has reversed everything that happened to Scarlett and Galthen after it was taken. For them only, however. You are truly selfless.

name: Old Map
notes: The full map that was put together from its 4 [[Part of an Old Map|pieces]].\nObtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
history:
Although this item was implemented with [[Updates/11.02|Update 11.02]], it was only obtainable after [[Updates/11.40|Update 11.40]].
\nWith [[Updates/11.80|Update 11.80]], its name was changed from ''old map'' to ''ancient map'', and it got a description. In a patch soon after it, the item name and description was changed again.
flavortext: Supposedly it shows the way to a hidden fairy treasure.

name: Moonlight Ipomea's Stamen
notes:
It can be harvested from a {{Ilink|Moonlight Ipomea}} [[Moonlight Ipomea]] in [[Oskayaat]] during a Full Moon {{Mapper Coords|129.64|128.176|5|8|text=here}}.
After completing {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|Paradise Lost}} it can be used to access the room under Oskayaat's [[Bright Sun Beacon]] / [[Full Moon Beacon]] {{Mapper Coords|128.243|128.199|8|8|text=here}} by using it on the [[twines]] between the [[Symbol of Fire]] and [[Symbol of Sula (Silver)]]. '''Note: this will consume the Moonlight Ipomea's Stamen, however you can get one once every Full Moon.''' Within this room, you will find a [[Treasure Chest (Oskayaat)]]. Opening the chest presents an opportunity to obtain a [[Werewolf Painting (Howling)]], [[Werewolf Painting (Moon)]], among other assorted items. For detailed information on the likelihood of obtaining each item, see [[Treasure Chest (Oskayaat)/Statistics]].

name: Orichalcum Pearl
droppedby: Betrayed Wraith | Broken Shaper | Dark Torturer | Death Priest | Emerald Tortoise | Fury | Grim Reaper | Grynch Clan Goblin | Massacre | Memory of a Shaper | Razzagorn | Twisted Shaper | Foam Stalker | Venerable Foam Stalker
notes:
Has special properties that enables them to be used for magical methods of travel, which can only be utilised by [[Premium]] players, however. Looks the same as the [[White Pearl]]. It's suggested to always have a few of these in your backpack.
\nYou need to complete the ''Astral Portals'' mission in [[The Explorer Society Quest]] to be able to buy and use them.
Lets you travel from [[Port Hope]] to [[Northport]] (near [[Carlin]]) or back. The same applies for [[Liberty Bay]] to [[Svargrond]]. Also needed to use the teleports in the [[Knightwatch Tower]] after you complete the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]].
Can be obtained from the [[Pits of Inferno Quest]] and from [[Gooey Mass]]es.

name: Ornamented Ankh
notes: Looks the same as the [[Ceremonial Ankh]].\nTrade this item for a [[Damaged Helmet]] (part of [[Helmet of the Ancients]]).
flavortext: This ancient relic shows signs of untold age. It seems to be rotting rapidly.

name: Ornamented Shield
notes: Valued mostly as decoration for its beauty, this shield was one of the few remaining respawn quests. It is now in the same bag as the crystal key.\nObtainable from [[Ornamented Shield Quest]].
history: The sprite of this shield was changed during [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]]. Before that, it looked like this: [[File:Ornamented Shield (Old).gif|Old Sprite]]
flavortext: Many gems sparkle on the shield.

name: Oven Spatula
notes: Can be found in most cities, particularly in castles or taverns.

name: Pair of Soft Boots
notes:
Obtained through the [[Pits of Inferno Quest]]. When the boots get completely used, they become a pair of [[Worn Soft Boots]].

These [[boots]] increase your [[Mana]] and [[Hitpoints]] [[Regeneration]] for 240 minutes (4 hours) by the rate of 3 [[HP]] and 12 [[Mana|MP]] per 6 seconds (0.5 [[HP]] and 2 [[Mana|MP]] / s), which means they recover 28800 [[Mana|MP]] and 7200 [[HP]] in total (for all vocations). Very useful when hunting or making runes, specially in [[Resting Area|resting areas]] as health and mana gained are also doubled (6 HP and 24 mana every 6 seconds) if the reward streak is 6 or higher. As a higher level option for hunts, [[Void Boots]] have the same regeneration bonus with added armor and speed.

Results of four hours of regeneration with Soft Boots:
{{{!}}class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;"
{{!}}-
! !! D/S !! ED/MS !! K !! EK !! P !! RP
{{!}}-
{{!}} style="color:red" {{!}} Health (Boots only)
{{!}} colspan="6" {{!}} 7200
{{!}}-
{{!}} style="color:#6698FF" {{!}} Mana (Boots only)
{{!}} colspan="6" {{!}} 28800
{{!}}-
{{!}} style="color:red" {{!}} Health (Food + Boots)
{{!}} colspan="2" {{!}} 8400 {{!}}{{!}} 9600 {{!}}{{!}} 10800 {{!}}{{!}} 9000 {{!}}{{!}} 9600
{{!}}-
{{!}} style="color:#6698FF" {{!}} Mana (Food + Boots)
{{!}} 38400 {{!}}{{!}} 43200 {{!}}{{!}} colspan="2" {{!}} 33600 {{!}}{{!}} 36000 {{!}}{{!}} 38400
{{!}}}

When a promoted [[mage]] is using Soft Boots and regenerating [[Mana]] by eating [[Food]] at the same time, they can make 129 [[SD]]s, 171 [[Magic Wall]]s, 324 [[GFB]]s or [[Avalanche (Rune)|Avalanche]]s, 470 [[Icicle (Rune)|Icicle]]s, 108 [[Ultimate Healing Rune|UH]]s, or 1230 [[HMM]]s during the 4 hours that the boots last. This is profitable for [[Druid]]s making [[Icicle (Rune)|Icicle]]s, taking into consideration the boots' recharging cost. It can also profitable for [[Sorcerer]]s to make [[SD]]s, depending on the [[SD]] price on the server. This provides a cost effective way of mana training. A promoted [[Paladin]] can make a total of 109 [[Enchanted Spear]]s if they are eating while using Soft Boots. Knights also use these when they hunt weaker creatures, as they only need [[Healing Spells|Spells]] to heal, or to reduce [[Mana Potion]] usage when hunting stronger creatures, such as [[dragon]]s and [[dragon lord]]s, or when blocking. When combined with [[life Ring]] or [[Ring of Healing]], making [[runes]] or [[Enchanted Spear]]s becomes even faster, allowing players to mana train more effectively and create a greater number of items.

A pair can be seen in [[Santa's House]] on [[Vega]]. Soft Boots look the same as [[Boots of Waterwalking]].

See the [[Money Spent per Mana Point|GP/MP]], [[Money Spent per Hit Point|GP/HP]], [[Capacity Taken per Mana Point|Cap/MP]] and [[Capacity Taken per Hit Point|Cap/HP]] efficiency tables for more information.
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.1|Christmas Update 2002]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.9|Christmas Update 2006]].\n}}\n<noinclude>[[Category:Regenerative Items]]</noinclu

name: Panpipes
droppedby: Arctic Faun | Dark Faun | Faun | Memory of a Faun | Raxias | Vashresamun
notes: [[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]].\nObtained from the [[Panpipe Quest]].

name: Parcel
buyfrom: Auron, Benjamin, Chemar, Chrystal, Dove, Elgar, Ezean, Fyodor, Gnomailion, Herbert, Jakahr, Kaya, Liane, Lokur, Murim, Nelly, Ninos, Olrik, Ray, Redward, Robson:15, Rock In A Hard Place, Wally
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Package of Potions]] and a [[Parcel (Watchtower)]].
Price is 10 [[gp]] if the [[Postman Quest]] has been completed, 15 gp otherwise. To send a parcel it must have a [[label]] in it with the name of the receiver written on the first row, and then placed on a [[mailbox]]. Once a parcel is sent, it is stamped [[Image:Stamped Parcel.gif]] and can no longer be sent through the mail; however, these used (stamped) parcels are widely used as ''ladders'' by stacking 3 of these to reach higher places that otherwise can be reached only by using the [[Instant Spells|spell]] [[Levitate]]. The weight is increased to 18.10 [[oz]] with the [[label]] in it that is required to send it. {{seealso|Mailbox|Sending Parcels}}.

name: Parchment
notes:
This is the fixed version of [[Parchment (Rewritable)]] which can be bought from some NPCs and is dropped by some creatures.
It looks the same as [[Intelligence Reports]], a [[Lottery Ticket (Blank)]], a [[Nomad Parchment]], an [[Old Parchment]], a [[Parchment (Rewritable)]] and [[The Peacock Ballad]].
{{seealso|Parchment (Rewritable)|Parchment (Yellow)}}

It is most likely not yet obtainable in game. Probably just a decoration piece with no magical powers. It has what appears to be an ape's paw on it. Its data can be seen in the [[Market]].<gallery position="center" style="text-align:center" captionalign="center" mode="nolines">PawAmulet.png|Paw Amulet</gallery>

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Can be obtained by [[skinning]] the corpse of a [[Behemoth]].
50 of these are needed for the [[Barbarian Outfits Quest]].
100 of these are needed for the [[Knight Outfits Quest]].
One of these is required to obtain the [[Toothfairy Assistant]] achievement during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
flavortext: Collectors all around the world crave for this item.

name: Pharaoh Sword
notes: Bares some similarity to a [[Giant Sword]], its graphic also having a similar shape and design. However, it is weaker than a Giant Sword but also [[One-Handed|one-handed]]. It would be a good weapon for players to use, if it was not one of the more elusive [[Pharaoh Rares]], especially due to the fact [[Dipthrah]] is one of the harder [[Pharaohs]]. It can be seen on the counter near [[Ormuhn]] in [[Ankrahmun]].

name: Phoenix Egg
notes: This egg can be used to reduce the cost of [[The Spark of the Phoenix]] blessing by 10% of its cost. You must have completed [[The Paradox Tower Quest]] for this to work. Carrying additional eggs will not further reduce the cost. Also note that you can use it more than once, you don't lose it when you buy the [[blessing]]. It can't be eaten like normal [[Egg]]s.\nReward from the [[Paradox Tower Quest]]. Can also be obtained from [[Surprise Nest]]s.
history: The sprite changed with [[Updates/10.7]].
flavortext: It seems to be burning from inside.

name: Phoenix Shield
droppedby: Ferumbras | Furyosa | Mahrdis | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Time Guardian | Ferumbras Mortal Shell

history:
Since it was very rarely dropped only by [[Mahrdis]], [[Ferumbras]], and [[Furyosa]], it was not a common item. With the introduction of [[The Time Guardian]], it lost its very rare status.

droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Frazzlemaw | Guzzlemaw | Memory of a Frazzlemaw | Plaguesmith | The Handmaiden | Weakened Frazzlemaw
notes: Has no practical use. In older days it was rumored that [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] made swords out of pieces of iron, e.g. a [[Warlord Sword]] for 100 pieces of iron. There are spawns of piece(s) of iron in [[Kazordoon]], [[Lost Mines]], [[Thais Troll Cave]], [[Serpentine Tower]] ([[White Pearl Quest]] room inside barel), [[Amazon Camp (Venore)|Amazon Camp]] and possible more. It wasn't possible to stack them back in the day, but now it's possible. Yet to this day so many people just throw them away.
