name: Pitchfork
notes:
Has no known practical uses. There also exists a [[Small Pitchfork]].
\nLooks the same as the [[Farmer's Avenger]].

\nCan be found at daily spawns on the third floor of the barn in [[Rookgaard]], {{Mapper Coords|125.83|125.185|7|text=here}} and in the [[Mintwallin]] storage room.

name: Plate
buyfrom: Ahmet, Bashira, Bertha, Chephan, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Maro, Perod, Red Lilly, Sarina, Zora
notes: Plates can be found in most [[Hometown|cities]] of [[Tibia]]. Also obtainable from the [[Present Quest]] on Rookgaard.

name: Plate Armor
droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Ancient Scarab | Behemoth | Black Knight | Bonebeast | Brutus Bloodbeard | Crystal Spider | Cursed Ape | Deadeye Devious | Destroyer | Dreadbeast | Giant Spider | Giant Spider (Nostalgia) | Hairman the Huge | High Templar Cobrass | Kongra | Lethal Lissy | Lizard Templar | Loricate Orger | Lucifuga Aranea | Memory of a Pirate | Memory of a Scarab | Naga Warrior | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Leader | Orc Warlord | Pirate Buccaneer | Quara Pincher Scout | Ron the Ripper | Sacred Spider | The Snapper | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | Valkyrie | Warlord Ruzad
buyfrom: Azil, Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Cornelia, Esrik, Flint, Hardek, Kroox, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Willard, Yanni
sellto: Azil, Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Cornelia, Esrik, Flint, H.L.: 110, Hardek, Kroox, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Willard, Yanni
notes:
This armor is used by mostly all players in lower levels, because it's easy to get and provides good defense. It is the next armor to get after [[Scale Armor]].
\nFor a mage, the more suitable armor with same defense is a [[Mammoth Fur Cape]]. [[Knight]]s should save for a [[Noble Armor|noble]] or [[Knight Armor|knight armor]]. [[Paladin]]s should buy a [[Belted Cape]] which has the same defense but is much lighter. This can also be gotten by [[Rust Remover|unrusting]] a [[Heavily Rusted Armor]], [[Rusted Armor]] or [[Slightly Rusted Armor]].\nCan be obtained in the [[Plate Armor Quest]].

name: Plate Legs
droppedby: Bibby Bloodbath | Bog Raider | Countess Sorrow | Dragon | Ghastly Dragon | Giant Spider | Grand Mother Foulscale | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Leader | Orc Warlord | Renegade Orc | Sea Serpent | The Snapper | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | Warlord Ruzad
sellto: Aldo, Azil, Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Cornelia, Esrik, Flint, Hardek, Kroox, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Willard, Yanni
notes: These legs are used by most low level [[Tibia]]ns. They can also be obtained by removing the rust from [[Heavily Rusted Legs]], [[Rusted Legs]] and [[Slightly Rusted Legs]]. They are part of the [[Plate Set]] and useful to all [[vocation]]s at a low level.

name: Platinum Amulet
droppedby: Angry Demon | Arachnophobica | Black Vixen | Brimstone Bug | Burster Spectre | Crystal Spider | Darkfang | Demon | Demon Outcast | Druid's Apparition | Energuardian of Tales | Enlightened of the Cult | Ferumbras | Ghazbaran | Giant Spider | Hand of Cursed Fate | Hemming | Latrivan | Lich | Mamma Longlegs | Memory of a Shaper | Morgaroth | Nightstalker | Orshabaal | Rage Squid | Sharpclaw | Spitter | Sulphur Scuttler | The Hungerer | The Old Widow | Twisted Shaper | Vexclaw | Vile Grandmaster | Werebadger | Werefox | Werewolf
notes: Reward in [[Behemoth Quest]].
flavortext: It is an amulet of protection.

name: Platinum Coin
notes:
One Platinum Coin is worth 100 [[Gold Coin]]s. For more information, read the [[Currency]] page.
{{Seealso|List of Creatures That Drop Platinum Coins}}
100 of them can be obtained from [[The Desert Dungeon Quest]], [[The Paradox Tower Quest]], [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]], [[The Queen of the Banshees Quest]], and the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]], 80 from the [[A Father's Burden Quest]], 60 from the [[Spirithunters Quest]], 52 from [[The Explorer Society Quest]], 50 from the [[Arito's Task Quest]] and the [[Nomads Land Quest]], 41 from [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]], 25 from the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]], 22 from the [[Uneasy Alliance Quest]], 20 from the [[Pilgrimage of Ashes Quest]] and the [[To Appease the Mighty Quest]], 13 from the [[Braindeath Quest]], 11 from the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]], 10 from the [[An Interest In Botany Quest]], the [[Frost Dragon Quest]], [[The Ultimate Booze Quest]], the [[To Blind the Enemy Quest]], and the [[Venore Daily Tasks Quest]], 6 from the [[Green Djinn Quest]], 5 from the [[Fishing Box Quest]], the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]], and the [[Ornamented Shield Quest]], and 2 from the [[Berserk Potion Quest]], the [[Lion Trophy Quest]], and the [[Troll Sabotage Quest]]. 10 of them are a possible reward in the [[Liquid Black Quest]] if all requirements are met. In addition, 20 of them can be obtained for every successful trip in the [[A Pirate's Death to Me]] world task. A maximum of 60 can be obtained from [[Piggy Bank]]s. 5 of them can be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s and 1 from [[Shiny Stone]]s.
{{Seealso|Gnomish Supply Package/Statistics|Shiny Stone/Refining Statistics}}

name: Poem Scroll
notes:
To get this item mention 'Love Poem' to [[Elvith]].
Looks the same as a [[Lottery Ticket]] and a [[Scroll (TBI)]].\nPart of the [[The Shattered Isles Quest]].
flavortext: It contains a love poem, written by an unknown elven poet.

name: Poison Arrow
droppedby: Arthom the Hunter | Dawnfly | Dworc Venomsniper | Elf Scout | Exotic Cave Spider | Giant Spider | Giant Spider (Nostalgia) | Hunter | Necromancer | Necromancer Servant | Omruc | Poacher | Troll-Trained Salamander
notes:
Causes physical damage. When a target is injured by the arrow it will be poisoned for 33 turns (4 seconds per turn). Poison damage starts at 3 HP for 4 turns, followed by 9 turns with 2 HP and 20 turns with 1 HP each, which adds up to 50 HP over a period of 2 minutes and 12 seconds.

An article from Tibianews, published on October 21, 2007, suggested that the attack rate for Poison Arrow is 22. Previously it has been believed that the attack rate is 20.

Can be obtained in [[Rookgaard]] through the [[Minotaur Hell Quest]]. Also obtainable in [[Dragon Tower Quest]], [[Poison Daggers Quest]] and [[Dead Archer Quest]].
history: Before the [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]] it was possible to create 7 of these using the [[Conjure Poisoned Arrow]] Spell.

name: Poison Dagger
droppedby: Banshee | Dworc Fleshhunter | Dworc Venomsniper | Dworc Voodoomaster | Elder Mummy | Memory of a Banshee | Mummy | Oodok Witchmaster | Orc Warrior | Putrid Mummy | Sun-Marked Goanna | Thalas | Warlock | Zarabustor
notes:
Since the [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]], this dagger causes [[earth]] damage, which does 1 damage each turn and lasts approximately 1 turn for every 10 damage done to the creature. The harder the hit, the longer the creature is poisoned.
\nSince the [[Updates/8.2|2008 Summer Update]] this dagger shows a physical attack value of 16 plus an additional +2 in [[earth]] damage when you look at it. It still does the same poison damage as described above though.
A few of those still remain in [[Rookgaard]] on a few [[world]]s since they were once lootable from [[Minotaur]]s.

name: Post Horn
notes:
[[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]].
\nIt looks the same as [[Waldo's Post Horn]] and [[The Horn of Sundering]].\nObtained from the [[Postman Quest]].
flavortext: It's property of the Postmaster's Guild and only rewarded to loyal members.

name: Post Officer's Hat
notes:
Sometimes used as decoration.\nItem obtained in the [[Postman Quest]].
\nAlso useful during the [[Thieves Guild Quest]], if you are an Archpostman.
flavortext: This hat is the insignia of all Tibian post officers.

name: Pot
droppedby: Memory of an Ogre | Ogre Brute
notes:
These can be found throughout [[Hometown|cities]] of [[Tibia]].
It looks the same as a [[Clay Pot]].
history: Before Winter Update 2007 players used these strategically in war, as it is the only item that a player could carry but not walk over, until the [[Updates/8.1|Update 8.1]]. Therefore they were used in wars but not anymore, since you can walk over them now. Although you can carry fluids in them, this item is rarely used to carry fluids.

name: Potted Flower
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
buyfrom: Azalea, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Florentine, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nienna, Nydala, Peggy, Rose, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: It is used as decoration.

name: Powder Herb
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Its flavour resembles of [[Wikipedia:Curry|curry]], according to [[Jean Pierre]]. It can be found in [[Green Claw Swamp|Venore Swamps]].
\nYou need one of these to make a dish on the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Power Arrow
notes: This [[item]] was deleted from the game and replaced with the [[Power Bolt]] sometime before the 7.0 client.

name: Power Bolt
droppedby: Annihilon | Betrayed Wraith | Broodrider Inferniarch | Demodras | Dragon Lord | Elder Wyrm | Frost Dragon | General Murius | Kalyassa | Nightmare | Omruc | Serpent Spawn | Undead Dragon | Wyvern
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes:
Very useful for hunting strong creatures with a blocker, since you can stay at a good range (depends on your [[Crossbows|Crossbow]]).
\nCan be obtained from the [[Power Bolts Quest]] and the [[Formorgar Mine Quest]]. 100 of these can also be obtained by clearing the Scrapper Arena during the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]].
history:
Once the most powerful bolt, but was superseded in the [[Updates/7.9|2006 Winter Update]], when [[Infernal Bolt]]s were implemented.

Before the [[Updates/Update 8.0|Summer Update 2007]] it looked different from now. It looked like this: [[File:Power_Bolt_(old).gif]]. You can now buy it from [[NPCs]] for 7 [[gp]], but before you could only loot it from some [[Creatures]], buy it from players or conjure 10 for 800 mana with the old [[Conjure Power Bolt]] spell.

Before the [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], [[Royal Paladin]]s could conjure 10 of these using the spell [[Conjure Power Bolt]]. The spell has now been removed.

name: Power Ring
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Cursed Ape | Dark Monk | Fernfang | Grorlam | Hairman the Huge | Kongra | Memory of an Ogre | Monk (Creature) | Museum Stone Golem | Ogre Brute | Stone Golem | The Handmaiden
notes: Power Rings increase the [[Fist Fighting]] skill by four points, for 30 minutes. One can be obtained in the [[Power Ring Quest]]. One can be obtained in the [[Panpipe Quest]]. One is required for the [[Bright Sword Quest]].
history: This ring used to increase [[Fist Fighting]] skill by six points. It was reduced to four points only after the [[Monk Vocation Update]].

name: Present
buyfrom: Ahmet, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Lubo, Maun, Maro, Nezil, Nienna, Perod, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Valentina, Zora
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Present (Postman)]], a [[Present (Explosive)]] and a [[Reward Box]].
Presents are good for delivering gifts to friends. Obtainable on Rookgaard in [[Present Quest]].
Obtainable in [[The Annihilator Quest]].
Obtainable in [[Barbarian Arena Quest]].
history: Before a certain [[update]], presents looked like this: [[File:Present Box (Old).gif]]

name: Protection Amulet
droppedby: Brutus Bloodbeard | Burster Spectre | Cobra Assassin | Countess Sorrow | Cursed Ape | Cursed Book | Enlightened of the Cult | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Grandfather Tridian | Hairman the Huge | Hand of Cursed Fate | Ink Blob | Kongra | Latrivan | Lethal Lissy | Massive Earth Elemental | Nightstalker | Orc Warlord | Orshabaal | Tzumrah the Dazzler | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | Ushuriel | Valkyrie | Warlord Ruzad | Werehyaena Shaman | Zomba | Shrieking Cry-Stal
notes: Reduces [[Physical Damage]] by exactly 6%, rounded '''up''' to the nearest whole number.

name: Pumpkin
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
buyfrom: Alissa, Ariella, Bonifacius, Brasith, Imalas, Jezzara, Livielle, Omur, Serafin, Sherry McRonald
notes:
It can be carved into a [[Pumpkinhead]]. {{Ilink|Pumpkinhead}} To do this, use a [[Kitchen Knife]], [[Whacking Driller of Fate]], or [[Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness]] on it. After carving, you can use the [[Pumpkinhead]] on a [[Candlestick]] to transform it into a [[Pumpkinhead (Lit)|Jack-o'-lantern]]. {{Ilink|Pumpkinhead (Lit)}}
Pumpkins give the lowest regeration value (per [[oz]].) of any fruit in Tibia.\nOne of these is needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Pumpkinhead
notes: It is a [[Pumpkin]] that was carved out with a [[Kitchen Knife]]. To do this, use a [[Kitchen Knife]], [[Whacking Driller of Fate]], or [[Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness]] on it. After carving, you can use the [[Pumpkinhead]] on a [[Candlestick]] to transform it into a [[Pumpkinhead (Lit)|Jack-o'-lantern]] to provide a bit of light. {{Ilink|Pumpkinhead (Lit)}}\n\nThere is a chance to obtain a [[Pumpkinhead]] when skinning the [[Slain Mutated Pumpkin]] within its portal.

name: Purple Tapestry
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Velvet, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Tapestries]] for more information about other types and colors of tapestries.

name: Purple Tome
droppedby: Angry Demon | Demon | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Rage Squid
notes: One of the 5 volumes of [[The Mystic Secrets of Tibia]]. You cannot write in it.Obtainable through the [[Purple Tome Quest]].
flavortext: It's a volume of The Mystic Secrets of Tibia.

name: Ornamented Axe
notes: Wyrms dropped them for a short period of time 2 months after the summer update of 2008, then wyrms ceased dropping it.Even though this axe can be seen around on various servers nowadays it became somewhat rare because only [[Ferumbras]] and [[Ferumbras Mortal Shell]] drops it today.

name: Orshabaal's Brain
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Used for decoration purposes only, it is quite rare, as it is only dropped by the [[Demon Lord]], [[Orshabaal]].

name: Package of Potions
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Parcel]] and a [[Parcel (Watchtower)]].
Reward from [[Rest in Hallowed Ground Quest]].
flavortext: It contains 5 health and 5 mana potions.

name: Pair of Earmuffs
droppedby: Ice Witch | Melting Frozen Horror | Yakchal | Zushuka
notes:
A rather rare item just used for [[decoration]]. Not recommended to sell to [[NPC]]s.\n
Can be obtained from an [[Unrealized Dream]].
history: After [[Updates/8.4|Update 8.4]], it gives +2% [[Ice damage]] protection.
flavortext: They feel nice and warm on your ears.

name: Paladin Armor
droppedby: Annihilon | Bog Raider | Terofar | Weakened Shlorg | Zavarash | Zulazza the Corruptor
notes: This can be obtained by [[Rust Remover|unrusting]] a [[Rusted Armor]].

name: Parcel (Watchtower)
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Parcel]] and a [[Package of Potions]].
Temporarily obtained in the [[Tower Defence Quest]] from [[Bunny Bonecrusher]].
flavortext: It is the parcel for the watchtower on the Femor Hills.

name: Parchment (Roses)
notes:
This item can be obtained by using an [[Inkwell]] on a [[Blank Poetry Parchment]]. It looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Blood)]], a [[Parchment (Carnage)]], a [[Parchment (Excellent)]], a [[Parchment (Mud)]], a [[Parchment (Sugar)]], a [[Parchment (Violets)]], a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].
Used in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: It says 'Roses are red...'.

name: Part of a Jester Doll (Left Arm)
notes: This is part of the [[Jester Doll]].
flavortext: It seems to be the left arm.

name: Part of a Jester Doll (Left Leg)
notes: This is part of the [[Jester Doll]].
flavortext: It seems to be the left leg.

name: Part of a Jester Doll (Right Arm)
notes: This is part of the [[Jester Doll]].
flavortext: It seems to be the right arm.

name: Part of a Jester Doll (Right Leg)
notes: This is part of the [[Jester Doll]].
flavortext: It seems to be the right leg.

name: Party Cake
notes:
Made with oven and [[Lump of Cake Dough]]. You can't eat it (you have to blow out the candle first).
It looks the same as an [[Odd Hat]].
'''How to make a Party Cake''' To make a ''Party Cake'', you need... [[Flour]] (can be obtained by harvesting [[wheat]] in a millstone)
[[Milk]]
[[Oven]]
Any kind of [[Fruit]]
[[Knife (utensil)]]
[[Candlestick]]
1. Get the milk into a [[trough]] or [[bucket]].
2. Use flour with milk. You will get [[Lump of Cake Dough|cake dough]].
3. Use the cake dough with an oven. You will get a [[cake]].
4. Use the knife on a [[fruit]] (check table of fruits you may use [[Cooking#Fruits for Decorated Cake and Fruit Juice|here]]) while having the cake in your [[backpack]]. If you've done this correctly, there will now be red decorations on your cake, forming a [[Decorated Cake|decorated cake]].
5. Put the cake on a surface and drop a [[Candlestick]] onto it.
Voila! A perfect ''Party Cake''.

{{clear}} Blow the candle out on 5 of these to obtain the [[Make a Wish]] [[achievement]].
flavortext: It is nicely decorated with fruits, icing and a candle. Someone is caring about you.

name: Party Hat
notes:
Introduced during [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]] where they were easily obtained using [[Surprise Bag]]s that were looted from many monsters and then again during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Also given away by [[Ned Nobel]].
When the hat is equipped on the helmet slot, it will let loose confetti over when used.
Could be bought from [[Stan]] only during [[Masquerade Day]]s.
Use it 200 times while wearing it to get the achievement [[Party Animal]].

name: Party Trumpet
notes:
[[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]]. Curiously, the inactive and the activated (playing) party trumpet are different items. You can add one or the other, or both to the [[Quick Looting|loot lists]].
It can be obtained by using a [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|Blue Surprise Bag]].
notes2: Use it 200 times to get the achievement [[Party Animal]].

name: Patched Boots
notes:
They can be seen in the [[Treasure Rooms#Amazon Camp Treasure Room|Amazon Camp Treasure Room]]. The name, weight and armor came up when trading to the NPC [[Rashid]] and can be seen in the [[Market]] and [[Cyclopedia]]. It's still [[Unobtainable Items|unknown]] how to obtain this item.

Amazon Camp Treasure Room.gif
| 1 = Patched Boots at Amazon Camp Treasure Room
</gallery></noinclude>

name: Peanut
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Enraged Squirrel | Grynch Clan Goblin | Mutated Human | Squirrel | Thieving Squirrel
notes:
Semi-rare food which is very valuable in the month of August, since it's used for a quest.
\nTwo are required for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Peg Leg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Pirate Buccaneer | Pirate Corsair | Pirate Cutthroat | Pirate Marauder
notes: \n100 of these are needed for the first addon of [[Pirate Outfits]].

name: Petrified Scream
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
One of these is needed for [[The Cursed Crystal Quest]].
5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Reap]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Piece of a Broken Amulet (Hanger)
notes: It is one of the [[Piece of a Broken Amulet|pieces]] of [[Koshei's Ancient Amulet]].\nPart of the [[Koshei the Deathless Quest]]. It can be found in a [[Stone Coffin]] on the third floor underground of the [[Dark Pyramid]], in the far northeastern part of [[Darama]] ([http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}130.26,126.22,10,3,1,1 here]). After delivering all four pieces of the amulet (and 5000 [[gp]]) to [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] he can give you the complete [[Koshei's Ancient Amulet|amulet]] after waiting for 24 hours in real-time.

name: Piece of Cactus
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A part of a [[Sun Adorer Cactus]].\nItem temporally obtained in [[The Ice Islands Quest]].
flavortext: It has been cut from the sun adorer cactus which is said to have curing abilities.

name: Piece of Crocodile Leather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 20 of these are needed during the [[Glooth Factory Quest]].

name: Piece of Dead Brain
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Brain Squid | Braindeath | Rage Squid | Squid Warden
notes: 5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Vampirism]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Piece of Hellfire Armor
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Piece of Massacre's Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

It's the special item from Thais.
Item need in ''Searoutes around Yalahar'' mission of [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

droppedby: Dwarf Soldier | Elder Forest Fury | Forest Fury | General Murius | Minotaur Archer | The Horned Fox
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard

name: Pig Foot
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Pigeon Trophy
notes:
[[File:Pigeontropgy.jpg|thumb]] You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.
This item can only be gotten by winning a contest hosted or sponsored by [[TibiaML]].
It was created by {{character|Goldstorm}} for [[TibiaML]]'s [[Item Design Contest]] where he won and was the first person to receive this item.
Its replica is the [[Pigeon Trophy (Replica)]]. Current owners of this item: * {{character|Fox Mc Cloud}}, the owner of [[TibiaML]]. * {{character|Kash Brus}} in lottery run by [[TibiaML]]. * {{character|Pilux}} for winning the Calmera Movies Competition 2010 hosted by [[TibiaML]]. * {{character|Mounthrize}} from [[Zanera]], for winning the Share it! Contest - Week 10 by [[TibiaML]]. * {{character|Relsiegpk}} for winning TibiaML Talent Hunt 2010. * One trophy also was given to {{character|Glotzer Clelesta}} for programming competition. * And other was recently given to {{character|Mefiles dark hedgod}} from [[Lucera]] for winning the Share it II! Contest. * {{character|Mage Rani}} for the second place in TibiaML's Movie Competition 2013. * Recently one awarded was to {{character|Mari Aloran}} for winning third place in [[TibiaML]]'s Comic Competition 2012.
flavortext: It's a symbol of peace handed out by Tibia ML.

name: Pile of Bones
notes:
This item can be found in several places around [[Tibia]]. There is a daily spawn in the [[Fibula Dungeon]] and there are a lot of these in the [[Alchemist Quarter]] and under the [[Necromant House]]. Looks the same as a recently [[Slain Skeleton|Slain]] [[Skeleton]], but it does not disappear, making it a fine decoration for [[Halloween]]. You cannot equip this item on your backpack slot.
Looks the same as a [[Pile of Bones (Quest)]].

name: Pirate Backpack
droppedby: Brutus Bloodbeard | Deadeye Devious | Lethal Lissy | Memory of a Pirate | Pirate Buccaneer | Pirate Corsair | Ron the Ripper
notes: Part of the [[Pirate Set]], this backpack rarely drops from [[Pirates]] and can be obtained in the [[Waterfall Quest]] and [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]].\n\nSee [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.
history: * Once the second rarest backpack after the [[Backpack of Holding]], its rarity declined with new additions like the [[Demon Backpack]] in the [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]].

name: Pirate Bag
notes:
Value decreased after this bag being obtainable in a [[A Pirate's Death to Me|world task]]. See [[Bag]] for general information regarding bags.
It looks the same as a [[Bag (Ahmet)]], a [[Bag of Smuggled Goods]] and a [[Suspicious Surprise Bag]].\nObtainable in the event "[[A Pirate's Death to Me]]".

name: Pirate Boots
notes:
A part of the [[Pirate Set]]. Price depends a bit on the price of [[Steel Boots]]. On older worlds, such as [[Hiberna]], you can get a full [[Pirate Set]] (including boots) for around 15,000 [[gp]] nowadays. The boots are also slightly better than [[Fur Boots]] despite having the same armor, for not decreasing speed and being lighter.
Looks the same as [[Worn-out Pirate Boots]].\nNeeded for the [[Meriana Quest]].

name: Pirate Hat
notes:
A part of the [[Pirate Set]]. Looks similar to [[Brutus Bloodbeard's Hat]].
Needed for the [[Meriana Quest]]. Can be obtained by completing the [[Waterfall Quest]].

name: Pirate Knee Breeches
notes:
A part of the [[Pirate Set]].
Needed for the [[Meriana Quest]].

name: Pirate Shirt
droppedby: Memory of a Pirate | Pirate Buccaneer
notes:
A part of the [[Pirate Set]].
Looks similar to [[Lethal Lissy's Shirt]].
Needed for the [[Meriana Quest]].

name: Plum
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: \n\n5 of these are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Poet's Fencing Quill
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Mephiles]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. This feather is actually weaker than a [[Sword]]. It cannot be used to break furniture as it has no ''use with'' option.
\nLooks the same as an [[Inkwell]].
\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: This feather is mightier than a sword.

name: Pointed Rabbitslayer
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Dirtbeard]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. It's the lightest [[Melee]] weapon in the game. It can '''not''' be used to break furniture or break through walls.
\nLooks the same as a [[Carrot]] and [[The Carrot of Doom]].
\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: Someone has sharpened this carrot to inflict some nasty damage especially on rabbits.

name: Poison Wall Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[File:Poisoned Icon.gif]] Creates a 1x5 [[Poison Field]] area if shot straight from the body. If shot on an angle, a total of 9 poison field squares will be made spanning 5 sqm vertical and 5 sqm horizontal.
It should not be bought unless you are wishing to own all [[Spells]] as most monsters - especially stronger ones - are immune to [[Earth Damage|earth damage]], making it useless in many situations. However, it might be useful to block a monster from attacking by shooting it in a narrow path. The poison fields will last for 4:08.
\nFor the spell, see [[Poison Wall]].

name: Potato
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crypt Defiler | Gargoyle | Grave Robber | Megasylvan Yselda | Nomad (Basic) | Nomad (Blue) | Nomad (Female)
notes: None.\n30 of these are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Precious Necklace
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Silver Amulet]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].

name: Present (Explosive)
notes:
It is obtainable during April, from the wandering NPC of [[Thais]], [[Hoaxette]]. Alternatively, it can be obtained from [[Unrealized Dream]]s and sometimes from [[Peaceful Pooka]], an NPC at Feyrist.
This item is not a [[containers|container]] and will explode when used.
It looks the same as a [[Present]], a [[Present (Postman)]] and a [[Reward Box]]. Open one to obtain the [[achievement]] [[Joke's on You]].

name: Present (Postman)
notes:
This item is not a [[containers|container]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Present]], a [[Present (Explosive)]] and a [[Reward Box]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Postman Missions Quest]]. DO NOT open it, it will poof and you will have to buy it from other player or from [[Black Bert]].

name: Prison Cell Key
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Crystal Key]].
\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
history: This item used to be called [[Key]], which was confusing because multiple items were called that way. In some update it got renamed to Prison Cell Key.

name: Pure Energy
notes: \nItem obtained in [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].

name: Purple Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Purple Bag
notes: See [[Bag]] for general information regarding bags.

name: Purple Kiss Blossom
notes: Temporarily obtainable during [[The Ice Islands Quest]], can be cut using a [[Kitchen Knife]] on a [[Purple Kiss Bush]].
flavortext: It has been cut from an exotic jungle flower.

name: Quagmire Rod
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Bonelord | Elder Bonelord | Fury | Lizard Snakecharmer
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: Quagmire Rods replaced [[Image:Wooden Wand.gif]] [[Wooden Wand]]s in the [[Updates/7.6|2005 Winter Update]] and were replaced by [[Terra Rod]]s in the [[Updates/8.1|2007 Winter Update]], though the sprite remained the same.
flavortext: It emits clouds of poisonous swamp gas.

name: Ornamented Brooch
notes: Shows which [[blessing]]s you have received, like a [[Ceremonial Ankh]]. Fluctuates in value.

name: Ornate Chestplate
notes: Part of the [[Ornate Set]].

name: Ornate Crossbow
droppedby: Capricious Phantom | Cave Chimera | Deepling Guard | Deepling Master Librarian | Deepling Spellsinger | Deepling Tyrant | Eyeless Devourer | Freakish Lost Soul | Gorerilla | Harpy | Katex Blood Tongue | Melting Frozen Horror | Mould Phantom | Naga Archer | Streaked Devourer | Usurper Archer | Vok the Freakish | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes: A rather cheap crossbow that serves as a good alternative to paladins who cannot yet afford a [[Composite Hornbow]].

name: Ornate Legs
notes: Part of the [[Ornate Set]].

name: Ornate Mace
notes: On most servers, this weapon is very cheap for its level requirement. The closest commonly available clubs would be either the [[Demonbone]] (level 80+) or the [[Obsidian Truncheon]] (level 100+), both of which are dropped by [[Annihilon]] and significantly more expensive. Part of the [[Ornate Set]].

name: Ornate Shield
notes:
At higher levels, this shield is better than the [[Prismatic Shield]], since:
* At higher levels, knights are more likely to have groups of monsters attacking them. Shielding can only block 2 monsters, so any more will not take advantage of the shielding bonus. The physical protection will still apply where the shielding does not.
* [[Blood Rage]] makes a knight defenseless, which in turn makes shielding ineffective.
* It has an imbuing slot.
Part of the [[Ornate Set]].

name: Oven Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct an {{Ilink|Oven}} [[Oven]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct an oven.

name: Painting of a Gozzler
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using an [[Artist's Brush]] on an [[Artist's Easel]].
flavortext: It was painted in the style of Lyxoph. Unfortunately, there are some blue pixels in this piece.

name: Painting of a Muse
notes: It was introduced during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Can be obtained by using an [[Artist's Brush]] on an [[Artist's Easel]].
flavortext: It was painted in the style of Penciljack. Unfortunately, there are some blue pixels in this piece.

name: Panther Head
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Its value can be very high due to the rarity of this item. Mostly used for decoration.

name: Panther Paw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Paralyse Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
[[Paralysis|Paralyses]] target. Any healing spell on the paralyzed target will cancel the effect.
This is a very expensive rune, which can only be created and used by druids. It costs 1400 mana to make, and an additional 1400 mana '''to use it'''. ''[[Convince Creature]] is the only other rune that requires mana to use.'' Many creatures are immune to [[Paralysis]], and any creatures that are [[Self-Healing]] will cancel the paralysis when they heal themselves. Paralyze runes are mostly used in war. Since you can heal only once per step, the paralyze rune will slow down your opponent and allow your team to combo the enemy to death.
This rune was once available for all vocations with magic level 18 and higher to use, however a [[updates|patch]] changed this. It costs 6000 Soul Points per Backpack.
For the spell, see [[Paralyse]].
history: With the release of the [[Updates/12.00|Winter Update 2018]], the cooldown for shooting a Paralysis Rune changed from 2 to 6 seconds.

name: Parchment (White)
notes:
This parchment can be seen behind the developed [[Farmine]] bank counter.
It looks the same as [[Building Plans for a Ship]], a [[Document of the Follower]], a [[Document of the Leader]], a [[Document of the Officer]], an [[Old Parchment (Omrabas)]] and [[Parchment of Dark Knowledge]].

name: Parchment (Yellow)
buyfrom: Ahmet, Bashira, Bertha, Bezil, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Nezil, Perod, Red Lilly, Sarina, Shiantis, The Librarian: 15, Thomas, Timur, Zora
notes:
You can find yellow parchments around the world. Anything written on one of them will be permanent and '''cannot''' be changed once saved.
It looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].
\n{{Seealso|Blank Parchment}}

name: Party Lampions (Green)
notes: The green lampion could be obtained from [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|blue surprise bags]] during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Both the green and [[Party Lampions (Red)|red party lampions]] can now be looted during raids in the [[Kingsday Mini World Change]].\n\n{{Seealso|Kingsday Mini World Change}}

name: Party Lampions (Red)
notes: The red lampion could be obtained from [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|blue surprise bags]] during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. Both the red and [[Party Lampions (Green)|green party lampions]] can now be looted during raids in the [[Kingsday Mini World Change]].\n\n{{Seealso|Kingsday Mini World Change}}

name: Party Wall Snake
notes: The Party Wall Snake could be obtained from [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|blue surprise bags]] during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. It can now be looted during raids in the [[Kingsday Mini World Change]].\n\n{{Seealso|Kingsday Mini World Change}}

name: Party Wall Tinsel
notes: The Party Wall Tinsel could be obtained from [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|blue surprise bags]] during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]]. It can now be looted during raids in the [[Kingsday Mini World Change]].\n\n{{Seealso|Kingsday Mini World Change}}

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crypt Warrior | Grand Master Oberon | Honour Guard | Jailer | Skeleton | Skeleton Elite Warrior | Skeleton Warrior | Teleskor
notes:
A creature product. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\n50 Are needed in [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].

name: Pendulum Clock Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Pendulum Clock}} [[Pendulum Clock]]. It looks the same as a medium [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.

name: Pharaoh Banner
notes: {{Seealso|Pharaoh Banner (Object)}}Can only be obtained through [[The Mummy's Curse]] [[World Change]].

name: Phoenix Charm
notes:
This item can be used to provide the user the [[blessing]] [[Spark of the Phoenix]]. It only works once, then it disappears, the [[Flame Effect]] {{Ilink|Flame Effect}} appears on the user and the following message will appear: {{Server Message|The Spark of the Phoenix emblazes you.}}
If the user already has the blessing, the following message will appear in orange preventing using it: {{Message|type=sound|You already possess this blessing.}}
\nThis charm was only available as a {{OfficialNewsArchive|2519|compensation}} for connections problems that took place in August 2013 till {{OfficialNewsArchive|4043|April 25, 2017}}. The only way to obtain the charm these days is to loot it in a monster.
flavortext: The Spark of the Phoenix is contained in it.

name: Phoenix Statue
notes:
Since [[TibiaFans.se]] left the fansite programme, this item cannot be obtained anymore. It was created by {{character|Van Lyves}} for TibiaFans item contest.

Its replica is the [[Phoenix Statue (Replica)]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Come closer, I will show some Tibian mysteries to you!|Feel the eternity of Tibiafans.se!|<player>, you are worthy to feel the power of Tibiafans.se! HAIL TIBIAFANS!}}
flavortext: This mighty statue contains a true phoenix feather inside. Awarded by Tibiafans.se.

name: Piano Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Julian, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Piano}} [[Piano]]. Looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs, however, the Piano Kit can still be bought in [[Rathleton]], likely due to an oversight by CipSoft. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a piano.

name: Piece of Archer Armor
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Piece of Marble Rock
droppedby: Eternal Guardian | Gargoyle | Stone Golem | Twisted Shaper
notes:
If you use an [[Obsidian Knife]] on it, you will either break it or carve one of the following: * [[File:Rough Marble Statue.gif]] [[Rough Marble Statue]] * [[File:Marble Statue.gif]] [[Marble Statue]] * [[File:Beautiful Marble Statue.gif]] [[Beautiful Marble Statue]] See a research article by [[Tibia-Stats]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20210509005650/http://www.tibia-stats.com/index.php?akcja=6003&research=sculpting here] to discover what the chances for getting each form of the marble statues are.
{{Seealso|Piece of Marble Rock/Sculpting Statistics}} One can be obtained through the [[Jack to the Future Quest]].
You can earn the [[achievement]] [[Marblelous]] by sculpting a [[Beautiful Marble Statue]] and the achievement [[Marble Madness]] by sculpting five [[Beautiful Marble Statue]]s.
history: Before [[Updates/8.60|Update 8.60]], this item could only be looted rarely from [[Eternal Guardian]]s. With this update, however, [[achievements]] got introduced. Two of these were for sculpting [[Beautiful Marble Statue]]s, which only happens one in a hundred tries. As Eternal Guardians only spawned in the area that can only be accessed once a week for theÂ [[Children of the Revolution Quest/Spoiler#Weekly Task: Zze Art of War|Zze Art of War]]Â task of the [[Children of the Revolution Quest]], these achievements would be nearly impossible to get if it stayed this way. That is why [[Chayenne]], after being made aware of this issue, added spawns of Eternal Guardians to [[Deeper Banuta]]Â and also added this item to the loot of [[Gargoyle]]s and [[Stone Golem]]s.
flavortext: It seems just perfect to try and create something out of it with a sharp obsidian knife.

name: Piece of Warrior Armor
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Minotaur Guard | Minotaur Invader | The Horned Fox
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Reap]], [[Intricate Reap]] and [[Powerful Reap]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Reap, Intricate Reap, Powerful Reap

name: Pineapple
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes:
See [[Tapestry]] for general information about tapestries.

It seems to mark the location of a valuable treasure. If only you could find out where this is...
Looks the same as a [[Treasure Map]], a [[Treasure Map (Pirate)]], and a [[Plan]].\nItem obtained in the [[Treasure Hunt Quest]]. Can be used to sail to the [[Treasure Hunt Island]].
flavortext: The location on the map is not familiar to you.

notes:
When used it gives a pirate random item. You can get a boss item from the bag.
\n{{Seealso|Pirates Surprise/Statistics}}\nCan be get obtained as a reward for one successful journey in [[A Pirate's Death to Me/Spoiler|A Pirate's Death to Me]] event.

notes: Can be obtained from [[Belongings of a Deceased]]. Use it to obtain the Plague Bell addon for [[Afflicted Outfits Quest]]

name: Plague Mask
notes: Can be obtained from [[belongings of a Deceased]]. Use it to obtain the mask addon for [[Afflicted Outfits Quest]].

buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes: Creates a 3x3 area of [[Poison Gas]]. The poison fields will last for 4:08.

name: Poison Field Rune
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes: [[File:Poisoned Icon.gif]] Creates a [[Poison Gas]] that lasts for 4 minutes and 8 seconds. If stepped on, it applies the [[Poisoned]] [[special condition]]. Its total damage is 105 [[hitpoints]] (5 turns of 5 [[hp]], 5 rounds of 4, 7 rounds of 3, 10 rounds of 2, and 19 rounds of 1).

name: Poison Spider Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blood Beast | Brimstone Bug | Diremaw | Filth Toad | Ink Blob | Lancer Beetle | Stonerefiner | Sulphur Scuttler | The Blightfather | Toad

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Frost]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Pot of Blackjack
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
history: The dish is one of the four winning recipes of the {{OfficialNewsArchive|1335|Gourmet Competition}} held by [[CipSoft]] in May 2010. The creator of this recipe is {{character|Karolak}}, formally known as ''Adray Del'Impro''.
flavortext: Nomads state that this meal fills you with energy several times before the pot is empty.

name: Premium Scroll
notes: Their purpose was replaced by [[Tibia Coins]] with the implementation of the [[Store]] in the [[Updates/10.8|Summer Update 2015]]. They were intended for private use and to trade premium time in a legal way. Premium Scrolls could only be stored in your [[Depot]], [[Inbox]] or [[Purse]]. It was not possible to move them out of containers or to put them onto the floor, for example. These scrolls were never dropped if the character holding them in his purse slot was killed. Its description used to be: Using this scroll will add 30 days of premium time to your account once. You could always order Premium Scrolls for yourself, but to transfer them to other players the following requirements had to be met: *The account had to be registered. *The account had to be a premium account. *Not having transferred more than 6 Premium Scrolls within the last 30 days. If purchased by credit card or PayPal: *The account had to have existed existed for at least of 240 days. *Having a character of level 70 or higher on the account. *Having bought at least 60 days of premium time more than 6 months ago. *The payment method credit card is not blocked on the account. *Having not transferred more than 3 Premium Scrolls within the last 30 days. *Having one month of active premium time left for every scroll to be transferred.

name: Prepared Bucket
notes:
This bucket is prepared to hold extra slippery water. Turns into [[Bucket of Bog Water]] if used on [[Bog Water]].

Can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.31|126.90|10|4|text=here}}.

Can be made by using a [[Flask of Embalming Fluid]] on a [[Bucket]]. This is the only container that can be used to hold [[Bog Water]] in the [[Thornfire]] World Change.
flavortext: This bucket is specially prepared for magical water, which is known to escape just about any vessel.

name: Pretty Clay Statue
notes:
When you "use" a [[Clay Lump]] you have a chance for it to turn into a little figurine. Sometimes it will be complete, sometimes it will not be. Unlike an [[Ice Cube]], you cannot use it several times and it will not "break". It will just remain incomplete if you fail. [[File:Clay_Statue_(Making).gif]]\nIf you make 1 of these, you will receive the [[achievement]] [[Clay Fighter]].
\nIf you make 5 of these, you will receive the achievement [[Clay to Fame]].
flavortext: This little figurine of Brog, the raging Titan, was skillfully made by "player name".

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

droppedby: Dawnfire Asura | Frost Flower Asura | Kusuma | Midnight Asura | The Blazing Rose | The Diamond Blossom | The Flaming Orchid | The Lily of Night | True Dawnfire Asura | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | The Moonlight Aster | The Winter Bloom
notes:
Can be used for decoration.
5 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Electrify]] and [[Powerful Electrify]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Pendulum
notes: Used in the [[Roshamuul Quest]]. [[Morax]] gives you this.
flavortext: Sometimes it swings out of its own accord.

name: Perfume Gatherer (First)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Perfume Gatherer (Filled)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (Final)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (Second)]] and [[Perfume Gatherer (Third)]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].
flavortext: It is empty. The first odour you're looking for is special snail slime.

name: Pet Pig
notes: It looks like a [[Little Pig]].\nCan be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.

name: Phoenix Statue (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. This item is a replica of [[Phoenix Statue]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Piece of a Broken Amulet (Eye)
notes: It is one of the [[Piece of a Broken Amulet|pieces]] of [[Koshei's Ancient Amulet]].\nPart of the [[Koshei the Deathless Quest]]. It can be found in a [[Stone Coffin]] some floors down in southern [[Drefia]], in the room with the single [[Vampire]] ([http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}129.26,126.217,7,3,1,1 here]). After delivering all four pieces of the amulet (and 5000 [[gp]]) to [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] he can give you the complete [[Koshei's Ancient Amulet|amulet]] after waiting for 24 hours in real-time.

name: Piece of a Broken Amulet (Mouth)
notes: It is one of the [[Piece of a Broken Amulet|pieces]] of [[Koshei's Ancient Amulet]].\nPart of the [[Koshei the Deathless Quest]]. It can be found under a [[Loose Board]] in the the [[Bath of Dreams]], the building west of [[Darashia]]'s [[depot]] ([http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}129.170,126.203,7,3,1,1 here]). After delivering all four pieces of the amulet (and 5000 [[gp]]) to [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] he can give you the complete [[Koshei's Ancient Amulet|amulet]] after waiting for 24 hours in real-time.

name: Piece of a Broken Amulet (Nose)
notes: It is one of the [[Piece of a Broken Amulet|pieces]] of [[Koshei's Ancient Amulet]].\nPart of the [[Koshei the Deathless Quest]]. It can be found in the [[Sand (Quest)|sands]] of the [[Kha'labal]], above the [[Ancient Ruins Tomb]] ([http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}129.188,127.81,7,3,1,1 here]). [[Use]] the sand to obtain the amulet piece, don't dig for it. After delivering all four pieces of the amulet (and 5000 [[gp]]) to [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] he can give you the complete [[Koshei's Ancient Amulet|amulet]] after waiting for 24 hours in real-time.

name: Piece of Swampling Wood
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Snake Skin]], [[Intricate Snake Skin]] and [[Powerful Snake Skin]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Snake Skin, Intricate Snake Skin, Powerful Snake Skin

name: Pieces of Magic Chalk
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blood Hand | Blood Priest | Shadow Pupil
notes: One is needed for the [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: Imbued with magic, this chalk is used for drawing incantation circles.

name: Piercing Bolt (Weak)
droppedby: Dwarf Soldier | Forest Fury | General Murius | Minotaur Archer | The Horned Fox
buyfrom: Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Vincent, Willard
notes: This weaker variant of [[Piercing Bolt]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Updates/10.8|Summer Update 2015]] with all [[Weak Ammunition and Runes]], but [[CipSoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Pinch of Crystal Dust
notes: Looks the same as [[Mushroom Spores]].\nObtained and used in [[The Cursed Crystal Quest]].
flavortext: It shimmers greenly and sparkles softly.

name: Pink Gloud Essence
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Vial]] of wine.
\nTemporarily obtained in [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.
flavortext: Zeronex' secret formula is probably toxic.

name: Pint of Glooth
buyfrom: Roswitha;The first is free by asking for a "pint" (once each hour) but afterwards you must pay by asking "drink".
notes: You can get this item for free by asking [[Roswitha]] for a {{KW|Pint}} otherwise say {{KW|Drink}} at the cost of 10{{GP|}}. By drinking it, you will be transformed into a [[Rot Elemental]] for 30 seconds. If you don't use it, it will become a [[Pint of Glooth (Green)]] after 10 minutes. Used in the [[Oramond_Quest#Dr._Merlay's_Misery|Oramond Quest - Dr. Merlay's Misery]].
flavortext: Though it's frothy green, it has quite a pleasant odour.

name: Plasma Pearls
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Breach Brood | Burster | Dreadful Disruptor | Essence of Malice | Instable Breach Brood | Reality Reaver | Rupture | Stabilizing Reality Reaver | The Sinister Hermit (Blue) | The Souldespoiler
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Plasmatic Lightning
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dreadful Disruptor | Eradicator | Reality Reaver | The Scourge of Oblivion

name: Platinum Token
notes: It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Poison Salt Crystal
notes: It's a piece of [[Crystallized Salt]].<noinclude>Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: Filtered from the putrefied purple lakes, this salt is deadly, if diluted in water.

name: Poisoned Fang
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Pool of Chitinous Glue
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Its only purpose is to be sold to NPCs. It has a high gold-to-oz ratio.

name: Power Bolt (Weak)
droppedby: Annihilon | Betrayed Wraith | Demodras | Dragon Lord | Frost Dragon | General Murius | Nightmare | Omruc | Serpent Spawn | Undead Dragon | Wyvern
buyfrom: Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Vincent, Willard
notes: This weaker variant of [[Power Bolt]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Updates/10.8|Summer Update 2015]] with all [[Weak Ammunition and Runes]], but [[CipSoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Prickly Pear
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Prismatic Armor
notes: Part of the [[Prismatic Set]]. Best blocking (physical) armor for paladins.

name: Prismatic Bolt
droppedby: Cliff Strider | Lava Golem | Orewalker | Weeper
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes: This is the third-strongest ammunition in the game, beaten by more rare [[Infernal Bolt]]s and [[Spectral Bolt]]s. Before the addition of Spectral Bolts to NPC shops, this used to be the strongest ammunition players could buy in shops. The arrow counterpart is [[Crystalline Arrow]] with 1 less attack. These bolts are intended to be an alternative to using [[Assassin Star]]s, compared to which they are cheaper (33gp average vs. 20gp per hit), stronger (65 vs 66+crossbow bonuses) and hit about as accurately.

name: Prismatic Boots
notes: Part of the [[Prismatic Set]].
history: These shoes are no longer able to be imbued with the "Swiftness" imbuement as of {{OfficialNewsArchive|4974|March 12, 2019}} prior to that date this imbuement was possible.

name: Prismatic Helmet
notes: Part of the [[Prismatic Set]].

name: Prismatic Legs
notes: Part of the [[Prismatic Set]].

name: Prismatic Necklace
notes: Reward from the [[Warzone 2]] chest of the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]].

name: Prismatic Quartz
droppedby: Boogy | Dark Faun | Gazer Spectre | Manticore | Memory of a Faun | Ogre Rowdy | Raxias | Shaper Matriarch | Spellreaper Inferniarch | Spiky Carnivor | The Sinister Hermit (Blue) | The Souldespoiler | Twisted Pooka | Memory of a Manticore
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan
notes: A piece of very valuable quartz.

name: Prismatic Ring
notes:
It lasts 1 hour.
\nCan be obtained as reward of the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]] in [[Warzone 3]].

name: Prismatic Shield
notes: Part of the [[Prismatic Set]].

name: Psychedelic Tapestry
notes: It's a very rare [[Tapestries|tapestry]], only dropped by some [[Roshamuul Prison]] bosses. It's one of the few tapestries that animate. The [[Demonic Tapestry]] is its counterpart.

name: Pulverized Ore
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Purple Nightshade Blossoms
notes: Can be harvested by using [[Blooming Purple Nightshade]] plants, which grow in a cave below [[Grimvale]]. Needed in the [[Grimvale Quest]].

name: Purple Powder
notes:
It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as [[Fish Flakes]] and [[Sorrow]].

name: Ornate Carving Axe
notes: This item is a replica of an [[Axe of Carving (Overcharged)]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Ornate Carving Blade
notes: This item is a replica of a [[Blade of Carving (Overcharged)]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Ornate Carving Bow
notes: This item is a replica of a [[Bow of Carving (Overcharged)]]. It is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Ornate Testtplate
notes: This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]. It's name and looks are a play on {{Ilink|Ornate Chestplate}}[[Ornate Chestplate]].

name: Ornate Tome
notes: Text cannot be edited once saved.

name: Page from a Mystic Book
notes: It contains [[Falcon Bastion Access (Book)]]. Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: A page from an extremely old book. It somehow feels very heavy, as if it was still part of the original book it was torn out of.

name: Painting of a Girl
notes: Obtained through the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: She has long dark hair and might be about seven years old.

name: Parchment (Blood)
notes:
This item can be obtained by using an [[Inkwell]] on a [[Parchment (Roses)]]. It looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Carnage)]], a [[Parchment (Excellent)]], a [[Parchment (Mud)]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Sugar)]], a [[Parchment (Violets)]], a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].
\n\nUsed in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: It says 'Roses are red, and so is my blood.' Damn, that sounds stupid. You have to start over.

name: Parchment (Carnage)
notes: This item can be obtained by using an [[Inkwell]] on a [[Parchment (Violets)]]. It looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Blood)]], a [[Parchment (Excellent)]], a [[Parchment (Mud)]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Sugar)]], a [[Parchment (Violets)]], a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].\nUsed in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: It says 'Roses are red, violets are blue, I love blood and carnage...' No, no, this is a war poem.

name: Parchment (Excellent)
notes: This item can be obtained by using an [[Inkwell]] on a [[Parchment (Sugar)]]. It looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Blood)]], a [[Parchment (Carnage)]], a [[Parchment (Mud)]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Sugar)]], a [[Parchment (Violets)]], a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].\nUsed in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: It says 'Roses are red, violets are blue, sugar is sweet and so are you.' Excellent.

name: Parchment (Mud)
notes: This item can be obtained by using an [[Inkwell]] on a [[Parchment (Sugar)]]. It looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Blood)]], a [[Parchment (Carnage)]], a [[Parchment (Excellent)]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Sugar)]], a [[Parchment (Violets)]], a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].\nUsed in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: It says 'Roses are red, violets are blue, sugar is sweet, there's mud on my shoe.' You blew it.

name: Parchment (Rewritable)
buyfrom: Bertha, Fyodor, Gorn, Perod, Shiantis, The Librarian:15, Thomas
sellto: Bertha:5, Fyodor:5, Gorn:5, Perod:5, Shiantis:5, The Librarian, Thomas:5
notes:
This is the rewritable version of [[Parchment]] which contains fixed text.
It looks the same as [[Intelligence Reports]], a [[Lottery Ticket (Blank)]], a [[Nomad Parchment]], an [[Old Parchment]], a Parchment (Rewritable) and [[The Peacock Ballad]].
{{seealso|Parchment|Parchment (Yellow)}}
history: Before the [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]], this parchment looked like this: [[File:Parchment (Old).gif]]
flavortext: It is rewriteable.

name: Parchment (Sugar)
notes: This item can be obtained by using an [[Inkwell]] on a [[Parchment (Violets)]]. It looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Blood)]], a [[Parchment (Carnage)]], a [[Parchment (Excellent)]], a [[Parchment (Mud)]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Violets)]], a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].\nUsed in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: It says 'Roses are red, violets are blue, sugar is sweet...' Very poetic, now for the final rhyme.

name: Parchment (Violets)
notes: This item can be obtained by using an [[Inkwell]] on a [[Parchment (Roses)]]. It looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Blood)]], a [[Parchment (Carnage)]], a [[Parchment (Excellent)]], a [[Parchment (Mud)]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Sugar)]], a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].\nUsed in the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].
flavortext: It says 'Roses are red, violets are blue...' Sounds good, but what now..

name: Parchment of Dark Knowledge
notes: It looks the same as [[Building Plans for a Ship]], a [[Document of the Follower]], a [[Document of the Leader]], a [[Document of the Officer]], an [[Old Parchment (Omrabas)]] and a [[Parchment (White)]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: Its power seems to seek a book to attach to.

name: Parchment of Interest
notes: It looks the same as a [[Note from the Thieves Guild]], an [[Old Encrypted Text]], an [[Old Piece of Paper]], an [[Old Pirate Poem]], a [[Piece of Paper]], a [[Piece of Paper (Object)]], [[Suspicious Documents]], [[The Alchemists' Formulas]] and a [[Translation Scroll]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: Once there was an extraordinary place where the magic entities lived peacefully and in harmony. It was a stronghold of knowledge.

name: Part of an Old Map (Bottom Left)
notes: The bottom left part of an [[Old Map]] that was torn apart.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
history: Although this item was implemented with [[Updates/11.02|Update 11.02]], it was only obtainable after [[Updates/11.40|Update 11.40]].

name: Part of an Old Map (Bottom Right)
notes: The bottom right part of an [[Old Map]] that was torn apart. This item is not obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest|quest]] in which you get the other [[Part of an Old Map|Parts of an Old Map]] and the [[Old Map]] itself, therefore this is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Part of an Old Map (Upper Left)
notes: The upper left part of an [[Old Map]] that was torn apart.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
history: Although this item was implemented with [[Updates/11.02|Update 11.02]], it was only obtainable after [[Updates/11.40|Update 11.40]].

name: Part of an Old Map (Upper Right)
notes: The upper right part of an [[Old Map]] that was torn apart.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
history: Although this item was implemented with [[Updates/11.02|Update 11.02]], it was only obtainable after [[Updates/11.40|Update 11.40]].

name: Partially Charged Lodestone
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Spike Tasks Quest|Geomantic Charges}}.

name: Patch of Fine Cloth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Grand Canon Dominus | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Grand Commander Soeren | Preceptor Lazare
notes: This item is required to upgrade a [[Falcon Shield]] into a [[Falcon Escutcheon]].\n\nThere's a chance you'll find one when opening a [[Brass-Shod Chest]] inside the [[Falcon Bastion]].
flavortext: A patch of fine cloth in the colours of the Order of the Falcon.

name: Pendulet
notes: You can [[Enchanted Pendulet|recharge]] it at [[Cledwyn]] for 2 [[Silver Token]]s.

name: Perfume Flacon
notes: Temporarily obtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]]. When using it, the item is consumed, and you get the following message: "{{Server Message|Hmmm, what an infatuating fragrance!}}" This unlocks the ability to damage [[The Lily of Night]], as long as you enter her boss room within the next 4 minutes and 59 seconds. If you try to use another perfume flacon within the next 4 minutes and 58 seconds, you get a different message: "{{Server Message|That would be a bit too much fragrancy.}}"

name: Perfume Gatherer (Filled)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Perfume Gatherer (Final)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (First)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (Second)]] and [[Perfume Gatherer (Third)]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].
flavortext: It is filled with smelly goo.

name: Perfume Gatherer (Final)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Perfume Gatherer (Filled)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (First)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (Second)]] and [[Perfume Gatherer (Third)]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].
flavortext: It is partly filled. The final odour you need is that of mouldy cheese.

name: Perfume Gatherer (Second)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Perfume Gatherer (Filled)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (Final)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (First)]] and [[Perfume Gatherer (Third)]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].
flavortext: It is partly filled. The second odour you need is black swamp gas.

name: Perfume Gatherer (Third)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Perfume Gatherer (Filled)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (Final)]], a [[Perfume Gatherer (First)]] and a [[Perfume Gatherer (Second)]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Goblin Merchant Quest]].
flavortext: It is partly filled. The third odour you need is a rotworm fart.

name: Phial of Fresh Water
notes: Obtained through the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: The phial contains fresh, clean water. It also looks like it sparkles. The flask is so thin and finely crated that the water seems to pour out little by little.

name: Piece of a Shell (Item)
notes: It can be temporarily obtained during the {{Spoiler Section|Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest|Sub-Mission 3: The Sunken City}}, after obtaining [[Some Broken Shells (Item)]] which becomes this item in a few seconds. It vanishes within seconds after being created.\n\nIt looks the same as the object [[Piece of a Shell]].

name: Piece of Ebony
notes: Temporarily obtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]].

name: Piece of Paper
notes: It looks the same as a [[Note from the Thieves Guild]], an [[Old Encrypted Text]], an [[Old Piece of Paper]], an [[Old Pirate Poem]], a [[Parchment of Interest]], a [[Piece of Paper (Object)]], [[Suspicious Documents]], [[The Alchemists' Formulas]] and a [[Translation Scroll]].

name: Piece of Paper (Blank)
notes: It looks the same as [[Notes and Coordinates]] and a [[Very Old Piece of Paper]].

name: Piece of Parchment (Gold)
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.
flavortext: Underneath the circle with the dot inside you read: "The alchemical symbol for gold.".

name: Piece of Parchment (Shadow Bite)
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.
flavortext: Underneath the plant drawing you read: "Shadow Bite Plant, grows only subterranean, underneath Edron.".

name: Piece of Parchment (Silver)
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.
flavortext: Underneath the moon you read: "The alchemical symbol for silver.".

name: Pillow Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Pinata Dragon
notes:
This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as the creature [[PiÃ±ata Dragon]].

name: Pink Fluid
notes: Temporarily obtained during the [[Cults of Tibia Quest]].

name: Pint of Glooth (Green)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This is an unused [[Pint of Glooth]] that has been sitting idle for 10 minutes. If you don't use it, it will become a [[Pint of Glooth (Stale)]] after 10 minutes. You can consume this green pint of glooth by using it on your character. Upon doing so, your character will experience the [[Yellow Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Yellow Notes Effect}} and you'll sing.
sounds: {{Sound List|Aaaand I knew a Mary who was fair and hairy, but one night she turned into a weeeerewooolf...}}
flavortext: Though it's green, it has quite a pleasant odour.

name: Pint of Glooth (Stale)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This is an unused [[Pint of Glooth (Green)]] that has been sitting idle for 10 minutes. You can consume this stale pint of glooth by using it on your character. Upon doing so, your character will experience the [[Poison Effect 2|Poison Effect]] {{Ilink|Poison Effect 2}} and you'll receive the following message: {{Server Message|The glooth is a little stale, but very refreshing.}}
flavortext: Though it's stale, it has quite a pleasant odour.

name: Plan for a Makeshift Armour
droppedby: The Baron from Below | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla
notes: Item needed to get base [[Makeshift Warrior Outfits]].
flavortext: With this plan you should be able to knock up an improvised armour.

name: Polished Key Fragment (Handle)
notes:
It is nice and shiny.
Reverts back to [[Rusted Key Fragment (Handle)]] after some time.Part of the [[Hidden Threats Quest]].
flavortext: This key fragment is polished and glares.

name: Polished Key Fragment (Head)
notes:
It is nice and shiny.
Reverts back to [[Rusted Key Fragment (Head)]] after some time.Part of the [[Hidden Threats Quest]].
flavortext: This key fragment is polished and glares.

name: Porcelain Mask
notes: It is one of the four permanent protector equipments against [[Mana Drain]], the other three being the [[Witch Hat]], [[Depth Ocrea]] and the [[Starlight Vial]]. The last one and the Porcelain Mask do not have vocation requirement.\n\nYou can obtain one every 5 days when the [[First Dragon Quest]] is active. 3 are needed for the [[Festive Outfits Quest]].

name: Present (Fairy)
notes: A special present from a generous fairy.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Pristine Worm Head
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: One of the heads of the Duke of the Depths.

name: Purified Soul
notes:
A [[Damned Soul]] becomes a Purified Soul after being slayed. It last for 5 seconds.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Deep Crystal]], a [[Gnomish Resonance Crystal]], a [[Life Crystal]], a [[Resonance Crystal]], a [[Resonance Crystal (Recorded)]] and a [[Spectral Stone]].\nItem temporarily obtained during [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].
flavortext: This pure soul is powerful enough to destroy Sin Devourers. The soul is fading away quickly though.

name: Purple Tendril Lantern
flavortext: It is made of leaves and seems to be irresistible to moths and other insects.

name: Ornate Carving Chopper
notes: This item is a replica of a [[Chopper of Carving (Overcharged)]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Ornate Carving Crossbow
notes: This item is a replica of a [[Crossbow of Carving (Overcharged)]]. It is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Ornate Carving Hammer
notes: This item is a replica of a [[Hammer of Carving (Overcharged)]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Ornate Carving Mace
notes: This item is a replica of a [[Mace of Carving (Overcharged)]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Ornate Carving Slayer
notes: This item is a replica of a [[Slayer of Carving (Overcharged)]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Ornate Locket
droppedby: Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Maxxenius
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan

name: Ornate Mayhem Axe
notes: This item is a replica of an [[Axe of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]. Due to its low attack, this weapon is only meant as decoration.
flavortext: This replica looks overcharged.

name: Overcooked Noodles
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It does not have any effect when eaten. After consuming one, you have to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish. \n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold.
flavortext: Not exactly 'al dente' yet some just seem to love it.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Phantasmal Hair
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Physical Amplification
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your targets sensitivity to your [[Physical Damage]] attacks by 8% for one hour. It only affects attacks against monsters.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily amplifies physical damage against monsters.

name: Physical Resilience
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase your [[Physical Damage]] protection by 8% for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases physical protection.

name: Pick (Enchanted)
notes: Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]]. Can be used to mine [[Tagralt Nugget]]s from [[Veined Stone]]s.
flavortext: It seems to be enchanted with a spell.

name: Pot with Sylvan Earth
notes: Use it on a [[House]] or [[Guildhall]] in order to grow a {{Ilink|Megasylvan Plant}} [[Megasylvan Plant]].\n\nTo obtain this pot, use a [[Megasylvan Sapling]] {{Ilink|Megasylvan Sapling}} on an [[Empty Flower Pot]] {{Ilink|Empty Flower Pot}}. Note that this can only be done '''once per character'''.
flavortext: The pot contains rare sylvan earth from the living forest under Bounac. Nothing is planted in there.

name: Potato Peelings
notes: They can be found on the floor around [[The Feeding Grounds]].\n\nThey are required for the ''Do not Feed the Porker'' game of the [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Psychedelic Marble
notes: It's part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
flavortext: A psychedelic marble. An engraving reads: IX.

name: Pumpkinhead (Lit)
notes:
It is a [[Pumpkin]], which can be carved and convert into a [[Pumpkinhead]] using a [[Kitchen Knife]], [[Whacking Driller of Fate]], or [[Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness]]. Once carved, the [[Pumpkinhead]] can be used on a [[Candlestick]] to transform it into a [[Pumpkinhead (Lit)|Jack-o'-lantern]], allowing it to provide light.
\nIt shares the same appearance as a [[Helmet of Ultimate Terror]]. {{Ilink|Helmet of Ultimate Terror}}

name: Purified Soul (Netherworld)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Purifier for Lost Souls
notes: They can be used to [[Purified Soul (Netherworld)|purify]] [[Lost Soul (Item)|Lost Souls]].\nPart of the [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].

name: Organic Acid
notes: Used on a [[Small Spore Reservoir]] during the [[Rotten Blood Quest]], to speed up access to [[Murcion]] in [[Jaded Roots]] by 20 seconds.
flavortext: Using this volatile acid on certain fungi will release rotten micro spores.

name: Palette and Brushes
notes: It looks the same as an [[Artist's Palette]].\n\nObtained during the [[25 Years of Tibia Quest]].

name: Pantibian Amphora
notes: A Pantibian Amphora was given to all characters who were invited to the [[Pantibian Festival]] and who did not get disqualified. The Amphoras given to players have the following inscription, written by one of the four founders that attended the event:\n\n:{{Message|type=look|''Founder'' wrote on 18. May 2022: ''Player'' participated in the Pantibian Festival together with the founders Durin, Guido, Stephan and Steve, to celebrate Tibia's 25th anniversary.}}
flavortext: It emanates a divine aura.
