name: Piece of Timira's Sensors
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Pieces of Eldritch Wax (Dry)
notes: [[Pieces of Eldritch Wax]] will become dry if not used shortly after picked up.

name: Pilchi with Paint
notes: Open the barrel found {{Mapper Coords|133.12|123.6|11|8|text=here}} to obtain the [[Pilchi with Paint]]. It can be collected daily. It is used in part of the [[Adventures_of_Galthen_Quest#Galthen_and_the_City_of_Gold_Part_II|Galthen and the City of Gold Part II]] quest.
flavortext: A ceremonial pilchi filled with paint that was used by the Iks to consecrate buildings in the city of Iksupan.

name: Pile of Presents Kit
notes:
Using a [[Pile of Presents Kit]] within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]] triggers a transformation, converting the kit into a [[Pile of Presents]].
{{Ilink|Pile of Presents}}
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a pile of presents.

name: Pile of Three Presents Kit
notes: Using a [[Pile of Three Presents Kit]] within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]] triggers a transformation, converting the kit into [[Three Presents]]. {{Ilink|Three Presents}}
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a pile of three presents.

name: Pink 25 Years Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Pink 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)|Pink 25 Years Balloon]] {{Ilink|Pink 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Pink Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Pink Balloon (Inflated)|Pink Balloon]] {{Ilink|Pink Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Pocket Sundial
Polished Idol of Tukh
notes:
Obtained by using a {{ilink|Jug of Gold Lye}} [[Jug of Gold Lye]] on an {{ilink|Idol of Tukh}} [[Idol of Tukh]]. This is the item needed to tame a {{Ilink|Mystic Jaguar (Mount)}} [[Mystic Jaguar]]. It has a chance of breaking when used.
Failed: {{Message|type=server|}}
Failed: {{Message|type=server|The jaguar seems to spot a lack of faith. Recognising the false idol he runs away angrily.}}
Succeeded: {{Message|type=server|You managed to calm down the jaguar. Approaching the creature slowly and with care, a unique bond forms between you.}}
flavortext: This idol has been polished to shine with a cold golden glow. In ancient Iks lore only the god Tukh has power over the mystic spirit animals of the Iks.

name: Portable Flame
notes: Item needed to get the second addon of the [[Fire-Fighter Outfits]].

name: Portrait with Ferumbras
notes:
During the '''25th Anniversary''' you were able to visit the [[Tibia%27s_25th_Anniversary#Picture_Wall|Picture Wall]].

Found in the 13 cities listed below you would find a painter{{Ilink|Painter}} and a painting booth{{Ilink|Painting Booth}} You would then 'Use' the painter with having 5 [[Gold Coin]]s in your inventory to get the right to take a picture. You would then move to the position behind the Booth to receive a {{Ilink|Portrait with Ferumbras}} [[Portrait with Ferumbras]].
You could repeat this activity once every 20 hours.

Cities in which it could be found in were: {{Mapper Coords|126.124|125.211|7|4|text=Thais}}, {{Mapper Coords|126.91|124.21|7|4|text=Carlin}}, {{Mapper Coords|128.241|125.55|6|4|text=Venore}}, {{Mapper Coords|129.180|124.77|7|4|text=Edron}}, {{Mapper Coords|126.57|128.66|7|4|text=Liberty_Bay}}, {{Mapper Coords|127.141|123.207|7|4|text=Ab'dendriel}}, {{Mapper Coords|132.117|123.30|7|4|text=Issavi}}, {{Mapper Coords|129.99|128.64|7|4|text=Ankrahmun}}, {{Mapper Coords|128.41|121.255|7|4|text=Yalahar}}, {{Mapper Coords|127.115|127.247|7|4|text=Port_Hope}}, {{Mapper Coords|126.30|121.167|7|4|text=Svargrond}}, {{Mapper Coords|129.198|126.175|7|4|text=Darashia}}, and {{Mapper Coords|131.104|124.134|5|4|text=Rahleton}}.

You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Paper Plane

name: Personal Letter of Adlerauge I
notes: {{Server Message|Amelia, my love, I want you to feel what I feel, hear what I hear and see what I see: the wonders of the world, the breath of life and the wildness of the sea. All in the warm, green colour of your vivid eyes, I have sunken into so deeply that they painted my world in the hues of your soul.}}
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 1/3.

name: Personal Letter of Adlerauge II
notes: {{Server Message|Amelia, why don't you answer as my heart yearns for you and my mind longs for the satisfaction of your kind words?}}
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 2/3.

name: Personal Letter of Adlerauge III
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 3/3.

name: Personal Letter of Clavius I
notes: {{Server Message|Professor, I have told you once and I will tell you again. The darkness we face today is not by our own making but it fall to us, to stand up against and fight it. It is in our hands to end the threats of our time, in our time.}}
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 1/3.

name: Personal Letter of Clavius II
notes: {{Server Message|Professor, Cormealius, we know each other for a long time now. As I have explained to you again and again, the enemy stands united while our dispute divides us even further. We have to act and as soon as we stand down, our enemies will prevail.}}
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 2/3.

name: Personal Letter of Clavius III
notes: {{Server Message|This will be my last letter to you, Professor. There is not a single argument of mine that you have ever considered. I will tell you this, the blood of the innocent of this world will be on your hands, when the tide of evil rises.}}
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 3/3.

name: Personal Letter of Michael the Stalwart I
actualname: personal letter of Michael the Stalwart I
notes: {{Server Message|Order of thirteen spike traps and five iron maidens to Michel the Starkheart: here are your traps and maidens, Suffer and Bleed Co. wishes you a very fun day!}}
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 1/3.

name: Personal Letter of Michael the Stalwart II
actualname: personal letter of Michael the Stalwart II
notes: {{Server Message|We are sorry, Mr. Steepwart, the rest of the SEVENTEEN spike traps originally ordered, are already on their way! The mistake was clearly on the side of Suffer and Bleed Co. We won't put you on the rack any longer!}}
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 2/3.

name: Personal Letter of Michael the Stalwart III
actualname: personal letter of Michael the Stalwart III
notes: {{Server Message|Thank you for the good wishes, Mr. Stalwart, we are glad the THIRTEEN spike traps arrived at your bastion of the Deer in Edron safe and sound. We hear the weather is nice there all year round! All the best, Suffer and Bleed Co.}}
flavortext: A personal letter of a knight of the Order of the Stag 3/3.

name: Rake
notes: You can find this in various places throughout Tibia.\nYou need one for the [[Eleonore Quest]], to get her ring, Also needed in the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]] and the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Rapier
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne: 15, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Lee'Delle: 13, Memech, Morpel, Obi: 15, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
sellto: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne: 5, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, H.L., Habdel, Hardek, Lee'Delle: 5, Memech, Morpel, Obi: 5, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
notes:
The rapier is slightly stronger than a [[knife]] or [[dagger]], but arguably less common because only [[Frost Troll]]s drop it.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Light Rapier]].\nYou can also get it in [[Rookgaard]] through the [[Rapier Quest]].

name: Ravager's Axe
droppedby: Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Morguthis | Mr. Punish
notes: One of the most rare and powerful two-handed [[Axe Weapons]] that was spotted for the first time on [[Berylia]]. As it is dropped by [[Morguthis]], one of the stronger (and, due to [[Shredderthrower]]s, more tedious to camp) [[Pharaohs]], it is one of the less commonly seen [[Pharaoh Rares]]. This item, or a similar item can be seen on the counter behind [[Ormuhn]], can not be identified correctly because of a [[Skull (item)|Skull]] above it. It has gained much in popularity after imbuement slots were implemented. Because of its three imbuement slots it is a viable option for anyone using a two-handed axe.

buyfrom: Alissa, Ariella: 5, Christine, James, Jehan the Baker, Lubo, Rodney
notes: You get a red apple if you go from [[Dawnport]] to [[Rookgaard]].\nThey are used in [[The Desert Dungeon Quest]], [[The Paradox Tower Quest]], [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]] and [[Mad Mage Room Quest]].

{{seealso|Red Dragon Leather/Skinning}} 100 are needed for an addon of [[Hunter Outfits]].

name: Red Mushroom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Flameborn | Haunted Treeling | Hellspawn | Orc Cult Inquisitor | Orc Cult Minion | Orclops Doomhauler | Orclops Ravager
notes: \n\nCan be found as a [[daily spawn]] in [[Dusalk's Troll Clan Cave]] east of the [[Dwarven Bridge]]. 10 of these are required for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Red Piece of Cloth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Moohtant | Barbarian Bloodwalker | Blood Hand | Blood Priest | Broken Shaper | Bullwark | Choking Fear | Dawnfire Asura | Depowered Minotaur | Execowtioner | Floating Savant | Fury | Furyosa | Gaz'haragoth | Glooth Bomb | Hellhound | Hero | Hideous Fungus | Humongous Fungus | Infernalist | Lava Golem | Mad Mage | Magma Crawler | Mawhawk | Minotaur Amazon | Minotaur Cult Follower | Minotaur Cult Prophet | Minotaur Cult Zealot | Minotaur Hunter | Minotaur Invader | Mooh'Tah Warrior | Moohtant | Moohtant Wallbreaker | Raging Mage | Renegade Knight | Terrorsleep | The Bloodtusk | The False God | The Pale Count | True Dawnfire Asura | Undead Jester | Vampire Viscount | Vile Grandmaster | Weakened Shlorg | Worm Priestess | Zugurosh | Zushuka
notes:
This item is used mainly for [[Outfits]] and [[Addons]]. It can be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s. The value of this item saw a considerable drop after the introduction of [[Oramond]] ([[Oramond Minotaurs]]), and then again when the [[Old Fortress]] was implemented. [[Irmana]] ([[Venore]]) trades a [[Red Robe]] for a Red Piece of Cloth.

Can be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s. A Red Piece of Cloth can be given to NPC [[Cael]] ([[Farmine]]) in exchange for a [[Dragon Throne]] after handing in 12 [[Tome of Knowledge|Tomes of Knowledge]].
50 of these are needed for the [[Barbarian Outfits Quest]].
50 of these are needed for the [[Assassin Outfits Quest]].
20 of these are needed for the '''male''' [[Summoner Outfits Quest]] / '''female''' [[Mage Outfits Quest]].
1 of these are needed for the [[Jester Outfits Quest]].

name: Red Robe
droppedby: Adept of the Cult | Banshee | Captain Jones | Pirate Ghost
notes:
Before the implementation of [[Pirate Ghost]]s and [[Adepts of the Cult]] in 2006, this item was considered very rare and valuable.
\n
\nCan be traded to [[Irmana]] for a [[Red Piece of Cloth]].
flavortext: The robe is artfully embroidered.

name: Red Rose
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crazed Beggar | Hero | Memory of a Hero | Pixie
notes:
A cheap but nice decoration item. Can be used as a [[Valentine's Day]] present along with [[Cherries]], [[Valentine's Cake]]s, [[Heart Pillow]]s and maybe a few [[Candy Cane]]s.\n

\nOne red rose is needed to brew the 'potion' used for curing [[Nemal]]'s blindness (according to [[Potion of Regained Vision (Book)|this book]]). You will get [[key 4037]] by doing this. There are some red roses in the garden to the northwest of the [[temple]] in [[Ab'Dendriel]], and there's one in the [[Carlin Graveyard]]. See also [[Daily Respawns]].

name: Red Spell Wand
notes:
This wand was transformed into the [[Wand of Dragonbreath]] in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]].
\nThis item no longer exists in game.

name: Red Tapestry
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Velvet, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Tapestries]] for more information about other types and colors of tapestries.

name: Red Tome
droppedby: Ferumbras | Infernalist | King Zelos | Morgaroth | Warlock
notes: One of the 5 volumes of [[The Mystic Secrets of Tibia]]. It is the second-most common tome in Tibia, following the [[Purple Tome]]. Many people use these tomes for decoration.
flavortext: It's a volume of The Mystic Secrets of Tibia.

name: Red Tunic

name: Rope
droppedby: Black Knight | Emerald Damselfly | Grynch Clan Goblin | Hero | Island Troll | Man in the Cave | Marsh Stalker | Meadow Strider | Memory of a Hero | Mountain Troll | Salamander | Salamander Trainer | Swampling | Troll | Troll Guard | Woodling | Young Troll
buyfrom: Ahmet, Al Dee: 50, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, John: 100, Larek, Lee'Delle: 45, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nelliem, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Raffael: 50, Rafzan, Richard: 50, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zethra, Zora
sellto: Ahmet, Al Dee: 8, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Lee'Delle: 8, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Rafzan: 8, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Richard: 8, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zethra: 8, Zora
notes:
The rope is the most commonly used [[Tools|tool]] in Tibia. Ropes are used to pull oneself up from a hole. Ropes work by using them on tiles called "[[Rope Spot|rope spots]]" which typically have a dark center. Not all holes have a rope spot, and not all rope spots are under a hole. It is possible to rope items and other players, but it is no longer possible to rope a creature. It is also possible to use a rope in the same way on a [[Ladder]], although in this case, it's only possible to rope an item or another player, you can't rope yourself. Alternatives to the standard rope are the [[Elvenhair Rope]], the [[Secret Agent Tool]]s and the [[Magic Rope]] spell. Note that each of these items may have their own unique properties. The spell, for example, cannot be used to rope other players or items.

According to the book [[The Adventurer's Guide to the Dungeons - Rope (Book)|Adventurer's Guide to the Dungeons]] from the [[Desert Dungeon Library|Jakundaf Desert Library]], a rope consists of many rat-tails tied together and it should never be missing in an adventurer's [[inventory]].
New players start at [[Dawnport]] with one in their backpack.

One can be obtained from a Chest in [[Edron]]'s basement, {{Mapper Coords|129.119|124.57|11|2|text=here}}.
history: Before the [[Updates/7.9|update 7.9]] this item looked like this: [[File:Rope (Old).gif]]. Since the [[Updates/8.7|update 8.7]] players are not able to rope wild creatures any more.

name: Rum
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
When you drink rum, you become temporarily drunk and not able to move correctly. You can also get rum by using any [[Containers#Fluid Containers|liquid container]] on a [[Rum Cask]], which can be found in [[Sabrehaven]], [[Nargor]] tavern and [[Liberty Bay]].
It looks the same as a [[Flask with Magical Oil]], a [[Flask with Oil and Blood]], and vials of [[Mead]], [[Mud]], [[Oil]], [[Beer]] and [[Tea]].








'''How to make Rum''' To make ''rum'', you need: [[Fire Bug]]
[[Sickle]]
[[Distilling Machine]]
Any fluid container like [[vial]]s or [[mug]]s. 1. Use the fire bug on [[Sugar Cane]]s to burn away the useless leaves.
2. Use the sickle to cut it and collect the [[Bunch of Sugar Cane]]s.
3. Use the bunch of sugar canes with a [[Distilling Machine]].
4. Use the fluid container on the distilling machine to get the rum. Note: Each bunch of sugar cane provides 10 seconds of rum production.


You need a [[Rum Flask]] of rum in the 'Searoutes around Yalahar' mission of the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]]. You also need 10 [[vial]]s of rum in the second mission of [[The Isle of Evil Quest]].

name: Shield of Honour
notes:
The Shield of Honour entered the game on January 7, 2002, as a gift for those who purchased a premium account of 7 months. This item was a special promotion for [[Tibia's 5th Anniversary]] and as a kick start to the introduction of premium accounts started only three months earlier. Due to its rarity, it has become a collector's [[item]].
20 shields of honour were awarded on a {{OfficialNewsArchive|3809|Rhyme Contest}} during [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]] celebrations. A shield of honour was awarded to {{character|Mytherin}}, in February 2017, for developing Tibialyzer. ThreeShieldsofHonour.JPG|Three Shields of Honour in a house on Antica
history:
The Shield of Honor was introduced to the game on January 7th, 2002 as a gift for those who purchased a premium account of 7 months. This prize was the first and last offered by Cipsoft, as they received many complaints from players that Cip was selling wealth. This item was a special promotion for Tibias 5th anniversary and as a kick start to the introduction of premium accounts started only three months earlier. This snippet of news can be seen in the Tibia news archive or as follows:
"On 7th January 1997 Tibia went online for the first time. This means that today is Tibia's fifth birtday! Because of our anniversary we want to give a special present to all players who sign up for a 7 months premium account or extend their premium accounts by 7 months. They will receive the so called shield of honour. This is a limited time offer. The payment must arrive until 31st January. Furthermore we want to announce that a few weeks from now we will introduce new premium account features. These include in-game support for guilds, the possibility for experienced characters to refine their vocations to achieve new titles, as well as new spells. Stay tuned!"
Some facts about this shield from the past: * 2002 - 157 of this shield existed. * 2004 - 120 of this shield existed * It is unknown how many shields exist in 2012, perhaps around 50% of the original amount. Many shields were eventually deleted/removed because of inactive players. Three were given at the Germany Tibia Convention as prizes and the winners were allowed to select which server the items would be placed on, all three choosing [[Premia]].
flavortext: A mighty shield awarded by the gods of Tibia.

{{Ilink|Small Enchanted Amethyst}} [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] {{Ilink|Sparking Rainbow Shield}} [[Sparking Rainbow Shield]] Increases your speed by 10 and gives 36 defense.
{{Ilink|Small Enchanted Emerald}} [[Small Enchanted Emerald]] {{Ilink|Terran Rainbow Shield}} [[Terran Rainbow Shield]] Regenerates 8 mana and 2 hitpoints every 6 seconds (300 hp and 1200 mana in total) and gives 37 defense.
{{Ilink|Small Enchanted Ruby}} [[Small Enchanted Ruby]] {{Ilink|Fiery Rainbow Shield}} [[Fiery Rainbow Shield]] Increases your shielding skill by 3 and gives 36 defense.
{{Ilink|Small Enchanted Sapphire}} [[Small Enchanted Sapphire]] {{Ilink|Icy Rainbow Shield}} [[Icy Rainbow Shield]] Gives you 39 defense.

* [[Gingerbreadman]]

* [[Christmas Present (Red)]]

history:
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy Relic Sword}} [[Icy Relic Sword]]
* {{Ilink|Earth Relic Sword}} [[Earth Relic Sword]]
* {{Ilink|Energy Relic Sword}} [[Energy Relic Sword]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery Relic Sword}} [[Fiery Relic Sword]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].

name: Rerun's Ring
notes:
Looks the same as an active [[Sword Ring]] (sparkling as if it was put in the ring slot).

\nThis is required for [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
flavortext: It belongs to Rerun.

name: Research Notes
notes: Looks the same as a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], a [[Parchment (Poetry)]], a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Wrinkled Parchment]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Resonance Crystal
notes:
After recording a song on it, it will become a [[Resonance Crystal (Recorded)]].
It looks the same as a [[Deep Crystal]], a [[Gnomish Resonance Crystal]], a [[Life Crystal]], a [[Purified Soul]], a [[Resonance Crystal (Recorded)]] and a [[Spectral Stone]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Explorer Society Quest]].

name: Ring of Wishes
notes:
It can be seen under the [[Serpentine Tower]] and in the [[Pythius The Rotten]]'s treasure room.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Ring of the Sky]]. Its data can be found on the [[Market]].
flavortext: (This item has 3 charges left).

name: Roasted Dragon Wings
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It will boost your [[shielding]] skill by 10 for one hour.

When using Roasted Dragon Wings, [[Fire Effect]] [[File:Fire Effect.gif|32px|link=Fire Effect]] will appear on the user who will get the following message: "{{Server Message|Your shielding is improved for one hour.}}"

To create this dish, you must speak with the [[Djinn]] [[Jean Pierre]] in [[Ankrahmun]], near the Marid Fortress, during the Hot Cuisine event.

'''Necessary Ingredients:'''

*1 Fresh [[Dead Bat]] [[File:Bat.gif]]
*3 [[JalapeÃ±o Pepper]]s [[File:JalapeÃ±o Pepper.gif]]
*5 [[Brown Bread]]s [[File:Brown Bread.gif]]
*2 [[Egg]]s [[File:Egg.gif]]
*1 [[Powder Herb]] [[File:Powder Herb.gif]]
*5 [[Red Mushroom]]s [[File:Red Mushroom.gif]]

Obtainable through the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]]. There's a chance you'll find one when opening a [[Brass-Shod Chest]] inside the [[Falcon Bastion]].
flavortext: You know why it's called 'dragon' when you feel the fire in your throat.

name: Robe of the Ice Queen
notes: It is a druid only robe that provides 12% ice protection, but causes the wearer to receive 12% more damage from energy. It has 4% more protection from ice and -4% from energy than the [[Glacier Robe]]. It is dropped by [[Ghazbaran]], first time seen on [[Guardia]].
flavortext: The soft tissue shimmers.

name: Robe of the Underworld
notes:
It gives 12% death protection, but increases damage taken from holy by 12%. It's often used on pvp servers to reduce damage taken from [[Sudden Death]] runes.
\nObtainable in the [[The Inquisition Quest]].

name: Ron the Ripper's Sabre
notes:
Used to look the same as the [[Sabre]] until [[Updates/8.6]] (Ron the Ripper's sabre sprite changed), but still share the same attributes apart from missing the [[Defense Modifier]].\n
\nUsed as a part of the [[Pirate Outfits Quest]] addon.

name: Rotten Heart of a Tree
notes: \n\nTemporarily obtained in [[Secret Service Quest]].

name: Round Blue Pillow
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Pillows]] for more information.

name: Round Purple Pillow
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Round Pillow]] for more information.

name: Round Red Pillow
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Round Pillow]] for more information.

name: Round Turquoise Pillow
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Round Pillow]] for more information.

name: Royal Axe
notes: A decent [[Axe Weapon|axe weapon]] for level 75s. A suggested upgrade is the [[Deepling Axe]] at level 80.\n\nCan be obtained through [[The Ultimate Challenges Quest]], Warlord Level.
flavortext: This axe is only granted to a warlord of the Svargrond arena.

name: Royal Crossbow
notes:
Its value grew considerably after the introduction of [[Prismatic Bolt|prismatic bolts]] and improvement of [[Infernal Bolt|infernal bolts]] in the [[Updates/9.6|summer update 2012]].
Obtainable in [[The Inquisition Quest]]

name: Royal Spear
droppedby: Blue Djinn | Dharalion | Dragon Lord | Efreet | Fahim the Wise | Green Djinn | Iks Chuka | Marid | Merikh the Slaughterer | Minotaur Hunter | Orc Leader | Quara Predator | Renegade Orc | Renegade Quara Predator | Shaburak Demon
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes: It's an affordable upgrade to regular [[Spear]]s. Paladins will see a significant improvement in their damage output even 5 levels below the required level. It doesn't offer comparable hit rates to [[Bows]] or [[Crossbows]]; the royal spear appeals to different requirements. Its main feature is its affordability. Typically new players will prefer to save money instead of spending it on ammunition for slightly higher experience rates.\n\nRoyal spears are slightly superior to [[Hunting Spear]]s in terms of attack rating, and are readily available from [[Equipment Shopkeeper NPCs|equipment shopkeepers]] in [[Premium Account|premium]] cities, whereas hunting spears can only be looted. Royal spears will break about 3.7% of the time, the same as spears. Break percentage was tested on training dummies over a period of hours, so it should be accurate. The range from which these can be thrown was reduced in the [[Updates/8.1|Christmas 2007 update]]; from 4 squares down to 3.

name: Royal Tapestry
notes: Used as a [[Tapestry]].

name: Runed Sword
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Prince Drazzak | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Sandking | The Time Guardian | Ushuriel | World Devourer
notes: This sword was implemented in the [[Updates/8.4|Winter Update 2008]]. In the past it had +3 Defense. Back then it was used often by [[Sorcerer]]s and [[Druid]]s due to its high defense modifier. Price can change extremely depending on each world.

name: Rusted Armor
droppedby: Broken Shaper | Deep Terror | Deepling Scout | Empowered Glooth Horror | Groam | Hellspawn | Leviathan | Lloyd | Lost Soul | Massive Earth Elemental | Massive Energy Elemental | Massive Fire Elemental | Mutated Bat | Professor Maxxen | Shrieking Cry-Stal | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | The Enraged Thorn Knight | Vampire Bride | War Golem | Werewolf | Worker Golem | Young Sea Serpent
notes:
Using a [[Rust Remover|rust remover]] on it will either '''break''' the armor or yield one of the following: * {{Ilink|Chain Armor}} [[Chain Armor]] * {{Ilink|Brass Armor}} [[Brass Armor]] * {{Ilink|Scale Armor}} [[Scale Armor]] * {{Ilink|Plate Armor}} [[Plate Armor]] (semi-rare) * {{Ilink|Knight Armor}} [[Knight Armor]] (rare) * {{Ilink|Paladin Armor}} [[Paladin Armor]] (rare) * {{Ilink|Crown Armor}} [[Crown Armor]] (very rare) (See [[Rusted Armor/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]]). Use a [[Rust Remover|rust remover]] to un-rust the armor. This [[Rusty Armor]] gives a medium chance of getting a rare item, higher than [[Heavily Rusted Armor|common]] but lower than [[Slightly Rusted Armor|rare]].
It can be obtained through the [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
history: In a small patch the weight was {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|changed}} from 100.00 oz to 120.00 oz on November 10, 2009.
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the armor you will be able to see what it is.
notes2: '''Note:''' Rusted armors can be found in two additional variations, [[Heavily Rusted Armor]] and [[Slightly Rusted Armor]].

name: Rusted Legs
droppedby: Deep Terror | Leviathan | Professor Maxxen | Worker Golem
notes:
Able to turn into: *[[Studded Legs]] *[[Chain Legs]] *[[Brass Legs]] *[[Plate Legs]] (semi-rare) *[[Knight Legs]] (rare) *[[Crown Legs]] (very rare) [[Rusted Legs/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]] Like the [[Rusty Armor]] it has a chance of breaking. You can un-rust these using a [[Rust Remover|rust remover]].
Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
history: In a small patch the weight was {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|changed}} from 35.00 oz to 70.00 oz on November 10, 2009.
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the legs you will be able to see what it is.

name: Ruthless Axe
droppedby: Anomaly | Branchy Crawler | Crypt Warrior | Ghazbaran | Hellhound | Kerberos | Rupture | Skeleton Elite Warrior | The Enraged Thorn Knight
notes: Considered a quite rare weapon in the past. It has almost the same sprite as a [[Steel Axe]], however this one has a double blade.
history: Before the [[Updates/Update 8.0|Summer 2007 update]], this axe had an attack value of 49. Currently it has 50 attack.

name: Sample of Sand Wasp Honey
notes:
It's the special item from Darashia.
Item need in ''Searoutes around Yalahar'' mission of [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Sample of Venorean Spice
notes:
It's the special item from Venore.
Item need in ''Searoutes around Yalahar'' mission of [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Santa Doll
value: 20,000 - 200,000 (depending of the Christmas Token Price on each Server)
notes:
You can get it through the [[Santa Event]], or as a gift from [[Santa Claus]].
\n\n* You can earn the achievement [[I Need a Hug]] by using a [[Panda Teddy]], a [[Stuffed Dragon]], a [[Baby Seal Doll]] and a Santa Doll.
sounds: {{Sound List|Ho ho ho!|Jingle bells, jingle bells...|Have you been naughty?|Have you been nice?|Merry Christmas!|Can you stop squeezing me now... I'm starting to feel a little sick.}}

name: Santa Hat
notes:
Used as decoration.
\nYou can get one by trading 50 [[Christmas Token]]s to [[Ruprecht]] on [[Vega]].

name: Sapphire Amulet
notes: It was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] for many years until it became a drop of [[Lady Tenebris]]. A Sapphire Amulet can be seen in the [[Treasure Rooms#Darashia Catacombs|Darashia Catacombs Treasure Room]].

name: Sapphire Hammer
droppedby: Animated Feather | Boar Man | Cliff Strider | Crystal Spider | Enslaved Dwarf | Icecold Book | Ironblight | Squid Warden | Stone Devourer | The Bloodweb | The Last Lore Keeper | The Souldespoiler | The Source of Corruption
flavortext: A beautiful gem is embedded in this weapon.

name: Scale from a Frozen Dragon
notes:
Looks like a [[Red Dragon Scale]] with some ice on it.
\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: This is the proof that there were once dragon lords on Okolnir which mutated into frost dragons.

name: Scarab Cheese
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
This item turns into a [[Moldy Cheese]] after 30 minutes. Watch out, since you can eat it.

\nItem needed for [[The Traveling Trader Quest]].
flavortext: It smells horrible and should not be in the sun for too long.

name: Secret Letter
notes:
You cannot read what is written in it.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Stamped Letter]], a [[Compromising Letter]], an [[Envelope from the Wizards]], a [[Letter to Eremo]], a [[Letter to Markwin]] and a [[Letter to Chantalle]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[Secret Service Quest]].

name: Seeds
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blightwalker | Carniphila | Crazed Summer Vanguard | Deathbine | Dryad | Dworc Venomsniper | Fahim the Wise | Jagged Earth Elemental | Marid | Marsh Stalker | Merikh the Slaughterer | Spit Nettle | Terror Bird | Tiquandas Revenge
notes: Trade 5 Seeds for a [[Flower Pot]] with [[Rosemarie]].
flavortext: They might be worth keeping, who knows what will happen to them.

name: Shadow Sceptre
droppedby: Anomaly | Burning Book | Choking Fear | Elder Wyrm | Enfeebled Silencer | Eyeless Devourer | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Lady Tenebris | Nightmare Scion | Phantasm | Rupture | Silencer | Spectre

name: Shard
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Barbarian Bloodwalker | Crystal Spider | Frost Dragon | Frost Giant | Frost Giantess | Gelidrazah the Frozen | Hirintror | Ice Dragon | Ice Golem | Ice Witch | Man in the Cave | Melting Frozen Horror | Shardhead | The Bloodweb | Yakchal | Zushuka
notes:
This shard is told to bear great magical powers, namely used to fuel great frost magic, whose magic has been mastered by the [[Nibelor]] shamans. It's a part of the [[Frostheart Spire]].

'''Note:''' This item can only be sold after having obtained both addons of the [[Norseman Outfits|Norseman Outfit]].


* 15 are needed for both addons of the [[Norseman Outfits Quest]].
* 1 can be obtained in the [[Skeleton Decoration Quest]].
* 1 can be obtained in the [[Frost Dragon Quest]].
* 1 can be obtained in the [[Chakoya Camp Quest]].
* 1 can be obtained in the [[Formorgar Mine Quest]].
* 1 can be obtained in the [[Lion Trophy Quest]].
* 1 can be obtained in the [[Berserk Potion Quest]].
* 5 can be obtained in the [[Sinatuki Quest]].
flavortext: It is a shattered part of the Frostheart Spire.

name: Shiver Arrow
droppedby: Crystal Wolf | Ghazbaran | Seacrest Serpent | Slick Water Elemental
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes: Causes half '''physical damage''' and half '''ice damage'''.\n50 of them can be obtained through the [[Tower Defence Quest]].

name: Shockwave Amulet
droppedby: Burster Spectre | Cursed Prospector | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Elder Wyrm | Energuardian of Tales | Essence of Malice | Harpy | High Voltage Elemental | Massive Energy Elemental | Spiky Carnivor | Wyrm | Yielothax
flavortext: It tickles your neck in a rather pleasant way and absorbs loads of damage.

name: Quara Tentacle
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Quara Constrictor | Quara Constrictor Scout | Renegade Quara Constrictor
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Rabbit's Foot
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Quest item temporarily obtained in the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]]. Obtained by using an [[Obsidian Knife]] or [[Kitchen Knife]] on a dead [[rabbit]].
\n''See also:'' [[Rabbit's Foot/Statistics]]

name: Rabbit's Foot Lucky Charm
notes: Quest item temporarily obtained in the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]]. Obtained by using a [[Handcrafted Ribbon]] on a [[Rabbit's Foot]].

name: Rare Crystal
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Life Crystal]], [[Matrix Crystal]], [[Memory Crystal]], [[Resonance Crystal]] and [[Spectral Stone]].
Item temporarily obtained in the [[Sea of Light Quest]].
flavortext: An extremely rare crystal you recovered from the Lost Mines.

name: Red Bed Kit
notes: Looks the same as a [[Furniture Package]] and many other [[Furniture]] kits.
history: It could be used on a bed to change the colors of the covers until [[Updates/12.20.9260|November, 2019]], when beds inside player's houses and guildhalls became movable. It was replaced by the [[Red Headboard]] and [[Red Footboard]]. \n\nSince the item may still be found in game but is no longer obtainable, it's a relatively rare item.
flavortext: Use it on your bed to change the bed to red.

name: Red Christmas Garland
notes: It can be obtained from a ([[Red Christmas Bundle|Red]]) [[Christmas Bundle]].

name: Red Cushioned Chair Kit
buyfrom: Allen, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Red Cushioned Chair}} [[Red Cushioned Chair]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a red cushioned chair.

name: Red Lantern
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Battlemaster Zunzu | Fazzrah | Lizard High Guard | Lizard Legionnaire | Lizard Zaogun
notes: A [[creature product]] that can be used for making a piece of [[furniture]].\n\nThe Red Lantern can be given to NPC [[Cael]] ([[Farmine]]) in exchange for a [[Dragon Statue (Item)|Dragon Statue]] after handing in 11 [[Tome of Knowledge|Tomes of Knowledge]].

name: Reins
notes:
A [[Reins]] can be used to tame a [[Black Sheep]]. Note: It has a chance of breaking when used.
Failed: '''The black sheep is trying to run away.'''
Failed: '''The black sheep ran away.'''
Broke: '''Oh no! The reins were torn.'''
Success: '''You tamed the black sheep.'''
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Replica of the Sceptre
notes:
This rod is a replica of [[Snake Sceptre]].
\nDelivered by NPC [[Zizzle]] in [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Reward Box
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Present]], [[Present (Postman)]] and [[Present (Explosive)]].
These are the possible things that the Reward Box can transform into:
* 4 - 16 [[Chameleon Rune]]s * [[Time Ring]] And possibly more. The Reward Box is given by NPC [[Casper]] after you successfully finish the [[Last Creep Standing]]. {{seealso|Reward Box/Statistics}}

name: Rice Ball
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: If you give a [[Bunch of Ripe Rice]] to NPC [[Swolt]] in [[Farmine]], he will make 10 Rice Balls for you. You need to have handed in 4 [[Tome of Knowledge]] to NPC [[Cael]] first before [[Swolt]] will make the Rice Balls for you. You need 10 of these to make a dish on the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Rope Belt
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Adept of the Cult | Crypt Defiler | Dark Monk | Fernfang | Grave Robber | Monk (Creature) | Monk of the Order | Nomad (Basic) | Nomad (Blue) | Nomad (Female) | Novice of the Cult
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Void]], [[Intricate Void]] and [[Powerful Void]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
flavortext: Though the name implies it, this simple and thin belt is not suited to be used as rope.
imbuements: Basic Void, Intricate Void, Powerful Void

name: Rotten Piece of Cloth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Rotten Witches' Cauldron Seed
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: This seed was gathered from the Rotten Witches' Cauldron Plant.

name: Rotworm Stew
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: It's hot, beefy and delicious. The perfect food for knights.

name: Rough Clay Statue
notes: When you "use" a [[Clay Lump]] you have a chance for it to turn into a little figurine. Sometimes it will be complete, sometimes it will not be. Unlike an ice cube, you cannot use it several times and it will not "break" it will just remain incomplete if you fail. [[File:Clay_Statue_(Making).gif]]
flavortext: It was made by "player name", whose potter skills could use some serious improvement.

name: Rough Marble Statue
notes: If you use [[Obsidian Knife]] on a [[Piece of Marble Rock]] you have a chance for it to turn into a Rough Marble Statue.
flavortext: This shoddy work was made by "player name".

name: Royal Draken Mail
notes: Obtained through the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].
history: * On the [[Test Server]] of its release, this armor gave +450 [[hitpoints]]. Due to a bug, players who wore this armor could not die as their health would not go below 450. As a result of this, CipSoft removed the extra bonus from this armor.

name: Royal Scale Robe
notes: During a [[Test Server]], this robe gave +20% protection against [[Mana Drain]] but this feature was replaced to [[Magic level]] +2.\nObtained through the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Sabretooth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Strike]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Sacred Earth
notes: \n\nNeeded in [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].
flavortext: This clay has been dug from sacred ground.

name: Sacred Tree Amulet
droppedby: Adult Goanna | Amenef the Burning | Arachnophobica | Baleful Bunny | Bashmu | Blemished Spawn | Cobra Scout | Cursed Book | Deepworm | Druid's Apparition | Earworm | Enusat the Onyx Wing | Eyeless Devourer | Gorgo | Guard Captain Quaid | Ink Blob | Lamassu | Liodile | Many Faces | Medusa | Noxious Ripptor | Nymph | Ogre Sage | Poisonous Carnisylvan | Ravenous Hunger | Rotten Golem | Sister Hetai | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The Many | The Welter | Turbulent Elemental | Young Goanna | Sabretooth (Creature)
flavortext: Its leaves stretch out to cover your whole body if you receive earth damage.

name: Safety Pin
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Dark Monk | Fernfang | Gravedigger | Monk (Creature) | Monk of the Order
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Sandcrawler Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
The value of the Sandcrawler Shell can rise significantly during '''August''', reaching '''10,000 â€“ 20,000{{GP}}''' as part of the [[Hot_Cuisine_Quest#Dish_12:_Blackjack|Hot Cuisine Quest]].
\nA total of five [[Sandcrawler Shell]]s are required to prepare the dish ''[[Pot of Blackjack]]'' {{Ilink|Pot of Blackjack}} during the [[Hot_Cuisine_Quest#Dish_12:_Blackjack|Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Santa Backpack
notes: See [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Santa Teddy
notes: [[Santa Claus]] may randomly give one to players during [[Christmas]].

name: Scale of Corruption
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Draken Abomination | Lizard Chosen | The Voice of Ruin
notes: Allows you to use the [[Teleport]] in the room under NPC [[Zlak]] (place it in the empty coal basin before entering the Teleport), which takes you to NPC [[Zizzle]] deep under [[Razachai]].

name: Scarab Pincers
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Ancient Scarab | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Fleshcrawler
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Scorpion Tail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\nUsed in the [[Witches' Cauldron Quest]].

name: Screaming Cherry
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: This fruit was gathered from the Screaming Cherry Tree.

name: Scribbled Sheet of Paper
notes: Looks the same as a [[Parchment (Gnomes)]] and [[Plans for a Strange Device]].Temporarily obtained in [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].
flavortext: Only a single word is scribbled on the sheet: SOLOSARASATIQUARIUM.

name: Scroll of Heroic Deeds
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Scroll of the Stolen Moment
notes: It was supposed to be the official [[FotoTibia]] item which was created by {{Character|Insane Jack}}. Since [[FotoTibia]] was removed from the fansite programme, this item will not be implemented ingame.
sounds: {{Sound List|Let me out!|What is going on?! I got so many years and I am still young...|Hail Fototibia!|I can swear this picture is moving!}}
flavortext: One wizard stole someone's moment and put it into this scroll long time ago. It was rewarded by Fototibia.

name: Scum Bag
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Grey Bag]] and a [[Bag of Screws]].
\nUsed in the [[World Task]] [[A Pirate's Death to Me]] to capture [[Spectral Scum]]. The [[Blue Electricity Effect]] {{Ilink|Blue Electricity Effect}} and the folloing message will appear when capturing a spectral scum: "{{Sound|ZZzzizzle!}}". If you've captured 5 or more spectral scums, the following message will also appear: "{{Server Message|You've caught enough scum.}}".

name: Scythe Leg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Scythe of the Reaper
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Boogey]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nLooks similar to a [[Scythe]], but then with a touch of death.
\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: This scythe has harvested countless souls and still hungers for more.

name: Sea Serpent Scale
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Sea Serpent Trophy
notes: You cannot hang this item on a wall.

name: Sedge Hat
notes: The name of this item was changed from Coolie Hat to Sedge Hat because "coolie" is a derogatory term used mainly in Eastern Asia, India and Guyana. The name change was proposed by {{character|Brother of Conway}}.\n\nObtainable from the [[An Interest In Botany Quest]]. You give this item to NPC [[Cranky Lizard Crone]] in exchange for the second addon of the [[Wayfarer Outfits]].
flavortext: This simple hat might be more worth than what it looks like.

name: Serpent Crest
notes: Given to you by [[Zalamon]] when completing the [[Children of the Revolution Quest]], and used in the [[Warmaster Outfits Quest]].
flavortext: This crest seems important. You shouldn't lose it.

name: Shadow Orb
notes: Looks the same as a [[Memory Stone]] and a [[Mind Stone]].\nPossibly temporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 10.

name: Shaggy Tail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Cublarc the Plunderer | Fleabringer | Gnarlhound | Orc Marauder
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Shamanic Hood
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Shapechanger
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Spellwand]].
\nUsed in the [[Last Creep Standing]] [[World Quests|World Task]]. Get it from [[Casper]], [[Kurik]]'s apprentice by saying "Change".
flavortext: It might do some funny things to you.

name: Shapeshifter Ring
notes: When equipping this ring, it will turn you into one of the event monsters ([[Carniphila]], [[Quara Hydromancer]], [[Lost Soul]], [[Blightwalker]], [[Mutated Rat]], [[Zombie]], [[Nightstalker]] and [[Pharaoh]]). Its effects will last for another 60 minutes after being taken off. The ring last for 600 minutes (i.e. 10 hours). This ring will only work if your world succeeded in the [[Last Creep Standing]] world task.\nReward from [[Last Creep Standing]].
flavortext: It will only work for a few days after the challenge of Kurik has been won.

name: Shield of Care
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Monstor]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nLooks the same as a [[Heart Pillow]].\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: This shield will surely care for anyone who can bear it.

name: Shield of Corruption
droppedby: Draken Abomination | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | The Sinister Hermit (Blue) | The Souldespoiler
notes:
An extremely rare shield, very hard to obtain. Since it's dropped by normal spawning creatures, its value will drop over time. It's an excellent choice for [[Knight]]s using [[Sword Weapons]]. However, a [[Mastermind Shield]] is much cheaper and has 1 higher defense point (but lacks the [[Sword Fighting]] +3 and weighs 8 oz. more).
\nAfter the implementation of [[Imbuing]] with the [[Updates/11.02|Winter Update 2016]], its price skyrocketed because this shield got 1 imbuing slot, making it more valuable.

name: Shield of the White Knight
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Mephiles]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
\nIt looks the same as a [[White Knight Token]].\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: It seems a bit chunky, but what was good enough for a white knight should be good for everyone.

name: Shiny Stone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Cliff Strider | Crystal Wolf | Earth Overlord | Enslaved Dwarf | Eternal Guardian | Ethershreck | Fahim the Wise | Gargoyle | Ghastly Dragon | Grorlam | Ironblight | Merikh the Slaughterer | Metal Gargoyle | Orewalker | Spectre | Stone Golem | Stonecracker | The Shatterer
notes:
See also [[Shiny Stone/Refining Statistics|refining statistics]].
\nYou can get [[Gold Coin]], [[Platinum Coin]], [[Small Diamond]], [[Crystal Coin]], and more items by refining it (using with a [[Pick]]).
After picking 100 Shiny Stones you will receive the achievement [[Petrologist]].
flavortext: Something precious might be sealed in it.

name: Rat Cheese
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard | Stonerefiner
notes: A new type of [[Cheese]].

name: Rat God Doll
droppedby: Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard
notes: The first Rat God Doll was given to {{Character|Bunny Luv}} as an {{OfficialNewsArchive|2233|award}} for naming the [[Corym]] race.\n<!-- note: this is to become a rather common item ... no reason to list owners -->

name: Ratana
droppedby: Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard | Werehyaena

name: Raven Herb
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: \nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
history: This used to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable item]] for 11 years, until it was introduced to the game in the [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update of 2017]].

name: Reagent Flask
notes:
Can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.28|126.94|10|4|text=here}}.
Looks the same as [[Milk]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[War Against The Hive Quest]].

name: Receipt (Fail)
notes:
'''Example of a Fail Receipt''':
{{Book|booktype=Receipt (Fail)|content= Date: 14. Nov 2014 - 13:01:14
Type: Guild to Guild Transfer
Gold Amount: 2000000
Receipt Owner: Tjured Ninja of Pink Ninjas
Recipient: Blue Ninjas

We are sorry to inform you that we could not fulfil your request, due to a lack of the required sum on your guild account.}}
Of a guild bank transfer, it will inform you of the date and time the transfer happened, the type of transfer, the amount of [[gold]] that was transferred, who transferred this money, and finally who received it. You will only receive this if the transaction was unsuccessful. If, however, the transaction was successful, you will receive a [[Receipt (Success)]]. The main difference between the two is the flavor text and the contents.
flavortext: This receipt serves as a reference to an unsuccessful guild bank transfer.

name: Receipt (Success)
notes:
'''Example of a Success Receipt''':
{{Book|booktype=Receipt (Success)|content= Date: 14. Nov 2014 - 13:01:14
Type: Guild Deposit
Gold Amount: 2000000
Receipt Owner: Tjured Ninja of Pink Ninjas
Recipient: Pink Ninjas

We are happy to inform you that your transfer request was successfully carried out.}}
Of a guild bank transfer, it will inform you of the date and time the transfer happened, the type of transfer, the amount of [[gold]] that was transferred, who transferred this money, and finally who received it. If the transaction was unsuccessful for whatever reason, you will instead receive a [[Receipt (Fail)]]. The main difference between the two is the flavor text and the contents.
flavortext: This receipt serves as a reference to a successful guild bank transfer.

name: Red Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Red Balloon (Inflated)|Red Balloon]] {{Ilink|Red Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Red Crystal Fragment
droppedby: Animated Guzzlemaw | Bloodback | Boar Man | Boogy | Cobra Assassin | Cobra Vizier | Crazed Summer Rearguard | Dreadful Disruptor | Emerald Tortoise | Enslaved Dwarf | Faceless Bane | Feroxa | Floating Savant | Frazzlemaw | Gazer Spectre | Girtablilu Warrior | Guzzlemaw | Infernal Demon | Ironblight | Kroazur | Lamassu | Lava Golem | Lavafungus | Mazoran | Memory of a Frazzlemaw | Nighthunter | Omrafir | Parder | Pirat Mate | Plagirath | Prince Drazzak | Ragiaz | Reality Reaver | Stabilizing Reality Reaver | Tremor Worm | Venerable Girtablilu | Vulcongra | Weeper | Werehyaena | Mantosaurus
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan

name: Red Hair Dye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Lost Basher | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Lost Thrower
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Red Power Core
notes: Looks the same as a [[Coloured Egg (Red)|Red Coloured Egg]].\n\nPart of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 12.

name: Red Teleport Crystal
notes: Use them to enter the [[Gnomebase Alpha]] [[Warzones]]. Can be obtained from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s.
flavortext: Such crystals are used to charge the teleporters to the warzones.

name: Ring of Ending
notes:
== The Ring of Ending Creation == The '''Ring of Ending''' is a [[Prime Artefacts|Prime Artefact]] that can be created by using a [[String of Mending]] on an equipped [[Broken Ring of Ending]]. === Creation Process === * '''Items Required:''' [[String of Mending]] and an equipped [[Broken Ring of Ending]]. * '''Duration:''' The process takes '''1 minute and 30 seconds (90s)'''. * '''Cancellation:''' If the ring is removed before the process is complete, the [[Broken Ring of Ending]] and [[String of Mending]] will separate safely, and neither item will be destroyed. === Risk and Outcome === * '''Risk:''' There is a '''50% chance of [[Death|dying]]''' in the process. This chance is exactly the same as the chance of success (50%). * '''Death Consequence:''' If you die, you will lose all of your [[blessings]] except [[Twist of Fate]] (as an ordinary PvE death) and the [[String of Mending]] and [[Broken Ring of Ending]] will both be destroyed. === Server Messages and Effects Timeline === Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 
'''Ring of Ending Creation Timeline'''
TimeEffectServer Message
'''0s'''None{{Server Message|The smooth string of mending coils around your whole arm as if it was to devour it.}}
'''1s'''{{Ilink|Cloud Effect}}{{Server Message|The ring feels quite heavy now. Nothing else happens.}}
'''10s'''{{Ilink|Green Sparkles Effect}}{{Server Message|The ring feels even heavier. You feel slightly stronger, however.}}
'''20s'''{{Ilink|Yellow Confetti Effect}}{{Server Message|You feel better, more energetic than ever before. The ring seems to wrap itself tighter around your finger.}}
'''30s'''{{Ilink|Blood Effect}}{{Server Message|The ring now cuts your flesh. However, you feel fast as lightning and strong as a dragon, fires seem to burn within you.}}
'''40s'''{{Ilink|Blue Electricity Effect}}{{Server Message|You feel as if you could touch the stars and see beyond even the dimmest of them. The ring hurts you now.}}
'''50s'''{{Ilink|Energy Effect}}{{Server Message|The ring now seems to be as hot as fire while at the same time cold as ice. Put it off or it will seriously hurt you.}}
'''60s'''{{Ilink|Death Effect}}{{Server Message|Pain is no word for what you feel anymore. If you do not put the ring off it MAY kill you. Chances are 50/50.}}
'''70s'''{{Ilink|Death Effect}}{{Server Message|Your pain transports you in a different world, you are alone there. Filled with anguish. You may live or it MAY KILL YOU.}}
'''80s'''{{Ilink|Death Effect}}{{Server Message|You became pain itself. You are mere seconds away from death. If you do not PUT OFF THE RING, you MAY actually DIE.}}
=== Final Message (90s) === The final message depends on the outcome: * '''Success:''' {{Server Message|The ring closes. It feels cool now. With the ring restored, you have returned.}} * '''Death:''' {{Server Message|A bright explosion bursts from inside the ring. You die.}} === Other Use === * As a [[Prime Artefacts|Prime Artefact]], the ring can be used to color a [[Cloth Fragment (Ring)|Cloth Fragment]] from appearing as this {{Ilink|Cloth Fragment (Ring)}} to appearing as {{Ilink|The Ring of Ending Carpet}}.
flavortext: This constantly rotating ring is perfectly weightless, yet feels infinitely heavy at the same time. You read: This eternal ring was forged in the pain of (player name) and hardened by (his/her) endurance.

name: Rocking Chair Kit
buyfrom: Allen, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Rocking Chair}} [[Rocking Chair]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a rocking chair.

name: Rocking Horse Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Rocking Horse}} [[Rocking Horse]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a rocking horse.

name: Roll of Covering
notes: It is used to build a [[Glooth Glider]].\nPart of [[Hero of Rathleton Quest]].

name: Rolling Pin (Rookgaard)
notes:
It seems like a good weapon to hit someone with when they are not looking.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Rolling Pin]] and a [[Club of the Fury]].\nObtained and used on a distracted orc during [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].
flavortext: A good item to knock out unsuspicious orcs.

name: Rorc Egg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Rorc Feather
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Basic Electrify]], [[Intricate Electrify]] and [[Powerful Electrify]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Basic Electrify, Intricate Electrify, Powerful Electrify

name: Rough Red Gem
notes: It can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.20|126.94|10|4|text=here}}. It looks the same as a [[Blood Crystal]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[Liquid Black Quest]].
flavortext: This blood red gem is still rough.

name: Round Table Kit
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem, Yulas
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Small Round Table}} [[Small Round Table]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a round table.

name: Royal Medal
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.
\nThis item can only be obtained as a [[fansites|Promoted or Supported Fansite]] contest prize.

name: Rubber Cap
droppedby: Glooth Bandit | Glooth Brigand | Glooth Fairy | Glooth Golem | Rotten Golem | Turbulent Elemental
notes: At level 70 this becomes a nice alternative to [[Terra Hood]].

name: Runic Ice Shield
droppedby: Gelidrazah the Frozen | Hirintror | Melting Frozen Horror
notes: Used to be a very rare item as it was only dropped by the boss Hirintror. As of the 20th anniversary of Tibia, it is also dropped by Gelidrazah the Frozen.

name: Sack of Herbs
notes: Can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.32|126.90|10|4|text=here}}.Temporarily obtained in [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].

name: Sandfish
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Can be [[Fishing|fished]] during the [[River Runs Deep Mini World Change]].

name: Santa Music Box
notes: When used, provides white music notes until turned off (using it again).

name: Sceptre Part (Cusp)
notes: Obtain the other two [[Sceptre Part]]s if you want to construct a [[Snake Sceptre]]. Obtained and used during the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Sceptre Part (Emerald)
notes: Obtain the other two [[Sceptre Part]]s if you want to construct a [[Snake Sceptre]]. Obtained and used during the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Sceptre Part (Shaft)
notes: Obtain the other two [[Sceptre Part]]s if you want to construct a [[Snake Sceptre]]. Obtained and used during the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Scorpion Sceptre
notes:
Used to tame a [[Sandstone Scorpion]] {{Ilink|Scorpion King}}. Like all [[Taming Items]], there is a chance for this to break. Failed: '''The sandstone scorpion eludes the influence of the scepter.'''
Failed: '''The sandstone scorpion flees.'''
Succeeded: '''You tamed the sandstone scorpion.''' Sc.jpg|Scorpion sceptre on [[calmera]]
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Scroll (Brown)
notes: It looks the same as an [[Old Parchment (Brown)]] and a [[Blurred Transcript]].

name: Scroll (TBI)
notes: Looks the same as a [[Lottery Ticket]] and a [[Poem Scroll]].\nPart of the [[Secret Service Quest]] ([[TBI]]).
flavortext: The correspondence written on this scroll could be considered quite compromising.

name: Sea Ear
flavortext: A sea shell formed like a listening ear, shimmering enticingly.

name: Seacrest Hair
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 10 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Frost]] and [[Powerful Frost]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Seacrest Pearl
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
May be worth holding on to, as it is required for a quest. Not very hard to loot.
Two are needed in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]].
flavortext: A giant pearl that glows and shimmers in all the wonderful hues of nacre.

name: Seacrest Scale
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It's a creature product, with no known use at the present. It can be sold to an NPC for a decent price and has a high gp-to-oz ratio.

name: Seashell Book (Blue)
notes:
It is a really important book for the deeplings, you can get it using 1 [[Key to the Drowned Library]] in a [[Seashell Bookcase]].\n

\n1 of them is needed to get Deepling Outfit in [[Liquid Black Quest]].
flavortext: I write this trilogy of blackness and death to warn the world of the evil in the depths.

name: Seashell Book (Green)
notes:
It is a really important book for the deeplings, you can get it using one [[Key to the Drowned Library]] in a [[Seashell Bookcase]].\n

\n1 of them is needed to get Deepling Outfit in [[Liquid Black Quest]].
flavortext: And they drove them mad and to the edge of extinction. Extinction of the world that surrounded them.

name: Seashell Book (Yellow)
notes:
It is a really important book for the deeplings, you can get it using one [[Key to the Drowned Library]] in a [[Seashell Bookcase]].\n

\n1 of them is needed to get Deepling Outfit in [[Liquid Black Quest]].
flavortext: Darkness clutches the creatures of the sea to end all living things. Be watchful of this black void.

name: Shadow Ashes
notes: Temporarily obtained in [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: The ashes are warm and greasy to the touch. They emit a faint, dark glow.

name: Shimmer Ball
notes: [[File:Shimmer Ball (Object).gif]] One of only two items to float on water, the other being the [[Waterball]]. It can be used in a [[Swimming Zone]] to play [[Water Polo]] with. It can only be picked up on land, not on water. Unlike most [[Shimmer Swimmer]] products, this item does not decay.\nUse a [[Shimmer Swimmer]] on a [[Bellow]] to get this item. Upon creating one, you will receive the following message: ''Pumping up the surprisingly sturdy shimmer swimmer with air from the bellow suddenly transforms him into a ball!''

name: Shimmer Bow
notes:
This weapon lasts for a total of 7 days.\n
\nCan be obtained by transforming a [[Shimmer Swimmer]] by using it on [[Yielocks]]. Upon creating one, you will receive the following message: ''Stringing the surprisingly strong hairs of the yielothax on the broad shimmer swimmer suddenly transforms him into a bow!''
flavortext: This bow seems to be alive but keeps perfectly still.

name: Shimmer Glower
notes: Can be used for decoration or as a faint light source, if equipped.\nCan be obtained by using a [[Shimmer Swimmer]] on an [[Eye of a Deepling]]. Upon creating one, you will receive the following message: ''Fitting the deepling eye into the shimmer swimmer and squeezing the surprisingly resilient shimmer swimmer makes him glow!''

name: Shimmer Rod
notes:
Seems to have similar power to [[Hailstorm Rod]] with higher level requirement due to 1 sqm longer range, which makes it a better choice for hunting with. This item lasts for a total of 7 days.\n
\nCan be obtained by transforming [[Shimmer Swimmer]] using it on [[Yielowax]]. Upon creating one, you will receive the following message: ''Waxing the surprisingly dry scales of the shimmer swimmer with the strange yielowax suddenly transforms him into a rod!''
flavortext: It feels cold and smooth.

name: Shimmer Swimmer
notes:
It can be found and fished at [[Lake Equivocolao]], north of [[Port Hope]] during the [[Twisted Waters]] [[World Changes|World Change]]. Upon catching one, you will receive the following message: ''A Shimmer Swimmer! It is said that this rare creature only appears once each day in the murkiest of waters!'' Once fished it will only respawn after 20 hours (character based time, and real life time). Getting this fish can be quite time consuming when using a character with a low [[Fishing|fishing skill]]. It can be transformed into: *{{Ilink|Shimmer Glower}} [[Shimmer Glower]], when used on an {{Ilink|Eye of a Deepling}}[[Eye of a Deepling]]
(''Fitting the deepling eye into the shimmer swimmer and squeezing the surprisingly resilient shimmer swimmer makes him glow!'') *{{Ilink|Shimmer Bow}} [[Shimmer Bow]], when used on {{Ilink|Yielocks}} [[Yielocks]]
(''Stringing the surprisingly strong hairs of the yielothax on the broad shimmer swimmer suddenly transforms him into a bow!'') *{{Ilink|Shimmer Sword}} [[Shimmer Sword]] when used on a {{Ilink|Flintstone}}[[Flintstone]]
(''Sharpening the surprisingly strong nose of the shimmer swimmer with a flintstone suddenly transforms him into a sword!'') *{{Ilink|Shimmer Wand}} [[Shimmer Wand]], when used on a {{Ilink|Broken Ring of Ending}}[[Broken Ring of Ending]]
(''Holding the broken ring of ending near the surprisingly lively eyes of the shimmer swimmer suddenly transforms him into a wand!'') *{{Ilink|Shimmer Rod}} [[Shimmer Rod]], when used on {{Ilink|Yielowax}}[[Yielowax]]
(''Waxing the surprisingly dry scales of the shimmer swimmer with the strange yielowax suddenly transforms him into a rod!'') *{{Ilink|Shimmer Ball}} [[Shimmer Ball]], when used on a{{Ilink|Bellow}} [[Bellow]]
(''Pumping up the surprisingly sturdy shimmer swimmer with air from the bellow suddenly transforms him into a ball!'') *{{Ilink|Babel Swimmer}} [[Babel Swimmer]] (presumably), when used on an unknown item. '''These items lasts for a total of 7 days each, except for the [[Shimmer Glower]] and the [[Shimmer Ball]], which will last forever.''' If you fish 50 shimmer swimmers, you'll receive the [[achievement]] "[[Biodegradable]]".
flavortext: This fish, and rare ingredient, can only be found in the dirtiest, murkiest and muddiest of waters.

name: Shimmer Sword
notes:
It has the same attack value as [[Relic Sword]] but can be properly handled by players of level 40 while [[Relic Sword]] requires level 50. This item lasts for a total of 7 days.\n
\nCan be obtained by using a [[Shimmer Swimmer]] on a [[Flintstone]]. Upon creating one, you will receive the following message: ''Sharpening the surprisingly strong nose of the shimmer swimmer with a flintstone suddenly transforms him into a sword!''

name: Shimmer Wand
notes:
Seems to have similar power to [[Wand of Starstorm]] with higher level requirement due to 1 sqm longer range. It's a good choice when you want to keep longer distance from creatures while running away or hunting in team, but it will last only 7 days.\n
\nCan be obtained by transforming [[Shimmer Swimmer]] using it on [[Broken Ring of Ending]]. Upon creating one, you will receive the following message: ''Holding the broken ring of ending near the surprisingly lively eyes of the shimmer swimmer suddenly transforms him into a wand!''
flavortext: It feels cold and smooth.

name: Shiny Blade
droppedby: Abyssador | Deathstrike | Gnomevil | Melting Frozen Horror
notes: It looks the same as [[The Epiphany]] [[File:The Epiphany.gif]], but in blue.

name: Shopping Bag
notes: You will get this bag from any shopkeeper. Right-click on any item in the [[NPC Trade]] box and select '''"Buy in shopping bags"'''.

name: Rattling Gourd
notes: It's a rattling [[Gourd]] and looks the same as that one.\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It is filled with shark teeth and onyx chips and attached to a short stick.

name: Raw Meat
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Clomp | Clomp | Museum Stone Rhino | Stone Rhino
notes:
Can be obtained by [[skinning]] a dead [[Clomp]]. [[Use]] it on a [[Campfire]] to [[Roasted Meat|roast]] it (''You are roasting the fresh and bloody meat over the fire. Soon it smells appetizing.'').
{{Seealso|Raw Meat/Skinning}}
flavortext: It doesn't look appetizing. Perhaps it would taste better if roasted.

name: Red Paint
notes: It can be used to paint something you want to imbue with shamanic powers.<noinclude>Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: It is sticky and smells of decayed plants.

name: Red Pit Demon
buyfrom: Agostina;For 6000 [[Drome Points]],Alberto;For 6000 [[Drome Points]],Emilio;For 6000 [[Drome Points]],Fabiana;For 6000 [[Drome Points]],Lorenzo;For 6000 [[Drome Points]]
notes:
It was obtainable by opening a [[Surprise Cube]], although these cubes are frequently preserved since they are no longer acquirable.
{{Seealso|Surprise Cube/Statistics}}
history: Before the [[Monster Arena]] was replaced with the [[Tibiadrome]], there existed an opportunity to receive a [[Surprise Cube]] from [[Lorenzo]] when exchanging [[Arena Badge]]s for potions. The likelihood of obtaining a Surprise Cube increased with the number of badges required for specific potions. These cubes could then be opened for a chance to receive a [[Pit Demon (Item)]].
flavortext: Figurine 5 of 5.

name: Red Powder
notes: It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Rift Bow
droppedby: Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Grimeleech | Hellflayer | Mazoran | Ragiaz | The Scourge of Oblivion | Vexclaw

name: Rift Crossbow
droppedby: Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Grimeleech | Hellflayer | Mazoran | Razzagorn | Shulgrax | The Scourge of Oblivion | Vexclaw | Zamulosh

name: Rift Lamp
notes: When you [[Lit Rift Lamp|lit]] it it appears to charge for some time: [[File:Rift Lamp (Charging).gif]]

name: Rift Lance
droppedby: Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Grimeleech | Hellflayer | Lloyd | Plagirath | Ragiaz | Razzagorn | Shulgrax | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Souldespoiler | Vexclaw

name: Rift Shield
droppedby: Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Grimeleech | Hellflayer | Mazoran | Plagirath | Ragiaz | Tarbaz | The Scourge of Oblivion | Vexclaw | Zamulosh

name: Rift Tapestry
notes: See [[Tapestries]] for more information about other types and colors of tapestries.\n\nReward for completing [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].

name: Ring of Blue Plasma
droppedby: Ahau | Alptramun | Amenef the Burning | Anomaly | Arachnophobica | Brain Squid | Breach Brood | Burster | Capricious Phantom | Cave Chimera | Count Vlarkorth | Crazed Summer Rearguard | Distorted Phantom | Dread Intruder | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Eradicator | Essence of Malice | Freakish Lost Soul | Guard Captain Quaid | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Lord Azaram | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Mould Phantom | Outburst | Paladin's Apparition | Pirat Bombardier | Plagueroot | Reality Reaver | Realityquake | Rupture | Sir Baeloc | Sorcerer's Apparition | Soul-Broken Harbinger | Sparkion | The Nightmare Beast | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Unarmored Voidborn | Usurper Commander | Venerable Girtablilu | Vibrant Phantom | World Devourer | Dreadful Disruptor
notes: It can be sold for the full price to the NPC even if used, as long as it does not disappear when used completely.

name: Ring of Green Plasma
droppedby: Ahau | Alptramun | Anomaly | Brachiodemon | Brain Squid | Breach Brood | Burster | Count Vlarkorth | Distorted Phantom | Dread Intruder | Dreadful Disruptor | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Eradicator | Essence of Malice | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | Katex Blood Tongue | King Zelos | Lord Azaram | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Outburst | Plagueroot | Reality Reaver | Realityquake | Rupture | Sir Baeloc | Sister Hetai | Sorcerer's Apparition | Sparkion | Srezz Yellow Eyes | The Nightmare Beast | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Unarmored Voidborn | Utua Stone Sting | World Devourer | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes: Increases your [[Mana]] and [[Hitpoints]] [[Regeneration]] for 30 minutes by the rate of 1 [[HP]] and 4 [[Mana|MP]] per 6 seconds, which means it recovers 1200 [[Mana|MP]] and 300 [[HP]] in total. It can be sold for the full price to the NPC even if used, as long as it does not disappear when used completely. \n}}\n<noinclude>[[Category:Regenerative Items]]</noinclu

name: Roasted Meat
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Obtain this food by [[use|using]] [[Raw Meat]] on a [[Campfire]].
\n10 pieces are needed during the [[Krailos Quest]].
\n5 pieces can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.

name: Rod of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Rod of Carving (Charged)}} [[Rod of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Rod of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Rod of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Rod of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Rod of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this rod received 2 imbuing slots.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Rod of Carving, Rod of Mayhem and Rod of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Rod of Destruction}} [[Rod of Destruction]].

name: Rod of Carving (Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Rod of Carving]] charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 20% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Rod of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Rod of Carving (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Rod of Carving]] heavily charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Rod of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Rod of Carving (Overcharged)
notes: This item is a [[Rod of Carving]] overcharged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Rod of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Rod of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s. This is the only rod that may be imbued with Critical Hit imbuements ([[Basic Strike|Basic]], [[Intricate Strike|Intricate]] and [[Powerful Strike]]).
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Rod of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Rod of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Rod of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Rod of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Rod of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Rod of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this rod received 2 imbuing slots.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Rod of Carving, Rod of Mayhem and Rod of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Rod of Destruction}} [[Rod of Destruction]].

name: Rod of Mayhem (Charged)
notes:
This item is a [[Rod of Mayhem]] charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Rod of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Rod of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)
notes: This is a heavily charged [[Rod of Mayhem]], which was charged by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 15% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 25% to 40%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Rod of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Rod of Mayhem (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an overcharged [[Rod of Mayhem]], charged by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s. It is possible to fail overcharging, in this case you will lose your 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 20% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 30% to 60%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Rod of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Rod of Carving, Rod of Mayhem and Rod of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Rod of Destruction}} [[Rod of Destruction]].
