With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Rod of Remedy|uncharged versions]].

name: Rusted Helmet
droppedby: Memory of an Ogre | Ogre Brute | Shaper Matriarch
notes:
Using a [[Flask of Rust Remover]] on it will remove the rust and uncover a helmet. There is a chance the helmet will fall apart upon trying to do so. Able to turn into:
*[[Brass Helmet]]
*[[Studded Helmet]]
*[[Iron Helmet]]
*[[Steel Helmet]]
*[[Crown Helmet]]
*[[Crusader Helmet]]

[[Rusted Helmet/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]]

Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the helmet you will be able to see what it is.

name: Rusted Shield
notes: Information about this item can be found in [[Market]]. However, it hasn't been obtained in-game yet, therefore this is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the shield you will be able to see what it is.

name: Rusty Boots (Common)
notes:
Information about this item can only be found in game files, it hasn't been obtained in-game yet, therefore this is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]. Using a [[Flask of Rust Remover]] on it will probably remove the rust and uncover a pair of boots. There might be a chance the rusty item will fall apart upon trying to do so.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Rusty Boots (Semi-Rare)]] and a [[Rusty Boots (Rare)]].\nSuccessfully polishing this item will probably count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the boots you will be able to see what it is.

name: Sacred Antler Talisman
notes: Sacred [[Antler Talisman]]. Use it on [[Tainted Soul]] in order to [[Redeemed Soul|redeem it]].
flavortext: It is an antler, entwined with star herb and blessed with holy water.

name: Sacred Bowl
notes: Looks the same as a [[Bowl]].Part of the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].
flavortext: This bowl was made from sacred wood and is currently untreated.

name: Sacred Bowl of Purification
notes: Part of the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].
flavortext: This bowl was coated with sacred clay and can be used to purify small amounts of corrupted water.

name: Sacred Coal
notes: Part of the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].
flavortext: Purified by sacred fires, this coal has the power to cleanse a significant amount of impure water.

name: Scroll of Ascension
flavortext: It is inscribed with faintly glowing ink and sealed with the letter F.

name: Scroll of Ascension (Used)
notes: Used [[Scroll of Ascension]]. You need to wait an hour before using it again.
flavortext: It is inscribed with faintly glowing ink and sealed with the letter F.

name: Shamanic Mask
droppedby: Ogre Brute | Ogre Savage | Ogre Shaman
notes: It can be sold to NPC [[Mugruu]] after finishing [[Vuzrog]]'s questline.\nCan be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.

name: Shamanic Talisman
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Ogre Shaman | Ogre Sage | Ogre Shaman
notes:
It can be sold to NPC [[Mugruu]] after finishing [[Vuzrog]]'s questline.
\nCan be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.

name: Shark Teeth
notes:
Some ferocious shark once boasted these teeth.
Part of the [[Krailos Quest]] and the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]]. It can be obtained once per day per player from a [[Floating Green Flask (Quest)|Floating Green Flask]] off the northern coast of [[Krailos]].

Handing this item in for the Threatened Dreams Quest is required to obtain the [[Toothfairy Assistant]] achievement.
flavortext: They are engraved with tiny unholy glyphs.

name: Sheet of Tracing Paper (Blank)
notes: Looks the same as a [[Blank Paper]]. Part of [[The Explorer Society Quest]].
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|2012 Spring Patch]] the sprite of Sheet of Tracing Paper (Blank) changed from [[File:Sheet of Tracing Paper (Blank Old).gif]] to [[File:Sheet of Tracing Paper (Blank).gif]].
flavortext: It is blank.

name: Sheet of Tracing Paper (Full)
notes: It looks the same as a [[Crude Primitive Printout]], [[Narsai's List]], [[Rita's Letter]], a [[Ransom Note]], a [[Sheet of Paper]], [[Shimun's List]], [[Tefrit's List]], a [[Torn Out Page]] and [[Yonan's List]].\nPart of [[The Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It contains some strange symbols of the lizard language.

name: Shield of Destiny
notes:
It's [[TibiaRoyal]]'s fansite item and was designed by {{Character|Lupus Aurelius}}. [[Use]] it to turn it into a [[Shield of Destiny (Activated)]].
Current owners of this item: *{{character|Lupus Aurelius}} from [[Fortera]]. Item creator. *{{character|Eric}} from [[Hydera]]. *{{character|Honourable Knight of Honera}} from [[Honera]]. *{{character|Licad}} from [[Shivera]]. *{{character|Tio}} from [[Antica]]. *{{character|Thoror}} from [[Gladera]]. *{{character|Ice Crambler}} from [[Monza]]. *{{character|Snulliz}} from [[Monza]]. *{{character|Seanq}} from [[Monza]]. *{{character|Enenra}} from [[Monza]]. *{{character|Wielki Stachu}} from [[Relania]]. *{{character|Diex Torrid}} from [[Talera]]. *{{character|Soulfired}} from [[Antica]]. *{{character|Crowny Cro}} from [[Damora]].
flavortext: Holding the divine intellect of Uman and the merciless destruction instinct of Zathroth, the eternal balance remains on the hands of its owner. Granted by TibiaRoyal.com.

name: Shield of Destiny (Activated)
notes: This is one of two forms of the [[Shield of Destiny]]. It changes between forms when used. The creator of this shield is {{Character|Lupus Aurelius}}.
flavortext: Holding the divine intellect of Uman and the merciless destruction instinct of Zathroth, the eternal balance remains on the hands of its owner. Granted by TibiaRoyal.com.

name: Quill
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Feather | Icecold Book | Knowledge Elemental
notes: 5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Vibrancy]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Rainbow Necklace
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/12.02|Update 12.02 (Winter Update 2018)]], it received proper stats (armor, resistances and level requirement) and was made available only after [[Updates/12.20|Update 12.20 (Summer Update 2019)]].

name: Rainbow Quartz
droppedby: Arctic Faun | Bashmu | Bony Sea Devil | Faun | Lamassu | Lavafungus | Makara | Manticore | Memory of a Manticore | Memory of a Werelion | Pixie | Pooka | Rhindeer | Sister Hetai | Spiky Carnivor | Werelion | Young Goanna
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Tesha, Tezila, Talila, Valindara, Yonan

name: Rare Earth
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 20 are needed for the [[Hidden Threats Quest]].

name: Recharging Tarantula Trap
notes:
This item was implemented in the [[Updates/9.1|Summer Update 2011]] with [[The Rookie Guard Quest]]. Its name and description suggest it was meant to be a temporary state of [[Tarantula Trap]]. However, since Tarantula Traps's effect last for 20 seconds, there is no need to limit players using it indefinitely. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
It is hard to see Recharging Tarantula Trap on light backgrounds due to it being white and stringy. Inside a container, it looks like this:
[[File:Spider Silk (background).png]]
It looks the same as [[Spider Silk]] and [[Steel Spider Silk]].
flavortext: You can't use this item for a short time.

name: Recipe for Magical Paint
notes: It describes the materials necessary to create [[Magical Paint]]. The recipe can be found inside the [[Dream Labyrinth]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|124.251|124.237|13|4|1|0.250.25}}.
flavortext: It says: Mix sun fruit juice with sapphire dust and dream essence to create magical paint. This paint may transform imagination into reality.

name: Red Ectoplasm
notes: It can be used to travel between the areas of the Haunted House as long as you completed the corresponding missions of the [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: The stuff nightmares are made of - literally.

name: Red Ectoplasmic Residue
flavortext: It seems a ghost was here.

name: Red Energy Ball
notes: Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].

name: Red Fireworks Powder
notes: You can fill a [[Fireworks Capsule]] with it to make a Fireworks Rocket.

name: Red Fireworks Rocket
notes: Using an [[Obsidian Knife]] on a firework allows you to disassemble the [[Fireworks|Red Fireworks Rockets]] into its respective components: [[Red Fireworks Powder]] and the [[Fireworks Capsule]]. \n\nYou can create one by using {{Ilink|Red Fireworks Powder}} [[Red Fireworks Powder]] on a {{Ilink|Fireworks Capsule}} [[Fireworks Capsule]].
flavortext: It can be disassembled with the right tool.

name: Red Goanna Scale
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Reflecting Crown
Reinvigorating Seeds
notes: Part of the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].
flavortext: A small bag full of healthy seeds.

notes:
It used to be a [[Resonance Crystal]] before a song was recorded on it.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Deep Crystal]], a [[Gnomish Resonance Crystal]], a [[Life Crystal]], a [[Purified Soul]], a [[Resonance Crystal]] and a [[Spectral Stone]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: You have recorded beautiful ice music on it for the Explorer Society.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes: Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].

notes: Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

notes: Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].

name: Ritual Sword
notes: Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: It is far too fragile to use it in a real battle.

name: Roasted Wyvern Wings
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It grants +7 [[Shielding]] skill for one hour when eaten. After consuming one, you have to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish. \n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold. \n}}<noinclude>[[Category:Shielding Booster]]</noinclu
flavortext: Wyverns are tough and renitent, unless roasted gently.

name: Rod of Destruction
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s. It is one of the few rods that may be imbued with Critical Hit imbuements ([[Basic Strike|Basic]], [[Intricate Strike|Intricate]] and [[Powerful Strike]]).
history: This weapon was created as the result of the unification of the [[Rod of Carving]], [[Rod of Remedy]] and [[Rod of Mayhem]].\n\nOn [[Updates/12.08.7995|February 5, 2019]], the level requirement for this weapon was raised from 100 to 200, and on [[Updates/12.31.9604|March 17, 2020]] its magic level boost got decreased from +2 to +1.

name: Rosebush (Item)
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].

name: Rotten Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Count Vlarkorth | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | King Zelos | Lord Azaram | Sir Baeloc

name: Royal Star
droppedby: Alptramun | Drume | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | Malofur Mangrinder | Manticore | Maxxenius | Memory of a Manticore | Plagueroot | Scarlett Etzel | The Nightmare Beast | The Percht Queen | The Scourge of Oblivion | True Dawnfire Asura | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Urmahlullu the Weakened
notes: It has a break chance of 30% and is as accurate as [[Assassin Star]]s.<!-- confirmation needed -->
history: [[Paladin]]s were meant to make 30 of them by casting the [[Conjure Royal Star]] [[spell]]. Due to players feedback, [[CipSoft]] decided to not implement the ''spell'', although the ''item'' was actually implemented, thus at one point it was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].\n\nOn the [[Updates/11.80|Summer Update 2018]], royal star's attack changed from 70 to 64 physical +2 fire, the level requirement changed from 150 to 120 and it was added as a loot from some creatures.

name: Rubbish Amulet
notes:
It looks like a [[Silver Amulet]] with a [[Piece of Iron]] on it.
It becomes a [[Glowing Rubbish Amulet]] for 5 minutes once it is charged.
It will expire 60 minutes after being looted. It's necessary during the {{Spoiler Section|Cults of Tibia Quest|Misguided}}
flavortext: To some it is rubbish, others see it as the most magnificent necklace in the world.

name: Ruby Fire Stone
notes: It vanishes into thin air 14 seconds after being obtained.\n\nPart of [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: It looks quite fragile.

name: Rusted Key Fragment (Handle)
notes: It is coated in years' worth of rust.Part of the [[Hidden Threats Quest]].
flavortext: The key fragment is quite rusted. Looks like it has been an ornate key once.

name: Rusted Key Fragment (Head)
notes: It is coated in years' worth of rust.Part of the [[Hidden Threats Quest]].
flavortext: The key fragment is quite rusted. Looks like it has been an ornate key once.

name: Rusty Winged Helmet
notes:
You can dig rusty winged helmets at [[Vigintia]]'s treasure hunting zone.
It was introduced to celebrate [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]].
flavortext: It's the Helmet of Hermes but it clearly has seen better days.

name: Sample of Monster Blood
notes: One can be obtained daily at [[The Extension Site]], [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}129.207-125.16-8-8-1-1 here]. Another one is in the chest inside hidden room with a single demon (second floor, far east from the entrance). To get there, player must pour his/her previous sample of monster blood on a skull which is near the throne.\n\nIt can be used to obtain a [[Broken Compass]].
flavortext: The blood in this test tube is of a very deep ruby red.

name: Santa Fox
notes: Purchased by saying ''turn in'', then ''santa fox''.

name: Sapphire Dust
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].

name: Scale of Gelidrazah
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It used to be [[Gelidrazah]]'s.Obtained and used during the [[First Dragon Quest]].

name: Scared Frog
droppedby: Adult Goanna | Sun-Marked Goanna | Young Goanna
notes: Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]]. Also needed for the [[Sculptor Apprentice]] achievement.
flavortext: It hopped out of the mouth of recently killed goanna. It is barely alive and looks very scared.

name: Scribbled Notes
notes: Looks the same as an [[Old Note]] and [[Notes of a Poacher]].Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].

name: Sealed Scroll
notes: Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: It is sealed with the symbol of Zathroth.

name: Secret Map
notes: It looks the same as an [[Ancient Map]], a [[Golem Blueprint]] and a [[Map (Brown)]].\nObtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]].
history: This item was not seem during the Test Server for the [[Updates/11.80|Summer Update 2018]].
flavortext: Several spots on it are marked with the letter Z.

name: Shadow Bite Berries
notes: Part of {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.

name: Shadow Mask
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Shadow Paint
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Shell (Item)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
You can dig shells at [[Vigintia#Treasure Hunting|Vigintia's Treasure Hunting Zone]].
It looks the same as a [[Shell]].
\nA stack of 4 or more of this item looks the same as [[Some Broken Shells]] and [[Some Broken Shells (Item)]].

name: Shield of Endless Search
notes: It's the official [[OrcSearch]] item.\n\nIts replica is the [[Shield of Endless Search (Replica)]].
flavortext: This is a tribute to every lost soul in the Tibia land. Awarded by OrcSearch.com.

name: Shimmering Beetles
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Arctic Faun | Boogy | Dark Faun | Faun | Pooka | Raxias | Twisted Pooka

name: Shimun's List
notes: It looks the same as a [[Crude Primitive Printout]], [[Narsai's List]], [[Rita's Letter]], a [[Ransom Note]], a [[Sheet of Paper]], a [[Sheet of Tracing Paper (Full)]], [[Tefrit's List]], a [[Torn Out Page]] and [[Yonan's List]].\nPart of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].
flavortext: needed ingredients: one lizard heart, twelve snake maws and five vials of ink.

name: Shining Sun Catcher
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Sun Catcher]].
\nThere is also a [[Dark Sun Catcher|dark version]] of this item: {{Ilink|Dark Sun Catcher}}.\nTemporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Quiver
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Galuna, Gnomerrow, Irea, Maun, Mugruu, Perac, Perod, Pompan, Robert, Silas, Raffael:350, Rock In A Hard Place, Taegen, Uzgod, Vincent, Xed, Willard
notes: Once a week, a quiver can be obtained on Rookgaard in a chest next to [[Blind Orc]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|125.100|125.128|4|4|1|0.250.25}}.

name: Raccoon Backpack
notes:
Someone can trade 15,000 trust points for this backpack with [[Tik'hi Tak'he]] in [[Rascacoon]].
\n\nSee [[Backpacks]] for general information regarding backpacks.

name: Rainbow Amulet
notes: This item can be seen on the [[Cyclopedia]]. It was implemented at the same update that [[Rainbow Necklace]] had its stats changed and became obtainable. The stats of both amulets were identical during the first days of the test server. Moreover, the description of the rainbow amulet used to be "{{Message|type=look|DO NOT USE}}". Someone might infer from this that this item was a duplicate of the [[Rainbow Necklace]] and, when the developers noticed it, they doomed it be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Rascoohan Rat Revealer
notes: It looks the same as an [[Arcane Staff]] and [[Arcane Staff (Unknown)]].\nItem temporarily obtained and used during [[A Pirate's Tail Quest]].
flavortext: The RRR is a testament if rascoohan ingenuity.

name: Ratmiral's Hat
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Ravenous Circlet
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Raw Eye of the Chasm
notes: Part of the [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].
flavortext: A raw yet beautiful gem.

name: Raw Watermelon Tourmaline
droppedby: Drume | Katex Blood Tongue | Plunder Patriarch | Srezz Yellow Eyes | The Abomination | Utua Stone Sting | Yirkas Blue Scales | Ichgahal

name: Red 25 Years Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Red 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)|Red 25 Years Balloon]] {{Ilink|Red 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Red Gem (Eye)
notes: Obtained during the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

name: Red Gingerbread Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It can be [[Inscribed Red Heart|inscribed]] by [[Xaver]].

name: Red Marble
notes: \nIt's part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
history: Prior to [[Updates/12.62.10592|February 09, 2021]], this object name used to be ''blue marble''.
flavortext: A glowing red marble. An engraving reads: III.

name: Red Quiver
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Galuna, Gnomerrow, Irea, Maun, Mugruu, Perac, Perod, Pompan, Robert, Silas, Raffael:350, Rock In A Hard Place, Taegen, Uzgod, Vincent, Xed, Willard

name: Red Silk Flower
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Katex Blood Tongue | Srezz Yellow Eyes | Utua Stone Sting | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes:
This is the item needed to tame a {{Ilink|White Lion (Mount)}} [[White Lion]]. It only works on the white lions at the entrance of the [[Lion Sanctum]] ({{Mapper Coords|text=here|129.99|125.254|10|2|1|0.50.5}}). Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The white lion majestically reject the flower.}}
Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The white lion fled.}}
Succeeded: {{Message|type=sound|The white lion will now accompany you as a friend and ally.}}
flavortext: The petals are made of silk, the buds and pistil of rubies. The werelions of the Darama Desert often use such flowers as decorations for bravery and valour.

name: Reed Balls
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: In order to get reed balls, you need to use a [[Baking Tray (Reed)]] with an [[Oven]].\nUse 100 reed balls on [[Hippo]]s in order to get the achievement [[Hippofoddermus]].

name: Replacement Marble
history: used to be named '''Marble Floor'''

name: Rhodolith Necklace
notes: Someone can trade 4,000 trust points for this necklace with [[Tik'hi Tak'he]] in [[Rascacoon]].

name: Ring of Secret Thoughts
notes: Alternate form [[Ring of Secret Thoughts (Charged)]]\n\nIt's part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

name: Ring of Secret Thoughts (Charged)
notes: It's a [[Ring of Secret Thoughts]] charged with memories from the [[Ambassador of Rathleton]].\n\nIt's part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].
flavortext: It is charged with the memories of the Ambassador of Rathleton.

name: Ring of Souls
notes: When equipped, it looks like this: [[File:Ring of Souls (Equipped).gif]].\n\nOnce [[Ring of Souls (Depleted)|depleted]], it can be recharged for 2 [[Silver Token]]s by [[Cledwyn]].

name: Ring of Souls (Depleted)
notes: It can be [[Ring of Souls|recharged]] for 2 [[Silver Token]]s by [[Cledwyn]].
flavortext: This ring is out of magic energy.

name: Rita's Letter
notes: It looks the same as a [[Crude Primitive Printout]], [[Narsai's List]], a [[Ransom Note]], a [[Sheet of Paper]], a [[Sheet of Tracing Paper (Full)]], [[Shimun's List]], [[Tefrit's List]], a [[Torn Out Page]] and [[Yonan's List]].\nItem temporarily obtained and used during [[A Pirate's Tail Quest]].

name: Ritual Notes
notes: Obtained during the [[Adventures of Galthen Quest]].
flavortext: These written notes from the knight Galthen contain information about an ancient ritual as well as blessings to counter it. The words DEMIHBOULDR, SOMMBHA and WITHER have been marked.

name: Rod (Creature Product)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Roots
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Rotten Tomatoes
notes: They can be found on the floor around [[The Feeding Grounds]].\n\nThey are required for the ''Do not Feed the Porker'' game of the [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Rotworm Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Rotworm Balloon (Inflated)|Rotworm Balloon]] {{Ilink|Rotworm Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Special Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Special Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Special Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Rotworm Head Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Rotworm Head Balloon (Inflated)|Rotworm Head Balloon]] {{Ilink|Rotworm Head Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Special Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Special Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Special Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Sacramental Wine
notes: Temporarily obtained during the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

name: Salt
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Item needed for a {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|An Ancient Feud}}.

name: Salted Cave Rat
notes: Temporarily obtained during the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|An Ancient Feud}}.

name: Sandscourge Figurine
sounds: {{Sound List|Bless your heart!|Everyday is a blessing.|Holy moly!}}

name: Sapphire Necklace
notes: Someone can trade 4,000 trust points for this necklace with [[Tik'hi Tak'he]] in [[Rascacoon]].

name: Scalpel
notes: They can be used on [[Slime Fungus]] to get [[Ulcer Probe]]s.\nPart of the [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].

name: Sceptre of Sun and Sea
notes: Item obtained and used during the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

name: Schnitzel Meat Grinder
notes: Part of [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Scorpion (Item)
notes: Can be obtained by using a [[Net (Fishing)]] on a [[Scorpion]]. Note that it may take several attempts to be successful. A successful attempt will show this message {{Sound|You have catched a scorpion.}} A failed attempt will show this message {{Sound|The scorpion scuttles through the net's holes and escapes.}} Item is needed for the [[Sculptor Apprentice]] achievement.

name: Scorpion Charm
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: It is made of bone.

name: Scrubbing Brush
notes: Item needed to get the second addon of the [[Rascoohan Outfits]].

name: Sea Horse Figurine
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Bragrumol | Burning Gladiator | Makara | Morshabaal | Mozradek | Neferi the Spy | Priestess of the Wild Sun | Sister Hetai | Tentugly's Head | Xogixath

name: Seal of Quality
flavortext: It was awarded by a CM as a token of gratitude for valuable feedback.

name: Secret Instruction (Gryphon)
droppedby: Priestess of the Wild Sun | Burning Gladiator
notes: It gives instructions on where to find a [[Gryphon Mask]].
flavortext: You can find the gryphon mask high in the mountains. It will open the gryphon-guarded door.

name: Secret Instruction (Ivory)
notes: It gives instructions on where to find an [[Ivory Mask]].\n\nIt can be found inside a [[Floating Green Flask]] west of [[Issavi]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|131.201|123.45|7|2|1|0.50.5}}.
flavortext: The ivory mask is under the ankh mosaic in the library. Put the missing emerald in the tile to open the hidden compartment. This mask will open the ivory-adorned doors.

name: Secret Instruction (Mirror)
droppedby: Priestess of the Wild Sun | Burning Gladiator
notes: It gives instructions on where to find a [[Mirror Mask]].
flavortext: The mirror mask is hidden in a tomb near the northern oasis. It will open the mirror-behung door.

name: Secret Instruction (Silver)
droppedby: Priestess of the Wild Sun | Burning Gladiator
notes: It gives instructions on where to find a [[Silver Mask]].
flavortext: The silver mask is hidden in the ruins of Nuur. It will open the silver-veined doors.

name: Shadow Cowl
notes: Item needed to get addon 2 of [[Hand of the Inquisition Outfits Quest|Hand of the Inquisition Outfits]].

name: Shark Fins
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Shield of Endless Search (Replica)
notes: You can obtain this item by trading 20 [[Silver Raid Token]]s to [[Jorge]]. It looks the same as a [[Shield of Endless Search]].
flavortext: Souvenir from Thais Museum.

name: Rainbow Opal
notes: This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
history: With the [[Summer Update 2025]], this item can be seen in a treasure room on Chapter III of the [[Book World]] hunting area.

name: Rainbow Torch
notes: When used it will [[Lit Rainbow Torch|light up]] {{Ilink|Lit Rainbow Torch}}.

name: Raven Herb (Orcsoberfest)
notes: Part of [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Recipe
notes: Part of {{Spoiler Section|Kilmaresh Quest|A Shark in Need}}.
flavortext: To make a salve or balm waterproof, the use of lanolin, or wool fat, proved to be the best practice.

name: Red Mushroom (Orcsoberfest)
notes: Part of [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Red Present Kit
notes: Using a [[Red Present Kit]] within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]] triggers a transformation, converting the kit into a [[Red Present]]. {{Ilink|Red Present}}
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a red present.

name: Red Skull (Item)
notes: Obtained during the [[25 Years of Tibia Quest]].

name: Remains of a Crude Dream (Large)
flavortext: They melt away as you look at them.

name: Remains of a Crude Dream (Small)
flavortext: They melt away as you look at them.

name: Research Records
notes: Temporarily obtained during [[The Cradle of Monsters Quest]].

name: Revised Promotion Scroll
notes: Using this [[Promotion Scroll]] will grant the character 9 promotion points to spend in the [[Wheel of Destiny]]. Each character can only use it once. Can only be dropped from [[Bakragore]] when fighting it under the influence of its [[Bakragore's Taints|final taint]] and at least [[Bakragore's Burden|two burdens]].
flavortext: Only a hero of level 51 or above can decipher this scroll to gain 9 promotion points for the Wheel of Destiny.

name: Reward Box (25th Anniversary)
notes:
It can be obtained by characters with more than 999 but less than 7197 [[Theons]] by talking to [[Theodora]]. 

By opening it you'll get all of the following items:
* {{Ilink|Bottle of Champagne}} 2x [[Bottle of Champagne]]
* {{Ilink|Candy Floss (Large)}} 2x [[Candy Floss (Large)]]
* {{Ilink|Ice Cream Cone (Sprinkles)}} 2x [[Ice Cream Cone (Sprinkles)]]
* {{Ilink|Birthday Layer Cake}} 2x [[Birthday Layer Cake]]s
* {{Ilink|Balloon Box}} 2x [[Balloon Box]]es
* {{Ilink|Luminous Box}} 1x [[Luminous Box]]
* {{Ilink|Carpet Box}} 2x [[Carpet Box]]es
* {{Ilink|Special Fx Box}} 3x [[Special Fx Box]]es
* {{Ilink|Special Carpet Box}} 2x [[Special Carpet Box]]es
* {{Ilink|Box Full of Presents}} 2x [[Box Full of Presents]]
* {{Ilink|Supernatural Box}} 1x [[Supernatural Box]]
* {{Ilink|Special Balloon Box}} 2x [[Special Balloon Box]]es
* {{Ilink|Embroidered Box}} 1x [[Embroidered Box]]
flavortext: It could be exchanged for Theons after the festivities of Tibia's 25th anniversary.

name: Shovel
droppedby: Dwarf Soldier | Minotaur Bruiser | Minotaur | Troll-Trained Salamander
buyfrom: Ahmet: 50, Al Dee: 10, Bashira: 50, Beatrice: 50, Bertha: 50, Bezil: 50, Gladys: 50, Gorn: 50, Gree Dee: 50, Halif: 50, John: 100, Larek: 50, Lee'Delle: 9, Lubo: 50, Maro: 20, Maun: 50, Nelliem: 20, Nezil: 50, Perod: 50, Pompan: 50, Raffael: 50, Rafzan, Red Lilly: 50, Rock In A Hard Place:50, Richard: 10, Sarina: 50, Shiantis: 50, Simon the Beggar: 50, Tefrit: 50, Timur: 50, Vigintius, Zethra, Zora: 50
sellto: Ahmet, Al Dee: 2, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Maro, Maun, Lee'Delle: 2, Lubo, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Rafzan: 2, Red Lilly, Richard: 2, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zethra: 2, Zora
notes:
Shovels are very useful for opening holes in [[Loose Stone Pile]]s or digging through sand in the desert. A necessity for most trips, but only one member of a team needs to bring one. Can usually be found littering the ground in the [[Kazordoon]] [[Dwarf Mines]]. It does the same duty as its lighter counter part, the [[Light Shovel]]. This item is no longer available from [[Dixi]] or [[Obi]], since they became specialised dealers in weapons and armors. [[Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness]], [[Squeezing Gear of Girlpower]] and [[Whacking Driller of Fate]] can be used as a shovel. One shovel can be seen in [[Al's Shop]] in [[Rookgaard]]. Can be gotten through [[The Beginning Quest]].
This item can be used to open 500 [[Loose Stone Pile]]s in order to gain the [[achievement]] [[The Undertaker]].

Since 8.71 update you can buy this weapon in mainlands. \n\nYou can use the [[Squeezing Gear of Girlpower]] as a substitution for this tool.

name: Simple Dress
droppedby: Banshee | Memory of a Banshee | Zombie
notes: Looks the same as a [[Spectral Dress]] and a [[Worn Dress]].

name: Simple Fanfare
notes:
[[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]]. During [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]] you could loot Simple Fanfare and other instruments from [[Groupie]]s. Once you have it, go to Mercutio's Band [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}126.14-125.51-7-4-1-1 here]. Then, use a [[Chameleon Rune]] on the fanfare, and play some to the band.
If you play the simple fanfare without the proper form you'll get a white message: ''"This might be even better with the right outfit."''
When you get transformed: ''"Good idea. Might sound and look awesome in Mercutio's band!"''
After playing transformed: ''"What a great addition to the band! The piano man might reward you."''
Say ''hi'' and enjoy your reward ([[Surprise Bag (Blue)|blue surprise bag]]).

name: Skull (Item)
droppedby: Amazon | Ancient Lion Knight | Animated Guzzlemaw | Animated Ogre Shaman | Arachir the Ancient One | Barbarian Headsplitter | Barbarian Skullhunter | Bonebeast | Brutus Bloodbeard | Deadeye Devious | Diblis the Fair | Dreadbeast | Dworc Fleshhunter | Dworc Venomsniper | Dworc Voodoomaster | Frazzlemaw | Ghoul | Guzzlemaw | Lethal Lissy | Memory of a Book | Mutated Rat | Necropharus | Ogre Shaman | Pirate Skeleton | Quara Mantassin Scout | Ron the Ripper | Shaper Matriarch | Sir Valorcrest | The Count | The Weakened Count | Undead Prospector | Valkyrie | Vampire | Weakened Frazzlemaw | Xenia | Zevelon Duskbringer | Memory of a Vampire | Memory of an Amazon
notes:
Many people believe these are skulls of the people [[Amazon]]s have killed. A class system in the [[Amazon]] camp determines status using these skulls as tokens of merit.
You can make a [[Skull Candle]] by using a Skull on a [[Candlestick]].
It looks the same as a [[Drowned Seaman's Skull]], [[Omrabas' Talking Skull]], a [[Skull of Ratha]] and [[Some Mortal Essence]]. 4 of these are needed to enter in the [[Paradox Tower]].
1 is needed for the [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].

name: Skull of Ratha
notes:
Ratha was a great explorer and even greater ladies' man. Sadly he never returned from a visit to the [[amazon]]s.
It can be sold only once by every player.
It looks the same as a [[Drowned Seaman's Skull]], [[Omrabas' Talking Skull]], a [[Skull (Item)]] and [[Some Mortal Essence]].
Item obtained in the [[Skull of Ratha Quest]].
The [[Tibian Explorer Society]] offers a substantial reward for the retrieval of Ratha or his remains.

name: Slime (Liquid)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
When you drink slime, you will become [[poisoned]] for 3 minutes. Damage is equal to the damage from a [[Poison Field]].
You can collect slime in any [[Containers#Fluid Containers|liquid container]] by using the container on the corpse of any creature with green blood (most poison creatures), or you can fill it at a swamp.
'''Note:''' be careful of a [[Scam#Slime Trick|scam]] involving giving slime to a player in order to kill him.
Looks the same as [[Wonder Glue]], an [[Animal Cure]], a [[Flask with Beaver Bait]], a [[Flask with Paint]], a [[Flask of Poison]], and a [[Flask of Plant Poison]].

name: Sling Herb
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Boogy | Carniphila | Crazed Beggar | Dharalion | Elf Arcanist | Fernfang | Memory of an Elf | Priestess | Spit Nettle
notes:
A fairly common herb. It can be found at several [[daily respawns]], such as on [[Donald McRonald]]'s farm in [[Thais]] ({{Mapper Coords|126.149|125.241|7|4|text=here}}), [[Greenshore]] and [[Greenclaw Swamp]].
It tastes like [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinnamon cinnamon] according to chef [[Jean Pierre]].
1 is needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]]
1 is needed in the [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].

name: Small Stone
droppedby: Animated Ogre Brute | Arctic Faun | Clay Guardian | Cursed Book | Dark Faun | Demon (Goblin) | Earth Elemental | Eternal Guardian | Faun | Frost Giantess | Gargoyle | Goblin | Goblin Assassin | Goblin Scavenger | Grorlam | Jagged Earth Elemental | Massive Earth Elemental | Memory of a Faun | Memory of an Ogre | Muddy Earth Elemental | Muglex Clan Assassin | Muglex Clan Footman | Muglex Clan Scavenger | Museum Stone Golem | Ogre Brute | Pooka | Raxias | Sibang | Stone Golem | Twisted Pooka | Vok the Freakish
notes:
The weak attack rating makes them useless as a primary weapon, however, this same characteristic makes them ideal to [[training|train]] with, and these are frequently used by [[paladins]] to train their [[distance]] skill.
\nExperiments show that, on average, 3 out of a 100 small stones will break when used. These have the identical range of [[Throwing Star|throwing stars]].\nThe easiest way of getting small stones is by hunting [[apes]]. [[Sibang]]s drop them quite frequently. [[Earth Elemental]] also drop nice amounts, but are considerably stronger to defeat. Note that if small stones are cheaper than 36 gp/piece it might not be worth looting them if you are low on [[cap]].
history:
Before the [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]], Small Stones looked like this: [[File:Small Stone (Old).gif]]
\nThey were once a common drop of [[Goblin]]s (Even 3 pieces per kill). The price has increased dramatically since they are dropped less commonly. After [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]], the drop rate of small stones by [[goblins]] was lowered and prices became higher.
\nAfter the [[Updates/9.6|Summer Update 2012]], their price dropped significantly due to the implementation of [[Training School|offline training]].

The [[druid]]'s equivalent of the [[sorcerer]]'s [[Wand of Vortex]] and the lowest-levelled rod available on the mainland. A rather ineffective weapon, as a lot of monsters, even the weakest, are resistant or outright immune to [[Earth Damage|earth damage]]. flavortext: It seems to twitch and quiver as if trying to escape your grip.

name: Snowball
notes:
It cannot be reused as they break after the first shot, therefore it is mostly used for decoration purposes.
At Christmas time, [[Santa Claus]] may give them to you if you have been a good boy or girl.
Their value dropped significantly after [[Grynch Clan Goblin]] raids during Christmas.
When snowballs are used as [[weapon]]s, they don't do any damage. It can be obtained through the [[Goblin Temple Quest]].
history:
==== Origin ====
Snowballs were implemented with [[Updates/6.5|Update 6.5]] when [[Snow Heap]]s were temporarily added to cities such as [[Thais]] and [[Edron]] as part of [[Christmas]] 2001. Due to players ''heavily misusing snowballs for powergaming'', this event was not repeated the following Christmas.<ref>{{OfficialNewsArchive|173|Christmas Update 2002}}</ref>

== Snowball Bug ==
Around the year 2004 or 2005 (before the walls of the mountains and many places were revamped, and you could use parcels everywhere to go up and down), there was a bug on [[Secura]] that a tree near [[Santa's House]] was deleted and players were able to reach one of the [[Snow Heap]]s. The snow heap was the source of snowballs, and that day many snowballs were created.

== Current Availability ==
Later on, they became semi-rare items since they were only available from the [[Goblin Temple Quest]] on [[Rookgaard]], as a loot from [[Yeti]]s or as a gift from [[Santa Claus]].

There came a large boost in the number of snowballs in-game during [[Christmas]] 2006, when [[Grynch Clan Goblin]]s dropped a fairly large number of snowballs and other items. 

They became even more common when [[The Colours of Magic]] was implemented with the possibility of many creatures dropping snowballs for one week when Furb of Fun (orange colour) wins.

Finally, with the introduction of the [[Winterlight Solstice]] event in December 2018, Snowballs became much more available, since they can be created without limit by using [[Snow Heap]]s on the [[Percht Island]].
<references />

name: Soldier Helmet
notes: A cheap and good helmet that many [[level]] 10-15 players use. Next, players should buy a [[Dark Helmet]] or [[Steel Helmet]]. [[Knight]]s can also get this [[helmet]] on the [[Island of Destiny]] and in [[Dawnport]]. Due to a bug, the helmet was also briefly brought to [[Rookgaard]] from Dawnport.

name: Spear
droppedby: Big Boss Trolliver | Black Knight | Faceless Bane | Frost Troll | Island Troll | Lizard Sentinel | Mountain Troll | Orc Shaman | Orc Spearman | Pirate Marauder | Salamander Trainer | Scar Tribe Shaman | Swamp Troll | Troll | Troll Champion | Troll Marauder | Valkyrie | Young Troll
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne: 10, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Galuna, Gnomerrow, Irea, Lee'Delle: 9, Maun, Mugruu, Obi: 10, Perac, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Raffael: 10;paladins, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Uzgod, Vincent, Willard, Xed
sellto: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Galuna, Gnomerrow, H.L.: 2, Irea, Lee'Delle, Maun, Mugruu, Obi, Perac, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Uzgod, Vincent, Willard, Xed
notes:
You need a spear to create an [[Enchanted Spear]]. Spears will break about 3.075% of the time. Break percentage was tested on training dummies for multiple hours, so it should be accurate.
\nOnce the paladin meets level requirements, spears should be discarded in favour of employing far superior [[Hunting Spear]]s.
\nLooks the same as a [[Mean Paladin Spear]] and a [[Giant Screwdriver]].
history:
==== Breakable ====
Before the [[Updates|update of the summer of 2005]], spears were unbreakable but due to abuse of this they were changed so that there was a chance a spear would break when thrown, their attack was also reduced from 30 to 25.

==== Breakability ====
Since the spears were made breakable, they had become nearly useless, and sub-sequentially were not used by very many players. To fix this, in the [[Updates|November 16 Update 2005]] CIP increased the resiliency of spears so that the did not break as often, making them more useful and valuable.

==== Stronger and Kept in Hand ====
During the [[Updates/8.00|Summer Update 2007]], the damage caused by melee and distance weapons was increased, so spears became more useful for hunting, and less useful for training. Before this update Spears were used by [[paladins]] to [[Training|train]] skills. However after the [[Summer Update 2007]] they do rather high damage and [[Small Stone|small stones]] have taken their place as a training weapon. Paladins with weaker skills still use them for training, though. Also with this update, spears no longer fall to the ground when they are thrown. Instead, they stay in your hand to prevent theft.

==== Decrease of range ====
After the [[Updates/8.10|Christmas 2007 Update]], the range of the spear was decreased from 6 down to 3 squares, the same as all "non-magical" spears. There are many creatures with distance attacks, e.g. [[Minotaur Archer]]s or [[Bonelord]]s, that will position themselves 4 squares away from you, effectively putting them out of range which forces you to chase them.

==== Price ====
Before patch {{update|8.7}} they priced at 10 gp in stores.

name: Spellbook
droppedby: Banshee | Bonelord | Braindeath | Dark Carnisylvan | Death Priest | Dwarf Geomancer | Elder Bonelord | Gravelord Oshuran | Lich | The Evil Eye
buyfrom: Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Nelly, Rabaz, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Thomas, Topsy, Xodet
notes:
You don't need to carry your spellbook with you all the time, it isn't necessary to have a spellbook to cast a spell. It does, however, tell you which spells you have, as well as the mana and the words needed to cast each spell. The spell words can also be found at the official web site, at the ingame Spell List or on the [[Spells]] page. It looks the same as an [[Almanac of Magic]], [[Nature Magic Spellbook]] and [[Spellbook of Dragha]]. It has been made somewhat redundant by the [[Flash Client]]'s ability to list a character's known spells. Obtainable through the [[Elvenbane Quest]], [[Ornamented Shield Quest]] and daily spawn on the top of the [[Senja]] Castle.
[[Sorcerer]]s require a spellbook for [[The Desert Dungeon Quest]]. {{seealso|Spellbook (Alternative)}}
history: Before [[Updates/8.2]], spellbooks didn't have a defence value, and couldn't be used as a shield. Before [[Updates/8.5]], spellbooks had a weight of 58.00 oz, which has been significantly decreased.
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Stealth Ring
droppedby: Angry Demon | Annihilon | Askarak Prince | Bibby Bloodbath | Black Vixen | Brimstone Bug | Burning Book | Captain Jones | Cave Devourer | Countess Sorrow | Demon | Demon Outcast | Diabolic Imp | Enfeebled Silencer | Ghazbaran | Ghost | Golden Servant | Golden Servant Replica | Golgordan | Latrivan | Mad Mage | Mamma Longlegs | Minotaur Hunter | Morgaroth | Mutated Rat | Neferi the Spy | Omruc | Orc Warlord | Orshabaal | Phantasm | Pirate Ghost | Pooka | Quara Mantassin | Quara Mantassin Scout | Raging Mage | Reflection of a Mage | Renegade Quara Mantassin | Sea Serpent | Shaburak Prince | Silencer | Spectre | Sulphur Scuttler | Tarnished Spirit | Thalas | The Handmaiden | The Horned Fox | The Old Widow | The Pale Count | Troll Legionnaire | Twisted Pooka | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | Ushuriel | Young Sea Serpent | Zamulosh
notes: Stealth Rings make you [[invisible]] for 10 minutes. This item is of course great for hunting [[creatures]] that are not immune to invisibility (such as [[Hunter]]s, [[Fire Devil]]s, [[Dwarf Guard]]s, [[Demon Skeleton]]s and [[Orc Berserker]]s) and for sneaking into places with large amounts of monsters that are not immune to invisibility, such as during the [[Medusa Shield Quest]]. On [[Hardcore PvP]], [[Open PvP#Retro Open PvP|Retro Open PvP]] or [[Retro Hardcore PvP]] game worlds, the spell [[Cancel Invisibility]] has a chance to destroy worn stealth rings. Be mindful of the time left on your [[ring]], as your invisibility might run out while you are in midst of a swarm of [[monsters]].\nObtainable in the [[Stealth Ring Quest]], the [[Demona Ring Quest]], [[The Queen of the Banshees Quest]], the [[Parchment Room Quest]] and through the [[Lightbearer]] [[event]].

name: Solar Axe
notes:
Can currently be seen in [[Pythius The Rotten]]'s treasure room; the axe is being covered by a [[Red Gem]].

Before [[Gamemaster]]s were dismissed, [[CipSoft]] gave them a list of items to choose as a token of their appreciation and this is one of the items that were on this list.

On August 6, 2010, {{character|GM Leen Leonhart}} created a thread that announced she chose a Solar Axe as reward and opened an auction.

On August 4, 2010, {{character|GM Dragonas}} created a thread that he'd possibly be selling one which on August 6, 2010 he made official that he was auctioning one. You can view original Solar Axes auctions on these threads: {{Thread|3125284|Solar Axe auction! (for real)}} (held by GM Leen Leonhart), {{Thread|3133985|Solar Axe }} (held by GM Exilya), {{Thread|3123530|Solar Axe Auction}} (held by GM Dragonas, the thread held by {{character|Pytru}} (GM Havey), who would choose a Solar Axe, a [[Dark Trinity Mace]] or [[The Epiphany]], {{Thread|3128637|here}}, or in thread made by GM Aestyn {{Thread|3129429|here}}.

On August 11, 2021, {{character|GM Kosari}} announced their Solar Axe for sale on {{Post|39219849|Luminera's Trade Board}}, where the axe was based at the time.

name: Some Leaves
notes:
It can be found at the [[Voodoodoll Quest]] in [[Greenclaw Swamp]], [[Orc Fortress]] (-1 floor near [[Orc Rider]]s) and around the [[Zao Steppe]].
It looks the same as [[Some Special Leaves]].\n[[Some leaves]] are an item required by [[Lazaran]] to fulfill a task after you have completed the [[Unnatural Selection Quest]].

name: Some Mushrooms
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
[[File:TUC.PNG|thumb|{{character|Bartuc Undead}} with 200 Some Mushrooms on [[Calmera]]]] There are 3 spawns of this semi-rare mushroom in the western [[Green Claw Swamp]]. They look like [[Some Mushrooms (Brown)]] but in green color, this mushroom doesn't have as good regain as the brown colored mushroom.




Follow this map to acess all respawns.
[[File:Mushrooms map.pngâ€Ž]]

name: Some Mushrooms (Brown)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Several can be found in the [[Green Claw Swamp]], is the second best food in Regain/Oz. They look like [[Some Mushrooms]] but have better regain. 100 of those mushrooms weights 10 oz. and will last you for 4 hours.

name: Some Special Leaves
notes: It looks the same as [[Some Leaves]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[What a foolish Quest]].
flavortext: They have an aromatic smell.

name: Some Wood
notes: They are found around [[Tibia]]. Has no practical use.

name: Soul Orb
droppedby: Annihilon | Betrayed Wraith | Blightwalker | Burning Book | Cliff Strider | Cobra Assassin | Countess Sorrow | Crypt Warrior | Dark Torturer | Dawnfire Asura | Defiler | Destroyer | Diabolic Imp | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Dracola | Elder Wyrm | Falcon Knight | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Foam Stalker | Frost Flower Asura | Fury | Furyosa | Ghastly Dragon | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Guardian of Tales | Hand of Cursed Fate | Hellfire Fighter | Hellhound | Juggernaut | Kusuma | Lost Soul | Massacre | Midnight Asura | Minotaur Hunter | Mr. Punish | Nightmare | Plaguesmith | Preceptor Lazare | Seacrest Serpent | Skeleton Elite Warrior | Spectre | The Abomination | The Blazing Rose | The Diamond Blossom | The Flaming Orchid | The Handmaiden | The Imperor | The Lily of Night | The Plasmother | The Winter Bloom | True Dawnfire Asura | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Venerable Foam Stalker | Werelioness | Zugurosh | Zulazza the Corruptor
sellto: The Bone Master;bob-rank1, The Dream Master;nk-rank1
notes:
An expert [[Smith NPCs|smith]] such as the [[A Sweaty Cyclops|Sweaty Cyclops]] should be able to work with this rare material. \nYou can exchange each soul orb for 3 [[Infernal Bolt]]s with the help of [[A Sweaty Cyclops|Sweaty Cyclops]] in [[Ab'Dendriel]].
\nA reward from the [[Rise of Devovorga]] [[World Quest]].
flavortext: This strange object seems to be made of half spirit, half metal. It is unknown to most smiths.

name: Soul Stone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Alptramun | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar the Banished | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Necropharus | Plagueroot | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Last Lore Keeper | The Nightmare Beast | The Percht Queen | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Time Guardian
notes:
It was once hard to obtain, because it was only lootable from [[Necropharus]] which was only a rare spawn, supported by many [[Necromancers]]. The price dropped due to a quest and multiple spawning places. Finally, the price collapsed after it become lootable from bosses with daily repeatable fights.
Needed for an addon of [[Mage Outfits]] (male) / [[Summoner Outfits]] (female).
flavortext: It contains the essence of countless tormented souls.

name: Sparking Rainbow Shield
notes: To get this shield you need to use a [[Small Enchanted Amethyst]] on a [[Rainbow Shield]], enchanting it with '''energy'''. It increases your speed by 10 for 15 minutes.
flavortext: It has been temporarily imbued with energy magic and increases your speed.

name: Spectral Stone
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Deep Crystal]], a [[Gnomish Resonance Crystal]], a [[Life Crystal]], a [[Purified Soul]], a [[Resonance Crystal]] and a [[Resonance Crystal (Recorded)]].
\nItem obtained in the [[Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It is pulsating with spectral energy.

name: Spellbook of Dark Mysteries
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Ghazbaran | Hellgorak | Horadron | Prince Drazzak
notes: It increases your Magic Level by 3. It's no longer obtained through [[The Demon Oak Quest]].\nObtainable through [[The Inquisition Quest]].
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spellbook of Enlightenment
droppedby: Blood Hand | Frost Dragon Hatchling | Golden Servant | Golden Servant Replica | Iks Ahpututu | Jungle Moa | Lloyd | Mutated Rat | Omnivora | Shadow Pupil | The Souldespoiler | Two-Headed Turtle | Iks Pututu
notes: It's the most common spellbook that gives +1 magic level.
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spellbook of Lost Souls
droppedby: Diblis the Fair | Eradicator | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Ghazbaran | Ghulosh | Hellgorak | Horadron | Lady Tenebris | The Pale Count | The Scourge of Oblivion
notes: This spellbook isn't quite rare, after the Update '08 [[Lost Soul]] dropped this spellbook for a very short time too. This spellbook gives +2 magic levels. The price on this spellbook may however vary from server to server. On some servers it has been sold for up to 300,000 gp.
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spellbook of Mind Control
droppedby: Blood Priest | Brachiodemon | Carnivostrich | Choking Fear | Dawnfire Asura | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Frost Flower Asura | Ghazbaran | Hellflayer | Hellgorak | Horadron | Infernalist | Lava Golem | Midnight Asura | Nighthunter | Raging Mage | Serpent Spawn | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | Soul-Broken Harbinger | The Moonlight Aster | The Noxious Spawn | The Welter | True Dawnfire Asura | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Yaga the Crone | Yirkas Blue Scales | Zamulosh | Zarabustor
notes: This item used to be really rare because it was only dropped by [[Yaga the Crone]]. After [[Updates/8.4|Winter Update 2008]], you can also loot it from many other strong [[creatures]]. Be aware if you've hunted with a normal shield that you will take extra damage.
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spellbook of Warding
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Anomaly | Blood Priest | Dark Carnisylvan | Distorted Phantom | Energuardian of Tales | Eradicator | Gaffir | Ghazbaran | Guardian of Tales | Hellgorak | High Voltage Elemental | Horadron | Lady Tenebris | Lavafungus | Lloyd | Mad Mage | Massive Energy Elemental | Necromancer | Neferi the Spy | Plagirath | The Baron from Below | Tremendous Tyrant | Usurper Commander | Varnished Diremaw
notes: Once had the highest defense of any spellbook in the game until [[Depth Scutum]] was introduced into the game.\nObtainable in the [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spellscroll of Prophecies
droppedby: Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Ghazbaran | Gravelord Oshuran | Hellgorak | Horadron | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Last Lore Keeper | The Time Guardian
notes: It increases your [[magic level]] by 3. It has weaker defense than a [[Wooden Shield]].
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spellwand
sellto: Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Shiriel, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes:
Implemented for [[April's Fools Day]]. You can use it on yourself or your friends (while '''Not''' in a [[Protection Zone]]) and it will turn the person into a [[rat]], a [[Green Frog|green frog]] or a [[chicken]] for a few seconds, while having a chance of breaking. Once it breaks it has a chance of spawning a [[Mad Sheep]]. For that reason it became a popular item for those who wished to train on remote locations or on [[Target Dummy|Target Dummies]] and on May 2011 a small patch was added to prevent people from abusing this option making it possible to spawn a '''Mad Sheep''' once per 12 hours. The chances are around 3/4 that it will spawn a '''Mad Sheep''' upon breaking which leaves 1/4 chance that it just breaks without spawning it.
Looks the same as a [[Shapechanger]].
flavortext: It might have some strange effects.

name: Spiderwebs
notes:
Can be gotten as a loot from [[The Mutated Pumpkin]] during [[Halloween]] OR by [[Skinning]] the corpse of [[The Mutated Pumpkin]].\nIn order to [[Skinning|skin]] [[The Mutated Pumpkin]] you need to be one of the people who fought it.
The corpse you can skin is located in a special room accessible through a teleport door [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}130.37-126.158-7-4-1-1 here].
flavortext: You can hang these on your walls.

name: Spiked Squelcher
droppedby: Bloodback | Braindeath | Bretzecutioner | Cliff Strider | Cyclops Smith | Depowered Minotaur | Drillworm | Falcon Knight | Flameborn | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Gorger Inferniarch | Hellspawn | Juggernaut | Lost Basher | Lost Berserker | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Moohtant | Orclops Doomhauler | Orclops Ravager | Preceptor Lazare | Retching Horror | Rustheap Golem | Shadowpelt | Stampor | Stone Devourer | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The Old Whopper | The Souldespoiler | Tromphonyte | Werebear | Werelion | White Pale | Worker Golem
notes: Good two-handed club for lvl 30 knights. <noinclude>It can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.</noinclude>

name: Spirit Cloak
droppedby: Afflicted Strider | Hellgorak | Nightstalker | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Sea Serpent | Werelion
notes: This is one of three [[Mage]]'s armors that increases [[Magic Level]] by 1, yet carries no minimum [[Level]] requirements. Compared to either a [[Focus Cape]] or an [[Ethno Coat]], this armor falls in the middle of the bunch in terms of protection, but it is the [[Capacity|heaviest]]. Only [[Sorcerer]]s and [[Druid]]s may use them.

name: Spool of Yarn
notes:
[[Marina]] can make 1 yarn in exchange for 10 [[Spider Silk]]s if you do a favour for her.
Before she will want to trade with you, you have to make a one-time donation of 50 [[Honeycomb]]s.

\n10 are needed for an addon of [[Barbarian Outfits]].
10 are needed for an addon of [[Summoner Outfits]]/[[Mage Outfits]].
10 are needed for an addon of [[Assassin Outfits]].
flavortext: It is made from fine spider silk.

name: Springsprout Rod
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Ancient Scarab | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Askarak Demon | Askarak Lord | Askarak Prince | Blemished Spawn | Bog Raider | Choking Fear | Crawler | Cursed Book | Dark Carnisylvan | Deathbine | Deepworm | Devourer | Distorted Phantom | Druid's Apparition | Enusat the Onyx Wing | Faceless Bane | Fleshcrawler | Flimsy Lost Soul | Gaffir | Infernal Phantom | Ink Blob | Ironblight | Liodile | Madareth | Memory of a Scarab | Pirat Scoundrel | Ripper Spectre | Turbulent Elemental | Usurper Commander | Usurper Warlock | Varnished Diremaw | Venerable Girtablilu | Vibrant Phantom | Weakened Shlorg | Young Goanna | Irgix the Flimsy
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frederik, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Romir, Siflind, Tandros
notes: The [[druid]]'s equivalent of the [[sorcerer]]'s [[Wand of Starstorm]] and the [[Earth Damage|earth damage]] counterpart to the [[Hailstorm Rod]] and the [[Underworld Rod]].
flavortext: It is filled with the energy of growing plants.

name: Staff (Simon)
notes: This is Simon the Beggar's favourite staff. It looks like an ordinary [[Staff]], but it doesn't have attack and defense attributes.\nIt is temporarily obtained during the [[Beggar Outfits Quest]]. Needed for the staff addon on the [[Beggar Outfits]].
flavortext: It must be the one which Simon the Beggar talked about.

name: Stamped Letter
notes:
Just like [[parcel]]s, when you send a [[letter]] to someone, it become stamped so it cannot be re-used or re-written.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Secret Letter]], a [[Compromising Letter]], an [[Envelope from the Wizards]], a [[Letter to Eremo]], a [[Letter to Markwin]] and a [[Letter to Chantalle]].

name: Steel Axe
notes: A player who joined in the knight vocation can choose this axe in the attached cellar of the [[Island of Destiny]]. Looks almost the same as a [[Ruthless Axe]] but with only one blade.

name: Stone (Small)
notes: Can be found in much places laying around. The smaller ones weigh 410.00 oz, while the larger version weighs 780.00 oz.

name: Silky Fur
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Silky Tapestry
notes: Used as a [[Tapestry]].

name: Silver Cup of Honour
notes:
This item can only be obtained in a soccer tournament.
The first silver cup of honour was given to [[Tibianews]]'s soccer team at the first [[Fansites Soccer Cup]]. One cup was also awarded to {{character|Goth Saibaiman}} for winning in second place the [[Portal Tibia]]'s soccer tournament. {{character|Avartax}}, {{character|Gensun}} and {{character|Sir Hybrid}} were awarded with silver cups of honour for winning the second place of the soccer tournament in the 7th Tibia Convention in Mexico. {{character|Archer Bean}} received this item by winning the 2nd place in [[Tibia Cubix]] "Cheering for the win" contest.
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer.

name: Silver Fafnar Trophy
notes: This trophy can be equipped as a light source.\nYou can get it by [[use|using]] the [[Statue of Fafnar (Lightbearer)]] in the reward room of the [[The Lightbearer]] event after you've lit at least one but fewer than ten basins during the event.
flavortext: You read: ''Player'' helped to keep the fire basins burning and is one of the lightbearers of this world.

name: Silver Rune Emblem (Animate Dead)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
flavortext: It's an adorned animate dead rune.

name: Silver Rune Emblem (Avalanche)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
flavortext: It's an adorned avalanche rune.

name: Silver Rune Emblem (Explosion)
notes:
These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
\nObtainable in the [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]].
flavortext: It's an adorned explosion rune.

name: Silver Rune Emblem (Heavy Magic Missile)
notes:
These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
\nObtainable in the [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]] and by clearing the Scrapper Arena in the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]].
flavortext: It's an adorned heavy magic missile rune.

name: Silver Rune Emblem (Magic Wall)
notes: These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
flavortext: It's an adorned magic wall rune.

name: Silver Rune Emblem (Sudden Death)
notes:
These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
\nObtainable in the [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]] and in the [[Crystal Wand Quest]]. Can also be obtained in the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]] by clearing the Warlord Arena.
flavortext: It's an adorned sudden death rune.

name: Silver Rune Emblem (Ultimate Healing)
notes:
These [[Rune Emblems]] replaced the old overcharged runes and can be won in fansite events.
\nObtainable in [[The Pits of Inferno Quest]] and [[Adorned UH Rune Quest]]. Can also be obtained in the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]] by clearing the Warlord Arena.
flavortext: It's an adorned ultimate healing rune.

name: Silver Trophy of Excellence
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer.
{{character|Hoenir}} and {{character|Sonoroman}} received this item in the [[TibiaNews]] Comic Contest.
{{character|Kariel Win}} received this item for being second placed from [[TibiaJourney]]'s "Design with items contest" competition.
{{character|Kerel of neerpelt}} and {{character|Creepy shaman}} received this item in the [[TibiaWiki]]'s "Create your own Creature" contest.
{{character|Li Dao}} received this item in the [[Tibiafriends]] item competition.
{{character|Arros The Brave}} received this item in the [[Tibiopedia]] "Tibian Traveler" contest on August 31st, 2009.
{{character|Dyloslawer}} from Pacera received this item for being second placed on [[TibiaVenezuela]]'s Gameplay Guide Contest.
{{character|Beyolina}} received this item from a [[TibiaMx]]'s Pumpkin Carving contest.
{{character|Pilux}} received this item for being second placed on the first [[Tibiopedia]] Movie Awards.
{{character|Ramy on Secura}} received this item from [[Tibia Lottery]]'s "Kill somebody or die trying" event.
{{character|Karlkoninan}} received this item for making most frags in [[Tibia Lottery]]'s Event "Kill Somebody or Die Trying" on March 22nd, 2010 and in fansite item competition of [[Tibia-Stats]].
{{character|Mirkaan}} received this item for the second place in a wrestling tournament at [[TibiaRP]]'s 2nd birthday party.
Two were given to {{character|Mounthrize}} on September 20th, 2010. One for winning the second place in "A day in the life of a role player" by [[TibiaRP]] and other for second place in the [[TibiaTR]] Item Competition.
{{character|Divine Law}} received this item for being second place in the [[TibiaBariloche]]'s screenshot contest on Jun 1st, 2011.
{{character|Ardilla Selassie}} received this item for being second place in the [[TibiaSpace]]'s "What's the Music?" Contest on July 25th, 2011.
{{character|Trimegis}} received this item for making second place in the [[TibiaRP]]'s Christmas contest on January 4th, 2011.
{{character|Abistral}} received this prize in the [[TibiaCity]]'s Easter Contest on May 4th, 2012.

name: Silver Warrior Trophy
notes:
You can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer.
{{character|Gus}} received this item for winning second place in the TibiaMx Wrestling Contest.
{{character|Nathyn Nightwatcher}} won this trophy in a screenshot contest at TibiaFans.se. Another one was given to {{character|Nyste}} for getting 2nd place on TibiaSpace Christmas Contest in 2010.

name: Skull Belt
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Leader | Orc Warlord | Orc Warrior
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Skull of a Caveman
notes: Item temporarily obtained in the [[Unnatural Selection Quest]].
flavortext: It once belonged to an ancestor of Lazaran. Obviously he had really bad teeth.

name: Skullcrusher
notes: It has the same Attack and Defense as [[The Stomper]], but is heavier and its level requirement is lower.
history: First looted in Tibia was in [[Chimera]] by the guild {{Guild|Squad}}.\n<gallery mode="nolines">Skullcrusher.jpg</gallery>

name: Skunk Tail
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Slightly Rusted Armor
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Annihilon | Empowered Glooth Horror | Ghastly Dragon | Grim Reaper | Hellgorak | Hellspawn | Horestis | Lost Soul | Madareth | Medusa | Metal Gargoyle | Plaguesmith | Professor Maxxen | Rustheap Golem | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | The Abomination | Ushuriel | Zanakeph | Zorvorax | Zugurosh | Zulazza the Corruptor
notes:
Using a [[Rust Remover|rust remover]] on it will either '''break''' the armor or yield one of the following: * {{Ilink|Brass Armor}} [[Brass Armor]] (common) * {{Ilink|Plate Armor}} [[Plate Armor]] (uncommon) * {{Ilink|Knight Armor}} [[Knight Armor]] (uncommon) * {{Ilink|Crown Armor}} [[Crown Armor]] (semi-rare) * {{Ilink|Golden Armor}} [[Golden Armor]] (very rare) (See [[Slightly Rusted Armor/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]]). There is high chance that the armor will break. Use a [[Rust Remover|rust remover]] to un-rust the armor. This [[Rusty Armor]] gives the best chance of getting a rare item. It was initially thought that [[Magic Plate Armor]]s or [[Dragon Scale Mail]]s were also available by unrusting the armor, but this has proven to be false.
Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
Getting a [[Golden Armor]] by successfully polishing this item is one of the two requirements to get the [[Lucky Devil]] [[achievement]].
history:
In a small patch the weight was {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|changed}} from 100.00 oz to 120.00 oz on November 10, 2009.
\nOn {{OfficialNewsArchive|5087|June 12, 2019}}, its name was changed from ''Rusty Armor'' to the current one, and the sprite was also updated.
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the armor you will be able to see what it is.
notes2: '''Note:''' Rusted armors can be found in two additional variations, [[Heavily Rusted Armor]] and [[Rusted Armor]].

name: Slightly Rusted Legs
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Fury | Hellgorak | Horestis | Madareth | Rustheap Golem | Sulphur Spouter | Zugurosh
notes:
Able to turn into: *[[Brass Legs]] *[[Plate Legs]] *[[Knight Legs]] (semi-rare) *[[Crown Legs]] (rare) *[[Golden Legs]] (very rare) [[Slightly Rusted Legs/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]] Like the [[Rusty Armor]] it has a chance of breaking. You can un-rust these using a [[Rust Remover|rust remover]].
Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
history: In a small patch the weight was {{OfficialNewsArchive|1123|changed}} from 35.00 oz to 70.00 oz on November 10, 2009.
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the legs you will be able to see what it is.

name: Slingshot
notes:
[[File:War Bear.gif|link=War Bear|right]] This is the item needed to tame a [[Bear]]. It has a chance of breaking when used. To buy this item, you need to have the rank of Huntsman or higher in the [[Paw and Fur Society]]. Players who choose to become a [[Paladin]] in [[Island of Destiny]] can see a slingshot in the associated cellar. Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The bear ran away.}}
Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The bear is trying to hit you with its claws.}}
Broken: {{Message|type=sound|Oh no! The slingshot broke.}}
Succeeded: {{Message|type=sound|You tamed the wild bear.}}
Most times the bear will either run away or try to hit you (when this happens the slingshot doesn't break).
history: Slingshot was implemented with [[Updates/7.8|Summer Update 2006]], but it was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] until [[Updates/8.7|Winter Update 2010]] when it was sold by NPC [[Grizzly Adams]] and dropped by [[Hunter]] (and could be used to tame [[War Bear]]). The price was supposed to be 100,000 gp, but due to a bug, players were able to get it for 34,463 gp, and CipSoft decided to keep it for approximately this price.
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Small Flask of Eyedrops
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Bonelord | Elder Bonelord | Gazer | The Evil Eye
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\nUsed in the [[Witches' Cauldron Quest]].

name: Small Notebook
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
flavortext: It contains a long list of 'saved maidens' and their addresses. Someone might be interested in it.

name: Small Pitchfork
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs, and as with other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
