notes:
Used in the [[Lion's Rock Quest]].
1 of them can be obtained through the [[Nomads Mini World Change]] event.
3 of them can be obtained through the [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
30 of them can be otained from [[Lightbearer]] event.

name: Snake God's Sceptre
Snake God's Wristguard
notes:
This is a wristguard, but it can be considered a "[[Spellbooks|Spellbook]]" type item, because it has the same attributes as one (worn in the shield slot, shows spells and boosts magic levels). Due to having 2 points less in defence than the [[Spellbook of Dark Mysteries]], it's only used as a shield by those who cannot afford the [[Spellbook of Dark Mysteries]].
Due to its rarity and appearance, it is often also used as a decorative item.
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Snake Sceptre
notes: This rod can be obtained by putting the [[Sceptre Part (Cusp)|Cusp]], [[Sceptre Part (Emerald)|Emerald]], and [[Sceptre Part (Shaft)|Shaft]] together.Obtained and used during [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: Snake Skin
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Serpent Spawn | Srezz Yellow Eyes | The Noxious Spawn
notes: 20 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Snake Skin]] and [[Powerful Snake Skin]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].
imbuements: Intricate Snake Skin, Powerful Snake Skin

name: Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness
notes:
Obtainable by opening [[AVIN]]'s [[Mysterious Package]]. You need to have the [[Secret Service Quest]] completed to be able to open the package, and it needs to correspond to the package you want to open.
Can be used as [[Rope]], [[Shovel]], [[Pick]], [[Machete]], [[Spoon]] and [[Kitchen Knife]], but not as a [[melee]] weapon to destroy objects. You must always keep in mind that this item can [[Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness (Jammed)|jam]] whenever you use it and can then not be used for 1 minute. It will show this message when you try to use it while jammed:
{{Sound|Oh no! Your tool is jammed and can't be used for a minute.}}
It's a good idea to always carry a rope and shovel with you even if you have this item. Can be gotten through the [[Secret Service Quest]].
This item can be used to open 500 [[Loose Stone Pile]]s in order to gain the [[The Undertaker]] [[achievement]].
This item can also be used to cut [[Jungle Grass]] 100 times in order to gain the [[Nothing Can Stop Me]] achievement. Can also be used to cut fruit for [[Decorated Cake]]s in order to gain the [[Piece of Cake]] and [[With a Cherry on Top]] achievements.
flavortext: This nifty gadget can be used for many vital and less vital purposes. If it's not jammed, that is.

name: Snowman Package
notes:
When you unpack it, you'll get a [[Snowman (Wrappable)|Snowman]] for your house with your name on it.

The package will disappear together with all snowmen once the [[Christmas]] event ends on January 10. Note that snowmen can be kept from disappearing if they are wrapped into [[Furniture Kit]]s.

If you use 100 of these, you will receive the achievement [[The Snowman]].
flavortext: Use it in your house to reveal a snowman.

name: Some Golden Fruits
notes:
Exposed in [[Treasure Rooms#Darashia Catacombs|Darashia Catacombs Treasure Room]], in [[Omruc]]'s Treasure Room and [[Yasir]]'s ship.
Reward in the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]], after finishing all 3 [[Warzones]], in {{Mapper Coords|128.54|124.2|10|text=a chest}} near the bank of [[Gnomegate]].
<gallery hideaddbutton="true" type="slideshow" mode="nolines">
Darashia Catacombs.gif|Darashia Catacombs
Omruc Treasure Room.png|Omruc's treasure
Yasir ship on Carlin.png|Yasir's ship
</gallery>
history: Due to a now fixed bug caused by [[Updates/9.4|Winter Update 2011]], a few players managed to obtain them by logging into Yasir's ship in [[Liberty Bay]]. This bug prompted [[CipSoft]] to make it obtainable after [[Updates/9.6|Summer Update 2012]].

name: Soul Contract
notes: It looks the same as a [[Bill]], a [[Document]], a [[Document (Rewriteable)]], a [[Fan Club Membership Card]] and all [[Gnomish Voucher]]s.\nUsed to bribe [[Leeland]] in [[The New Frontier Quest]].
flavortext: A contract in which some desperate person has sold his soul.

name: Souleater Trophy
notes: An extremely rare drop from [[Souleater]]s. Gives a small amount of light.

name: Special Polish
notes:
This is used to polish [[Crystal Ball]]s. It disappears once used.
Made by combining [[Molten Wax]] with a [[Grave Flower]]. Used in the [[Assistant of Eclesius Quest]].
flavortext: You can use it to polish Eclesius' crystal ball.

name: Spectral Cloth
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[A Father's Burden Quest]].

name: Spellbook (Alternative)
notes: It can be seen in the basement of [[Mal'ouquah]] (Green Djinn Fortress), [[Rahemos]]'s room, [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis Room]] (under a fence) and [[Treasure Rooms#Ferumbras Treasure Room|Ferumbras Citadel Treasure Room]]. It was temporarily obtainable on the [[Updates/8.54|Christmas Test Server 2009]].

name: Spellweaver's Robe
droppedby: Brain Squid | Burning Gladiator | Draken Spellweaver | Energetic Book | Energuardian of Tales | Ethershreck | Ghastly Dragon | Hatebreeder | Haunted Dragon | Juvenile Bashmu | Knowledge Elemental | Lady Tenebris | Lloyd | Lokathmor | The Duke of the Depths | Undead Dragon | Utua Stone Sting | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes: Somewhat better than a [[Lightning Robe]].

name: Spider Fangs
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Sacred Spider | Spider | Spider (Nostalgia) | Tarantula
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\nUsed in the [[Witches' Cauldron Quest]].

name: Spider Silk
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Cave Spider | Crystal Spider | Exotic Cave Spider | Giant Spider | Hide | Mamma Longlegs | The Bloodweb | The Old Widow | Undertaker
notes:
A semi-rare item. Because of its heavy use in obtaining addons as well as its low drop rate, spider silks have a good market value. However, this is declining with the introduction of many new areas with [[Giant Spider]]s and [[Crystal Spider]]s. Low levels can and often do complete the [[Tarantula]] task of [[Killing in the Name of... Quest]] to get a high chance of looting one from the boss, [[Hide]]. Due to a (now fixed) game bug that allowed people to kill an unlimited number of task bosses using field runes, spider silks were heavily inflated even on [[Aurora]] and [[Aurera]] where [[World Transfer]] is forbidden.
It looks the same as [[Recharging Tarantula Trap]] and [[Steel Spider Silk]], which is also often used to scamming people through trade. It is hard to see Spider Silk on light backgrounds due to it being white and stringy. Inside a container, it looks like this:
[[File:Spider Silk (background).png]] 100 of these (10 [[Spool of Yarn]]) are needed for [[Barbarian Outfits Quest]].
100 of these (10 [[Spool of Yarn]]) are needed for [[Assassin Outfits Quest]].
100 of these (10 [[Spool of Yarn]]) are needed for male [[Summoner Outfits Quest]].
100 of these (10 [[Spool of Yarn]]) are needed for female [[Mage Outfits Quest]].
1 is needed for [[What a foolish Quest]].
10 of these can be traded for a [[Spool of Yarn]] with [[Marina]].
history: With update {{Update|8.5}} this item was renamed from '''Giant Spider Silk''' to Spider Silk. This is because (in an earlier update?) other monsters such as [[Crystal Spider]] began dropping them.

name: Spiked Iron Ball
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Eternal Guardian | Lizard Chosen | Lizard High Guard | The Voice of Ruin
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Spirit Container
droppedby: King Zelos | Souleater | The Enraged Thorn Knight | Ushuriel
notes: Looks the same as an [[Ectoplasm Container (Bone)]] and an [[Ectoplasm Container (Ectoplasm)]].\nOne of these is needed for the [[Warrior Outfits Quest]] and another for the [[Barbarian Outfits Quest]].
flavortext: It contains pure fighting spirit.

name: Spiritual Charm
notes:
This item can be used to provide the user the [[blessing]] [[The Spiritual Shielding]]. It only works once, then it disappears, the [[Ripple Effect]] {{Ilink|Ripple Effect}} appears on the user and the following message will appear: {{Server Message|The Spiritual Shielding protects you.}}
If the user already has the blessing, the following message will appear in orange preventing using it: {{Message|type=sound|You already possess this blessing.}}
The price of this item varies quite a lot because depending on your level is how much this blessing would cost for you if you were to buy it at the NPC.\nObtained in the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].
flavortext: The Spiritual Shielding is contained in it.

name: Spooky Blue Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Squeezing Gear of Girlpower
notes:
Obtainable by opening [[CGB]]'s [[Mysterious Package]]. You need to have the [[Secret Service Quest]] completed to be able to open the package, and it needs to correspond to the package you want to open.
Can be used as [[Rope]], [[Shovel]], [[Pick]], [[Machete]], [[Scythe]] and [[Sickle]], but not as a [[melee]] weapon to destroy objects. You must always keep in mind that this item can [[Squeezing Gear of Girlpower (Jammed)|jam]] whenever you use it and can then not be used for 1 minute. It will show this message when you try to use it while jammed:
{{Sound|Oh no! Your tool is jammed and can't be used for a minute.}}
It's a good idea to always carry a rope and shovel with you even if you have this item. Can be gotten through the [[Secret Service Quest]].
Can be used to open 500 [[Loose Stone Pile]]s in order to gain the [[The Undertaker]] [[achievement]].
Can also be used to cut [[Jungle Grass]] 100 times in order to gain the [[Nothing Can Stop Me]] achievement.
Can also be used to cut [[Wheat]] 200 times in order to gain the [[Happy Farmer]] achievement.
Can also be used to cut [[Sugar Cane]] 50 times in order to gain the [[Natural Sweetener]] achievement.
flavortext: This nifty gadget can be used for many vital and less vital purposes. If it's not jammed, that is.

notes:

\nLooks the same as [[Bread]] and [[Garlic Bread]].
\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: This bread is so old that it has become unbreakable and a formidable weapon.

name: Skinning Knife
notes:
Can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.30|126.92|10|4|text=here}}.
Skinning knife is temporarily obtained during [[The Rookie Guard Quest]], however, it's possible to keep the knife permanently. Instruction:

1. Collect the knife from the dead body during the quest.

2. Drop the knife on the ground.

3. Go back to Tom and tell him youâ€™ve lost your knife.

4. Tom will reset your mission, and youâ€™ll be able to collect the second knife from the dead body.

5. You will have two knives, and after you use one on the dead war wolf corpse, it will disappear, but you can keep the first knife for yourself.
flavortext: Use this knife on a dead war wolf to retrieve some leather. Don't lose it and don't leave the cave.

name: Slime Gobbler
notes:
It takes 5 seconds for this item to recharge.\n

Get this item from [[Servant Sentry]].\nCan be used to remove Slime Fungus from the floor within the Golem caves.

name: Slime Mould
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

notes: \n\n20 of these are needed in the [[Elementalist Outfits Quest]].

name: Slug Drug
notes:
Used to tame a {{Ilink|Tiger Slug}} [[Slug]]. It has a chance of breaking (around 30%) when used. You can find [[Slug]]s north west in the [[Venore]] [[Swamp Troll Cave]] down a hole.

'''Failed''':
{{Sound|The slug flees.}}
'''Failed''':
{{Sound|The slug slips through your grasp.}}
'''Broke''':
{{Sound|This slug drug didn't seem to have any effect.}}
'''Succeeded''':
{{Sound|You drugged the slug.}}
It can be gotten from [[Belongings of a Deceased]].
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Solitude Charm
notes:
This item can be used to provide the user the [[blessing]] [[Wisdom of Solitude]]. It only works once, then it disappears, the [[Green Sparkles Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Sparkles Effect}} appears on the user and the following message will appear: {{Server Message|The Wisdom of Solitude inspires you.}}
If the user already has the blessing, the following message will appear in orange preventing using it: {{Message|type=sound|You already possess this blessing.}}
It is quite valuable to free account players since it gives one of the only blessings they can not buy.\nA reward from the [[Rise of Devovorga]] world quest.
flavortext: The Wisdom of Solitude is contained in it.

name: Soul Net
notes: Can be seen in the [[Gardens of Night]], {{Mapper Coords|129.31|126.91|10|8|text=here}}. The NPC [[Alternative Rock]] will hand you this item after you offer him help. He needs you to capture evil spirits that corrupt the Deeplings.\n\nYou have to use this item on the corrupted deepling spawns, located east of the area accessed by a teleporter, in a cave populated by [[Deepling Worker]]s. You need several people using Soul Nets to purify all the corrupted spawns before they "regenerate" (two minutes). This quest is probably related to an addon for the [[Deepling Outfits]].

name: Soulfire Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
[[File:Burned Icon.gif]] Causes the target to catch on [[fire]].
This rune causes 10 damage every 9 seconds for a period of time. How long the effect will last depends upon your level and magic level.
This rune is most effective when used as the first attack against a strong creature, causing them to burn while being attacked. It's used mostly in [[PVP]] combat to keep the enemy from logging out or fleeing to a [[Protection Zone]]. Note that the caster is not able to logout while target burns, too. Formula for amount of ticks is very simple. For [[Druid]] and [[Sorcerer]] it's a sum of [[Level]] and [[Magic Level]] and both divided by 3. AMOUNT_OF_TICKS = (LEVEL + MAGIC) / 3 If you are a [[Knight]] you have to sum your [[Level]] and [[Magic Level]] and divide both by 20. [[Paladin]] have to divide the sum by 15. To throw soulfire for 15 minutes you need to be a [[Druid]] or [[Sorcerer]] with atleast ([[Level]] + [[Magic Level]]) above 300. Or [[Knight]] with [[Level]] above 2000 or [[Paladin]] with [[Level]] around 1460 and [[Magic Level]] around 40. It's not known there is a cap for how long the effect can lasts. Rumors are the cap is 15 minutes (1000 damage in total). But it needs to be checked. For the spell, see [[Soulfire]].

name: Statue of Devovorga
notes:
Emits weak green light (can be seen with ambient light mode turned low).
It can be obtained through the [[Rise of Devovorga]] event.
flavortext: In memory of her - half plant, half demon, incredibly powerful and betrayed by her own creators.

name: Stone of Wisdom
notes: Until 2014 you received experience equivalent to 5000 times your level by handing this stone to [[Milos]] ({{Mapper Coords|129.234|124.79|3|4|text=here}}) or [[Trimegis]] ({{Mapper Coords|126.51|125.187|5|3|text=here}}). As of August 29, 2012, you can only use one stone per year, and only when the [[Rise of Devovorga]] event is active (September 01â€“07). On worlds which were successful on completing the event, players can use this stone up until the server save on September 30th. In 2014, it was replaced by [[Stone of Insight]].\nReward of the [[Rise of Devovorga]] [[World Quest]], for characters who damaged [[Devovorga]] or one of its incarnations.
history: This stone was extremely valuable right after it was released on ''September 1, 2010'' because there was no limit to how many stones of wisdom you could use at a time. The stone of wisdom was created for the intention of providing players an easy way to recover their lost experience while doing the [[Rise of Devovorga]] [[World Quest]]. However, due to the abuse of such item from some players, this item was then adjusted by [[CipSoft]] in the next update - the stone could be used at any level but only one stone could be used per month. Needless to say, this adjustment to the item drastically dropped its price. As of ''August 29, 2012'', the amount you can trade in decreased to one per year, and only during the event.
flavortext: This rare artefact is a mere relic nowadays.

name: Stone Shower Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
[[File:Poisoned Icon.gif]] Shoots an earth attack that covers a large circular area around the target, this is the Druids' equivalent of the [[Thunderstorm]].
This is a new rune added in the [[Winter Update 2007]]. The player using the Stone Shower rune is never affected by it. This rune can be used as a scam by telling other players to use it as [[Chameleon Rune]], thus making the victim skulled.
\nFor the spell, see [[Stone Shower]].
history: The price was changed from 37 to 41 since [[Summer Update 2024]].

name: Strange Blue Powder
notes: Obtain it by opening an [[Envelope from the Wizards]]. Use it to mark yourself "blue", and use the [[Strange Blue Powder (Used)|remaining powder]] on a player marked with a different color to join either Green (Blue+Yellow) or Violet (Blue+Red).\nNeeded for the March and September event [[The Colours of Magic]].

name: Strange Powder (Hive)
notes:
Looks the same as [[Lump of Dough]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[War Against The Hive Quest]].

name: Strange Red Powder
notes: Obtain it by opening an [[Envelope from the Wizards]]. Use it to mark yourself "red", and use the [[Strange Red Powder (Used)|remaining powder]] on a player marked with a different color to join either Violet (Red+Blue) or Orange (Red+Yellow).\nNeeded for the March and September event [[The Colours of Magic]].

name: Strange Yellow Powder
notes: Obtain it by opening an [[Envelope from the Wizards]]. Use it to mark yourself "yellow", and use the [[Strange Yellow Powder (Used)|remaining powder]] on a player marked with a different color to join either Green (Yellow+Blue) or Orange (Yellow+Red).\nNeeded for the March and September event [[The Colours of Magic]].

name: Shrunken Head Necklace
notes: It provides the highest [[Speed]] bonus of all [[Amulets and Necklaces]], but is mostly sought after to be used as a decoration due to its rarity.

name: Sight of Surrender's Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Its only purpose is to be sold to NPCs. It has a high gold-to-oz ratio.

name: Signed Contract
notes: Looks the same as a [[Document (Certificate)]], a [[Contract]], a [[Tactical Map]], and a [[Faded Last Will]].Part of [[What a Foolish Quest]].

name: Silencer Claws
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 25 of them are needed for the [[Intricate Void]] and [[Powerful Void]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Silencer Excretion
notes: Can often be found on the ground near [[Silencer]] spawns. [[Silencer]]s produce it randomly when they have a target. It decays 60 minutes after produced, so not really that quickly.\n\nUsed in the [[Roshamuul Quest]].
flavortext: This dung smells extremely awful and deteriorates quickly.

name: Silencer Resonating Chamber
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
You can use it and make it break or... It has a high gold-to-oz ratio.
\nSome of these are needed for the {{Spoiler Section|Roshamuul Quest|Luring Silencers}} mission and hence also for the [[Luring Silence]] [[achievement]].
flavortext: Blowing this fragile resonance chamber from an elevated place is likely to attract other silencers.

name: Silver Medal
notes:
Probably a future [[Contest Prizes|contest prize]].
\nYou can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer.

name: Silver Prison Key
notes: Low chance to obtain it from an [[Unrealized Dream]]. Allows access to [[Terofar]]'s chamber. Use it on in the [[Roshamuul Prison]] when standing on the respective platform to be taken to him.
flavortext: You dreamt that this key unlocks the prison of a powerful horror that you had to face on your own.

name: Silver Raid Token
droppedby: Furyosa | Ocyakao | The Pale Count | The Welter | Tyrn | Weakened Shlorg | White Pale | Willi Wasp | Zomba | Zushuka | Hirintror

name: Simple Arrow
droppedby: Dawnfly | Troll Marauder | Troll-Trained Salamander | Woodling
notes:
Players will receive 100 of these arrows when going through the [[Paladin]] gate on [[Dawnport]] the first time.
\nYou can create 30 with [[Arrow Call]].

name: Skull Shatterer
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Slime Heart
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Blood Beast | Brain Squid | Cave Devourer | Rage Squid | Squid Warden
notes: 2 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Venom]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Slimy Leaf Tentacle
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It's a creature product, with no known use at the present. It can be sold to an NPC for a decent price and has a high gp-to-oz ratio.

name: Small Crystal Bell
notes: When you use it, [[White Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|White Notes Effect}} appear. \nObtained and used during [[The Cursed Crystal Quest]].
flavortext: It seems fragile and precious.

name: Small Dragon Tear
notes: 3 of them are obtained and used during [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]].
flavortext: A dragon tear looks like a small, luminous gem, glittering in a golden light.

name: Smoking Coal
notes: Used in battles against [[Shlorg]]. A player is supposed to use it on basins around the lair in order to light them. Once it's done, [[Shlorg]] (if spawned) will disappear and [[Weakened Shlorg]] will respawn.
flavortext: This coal is smoking and emits quite a stench.

name: Snow Flake Tapestry
notes: See also other [[Tapestries]]. You can trade it for 75 [[Christmas Token]]s, but due to a bug you can only make the trade if you have 100+ tokens. That is, [[Ruprecht]] does not respond to '''snowflake tapestry''' unless you have 100+, but he only takes 75 for it.

name: Snow Globe
notes: Can be turned on/off.
history: With a [[Updates/10.31|a small patch]] close after its implementation this item can also give light. With its initial release it could already be equipped in the light source spot.

name: Soft Cheese
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard
notes: A new type of [[Cheese]].

name: Soft Piece of Cloth
notes:
A soft piece of cloth can be found in [[Workshop Quarter]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Dubious Piece of Cloth]].
flavortext: Though beautifully woven, it seems rather thin and airy

name: Sorcerer and Druid Staff
notes: It looks the same as a [[Wand of Vortex]] and [[Xodet's First Wand]].

name: Spare Part
notes: Looks the same as a [[Throwing Star]].\n\nPart of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 12.

name: Special Flask (Fools Guild)
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[What a Foolish Quest]]. When you use it on fresh [[Slime]] gas it becomes [[Special Flask (Slime)]]. When you use it on a fresh [[Stalker]] corpse it becomes [[Special Flask (Stalker)]]. When you use it on a fresh [[Quara Constrictor]] corpse it becomes [[Special Flask (Quara)]].
flavortext: Bozo gave it to you to collect certain secret ingredients.

name: Special Flask (Holy Water)
notes: Looks the same as a [[Vial]] of [[Water (Liquid)|Water]], a [[Vial of Elemental Water]] and [[Quara Ink]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[The Inquisition Quest]] and [[Rest in Hallowed Ground Quest]]. Also needed for the [[Blood Brothers Quest]] and the [[Glooth Factory Quest]].
flavortext: It contains holy water from the white raven monastery.

name: Special Flask (Padreia)
notes: \n\nItem temporarily obtained in the [[The Exterminator Quest]].
flavortext: It contains highly intensified poison against vermin.

name: Special Flask (Quara)
notes: Looks the same as a [[Vial]] of [[Water (Liquid)|Water]], a [[Vial of Elemental Water]] and [[Holy Water]].You obtain this by using an empty [[Special Flask (Fools Guild)|Special Flask]] on a fresh dead [[Quara Constrictor]]. Used in the [[What a Foolish Quest]].
flavortext: It contains the ink of a freshly slain quara.

name: Special Flask (Slime)
notes: You obtain this by using an empty [[Special Flask (Fools Guild)]] on a slain [[Slime]]'s fresh [[Poison Gas]]. Used in the [[What a Foolish Quest]].
flavortext: It contains the smell of a freshly slain slime.

name: Special Flask (Stalker)
notes: You obtain this by using an empty [[Special Flask (Fools Guild)|Special Flask]] on a fresh dead [[Stalker]]. Used in the [[What a Foolish Quest]].

name: Spellbook of Ancient Arcana
notes: Obtainable through [[The Demon Oak Quest]].
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spellbook of the Novice
notes: The weakest spellbook of all. You receive it on the [[Dawnport]] to practice [[Druid]] and [[Sorcerer]] vocations. It's advised to switch it with a [[Wooden Shield]] from [[Knight]]'s gate as their def makes a lot of difference. You cannot take it with yourself to the Mainland, however some people still own multiple copies there from exploiting the bugs in the beginning of [[Dawnport]] existance.
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spellbook of Vigilance
notes: None.
flavortext: It shows your spells and can also shield against attacks when worn.

name: Spike Shield
droppedby: Corym Charlatan | Corym Skirmisher | Corym Vanguard
notes: New item implemented in the [[Winter Update 2012]]. It has the same defense as the [[Bonelord Shield]] but it weighs more and usually costs less.

name: Spirit Shovel
notes: It doesn't work like a normal [[shovel]].\nPart of the [[Spike Tasks Quest]].

name: Spool of Steel Silk Yarn
notes:
Looks the same as [[Spider Silk Yarn]].
\nTemporarily obtained in [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.
flavortext: It is made from steel spider silk.

name: Stale Mushroom Beer
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Becomes stale when [[Fresh Mushroom Beer]] is left to sit for 20 seconds.

name: Statue of Abyssador
notes: Bring the [[Tail of Abyssador]], the [[Torso of Abyssador]] and the [[Head of Abyssador]] to [[Gnomally]] to have the statue of Abyssador reconstructed.

name: Statue of Deathstrike
notes: Bring the [[Legs of Deathstrike]], the [[Torso of Deathstrike]] and the [[Head of Deathstrike]] to [[Gnomally]] to have the statue of Deathstrike reconstructed.

name: Statue of Gnomevil
notes: Bring [[Legs of Gnomevil]], [[Torso of Gnomevil]] and [[Head of Gnomevil]] to [[Gnomally]] to have the statue of Gnomevil reconstructed.

name: Steel Spider Silk
notes: Temporarily obtained in [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.
history: It used to look the same as [[Recharging Tarantula Trap]] and [[Spider Silk]] until the [[Updates/12.51.10215|patch 12.51.10215]]. Its sprite was changed because it was frequently used to scam players that bought this item believing they were regular [[Spider Silk]]s.
flavortext: It's much tougher than ordinary spider silk.

name: Stimulated Brain
notes: Item temporarily obtained in [[The Gravedigger of Drefia Quest]]. It looks like a gray [[Orshabaal's Brain]].
flavortext: It glistens and pulsates with a subtle, worrying glow.

name: Stolen Golden Goblet
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Golden Goblet]].

Temporarily obtained in [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].
flavortext: It looks incredibly valuable.

name: Stone Nose
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Stone of Insight
notes:
This stone is a replacement for its old version, the [[Stone of Wisdom]]. By handing this stone to [[Milos]] ({{Mapper Coords|129.234|124.79|3|4|text=here}}) or [[Trimegis]] ({{Mapper Coords|126.51|125.187|5|3|text=here}}) you will receive experience equivalent to 100 times your level multiplied by your level.

<math>{Exp} = 100\,	imes\,{(Level)}^2</math>

You can only use one stone per year per character and only when the [[Rise of Devovorga]] event is active (September 01â€“07) or before [[server save]] on September 30th, if your server successfully finished the event.

In case you want to know the experience difference gained from a level and another one (in case you decide to use the stone at the end of month to earn some extra experience), you can use the following formula:

<math>{ExpDiff} = 200\,	imes\,{(CurrentLevel)}\,	imes\,{(LevelsGained)}\,+\,100\,	imes\,{(LevelsGained)}\,	imes{(LevelsGained)}</math>

Reward of the [[Rise of Devovorga]] [[World Quest]], for characters who damaged [[Devovorga]] or one of its incarnations ([[Anmothra]], [[Irahsae]], [[Teneshpar]], [[Chikhaton]] or [[Phrodomo]]).
flavortext: This rare artefact can be traded with Milos or Trimegis for a fraction of their knowledge.

name: Stone Rubbish
notes: It can be found at several spots all over [[Tibia (Continent)|Tibia]] in four different versions.

name: Stone Table Kit
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Carved Stone Table}} [[Carved Stone Table]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a stone table.

name: Strange Amulet
notes:
There's a mysterious message on it.
Looks the same as an [[Ancient Amulet]].\nObtained and used in the [[Dawnport Quest]].
flavortext: It shows some half-erased hieroglyphs.

name: Strange Device
notes: Temporarily obtained and used in the {{Spoiler Section|Glooth Factory Quest|The Mutated Glooth Plague}}.

name: Strange Good Night Songs
notes: It looks the same as an [[Atlas]], a [[Book (Atlas)]] and a [[Book (CGB)]].\nObtained during {{Spoiler Section|Roshamuul Quest|Soothing Bad Dreams}}.
flavortext: It contains some hypnotic melodies that are hard to remember.

name: Strange Probing Device
notes: It looks the same as an [[Active Probing Device]] and a [[Strange Probing Device (Instable)]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Oramond Quest]].
flavortext: There is no evidence this thing even works. Even slightest movement may trigger its mechanisms.

name: Silver Dust
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.

name: Silver Key (Outpost)
notes:
The corresponding key is [[Key 0010]].
It looks the same as a [[Silver Key]] and [[Theodore Loveless' Key]].
flavortext: This could be the key to a room in the outpost.

name: Silver Nuggets
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.

name: Silver Token
droppedby: Alptramun | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla | Black Vixen | Bloodback | Count Vlarkorth | Darkfang | Drume | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Essence of Malice | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Ghulosh | Gorzindel | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Kroazur | Lady Tenebris | Lloyd | Lokathmor | Lord Azaram | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Mazoran | Mazzinor | Melting Frozen Horror | Plagirath | Plagueroot | Ragiaz | Ravenous Hunger | Razzagorn | Scarlett Etzel | Shadowpelt | Sharpclaw | Shulgrax | Sir Baeloc | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | Tarbaz | The Baron from Below | The Blazing Time Guardian | The Count of the Core | The Duke of the Depths | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The False God | The Freezing Time Guardian | The Last Lore Keeper | The Nightmare Beast | The Sandking | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Souldespoiler | The Source of Corruption | The Time Guardian | The Unarmored Voidborn | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Zamulosh
notes:
Can be exchanged with [[Cledwyn]] for various armors providing both a skill and a resistance bonus and also for the first and second addons of the [[Rift Warrior Outfits]]. 5 of this is a reward after completing through the [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].
You have a chance of finding one when opening a {{Ilink|Surprise Jar}} [[Surprise Jar]].
history: * During the [[Updates/12.80.11430|Winter Update 2021]], the item's weight was reduced from '''0.20''' oz to '''0.01''' oz.

name: Simple Arrow (Weak)
droppedby: Dawnfly | Troll Marauder | Troll-Trained Salamander | Woodling
notes: This weaker variant of [[Simple Arrow]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Updates/10.8|Summer Update 2015]] with all [[Weak Ammunition and Runes]], but [[CipSoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Single Human Eye
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: You see an oculus gift. For two dimensions only.

name: Skull Fetish
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Animated Ogre Shaman | Ogre Brute | Ogre Rowdy | Ogre Ruffian | Ogre Sage | Ogre Savage | Ogre Shaman | The Unarmored Voidborn
notes: It can be sold to NPC [[Mugruu]] after finishing [[Vuzrog]]'s questline.\nCan be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.

name: Slayer of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Carving (Charged)}} [[Slayer of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Slayer of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Slayer of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Slayer of Carving, Slayer of Mayhem and Slayer of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Slayer of Destruction}} [[Slayer of Destruction]].

name: Slayer of Carving (Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Slayer of Carving]] charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 20% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Slayer of Carving (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Slayer of Carving]] heavily charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Slayer of Carving (Overcharged)
notes: This item is a [[Slayer of Carving]] overcharged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Slayer of Destruction
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history: This weapon was created as the result of the unification of the [[Slayer of Carving]], [[Slayer of Remedy]] and [[Slayer of Mayhem]].\n\nOn [[Updates/12.08.7995|February 5, 2019]], the level requirement for this weapon was raised from 100 to 200.

name: Slayer of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Slayer of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Slayer of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Slayer of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Slayer of Carving, Slayer of Mayhem and Slayer of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Slayer of Destruction}} [[Slayer of Destruction]].

name: Slayer of Mayhem (Charged)
notes:
This item is an [[Slayer of Mayhem]] charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Slayer of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is an [[Slayer of Mayhem]] heavily charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 15% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 25% to 40%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Slayer of Mayhem (Overcharged)
notes: This item is a [[Slayer of Mayhem]] overcharged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 20% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 30% to 60%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Slayer of Remedy
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Remedy (Charged)}} [[Slayer of Remedy (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Remedy (Heavily Charged)}} [[Slayer of Remedy (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Slayer of Remedy (Overcharged)}} [[Slayer of Remedy (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this weapon received 3 imbuing slots and its attack and defense values were adjusted to the to values of its heavily charged version.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Slayer of Carving, Slayer of Mayhem and Slayer of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Slayer of Destruction}} [[Slayer of Destruction]].

name: Slayer of Remedy (Charged)
notes: This item is an [[Slayer of Remedy]] charged with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Slayer of Remedy (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is an [[Slayer of Remedy]] heavily charged with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Slayer of Remedy (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an [[Slayer of Remedy]] overcharged with the [[Hit Points Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the hit points leech chance changed from 35% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Slayer of Remedy|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Slightly Rusted Helmet
droppedby: Ghulosh | Lokathmor | Mazzinor | The Baron from Below | The Count of the Core | The Duke of the Depths
notes:
Using a [[Flask of Rust Remover]] on it will remove the rust and uncover a helmet. There is a chance the helmet will fall apart upon trying to do so. Able to turn into: *[[Iron Helmet]] *[[Steel Helmet]] *[[Crown Helmet]] *[[Crusader Helmet]] *[[Royal Helmet]] [[Slightly Rusted Helmet/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]] One can be obtained through the [[Krailos Quest]].
Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the helmet you will be able to see what it is.

name: Slightly Rusted Shield
droppedby: Ghulosh | Gorzindel | Mazzinor | The Baron from Below | The Count of the Core | The Duke of the Depths | Lokathmor
notes:
Using a [[Flask of Rust Remover]] on it will remove the rust and uncover a shield. There is a chance the shield will fall apart upon trying to do so. Able to turn into: *[[Plate Shield]] *[[Ancient Shield]] *[[Norse Shield]] *[[Crown Shield]] *[[Vampire Shield]] [[Slightly Rusted Shield/Unrusting Statistics|Unrusting Statistics]] One can be obtained through the [[Krailos Quest]].
Successfully polishing this item will count towards the [[Polisher]] [[achievement]].
flavortext: If you can remove the rust layer and dirt from the shield you will be able to see what it is.

name: Slimy Leg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
flavortext: A slimy leg of the Baron from Below.

name: Small Energy Ball
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness (Jammed)
notes: This is a jammed [[Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness]]. It will return to its original state after a minute. Before then, it cannot be used to perform the functions that a [[Sneaky Stabber of Eliteness]] can.
flavortext: Argh! It's jammed right now! Should hopefully work again within a short time though.

name: Sniper Arrow (Weak)
droppedby: Braindeath | Crystal Spider | Elder Bonelord | Hero
buyfrom: Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Vincent, Willard
notes: This weaker variant of [[Sniper Arrow]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Updates/10.8|Summer Update 2015]] with all [[Weak Ammunition and Runes]], but [[CipSoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Solid Rage
droppedby: Ghulosh | Stabilizing Dread Intruder | The Source of Corruption

name: Some Grimeleech Wings
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 5 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Void]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Soothe Bloom
notes: Temporarily obtained in the [[Oramond_Quest#Dr._Merlay's_Misery|Oramond Quest - Dr. Merlay's Misery]] from [[Azalea]]. You can obtain multiple by dropping it on the ground or storing it in your [[Depot]] and saying {{KW|Lost}} to [[Azalea]]. You can request a replacement once every hour until you report the quest.
flavortext: Just looking at it makes you feel relaxed and at ease.

name: Spark Sphere
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Breach Brood | Burster | Eradicator | Melting Frozen Horror | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Sinister Hermit (Blue) | The Souldespoiler

name: Sparkion Claw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Spectral Bolt
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Maun, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes: It is as accurate as [[Prismatic Bolt]]s.
history: Before [[Updates/12.55|Vocation Adjustments Update]], [[Paladins|Royal Paladins]] could make 100 of them by casting the [[Conjure Spectral Bolt]] [[spell]]. Spectral Bolts used to expire 60 minutes after they were made.

name: Spying Eye
Squeezing Gear of Girlpower (Jammed)
notes: This is a jammed [[Squeezing Gear of Girlpower]]. It will return to its original state after a minute. Before then, it cannot be used to perform the functions that a [[Squeezing Gear of Girlpower]] can.
flavortext: Argh! It's jammed right now! Should hopefully work again within a short time though.

name: Stalagmite Rune (Weak)
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Nelly, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: This weaker variant of [[Stalagmite Rune]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Summer Update 2015]], but [[Cipsoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Starfish (Item)
notes:
You can dig starfish at [[Vigintia#Treasure Hunting|Vigintia's Treasure Hunting Zone]].
It looks the same as an immobile [[Starfish]].

name: Starlight Vial
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Gleaming Starlight Vial]].
\nThere is also an [[Empty Starlight Vial|empty version]] of this item: {{Ilink|Empty Starlight Vial}}.\nReward from the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Stone Shower Rune (Weak)
buyfrom: Alexander, Rock In A Hard Place
notes: This weaker variant of [[Stone Shower Rune]] was supposed to be implemented in the [[Summer Update 2015]], but [[Cipsoft]] decided to postpone the change for an unknown amount of time.

name: Stone Tablet with Ley Lines
notes: Part of the {{Spoiler Section|Grimvale Quest|The Curse Spreads}}.

name: Stonerefiner's Skull
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Strange Blue Powder (Used)
notes: Obtain it by using a [[Strange Blue Powder]]. Use this powder on a player marked with a different color to join either Green (Blue+Yellow) or Violet (Blue+Red).\nNeeded for the March and September event [[The Colours of Magic]].

name: Strange Mallet
notes: This item can be obtained by asking [[Gnominimus]] to put together its three parts: a [[Mallet Pommel]], a [[Mallet Handle]] and a [[Mallet Head]].\n\nPart of the [[Dangerous Depths Quest#Ancient_Spawn_of_Morgathla|Dangerous Depths Quest]]. When used on a [[Gong]] you will hear a {{Message|type=sound|BOOOOOOOONG!}} and the Mallet will be destroyed.
flavortext: This mallet seems almost anxious to hit something.

name: Strange Proto Matter
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Strange Red Powder (Used)
notes: Obtain it by using a [[Strange Red Powder]]. Use this powder on a player marked with a different color to join either Violet (Red+Blue) or Orange (Red+Yellow).\nNeeded for the March and September event [[The Colours of Magic]].

name: Strange Yellow Powder (Used)
notes: Obtain it by using a [[Strange Yellow Powder]]. Use this powder on a player marked with a different color to join either Green (Yellow+Blue) or Orange (Yellow+Red).\nNeeded for the March and September event [[The Colours of Magic]].

name: Strawberry Cupcake
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: One per character can be obtained from [[Brutus The Baker]] if the game world succeeds in [[A Piece of Cake]]. Eating the strawberry cupcake will completely refill your health. The cooldown period for this item is 10 minutes

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Small Petrified Tortoise
flavortext: It is a present you received from the medusa Alyxo.

name: Small Tortoise
notes: Can be also be obtained by using a [[Net (Fishing)]] on the water like a fishing rod. Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]]. Also needed for the [[Sculptor Apprentice]] achievement.

name: Snake Maw
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Used in part of the [[Kilmaresh_Quest#Midnight_Rituals|Kilmaresh Quest]]. It is identical to the [[Frayed Snake Maw]].

name: Soft Hammer
notes:
It looks like a [[Wooden Hammer]].
\nPart of the [[Winterlight Solstice]] event.

name: Some Broken Shells (Item)
notes: It can be temporarily obtained during the {{Spoiler Section|Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest|Sub-Mission 3: The Sunken City}}, but it will quickly become a [[Piece of a Shell (Item)]] which will vanish within seconds.\n\nIt looks the same as a stack of 4 or more [[Shell (Item)]], and the object [[Some Broken Shells]].
flavortext: They're drying and dissolving in the sunlight as you watch.

name: Some Mushroom Fertilizer
notes: This item was implemented in the [[Updates/9.6|Summer Update 2012]], suggesting that it was intended to be used during [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]]. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
flavortext: It is empty.

name: Sorc and Druid Attack Rune
notes: This rune was implemented in the [[Updates/9.8|Winter Update 2012]] when [[Isle of Destiny]] was revamped, suggesting that it was intended to be given during the [[Festival of Initiates]]. Although the item name implies this rune can only be used by sorcerers and druids, there is no actual vocation requirement to use it. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]. The type of damage is believed to be [[Energy Damage]], but this has not been confirmed yet.

name: Sorcerer Test Weapon Test
notes: This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Strand of Hair
notes: Temporarily obtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]].

name: Strange Empty Bucket
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: This strange bucket seems to have been specially prepared for something but looks quite leaky.

name: Strange Green Powder
notes: This item was implemented in the [[Updates/8.61|Update 8.61]], suggesting that it was intended to be used during [[The Colours of Magic]]. Possibly used during internal tests to directly side with the wizard of the respective colour, without the need of another character. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Strange Orange Powder
notes: This item was implemented in the [[Updates/8.61|Update 8.61]], suggesting that it was intended to be used during [[The Colours of Magic]]. Possibly used during internal tests to directly side with the wizard of the respective colour, without the need of another character. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Strange Probing Device (Instable)
notes: It looks the same as an [[Active Probing Device]] and a [[Strange Probing Device]].\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Oramond Quest]].
flavortext: There is no evidence this thing even works. Even slightest movement may trigger its mechanisms.

name: Strange Violet Powder
notes: This item was implemented in the [[Updates/8.61|Update 8.61]], suggesting that it was intended to be used during [[The Colours of Magic]]. Possibly used during internal tests to directly side with the wizard of the respective colour, without the need of another character. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Strangely Ornamented Key
notes: Part of [[The Dream Courts Quest]].
flavortext: This key belongs to an ancient being which will reclaim it if you do not hurry.

name: Sight of Surrender's Plushie
notes: There's a low chance of getting this item from [[Lots]].

name: Silver and a Golden Hand
notes: Temporarily obtained during the [[Within the Tides Quest]].

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Silver Hand
notes: Temporarily obtained during the [[Within the Tides Quest]].

name: Silver Moon Coin
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Tamru the Black | Weretiger | White Weretiger
notes: Use it to transform it into a [[Silver Foxmouse Coin]].

name: Sliver
notes: 50 slivers are needed in order to create an [[Exalted Core]] at the [[Exaltation Forge]] (part of the [[Equipment Upgrade|Equipment Upgrade System]]).
flavortext: This item can be used in the exaltation forge to create exalted cores.

name: Small Blue Present Kit
notes: Using a [[Small Blue Present Kit]] within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]] triggers a transformation, converting the kit into a [[Small Blue Present]]. {{Ilink|Small Blue Present}}
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a small blue present.

name: Small Reward Box
notes:
It can be obtained once by characters with less than 1000 [[Theons]] when first talking to [[Theodora]]. 

By opening it you'll get all of the following items:

* {{Ilink|Bottle of Champagne}} 2x [[Bottle of Champagne]]
* {{Ilink|Candy Floss (Large)}} 2x [[Candy Floss (Large)]]
* {{Ilink|Ice Cream Cone (Sprinkles)}} 2x [[Ice Cream Cone (Sprinkles)]]
* {{Ilink|Birthday Layer Cake}} 2x [[Birthday Layer Cake]]s
* {{Ilink|Balloon Box}} 2x [[Balloon Box]]es
* {{Ilink|Luminous Box}} 1x [[Luminous Box]]
* {{Ilink|Carpet Box}} 1x [[Carpet Box]]es
* {{Ilink|Special Fx Box}} 3x [[Special Fx Box]]es
flavortext: It could be exchanged for Theons after the festivities of Tibia's 25th anniversary.

name: Some Pieces of Wood
notes: Part of [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Sorrow
notes:
It looks the same as [[Purple Powder]] and [[Fish Flakes]].

It's the corpse of a [[Hateful Soul]] which is part of the fight against [[Goshnar's Hatred]] during the [[Soul War Quest]].

It was able to be obtained by eating at [[The Ambrosia Buffet]] and by trying your luck at the [[Lucky Dragon]].
By opening this box you can get one of the following: * {{Ilink|Bonelord Balloon}} [[Bonelord Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Cyclops Balloon}} [[Cyclops Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Cyclops Head Balloon}} [[Cyclops Head Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Dwarf Balloon}} [[Dwarf Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Eloise Balloon}} [[Eloise Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Hydra Balloon}} [[Hydra Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Orc Balloon}} [[Orc Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Orc Head Balloon}} [[Orc Head Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Rotworm Balloon}} [[Rotworm Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Rotworm Head Balloon}} [[Rotworm Head Balloon]] * {{Ilink|Tibianus Balloon}} [[Tibianus Balloon]] {{Seealso|Special Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Special Carpet Box
notes:
It was able to be obtained by eating at [[The Ambrosia Buffet]] or by trying your luck at the [[Lucky Dragon]].
By opening this box you can get one of the following: * {{Ilink|Folded Dragon Lord Carpet}} [[Folded Dragon Lord Carpet]] * {{Ilink|Folded Dragon Carpet}} [[Folded Dragon Carpet]] * {{Ilink|Folded Elemental Carpet}} [[Folded Elemental Carpet]] * {{Ilink|Folded Ghazbaran Carpet}} [[Folded Ghazbaran Carpet]] * {{Ilink|Folded Morgaroth Carpet}} [[Folded Morgaroth Carpet]] * {{Ilink|Folded Orshabaal Carpet}} [[Folded Orshabaal Carpet]] {{Seealso|Special Carpet Box/Statistics}}

name: Spiritthorn Ring
notes: Part of the [[Spiritthorn Set]]. You can [[Charged Spiritthorn Ring|recharge]] it at [[Cledwyn]] for 5 [[Silver Token]]s.\n\nIt is a possible reward of the [[Primal Ordeal Quest]], which guarantees one random item from the [[Primal Set]] through the [[Hazard System]].

name: Spiritual Horseshoe
notes: You will need a total of '''four''' Spiritual Horseshoes to get the [[Spirit of Purity]] [[Mount]].\n\nIt can be dropped by characters that have not killed [[Bakragore]], but can only be used by those who have already defeated him. When you try to use it on a character that hasn't yet defeated Bakragore, you get the message: "{{Server Message|You have to kill Bakragore first!}}".

name: Stamina Extension
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will refill one hour of [[Stamina]], but not above the maximum.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion fills up stamina by one hour.

name: Sticky Elemental Goo

attrib: sword fighting +2, axe fighting +2, club fighting +2

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Soul Prism
notes: It is a semi-rare drop (1 to 5% chance of drop) from [[Fiendish and Influenced Creatures|fiendish creatures]].\n\nCan be used on a [[Soul Core]] to transform it into the Soul Core of a random creature from the next higher [[Bestiary]] difficulty level. If used on a Soul Core of the highest bestiary difficulty, it will just transform it into a random Soul Core of the same difficulty. In rare cases the Soul Core will not be consumed, and the player will receive an [[Ominous Soul Core]] instead.

name: Stuffed Dragon
Sudden Death Rune
droppedby: Gravedigger | Hand of Cursed Fate | Tyrn
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
[[File:Cursed Icon.gif]] Shoots a powerful [[Death Damage]] attack on a single target.
This is arguably the strongest [[rune]] in the game. However, as it is a quite expensive rune, it's mostly used to kill strong [[Monsters]] fast, or gain a large amount of [[Experience]] in a relatively short time span.
\nFor the spell, see [[Sudden Death]].\nReward from the [[Iron Helmet Quest]].
history:
Used to be used by [[Paladin]]s, but since theÂ [[Updates/8.0|Summer Update 2007]]Â magic level is more important for the damage done from runes than your characters experience level, therefore all vocations do less damage with SD runes nowadays.

Before theÂ [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]] SD runes did physical damage, but since that update they do death damage. Note that many [[Death Damage#Immune to Death Damage|creatures]]Â are immune to SD runes even though the rune is very powerful. The magical formula wasÂ '''adori vita vis'''Â but has been changed toÂ '''adori gran mort'''Â in the same update to better match the new element system.
The price was changed from 135 to 162 since [[Summer Update 2024]].

name: Surprise Bag (Blue)
notes:
Blue Surprise Bags were introduced during [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]], when any [[monster]] yielding 70+ [[experience]] could drop them. They were also obtainable during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]] from special [[Troll]]s, [[Frost Troll]]s, and [[Swamp Troll]]s in certain [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary/Raids|raids]], as well as by asking [[Solkrin (NPC)|Solkrin]] for a {{KW|Present}}. They are not worth much and can give the following items:
{{Ilink|Green Balloons}} [[Green Balloons]]
{{Ilink|Red Balloons}} [[Red Balloons]]
{{Ilink|Cookie}} 10 [[Cookies]]
{{Ilink|Cream Cake}} [[Cream Cake]]
{{Ilink|Party Trumpet}} [[Party Trumpet]]
{{Ilink|Bar of Chocolate}} [[Bar of Chocolate]]
{{Ilink|Candy}} 3 [[Candy|Candies]]
{{Ilink|Party Hat}} [[Party Hat]]
{{Ilink|Party Cake}} [[Party Cake]]
{{Ilink|Fireworks Rocket}} [[Fireworks Rocket]]
{{Ilink|Piggy Bank}} [[Piggy Bank]]
From a sample of 447 Surprise Bags there was no contradiction with the assumption that each of the 11 items has a 1/11 chance of being received. {{Seealso|Surprise Bag (Blue)/Statistics|Surprise Bag (Red)}} Can be obtained in the [[Barbarian Arena Quest]] from the [[Greenhorn Arena]] and from [[Surprise Nest]]s.

name: Surprise Bag (Red)
notes:
Red Surprise Bags were added during [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]], when they were rarely dropped by strong [[monsters]]. These bags contain rarer items than [[Surprise Bag (Blue)|Blue Surprise Bags]], but these in their turn contain some unique [[Party Items|festive items]]. The red surprise bag can contain festive items and rarer items. The following items are obtainable by using a bag:
{{Ilink|Fireworks Rocket}} [[Fireworks Rocket]]
{{Ilink|Cream Cake}} [[Cream Cake]]
{{Ilink|Bar of Chocolate}} [[Bar of Chocolate]]
{{Ilink|Party Hat}} [[Party Hat]]
{{Ilink|Piggy Bank}} [[Piggy Bank]] (semi-rare)
{{Ilink|Violet Gem}} [[Violet Gem]] (rare)
{{Ilink|Soul Orb}} [[Soul Orb]] (rare)
{{Ilink|Red Gem}} [[Red Gem]] (very rare)
{{Ilink|Teddy Bear}} [[Teddy Bear]] (very rare)
{{Ilink|Demon Shield}} [[Demon Shield]] (very rare)
{{Ilink|Panda Teddy}} [[Panda Teddy]] (very rare)
{{Ilink|Boots of Haste}} [[Boots of Haste]] (very rare)
{{Ilink|Dragon Scale Mail}} [[Dragon Scale Mail]] (very rare)
{{Ilink|Royal Helmet}} [[Royal Helmet]] (very rare)
{{Ilink|Amulet of Loss}} [[Amulet of Loss]] (very rare)
{{Ilink|Stuffed Dragon}} [[Stuffed Dragon]] (very rare)
During [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]], the following approximate changes were made:
{{Ilink|Cream Cake}} [[Cream Cake]] → {{Ilink|Anniversary Cake}} [[Anniversary Cake]]
{{Ilink|Party Hat}} [[Party Hat]] → {{Ilink|Party Wall Snake}} [[Party Wall Snake]]
{{Ilink|Soul Orb}} [[Soul Orb]] → {{Ilink|Small Diamond}} 5 [[Small Diamond]]s
{{Ilink|Violet Gem}} [[Violet Gem]] → {{Ilink|Platinum Coin}} 15 [[Platinum Coin]]s
{{Ilink|Red Gem}} [[Red Gem]] → {{Ilink|Gold Ingot}} [[Gold Ingot]] Because they bear similarity in probability, they may even share exact loot tables save for those item changes. The obtained items have now been reverted back and [[Violet Gem]]s for example can be obtained from 15th Anniversary Red Surprise Bags again. During [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]], Red Surprise Bags may have also contained [[Red Balloons]]. {{Seealso|Surprise Bag (Red)/Statistics|Surprise Bag (Blue)}} Can be obtained by [[skinning]] the [[Slain Mutated Pumpkin]] inside its reward room and by using [[Surprise Nest]]s. Could also be obtained from [[Anniversary Remains]] during [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]].

name: Sword
droppedby: Animated Rotworm | Brittle Skeleton | Crypt Warrior | Gladiator | Grand Master Oberon | Jailer | Juvenile Cyclops | Lizard Templar | Lumbering Carnivor | Minotaur | Minotaur Bruiser | Mutated Human | Pirate Skeleton | Rottie the Rotworm | Rotworm | Skeleton | Skeleton Elite Warrior | Skeleton Warrior | Smuggler | Teleskor | Undead Mine Worker
