notes: Used in the [[Desert Dungeon Quest]].

name: Sword Hilt
notes: Trade this item for a [[Right Horn]] (part of [[Helmet of the Ancients]]).
flavortext: This was once part of a formidable two handed weapon. It seems to be rotting rapidly.

name: Sword Ring
droppedby: Arachnophobica | Damaged Worker Golem | Madareth | Mooh'Tah Warrior | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Leader | Renegade Orc | Sir Valorcrest | Vulcongra | Werehyaena Shaman
notes: Sword Rings increase the [[Sword Fighting]] skill by four points, for 30 minutes.

name: Talon
droppedby: Angry Demon | Anmothra | Arthom the Hunter | Defiler | Demon | Devourer | Ferumbras | Ghazbaran | Irahsae | Latrivan | Morgaroth | Orshabaal | Priestess | Rage Squid | Renegade Quara Pincher | Spiky Carnivor | Teneshpar | Warlock | Yielothax | Zugurosh
notes: Talons add a nice touch to house decorations, and many "richer" players might be interested in buying some at higher prices.\n\nCan be obtained through [[Paradox Quest]], [[Giant Smithhammer Quest]] and [[Parchment Room Quest]]. One spawns under a heap of corpses in the single [[Giant Spider]] hole in [[Plains of Havoc]]. One also spawns {{Mapper Coords|text=here|127.71|125.137|8|4|1|0.250.25}} in a hole in the [[Jakundaf Desert]].
flavortext: There are many rumours about these magic gems.

name: Tear of Daraman
notes: According to the Djinn histories, [[Daraman]] was a great spiritual leader that visited the island of [[Darama]] and the [[Djinns]]. He experienced such grief at the anger and hatred between the Djinns that he began to weep. His tears were very large and filled with the purity and compassion. It is said that his tears have great magical powers.\nOne of the [[items]] you must retrieve and surrender during the [[Green Djinn Quest]].

name: Teddy Bear
notes:
These were first given out on some of the older [[world]]s as presents by [[Santa Claus]] during Christmas. Teddy Bears were also the prize for the global Teddy Bear Quest, presented by [[Tibianews]] and [http://risingdragons.org/ Rising Dragons]. Nowadays [[Santa Claus]] randomly gives this [[item]] to players. It used to be rare when one was given out per server. Due to the [[Updates/7.9|Christmas Update 2006]] they are given out a lot more and the value has dropped increasingly. During [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]] and [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]] they could be received in [[Surprise Bag (Red)|Red Surprise Bags]].
\nLooks the same as an [[Annihilation Bear]].
\nOne can be seen on the upper floor of The [[Ironhouse]] in [[Venore]].

name: Tempest Rod
droppedby: Adept of the Cult | Blightwalker | Marid | Priestess
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: It was very useful for high leveled [[druid]]s.
history: Tempest Rods replaced {{Ilink|Elven Wand}} [[Elven Wand]]s in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]] and was replaced by [[Hailstorm Rod]] in [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]].
flavortext: It grants you the power of striking your foes with furious thunderstorms.

name: Templar Scytheblade
notes: Shaped as a [[Scythe]] but used as a [[Sword Weapons|sword]]. This blade is created by the [[Lizard]]s of [[Chor]]. The [[Lizard Templar]] wield them.\n\nServes as a decent weapon for levels 8-20, however the [[Spike Sword]] is easier to come by and superior in almost every way. Also, the [[Jagged Sword]] is free and only 2 attack lower.

name: Terra Rod
droppedby: Acolyte of the Cult | Adult Goanna | Blemished Spawn | Bonelord | Cart Packed with Gold | Cobra Vizier | Devourer | Druid's Apparition | Drume | Elder Forest Fury | Enusat the Onyx Wing | Faceless Bane | Flimsy Lost Soul | Fury | Gaffir | Infernal Phantom | Irgix the Flimsy | Lavafungus | Lizard Dragon Priest | Lizard Snakecharmer | Megasylvan Yselda | Menacing Carnivor | Mercurial Menace | Neferi the Spy | Oodok Witchmaster | Poisonous Carnisylvan | Ripper Spectre | Scarlett Etzel | Sun-Marked Goanna | The Evil Eye | Varnished Diremaw | Vibrant Phantom | Wiggler | Young Goanna
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: An upgrade from the [[Necrotic Rod]] and the [[Northwind Rod]], that, however, does not makes them both obsolete, since [[Earth Damage|earth]] is widely considered to be the worst element, as a lot of monsters are immune to it. It is the [[druid]]'s equivalent of the [[sorcerer]]'s [[Wand of Cosmic Energy]]. Terra Rods replaced [[Quagmire Rod]]s in the [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]], which in turn replaced {{Ilink|Wooden Wand}} [[Wooden Wand]]s in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]].\nNeeded for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] (male) and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]] (female).
flavortext: Small stones are flying from its tip.

name: The Avenger
notes: It is one of the strongest sword weapons available in-game, with a very high defense value as a two-handed weapon. Its price varies greatly, but it is pretty cheap to get nowadays.\n\nObtainable through the [[Pits of Inferno Quest]].
flavortext: This holy blade was forged of shattered dreams.

name: The Holy Tible
notes: It looks exactly like the old [[T-Book]].\n[[File:HolyTible.jpg|Chest with the Holy Tible.|thumb|right]]\nObtained in the [[Pits of Inferno Quest]], found in a chest south of the [[Plains of Havoc]] temple. If you need a new one, [[Oldrak]] will reset your Tible quest flag for 1,000 gp allowing you to obtain it again. The book is found near the [[Knightwatch Tower]] ({{Mapper Coords|128.60|126.83|7|text=here}}). Note that you will need either the [[Levitate]] spell or 3 [[Parcel]]s to go up the mountain.

name: The Lethal Lissy's Shirt
notes:
It's not possible to wear it. It is dropped by [[Lethal Lissy]] during a [[Liberty Bay Raids#Pirate Boss Raid on Liberty Bay|raid]] on [[Liberty Bay]].
Looks almost the same as a [[Pirate Shirt]].
This item is needed for an addon of the [[Pirate Outfits Quest]].

name: Throwing Knife
droppedby: Dworc Venomsniper | Memory of a Pirate | Orc Leader | Pirate Buccaneer | Renegade Orc | Stalker
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
sellto: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, H.L., Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
notes:
A good choice for [[paladin]]s that want to use a [[Shields|shield]] and a lightweight throwing weapon. 
Experiments show that, on average, 7 out of a 100 throwing knives will break, thus the breakage is 7% (considerably higher than a [[Small Stone]]).
The range of a throwing knife is 4 squares, the same as [[Throwing Star]]s and small stones.
4 throwing knives can be found in the [[Dark Helmet Quest]].

name: Throwing Star
droppedby: Assassin | Bibby Bloodbath | Crypt Shambler | Demon Skeleton | Energy Elemental | Guard Captain Quaid | Knowledge Elemental | Orc Warlord | Pirate Corsair | Rukor Zad | Troll Legionnaire | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | Warlord Ruzad
buyfrom: Asnarus, Brengus, Cedrik, Dario, Edoch, Eliyas, Habdel, Maun, Memech, Mugruu, Perod, Pompan;tomes-1, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Silas, Taegen, Vincent, Willard
notes: 10 throwing stars can be found in the [[Throwing Star Quest]]. Experiments show that they have a 10% break chance. It looks the same as a [[Spare Part]].

name: Thunder Hammer
history:
* It was for a long time one of the best one-handed [[Club Weapons|Club Weapon]] available. * The first person in Tibia who looted it was {{Character|Elahrion Avessar}} ([[Elysia]]). * In the past, only three such hammers existed. ** One was rewarded on [[Eternia]] together with a [[Golden Helmet]] for reporting a security bug ** One was a gift from the gods to the person responsible for the 2002 real life convention. That hammer was later given to Pytru as a Christmas gift in 2002. ** One was illegally gained by Warrax from the one shot [[Behemoth Quest]], using his bought [[GM]], Ender Speaker of the Dead. After Warrax's deletion, the hammer was sold. The buyer lost more then the hammer when he failed to heed the words from GM Flattery, losing his depot along with the hammer when CIP found him. * A Thunder Hammer existed on [[Premia]], entering through the Demon Quest that was located in today's [[Vampire Shield Quest]] that CipSoft created to get more people interested in Premia. The hammer was gained and sold by a Premian char named Morak. === World of Tibia Forum ==== The history of this hammer was best summed up by [[World of Tibia|WoT]]: Khundahamar, The Thunder Hammer
"In the times of dread some of the best dwarven smiths were hold captive by the forces of Blog. They were forced to teach the secrets of smithing to Blogs children, the cyclopses. Kazrad Rockfist, a dwarven hero, braved many dangers to find the hidden underground forges. He sneaked in and managed to free the captives, but as they made a run to the exit, they found the steel doors sealed shut. With the rampaging cyclopses of Blog in their back the dwarf begun to pray to their gods and in the last minute they got an answer from the heavens. Kazrads hammer became blessed, and with a single mighty hit the hero shattered the doors, allowing all captives to escape. Wielded in many battles as a symbol of the fight against the cyclopses, the hammer was lost. The dwarves call this artefact Khundahamar, which means ''liberator'' but its only known as the ''Thunderhammer'' by the humans."
==== Gallery ==== Thsolera.JPG | 1 = The TH of Solera
flavortext: It is blessed by the gods of Tibia.

name: Tic-Tac-Toe Token (O)
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].\n\nA set can be found in [[Kazordoon]]'s Gamehall.

name: Tic-Tac-Toe Token (X)
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].\n\nA set can be found in [[Kazordoon]]'s Gamehall.

name: Time Ring
droppedby: Adept of the Cult | Armadile | Chizzoron the Distorter | Crystal Spider | Darkfang | Giant Spider | Gorger Inferniarch | Hemming | Hide | Lucifuga Aranea | Madareth | Mamma Longlegs | Renegade Quara Pincher | Rhindeer | Rotspit | Spitter | Tarantula | Thalas | The Bloodweb | The Hungerer | The Old Widow | Tremor Worm | Werebear | Werewolf | Zamulosh
notes:
In the old days before rings had any use Time Rings had the name Speed Ring and were dropped by Giant Spiders.
Nowadays it increases your [[speed]] by 30 for 10 minutes. Check [[Speed Breakpoints]] to see when is worth to equip and use this ring.
Obtained from [[Time Ring Quest]], [[Ornamented Shield Quest]], [[Ring Quest]], by doing a task for the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]] and every year through [[Lightbearer]] event.

name: Tomato
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
buyfrom: Alissa: 4, Armenius, Christine: 5, Clyde, Jezzara:10, Maria: 5, Omur: 5
notes: None.\n4 of these are required for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Torch
droppedby: Amazon | Apprentice Sheng | Assassin | Barbaria | Barbarian Headsplitter | Barbarian Skullhunter | Brittle Skeleton | Demon Skeleton | Dworc Fleshhunter | Dworc Venomsniper | Dworc Voodoomaster | Fire Devil | Ghoul | Grand Master Oberon | Hunter | Lesser Fire Devil | Lost Gnome | Memory of a Pirate | Minotaur Mage | Minotaur Occultist | Orc Rider | Pirate Buccaneer | Pirate Marauder | Poacher | Skeleton | Smuggler | Swamp Troll | Teleskor | Undead Prospector | Worm Priestess | Memory of an Amazon
buyfrom: Ahmet, Al Dee: 2, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, John: 5, Lee'Delle: 2, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Raffael: 2, Richard: 2, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Rafzan, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zethra, Zora
notes:
This torch can be [[Lit Torch|Lit]] in order to provide light for up to 20 minutes. As the torch is used, the light gets weaker and the torch shorter. This first stage of the torch lasts for 10 minutes while lit, when it becomes a [[Torch (Medium)]].

It was once a very useful [[item]] before the client had the option to set the ambient light off. People always carried one of these in their belt to save [[mana]] in hunts from casting light [[Instant Spells|spells]]. Since the ambient light feature was implemented, torches were left behind, and nowadays they are almost completely useless. 

Obtainable in [[The Beginning Quest]].
history: With the [[Updates/9.5|spring patch 2012]] the sprite of Torch changed from [[File:Torch (Old).gif]] to [[File:Torch.gif]].

name: Torn Book
notes:
It has no practical use.
It looks the same as a [[Damaged Logbook]], a [[Torn Book (Diary)]], [[Torn Book (Readable)]] and a [[Torn Log Book]].

name: Tortoise Egg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Never eat the tortoise egg that can be found in a small room at [[Nargor]], see spoilers to know why.
Looks the same as a [[Tortoise Egg from Nargor|tortoise egg from Nargor]].
The tortoise egg found in Nargor is used in [[Meriana Quest]]. If you eat it by mistake you can get the tortoise egg the same way again after 24 hours, '''if you're on that mission'''.

name: Tortoise Shield
notes: Quite common as a lot of knights have [[backpack]]s of them from hunting [[Tortoise]]s. It can be sold to low level players because it has the same defense as a [[Dwarven Shield]], but is 3 oz. lighter.

name: Tower Shield
droppedby: Annihilon | Armadile | Boar Man | Dragon Lord | Draken Warmaster | Enslaved Dwarf | Esmeralda | Eternal Guardian | Frost Dragon | Lizard Chosen | Lizard High Guard | Lizard Zaogun | Lost Berserker | Lost Exile | Lost Husher | Lost Soul | Memory of a Lizard | Mutated Rat | Retching Horror | Serpent Spawn | Sight of Surrender | Soul-Broken Harbinger | The Noxious Spawn | Zulazza the Corruptor
notes: A good [[Shields|shield]] for low/mid levels, though its high weight compared to defense value lowers its value somewhat. The next step up would be a [[Crown Shield]] or a [[Medusa Shield]].\nObtainable through the [[Deeper Fibula Quest]] and [[The Queen of the Banshees Quest]].

name: Trap
notes: Traps can be set to deal [[creatures]] exactly 30 physical damage, but they do not stop the creatures from moving. \nThe damage works similarly to a [[Distance Fighting|distance attack]]: it is reduced by armor, but not by shielding. \nYou can find this item around dwarven camp in [[Tiquanda]]. Put it on the ground and use it to open a [[Closed Trap]]. If you move an open trap it will close again. Note that usage of a trap to damage a creature will yield less [[experience]], and completely killing a creature using traps will not yield experience, [[Dust]], [[Weapon Proficiency]] and bestiary or bosstiary progress. If you want to sell or buy a Trap from NPCs, it has to be as a [[Closed Trap]].
history: Before the [[skull system]] was implemented this was used to [[Player Killing|kill players]] in an anonymous way. TheÂ character page would only state: "Killed at level XX by a hit."\n\nBefore the introduction of [[Bestiary]], this item was used to estimate creature's armor value, since it deals a consistent amount of shield-irreducible damage.

name: Treasure Map
notes:
Not a real map.
It gives random coordinates such as:
6 steps north and 9 steps east
Try digging here!
2 steps north 1 step west
1 step south 9 steps east
Try digging here!
This happens in any place you ''use it''.
It looks the same as the [[Treasure Map (Pirate)]], a [[Pirate Treasure Map]], and a [[Plan]]. Use it 100 times to get the achievement [[Slim Chance]].
flavortext: It obviously shows Treasure Island including a big, red cross and detailed instructions.

name: Treasure Map (Pirate)
droppedby: Pirate Buccaneer | Pirate Cutthroat | Pirate Marauder
notes:
This map is not the same as the one that you can buy from [[John]] on [[Treasure Island]]. To use the map, simply walk around and dig in the sand until uncover a [[Hole]]. When you open the [[Hole]] the Treasure Map (Pirate) will be used. After 20 seconds the [[Hole]] will return to hide, and you can use the map again.
\nIt looks the same as the [[Treasure Map]], a [[Pirate Treasure Map]], and a [[Plan]].
flavortext: It obviously shows Treasure Island including a big, red cross.

name: Tribal Mask
droppedby: Dworc Fleshhunter | Dworc Venomsniper | Dworc Voodoomaster | Frost Flower Asura | Midnight Asura | Oodok Witchmaster | The Moonlight Aster | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura
notes:
Found in southern [[Tiquanda]]/[[Trapwood]] (semi-rare). It has the exact same gp-to-weight ratio as pure [[gold coin]]s.5 are needed for an addon of the [[Shaman Outfits]].
Can be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.

name: Troll Green
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Black Vixen | Darkfang | Hemming | Sharpclaw | Swamp Troll | Werebadger | Werefox | Werewolf
notes:
[[Troll]] Greens are a rare class of herbs, which tastes similar to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basil basil]. They can be found in a [[Dusalk's Troll Clan Cave]] located in the [[Green Claw Swamp]] and in the northeastern part of the main [[Necromancer]] cave in [[Drefia]]. It is located near the [[Black Sheep]]. You can see one in [[Meriana]] in [[Chondur]]'s house. They can also be seen in quite a large quantity around the [[Paradox Tower]].\n

2 of them are needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]]

name: Tulip
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It can also be found in [[Fibula Dungeon]] and in some secret spots in [[Ab'Dendriel]], see also other [[Daily Respawns]]. It's a cheap but nice decoration.

name: Turtle Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Players looking for addons might pay high prices for these shells. It can also be obtained from [[Belongings of a Deceased]].\n\n100 are needed for Shoulder Spike addon of [[Warrior Outfits]].

name: Tusk
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Rare loot from [[Elephant]]s. Used mainly as house decoration.
Looks the same as an [[Orc Tusk]]. * 10 of these are needed for [[The Thieves Guild Quest]]. * 2 can be obtained through [[Elephant Tusk Quest]]. * 1 of these is needed in the ''Searoutes around Yalahar'' mission of [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].
history: The tusk was the first [[Creature Products|Creature Product]] in game, preceding the [[Hydra Egg]] by a couple of months and [[Updates/7.8|the first larger batch of products]] by about a year. This unique origin presumably contributes to it being one of very few stackable creature products with a visible growing stack. Before the [[Creature Products]] category was added to the wiki, it was sorted in the [[Decorations]] section. It was originally called ''Elephant Tusk''.

name: Tusk Shield
droppedby: Clomp | Elephant | Mammoth | Memory of a Mammoth | Stone Rhino | Terrified Elephant | The Bloodtusk | Venerable Foam Stalker
notes: A rare shield from [[Elephant]]s and [[Mammoth]]s.\nCan be obtained from [[Shaggy Ogre Bag]]s.

name: Twigs
droppedby: Ancient Lion Knight | Foam Stalker | Frost Troll | Jagged Earth Elemental | Memory of a Book | Venerable Foam Stalker
notes: It has no practical use. It can be found on the ground in many caves and trash piles.

name: Twin Axe
notes: Was first seen on [[Trimera]] and first to be dropped by [[Ghazbaran]] in [[Malvera]]. One of the [[Pharaoh Rares]].

droppedby: Behemoth | Bibby Bloodbath | Black Knight | Bonelord | Crazed Summer Vanguard | Crypt Shambler | Elder Bonelord | Ferumbras | Filth Toad | Frazzlemaw | Giant Spider | Guzzlemaw | Hero | Lumbering Carnivor | Madareth | Memory of a Hero | Morgaroth | Orc Warlord | Orshabaal | Plaguesmith | Quara Mantassin | Quara Mantassin Scout | Quara Predator Scout | Renegade Knight | Renegade Quara Mantassin | Ripper Spectre | Stonecracker | The Evil Eye | Undead Elite Gladiator | Undead Gladiator | War Golem | Warlord Ruzad

name: Summer Dress
history: This was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], [[Death Damage|Death]] protection was added.

name: Suspicious Signet Ring
notes:
Can be worn as a normal ring.
\n\nTemporarily obtained in the [[Secret Service Quest]]: TBI branch. For the AVIN equivalent, see [[Family Signet Ring]].

name: Suspicious Surprise Bag
notes:
Added as loot to [[Undead Jester]] in the [[Winter Update 2008]]. It looks the same as a [[Bag of Smuggled Goods]], a [[Bag (Ahmet)]], and a [[Pirate Bag]]. Around '''1/3''' of the time you will only receive a [[Cream Cake Effect|pie in the face]]. [[File:Cream Cake Effect.gif]] However if there is something inside the [[Confetti Effect]] [[File:Confetti Effect.gif]] will be shown and you will receive one of the following items: {{Ilink|Spellwand}} [[Spellwand]]
{{Ilink|Yellow Pillow (Supersoft)}} [[Yellow Pillow (Supersoft)]]
{{Ilink|Bar of Chocolate}} [[Bar of Chocolate]]
{{Ilink|Cream Cake}} [[Cream Cake]]
{{Ilink|Ice Cream Cone (Blue-Barian)}} [[Ice Cream Cone (Blue-Barian)]]
{{Ilink|Piggy Bank}} [[Piggy Bank]]
{{Ilink|Present (Explosive)}} [[Present (Explosive)]]
{{Ilink|Toy Mouse}} [[Toy Mouse]]
{{Ilink|Jester Doll}} [[Jester Doll]]
{{Seealso|Suspicious Surprise Bag/Statistics}}
flavortext: It's from an undead jester, so open at own risk.

name: Swamplair Armor
droppedby: Chizzoron the Distorter | Cursed Book | Earth Overlord | Ink Blob | Kusuma | Paiz the Pauperizer | Serpent Spawn | The Enraged Thorn Knight | The Noxious Spawn
notes: It gives 3% earth protection, but increases damage taken from fire by 3%.

name: Taurus Mace
droppedby: Minotaur Cult Zealot | Minotaur Mage | Worm Priestess
history: After the [[Updates/8.1|8.1 winter update]] it was possible to sell these for 5k to [[Rashid]], instead of the 500 normally. This way it was possible to gain extra money selling these.

name: Tea
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It is a very nice drink for cold climates.
Looks the same as a [[Flask with Magical Oil]], a [[Flask with Oil and Blood]], and vials of [[Mead]], [[Mud]], [[Oil]], [[Rum]] and [[Beer]].

name: Technomancer Beard
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Required in the [[Secret Service Quest]].

name: Tempest Shield
notes:
One can be seen at [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis Treasure Room]]. It is now very expensive and rare due to the fact that the [[raid]]s in which it was dropped have ended and it is now only dropped by some bosses.
<gallery hideaddbutton="true" position="center" style="text-align:center" captionalign="center" mode="nolines">
KD_Secura_rare_item_07.jpg|Tempest Shield on [[Secura]] in 2007
</gallery>
history:
Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]], it became obtainable with the [[Darashia Raids#Demonic Creatures on Darashia (Deprecated)|Demonic Raids in Darashia]] during [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]] in January 2007.
\nIt was first looted from [[Ferumbras]] on May 1, 2009, by a team on [[Eternia]].

name: Terran Rainbow Shield
notes: To get this shield you need to use a [[Small Enchanted Emerald]] on a [[Rainbow Shield]], enchanting it with '''earth'''. It speeds up your regeneration for 15 minutes (8 manapoints and 2 hitpoints every 6 seconds; 300 HP and 1200 MP in total).\n}}\n<noinclude>[[Category:Regenerative Items]]</noinclu
flavortext: It has been temporarily imbued with earth magic and boosts your regeneration.

name: Thaian Sword
notes: It may be considered somewhat expensive and rare on some worlds due to being dropped by only a single, infrequently hunted [[boss]].

name: The Alchemists' Formulas
notes: It looks the same as a [[Note from the Thieves Guild]], an [[Old Encrypted Text]], an [[Old Piece of Paper]], an [[Old Pirate Poem]], a [[Parchment of Interest]], a [[Piece of Paper]], a [[Piece of Paper (Object)]], [[Suspicious Documents]] and a [[Translation Scroll]].\nItem obtained temporarily in the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

name: The Calamity
notes:
It's a rare item because it is only dropped by a boss monster.

name: The Carrot of Doom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
They can be seen under the [[Serpentine Tower]]. It may be related to [[Hugo (Demonbunny)|Hugo the Demonbunny]]. This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Carrot]] and a [[Pointed Rabbitslayer]].
flavortext: You can sense the evil power of the carrot.

name: The Devileye
notes: The first Devileye was looted on [[Valoria]], on March 08, 2009. An article from [[Tibianews]], published on October 21, 2007, suggested that The Devileye has similar attack and hit ratio to those of [[Assassin Star]]s (this was incorrect). However, [https://web.archive.org/web/20211005114426/http://www.tibia-stats.com/index.php?akcja=6003&research=distance research] conducted by [[Tibia-Stats]] suggests that an Assassin Star has a 96% hit rate compared to the 71% hit rate of The Devileye (according to its Distance calculator). The Devileye used with [[Infernal Bolt]]s will have 92 attack points which is 28 more than assassin stars, and will have 2 squares of range more. Having said all of that, a [[Royal Crossbow]] will still do '''more overall damage''' than The Devileye.

name: The Dust of Arthei
notes:
It can be obtained by using a [[Blessed Wooden Stake]] on the remains of [[Arthei]]. It looks like [[Vampire Dust]] with sparkles.
\nIt looks the same as [[Cleansed Sanity]], [[The Dust of Boreth]], [[The Dust of Lersatio]], and [[The Dust of Marziel]].\nIt is needed temporarily in the [[Blood Brothers Quest]].
flavortext: Julius might be interested in the ashes of this vampire lord.

name: The Dust of Boreth
notes:
It can be obtained by using a [[Blessed Wooden Stake]] on the remains of [[Boreth]]. It looks like [[Vampire Dust]] with sparkles.
\nIt looks the same as [[Cleansed Sanity]],[[The Dust of Arthei]], [[The Dust of Lersatio]], and [[The Dust of Marziel]].\nIt is needed in the [[Blood Brothers Quest]].

notes:
Looks the same as a [[Fake Dwarven Beard]] and [[Dwarven Beard]].
Item temporarily obtained in [[What a foolish Quest]].

name: The Famous Mina Losa Painting
notes:
Looks the same as a [[Picture (Portrait)]]. The name ''Mina Losa'' is an obvious [[Allusions|allusion]] to [[Wikipedia:Mona Lisa|Mona Lisa]].
Temporarily obtained in [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].

name: The Handmaiden's Protector
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: The Head of a Jester Doll
actualname: the head of a jester doll
notes: This is part of the [[Jester Doll]]. It was added after the [[Updates/8.4|Winter Update 2008]].

name: The Horn of Sundering
notes:
This item can be seen under the [[Serpentine Tower]] and inside [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis' Treasure Room]].
\nIt looks the same as [[Waldo's Post Horn]] and a [[Post Horn]].
flavortext: (This item has 2 charges left).

name: The Imperor's Trident
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: The Ironworker
notes: Obtainable in [[The Elemental Spheres Quest]].

name: The Justice Seeker
notes:
This great sword devalued the popular [[Magic Sword]], with almost similar stats, and much easier to obtain. It is a great sword from [[Level]] 75-100.
\nReward from the [[Barbarian Arena Quest|Arena]], Warlord level.
flavortext: This sword is only granted to a warlord of the Svargrond arena.

name: The Mexcalibur
notes:
This item can no longer be obtained due to the removal of [[TibiaMx]] from the fansite programme on {{OfficialNewsArchive|1838|September 26, 2011}}.
You can only read the text if you stand 2 SQMs from it or closer. Its replica is the [[The Mexcalibur (Replica)]].
flavortext: Your name is carved on this mighty sword.

name: The Plasmother's Remains
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

notes:

name: The Stomper
notes: Can be seen behind [[Harog]] in [[Beregar]].

name: Tibiacity Encyclopedia
notes:
It could only be gotten by winning a contest held by [[TibiaCity]]. It was created by {{character|Mage of the Fall}} from Astera. It weighs 13.37 (1337), which means '''Elite''' in [[Wikipedia:Leet|Leet]].

Its replica is the [[Encyclopedia (Replica)]].

Owners of this item:
* {{character|Sahsy}} from [[Libera]] for [[Tibia ML]]'s "Share it!" contest.
* {{character|Squall Arcalarya}} from [[Julera]] for the "Screenshot Competition" of TibiaCity.
* {{character|Teean}} from [[Hiberna]] for "Tibiacity logo contest".
* {{character|Sir Brancaleone}} from [[Arcania]].
* {{character|Nini}} from [[Olympa]].
* {{character|Olite Shalon}} from [[Celesta]].
* {{character|Ardilla Selassie}} from [[Libera]].
* {{character|Darkz Furion}} from [[Magera]] for "Comic Competition 2012" of TibiaML.
* {{character|Busa}} from [[Secura]].

name: Tortoise Egg from Nargor
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It's an important tortoise egg, don't eat it.
It looks the same as a [[Tortoise Egg]]. This tortoise egg is temporarily obtained during {{Spoiler Section|Meriana Quest|Tortoise Egg from Nargor Mission}}.
If you eat it by mistake you can get the tortoise egg the same way again after 24 hours, '''if you're on that mission'''.
flavortext: Handle with care and don't try to eat it.

name: Toy Mouse
notes: This toy looks just like a rat, and can scare some people.\nThis item is temporarily obtained on the [[What a Foolish Quest]].

name: Toy Spider
notes:
Can be obtained as loot from [[The Mutated Pumpkin]] during [[Halloween]] (October 31st to November 3rd), or by [[Skinning]] its corpse. To [[Skinning|skin]] [[The Mutated Pumpkin]], you must have participated in the battle. The corpse is located in a special room accessible through a teleport that appears for 30 minutes after the Pumpkin is slain, found ({{Mapper Coords|130.37|126.159|7|8|text=here}}).\n\nIt appears to become ''alive'' when used which appears as this:
[[File:Toy Spider (Animated).gif|link=Spider]]

This is an extremely rare drop from witches. It is hard to obtain as there are only few places you can hunt Witches.
This item is also obtainable by being a winner at a fansite contest.
'''Fansite contest winners who won this item :''' * {{character|Mage Mago Mal}} for winning a [[TibiaSpace]] contest. * {{character|Epicnez}} for winning a [[TibiaFans.se]] contest. * {{character|Kariel Win}} for winning the 2nd place in [[FunTibia]] contest.

name: Sulphurous Stone
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Brimstone Bug | Grorlam | Orewalker | Stone Golem | Sulphur Scuttler
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs but it is not recommended because it has a use during June. As other creature products, has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\nUsed in the [[Witches' Cauldron Quest]].

name: Suspicious Documents
notes:
Be careful not to lose them, since they cannot be bought from [[Black Bert]].
It looks the same as a [[Note from the Thieves Guild]], an [[Old Encrypted Text]], an [[Old Piece of Paper]], an [[Old Pirate Poem]], a [[Parchment of Interest]], a [[Piece of Paper]], a [[Piece of Paper (Object)]], [[The Alchemists' Formulas]] and a [[Translation Scroll]].\nItem temporarily obtained in the [[Secret Service Quest]] (CGB).

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Sweet and Sugary Substance
notes:
It should be given to one of the bakers at the cake extractor machines.
Used in the world quest [[A Piece of Cake]].
flavortext: It is incredibly sticky and too sweet to eat it.

name: Sweet Mangonaise Elixir
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
history: The elixir is one of the four winning recipes of the {{OfficialNewsArchive|1335|Gourmet Competition}} held by [[CipSoft]] in May 2010. The creator of this recipe is {{character|Exaga}}.
flavortext: It's said to have incredible effects if you drink it while wearing certain magical rings. So it will not work on every kind of them.

name: Sweet Smelling Bait
notes:
This item is used to tame a {{Ilink|Widow Queen}} [[Wailing Widow]]. It has a chance to be eaten. '''Failed''':
{{Sound|The wailing widow ran away.}}
'''Failed''':
{{Sound|The wailing widow is hissing at you.}}
'''Break''':
{{Sound|Oh no! The wailing widow ate the bait.}}
'''Succeeded''':
{{Sound|You tamed the wailing widow.}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.

name: Tactical Map
notes:
It is readable, but is blank when read.
Looks the same as a [[Document (Certificate)]], a [[Contract]], a [[Signed Contract]], and a [[Faded Last Will]].\nPart of the [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: A map showing recent troop movements and tactical instructions of parts of the Emperor's army.

name: The Famous Golden Bug
flavortext: It's given to skilled discoverers of extra nasty bugs and to great scholars writing useful reports.

name: The Rain Coat
notes:
Use the dead body of [[Mephiles]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. It can be used every 5 minutes if you're wearing it.
It looks the same as a [[Cape]].
When you use it, the [[Thunderstorm Single Field Effect]] appears on you. {{Ilink|Thunderstorm Single Field Effect}}\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: The wearer of this cape commands the forces of heaven.

name: The Shield Nevermourn
notes: Use the dead body of [[Dirtbeard]] to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. It makes a sound when used, but it can only be used every 5 minutes. The orange text can only be seen by the player using the shield. The customer and bank teller joke is rarer than the others, it has the chance of around 1% of appearing. It looks the same as a [[Dark Shield]].\nThere is a chance of obtaining it in the [[Isle of Evil Quest]].
sounds: {{Sound List|Servant! Please call me a coach. - Yes, sir. You are a coach!|Did your father help you do your homework? No, he did it all by himself.|If big elephants have big trunks, do small elephants have suitcases?|Do you want to hear a dirty joke ? A white horse fell in the mud.|What do you call a deer with no eyes ? - I have no I-Deer!|My friend said he knew a man with a wooden leg called Sam. So I asked him 'What was the name of his other leg?'|Did you hear about the Lich who walked into frodo's bar? He ordered a cup of beer and a mop.|If tin whistles are made of tin, what are fog horns made of?|Bank Teller: How do you like the money? Customer: I like it very much.}}
flavortext: It is said that the wearer of Nevermourn will never mourn. What a powerful shield.

name: The Tail of the Keeper
notes: Temporarily obtained in [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].

name: The Torso of a Jester Doll
actualname: the torso of a jester doll
notes: This is part of the [[Jester Doll]]. It was added after the [[Updates/8.4|Winter Update 2008]].

name: Thorn
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Thunderstorm Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
[[File:Electrified Icon.gif]] Shoots an [[Energy Damage]] attack that covers a large area around the target, this is the Sorcerers' equivalent of the [[Stone Shower]].
New spell in the [[Winter Update 2007]]. The player using the Thunderstorm rune is never affected by it.
\nFor the spell, see [[Thunderstorm]].
history: The price was changed from 47 to 52 since [[Summer Update 2024]].

name: Tibiora's Box
notes:
It can only be obtained by winning a contest held by [[Tibia-Stats]]. It was created by {{character|Mondlanze}} from Lunara. As far as is known, there are 6 Tibiora's Box in Tibia.
Current owners of this item: * {{character|Mondlanze}} * {{character|Beartin}} was awarded with this box for winning 1st place in the Riddle contest, although the current owner is: * {{character|Andarist}} and it can be seen in [[Market Street 1]] on [[Furora]]. * {{character|Princess Oriana}} was awarded with this box for winning 1st place in the Lottery of the Riddle contest. * {{character|Todraphic}} won a Tibiora's Box from [[Tibia-Stats]] latest contest and sold it to {{character|Tala The Homeless}}, who in turn sold it to {{character|Olite Shalon}}. * {{character|Gorak}} * {{character|Dans cruf}} This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were: * {{Character|Ironman Shoob}} ([[Gladera]]) * {{Character|Meaty Mcmeatshield}} ([[Calmera]]) * {{Character|Hunter of Dragoes}} ([[Pacera]])
sounds: {{Sound List|Click! You don't seem experienced enough to open this properly.|Click! The box won't open for you.|Click! This item is too precious for a newbie. You are unable to open it.}}
flavortext: It contains all the knowledge of the Tibian lands gathered arduously by Tibia-Stats.com.

name: Tin Key
notes:
This is the item needed to tame a [[Tin Lizzard]] [[File:Tin Lizzard.gif]]. It has a small chance of breaking when used. It has a very rare chance that the key does not break but the lizzard does. Since the item is very hard to loot and thus considered very rare, it is priced high.

Succeeded: '''Krkrkrkrk'''<br/ >
'''You wind up the tin lizzard.'''

Tin lizzard broken: '''Krr... kch.'''<br/ >
'''The tin lizzard broke apart.'''
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Tome of Knowledge
notes:
These books are valuable and sought after by certain players. A few of them are extremely hard to get hold of.
Obtainable in the [[Tomes of Knowledge Quest]]. You need to hand these books in to NPC [[Cael]] by saying "{{KW|Tome of Knowledge}}" to unlock trading abilities with [[Farmine]] NPC's and earn other rewards. You can only give one Tome of Knowledge to him every 20 hours in real time.
Rewards for handing the tomes into NPC [[Cael]]: *'''1st Tome''': [[Dragon Tapestry]]
Allows you to buy [[Dragon Tapestry|Dragon Tapestries]] from NPC [[Pompan]] for 80 [[gp]] each. *'''2nd Tome''': [[Minotaur Backpack]]
Allows you to buy [[Minotaur Backpack]]s from NPC [[Pompan]] for 200 [[gp]] each and sell him lizard flags. *'''3rd Tome''': [[Lizard Weapon Rack]]
Allows you to buy [[Lizard Weapon Rack]] from NPC [[Esrik]] for 500 [[gp]] each. *'''4th Tome''': [[Rice Ball]]s
Allows you to trade a [[Bunch of Ripe Rice]] for 10 [[Rice Ball]]s with NPC [[Swolt]]. This can be repeated as often as you like, as long as you have a [[Bunch of Ripe Rice]] to give to [[Swolt]]. *'''5th Tome''': [[Dragon Backpack]]
Allows you to buy [[Dragon Backpack]]s from NPC [[Pompan]] for 200 [[gp]] each. *'''6th Tome''': [[War Drum]] & [[Didgeridoo]]
Allows you to buy [[War Drum]]s (for 1000 [[gp]] each) and [[Didgeridoo]] (for 5000 [[gp]] each) from NPC [[Cael]]. '''You need to have finished [[The New Frontier Quest]] in order to hand in the rest of the tomes''' *'''7th Tome''': Snake Head Teleport
Handing in 7 Tomes you will allow you to use the snake teleport at the peak of the mountain, inside of which [[Farmine]] is located. It takes you to the [[teleport]]er in northern [[Zao]], south of the [[Dragonblaze Peaks]] which is the [[teleport]]er to [[Muggy Plains]]. The snake head teleport is a one-way teleport '''only'''! *'''8th Tome''': [[Corruption Hole]]
Allows you to enter a hole in the north-eastern end of [[Zao]], where you can find many [[Lizard Chosen]] as well as 4 [[Ghastly Dragon]]. *'''9th Tome''': Lizard Weapons
Allows you to sell [[Zaoan Helmet]], [[Zaoan Armor]], [[Zaoan Legs]], [[Zaoan Shoes]], [[Drakinata]], [[Traditional Sai]]s, [[Zaoan Sword]], [[Drachaku]], [[Twin Hooks]], [[Zaoan Halberd]] and [[Wailing Widow's Necklace]] to NPC [[Esrik]]. *'''10th Tome''': [[Zao Palace]]
Allows you to enter the [[Zao Palace]]. It is situated deep underground, below the mountain base of the Lizards. You will find [[Ghastly Dragon]]s there, but before you get to them you will have to fight your way through hordes of [[Draken Warmaster]]s and [[Draken Spellweaver|Spellweaver]]s. *'''11th Tome''': [[Dragon Statue (Item)|Dragon Statue]]
Allows you to buy a [[Dragon Statue (Item)|Dragon Statue]] from NPC [[Cael]] after you bring him a [[Red Lantern]]. *'''12th Tome''': [[Dragon Throne]]
NPC [[Cael]] will now make a [[Dragon Throne]] for you after you bring him a [[Red Piece of Cloth]]. There is a time limit on the [[Dragon Throne]] and [[Cael]] will only make them once every 5 weeks (35 days) for you. *'''More than 12 Tomes''': If, by any chance, you are able to get more than 12 Tomes, you can still hand them in to NPC [[Cael]]. He will reward you with 5000 [[experience]] points for each extra tome you give to him, but still only one is allowed every 20 hours in real time.
history: Before [[Updates/9.83|Update 9.83]], Tomes of Knowledge could only be turned in every 24 hours instead of 20.
flavortext: Bring this encrypted book to a sage in Farmine to gain wisdom or unlock more of Zao's culture.

name: Tonguefruit
notes: Item temporarily obtained in the [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: This fruit was gathered from a Wraithtongue.

name: Toxic Tulip Seed
notes: Item temporarily obtained in the [[Children of the Revolution Quest]].
flavortext: This seed was gathered from a Toxic Tulip.

name: Traditional Sai
droppedby: Black Vixen | Choking Fear | Darkfang | Ethershreck | Frazzlemaw | Guzzlemaw | Hemming | Paiz the Pauperizer | Plagirath | The Bloodweb | Weakened Frazzlemaw
notes: Obtainable since the [[Updates/9.2|Autumn Patch 2011]].
history: * With update [[Updates/10.34|10.34]] '''sais''' was renamed to '''sai'''. The word ''sai'' comes directly from Japanese and Japanese does not form plurals of nouns.\n* It was renamed from '''Sai''' to '''Traditional Sai''' with the [[Monk Vocation Update]] that introduced a new [[Fist Fighting]] weapon called [[Sai]], and also changed its vocation from Knights to Monks.\n* On [[Updates/15.12.c7d92c|October 21, 2025]] the attack value was reduced from 28 to 27.

name: Trashed Draken Boots
notes: Due to {{OfficialNewsArchive|1390|a bug}}, older [[Draken Boots]] were turned into trashed draken boots. The following NPCs used to buy these boots for 40,000 gold: [[Cornelia]], [[Esrik]], [[Sam]], [[Shanar]], [[Willard]] and [[Yanni]]. Esrik is the only one who kept buying them. These boots decayed into nothing on July 15, 2015.
flavortext: They will expire within a short time, sell them back to Esrik before they do.

name: Treasure Chest (Ornamented)
buyfrom: Allen, Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Can be seen in [[Liberty Bay]] [[Bank]], [[Explorer Society]] Outpost in [[Liberty Bay]] and the [[Heart of Destruction Quest]] reward room, along with other valuable and rare items, on display, in areas which are unreachable.
history: Due to a {{OfficialNewsArchive|2454|bug}} in the [[Updates/10.1|10.1 update]], this chest was part of the [[Small Sapphire Quest]] and could be taken by players. This was fixed with the server save of July 18, 2013 when it was replaced by a regular chest. This chest then became available at [[Furniture Shopkeeper NPCs|furniture shops]] for 1,000 [[gp]].

name: Tribal Crest
notes: Given to you by [[Lazaran]] when completing the [[Unnatural Selection Quest]], and used in the [[Warmaster Outfits Quest]].

name: Sugar Oat
notes:
Used to tame a [[Wild Horse]]. Can be obtained by combining [[Bunch of Sugar Cane|sugar cane]] and [[Bunch of Wheat|wheat]]. Failed: '''The wild horse happily munches the sugar oat and runs on.'''
Failed: '''Weeeheeeehee.'''
Failed: '''With its last strength the horse the horse runs to safety.'''
Succeeded: '''The horse eats the sugar oat and accepts you as its new master.'''
'''How to make Sugar Oat''' To make Sugar Oat, you will need a [[Sickle]], a [[Scythe]], a [[Bunch of Sugar Cane]], [[Wheat]] and a [[Fire Bug]]. 1. Travel to [[Liberty bay]] and buy [[Fire Bug]]s from Evan {{Mapper Coords|126.3|128.113|7|3|text=here}}.
2. Go to the [[Sugar Cane]]s {{Mapper Coords|125.227|128.29|7|2|text=here}} and use the [[Fire Bug]]s to burn the [[Sugar Cane]]s down.
3. Pick up the Bunch of Sugar Canes using [[Sickle]] and travel to [[Thais]] wheat field {{Mapper Coords|126.181|125.246|7|4|text=here}}.
4. Cut down the wheat with the [[Scythe]].
5. Use the [[Bunch of Wheat]] on the [[Bunch of Sugar Cane]]. Note: You can use the Sugar Oats on [[Wild Horse]] to get the [[War Horse]] mount.{{Ilink|War_Horse}}
flavortext: A hermit near Carlin might be able to tell you more about it.

name: Sun Mirror
notes: Can be equipped in the belt slot as a light source.

name: Tapestry of Honour
notes:
The leaders of [[guild]]s older than 5 years received 15 of these for [[Tibia's 15th Anniversary]], 20 for the [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary|20th Anniversary]], and 25 for the [[Tibia's 25th Anniversary|25th Anniversary]]. The Roman numeral on each tapestry varies according to how long exactly the guild had been in existence on January 7, 2012, 2017 and 2022. No guilds received the X, XV and XX Roman numeral tapestries of honour in 2012, 2017 and 2022, respectively, because the guild system itself wasn't 10, 15 and 20 years old on Tibia's anniversary in 2012, 2017 and 2022. You can only read the text if you stand 2 fields from it or closer. name: Twin Sun Charm
notes:
This item can be used to provide the user the [[blessing]] [[Fire of the Suns]]. It only works once, then it disappears, the [[Red Sparkles Effect]] {{Ilink|Red Sparkles Effect}} appears on the user and the following message will appear: {{Server Message|The Fire of the Suns engulfs you.}}
If the user already has the blessing, the following message will appear in orange preventing using it: {{Message|type=sound|You already possess this blessing.}}
\nThis charm was initially only available as a {{OfficialNewsArchive|2519|compensation}} for connections problems that took place in August 2013 till {{OfficialNewsArchive|4043|April 25, 2017}}. The only way to obtain the charm these days is to loot it in a monster.
flavortext: The Fire of the Suns is contained in it.

name: Ultimate Healing Rune (Item)
buyfrom: Asima, Chartan, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Ghorza, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Talila, Tandros, Topsy, Valindara, Xodet
notes:
Heals the target a large amount of HP. The amount changes with the magic level and level of the user. Most frequently, players use this rune on themselves, but it can also be used to rescue a fellow player or a [[summon Creature|summoned creature]] from dying.
[[Druid]]s or [[Sorcerer]]s using this rune on themselves are guaranteed to heal completely because their magic power is a lot higher and their maximum [[HP|hit points]] are much lower than [[knight]]s or [[paladin]]s of equal level.
Prior to the Christmas Update of 2007, this rune was widely used by knights, however, after the update they are not longer useful for knights or paladins. This rune can be used by mages to heal themselves or their blocker. [[Ultimate Healing Rune (Item)]] is by average around 5% weaker than [[Heal Friend]] (at higher levels difference is near 4%). The biggest advantage of this rune is that it has the highest minimal healing, making it the safest healing in critical fights. For example, if you heal your blocker with two very weak [[heal friend]] spells in a row which may not be enough to keep blocker alive, this rune have higher minimal healing which may be safer and less luck-based healing. Keep in mind, using this rune shares cooldown with other runes and potions. For the spell, see [[Ultimate Healing Rune]].
history: In the [[Updates/8.7|Winter Update 2010]], the color of this rune was changed from dark blue to white to avoid abuse scenarios.

name: Unity Charm
notes:
This item can be used to provide the user the [[blessing]] [[Embrace of Tibia]]. It only works once, then it disappears, the [[Blue Sparkles Effect]] {{Ilink|Blue Sparkles Effect}} appears on the user and the following message will appear: {{Server Message|The Embrace of Tibia surrounds you.}}
If the user already has the blessing, the following message will appear in orange preventing using it: {{Message|type=sound|You already possess this blessing.}}
\nThis charm was only available as a {{OfficialNewsArchive|2519|compensation}} for connections problems that took place in August 2013 till {{OfficialNewsArchive|4043|April 25, 2017}}. The only way to obtain the charm these days is to loot it in a monster.
flavortext: The Embrace of Tibia is contained in it.

name: Tibia Coins
notes:
You can exchange them for [[Premium Time]], Extra Services ([[Sex Change]], [[Name Change]], [[World Transfer]] and [[Express World Transfer]]), [[Blessings]], [[Potions]], [[Runes]], [[Mounts#Bought Mounts|Mounts]], [[Store#Outfits|Outfits]], [[Store#House Equipment|House Equipment]], [[XP Boost]] and ''Useful Things'' ([[Charm Expansion Offer]], [[Instant Reward Access]], [[Prey Bonus Reroll]], [[Permanent Prey Slot]], [[Gold Pouch]], [[Gold Converter]] and [[Temple Teleport]]) via the [[Store]]. They can be traded with other players via the [[Market]]. Once bought, they are available to all characters of the same account no matter the [[Game World]] and it's also possible to transfer them to any player anywhere. Tibia Coins are therefore the only items which can cross server boundaries. They are also only items for which free players can place 'buy'-offers in the market and the only items to hold a Market category of their own. 

After 3 years an account hasn't been used, all Tibia Coins on it are deleted. Several emails are sent beforehand to the account's email address warning inactive players about this procedure. A single login before the 3 years are over will prevent the deletion of the Tibia Coins.

'''Note:''' Two asterisks (**) after a payment method name indicate that Tibia Coins bought with this service will only become transferable 6 months after their purchase. These methods include ''BoaCompra Gold'', ''Boku'' (appears as ''Mobile Payment'' on the Webshop), ''Boleto BancÃ¡rio'' and ''PagSeguro''. Depending on the country, ''Credit/Debit Card'' and/or ''PayPal'' may also sell temporarily untransferable Tibia Coins, so pay attention to the asterisks.
flavortext: Tibia Coins are needed to shop exclusive products in the Store, including fabulous mounts, classy outfits, a Name Change or even Premium Time.

name: Tinder Box

name: Umbral Spellbook
notes:
Use this spellbook if you want some all-round resistance and can't use the [[Umbral Master Spellbook]]. However, the cost of forging is very high and the following alternatives might be a better choice until you can upgrade further:
* [[Spellbook of Ancient Arcana]]: +4 magic level, +5% death resistance, ''can be considerably expensive''
* [[Spellbook of Vigilance]]: +3 magic level, +3 earth resistance, -3% fire resistance, ''very cheap on most worlds''.
* [[Spellbook of Dark Mysteries]] / [[Snake God's Wristguard]]: +3 magic level

This weapon can '''only''' be imbued with '''Basic imbuements'''. Intricate and Powerful imbuements are not available for Crude and Regular Umbral weapons.

This item is forged through [[Umbral Creation]].

You wished for something cool.}}) * 1x [[Rubbish]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You thought about getting rich and a pile of loot...}}) * 1x [[Present (Explosive)]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You were that curious for the surprise.}}) * 1x [[Simple Dress]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and ... Oops, where did that dream come from?}}) * 1x [[Silver Prison Key]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You just thought about a true challenge.}}) * 1x [[Spellwand]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. Somehow you seemed to get distracted when you thought of Ferumbras.}}) * 1x [[Die]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You just wondered if you'd be lucky this time.}}) * 1x [[Mirror]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You shouldn't really think about yourself that often.}}) * 1x [[Cluster of Solace]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You thought of your last night's dream}}, {{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You couldn't focus on anything specific.}}) * 1x [[Meat]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You just thought about a loyal companion.}}) * 1x [[Copper Prison Key]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You just thought about a true challenge.}}) * 1x [[Bronze Prison Key]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You just thought about a true challenge.}}) * 1x [[Golden Prison Key]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You just thought about a true challenge.}}) * 1x [[Wedding Ring]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You wonder what were you thinking about.}}) * 1x [[Stuffed Bunny]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You just thought about having a true friend.}}) * 1x [[Dream Warden Claw]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You wonder what were you thinking about.}}) * 1x [[Pair of Earmuffs]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. Sadly you had cold ears just in that moment.}}) * 1x [[Bag of Apple Slices]] ({{Server Message|You try to concentrate and your dream comes true. You thought about your sore feet.}})
{{Seealso|Unrealized Dream/Statistics}}

name: Unstable Ring of Ending
notes: Obtained when using a [[String of Mending]] on a [[Broken Ring of Ending]]. When wielded, it will begin transformation, the result of which will either be a [[Ring of Ending]], or the character's death.
flavortext: Something is happening to this ring.

name: Strong Health Keg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is available in the [[Store]] only. It fills up to 500 [[Strong Health Potion]]s. All potions created this way as well as the keg itself will be kept in [[Your Store Inbox]]. A keg is not only useful for providing potions in a hunting ground, it also saves you some capacity as its constant weight equals the net weight of 250 potions. The keg can only be used by the character who purchased it in the Store. For this reason, the potions filled using the keg need to fit the character's vocation and level. Once the keg is empty it will vanish into thin air.\n\n{{Seealso|Cask & Keg Value Effectiveness}}
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its Store price was 46 [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This keg can be used to refill strong health potions.

name: Strong Mana Keg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is available in the [[Store]] only. It fills up to 500 [[Strong Mana Potion]]s. All potions created this way as well as the keg itself will be kept in [[Your Store Inbox]]. A keg is not only useful for providing potions in a hunting ground, it also saves you some capacity as its constant weight equals the net weight of 250 potions. The keg can only be used by the character who purchased it in the Store. For this reason, the potions filled using the keg need to fit the character's vocation and level. Once the keg is empty it will vanish into thin air.\n\n{{Seealso|Cask & Keg Value Effectiveness}}
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its Store price was 37 [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This keg can be used to refill strong mana potions.

name: Sugatrap's Obsidian Lance
notes:
It once belonged to the great goblin Sugatrap.
It looks the same as an [[Obsidian Lance]].\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: Its blade is sharp and its wood carefully preserved. A weapon for a strong goblin, and clearly used before.

name: Sun Catcher
notes:
It looks the same as a [[Shining Sun Catcher]].
\nThere is also a [[Dark Sun Catcher|dark version]] of this item: {{Ilink|Dark Sun Catcher}}.\nReward from the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Supreme Health Keg
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: This item is available in the [[Store]] only. It fills up to 500 [[Supreme Health Potion]]s. All potions created this way as well as the keg itself will be kept in [[Your Store Inbox]]. A keg is not only useful for providing potions in a hunting ground, it also saves you some capacity as its constant weight equals the net weight of 250 potions. The keg can only be used by the character who purchased it in the Store. For this reason, the potions filled using the keg need to fit the character's vocation and level. Once the keg is empty it will vanish into thin air.\n\n{{Seealso|Cask & Keg Value Effectiveness}}
history: Before {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}}, its Store price was 230 [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This keg can be used to refill supreme health potions.

name: Supreme Health Potion
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Alptramun | Brain Head | Count Vlarkorth | Drume | Duke Krule | Earl Osam | Ghulosh | Gorzindel | Goshnar's Cruelty | Goshnar's Greed | Goshnar's Hatred | Goshnar's Malice | Goshnar's Megalomania | Goshnar's Spite | Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar Champion of Winter | Izcandar the Banished | King Zelos | Lord Azaram | Malofur Mangrinder | Maxxenius | Mazzinor | Megasylvan Yselda | Plagueroot | Scarlett Etzel | Sir Baeloc | The Abomination | The Brainstealer | The Dread Maiden | The Fear Feaster | The Nightmare Beast | The Pale Worm | The Scourge of Oblivion | The Unwelcome | Urmahlullu the Weakened | Vemiath | Chagorz | Ichgahal
buyfrom: Alaistar, Asima, Asnarus, Chartan, Chuckles, Faloriel, Frederik, Ghorza, Maun, Mehkesh, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rock In A Hard Place, Romir, Sandra, Siflind, Talila, Tandros, Tarun, Valindara
notes:
It has a deposit of '''5 [[Empty Potion Flask (Large)|gp]]''' and restores between '''875''' and '''1,175 [[Hit Point]]s''', around '''1,000''' on average.
{{Seealso|Money Spent per Hit Point|Capacity Taken per Hit Point}} | history = * The price was further increased from '''625 gp''' to '''650 gp''' with the [[Summer Update 2024|Summer 2024 Update]] on {{OfficialNewsArchive|7952|Jul 01, 2024}}. * The price was increased from '''500 gp''' to '''625 gp''', additionally the [[Store]] prices were also raised with the [[Updates/11.94.7495|update]] on {{OfficialNewsArchive|4795|October 29, 2018}} shown below. ** 100x Supreme Health Potions went from '''37 Tibia Coins''' to '''47 Tibia Coins'''. ** 250x Supreme Health Potions went from '''90 Tibia Coins''' to '''113 Tibia Coins'''.
flavortext: This potion can only be consumed by knights of level 200 or higher.

name: Surprise Cube
notes:
'''Surprise Cubes are no longer obtainable''', but they look the same as [[Drome Cube]]s which can be exchanged by [[Tibiadrome|drome points]]. There is a chance of getting any of these items by opening it: *{{Ilink|Orange}} 20 [[Orange]]s *{{Ilink|Platinum Coin}} 5 [[Platinum Coin]]s *{{Ilink|Dwarven Ring}} [[Dwarven Ring]] *{{Ilink|Energy Ring}} [[Energy Ring]] *{{Ilink|Stealth Ring}} [[Stealth Ring]] *{{Ilink|Time Ring}} [[Time Ring]] *{{Ilink|Ring of Healing}} [[Ring of Healing]] *{{Ilink|Green Crystal Shard}} [[Green Crystal Shard]] *{{Ilink|Violet Crystal Shard}} [[Violet Crystal Shard]] *{{Ilink|Blue Crystal Shard}} [[Blue Crystal Shard]] *{{Ilink|Cyan Crystal Fragment}} [[Cyan Crystal Fragment]] *{{Ilink|Red Crystal Fragment}} [[Red Crystal Fragment]] *{{Ilink|Green Crystal Fragment}} [[Green Crystal Fragment]] *{{Ilink|Berserk Potion}} [[Berserk Potion]] *{{Ilink|Bullseye Potion}} [[Bullseye Potion]] *{{Ilink|Mastermind Potion}} [[Mastermind Potion]] *{{Ilink|Brown Pit Demon}} [[Brown Pit Demon]] *{{Ilink|Green Pit Demon}} [[Green Pit Demon]] *{{Ilink|Blue Pit Demon}} [[Blue Pit Demon]] *{{Ilink|Black Pit Demon}} [[Black Pit Demon]] *{{Ilink|Red Pit Demon}} [[Red Pit Demon]] Opening it will trigger the appearance of the [[Die Effect]]. {{Ilink|Die Effect}}
{{Seealso|Surprise Cube/Statistics}} There was a chance of obtaining these from [[Lorenzo]] after exchanging [[Arena Badge]]s for potions, before the [[Monster Arena]] was replaced with the [[Tibiadrome]]. The higher the amount of required badges for a certain kind of potions, the higher was the chance of getting a surprise cube.
flavortext: There might be something valuable inside.

name: Surprise Jar
notes:
Use it to get one of the following:
*{{Ilink|Blue Gem}} [[Blue Gem]]s
*{{Ilink|Gold Token}} [[Gold Token]]s
*{{Ilink|Silver Token}} [[Silver Token]]s
*{{Ilink|Suspicious Device}} [[Suspicious Device]]s
*{{Ilink|Violet Gem}} [[Violet Gem]]s
{{Seealso|Surprise Jar/Statistics}}

When opening a Surprise Jar, an [[Energy Effect]] {{Ilink|Energy Effect}} will be displayed on the character.

Rewarded after completing tasks from [[Dangerous Depths Quest]].

name: Suspicious Device
droppedby: Cave Devourer | Chasm Spawn | Diremaw | Deepworm | Lost Exile | Tunnel Tyrant
notes: It can be obtained by using a [[Surprise Jar]].\nPart of the [[Dangerous Depths Quest]].
flavortext: This thing looks like it was carried around by someone for a long time.

name: Swan Feather
notes: The [[Fae]] make cloaks out of these.Part of the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Swan Feather Cloak
notes: Reward from the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
history: During the test server of its release it did not have the speed bonus, the earth protection and the flavor text, and its weight was 28.50 oz. It was changed during the test server for this lighter version with speed +10 and earth +12% after player feedback regarding its usefulness.
flavortext: It was carefully crafted out of one hundred swan maiden feathers.

name: Swarmer Drum (Vibrating)
notes:
This is a [[Swarmer Drum]] right after being used. It will return to its original state after 30 seconds. If you try to use this swarmer drum, you will get the following message: {{Server Message|The drum is still vibrating and not yet ready to be used again.}}
\nIt looks the same as a [[Drum]] and a [[Swarmer Drum]].\nItem temporarily obtained in [[War Against The Hive Quest]].
flavortext: The drum is still vibrating and not ready for use.

name: Tarnished Rhino Figurine
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Tattered Swan Feather
notes: Temporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].

name: Tatty Dragon Scale Legs
notes:
You can dig tatty dragon scale legs at [[Vigintia]]'s treasure hunting zone.
It was introduced to celebrate [[Tibia's 20th Anniversary]].
flavortext: They clearly have seen better days.

name: Teleportation Rod
notes: Despite being a [[Rod]], it cannot be used as a weapon.\nPart of the [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].
flavortext: A rod to be powerful enough to transport the godbreaker parts to a place of safety.

name: Temple Teleport Scroll
notes:
When used, the temple teleport scroll will send the character immediately to their [[Portal of Citizenship|home temple]]. A temple teleport scroll cannot be used in [[No-Logout Zone]]s or if the character has a [[Logout Block]] or [[Protection Zone Block]].

The scroll can be taken from the [[Daily Reward System]] and expires after 7 days or after use.

You can also buy a one-time use [[Temple Teleport]] on the [[Store]] for 15 {{TC}} [[Tibia Coins]].
flavortext: This item cannot be traded.

name: Test Voodoo Doll
notes:
It could be bought from [[Testserver Assistant]]s during the test servers for the [[2015 Winter Update]], [[2016 Summer Update]], [[2016 Winter Update]], and almost every other test servers since then. It is used to facilitate testing by removing some cooldowns, like the [[Duelling Arena]] and some boss fights.

It could be seen in [[The Market (Object)|The Market]] for some time.

It looks the same as a [[Mysterious Thing]], a [[Voodoo Doll]], a [[Voodoo Doll (2543)]], a [[Voodoo Doll (3613)]] and a [[Voodoo Doll (5261)]].

name: Test Wand of Voodoo
notes:
It could be bought from [[Testserver Assistant]]s during the test server for ''Revamped and New Spells'' of [[Summer Update 2017]] and could be used to remove the cooldowns of the new spells. Upon using this item, you'll get the following message: {{Server Message|Certain spell cooldowns have been reset.}}
It looks the same as a [[Wand of Voodoo]].

name: Thawing Ice Pick
notes: It disappears and respawns after 5 seconds. This pick doesn't open [[List of Pickeable Holes|pick holes]]. It looks the same as a [[Dwarven Pickaxe]] and an [[Ice Pick]].\nItem obtained and used during the fight against [[Zushuka]].
flavortext: It is frosted with tiny ice crystals and starts to melt as you look at it.

name: The Crossbow of Swordfish
notes:
It once belonged to the great goblin Swordfish.

It looks the same as an [[Arbalest]].
Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It has inlaid swordfish teeth and is surprisingly big.

name: The Cube
notes: The cube is mentioned on [[Research Notes of Dolis II (Book)]].
flavortext: It's black.

name: The Rite of Eternal Night
notes: It looks the same as a [[Music Sheet (First Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Second Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Third Verse)]], a [[Music Sheet (Fourth Verse)]] and an [[Old Letter]].\nPart of the [[Ferumbras' Ascension Quest]].
flavortext: It is a disturbing invocation of dark and heinous powers.

name: Thorn Seed
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Throwing Star of Sula
notes: It can be seen close to [[Stressed Storeman]] on [[SchrÃ¶dinger's Island]], {{Mapper Coords|128.48|126.169|7|8|text=here}}.\n\nThis is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]]. It looks the same as a [[Starfish]].
flavortext: The golden starfish's arms are sharp as razor blades.

name: Thundersoul Tabard
notes: Can be bought from [[Cledwyn]] for 100 [[Silver Token]]s.

name: Tiara of Power
droppedby: Anomaly | Eradicator | Outburst | Realityquake | Rupture | World Devourer
notes: Looks like [[File:Tiara of Power (Red).gif]] when equipped. Increases your [[Mana]] and [[Hitpoints]] [[Regeneration]] for 60 minutes (1 hours) by the rate of 2 [[HP]] and 8 [[Mana|MP]] per 6 seconds, which means it will recover 4800 [[Mana|MP]] and 1200 [[HP]] in total. Tiara of Power can't be repaired. It disappears after using for 60 minutes.\n}}\n<noinclude>[[Category:Regenerative Items]]</noinclu

name: Tiger Eye
droppedby: Barkless Fanatic | Crazed Winter Vanguard | Goldhanded Cultist | Goldhanded Cultist Bride | Iks Ahpututu | Menacing Carnivor | Shadowpelt | Iks Pututu
sellto: Augustin, Briasol, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan

name: Tinged Pot
droppedby: The Count of the Core | Ancient Spawn of Morgathla
notes: Item needed to get addon 2 of [[Makeshift Warrior Outfits]].
flavortext: It looks like you could use it as a makeshift helmet.

name: Tiny Healing Rune
notes: This rune was implemented in the [[Updates/9.8|Winter Update 2012]] when [[Isle of Destiny]] was revamped, suggesting that it was intended to be given during the [[Festival of Initiates]]. It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Titanium Token
notes: It is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Tool for Analyzing Fluids
notes: Obtained during the [[Cults of Tibia Quest]].
flavortext: With this tool it is possible to analyze fluids in a very comfortable way.

name: Tooth of Tazhadur
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It used to be [[Tazhadur]]'s.Obtained and used during the [[First Dragon Quest]].

name: Torn Book (Diary)
notes:
This is [[Arthei's Descent into Vampirism I (Book)|the first part of Marziel's diary]], in which [[Julius]] is interested.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Damaged Logbook]], [[Torn Book]], [[Torn Book (Readable)]] and a [[Torn Log Book]].
flavortext: It seems to be an old diary written by someone called Marziel, but a lot of pages are ripped out.

name: Torn Piece of Paper
notes: It spawns in [[Drefia]]'s [[Vampire Crypts]] and [[Issavi Libraries|Issavi Library]].

name: Torn Shirt
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Barkless Devotee | Barkless Fanatic | Ravenous Hunger
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}
flavortext: Someone's last shroud.

name: Trapped Hyaena
notes: Keep it carefully trapped if you don't want to be bitten.\nPart of the [[Krailos Quest]].
flavortext: It doesn't seem pleased to be captured in this net.

name: Treasure Chest (Item)
notes:
Two versions of this item exits: one facing South and the other facing East. However, they are not rotatable.
\nThis is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Tunnel Tyrant Head
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Tunnel Tyrant Shell
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

flavortext: This potion can only be consumed by paladins and monks of level 130 or higher.

name: Used Globe Kit
notes:
Furniture kit for a used [[Globe]].
\nIt looks the same as an [[Amazon Disguise Kit]], a [[Birdcage Kit]], a [[Dwarf Disguise Kit]], a [[Globe Kit]], a [[Gnomish Crystal Package]], a [[Mysterious Package (AVIN)]], a [[Mysterious Package (CGB)]], a [[Mysterious Package (TBI)]] and a [[Table Lamp Kit]].\nItem needed in {{Spoiler Section|Jack to the Future Quest|Mission 2}}.
flavortext: Use it in Jack's house to place a used globe.

name: Used Red Chair Kit
notes: Furniture kit for a used [[Red Cushioned Chair]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].\nNeeded in a mission of [[Jack to the Future Quest]].
flavortext: Use it in Jack's house to place a red cushioned chair.

name: Used Rocking Horse Kit
notes: Furniture kit for a used [[Rocking Horse]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].\nNeeded in a mission of [[Jack to the Future Quest]].
flavortext: Use it in Jack's house to place a rocking horse.

name: Used Telescope Kit
notes: Furniture kit for a used [[Telescope]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].\nNeeded in a mission of [[Jack to the Future Quest]].
flavortext: Use it in Jack's house to place a telescope.

name: Sturdy Book
notes: 5 are required for the first addon of the [[Battle Mage Outfits Quest|Battle Mage Outfits]].
flavortext: It looks like you could use it as a kind of protection.

name: Summerblade
droppedby: Izcandar Champion of Summer | Izcandar the Banished

name: Sun Fruit
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crazed Summer Vanguard | Crazed Summer Rearguard | Insane Siren
notes: One is needed during [[The Dream Courts Quest]].

name: Surprise Bag (Yellow)
notes: This surprise bag was originally supposed to drop - probably from [[PiÃ±ata Dragon]]s - on Tibia's Anniversary in 2019, but later it was decided to leave it out, making it an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Svargrond Salmon Filet
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It grants +30 [[Fishing]] skill for one hour when eaten. After consuming one, you have to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish. \n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold.
flavortext: Fresh from the coast of Svargrond, this salmon lives up to traditional northern cuisine.

name: Symbol of Sun and Sea
notes: This item can be obtained during the ''Midnight Pilgrimage'' mission of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].

name: Tagralt Nugget
notes: Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]]. Can be obtained by using a [[Pick (Enchanted)]] on [[Veined Stone]]s.

name: Tearesa
notes: In original state she is crying, then when used she will become happy [[File:Tearesa 2.gif]] for quite some time.\nIt is a possible reward of the [[Demon's Lullaby]] event.

name: Tefrit's List
notes: It looks the same as a [[Crude Primitive Printout]], [[Narsai's List]], [[Rita's Letter]], a [[Ransom Note]], a [[Sheet of Paper]], a [[Sheet of Tracing Paper (Full)]], [[Shimun's List]], a [[Torn Out Page]] and [[Yonan's List]].\nPart of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].
flavortext: needed ingredients: five crab pincers, twenty pieces of honey palm bark, twenty-five shreds of spiderweb clouds and fifteen wild desert roses.

name: Terra Helmet
attrib: sword fighting +2, club fighting +2, axe fighting +2
droppedby: Duke Krule | Sir Baeloc | Earl Osam | Count Vlarkorth | Lord Azaram

name: Test Weapon for Knights
notes: This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: The Cobra Amulet
notes: By using this item on an [[Intricate Cobra Shrine]] {{Mapper Coords|text=here|129.76|127.113|8|4|1|0.250.25}}, you can get A [[Note About Two Souls]] which is related to [[Scarlett Etzel]] and Galthen. Using the amulet on [[Intricate Cobra Shrine]] will break the curse on [[Scarlett Etzel]] and Galthen, ''returning the bastion to its former glory''. '''Warning:''' You will lose the Cobra Amulet in the process.\n\nCipSoft has confirmed that when a specific number of players use their amulets, there will be a slight "cosmetic" change. However, the details of this cosmetic change are yet to be discovered.
flavortext: The bearer of this amulet will command the gaze, the resilience and deadliness of the cobra. Yet what firmly has its place in the heart of its wearer, the cobra will conceal.

name: The Crown of the Percht Queen (Fire)
actualname: the crown of the percht queen
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It is one of the few creature items that is wearable.

name: The Crown of the Percht Queen (Ice)
actualname: the crown of the percht queen
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It is one of the few creature items that is wearable.

name: The Missing Piece of the Cube
actualname: the missing piece of the cube
notes: It's the missing piece of [[The Cube]].\nPart of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].\nIt can be found in Edron by clicking on a [[Burial Case]] close to the wyvern stairs, {{Mapper Coords|text=here|129.194|123.250|8|2|1|0.50.5}}.
flavortext: It's black and it's missing.

name: The Peacock Ballad
notes: It looks the same as [[Intelligence Reports]], a [[Lottery Ticket (Blank)]], a [[Nomad Parchment]], an [[Old Parchment]] and a [[Parchment]].\nTemporarily obtained during [[The Secret Library Quest]]. Its text can be read [[The Peacock Ballad (Book)|here]].

name: The Regalia of Suon
notes:
Item used to tame a {{Ilink|Gryphon (Mount)}} [[Gryphon]] while wearing a [[Gryphon Mask]]. Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The gryphon flew off.}}
Failed: {{Message|type=sound|The gryphon rejects your gift.}}
Succeeded: {{Message|type=sound|The gryphon will now accompany you as a friend and ally.}} This item can be assembled from its four pieces: * {{Ilink|Blue and Golden Cordon}} [[Blue and Golden Cordon]] * {{Ilink|Golden Bijou}} [[Golden Bijou]] * {{Ilink|Sunray Emblem}} [[Sunray Emblem]] * {{Ilink|Sun Medal}} [[Sun Medal]] Its four parts are rewards of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]]. [[Yonan]] on the city market can assemble it for you.
flavortext: A golden sun medal is attached to a silken cordon and soldered on a sunray emblem with a bijou.

name: The Spatial Warp Almanac
notes: Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: An extremely old book on teleportation containing a variety of spells on bending space. It seems tainted by something.

name: The Supreme Cube
notes:
It's [[The Cube]] with its [[The Missing Piece of the Cube|missing piece]]. When using it, two things may happen:

* If you don't have a battle sign, you can [[The Cube (Location)|enter it]], as long as you have the quest requirements. You can then use it again while inside, and you will be teleported to [[Gray Beach]]. This is very useful as a free teleport out of almost any location.
It is advisable to relog first and then quickly use the Cube, this way you won't get any damage from the Planedwellers. 
* If you're inside a [[House]] you own and have defeated the [[Planestrider]], you can also [[Sleep]] (and offline train), but only once every 48 hours. When you do that, it will change into [[The Supreme Cube (Small)]].

There is a 2 hour cooldown to use the Cube, regardless if you accessed the Cube dimension or slept. 

Part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].
flavortext: It's black and it's supreme.

name: The True Book of Death
notes: Part of [[The Secret Library Quest]].
flavortext: The writing in this book seems clear at first but is almost illegible if you try to make sense of anything. It's as if the book itself does not want to be read.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

\nIt looks the same as a [[Damaged Logbook]], [[Torn Book]], [[Torn Book (Diary)]] and a [[Torn Log Book]].

name: Training Rod

By using it on an [[Exercise Dummy]] you'll train your [[Magic Level]] at a much faster rate than by spending the mana from basic regeneration or even over-time regeneration items like [[Soft Boots]]. It has the same effect as a [[Training Wand]] and can be used by both [[Druids]] and [[Sorcerers]].

name: Tropical Marinated Tiger
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: It grants +3 [[Magic Level]] for one hour when eaten. After consuming one, you have to wait 10 minutes to consume another Hireling or [[Jean Pierre]] dish. \n\nA [[Hirelings]] with the Cook skill can prepare this dish specifically for 90,000 gold, or a random dish for 15,000 gold. This item has the properties of [[Store]] products, which means it can only be stored inside [[Your Store Inbox]] and [[Depot Box]]es and cannot be thrown on the ground, traded or used by other players.
history: * The [[Winter Update 2023]] allowed players to specifically choose the dish for 90,000 gold. \n}}<noinclude>[[Category:Magic Booster]]</noinclude>
flavortext: This delicious tiger meat is marinated in a tasty exotic sauce.

name: Turquoise Fireworks Powder

name: Turquoise Fireworks Rocket
notes: Using an [[Obsidian Knife]] on a firework allows you to disassemble the [[Fireworks|Turquoise Fireworks Rockets]] into its respective components: [[Turquoise Fireworks Powder]] and the [[Fireworks Capsule]]. \n\nYou can create one by using {{Ilink|Turquoise Fireworks Powder}} [[Turquoise Fireworks Powder]] on a {{Ilink|Fireworks Capsule}} [[Fireworks Capsule]].
flavortext: It can be disassembled with the right tool.
