name: Strike Enhancement
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will increase the [[Critical Hit]] chance by 5% for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily increases critical hit chance.

name: String of Fairy Lights (BGY)
notes:
It displays a sequence of Blue, Green and Yellow lights. It can be [[String of Fairy Lights (BGY, Unlit)|turned off]], and when unlit it can be sold on the market. 

You can also find Strings of Fairy Lights with [[String of Fairy Lights (RYG)|Red-Yellow-Green]] and [[String of Fairy Lights (BRG)|Blue-Red-Green]] lights.

[[File:String of Fairy Lights (BGY).png|thumb|left|An example of the light they spread.]]

notes: This Skull is sometimes using during [[Test Server]]s to activated specific parts of quests and make testing easier. For example, during the tests for the [[Summer Update 2023]] it could be used to immediately get access to the [[Rotten Blood Quest]] bosses without having to do the access mechanics. When available it can be bought from the [[Testserver Assistant]], just like the [[Test Voodoo Doll]].

Dragon: [[File:The Dragon Spirit (Dragon).gif]]
flavortext: It represents the spirit of your first dragon. Granted by Intibia.com

[[File:The God's Twilight Doll 2.gif]]

sounds: {{Sound List|<Player>, the moment has come... Make your decision, would you follow Fardos or Variphor?|Azerus, Prince Drazzak, Mazarius, World Devourer, Source of Corruption, Scourge of Oblivion - harbingers of things to come.|Look by your side, you're not alone, you've never been...|The path of light or darkness, it's your choice <Player>... You've always been free to choose your side.|You read on the back: forged in the flames of the Temple of Light.}}
flavortext: It represents Valiant on behalf of Fardos and Ragna on behalf of Variphor. It symbolizes the fight between light and darkness, wisdom and ignorance, freedom and domination. Granted by TibiaLight.com.

name: The Key Intihuatac
notes: Assembled as part of the '''Galthen and the City of Gold''' mission of the [[Adventures of Galthen Quest]] and used to access [[Iksupan]].\n\nIn case you have lost this key after completing the quest you can reassemble a new one by collecting the ancient disc parts again in [[Folda]], [[Oramond]], and [[Roshamuul]] by saying {{KW|lost key}} to NPC [[Sandomo]].
flavortext: Intihuatac, the key to the lost city of Iksupan.

name: The Living Idol of Tukh
notes: It's very similar to the [[Golden Idol of Tukh]], but this one opens its eyes from time to time. \n\nObtained during the [[Adventures of Galthen Quest]].
flavortext: It feels warm, despite being made of pure gold and jade. It seems to observe your every move.

name: The Mitmah East Key
notes: Obtained by killing [[Atab]] for the first time. It is used in part of the [[Adventures_of_Galthen_Quest#Galthen_and_the_City_of_Gold_Part_II|Galthen and the City of Gold Part II]] quest.
flavortext: An otherworldly key that seems to be part of a set. It shows markings of the Mitmah.

name: The Mitmah North Key
notes: Open the pile of bones found {{Mapper Coords|132.233|122.242|11|8|text=here}} to obtain the [[The Mitmah North Key]]. It is used in part of the [[Adventures_of_Galthen_Quest#Galthen_and_the_City_of_Gold_Part_II|Galthen and the City of Gold Part II]] quest.
flavortext: An otherworldly key that seems to be part of a set. It shows markings of the Mitmah.

name: The Mitmah South Key
notes: Locate and open the trunk that can be found either {{Mapper Coords|133.47|123.140|10|8|text=here}}, {{Mapper Coords|132.255|123.92|10|8|text=here}}, or {{Mapper Coords|132.187|123.60|10|8|text=here}} to obtain the [[The Mitmah South Key]]. It is used in part of the [[Adventures_of_Galthen_Quest#Galthen_and_the_City_of_Gold_Part_II|Galthen and the City of Gold Part II]] quest.
flavortext: An otherworldly key that seems to be part of a set. It shows markings of the Mitmah.

name: The Mitmah West Key
notes: Open an ornate case found {{Mapper Coords|132.215|123.129|10|8|text=here}} to obtain the [[The Mitmah West Key]]. It is used in part of the [[Adventures_of_Galthen_Quest#Galthen_and_the_City_of_Gold_Part_II|Galthen and the City of Gold Part II]] quest.
flavortext: An otherworldly key that seems to be part of a set. It shows markings of the Mitmah.

name: Sugar (Quest)
notes:
You can find [[Sugar (Quest)|Sugar Cubes]] in [[Feyrist]] located {{Mapper Coords|130.142|125.215|8|8|text=here}}, {{Mapper Coords|130.215|126.29|8|8|text=here}}, and lastly in the cave {{Mapper Coords|131.18|125.212|7|8|text=here}}, which is found one floor below {{Mapper Coords|131.34|125.186|9|8|text=here}}. The [[Sugar (Quest)|Sugar Cubes]] are used in part of the [[Threatened Dreams Quest#Sweet Dreams|Threatened Dreams Quest - Sweet Dreams]] when making the different sirups for the [[Gingerbread Key]]. 

'''Note''': While you're on this part of the quest you'll be able to collect the [[Sugar (Quest)|sugar cubes]] from each of the chests 1x every hour until completing this task. This will allow you to make extras of the three different sirups:
* {{Ilink|Flask with Lemon Sirup}} [[Flask with Lemon Sirup]]
* {{Ilink|Flask with Moon Melon Sirup}} [[Flask with Moon Melon Sirup]]
* {{Ilink|Flask with Raspberry Sirup}} [[Flask with Raspberry Sirup]]

name: Taiyaki
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Can be fished with [[Yummy Gummy Worm]]s or [[Gummy Rotworm]]s in the cocoa lakes as well as in the milk lakes on Candia.
flavortext: These waffle fish can be caught in the milk and cocoa lakes of Candia. They are filled with chocolate cream, jam or other sweet stuffings, depending on what they have eaten beforehand.

objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Tattered Piece of Paper
notes: Temporarily obtained during the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].
flavortext: Looking pretty, but too sweet... far too sweet. Kept cute turtle but sold other three to a voracious werehyaena, a lofty medusa and a beautiful woman who called herself some kind of burning flower.

actualname: the mariner's compass from the Antoinette
notes: The signs engraved ('JT(O~X') are written in [[Jekhr]] are read as "JHLOSK" and mean "Undersea / the location" (according to {{Post|34456139|this}}).
flavortext: The compass from the legendary Antoinette, flagship of the Bounacean Order of the Lion and pride of Bounac. The signs JT(O~X are engraved in its underside.

buyfrom: Ashtamor, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: It can be rarely seen in houses, even though it is a nice piece of decoration. One vase can also be found as daily spawn in [[Black Knight's Villa]] and in the ruin north-west of [[Venore]].

buyfrom: Ahmet: 20;oil, Bashira: 20;oil, Bezil: 20;oil, Gree Dee: 20;oil, Halif: 20;oil, Larek: 20, Larek: 50; milk, Nezil: 20;oil, Sandra: 10;urine, Sandra: 12;slime, Sandra: 15;blood, Sandra: 20;oil, Sandra;water, Sarina: 20;oil

You can trade 100 vials with [[Sandra]] in [[Edron]] for a [[Lottery Ticket]]. Vials are also called flasks. You can only sell/trade in 100 vials at a time (of the same kind).
\nYou can get an empty vial if you buy one with fluid in it from a store and then empty it. Plenty of them are also found in [[daily spawns]].\nIt is refillable.

name: Viking Helmet
droppedby: Barbarian Headsplitter | Barbarian Skullhunter | Brittle Skeleton | Ghoul | Grand Master Oberon | Loricate Orger | Skeleton | Teleskor | Undead Prospector
buyfrom: Azil, Cornelia, Flint, Sam, Timur, Turvy
sellto: Azil, Brengus, Coltrayne: 25, Cornelia, Dixi:25, Flint, H.L.:12, Hardek, Kroox, Lee'Delle: 25, Memech, Morpel, Sam, Shanar, Timur, Turvy, Yanni
notes: The Viking Helmet provides as much armor as the [[Legion Helmet]] but weighs more, it's a good item for bringing to [[mainland]] and selling it there. It is part of the [[Viking Set]]. It is common to find this helmet in the [[Skeleton]] tomb, which can be accessed by digging a hole in the middle grave, located {{Mapper Coords|125.151|125.151|7|3|text=here}}.\nThis item can be obtained in the [[Katana Quest]] in [[Rookgaard]].

name: Volcanic Rod
droppedby: Diabolic Imp | Fire Devil | Morgaroth | Rahemos | Warlock | Witch
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
history: Volcanic Rods replaced {{Ilink|Wand of Might}} [[Wand of Might|Wands of Might]] in [[Updates/7.6|Update 7.6]], and these were replaced by [[Necrotic Rod]]s in the [[Updates/8.1|Update 8.1]].
flavortext: It erupts powerful bursts of magma upon everything in your path.

name: Voodoo Doll
droppedby: Death Priest Shargon | Dworc Voodoomaster | Golgordan | Grandfather Tridian | Ogre Shaman | Orshabaal
notes:
Using this doll on any player or [[NPC]] will show either the following text message: "{{Sound|You concentrate on your victim, hit the needle in the doll.......but nothing happens.}}" or "{{Sound|You concentrate on your victim and hit the needle in the doll.}}", in which case a blood hit {{Ilink|Blood Effect}} will appear on the target, dealing no damage.
It looks the same as a [[Mysterious Thing]], a [[Voodoo Doll (2543)]], a [[Voodoo Doll (3613)]], a [[Voodoo Doll (5261)]] and a [[Test Voodoo Doll]].\nFive of them are needed in the [[Shaman Outfits Quest]].
One is needed in the [[Treasure Hunt Quest]].
One is required (but not consumed) to obtain the [[achievement]] [[Dark Voodoo Priest]].

name: Voodoo Doll (King)
notes: This item has the same name as [[Voodoo Doll]], but they are different [[item]]s.\nThis can be obtained by the [[Voodoo Doll Quest]] at [[Venore]].
history: After [[Updates/7.8|Summer Update 2006]], the name of this [[item]] changed from '''voodoodoll''' to '''voodoo doll'''. Before the same update, it looked the same as a [[Doll]].
flavortext: It looks like a little king.

name: Wall Mirror (Edged)
buyfrom: Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Has no known purpose, except to admire your own beauty. You could use it a lot of times in a day but only the first time it would tell you a message, the other times it will tell you "Don't be so vain about your appearance." In shops, it is simply called "Wall Mirror", as there are 3 mirrors. Look at the picture to see whether you're getting the right one!
sounds: {{Sound List|You could win a beauty contest today!|You rarely looked better.|Well, you can't look good every day.|You should think about a makeover.|Is that the indication of a potbelly looming under your clothes?|You look irresistible.|You look tired.|You look awesome!|You nearly don't recognize yourself.|You look fabulous.|Don't be so vain about your appearance.}}

name: Wand of Cosmic Energy
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Arachnophobica | Blemished Spawn | Burster Spectre | Diamond Servant | Diamond Servant Replica | Elf Arcanist | Energy Elemental | Flimsy Lost Soul | General Murius | Gorzindel | High Voltage Elemental | Instable Sparkion | Irgix the Flimsy | Knowledge Elemental | Lokathmor | Memory of a Shaper | Memory of an Elf | Mercurial Menace | Minotaur Mage | Quara Hydromancer | Quara Hydromancer Scout | Realityquake | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Sister Hetai | Souleater | Sparkion | Spectre | Thanatursus | The Horned Fox | The Moonlight Aster | Thul | Tremendous Tyrant | Twisted Shaper | Usurper Warlock | Venerable Girtablilu | Yielothax
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes:
An upgrade from the [[Wand of Decay]] and the [[Wand of Draconia]] that makes them both largely obsolete, since, in addition to dealing more damage per shot, [[Energy Damage|energy]] is considered to be a more useful element than [[Fire Damage|fire]] and, at least at a lower level, [[Death Damage|death]]. It is the [[sorcerer]]'s equivalent of the [[druid]]'s [[Terra Rod]]. \nReward in [[The Paradox Tower Quest]].
\nNeeded for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] (male) and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]] (female).
history: [[Wands]] of Cosmic Energy replaced the rare [[File:Yellow Spell Wand.gif]] [[Yellow Spell Wand]]s in [[Updates/7.6|Update 7.6]].
flavortext: The energy of a radiant star is trapped inside its globe.

name: Wand of Dragonbreath
droppedby: Crazed Summer Vanguard | Dark Apprentice | Insane Siren | Manticore | Menacing Carnivor | Sabretooth (Creature)
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frederik, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Romir, Siflind, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet, Rachel
notes: An upgrade from the [[Wand of Vortex]] and the second weakest wand available on the mainland. It is the [[sorcerer]]'s equivalent of the [[druid]]'s [[Moonlight Rod]]. Provides 2 sqm of red light. Wands of Dragonbreath replaced {{Ilink|Red Spell Wand}} [[Red Spell Wand]]s in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]].\nNeeded for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] (male) and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]] (female).
flavortext: Legends say that this wand holds the soul of a young dragon.

name: Wand of Inferno
droppedby: Amenef the Burning | Cloak of Terror | Dawnfire Asura | Dragon | Draken Spellweaver | Efreet | Enlightened of the Cult | Essence of Malice | Feral Sphinx | Gazer Spectre | Grand Mother Foulscale | Grandfather Tridian | Gravedigger | Guardian of Tales | Hand of Cursed Fate | Hellfire Fighter | Hellhound | Insane Siren | Lava Golem | Lavafungus | Lizard Dragon Priest | Lokathmor | Madareth | Massive Fire Elemental | Ogre Rowdy | Pirat Scoundrel | Sabretooth (Creature) | Shaburak Demon | Shaburak Lord | Shaburak Prince | Sister Hetai | Spellreaper Inferniarch | The Baron from Below | The Count of the Core | The Duke of the Depths | Thornfire Wolf | True Dawnfire Asura | Vulcongra | Wyvern | Xogixath
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frederik, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Romir, Siflind, Tandros
notes:
An upgrade from the [[Wand of Cosmic Energy]] and the [[sorcerer]]'s equivalent of the [[druid]]'s [[Hailstorm Rod]]. It is the [[Fire Damage|fire damage]] counterpart to the [[Wand of Starstorm]] and the [[Wand of Voodoo]]. Wands of Inferno replaced {{Ilink|Ritual Wand}} [[Ritual Wand]]s in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]].
\nNeeded for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] (male) and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]] (female).
flavortext: It unleashes the very fires of hell.

name: Wand of Might
history: This wand was transformed into the [[Volcanic Rod]] in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]]. This item no longer exists in game.

name: Wand of Plague
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Nelly, Rabaz, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
history: Wands of Plague replaced {{Ilink|Green Spell Wand}} [[Green Spell Wand]]s in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]] and were replaced by the suspiciously similar looking [[Wand of Decay]] in [[Updates/8.1|Update 8.1]].
flavortext: Infectious goo covers its tip.

name: Wand of Vortex
buyfrom: Alexander, Asima, Chuckles, Fenech, Frans, Frederik, Gnomegica, Hamish, Khanna, Mordecai, Nelly, Onfroi, Rabaz, Rachel, Romir, Shiriel, Siflind, Sigurd, Tandros, Topsy, Xodet
notes: The [[sorcerer]]'s equivalent of the [[druid]]'s [[Snakebite Rod]] and the lowest-levelled wand available on the mainland. Provides 2 sqm of blue light. A rather effective weapon, as low level monsters are usually not resistant to [[Energy Damage|energy damage]]. Wands of Vortex replaced {{Ilink|Blue Spell Wand}} [[Blue Spell Wand]]s in the [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]]. Looks the same as [[Xodet's First Wand]] and the [[Sorc and Druid Staff]].\nNeeded for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] (male) and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]] (female).
history: The [[Updates/10.55|Autumn Patch 2014]] lowered the level requirement to wield this wand from 7 to 6.
flavortext: Surges of energy rush through the tip of this wand.

name: War Hammer
droppedby: Crawler | Cult Enforcer | Enslaved Dwarf | Furious Troll | Headpecker | Hero | Hideous Fungus | Hulking Carnisylvan | Hulking Prehemoth | Juvenile Bashmu | Memory of a Hero | Ogre Ruffian | Ogre Savage | Plaguesmith | Renegade Knight | Rustheap Golem | Shadowstalker | Stampor | The Count | Thornback Tortoise | Toad | Vicious Squire | Vile Grandmaster | Werelion | White Lion | Worker Golem | Iks Aucar
buyfrom: Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Esrik, Flint, Gamel, Habdel, Hardek, Memech, Morpel, Nah'Bob, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Romella, Rowenna, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Uzgod, Willard
sellto: Baltim: 470, Brengus: 470, Cedrik: 470, Esrik: 470, Flint: 470, Gamel: 470, H.L.: 90, Habdel: 470, Hardek: 470, Memech: 470, Morpel: 470, Nah'Bob, Robert: 470, Rock In A Hard Place: 470, Romella: 470, Rowenna: 470, Sam: 470, Shanar: 470, Turvy: 470, Ulrik: 470, Uzgod: 470, Willard: 470
notes: Used to be used by most [[club]] fighters to cause heavy damage. Has lost most of its usefulness since the [[Summer Update 2007]], since the level required for proper use is now 50. It looks the same as a [[Worm Punisher]].\nObtainable from the [[Circle Room Quest]].
history:
From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy War Hammer}} [[Icy War Hammer]]
* {{Ilink|Earth War Hammer}} [[Earth War Hammer]]
* {{Ilink|Energy War Hammer}} [[Energy War Hammer]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery War Hammer}} [[Fiery War Hammer]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].

name: Warlord Sword
notes: It is one of the rarest items in the game, with only a few existing across all worlds. \n\nIt can be seen below [[A Sweaty Cyclops]] in [[Ab'Dendriel]] and in [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis Room]]. If you talk to the sweaty cyclops and say {{KW|warlord sword}}, he will ask for materials to make it. These materials, however, remain unknown.
history: * It used to be considered one of the best swords of Tibia, after [[Magic Longsword]].\n* It used to have an attack value of 62 and a defense value of 40.\n* One of the few known examples of this sword was shown in the famous [[Tibianic Exhibition]] on [[Antica]], hosted by the Alliance of Free Tibians led by Taghor.
flavortext: Strong powers flow in this magic sword.

name: Warrior Helmet
droppedby: Black Knight | Cult Enforcer | Earl Osam | Enslaved Dwarf | Flameborn | Hellspawn | Hydra | Lavaworm | Minotaur Amazon | Minotaur Cult Follower | Minotaur Invader | Orc Cult Fanatic | Orc Leader | Paladin's Apparition | Quara Pincher | Renegade Orc | Renegade Quara Pincher | Serpent Spawn | Spiky Carnivor | Terrorsleep | The Many | The Welter | Ushuriel | Usurper Archer | Vicious Squire
notes:
Heavy helmet compared to the [[Crusader Helmet]] which is lighter and has the same armor rating. Also, the price is lower because of its weight and because it is quite easy to loot.\nIt can be obtained from [[Deeper Fibula Quest]].
\n4 warrior helmets can be traded by [[Haroun]] ([[Blue Djinn Fortress]]) or [[Yaman]] ([[Green Djinn Fortress]]) for 1 [[Flask of Warrior's Sweat]].

name: Watch
buyfrom: Ahmet, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zora

notes:
When you use it, the watch tell the [[time]]: {{Message|type=server|The time is ''hh'':''mm''.}}
\nLooks the same as a [[Magical Watch]], a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch]], a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch (Broken)]], and a [[Stabilizer]].
\nCan be found as a daily spawn in [[Dusalk's Troll Clan Cave]].

name: Water (Liquid)
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
To get water, simply "use" a [[Containers#Fluid Containers|Fluid Containers]] on another container holding water, on a [[Water (Tile)|shoreline]], a [[Draw Well]], a [[Fountain]], a [[Rain Barrel (Open)]], a [[Water Cask]], or a [[Wall Fountain]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Vial of Elemental Water]], [[Holy Water]] and [[Quara Ink]].\n1 of them is required for both the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]] and the [[Arito's Task Quest]]. 2 [[vial]]s of water are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Water Pipe
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Shiantis, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes:
It is exposed in Explorer Society Hall ([[Port Hope]]). You can use this item to simulate smoke.\n
{{seealso|Water Pipe (Deluxe)|Imported Water Pipe}}

name: Waterskin
droppedby: Animated Ogre Shaman | Elf Scout | Ogre Shaman | Shaper Matriarch
buyfrom: Ahmet: 40;water, Bashira;water, Bezil;water, Gree Dee;water, Halif: 40;water, Lubo;water, Nezil;water, Red Lilly;water
notes: It looks the same as a [[Gas Bag]] and a [[Full Gas Bag]].
history: Previously, Waterskins were known as ''Water Hoses''. Before a certain [[update]], WaterskinsÂ looked like this: [[File:Waterskin (Old).gif]]

name: Wedding Ring
droppedby: Banshee | Hero | Memory of a Banshee | Vile Grandmaster | Memory of a Hero
buyfrom: Augustin, Briasol, Carina, Chantalle, Edmund, Gail, Hanna, Ishina, Iwan, Jessica, Odemara, Oiriz, Talila, Tesha, Tezila, Valindara, Yonan

notes: Used for in-game player [[wedding]]s.\nIt can be obtained from the [[Wedding Ring Quest]] and the [[Longsword Quest]]. It can also be gotten from an [[Unrealized Dream]].

name: Whisper Moss
notes:
Looks the same as the [[Stone Herb]].

\nItem temporarily obtained in the [[Banuta Quest]].

name: White Mushroom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
droppedby: Crazed Dwarf | Crypt Warrior | Dazed Leaf Golem | Dryad | Dwarf | Dwarf Geomancer | Dwarf Guard | Dwarf Soldier | Haunted Treeling | Jailer | Leaf Golem | Mad Scientist | Memory of a Dwarf | Omnivora | Skeleton Elite Warrior | Skeleton Warrior | Swampling | Thornback Tortoise | Undead Mine Worker | Wiggler | Wilting Leaf Golem | Woodling
notes:
Can be seen in Mushroomfarms Brewery in [[Kazordoon]] and are commonly dropped by all kinds of [[dwarves]]. Good regeneration rate, only make you slightly full and are very light. One hundred white mushrooms will provide hp/mana regeneration for 3 hours.

Because of its weight, it's a good food for skilling.
A lot of them can be found at [[daily spawns]] in [[Edron Goblin Cave]], west of the quadruple [[Hunter]] spawn near [[Edron]] and in [[Hellgate]] in the [[Elf]] area. There also spawn 9 of them in the War Wolf Den on [[Rookgaard]]. 20 of them can be gotten from [[Gnomish Supply Package]]s. 1 of these is required for [[The Shattered Isles Quest]] and 20 are needed in the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: White Pearl
droppedby: Abyssal Calamary | Adult Goanna | Animated Ogre Brute | Banshee | Blood Crab | Cliff Strider | Death Priest | Deepsea Blood Crab | Emerald Tortoise | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Fleshslicer | Foam Stalker | Frost Flower Asura | Ghazbaran | Golgordan | Gravelord Oshuran | Hellgorak | Kusuma | Latrivan | Lich | Lost Soul | Memory of an Ogre | Midnight Asura | Morgaroth | Ocyakao | Ogre Brute | Orshabaal | Quara Hydromancer | Quara Hydromancer Scout | Renegade Quara Hydromancer | Rustheap Golem | Seacrest Serpent | Sphinx | Sulphider | Swan Maiden | Thornback Tortoise | True Frost Flower Asura | True Midnight Asura | Ushuriel | Usurper Archer | Vashresamun | Venerable Foam Stalker | Werelioness

You can dig white pearls at [[Vigintia]]'s treasure hunting zone.
It looks the same as the [[Orichalcum Pearl]].\nReward in the [[White Pearl Quest]], [[Berserker Treasure Quest]], [[Alawar's Vault Quest]] and the [[Skull of Ratha Quest]]. Needed for a seal in [[The Queen of the Banshees Quest]]

name: White Tapestry
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Velvet, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Tapestries]] for more information about other types and colors of tapestries.

name: Wine
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
buyfrom: Innkeeper Alphonse;mug,Norma;mug, Ramina: 15;greenflask, Relaxed Bartender:15;vial, Satsu:52;cocktailglass, Tanaro;greenflask, Urkalio;mug
notes: When you drink wine, you become temporarily drunk and not able to move correctly. You can also get wine by using any [[Containers#Fluid Containers|liquid container]] on a [[Wine Cask]]. Used as a [[scam]] because it looks the same as [[manafluid]].\n18 [[vial]]s of wine are needed in a mission of [[What a Foolish Quest]] and 1 is needed for the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].

name: Winged Helmet
notes:
Contrary to popular belief, this helmet has never granted speed, ultimate protection beyond its healthy defensive powers, or anything else.

This item is very rare, even though it was illegally duplicated a long time ago. There should be around 10 of these helmets existing, initially on [[Antica]].

It can be seen in [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis Room]] and [[Treasure Rooms#Beregar Treasure Room|Pythius The Rotten's Treasure Room]].
history: * Back when only [[Thais]] existed, this helmet used to spawn once per map reset (around every 6 months) on a [[chest]] with some [[Gold Coin]]s in the [[Thais Lighthouse]], where the [[Dark Shield Quest]] is now.\n* It used to look like this: [[File:Wh1.gif]][[File:Wh2.png]]\n* In {{Auction|1788224|February 16, 2025}}, one of them was sold in [[Antica]] through the [[Character Auctions|bazaar]] for {{ilink|Tibia Coin}}217,626 [[Tibia Coins|TCs]].
flavortext: It's the Helmet of Hermes.
notes2:
<gallery>
Pythius The Rotten Treasure Room.jpg|Winged Helmet and other rares in Pythius the Rotten's Treasure Room
Lord Warez Rares.png|Winged Helmet and other rares on [[Pacera]]
</gallery>

name: Witches' Cap Spot
notes: The only known not [[Food|edible]] mushroom, that you can pick up.\nThis item can be temporarily obtained as a mission of [[The Ape City Quest]].

name: Witchesbroom
notes:
Not to be mistaken with [[Witch Broom]].
It looks the same as a [[Broom]] and a [[Ghost Duster]].Reward of the [[Blood Herb Quest]].
flavortext: Don't use it without flying license. Not suitable for minors.

name: Wolf Tooth Chain
droppedby: Cyclops | Ekatrix | Fernfang | Gargoyle | Gloom Wolf | Orc Rider | Rorc | Witch | Yaga the Crone | Yeti
notes: In the past some people have thought it increases the chance to get rare loot, but it was shown to be false.

name: Wood Mushroom
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: Semi-rare mushrooms.

name: Wooden Doll
notes: \n\nIt can be obtained from the [[Longsword Quest]].

name: Wooden Flute
droppedby: Fahim the Wise | Madareth | Marid | Priestess
notes: [[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]].\nIt is needed in a daily task in the [[An Uneasy Alliance Quest|Uneasy Alliance Quest]].

name: Wooden Hammer
sellto: Ahmet, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nezil, Perod, Red Lilly, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zora
notes: It can be found in various locations around Tibia. There is one in the [[Carlin]] prison, in the entrance of a dwarven mine (the first from the stairs to the west, go down and you will find NPC [[Budrik]]), and in the meeting hall in [[Mintwallin]]. There is also one that spawns in the northwest of Venore on the ship that is under construction.\nNeeded for a task in [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].

name: Wooden Key
notes: There are only a few Wooden [[Keys]] known. One of them is [[Key 3940]], which leads to the [[Fibula Dungeon]] entrance and can be purchased from [[Dermot]] on [[Fibula]] for 2,000 [[gp]], or from [[Simon the Beggar]], south of the village for 800 [[gp]]. The others are the Old Fibula Flute Room Key, [[Key 3930]] (use unknown) and the Master Key, [[Key 0000]]. For a list of wooden keys, see [[Keys by Type/Wooden Key]].

name: Wooden Shield
droppedby: Big Boss Trolliver | Frost Troll | Island Troll | Troll | Troll Champion | Troll Marauder | Young Troll
buyfrom: Azil, Baltim, Brengus, Cedrik, Coltrayne: 15, Cornelia, Dixi, Esrik, Flint, Hardek, Kroox, Lee'Delle: 13, Memech, Morpel, Robert, Rock In A Hard Place, Sam, Shanar, Turvy, Ulrik, Willard, Yanni

notes: The first [[Shields|shield]] you may find in [[tibia]], as well as being the weakest shield. Common [[lootbag]] item for lower [[level]]s.

name: Wooden Spoon
notes: Can be found in most cities, particularly in castles or taverns.

name: Wooden Wand
notes: The item sprite was added to client in [[Updates/6.0]], but the item was only obtainable between [[Updates/6.61-6.97]] and [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]].
history:
This wand was transformed into the [[Quagmire Rod]] in [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]] which was later changed into a [[Terra Rod]].
\nThis item no longer exists in game and was obtainable through the [[Paradox Quest]]. It could have been seen in [[Wyda]]'s hut ({{Mapper Coords|127.213|124.234|6|2|text=here}}).

name: Worm
droppedby: Agrestic Chicken | Animated Mummy | Animated Rotworm | Azure Frog | Carrion Worm | Cave Rat | Chicken | Coral Frog | Crimson Frog | Crypt Shambler | Drillworm | Earworm | Elder Mummy | Enraged Bookworm | Feverish Citizen | Fleabringer | Ghoul | Ghoulish Hyaena | Gnarlhound | Hyaena | Mahatheb | Marsh Stalker | Meadow Strider | Mummy | Munster | Mutated Human | Orchid Frog | Rottie the Rotworm | Rotworm | Rotworm Queen | Slug | Terror Bird | Tomb Servant | Undead Prospector
buyfrom: Ahmet, Al Dee: 1, Bashira, Beatrice, Bertha, Bezil, Gladys, Gorn, Gree Dee, Halif, Iriana, John: 2, Lee'Delle: 1, Lubo, Maro, Maun, Nelliem, Nezil, Perod, Pompan, Raffael: 1, Rafzan, Red Lilly, Richard: 1, Rock In A Hard Place, Sarina, Shiantis, Tefrit, Timur, Zethra, Zora
notes:
Worms are needed to [[Fishing|Fish]]. They were previously sold in sixpacks for 5 [[gp]] each. Looks the same as an [[Enraged Bookworm]], which becomes a Worm itself when it dies. The worm image changes depending on the stack size:
*1 worm [[File:Worm 1.gif]]
*2 worms [[File:Worm 2.gif]]
*3 worms [[File:Worm 3.gif]]
*4 worms [[File:Worm 4.gif]]
*5â€“9 worms [[File:Worm 5-9.gif]]
*10â€“24 worms [[File:Worm 10-24.gif]]
*25â€“49 worms [[File:Worm 25-49.gif]]
*50â€“100 worms [[File:Worm 50-100.gif]]
Needed for the [[Demon's Lullaby]] [[World Quest]].
history:
Worms were introduced in some [[Updates/7.5|Update 7.5]]. Before their introduction it was possible to fish with only a [[Fishing Rod]]. This led to insane amounts of [[Fish]] and food had almost no value because it was so easy to obtain. Rune botters were also used to endlessly fish and make runes to sell, as runes weren't sold at NPCs and there wasn't soul points before. With [[Updates/10.51|Update 10.51]] the worm received a new image. It used to look like this: [[File:Worm (Old).gif]]
Previously there were 8 stacks with 2 frames each, after the update there were 8 stacks with 8 frames each. Therefore the [[:File:Worm.gif]] has one of the largest amounts of frames any Tibian image has.

name: Worn Leather Boots
droppedby: Countess Sorrow | Memory of a Pirate | Pirate Buccaneer
notes: They are found around [[Tibia]]. They cannot be worn.

name: Wrinkled Parchment
notes:
This parchment is probably written in the strange [[Bonelord Language]].
Looks the same as a [[Parchment (Yellow)]], a [[Gingerbread Recipe]], [[Research Notes]], a [[Parchment (Questionnaire)]], and a [[Parchment (Poetry)]].Temporarily obtained in the [[Explorer Society Quest]].
flavortext: It is covered with strange numbers.

name: Yellow Rose
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
A rare and nice decoration item. It had been rumored to have spawned somewhere in [[Ab'dendriel]] although this was never confirmed.

It could also be acquired due to a certain bug in [[Venore]] at one time, since there used to be one on display on a table there (it was removed after [[Updates/9.8]]).

Nowdays they are given sometimes as [[Fansites]] [[Contest Prizes]].

There are about 100 yellow roses known to exist.

history: This wand was transformed into the [[Wand of Cosmic Energy]] in [[Updates/7.6|Winter Update 2005]]. It can no longer be found in game.

name: Yellow Tapestry
buyfrom: Dorbin, Eddy, Edvard, Feizuhl, Gamon, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Velvet, Vera, Yoem
notes: See [[Tapestries]] for more information about other types and colors of tapestries.

name: Valuable Vase
notes: Looks the same as an [[Elven Vase]], a [[Fine Vase]] and a [[Fine Vase (Unknown)]]. Unlike Fine Vase, it does '''not''' break.\nNeeded in a mission of [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].

name: Vampire Dust
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Can be obtained by using a [[Blessed Wooden Stake]] on the corpses of slain [[Vampires]]. See statistics at [[Vampire Dust/Dusting]].
* 20 of them are needed to acquire [[Assassin Outfits]]. * 30 of them are needed for an addon of female [[Mage Outfits Quest]]. * 30 of them are needed for an addon of male [[Summoner Outfits Quest]]. * 20 of them are needed for the [[The Inquisition Quest]].
history: This item used to be an ingredient for the [[Bewitched]] event up until it was removed from the list in 2019.
flavortext: Sun can be a merciless killer, but so can you.

name: Vampire Lord Token
droppedby: Arachir the Ancient One | Diblis the Fair | Sir Valorcrest | The Pale Count | Zevelon Duskbringer
notes:
It's one of few items that weighs less than 0.10 oz.\n
\n100 are needed to complete the [[Vampire Hunter Quest]].
flavortext: It proves that you have killed a vampire lord.

name: Very Noble-Looking Watch
notes:
When you use it, you'll receive the following message informing the current [[time]]: {{Server Message|The time is ''hh'':''mm''.}}
\nAfter 24 hours, it will break and become a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch (Broken)|Broken Very Noble-Looking Watch]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch (Broken)|Broken Very Noble-Looking Watch]], a [[Magical Watch]], a [[Stabilizer]] and a [[Watch]].

name: Vile Axe
droppedby: Dark Torturer | Eradicator | Ferumbras | Ferumbras Mortal Shell | Grimeleech | Hellgorak | Horadron | Realityquake | The Unarmored Voidborn
notes: A rare axe. Decreased in rareness after [[Updates/8.2]] when Hellgorak was proven to drop it in large amounts, but after a patch this was reduced. Still considered rare with a high value on most servers. Mostly used as decoration. Mages of a high level, might consider using it instead of rods or wands in some cases, since it gives a +3 defense bonus, and is on most servers the cheapest item that gives the +3 defense modifier.

name: Viper Star
droppedby: Annihilon | Assassin | Blood Beast | Rukor Zad | Zulazza the Corruptor
notes:
Poisons the enemy starting at 2 [[hp]] per turn.
\nSince these are dropped only by [[Assassin]]s and a couple of bosses, they're considered semi-rare. The Viper Star isn't a super effective weapon (much like the rather weak [[Poison Arrow|poison arrow]]). It does less [[Earth damage|damage]] than a regular [[Throwing Star|star]], and the additional [[earth damage]] is just too feeble. It looks nice for decorative purposes. Tests show this weapon has a 9% breakage.

name: Voltage Armor
droppedby: Energy Overlord | Hellgorak | Terofar | The Last Lore Keeper
notes: It gives 3% energy protection, but increases damage taken from earth by 3%.

name: Waldo's Post Horn
notes:
[[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Post Horn]] and the [[Horn of Sundering]].\n[[Quest Item]] temporarily obtained in the [[The Postman Missions Quest]].

However, many [[sorcerer]]s prefer to wait until they can use the [[Wand of Draconia]], since at a lower level [[Fire Damage|fire]] is a more useful element than [[Death Damage|death]]. Provides 2 sqm of green light. Wands of Decay replaced {{Ilink|Wand of Plague}} [[Wand of Plague|Wands of Plague]] in the [[Updates/8.1|Winter Update 2007]].\nNeeded for [[Mage Outfits Quest]] (male) and [[Summoner Outfits Quest]] (female).

flavortext: This wand holds the spirit and soul of a dragon lord.

name: War Axe
droppedby: Behemoth | Eyeless Devourer | Falcon Knight | Glooth Bandit | Grand Chaplain Gaunder | Hulking Prehemoth | Infernal Demon | Infernal Phantom | Juggernaut | Katex Blood Tongue | Lost Basher | Nightmare | Outburst | Preceptor Lazare | Priestess of the Wild Sun | Rotten Golem | Srezz Yellow Eyes | Stone Devourer | Stonecracker | Streaked Devourer | The False God | Tormentor | Undead Dragon | Yirkas Blue Scales
notes: A rare but strong [[Axe Weapons|Axe]], and the strongest weapon that could be [[enchanting|enchanted]]. It could be seen in the [[Treasure Rooms#Morguthis Treasure Room|Morguthis Treasure Room]] long before it was available to players.\n\nDue to it's similarity in appearance to an [[Angelic Axe]] it's some times used in a bait and switch [[scam]], those trading in person are advised to be careful.
history:
Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.4|Christmas Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/8.0|Summer Update 2007]] when it was added to creatures loot.

From [[Updates/8.1|Christmas Update 2007]] until [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], it could be transformed into the following [[Enchanted Weapons]] through the process known as [[Enchanting]]:
* {{Ilink|Icy War Axe}} [[Icy War Axe]]
* {{Ilink|Earth War Axe}} [[Earth War Axe]]
* {{Ilink|Energy War Axe}} [[Energy War Axe]]
* {{Ilink|Fiery War Axe}} [[Fiery War Axe]]
These sprites are now used for their respective [[replicas]].

name: War Horn
notes:
[[Green Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Green Notes Effect}} will appear when you play this [[Musical Instruments|instrument]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Horn]].
history: Although this item was implemented in [[Updates/7.3|Summer Update 2004]], it became obtainable only after [[Updates/7.9|Christmas Update 2006]] when Plaguesmiths were implemented.

name: Warsinger Bow
notes:
This bow has a hit% of +5, and atk +3. The bow's hit% of +5 makes arrows incredibly accurate and with the new [[Crystalline Arrow]] introduced in [[Updates/9.6]], calculations have shown that the bow is the second most effective [[Distance Weapons]] in the game after [[Mycological Bow]], beating both [[Royal Crossbow]] and [[Thorn Spitter]] on average damage per hit with regular ammunition (non-[[Infernal Bolt]]). 

To elaborate, the [[Crystalline Arrow]] has a significantly higher hit rate than its bolt counterpart, the [[Prismatic Bolt]], but only slightly lower attack. The higher hit rate outperforms the extra potential damage that comes from using a crossbow.

The bonus range is also a welcome addition to any hunt as it allows you to start attacking creatures just as they enter the screen. It can also be useful in a narrow PvP-environment. 
Obtainable in the [[The Inquisition Quest]].

name: Waterball
notes: One of only two items to float on water, the other being the [[Shimmer Ball]]. It can be used in a [[Swimming Zone]] to play [[Water Polo]] with. It can only be picked up on land, not on water.

name: Watering Can
notes: Can be used to water a [[Flower Pot]]. A watering can is one of the items needed to earn the [[Green Thumb]] [[Achievement|achievement]], which requires you to fully grow 100 flowers in [[Flower Pot]]s.

name: White Bishop Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].

name: White Castle Token
notes: Used to play [[Games]] in Tibian [[Gamehalls]].

name: White Dress
notes: One can be seen on the upper floor of [[Venore]]s furniture shop. Little is known about this item. Rumor says it is a unique item and only one exist all over Tibia, gifted from [[CipSoft GmbH|CipSoft]]'s founders to a couple of [[Gamemaster]]s for their wedding. \n\nIt is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: White Flower

name: Winning Lottery Ticket

The '''winning lottery ticket''' can be exchanged at the [[Edron]] fluid shop for the fluid belt addon, which is part of the [[Summoner Outfits Quest|male Summoner Outfit]] and the [[Mage Outfits Quest|female Mage Outfit]]. According to a [https://web.archive.org/web/20210413023016/http://www.tibia-stats.com/index.php?akcja=6003&research=lottery research] from [[Tibia-Stats]], the chance to win is 1 to 100, making the average money spent on a winning lottery ticket 50,000 [[gp]].

notes: If you don't water your [[Flower Pot|plant]] for too long, it will turn into a withered plant, and only fast watering saves it from disappearing: {{Sound|You finally remembered to water your plant and it recovered.}} The plant will then be restored to its 3rd stage.
flavortext: This plant urgently needs some water, else it will wither away and disappear completely.

It can be found [http://tibia.wikia.com/wiki/Mapper?coords{{=}}128.171,124.33,9,3,1,1 here].

There is a chance of 70% that [[Red Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Red Notes Effect}} will appear and the whistle will be destroyed. And there is a 30% chance that [[Yellow Notes Effect]] {{Ilink|Yellow Notes Effect}} will appear and the whistle will survive.

This item is also referred as ''Wolf Whistle''.

[[File:Silvato.png|thumb|Rare loot of the boss Fernfang]]

history: Prior to the [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]] these boots looked the same as [[Worn Leather Boots]] and [[Worn Firewalker Boots]]: [[File:Worn Leather Boots.gif]]

notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Weapon Rack}} [[Weapon Rack]]. It looks the same as a large [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.

notes: It looks the same as a [[Crate]], a [[Crate (Usable)]], an [[Old Crate]], a [[Crate (Wine)]], a [[Crate (Swapped)]], a [[Crate (Jimmy)]], a [[Crate Full of Coral]], a [[Machine Crate]] and a [[Weapons Crate (Set)]].\n\nItem temporarily obtained in [[Secret Service Quest]].

name: Weaver's Wandtip
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Wedding Outfit Box
notes: Needed to get married.

name: Werewolf Fur
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: A creature product with no practical use at present. It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.

name: Whacking Driller of Fate
notes:
Obtainable by opening [[TBI]]'s [[Mysterious Package]]. You need to have the [[Secret Service Quest]] completed to be able to open the package, and it needs to correspond to the package you want to open.
Can be used as [[Rope]], [[Shovel]], [[Pick]], [[Machete]], [[Crowbar]] and [[Kitchen Knife]], but not as a [[melee]] weapon to destroy objects. You must always keep in mind that this item can [[Whacking Driller of Fate (Jammed)|jam]] whenever you use it and can then not be used for 1 minute. It will show this message when you try to use it while jammed:
{{Sound|Oh no! Your tool is jammed and can't be used for a minute.}}
It's a good idea to always carry a rope and shovel with you even if you have this item. Can be gotten through the [[Secret Service Quest]].
Can be used to open 500 [[Loose Stone Pile]]s in order to gain the [[The Undertaker]] [[achievement]].
Can also be used to cut [[Jungle Grass]] 100 times in order to gain the [[Nothing Can Stop Me]] achievement.
Can also be used to cut fruit for [[Decorated Cake]]s in order to gain the [[Piece of Cake]] and [[With a Cherry on Top]] achievements.
flavortext: This nifty gadget can be used for many vital and less vital purposes. If it's not jammed, that is.

name: Widow's Mandibles
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: {{CreatureProductNotes}}

name: Wild Growth Rune
buyfrom: Alexander, Asnarus, Ghorza, Khanna, Maun, Mordecai, Onfroi, Rock In A Hard Place, Talila, Valindara
notes:
[[File:Wild Growth (Object).gif]] Creates a rune to cast [[Wild Growth (Object)|a tree]] which blocks off 1 square meter.

This spell is similar to a [[Magic Wall]]: It creates a tree which lasts for 30 to 60 seconds and blocks one square meter. The main difference is that ammunition, spells and runes may also be shot through [[Wild Growth]]. 

On [[Open PvP]], [[Retro Open PvP]], [[Hardcore PvP]] and [[Retro Hardcore PvP]] words, they can be destroyed using a [[Heavy Machete]] or [[Machete]]. On [[Optional PvP]] worlds they can be destroyed by walking over them. 

The cost to make one of these runes with regular [[mana potion]]s and selling the vials is around 135 gps, so having the soul points and the time, it is better to make them with [[mana potion]]s than buy them on [[NPC]]. 

For the spell, see [[Wild Growth]].
history:
This rune became obtainable with the [[Summer Update 2008]], until then [[Wild Growth]] an [[instant spell]] which would shoot one square in front of the caster, but was changed for more flexibility. 

With the [[Updates/8.53|Autumn Patch 2009]], they became passable on [[Optional PvP]] Worlds. With the [[Updates/10.00|Update 10.00]], the duration of the Wild Growth was changed from fixed 45 seconds to a random duration between 30 and 60 seconds ''to make it more difficult to create "permanent" blockades''.<ref>{{Post|35059085|Post on official forum by a [[Community Manager]].}}</ref> Then, with the [[Updates/10.01|10.01 Update]] they were changed again, and became destroyed if a player walks over them (still only on Optional PvP).

history: This was an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]] till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. On such update, its armor value was changed from 2 to 3, and [[Earth Damage]] protection, [[Distance Fighting]] skill modifier and vocation requirement were added to it.

name: Wooden Chair Kit
buyfrom: Allen, Dorbin, Feizuhl, Hofech, Iwar, Janz, Nicholas, Nydala, Peggy, Ukea, Vera, Yoem
notes: Use it while standing in a [[house]] to construct a {{Ilink|Wooden Chair}} [[Wooden Chair]]. It looks the same as a small [[Furniture Package]].
history: Since [[Updates/10.92|April 2016]], usable furniture kits can no longer be bought from NPCs. An alternative general purpose [[Furniture Kit]] that contains the desired furniture can be bought instead and be unwrapped in a house.
flavortext: Use it in your house to construct a wooden chair.

name: Wooden Ties
notes:
Can be obtained by using a [[Saw]] on a piece of [[Wood]]. They look the same as a stack of 3 or more [[Wood]].
\nIt looks the same as a [[Demon Oak Wood]].\nThis item is used in the [[Royal Rescue Quest]].

name: Wool
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It can be sold to NPCs and as with other creature products, it has among the highest gold-to-oz ratio of all items.
\n\nUsed to make [[Fake Rabbit's Foot|Fake Rabbit's Feet]] for [[Rottin Wood]]'s daily task [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest/Spoiler#Daily Task: Lucky Loop|Lucky Loop]]. Completing this earns you the Achievement, [[Bunny Slipped]].

name: Worm Punisher
notes:
When this item is used with a [[Crucible]] it will turn into a [[Heated Worm Punisher]] for 10 seconds and can be used to hit [[Wormhole (Rotworm)|Rotworm]]s and [[Wormhole (Carrion Worm)|Carrion Worm]]s on their head when they pop out of their tunnels.
Looks the same as a [[War Hammer]].Obtained in [[The Isle of Evil Quest]].
flavortext: The hammer would be more effective when heated.

name: Worm Queen Tooth
notes: None.\nPossibly temporarily obtained in the [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]], mission 10.

name: Worn Firewalker Boots
notes:
They're a pair of [[Firewalker Boots]] after they were completely used, It is not really considered a rubbish since it is still expensive, even though it has no practical use.

Obtainable from the [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest|The Hidden City of Beregar]], as [[Firewalker Boots]].
These boots can be recharged with an [[Enchanted Small Ruby|enchanted ruby]].
history: Prior to the [[Updates/8.5|Summer Update 2009]] these boots looked the same as [[Worn Leather Boots]] and [[Worn Soft Boots]]: [[File:Worn Leather Boots.gif]]
flavortext: They can be recharged with an enchanted ruby.

name: Wyrm Scale
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 10 of them are needed for the [[Powerful Cloud Fabric]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Wyvern Talisman
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: 20 of them are needed for the [[Basic Cloud Fabric]], [[Intricate Cloud Fabric]] and [[Powerful Cloud Fabric]] [[Imbuing|Imbuement]].

name: Xodet's First Wand
notes: Looks the same as a [[Wand of Vortex]] and a [[Sorc and Druid Staff]].\n<noinclude>Part of [[The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest]].</noinclude>
flavortext: This could just help to remind him of his old friendship.

name: Yalahari Armor
notes: This item was implemented in the [[Updates/8.4|Christmas Update 2008]]. Part of the [[Yalahari Set]]. Before a minor content fix its armor value was 17 and it had +5% protection to death. Good choice for a midlevel knight, because it has more armor than a [[Dragon Scale Mail]] and much cheaper than a [[Magic Plate Armor]].\n\nObtained through the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Yalahari Leg Piece
notes: Part of the [[Yalahari Set]]. Obtained through the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Yalahari Mask
notes: Is part of the [[Yalahari Set]]. Obtained through the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].

name: Yellow Bed Kit
notes: Looks the same as a [[Furniture Package]] and many other [[Furniture]] kits.
history: It could be used on a bed to change the colors of the covers until [[Updates/12.20.9260|November, 2019]], when beds inside player's houses and guildhalls became movable. It was replaced by the [[Yellow Headboard]] and [[Yellow Footboard]]. \n\nSince the item may still be found in game but is no longer obtainable, it's a relatively rare item.
flavortext: Use it on your bed to change the bed to yellow.

name: Zaoan Armor
droppedby: Battlemaster Zunzu | Draken Abomination | Draken Elite | Draken Warmaster | Ethershreck | Fazzrah | Ghastly Dragon | Hatebreeder | Lizard Chosen | Lizard Gate Guardian | Lizard High Guard | Lizard Legionnaire | Lizard Zaogun | Paiz the Pauperizer

notes: Part of the [[Zaoan Set]]. There is a [[Daily Respawns|daily respawn]] on the top of the [[Zzaion]] palace.

name: Zaoan Helmet
droppedby: Draken Abomination | Draken Elite | Ethershreck | Ghastly Dragon | Hatebreeder | Lizard Chosen | Lizard Gate Guardian | The Voice of Ruin
notes:
Part of the [[Zaoan Set]]. It is better than the [[Demon Helmet]], since the [[Demon Helmet]] has one armor value more, which blocks 0.7 damage on average, while the Zaoan Helmet has 5% protection against [[Physical Damage]], which blocks at least 1 damage.
If a creature hits an average of 100 damage every hit, Demon Helmet will reduce the damage with a minimum of 4.8 and a maximum of 8.5 while Zaoan Helmet will reduce it with a minimum of 4.3 and maximum of 7.6 with an additional of 5%.
In the end, Zaoan Helmet will reduce the damage by 9min and 12max compared to Demon helmet with 5 min and 9 max.
[[Dwarven Helmet]] only reduces the damage by 2.9 min and 5.7 max with an additional amount of 2% which goes towards reducing 4.8 min and 7.6 max. Keep in mind that "100 damage" was used for the calculation. The price of the Zaoan Helmet has decreased since the [[Elite Draken Helmet]] was implemented because it was first used by many [[Paladins]].

name: Zaoan Legs
droppedby: Battlemaster Zunzu | Draken Abomination | Draken Elite | Draken Spellweaver | Draken Warmaster | Ethershreck | Fazzrah | Ghastly Dragon | Hatebreeder | Lizard Chosen | Lizard Gate Guardian | Lizard High Guard | Lizard Zaogun | Memory of a Lizard
notes: Part of the [[Zaoan Set]].

droppedby: Draken Spellweaver | Flamecaller Zazrak | Lizard Dragon Priest
notes: It has a better fire reduction than a [[Magma Coat]].

notes: On one hand these [[boots]] can be used effectively by low [[level]] [[players]] because of their low price and a decent [[speed]] bonus and [[armor]]. On the other hand these boots aren't very useful, because some might consider their armor and speed bonus as too low. Part of the [[Zaoan Set]].

droppedby: Draken Elite | Eternal Guardian | Ethershreck | Ghastly Dragon | Hatebreeder | Lizard Gate Guardian | Paiz the Pauperizer

You can use this to fill a [[Glooth Converter]] to obtain [[Filled Glooth Converter]].
Obtained and used in the {{Spoiler Section|Glooth Factory Quest|Mutated Glooth Plague}}.

* {{Character|Ewrr}} ([[Lobera]])
* {{Character|Jayrp}} ([[Quelibra]])
* {{Character|Verdito}} ([[Yonabra]])

name: Zaoan Chess Box

flavortext: This chess box is made of jade and obsidian. It will hold a full set of 32 Zaoan chess figures.

After 24 hours, a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch]] will break and become this item.
\nDifferently from a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch]] and a [[Watch]], you won't receive a message informing the current time upon using this item.
\nIt looks the same as a [[Magical Watch]], a [[Stabilizer]], a [[Very Noble-Looking Watch]] and a [[Watch]].
flavortext: Unfortunately it seems to be broken.

name: Vexclaw Talon

name: Vibrant Egg

name: Violet Crystal

name: Violet Glass Plate

name: Void Boots
droppedby: Anomaly | Eradicator | Outburst | Realityquake | Rupture | The Scourge of Oblivion | World Devourer
notes: Look like [[File:Void Boots (Red).gif]] when used. Increases your [[Mana]] and [[Hitpoints]] [[Regeneration]] for 60 minutes (1 hour) by the rate of 3 [[HP]] and 12 [[Mana|MP]] per 6 seconds, for a total of 7200 [[Mana|MP]] and 1800 [[HP]]. Void Boots cannot be repaired and will disappear after use. As they have the same regeneration bonus as [[Pair of Soft Boots|Soft Boots]], the Void Boots are a better alternative while hunting due to armor and speed bonuses. If they cost less than 2500 gold on your game world, they are even cheaper than [[Pair of Soft Boots|Soft Boots]] to use.\n}}\n<noinclude>[[Category:Regenerative Items]]</noinclu

name: Volatile Proto Matter
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Voodoo Doll (2543)
notes:
Other possible numbers in item description are [[Voodoo Doll (3613)|3613]] and [[Voodoo Doll (5261)|5261]]. This item might be obtained during a quest. You can neither sell it to any [[NPC]] nor use it for any other [[Quest]].
It looks the same as a [[Mysterious Thing]], a [[Voodoo Doll]], a [[Voodoo Doll (3613)]], a [[Voodoo Doll (5261)]] and a [[Test Voodoo Doll]].\nIt might be obtained during the [[Treasure Hunt Quest]].

It looks the same as a [[Mysterious Thing]], a [[Voodoo Doll]], a [[Voodoo Doll (2543)]], a [[Voodoo Doll (5261)]] and a [[Test Voodoo Doll]].\nIt might be obtained during the [[Treasure Hunt Quest]].

name: Wand of Carving
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
It could be enchanted with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Wand of Carving (Charged)}} [[Wand of Carving (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Wand of Carving (Heavily Charged)}} [[Wand of Carving (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Wand of Carving (Overcharged)}} [[Wand of Carving (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this wand received 2 imbuing slots.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Wand of Carving, Wand of Mayhem and Wand of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Wand of Destruction}} [[Wand of Destruction]].

name: Wand of Carving (Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Wand of Carving]] charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 20% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Wand of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Wand of Carving (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Wand of Carving]] heavily charged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 25% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Wand of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Wand of Carving (Overcharged)
notes: This item is a [[Wand of Carving]] overcharged with the [[Mana Leech]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the mana leech chance changed from 30% to 100%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Wand of Carving|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

name: Wand of Darkness
notes: [[Promotion|Master sorcerers]] can create a Wand of Darkness by casting the [[Conjure Wand of Darkness]] [[spell]]. It was the strongest [[Death Damage|death damage]]-dealing magical weapon in the game until the introduction of the [[Soultainter]]. Even though it can be used as early as level 41, thanks to its high base damage output and powerful bonuses, it rivals the highest-levelled wands and rods. However, it is a temporary weapon and will disappear after 15 minutes or after 250 shots.
history: * With the [[Updates/12.55|Vocation Adjustments Update]], the critical extra damage was reduced from 50% to 35%, and the damage range was reduced from 80-100 to 75-95.\n* On {{OfficialNewsArchive|8436|July 21, 2025}}, the [[Summer Update 2025]] nerfed some of its attributes with the introduction of [[Weapon Proficiency]].

name: Wand of Destruction
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s. Wand of Destruction, [[Falcon Wand]], [[Lion Wand]] and [[Soultainter]] are the only wands that may be imbued with Critical Hit imbuements ([[Basic Strike|Basic]], [[Intricate Strike|Intricate]] and [[Powerful Strike]]).
history: This weapon was created as the result of the unification of the [[Wand of Carving]], [[Wand of Remedy]] and [[Wand of Mayhem]].\n\nOn [[Updates/12.08.7995|February 5, 2019]], the level requirement for this weapon was raised from 100 to 200, and on [[Updates/12.31.9604|March 17, 2020]] its magic level boost got decreased from +2 to +1.

name: Wand of Destruction Test
notes: This is believed to be an [[Unobtainable Items|Unobtainable Item]].

name: Wand of Mayhem
notes: [[Yana]] will trade you one for 50 [[Gold Token]]s. This is the only wand that may be imbued with Critical Hit imbuements ([[Basic Strike|Basic]], [[Intricate Strike|Intricate]] and [[Powerful Strike]]).
history:
It could be charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus by asking Yana for it till [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]. There were three levels of charging:
*{{Ilink|Wand of Mayhem (Charged)}} [[Wand of Mayhem (Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Wand of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)}} [[Wand of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)]]
*{{Ilink|Wand of Mayhem (Overcharged)}} [[Wand of Mayhem (Overcharged)]]
On the same update, this wand received 2 imbuing slots.

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Wand of Carving, Wand of Mayhem and Wand of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Wand of Destruction}} [[Wand of Destruction]].

name: Wand of Mayhem (Charged)
notes:
This item is a [[Wand of Mayhem]] charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 5 [[Gold Token]]s.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Wand of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is charged.

name: Wand of Mayhem (Heavily Charged)
notes: This item is a [[Wand of Mayhem]] heavily charged with the [[Critical Hits]] bonus, which can be done by [[Yana]] for 10 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 15% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 25% to 40%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Wand of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is heavily charged.

name: Wand of Mayhem (Overcharged)
notes: This item is an overcharged [[Wand of Mayhem]], charged by [[Yana]] for 15 [[Gold Token]]s. It is possible to fail overcharging, in this case you will lose your 15 [[Gold Token]]s.
history:
With [[Updates/11.02]] the critical hit chance changed from 20% to 10% and the critical extra damage changed from 30% to 60%.
With [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]], the ability to charge weapons was removed, reverting charged weapons to their [[Wand of Mayhem|uncharged versions]].
flavortext: This weapon is overcharged.

*{{Ilink|Wand of Remedy (Overcharged)}} [[Wand of Remedy (Overcharged)]]

With the [[Updates/11.50|Winter Update 2017]], Wand of Carving, Wand of Mayhem and Wand of Remedy were merged into {{ilink|Wand of Destruction}} [[Wand of Destruction]].

name: Wealth Duplex
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
Drinking this potion will double the loot from every regular monster you kill for one hour.
\nThis potion can be obtained every two weeks by either ranking among the top 20 in the [[Tibiadrome]] leaderboards or by being raffled among the remaining participants.
\nThere is a cooldown of 24 hours after drinking this potion. Since this is an individual cooldown, one may stack the effects of multiple [[Tibiadrome#Rewards|Tibiadrome Potions]].
flavortext: Drinking this potion temporarily doubles the loot from every regular monster you kill.

This item was {{OfficialNewsArchive|6663|awarded}} to three players during the [[Fansite Appreciation Day 2022]]. The winners were:
* {{Character|Mishrabck}} ([[Gladera]])
* {{Character|Adinassey}} ([[Pacera]])
* {{Character|Lord Waxu}} ([[Peloria]])

name: Worn Leather Boots (Orcsoberfest)
notes: Part of [[Orcsoberfest]].

name: Wyvern Soul Core
flavortext: Offers a soul to the Soulpit. Combine with another soul core to create a random new soul core.

name: Yapunac Dagger
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink

name: Yellow 25 Years Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Yellow 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)|Yellow 25 Years Balloon]] {{Ilink|Yellow 25 Years Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Yellow Balloon
notes:
It's a deflated [[Yellow Balloon (Inflated)|Yellow Balloon]] {{Ilink|Yellow Balloon (Inflated)}} and can be inflated by using it within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]].
You can obtain this balloon from a [[Balloon Box]] {{Ilink|Balloon Box}}.\n\n{{Seealso|Balloon Box/Statistics}}

name: Yellow Darklight Matter
notes: This item can be used to speed up the access to [[Vemiath]] by 3 charges (60 seconds) during the [[Rotten Blood Quest]]. It disappears after a few minutes if not used.
flavortext: This rare form of darklight matter is highly volatile.

name: Yellow Present Kit
notes: Using a [[Yellow Present Kit]] within your [[House]] or a [[Guildhall]] triggers a transformation, converting the kit into a [[Yellow Present]]. {{Ilink|Yellow Present}}
flavortext: Use it in your house to place a yellow present.

name: Yellow Skull (Item)
notes: Obtained during the [[25 Years of Tibia Quest]].

name: Yeti Doll
notes:
It's [[TibiaFanart.com]]'s fansite item. 

It has also other stage that appear when interacted with:

[[File:Yeti Doll 2.gif]]
sounds: {{Sound List|<Player>, paint me a snowman or a happy tree or the almighty Lord Ferumbras!|Evil Santa stole my slippers!|Hail TibiaFanart.com!|Let it go, let it go!|Me wanna build snowman!|Yooodelaaahooohooo!}}
flavortext: It may be a little too cool to handle. It is entrusted by TibiaFanart.com.

name: Worn Guide Book
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes: When used, it gets consumed and resets the [[Bosstiary|bossfight cooldown]] of [[Adventurer Group]].\n\nA message in the [[Server Log]] will show {{Server Message|The worn pages stir on their own as the Adventurers gather for another clash}}
flavortext: Compiled Questsolutions fur Dummies.

name: Yalahari Footwraps

name: Zaoan Monk Robe
droppedby: Hatebreeder | Soul of Dragonking Zyrtarch | Lizard Templar | Ethershreck

name: Zaoan Sauce
objectclass: Plants, Animal Products, Food and Drink
notes:
It will boost your [[Fist Fighting]] skill by 10 for one hour.

To create this dish, you must speak with the [[Djinn]] [[Jean Pierre]] in [[Ankrahmun]], near the Marid Fortress, during the Hot Cuisine event. Using a [[Transcendence Potion]] will break the effect.

Only obtainable through the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].
flavortext: This sauce is said to be the pinnacle of the culinary sweet and sour sensation. Eating it will have beneficial effects on the harmony and balance of body and soul.
